Herrick was a very tough professor. Her lectures didn't connect very much to the exam material. I put immense amounts of time and effort into the class and her weekly quizzes brought down my grade. Lab was pretty easy, but the quizzes were very specific.
Good teacher, helpful in class; takes time to go into detailed examples in order to explain difficult concepts

This is my second time with Herrick. I thought she might have improved since 1108 but no, if anything she's worse. The class has no structure and Susan rushed through the important topics and spends too much time on the easy ones. She seems nice out side the classroom however.

Herrick is tough and can be confusing, however if you put effort into the class you will pass. Lab WILL save your grade quizzes and write ups are pretty easy. Tests are difficult if you don't take note. Lecture not really necessary, however the clicker bonuses will help a lot. She also drops two lowest quiz grades. She is tough, but fair

Easy to get a good grade (A to B+) if you read the book and go to lecture. She's a ditzy teacher so don't bother asking questions, but read the book for all you need. Also drops so many quizzes you'll be fine if you go to lecture and read chapters beforehand.

Read the book and study clicker quizzes. Her lectures are not relevant, you only need to attend for clicker points and clicker quizzes on Fridays. She is a little bit intimidating but is extremely knowledgeable on the subject. She is always happy to help the students with questions. Not difficult if you just stick to the book.

Probably one of the worst teachers I've ever come across. Rude, and inconsiderate to students. When you talk to her it seems like she has an attitude towards you, and doesn't want to go out of her way to help you at all. Doesn't have office hours, and don't pass back exams go over with you. No one goes to lecture, and she doesn't care.

She doesn't answer emails, and is extremely boring. A good portion of the class is playing with their phones, or working on other class work from different courses.She doesn't make the class enjoyable, and gives rather challenging questions on exams and quizzes.Study, because lectures won't help. There only useful for clicker questions. not easy

Need book to do well. Lecture is pointless only for clicker points. Actually do work in your lab notebook because it's worth 100 points and some TA's will take it seriously. Hard class that requires work but it is interesting.

Extremely rude, not approachable with any questions you may have. Her weekly quizzes is what brought my grade down. Don't ask to see your exam because she won't email you back EVER. I love bio but hated this class.

This class isn't awful, but it isn't good... The textbook is a waste of money and time, and the only reason to go to class is for the extra bonus clicker points which help your grade and the questions are all used directly on tests from the questions and clicker quizzes. She is not a good teacher and is kind of rude, but not an impossible class!

Honestly the only reason to go to lecture is for the bonus points, which you basically get just for showing up. This class is a VERY easy A. Dr. Herrick is extremely nice and willing to go out of her way to help you. Exams are straightforward with no tricks, and a lot of reused questions from quizzes and clicker questions.

YOU WILL NEED THE BOOK because she doesnt teach you anything. Lecture is pointless bc she doesnt know how to answer your questions and wastes time with all her technical problems. Count your own grades, because she messes up a lot. clicker quizzes and bonuses help you out

She's not a bad professor, however, this is one of the classes you will have to teach yourself. Labs were long and tedious and lectures were useless, however, you do get clicker points which help your grade a lot. As long as you keep up with the chapters in the book, you will get an A
Not a bad professor at all but she goes off topic a lot. Read the book and you should do fine. Attend lectures for clicker points because those points make a difference in your final grade.

Although you don't need to go always go to lecture, just go, it'll be worth it. You can get clicker points and gain a better understanding of the reading. Quizzes are very tricky, exams also. Lab is long and hard but fun. If you do your work and study, you'll receive a nice grade in the class.

Susan Herrick is by far the hardest teacher I have ever had. She is extremely confusing. Half the time she does not know the answers to her own question. She is always being corrected by the the students. She purposely adds trick question to her exams to students will get them wrong. Never, ever, take this class.

She was definitely a good teacher. There are only 2 semester exams, so they each weigh your grade a lot. You need to pay attention to lecture and quizzes, exam questions come directly from that. I did not pay attention for the first exam and I got slammed. Even with an A in lab, it was still hard to pull my grade up.

Overall, I enjoyed the class - especially the lab section. The lecture was kind of boring but she tried to make it somewhat interesting. She actually gave me an answer on an exam that was giving me some trouble. As long as you pay attention in lab and show up to the lecture quizzes, you'll do fine

Great professor! She is thoughtful and if you don't understand something in lecture she is happy to sit down with you and talk about it. I found that lecture notes were helpful but the book was what was on the test. READ! Her tests are pretty easy. Lab helps a lot so pay attention and make sure you have a good TA :)

The exams are pretty easy, but I only started doing well when I studied directly from her slides. Reading the textbook is a waste of time, and I read every assigned page for 1107 and did really well. Trust me, don't read for 1108. Also, she was very rude during office hours.

Not a bad public speaker, but a horrible professor if you actually want to learn. She doesn't answer most questions because she simply doesn't know the answers, she will go around the question and never actually answer it. Aced her exams but TA was absolute TERRIBLE. Lectures are useless except for clicker pts. Read the book for the exams.

Supposed to be easier than bio1107... its not. herrick is a good public speaker. clicker points during lecture, so go to class. you would think that the exams would be pretty easy because of the notes DONT BE DECEIVED. the exams are wicked hard and arent really what you studied. lab is easy and TAs are so nice. learned a lot in lab.

She was ok, she tries to make lectures interesting but I just feel like she doesn't even know the material half the time. The exams are doable, got As on all of them. Make sure you get a good TA, because mine failed me in lab even though I had an A exam average. I always read the book and I found it more helpful than her lectures.

The class is not anywhere near impossible. Some people are better able to comprehend science than others. A high school level science course is a lot different than college. Susan tested on a lot of specifics and some test questions were okay. She did her best and tries to help. She is decent.

She is not the most exciting lecturer, but if you get to know here as a person in office hours she can be quite helpful. Do the study guides and if you have a question on an exam, ask her afterward. She will guide you to the right answer and may even let you change your response. Lab is easy as long as you have a good TA. Mine was quite chill.

Lecture can be sometimes a bit boring but she tries to make it interesting, best way to get bonus points. She lets you know what you got wrong on the exams but I didnt see any above and beyond effort for grade adjustments. Not lenient about overall grade so try to get as many points as you can on the exams.
no, Susan. just no

Favorite teacher at UCONN. Wont trick you at all about whats on the tests, its straight from her powerpoints. Gives 5 bonus points on every test if you go to lecture and is extremely helpful one on one. Great lady, reccomend her as a proffessor to everyone

Lectures are boring, her slides are helpful to learn but she tests you on the smallest details you wouldn't need to know or pick up on. Tests are designed to trick you. Went to her office hours only to be turned away by her horrible attitude towards. Overall, doesn't care about the students or how they do. She doesn't deserve to be a teacher

I would know the study guide like the back of my hand and go in to take the exam and feel like it was written in German. She is so specific in her exams but not at all in lecture. Youll get extra credit from going to class and the Lab TA's are helpful and want you to do well unlike her. She said "Ill get in trouble if you all do well in class"

She has a horrible attitude, her exams don't test any real knowledge and she is unwilling to listen to anyone but herself. I took botany last semester, taking this class as a continuation to expand on my interest of plants and she killed it. Uninteresting, sassy in the worst way, and set in her own ways. Do not take bio1108 with herrick

The class is very boring and it does'nt matter if you show up or not. Personally I only went for the clicker points. Exams were very hard. Study guides were questions right off the slides and often were hundreds of unnecessary questions that were not on the exam. Lab helped a lot with the quiz and HW. Overall,I hate this class!

The only reason to go to class is for Clicker points. The lab is way more interesting than the lecture. I learned everything in lab pretty much. Lectures were so so awful and reminded us almost everyday she is a zoologist not a botanist aka "idk what I'm talking about for half the class." She shouldn't teach this class. Material is easy to learn.
Worst professor I have ever had. Lectures so vague and completely unrelated to the material in the book or lectures. It is nearly impossible to know what to expect on the exams. Failure of a teacher.

This class is packed with students, mostly freshman whom all want to go to medical school. She knows that, and she want the class to be competitive. Definitely shoot for (+90 average ) for the lab portion and attend all classes for EXTRA credit clicker points! These two will help your grade at the end ! Exams are 35-40 questions long. Do the math!

Personally thought she was fine. Her lectures are pretty informative as long as you pay attention. NEVER read the book and still got B+ and A's on all exams including the final simply my printing out the power points and studying them. Lab is very helpful on some sections and never lasts the full 3hrs.

She is a HORRIBLE professor. Her lectures are vague but her exams are so specific. She has no clue what she is talking about half the time, and when you go see her during her office hours, she will give you attitude and not help you. It is impossible to do well on the final if you do badly on the midterms because that's where she takes it from.

She is probably the worst professor I have ever had. I feel bad saying that but she is not helpful whatsoever and her lectures are very contradictory of other classes so it is all very confusing. The tests are IMPOSSIBLE! I used to have an A in my other bio classes but not hers because the wording was that bad. Try to take a different prof.

This professor is horrible!!! DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS, she has to be one of the worst professors here at Uconn. she is rude, not helpful and exams are not related at all to what she teaches in class. Very unfair, she does not know how to word questions, and you ask she will give you an attitude.

Tells students to study from past tests... Doesn't return past tests to students. Consistently mixes up key concepts, constantly has to clarify areas where she misspoke in lecture, often making sections confusing. She is interested in her subject, though, which is a plus.

She is a pretty good teacher. She doesn't have a bored voice and is interested in the topics. Sometimes she may contradict what the textbook says, and the wording of the exams can screw you up. Not a bad class.

Nice Person but lectures are unbearable. She talks the entire class and does not emphasize major points. It is exhausting trying to sort out important information from the useless examples and stories she talks about.
Good teacher, a lot of info but she is very clear what you need to know and what you can disregard. Exams aren't bad, the lab is fun. Good class/teacher

Good personality, nice and helpful. Exams are impossible since you have to choose the BEST answer. Also there are only 25 questions and each worth 4 points so be careful. Sometimes she goes as far as making exam questions from book, lecture, and notes so make sure you read the assign chapters reading which are 20-25 big page long. Now you decide.
Nice lady, and GIVES YOU NOTES! Makes studying very easy. She goes off tangents in lecture, but overall pleasant, reasonable, and helpful

All the materials are in the slides, making lectures pretty much pointless. She's a nice professor, but she doesn't seem to be the most organized, b/c once she handed out an exam that included few questions the class did not learn

You're expected to memorize 500+ species and their calls. Now, I can identify a black-capped chickadee whenever I hear one till this day. The no-technology rule is strict. I got caught typing notes after forgetting my outline, so he took away my attendance for the day. As a commuter, it was a waste of time and gas bc it was my only on-campus class.

This class would be great if not for the biodiversity exams. They totally ruined the class for me. Lectures consist of him providing fill-in-the-blank sheets with bolded information on the slides, and exams are open-note (except the biodiversity exams). Do not recommend this class in its current form.

Take this class if you want to throw away your social life for 4 months. Biodiversity exams were an insane amount of memorization and lecture exams were so specific that it was impossible to do well. Also be sure to have secure wifi because if anything crashes during the exam you will be penalized with a zero!
This guy just does not act like a professor. Failed me and never gave help when I needed him to

Adam Fry has a high score on here but if you take a second to look at why you will see that this was a teacher who cared and over the years he has completely given up on being a great teacher. all of the new reviews are 100% true. The class was completely unfair and why to much was expected for a freshman lv class. DO NOT TAKE UNLESS YOU HAVE TO!!

Fry seemed like an okay guy, but the class itself was way different from past semesters. A ton of memorization. Exams were moved to lab in person because he felt like people were cheating. He overall kept switching things up, which made it hard to stay organized for this class. Too much work and time devoted to this class outside of class.

unless you want to memorize over 500 total animals/plants/bird sounds, don't take this class. all tests are on lockdown browser with camera or taken in lab. Lab quizzes were also ridiculously specific for some reason but maybe i wasn't studying correctly. if you're just looking to take a lab class DONT TAKE THIS unless you like memorization

Extra tests based on how well you can memorize pictures of birds&animal sounds.They have nothing to do with biology/the course&are not covered in lecture. So many tests and they switched from online with webcam to in person. You will spend all of your time on this class, which is a gen ed req by non-bio kids. It's so difficult, do not recommend!

Listen, I don't usually give advice, but if you want to keep your sanity intact, steer clear of BIO 1102 with Prof Fry. The course-load is like a root canal for your brain. Instead, take any other science GE course.

I took this class as a GE and am AWFUL at anything stem. Some of Frys lectures were generally interesting, but the organization of his class was terrible. He randomly changed the syllabus and didn't tell us, and assigns MANY tests and no homework. The biodiversity tests are killer and were SUPPOSED to be optional. Would not recommend this class.

I took this class as a senior because I needed a lab requirement. Worst mistake ever. Changed the syllabus halfway through to make all the optional exams required. Extremely unnecessary and difficult trying to memorize 300+ plants and animals. Lab quizzes are also difficult. If you're looking for an easy class this is not it.

Stay far far far away. Not a good class, not a good professor. Biodiversity exams on things that are never once covered in class as well as weekly high-point lab quizzes. You will spend far more time memorizing species of birds or trees or sounds than you will learning anything useful or interesting. Treats students rudely as well. 11/10 regret.

-Biodiversity exams are to bring down your grade, a preventative against grade inflation - I was the 1st semester it wasn't open notes or online. A gen-ed should not require me to memorize 900 animals -Other exams are open-note online lecture fill in the blanks, no learning needed, lectures insanely boring, he does the bare minimum as a professor
just awful. took it for a requirement and it was the biggest mistake of my life. every single bad review about this course is accurate. NOT easy!!!

Absolutley horrible. So uncaring about his students. Expects students to memorize 300+ plants and animals with scientific names. Pointless information. He also changed the syllabus in the middle of the semester and made us switch how we take exams. DONT TAKE THIS AS A GEN ED HES SO BAD.

This class is easily the hardest class I've taken. As a GenEd class, he makes it extremely hard. Tests are "open notes" but some require you to use exact spelling, and detailed info in the notes. Everything is lockdown with webcam. The Biodiversity exams are all based on how well you can memorize, not the content. Lab is a joke with hard quizzes.

This class could be difficult for non-stem majors. He only "amped" up the class because of how easy it was to cheat the past semesters. There is a TON to memorize but he gives you weeks in advance to study for the exams so don't wait until the last minute to review. This class can be manageable if you make it, but it is time consuming.

Took this class in Spring 2022 & put it on pass/fail. I managed to pass & subsequently took ERTH1050 where I got an A for my lab requirement. Do the same thing. Fry's exams are ridiculous as they require you to remember well over 111 terms & the lab quizzes were random. It was thanks to extra credit & online exams I passed. He's not good anymore.
Just do not take this class. Take any other lab class the school offers and it will be better than this. Thank you professor for making this class horrible for Spring 2023 students. DO NOT TAKE THIS

Many exams. many memorization of useless pictures and sounds. Waste of time and unlike the other reviews from past classes. Exams online with camera and lockdown browser. Policy switch to in person with lock down browser. OOF. I get ptsd from hearing any kind of animal sound now because it reminds me of this class.

Funny enough this might be one of the hardest classes I take for my entire major. Lab quizzes every week from stuff you do not learn in lab, random lecture quizzes, expected to attend EVERY lecture even if you are sick, changing syllabus half way through the course, expected to memorize close to 700 pictures of plants, plus 4 more exams. Dont take

We have to take weekly lab quizzes. We have random pop-quizzes. We have unit exams every few weeks. AND FINALLY biodiversity exams which are ridiculous -- memorzing hundreds of plants, animals, and sounds. Since the start of this semester, I haven't had a single week where I'm not stressed because of this course.

Professor should be ashamed by how hard this class is for non bio majors. Let alone a freshman level course. Could never imagine having to put the majority of my time into this class when it is not even my major... he needs to get a grip on reality and realize nobody is taking this course to memorize 500 bird sounds and pictures of animals.

Do not take this course. Too many exams, too many lab quizzes, too much work (considering this is a freshman course, it should be not this time consuming and stressful). It's all about memorizing and recalling facts on pages and pages of lecture lines.

We have weekly lab quizzes. No open notes! Everyone complains about how difficult these lab quizzes are. On top of that, we have biodiversity exams that are memorizing 400 animals and 400 plants and 50 animal sounds. This isn't including his 70 question unit exams (50-60 mins) that cover like 10 chapters. Too much work. Unnecessary stress.
Ridiculous! Time-consuming! Useless!

This class is nothing like the previous reviews stated. It is ridiculously hard and time consuming for non bio majors. Labs are so unorganized. You are expected to attend every lecture where you do not get a second to even collect your thoughts from writing notes. Also, he just changed the syllabus halfway through the semester to make it harder....

If you want to take BIO1102, don't...look at his ratings under him in the biology department section of this site. He changed the class from last semester and made everything way harder. Everything is on lockdown with a camera; you must memorize 300+ plants and animals by sight and animal sounds. This class is very intense and too much for non-stem
the biodiversity exams are very pointless. Too much info to learn for each test and less than a minute per question

save yourself. i read all these reviews thinking this class would easy and fun but it's not. it is so time consuming and he changed everything to be on lockdown with camera. over 400 terms you need to remember per lecture exam, 200-300 for the biodiversity exams and the labs are unorganized with weekly quizzes. i should've switched when i could've.

I didn't even go to 3/4 of the main lectures, and still passed. As long as you acquire the notes from a classmate, you'll be fine. Labs are mandatory, but they were interesting if you have a good table. There are weekly lab quizzes (lockdown/no notes) but there are so many other easy A assignments you can do that those quizzes won't matter.

Definitely one of the best bio professors. He makes lecture interesting and it is very easy to be successful. Labs were kind of a lot of work and attendance was mandatory but if you have a good table it can be fun. My only complaint was he talked a little bit quietly.

Prof. Fry is awesome. He makes science so easy and really sets his students up for success. You get fill in the blank notes and everything you need for the tests is basically word for word off the notes. The biodiversity exams are really annoying but that's really the only issue. Overall a super easy class and Prof. Fry is great.

Absolutely love adam fry. I suck at science but he made this class so easy. Would definitely recommend taking him. the labs are lowkey hard sometimes, but adams lectures are amazing and you just fill in the blanks with his note sheet he gives you. 10000/10, definitely recommend him. Exams are also online and open notes, super easy

Professor Fry is a great choice if you need a science credit. Bio 1102 was a relatively easy A if you study before the tests. This class is pure memorization; no critical thinking. Ideally studying the terms each day will best prepare you, but if you study a Quizlet the week before you should be fine. He wants his students to get an A!

I took this class online and it was super easy. He sent out notes in the beginning of the unit and the test questions were straight from the notes. Highly recommend this for non stem majors or people who are just bad at science.

I only took this class b/c of my major but I still enjoyed it a lot. It is very straightforward and if you just study the lecture notes you will pass. Consisted of 4 exams, 3 quizzes, and lab which is 2 assignments every week. I did not interact with him much b/c of the asynchronous format but you can tell he really wants his students to pass

This guy is a lifesaver for people who suck at science. Literally the easiest science class I've ever taken in my life, maybe even easier than high school bio. If you need an easy lab science, take this! I guess the hard part for this in-person is probably memorization, but everything's open note when it's online.

Adam Fry is a literal ANGEL! Having to take a science requirement because of CLAS, I was not excited for this course. Adam made it super painless and cared so much about us. He sent email reminders. He gave tips on how to do well for exams. He dropped the lowest exam grade. Labs were just 3 questions or 3 sentence discussion post. Take this class.

Prof. Fry is one of the best I've ever had. He truly cares about his students and wants everyone to do well. He makes everything super clear, which makes the tests quite simple if you pay attention. Labs are not bad at all, even with it being online. He is insanely accommodating and super nice. Made this class so much more interesting.

If you have a lab science requirement, this is the class to take! The labs are very simple and straight-forward and the lab period is really just office hours for TAs. The exams are all open-note, and Professor Fry gives you all the notes no video lectures. I cannot recommend this enough as an online course!!!!

Since I'm taking this class fully online because of the pandemic my times for lab isn't actually lab. The exams are open notes and so is the quizzes in lab. Easy to pass! Taking this class as a requirement and I'm happy I choose this class since I don't enjoy science either.
If you show up and actively try there is no way to fail. Professor Fry is super understanding and genuinely wants you to get an A.
Best class for lab requirement, just put the time in and you will do good. Professor Fry wants every student to get an A

Adam Fry is such an amazing Professor. He gives notes for you to fill out during class, and before an exam he tells you exactly what will be on the exam. Put lots of time aside to study. Extra credit for attending classes! Labs are hit or miss, all depends on your TAs. Definitely go to office hours and get to know him, I loved talking to him!

This is the best choice for those looking for a lab requirement. It's very straightforward, Adam gives a fill-in-the-blank worksheet each lecture and you fill it in as he goes through the presentation. Could not be easier. There's 4 tests, all multiple choice and non-cumulative, but he makes you memorize a lot of terms 200. Not bad if you study.

The best professor I have had at Uconn. He truly cares about his students and does everything he can to help them succeed. He learned everyone's name and always made sure to say hi when he saw me. He gives lecture outlines and study guides, there is a good amount of memorization but really an easy A if you study! Lab also isn't that bad.

Dr. Fry is the best and most caring professor I've had at UConn. He makes this topic fun, even if you think you hate biology. Exams need to be studied for heavily (mostly memorization) if you want an A, but are clear cut and easy. This class is perfect for a lab requirement, and the lectures are very well structured.

Adam Fry is the best professor I have had at UConn. He is the nicest & most caring professor there is as he looks out for every student and even goes beyond to learn every student's name. Lecture is mandatory as thats where you will get all the notes, plus he gives a bonus for it. Attend Lab too as there are quizzes. Study lecture outline for test

Absolute best professor I have ever had. He learned my name even though there were about 300 students in the class. The only thing is that you really have to study a lot and the exams are rough. There Is no midterm/final, just exams 1-4 and two biodiversity exams. I loved learning from Dr. Fry and wish he taught more classes for my major.

Hands down one of the best professors I have had at uconn. There are four exams and two biodiversity exams (one is optional) that really help boost your grade. Lab is a bit tough but if you put the time in your grade will definitely show it. Professor fry really cares about all of his students, if your looking for a lab credit this is the one!

While all the exams are heavily memorization, if you set aside a couple hours before the test, you should get an easy A. Two tests involve memorizing a lot of animal species, but the entire class (200 students) got a median grade of 99. Lectures are very interesting, he cracks a lot of jokes, and he relates material to our lives. Great class!

Dr. Fry is an absolutely phenomenal professor! For the exams, all you need are the lecture outlines, which are fill-in-the-blank, and the answers will be in blue on the slides. Attendance is not "mandatory", BUT it'll count as a bonus to your grade. Lab was alright, but just read through the outlines everyday and you have an A!

Adam Fry is the best! I took BIO 1002 for my lab as a non-science major and found myself loving the course more than I expected. I am so glad I took this course. Adam Fry is funny and understanding and an overall great guy.

Absolutely FANTASTIC!! He started the first lecture with "this class is for everyone, even if you think you can't do science." I felt respected and motivated from day one. His outlines keep you organized and make studying easy. He is very passionate & it will get you excited, too! Interesting topics and fun lab experiments. Highly recommend :)

Fry is a fantastic professor. Take this BIO class if you need the lab credit, you will not regret it. Tests are a breeze because they are directly from lecture notes. He gives you two opportunities to make up low test grades with biodiversity tests. He's awesome, friendly, and really wants you to learn. 10/10 professor.

Professor Fry is a great guy. He always has office hours, very accessible. You need to go to lecture in order to get the notes, but he does a great job explaining things, and lectures are actually enjoyable. Great professor for people who know nothing about bio

Every class he gives us a handout that w/ fill-in-the-blacks & things of that nature & the exams are those questions & answers verbatim, which sounds pretty easy, except that means you have to study about 300+ questions/16-20 handouts per exam, which is time consuming and headache-inducing only for about 60 of those questions to show up.

Great method to his teaching style that keeps you actively paying attention during the lectures, if you show up. If you don't show up, good luck! His expectations are clear and offers advice and assistance when you need it. Very approachable in and out of the class. He's one of the best professors I've had at Storrs.

Adam Fry is great! You fill out lecture outlines for each class and there will never be anything on the exams that is not on the outlines. However, you do have to do a lot of memorizing to do well but he is really accessible and helpful if you need it
The class for me personally was difficult. A lot of memorizing and Im not good at that. But, Professor Fry is a really great professor and made it as easy for his students as possible.

If you do not study everyday for this class you will not do well. He gives you note sheets which is nice, but does not narrow down the actual information that will be on it. I usually have 400+ flashcards for each exam; for an exam that will only mention like 80 terms.

I LOVE Adam! He's the best! You enter class (a lecture hall) and receive a paper with notes and fill ins. During the lecture, Dr. Fry has what you need to fill in on blue on powerpoint slides. (There's your study guide when class ends). After some classes, you'll take the exam, which is verbatim the hand out notes. 10 Min of studying a day A!!!

Prof Fry is an amazing guy. He really wants to help you since it is a non-major class. Every lecture he gives you fill-in notes. You need to go to the lectures because he never posts the notes. Having a friend in the class is a good backup. The tests are easy if you study.

Adam Fry is honestly one of the best professors i've ever had. He designs the class to be easy for non-science majors. There are around 200 terms to know for each test, but as long as you really work on memorizing them the tests are insanely easy. Lecture is a fill in the blank notes outline and the test takes information straight from them.

Adam Fry is such a nice and genuine person. He learned every single student's name in our class of about 200. He gives you all of the notes you need for the exam. It's a lot of memorization, but study and you'll do well. He really cares about his work and his students and you can clearly tell.

His class is definitely the class to take if you are a non-science major in need of a lab science. He gives students every chance for success & tries to focus his lectures on interesting examples to make his points. And there is NO textbook, only a lab manual. So, it's likely the cheapest AND best lab science option. Would rate above 5 if I could.

Fry is a fantastic professor. BIOL 1102 is specifically for non-science majors. He gives a hand out during each class which is basically a study guide for the exams. There are five exams which spread out the material evenly. He also takes attendance each class. I HIGHLY recommend Adam! He is truly a great professor.

Very straightforward, lots of memorization of basic bio concepts but this class is cake. Study the terms and you'll get an A on the exams. Prof is super helpful and understanding, he knows that mostly non-bio majors take this course so he doesn't have very hard tests. Every lecture, he gives out an outline where you write down notes and definitions

Adam Fry is one of the best professors I've had at UConn. All of his lectures consist of an outline with blanks that you fill in throughout the lecture, with the answers clearly highlighted on the slides. only these blanks are on the tests which are every two weeks and non-cumulative. he gives ex. cred just for showing up and knows everyone by name

Adam Fry is a great professor. He is always available and really understanding. Lecture is very easy if you just study the outlines. The tests are straight forward and fair. Lab is a little harder but he gives extra credit opportunities to make up for it. One of the best professors I have ever had by far.

Super organized lectures-- gives an outline at the beginning of each class and you just fill in the blanks. None of the exams are cumulative! 5 exams on about 2.5 weeks of material that only comes from the lecture outlines. He really wants his students to do well and understands most people in his class aren't bio majors

By far one of my favorite professors at UConn. He makes the lectures entertaining and the way he does notetaking makes it that much easier. The tests are easy if you study and he is very straightforward as to what will be on the tests. The lab is more difficult- the quizzes are pretty hard- but he gives out lots of extra credit to make up for it.

BIOL 1102 is an awesome class! I learned so much in this class compared to others. You HAVE to study! Studying a little every night is an easy way to do good on exams. Lab is kinda boring and the quizzes are hard, but the actual exams are easy as long as you study. He also offers a lot of extra credit on the exams.

Adam Fry is a great guy. Nice and funny and also tries to make lectures as interesting as possible. The formats of his test are kind of odd, using a lot of fill in the blank with a huge word bank. 100% memorization. Requires a good amount of studying but best way to go if you need a lab science and you aren't a science major.

Lectures are not necessarily mandatory but he randomly gives out assignments at the end of lecture that are worth credit. He makes you write down your name and lab section on an index card and gives you more extra credit the more lectures you attend. Overall super nice and friendly guy. Class is relatively easy if you study. Lab sucks but not 2 bad

Super easy course, just show up with a pen and hell provide the note sheet for the day, all you do is fill in the blanks from lecture. Exam every 2 1/2 weeks, youll have to memorize around 300 terms. He makes the course as easy as possible and actually wants you to succeed!! Funny & nice guy, easy A if you put in the studying time!!!

My favorite professor so far! His lecture is extremely clear and he literally tests want is in the lecture notes. Need high focus and quick wring in his lecture. Very friendly during and outside the lecture, very approachable and flexible office hour time. I learned A LOT in his course and it definitely worth it. Do not skip class otherwise, you will miss the lecture notes.

Adam Fry has been my favorite professors so far at UConn. He makes it as easy as he can and clearly states what is expected of students to know for the exam. He is always available via email and office hours. He is such a great guy and arguably the best biology professor at the university.
Greatest professor of all time, very knowledgeable and cares about the students.
He has absolutely no sympathy for students and is very disrespectful and passive aggressive. Exams are hard if you have terrible memory. I hate this class and very much dislike this man.

UGH ADAM FRY IS MY GUY. I can't say enough good things. At first he seems a little stand offish. But IM TELLING YOU, go to his office hours and ask him anything or just introduce yourself. He is truly an angel. He expects us to know a lot so put in the work and it will show. I highly recommend this class. I would take a bullet for this man.

This is a solid lab science option. That being said, I would caution some of you out there. If you want an A or even a B, you HAVE to study. A lot. Memorization is key, and you need to memorize at least 300+ terms every 2 1/2 weeks. If you have a heavy course load, I would not recommend. He does curve at the end, which is really really helpful!

I really struggled in this class because I'm totally not a science person, but if you work hard at it and figure out what study tools work best for you then you'll be fine. I'd recommend going to lecture, he tries to give you ways to remember different terms and I found that the most helpful.

Organized professor. Gives you outlines in the beginning of class and you fill out with notes. Exams are exactly what you wrote in class so it's not stressful when you're studying because everything is fair game. Use his tips in the beginning of the semester and you should get a decent grade. I recommend studying 5 minutes everyday and not cramming

Daddy Fry is honestly one of my favorite professors ever. At the beginning he seems like kind of a jerk, but he is a jerk because he wants you to take what he says seriously. USE HIS METHODS OF STUDYING. Once I actually listened to his tips, everything was so much easier. Dope dude, totally a feminist, 10/10 would recommend. 3

He is a great professor! You can always ask him question when he is in his office or email him. He'll response quickly! He is always willing to help you to learn bio, as long as you ask for help! If you feel confused about something, feel free to stop by his office hour and he'd like to explain to you as much as he can. He talks kind of fast!
He forces his own views of study habits down your throat. He outlines every lecture which is nice, but not the best way for learning. You have to memorize a lot for this course.

He is great, he will curve grade at the end of the course, I have a hard time finding ways to memorized his lecture materials. If you have a good memorization, he is highly recommended. His exams are all based on his lecture materials. In another words, if you remember the materials it will be an easy A, be prepared for the Lab, Lab weights a lot

Professor Fry was one of the best professors I've had. His lectures were interesting and he gave lecture outlines every class which were very helpful when studying for exams. Study the notes a lot and you will be fine. Professor Fry wants everyone to get an A if you put in the work and there was always extra credit on exams. Great professor.

He hands out lecture notes every class with blanks that you'll fill in throughout the lecture. Even though it's a 400 person class, he ALWAYS takes attendance using note cardsr. There are 4 exams and a final. I study using quizlet which works great, definitely study and you will probably get an A. He really wants people to get good grades.

Dr. Fry is one of the most amazing professors I've ever had at UCONN. I am not a biology major, so I struggled with biology in general, but Dr. Fry was always available to help and gave multiple opportunities to increase your grade. Definitely go see him in his office hours, he will always remember you. Gives a good behavior bonus, exam retake.

I, and most of the students who take this class dislike biology, but Fry made the class bearable. Attendance is taken and participation credit is given. Tons of material in class, so attendance and studying is imperative (I made 100-250 notecards for each exam). Lots of memorization, but hard work will definitely earn you an A.

Overall, loved this class. He cares about his students, do what he tells you about studying. Exam every 2 1/2 weeks on 8 lectures LOTS of information, mainly memorization. Great professor great class. The lab though sucks. Extremely rushed, quizzes are more like tests, if they run out of time to teach something they'll still test you on it.

A LOT of memorizing (like A LOT), so if you're not good at that, do not take this class. attendance isn't mandatory, but I would not recommend skipping. If you need a lab course just to graduate I really wouldn't recommend this one because it is a lot of studying and there are 6 exams.

Fry really cares about the students. Tells you exactly what you need to know for the exams. There's definitely a lot of studying for this class but if you're willing to put in the effort you'll do well

Literally memorize all of the worksheets that he has word for word and you will get an A. Though it seems like a lot of work, he gives tips and reviews a bit if you go to his office hours. Overall he's super helpful and the class is easy.
Don't skip or be late, huge stickler about it.

This class was by far the most interesting class I took this past semester! I truly learned a lot from Dr. Fry. He's very clear in what he expects from students and it really pays to pay attention in class. Make flashcards based on the outlines given in class and you'll be fine! Dr. Fry is also an awesome professor!

Adam Fry is very knowledgeable and passionate about his field. Exams are entirely based on lecture, no text required. Study the sheets he gives you and you will get an A. Do not text or fool around in his class, he will call you out since he somehow knows EVERY ONE'S FACE AND NAME (slightly creepy, really impressive). Work hard and you'll be fine.

Fry is amazing. While there is a lot of information you have to remember for each exam, you fill out an organizer during each lecture that he gives you, so you know exactly what is going to be on the exam- if you study a little everyday it's an easy and fair A. He is a great professor and this is your best option for the science requirement.

Easy class if you don't mind memorization. There are several exams that are straight memorizing the lectures (non-cumulative final though). Definitely requires studying. You have to go to class for in-class assignments, and he grades attendance. No textbook and lab was super fun actually!

This is a great course if you need a lab and don't mind science. It is a decent amount of work, but very manageable if you put the time in. Exams are 100% memorization of lecture outlines, and straight forward. Don't skip class if you don't need to or you will lose credit. Lab is fair, but there are weekly quizzes. Prof. Fry is a standup guy.

If you do not like memorizing 400+ terms word for word for exams every other week, I would not recommend this class. Everything is clear, but it is not fair how much you have to memorize. Aside from that, you have lab quizes that are graded harshly. You need to invest your life into this class to do decent.

The most studying I have ever done for any class. There are 5 exams (including the final) and weekly lab quizzes. 100% straight memorization, I learned a lot of interesting things but was definitely a time intensive class. Very kind professor, he truly wants everyone to succeed. If you have a question definitely ask him, he's always ready to help.

Professor Fry cares a lot about his students and really does everything he can to make sure everyone is successful. Lecture consisted of filling in outlines from the information on his powerpoints. There were about 5 exams, mainly multiple choice. There is a lot of memorization involved in studying for tests. I found the class to be fairly easy.

Professor Fry cares a lot about students and the subject. This class was no joke for me, I had to work hard for the grade that I earned, but Professor Fry will do everything he can to help you if you put in the effort. Be prepared to memorize and go to class every day.

Literally gives you a sheet of terms that you fill in definitions for during lecture. All you have to do is memorize these terms and you'll get an A. However, there are a good amount of terms so leave yourself atleast 3 days to study. Lab is easy, so are lab quizes. Study for 15 minutes and a guaranteed A on the quiz(15 minutes may be too much)

Adam was one of the best professors I've ever had. He really wants students to succeed in this class and makes it as easy as he can to make sure that happens. As long as you put the work in you will get a good grade. You just have to memorize the content he gives to you in lecture.

Just memorize all the lecture slides. No reason why you can't get an A. Gives alot of extra credit opportunity. Labs are somewhat long and boring, but easy. Nice, helpful professor who SPOONFEEDS you all the tools to succeed. People who didn't do well either don't try or don't care enough

If you put the time in to study for this class, you will do well. You get what you put into it. He offers a big attendance bonus at the end of the semester so go to class. Fry made bio accessible and sort of fun even though I am not science oriented. Lab can be tedious but again, if you take the time to study for lab quizzes, you'll be set.

I recommend not taking this class. Yes, the material is very straight forward, and the test are straight from the notes, but when only 10% of those lecture notes are on the exam, and he gives you 350 words to study, it is very hard to do well when the exams are on 15 different topics. I recommend finding another lab, avoid this class.

I took this class because I am an English major and needed a lab for my gen-eds. Overall it definitely could've been worse in terms of a science. Everything you're tested on is based on lecture outlines he gives you, but there's a lot of information on each exam. If you're good at memorization this is the class for you. The lab wasn't hard at all

Very good guy. Very straightforward class. The questions on the exam are straight from the notes. With this being said, I do not recommend this class. For a non-Bio major class, it is way too difficult. I worked harder in this class than I have in any other class. Still nowhere close to getting an A in the class.

Really straightforward teacher, what he puts on lecture is what exactly the exams will be on. Expect to remember about 200+ terms for each exam, took studying for granted for his exam. Overall would take his class again even exam is basically all memorization.

He tells you exactly what's going to be on the exams. You get to retake one exam at the end of the semester if you want to try for a better grade. He's brilliant and extremely amazing. Some students don't like how strict he can be, but get over it. Labs are pretty easy. Go to lecture and memorize literally everything and you'll be fine.

He is very thorough and tell us exactly what we need to know for the exam. Study a lot and you will be fine. And when I say study a lot I mean like more than you ever have in your life. Lectures also go quickly because you are always talking notes, he gives you work sheets and you just fill in whats in blue on his slides.
Easy class if you study. His tests are all memorization.

Adam is an awesome professor. grade based off 4 exams (you get to retake the lowest) & easy quizzes he gives in class that he usually just gives you the answers to. He's straight forward, there's no surprises in this class at all. Go to class, don't be late and don't use your phone. Gave me 2 extra points for perfect attendance as well.

Fry is the best. Compared to any other class you'll take here hes very clear. The average for exams is around an 80, but he doesn't make lecture hard bc theres so much info he doesn't really have to to make a curve. Your grade is completely reliant on your work ethic.
No help worst teacher ever can't stand him

Great professor. He's very strict- do not be late to lecture, no cell phone usage (even though it is a big lecture), and pay attention. But, he's extremely straight forward. Show up to lecture, fill in the outline he gives at beginning of class by using his PPT, and study it for exams. Labs are a little difficult, but doable. Highly recommend!

Amazing professor! Super interesting and adorable. Key to getting an A is to memorize his lecture handouts word-for-word. Class is pretty straight-forward. 4 Exams and you're allowed to retake one at the end of the semester. Lab quizzes were hard but if you study the key details you should be fine. No textbook.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Class is pure memorization, so it's easy to get an A but you have to put the time in to learn it all. His lectures are very clear (fill-in notes), and the lab is not too bad either (plus it's only 2 hours). I would definitely recommend this for your lab science. Also go to class for an attendance bonus!

Adam is one of the best professors I've ever had. He makes getting a good grade easy by giving straight forward lectures and tests questions that are word-for-word from the lecture notes. He truly cares about each student's grade in the class. I highly recommend taking this class for your lab course.

Dr. Fry was great! He knows that 1102 is not for bio majors and makes it as easy and simple as possible! As long as you go to class, and study what he gives you, you will get a good grade in this class! He is also willing to help with anything and makes it very clear that he wants his students to succeed! I would highly recommend for a lab course!

Adam Fry is a great professor. He's very clear on what he expects and what you need to do to get an A. Participation really helps your grade and there's a lot of chances for extra credit as long as you go. He makes an effort to learn everyones name and is quick to respond to emails.

Adam is a really good guy who knows most of the students there are not science majors. With this in mind he keeps the class simple, no book, no homework just lecture outlines that you must fill in every class. If you do what he tells you and look over the outlines you will get upper 90s on every exam because most questions are word for word.

Dr. Fry is without a doubt the best professor I've had at UConn. His lectures are clear and tell you exactly what will be on the exams. He cares enough to get to know the names of every student he teaches, and is more than willing to help with any concerns. I would recommend class with him a hundred times over. No textbook.

He's my favorite professor and brought up my interest of biology. He's really nice and offered me help during the whole semester. The class was easy, all I did was memorizing the lecture outlines and got high scores. But students had to spend plenty of time to review and remember. The lab quizzes were detailed so I got average 8.510.

Adam Fry was an awesome professor! He is not going to debate over correct or incorrect questions because you can pass the class by memorizing the notes that you take (he gives you fill in the blank worksheets). He knows everyone's name by the 3rd week and really wants each person to succeed, but will only help out those who seek help. Great guy.

Fry is one of the best professors I've had at UConn. He cares so much about his students and really wants them to succeed. There are four exams in total. As long as you put in the work and study all of his material, you'll do fine. You just need to be willing to work in this class. Definitely take if you need a lab.

Lab helps reinforce material from lecture. Provides worksheet with fill in the blanks as your official notes. Know everything on the notes word for word but nothing other than that. He will tell you what is on the exam! Just show up! He gives attendance bonuses so he makes it worth your while. Nice guy

Honestly one of the best classes i've ever taken at UConn. Awesome professor who really wants to see his students excel. He gives you note sheets that you fill in during class and you just need to memorize everything for the test, nothing concept based. You have to study a lot before the test but if you do that you'll get an A.

Great Professor but indeed a GPA Killer. If you want to get a good-looking GPA, the you better should not attend this course. Lots of memorizing which is more than you think. Truly not easy course, very hard.

Adam Fry is a great teacher who really helps you get an A. As long as you show up and look over the notes you will do good in his class. Also at the end of the semester he gives you extra credit based on your attendance and you can make up one exam.

Fry lays out the material very clearly and makes it easy to succeed in his class. He is very well organized, knowledgable, and engaging. His exams were very fair and the lecture outlines that he uses are an extremely useful tool that made it much easier to study and learn the material. Prof. Fry is one of the best professors I've ever had.

I hated bio before taking this course but Fry is an amazing professor, one of the best I've had at UConn! He gives a lot of information and tests you on pretty much all of it, but if you put in the time, you're guaranteed a good grade. If you have to take a lab course or if you're just interested in bio, this is the class to take.
AMAZING professor. Will do anything to help you better your grade. Is very clear of his expectations and what will be on the test etc., ball's in your court whether or not you get an A.

Class isn't mandatory, but there is an attendance bonus, so you should go. Also there are fill in the blank style notes so without going to class you are really hurting yourself. Study for tests the way he says and you are almost guaranteed and A.
Awesome professor! Just go to class and make flashcards for every exam and you will get an A.

Dr. Fry is super clear about his expectations throughout the semester. If you come to class, act respectfully, and seek him out for help if you need it, you should do really well. He hates people coming late or using their phones. The class is 100% memorization, but if you study the way he tells you to, you'll do well. Highly recommend!
Great class, I learned a lot. Material can be in depth, but the outlines help narrow it down. He's great, highly recommend!

He's a good professor. Has interesting lectures (which are essentially mandatory) No book needed, but the notes are only given in class so go to class! Plus he gives out 2 additional points to your final if you had perfect attendance. Fry I should add, can be a jerk sometimes and can be very stubborn to students sometimes. Class is all memorization

Great lecturer and keeps things interesting. All notes are done on lecture outlines your receive at each class. Exams are straightforward and questions come right off of the lecture outlines. You do have to study for this class but he makes it easy to do well. He takes attendance every class and provides a bonus for perfect attendance! Great class!

Nice guy. The class is harder than expected but he is willing to help if you ask for it. Attending is mandatory and it'd be best if you go because points he goes over is class are going to be tested. Tons of memorization

Dr. Fry is an awesome teacher with a true interest in his students. Lecture outlines are given to you and he tells you exactly what you need to write down. You must study but tests are straightforward.
Very interesting lectures, and a really nice guy. Makes it easy for you to learn what you need to. Lectures mandatory but I learned a lot!

Dr. Fry is a great guy, he does everything in his power to help you as long as you seek it. Material is interesting, no book, attendance is mandatory, study for tests and you'll be fine. If you need a science with a lab, this one is awesome!

Such a great class to take if you need a 4-credit lab course. I have always hated science and Dr. Fry made me want to go to lecture because he kept it interesting and not dry and boring (plus you get extra credit for attending) Very clear about what is expected of you for the course. If you put in the time you will see results.

Great class, exams are a lot of memorization, and make sure you memorize everything. Going to lecture is mandatory because he takes attendance every class and it's part of your grade. Lab can be tricky because there is so much to cover for quizzes, and quizzes are only worth ten points. Overrall, it's a great class and I'm glad I took it.
Lectures are easy but he is not willing to help you out at all

Awesome teacher, everything is very straight forward. If you memorize all the outlines, pretty much word for word, you will do extremely well on all the exams. Lab is harder than lecture, but Adam Fry is an awesome teacher.

Very straightforward class. Outlines of the class are given and you fill in the blanks throughout lecture. Exams come directly from these notes. No textbook. No guessing. Probably your best bet if you're a non-science major.

this class is awesome. i am not a science person, but Fry is an AMAZING teacher. he gives you a sheet of notes to fill in every class - it keeps you paying attention and its easy- and the exam questions come straight from it. if you need a lab science, take this one. Fry rocks!

First off, he knew my name and face perfectly on Day 1. That's pretty amazing. Anyway, the grade you get in this class is completely up to you since it's just memorization. Great guy though, really funny. Highly recommend it.

You will get as much from this class as you put into it. Professor Fry makes a point that you need to study everyday in order to do well in his class and he is absolutely correct. One of the best classes I have ever taken even though my grade does not reflect it.

The best professor I've had so far at UConn. He is always willing to help and will tell you exactly what you need to know for the exams. Exams are a lot of memorizing, so make sure you are constantly studying. I never had an interest in paying attention in Bio, until I had Dr. Fry. Definitely a class worth taking.

Dr. Fry is a really nice guy. He really cares about his students and makes everything you need to know on the exam extremely clear and straight forward. No textbook, just outlines he provides for each lecture. Lots of memorization so studying takes time but if you put in the time you'll get an A.

Profesor Fry does a great job in teaching the biology for non-majors course. He knows that the material is not of keen interest to all, so he presents it in a way that is beneficial to himself and the students. This doesn't mean it's easy. The course does require a lot of memorization. Go over the outlines and go to class and you'll do well.

LOVE him. No textbook. Gives notes outlines at start of every lecture. He is funny. Memorizes the names of all 400+ students he has at the time (kinda freaky but cool!). Tests are straightforward-- BUT only if you study hard. I was scared of Biology until I had a class with him. He makes science simple and interesting !!

Dr. Fry is one of the greatest professors I've had at UConn thus far. If anyone reading this is on the fence about taking his class, take it! He's very fair and will know you by name by the third week. :)

Nicest professor at Uconn! He gives clear note outlines to use to study from exams, although there is a significant amount of memorization and studying needed to do well in this class.If you go to his office he will drop whatever he's doing to help you. He's helpful,such a sweetheart I will really miss him!

Such a great teacher! Gives you everything you have to know, he is always helpful & such a nice guy. Goes out of his way to make the class interactive and interesting! That being said, the class and lab were a ton of work, so don't take it if you can't/don't want to spend a TON of time on it. Learned a lot & had fun but overall very time-consuming.

One of the best professors ever. Excellent lectures, notetaking outlines provided. Flexible office hours and offers help whenever and wherever needed. Really nice guy too. Exams require a lot of studying, but they're straightforward and are simple with good attendance and notetaking.

I have no interest in biology,yet this class was pretty interesting and he goes out of his way to make it okay for everyone,even if you don't care about biology. Class is a lot of work, lots of memorization, but he's super sweet and helpful.He really wants everyone to do well, always has office hours so you can go get help. I will really miss him!

He presents the material to you in a clear manner and he is interesting to listen to in lecture (which you MUST go to). This was a lot of work for a gen-ed, especially a class made for non-science majors. You have to strictly rely on memorization so you don't really retain anything he teaches because all you do is memorize the notes he gives you.

Dr. Fry is a really awesome professor. He has a note sheet for every lecture. As far as biology goes, this class was not that bad, but it is a TON of work and studying for a gen-ed. Overall a good experience. He's understanding and really wants his students to do well, he is not out to trick you or make your life difficult. No textbook

Dr. Fry is literally the best professor I've had at UConn. He knows what he's doing, makes the class interesting, and is very helpful. He wants everyone to succeed. TAKE HIS CLASS! I personally am going to miss him!
It is a lot of studying and info. but it's a pretty good and easy class. Super nice guy really chill, wants students to do well.
Great professor! Actually likes to see his students do well, and goes out of his way to make this happen. Even if you don't like biology, this is a good class to take.

I am not a biology major, nor do I really have a big interest in bio, but I loved this class and having him as a professor! It's a ton of info. but if you study it's easy because it's all verbatum from the lectures. Flexible office hours, he's so kind and eager to help you. He truly wants you to do well, and is soo genuinely sweet! take this class!
Tells you exactly what to know for exams. A lot of information but an easy class. I recommend him if you are a non-science major.

TAKE HIS CLASS! Seriously the best professor ever. He's so nice, he lets you know exactly what will be on the exams and how to study for them. Definitely take his advice on how to study, it really works. He really makes bio easy and his class is worth taking
Awesome guy, really knows what he's talking about. Lectures outlines are very helpful and he tells you what's basically going to be on the exam. Great professor.

Gives you an outline with everything you need. Exams are hard, lab is a bit tedious. Overall very easy to do well in, especially since he gives you literally every bit of info you'll need to know. Takes attendance every class
He's wonderful. He knows the names of every student and gives very straight-forward tests. His exams are only easy only if you study everyday though.

Nicest professor you can have at UConn. You can go into his office whenever you want and he'll drop what he's doing to help you. Gives hints throughout class for what is going to be on the tests. Clearly cares a lot about his students and job.
Very good guy, he really wants all his students to succeed, and he makes the class interesting and easy to follow.
Great Proffesor, very helpful and really enjoys teaching. Will help you when needed and his tests are tough but he won't trick you. You just have to put the work in.

Fry is the man! He's incredibly nice and really goes out of his way to help you out. Exams are difficult if you don't study and attendance is mandatory, but there is no textbook for the class and he gives you handouts to fill in the information from lecture. If you're not a science major and need a lab course, Fry's class is the one you want!
Amazing, amazing, amazing professor. Learned everybody's name in less than one week. Dumbledore-esque ability to teach.

One of the best Ive had in terms of making what we need to know perfectly clear, tests are tough and there is a lot to memorize but he is an awesome, helpful guy. He also knows that his class is mostly non-science people. He really emphasizes real life things in each section and keeps it pretty interesting. overall a great professor.

I have never had a professor that is so clear and cares so much about his students. Exams aren't easy, but the notes are straightforward and there aren't any tricks. He knew every single student by name in a class of 300. He is also sooooo sweet!

Love, love, LOVE this guy! One of the best professors at UConn! He was so nice and so willing to help you. If you want a class you can skip, don't take it, but it's really an interesting class overall, so I wouldn't want to miss it anyways. Tests are difficult, but if you go to class, pay attention and study, you'll be fine.

Dr. Fry is so nice and goes way out of his way to help you. Lectures are interesting too. He knows everyone's name, and takes attendance very important. He grades fair and tries to give you many opportunities for lost points on exams. But I had a lot of trouble with exams, they weren't easy. You have to put the time into it, same with lab.

Made the subject soo interesting. Always gave real world applications to the given subject matter. No textbook. Always available to help out if you have questions. Tests are directly from class handouts. Completely straight-forward and I actually learned things!

Best class I took this semester! He knows the majority of the students are taking the class for their gen.ed.,so he makes every class fun.He knew all 200 students names,even without meeting them.No textbook, just fill in outlines that he supplies. Tests come straight from the outlines. Attendance taken everyday,but it's a fun class to go to anyway!

He is the best. As a Business major I really have no interest in Biology, but he made it easy and clear enough for everyone. The exams are easy. He tells us to read the lectures every day so you know them by heart when the exam comes, but you really don't need to. Do study really hard for exam 2-it has a lot of info.
BEST TEACHER EVER!!!! Adam is the man! he makes this class so fun and he cares a lot about his students..you can easily get a good grade in his class if you study and attend lecture

BEST PROFESSOR EVER! You can tell Fry cares a lot about his students. I had zero interest in bio before his class, but he made it so interesting. The exams weren't easy, but if you worked hard for it you got the grade you deserved. Best professor I've ever had and it will probably be hard to beat him.
best professor I've had at uconn. he really cares & wants his students to succeed. He knows we don't really care about his subject, so he tries really hard to make it relevant & interesting.

Hated bio going in, like it a little better now. I was hopeless at it but Fry mad it very clear and interesting. The tests were extremely hard, meaning you had to study at least 30 hours to get an A. He's a really nice guy and going to class and lab all the time will help your grade a lot.

He is the nicest professor at UConn. He will bend over backwards to help you get an A- in the course. I visited him and the Lab TA's a lot during their office hours, studied a lot for the exams and got an A- in the course. He really is something else. Take his class if you can!
He is amazing! Great class and he really cared for his students. This was by far my favorite class this semester!
LOVED HIM! amazing professor. tells you exactly what you need to know for the test. notes are fill in the blank. BY FAR my favorite professor yet.

If you need bio take it with him. Extremely clear in lecture, notes are easy to take as they are fill in the blank which allows you to concentrate on what he says AND take notes which really helped me learn. Exams are fair and are multiple choice/short answer. I studied a lot and got a B+. I fully recommend taking this class!

I dreaded taking bio, and he not only made it relatively painless but actually interesting! Lectures were a PLEASURE to attend, and he really tried to have some interesting content and occasionally made some very funny jokes. He didn't sweat it when I missed class because I'm commuter, either! Really cares, really good prof, HIGHLY recommend.
Great professor, you can tell he actually cares about his students (a rarity at UConn). Take his class if you can.

Great guy... only wants you to do well. He is extremely smart... memorizes everyone's name (yep all 350+ of his students each semester) within a couple months. Without a doubt my favorite professor so far in college. Just go to class... he gives you all of the notes, and that is exactly whats on the test, not all that difficult.

Loved loved loved him. I hate biology, and I always looked forward to going to his class. He has outlines and you just have to fill in the blanks with the right word. Tests are a little hard, but very doable. If you have trouble, he is ALWAYS there to help. If make an effort to do well, he will reciprocate. Take him if you can, he is great!

Adam Fry can be summed up in one word: amazing. One of the nicest, caring, most genuine professors and people I've ever met. He will make you love and learn Biology! Don't take this class with anyone else!!!

Probably the best professor I have had at UConn!! Prof. Fry ia overall a great guy and awesome prof! He will go above and beyond to help students and makes the class enjoyable :) Definitely recommend!!!
Great,friendly guy! Genuinely cares about his students' success. No textbook required. Class is pretty easy if you put in the studying that he recommmends.

Take Biology 1102 with Adam Fry! He is an awesome professor who obviously cares about his students. His office hours are all day, everyday (except when he is teaching the lecture). He is one of the best professors I have had since coming to Uconn.

Absolutely wonderful professor. Genuinely cares about his students. Whenever I see him outside of class, he makes it a point to say hello to me. He doesn't make the class extra easy, but is very willing to meet you at least halfway. Truly a good guy!

Prof. Fry will go above and beyond to help you. His lectures are interesting and funny. There is no book required for the class and attendance is mandatory. Labs can be a little hard but over-all the class is amazing

I love love love this professor! I'm an english major so science isn't my strong point but he sincerely wants his students to do well. He hands out outlines for each lecture, gives points just for attendance, and ALL of the test questions comes from the outlines. His office hours are all day, everyday. Really awesome professor!

Doesn't use textbook. Great person and teacher. Its a ton of material for 50 questions on each test. It takes up a lot of time for studying. The lab has weekly homework and quizzes, plus essays once in a while. I recommend taking another science for gened if you don't want to spend the time.

The greatest professor I've had since being at UConn. He's very fair and his lectures are straight forward and interesting. He will go out of his way to help you on exams and is always available for questions. Best professor.
I am not a Bio major, but I really enjoyed this class. He is helpful and funny and he makes the class interesting.

Professor Fry was the best professor I had my freshman year. He really goes out of his way to give you an A, is constantly in his office all day for you to talk to, and keeps class interesting. YOU MUST ATTEND CLASS TO PASS IT. Everything on his exams comes from the lecture outlines in class. Exams are hard but not if you study a lot. Nice guy.
He is amazing...if your a non bio major take this course..he wants to give you an A. Gives course outlines to just fill in the blanks and he is just soooo nice =D
Makes bio easy and pretty interesting. Exams are extremely straightforward. Highly recommend.
All you have to do is go to class and pay attention. He makes it totally bearable. :)
The finest teacher the world has ever seen.
FRY IS THE MAN!
Fry is SUCH a good professor!
Amazing teacher, by far the best. I wish he would teach Bio 107 or 108 also. Def take bio with him he will make it so much easier.

Professor Fry was the best teacher I have had at UCONN. He is awesome! Really helpful and he wants to make you get an A. Go to class, he often gives hints for his tests (especially fridays). He made the class a lot more bareable for a non-bio major. I highly recommend taking his class.
Professor Fry is the Man! He tests you right from the handouts he gives you. He is very clear and understandable. I definetly recommend taking him for Biology 102!

Great teacher, wonderful speaker, and does his damndest to get students good grades (honestly). Gives you lecture outlines so the text book is entirely unnecessary, but then class attendance is crucial. Labs were easy but semi-boring. I recommend Bio 102 as your lab science especially if you get Professor Fry.
He is one of the best professors i've had at the University of Connecticut.

GREAT TEACHER!! loved him- makes everything extremely easy by giving you typed up outlines that you have to fill in words which he puts up on the powerpoint. you dont use the book at all only study the sheets he gives you. my TA's in lab were horrible and extremely hard unlike the lecture
Absolutely phenomenal teacher. He had printed out notes to fill in for every class, and did his best to give every student the tools to get an A.
Great professor, makes bio easy to understand for the scientifically-challenged, overall great professor and a good science class to take.

Great guy, great class, I hate bio and still do but his class was definitely worthwhile. The exams are hard but he really does spell it out for you in the notes and tells you exactly what you'll need to know. If you go to class you'll get a good grade.
tests cover a lot of material. you really have to study a lot, but as long as you do, you do okay.
He's a really nice guy. Makes lectures more interesting with powerpoint and has an outline that you have to fill in. (he has to use a mike he said because he's mostly deaf). I liked him alot.
Gives you an outline to follow, making tests far, far more easier. Fairly cool guy, I'd recommend him.
he breathes into his microphone and it sounds like darth vader sometimes otherwise he's straight, gives you all the information, but can go pretty fast; does a decent job though
No Comments
No Comments
Tends to breathe heavy into his microphone and can go rather quick, but he makes lectures clear and his exam was fair.

I have had this teacher for chem 1124Q and now currently 1125Q. You HAVE to go to lecture, almost every lecture there are pop quizzes about the material for participation. Do not need to get the problems right to get credit. She is not helpful when going to office hours. Be prepare to go to SI which is very helpful and to deeply study the textbook

I had her for both 1124Q and 1125Q and didn't mind 1124 honestly. 1125Q with her was honestly one of the most difficult classes Ive taken at UCONN. The class is disorganized and the pacing she goes by does not help student learning. The class covers only 5 chapters, yet the first 3 were finished in a week each and the last 2 took up the rest of sem

Another review said it perfectly: This is the most average professor I have ever had. Her lectures were helpful. She is thorough especially when doing examples with the class. The course organization is a disaster for many reasons. We would be doing worksheets on content not yet covered in lecture, the online homework is frustratingly buggy.
She tends to ask "any questions" and then ignore all of the hands raised. She is not at all accessible outside of class and when she does answer a question the explanation is not clear.

The worksheets and textbook problems do not align with her exams. She does problems in the exams during lecture, so go to lecture! She posts exam slides but it takes her a couple days to a week to do so. She does not explain things well which makes the course even harder. It takes so much time out of your week (4 hours minimum if I'm lucky).

I was surprised that Dr. Selampinar got such a low grade on this website. I went from 1124 to 1126 with her, and it was awesome. I was not doing so well in my first two semesters, but I still got B and C from her class, so the class was not hard at all. 1126 could be more challenging. Go to lectures, do your worksheet, your exams will be just fine.

Class is more stressful than necessary. There are 5 exams throughout the semester plus the final. Iclicker is used during lectures so they are mandatory. She usually is far behind and you have to teach yourself the content for labs and homework before she even gets to it in lecture

Take another professor if you can. She does not curve, and her extra credit is worth nothing. I want to cry especially after this semester. I had a terrible semester and I wish I could go back and do better on the exams. Her discussion worksheets do not align with the exams so do the textbook problems.

Dr Selampinar is nice but I don't like the setup of her lectures. She jumps around a lot and we never finished the material in time. There is an exam every 2 weeks which can be stressful when she doesn't finish the material until 2 days before, and even has to leave stuff out of the exam because we never covered it (this goes for the final too).

Professor Selampinar is probably one of the most average professors I have ever had. Her grading criteria is very flexible since she has two grading paths based on how you do on her biweekly exams. Attendance to her lectures is mandatory because there is nowhere else to find missed material. Her lectures are sometimes dry and she can be rude.

I did not enjoy Selampinars class. She is constantly giving lengthy homework assignments which are very complex and often graces over topics that are important on Tests. She is not aware of her surroundings and will often not notice when students have questions and just move on anyways, avoid her
