This professor is friendly and always tries to explain hard concepts. I took 1124Q with her which was worse, 1125 wasn't that bad honestly. I did the homework, took notes off of the slides, went to office hours, and Supplemental Instruction which helped a lot. If you keep up with the content you should end with a decent grade.

Dr. Selampinar is fantastic. Her grading format is perfection, and she makes difficult topics accessible. Exam every other week is a bit of a task, but the breakup of concepts means that it's manageable. She cares about her students and likes to see familiar faces. You will not feel like a number in her classes. I wish she could teach me all 4 yrs!

I loved Dr. Selampinar! She was funny and made lecture interesting. She sometimes gives extra credit before exams and this is structured similar to a high school class (weight of grade wise). She has 2 grading plans and always takes the higher final grade. Overall a great professor!

Had her for 1124 and I am currently in 1125. If you watch the pre-lecture videos you will be fine. She really cares about her students, and will do anything she can to support your learning. Chem is generally a pretty tough subject and requires some effort but she made the topics much easier to understand. She provides chapter handouts for exams.

I actually really enjoyed Dr. Selampinar! She is very personable with her students and even goes as far to learn names of those who participate in lectures frequently. If you did not take an honors or AP level chem in HS, you will probably struggle in this class as she moves quickly. I found the class easy, but that's because it was review for me.

Dr. Selampinar has been one of my favorite professors thus far. She has very clear grading that is fair, gives extra credit, and curves the final. She wants her students to do well. If you attend lecture, go to lab, do the worksheets, and practice the problems she gives in class, you will be fine for the test. The SI sessions really help too.

Selampinar is overall a pretty decent professor. You really need to find the trick and know what types of questions she is going to ask for in exams. I recommend studying the problems she goes over during class, that is what closest mimics what you will see during exams. Weekly homework is pretty easy. Pre-Labs are always hard but good luck!

She knows what she is doing but does not explain anything well at all. Exams are usually multiple choice, 11 questions and somehow worth 70 points. If you get 1 question wrong your exam grade is already an 85 which ruined my grade. After the first week of review I was already nervous with her class because she could barely explain sig figs clearly

Prof. Selampinar likes to crack jokes and be personal with each student. The class is a bit confusing at the beginning because she doesn't explain the overall format of everything, but once you figure out which assignments are due when, it's an absolute breeze. As long as you take notes in lecture and study the problems given, you should be fine.

Not a good professor at all. She clearly knows what she's doing but she moves so quickly and doesn't teach the steps well at all. Her exams are pretty difficult and don't match up with what you learn in class. Might need to go to the Q Center or invest in a tutor.

Dr. Selampinar gives an exam every other week without a curve and doesn't know how to explain the material or questions students have. Students often watch other youtube videos during class because they don't understand her. She also gives clicker questions and goes around the room counting heads and matching up with how many answered the question.

I had Professor Selampinar for 1124, 1125, and 1126, and she was so helpful throughout. She has a great sense of humor and really does want her students to do well. You do not need to read the textbook. Just study and understand what's on the slides and redo problems that she went over in class and you will do well.

The class was online so it takes a toll on the grade, is not really clear on what you should know for the exams been though she gives a study guide. the discussion was just for the grade not even useful. The final Exam was not like the exams taken and she didn't tell us what it was out of. Honestly not the best chem professor.

Not bad, but not the greatest. The switch to online is stressful enough, didn't like her excessive use of lockdown browser for everything but it is what it is. Topics are manageable if you study, and she also offers extra credit so thats a plus. 2-3 hw assignments due every week, 5 exams total given every other week, and a cumulative final.

Dr. Selampinar was a great professor, had her for 1125 and 1126. She will always meet with you if you ask, and the exams are always very reasonable. The discussion sections are really where you apply what she teaches in lecture. She likes to get to know her students.

The biggest thing for me is that I can't understand what she's saying. Her accent is so thick that I get confused what she's trying to say sometimes. Her lectures aren't helpful, just watch the prelecture videos instead. SO much homework it's excessive. Lab is just doing a worksheet with your TA. I dreaded this class so much.

She's very hard to work with outside of the classroom. Takes forever to respond to emails, poorly resourceful, and teaches as if everyone understands the material at her level. Her test/quizzes are heavily graded, yet cover maybe 15% of the study guides, at best. More often than not, her TA's are more helpful than she is. 10/10 do not recommend.

Dr. S has become my favorite chem prof. so far. She had clear grading criteria and frequently gave us opportunities to get our grades up. The only complaint I have is that this class became difficult online due to changes in exam format and labs. But put the work in, attend discussion, ask questions and you'll do well. She wants you to pass!

Very confusing and hard to understand lady. The quizzes and exams were multiple choice, online. This offered no partial credit and hurt many students. It was an awful experience and I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy.

I love her! She has a sarcastic sense of humor and is sweet. She gave a lot of work, and quizzes/exams are every other week, so you have to keep up with the material. But she has so many extra credit opportunities (up to 25-ish points) and even allowed us to take an optional quiz to replace the lowest quiz grade. Class avg was an 88.

I felt she didnt explain the material very well. All of her quizzes (every 2 weeks) are multiple choice on lockdown browser, so absolutely no chance to get any partial credit. These tanked my grade. Luckily, she has 2 grading systems, one of which heavily weights homework, thankfully. Overall, I do not recommend her class to anyone.

Before I took her class, I read reviews on here and was expecting the worst. She is not bad at all. As long as you attend lecture, follow along, and keep up with your work you'll do fine. She has 2 plans for grading and gives you the highest grad, and she gives extra credit.

Selampinar does a good job with explaining concepts and going over practice problems in class. Her only downside is that she teaches the material incredibly slow so when you have your weekly lab/discussion half the time you have no idea whats going on. Make sure to do the notes problems and her extra problems for the exams. She gives extra credit.

I'm gonna be real with you guys. Lectures are a waste of time just only go for the clicker questions and do Aleks. Quizzes are online and have no partial credit. Exam reviews given have nothing to do with the actual exams. There's not enough time to complete exams. If you can, take the class at Hartford where they will actually teach you.

Dr. S is sweet. She lectures off of her slides and does examples. She posts her lecture slides, but not her examples. We had 3 exams, weekly ALEKS problems (get access codes), clicker questions (in class), quizzes, etc. Chem is typically hard but she gets the job done. She made cookies for us and makes jokes to herself. I'm with her next semester!

Dr. Selampinar gave my class a tremendous amount of extra credit opportunities. I got a 57 on an exam & with all the extra credit got well in the 80s. I went to her office hours & got a lot of help with concepts I was struggling with in class. If you make the effort, she presents you with all possible ways to pass and she's very extremely caring

Avoid this professor at all costs!! She does not answer questions clearly and rarely does examples in class, but when she does they are full of mistakes. Exams are extremely tough and blames the students when the class average is below a 50. If you have chemistry with her I highly suggest you drop it immediately.

God awful. UConn owes the students better than to continue to employ inept professors in the Chemistry department. Test questions were poorly written. Exams can't possibly be completed in allotted time. Messes up in lecture all the time, creating more confusion. Book used is Open Stax and also contains considerable mistakes.
Difficult, too fast paced.

Fantastic person. I missed a midterm with no real excuse and she said she would just give me the same grade for the midterm that I got on questions related to that chapter from the final. Would have gotten a 0, but instead got a 100. The class is pretty difficult, but if you always pay attention in lecture (the hardest part) you'll do fine

Almost everyone in my discussion class failed. So many students were put on academic probation or kicked out of their programs because of this class. ALEKS is a joke and the professor and TA barely knew how to do their own problems, especially when going over the exams. There is a serious problem with the chem department at UCONN, go somewhere else

You get what you put into this class. You can't study the week of the exam and expect a good grade. Read the text book the week before the exam, take notes from it, and do the problem set questions. Dr. Selampinar goes over all of the material on the exam and gives a lot of extra problems to do. She is available in her office whenever you need her.

She doesn't care about anything. The scribbles on the powerpoints and doesn't explain anything, and gets mad when you question her. Blames bad grades on the 1000+ students that "didn't study" when the only way to attempt to pass is studying for a week straight. Tests you on material she skips in class. Homework is annoying and not helpful.

She is so bad, the only good thing about her lecture is that she gives out summaries of the chapters. For the tests she gives out an extra review sheet that the other professors do not give out, which is nice. I survived the class by going to Dr. Cady's lecture.... Avoid her if possible
Disorganized, hard to understand, work is ridiculously hard, tests seem nearly impossible.

She is quite an interesting lady to say the least. She always falls behind, but somehow is able to keep you filled in on all of the content that will be on the exams. She has a great sense of humor, and is a very sweet lady. The main problem with chemistry is not the professor, but the way that the course is designed. ALEKS is annoying.

Hands out outlines of the notes but tends to not put important things that she has on the slides on to the outlines. Makes a lot of mistakes and doesn't answer students' questions clearly. Gives out study guides for exams but they're a lot easier compared to what the test is actually like. ALEKS is annoying but you learn more from it than from her.

A lot of people don't like Selampinar as a chem professor, but I honestly thought she was an amazing teacher. Yes, her tests are very difficult, but she gives you all the materials you need to do well in the class, it's just a matter of whether you use it or not. I am taking the second part of this course, Chem 1128Q with her next semester.
Very difficult to follow during lecture. Works quickly and makes mistakes in teaching that cause more confusion. Would not recommend taking if there are any other options. Tests are difficult.

Professor Selampinar is a nice person however, not the best teacher. Lectures are at a slow pace and makes the class seem very boring. The exams are not difficult but, the Openstax Textbook is horrific and useless. Be prepared to search up explanations online instead of learning through the lecture or through the textbook.

Selampinar really wants you to do well but moves through material too quickly and but some how she always falls behind. She will teach basics but not applied content that shows up on exams. She is funny and sometimes gives extra credit if you show up continually go to lecture. If you have her, take SI instruction.
Got an A in the class, just study the book, not the hard. PNB major going into pre-med.
I never know what's happening because she goes way too fast. Exams are extremely hard and she does irrelevant stuff during the lecture according to the exams. Do not take her class.
I took her in the summer time and I found she is not as bad as many reviews here. She provided very detailed review handouts and well-organized PPTs.
Hard to understand, covers material that is not on the exam and vaguely mentions material that is
Worst professor at Uconn, can not believe how little she cares about her students success. Her exams are impossible, the average for the third one was a 59% and they didn't scale it. Avoid this class

this course has a lot of hard concepts and materials. Personally I didn't find the lectures very helpful, but she provided a outline of what she was lecturing about which did help with studying. She used Aleks which I thought was way more useful then the lecture,but this won't help you that much on the exams. Practice the problem sets is key.

Hardest class I've ever taken. The course is a mish-mosh of unrelated concepts. Extremely dry lecturer, useless examples, most people didn't find them helpful. Take this class elsewhere if you can. If you're Honors, take that version. Labs are tedious but easy. Depends on TA, but discussion is where you'll actually learn. Exams are stupid tough.
Pros: Outlines given out at each lecture. Cons: Only did irrelevant practice problems during lecture, tests were difficult and not graded leniently.

Pros: Great chapter summaries given out in lecture which she pulls information from and puts on her exams as multiple choice questions. I just go to lectures and chill on my phone just so I can grab them. The exams are very formulaic. Majority of your grade is multiple choice so read up, but also Heavily practice problem sets/open ended problems

This professor is the worst one to take Chemistry with. She is extremely hard o understand, and often says one thing and write another. She rarely makes sense, and does not try to help students if they are struggling or don't understand. She didn't do a good job at preparing you for exams, either, through lectures or work.
If you need help she will help but it is a hard class and hard to understand if you've never taken a good chem class

Dr. Selampinar is an intelligent woman and she wants to help; that being said, she is sometimes unclear when teaching. Go to her during her office hours and take advantage of her one on one explanations.

TAKE THIS CLASS WITH SELAMPINAR! no professor gives really helpful/ easy to follow lectures but she gives extra credit and AMAZING chapter summaries with everything you need to know AKA you won't need to read the book. Do all the assigned problems and the problems around them in the book and know them like the back of your hand.

I just finished taking this class for Fall semester and IT WAS THE WORST CLASS EVER! I went to every lecture, which was basically a waste of my time because it was USELESS. She is very confusing and basically reads from the book you already have to buy. Now I have to start from scratch and retake the class. ALEK is annoying but very helpful

Exams are difficult and if you are having trouble go to your TA with homework questions. Aleks are weekly online homework assignments that can be extremely long and tedious, I suggest taking notes on them for the quiz at the end of the week. Going to class is not mandatory but she hands out helpful worksheets sometimes.

Had to drop. It is possible to get a good grade as long as your comfortable with a lot of math or its your hardest class in your schedule. Strongly advise you not to take bio and this course at the same time.
Her lectures are super confusing. After the second exam started going to Cady's lectures and he actually helped me pull my grade up. To do well in this class make sure you have A's on Aleks and lab.
I didn't take any ap chemistry before this and this class was very easy if you put the work in.

Avoid her at all costs. She's very unclear and spends all class trying to explain one simple problem. You'll have to teach yourself everything. Tests are brutal and hard to complete within the time limit. Aleks is the most frustrating thing ever but will be a good grade booster. Pre-labs can be tricky but you can easily get a good lab grade.

Run and hide. Try to get any other professor for beginner chem. Fatma does not help in the slightest and you basically have to read the book to learn anything. her lectures are pointless to attend and are not even interesting. The only redeeming quality is the fact that she gives out printed notes .

If you read and do problems, you're set. I'm looking at a B+/A- right now, and her lectures are useless if you read. She's reading slides which are basically straight out of the books. The test designs are pretty bad. Some will focus on multiple choice, some will focus on open ended. She started checking for attendance after the second test though.

She is an amazing woman and she is really there to help! I wasn't doing well and I went to her for help and she assigned me a study plan to check in with her every week with new problem set questions and we reviewed them! She doesn't want you to do bad! If you don't do the problem sets, you won't do well so really do them!!!!!!

Fatma is brilliant but just because she is smart doesn't make her a good teacher. Often times she skips steps and assumes you to know them. I personally don't get much out of lectures but her notes are helpful that she hands out. Definitly go to supplemental instruction or honesty take 1123 instead; its a weed out class
Was doing so bad in 1127 that I had to drop to save my GPA
havnt finished yet, but lets just say i got a 31 on the first exam. save yourself dont take 1127 at uconn
Sitting here in her lecture right now as we continue to do more problems from the homework. My neighbor has skipped this class for the past 2 weeks and still has an A.

Retook 1127Q going after an A, took her class for the summer session. What I noticed is that she is much different from my previous chem professor. Her exams are much much harder and ALWAYS exceeded the time limit where they had no choice but to give us extra minutes AND every exam had some answer key error, so expect points off on Qs you got right

This was definitely the worst class I've ever taken. No matter how much effort I put in, I still could not get a good grade. There are no practice exams, and her review sessions do not help because she covers material that isn't on the exams. Perfect lab and Aleks grades are essential to make up for bad exam grades.

1128 is the hardest class I've taken so far, and Selampinar doesn't make it much easier. I went to almost all the lectures, and they were basically useless. She's very confusing, and she goes through examples too quickly. Reading the textbook and doing the problem sets are ESSENTIAL to getting a decent grade.

I got an A- in chem 1127Q and I was not expecting 1128Q to be this hard. Fatma did not help one bit. She is very confusing, she even confused me and I took this class senior year of high school and passed with an A. I DO NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE TO TAKE HER CLASS!
Hardest class I've ever taken at UConn. Am an A student otherwise that put all my time into Chem and now have to retake. Save yourself and take at a branch.

It's possible to pass this class but you really need to work for it, especially if mathscience isn't your fortÃ©. She does have an accent so if you aren't good with accents, beware. She doesn't like when students ask questions. Exams are difficult. I think you'll be okay if you get a good TA though.
1128 is the hardest class you will ever take. Got an A in 1127 and have to retake 1128.
The worst professor I've ever had here at UConn. This woman could care less about how much you learn.

I hate this lady. She literally laughs at students with questions that she thinks are stupid, and then won't even answer them! She seemed giddy when she told us that "more than half of my students fail the second exam of this course" and didn't seem to comprehend that it was her fault because she's a terrible teacher. I go to another lecture now.

Selampinar's lectures are very long. She mostly just does problems in class. She gives out a packet that summarizes the notes of every chapter which is very helpful. Reading the book and doing all the problem sets are a must if you want to ace the exam. I don't recommend taking this class if you don't have to, because exams are very specific.

Dr. Selampinar's class was honestly one of the worst classes I've ever taken. Her lectures were basically her doing easy practice problems that made students feel comfortable for the exam. Then when the test came around, the problems were ridiculous and had nothing to do with lecture. If you can avoid this class do it, there are better teachers!
She's hard to understand at times, but most of what she talks about in class will be on the exams. She tries to help her students as much as possible.
Truly terrible teacher and class. Her lectures were boring and unhelpful. Gives very unclear answers to questions. The tests are tough because there is not much to study off of.

I found lectures to be very confusing. Moves very quickly through problems, and doesn't give you time to comprehend or really ask any questions. Stopped going to lectures. DEFINITELY get the textbook, take notes and do the problem sets - I felt much more prepared for the exams once I started doing this, and the exams are hard.

This class is dependent on your understanding of the material... and Dr. Selampinar doesn't care if you know it or not. She is extremely confusing and I would recommend avoiding this class at all costs.

1127 is the hardest class I've ever taken. All Fatma does is do problems on the projector during lecture. The exams are very hard and it takes a lot of studying to do alright. I've heard different things about the TA's, but personally, mine was a very hard grader for labs and discussion assignments, and he barely spoke english.

Chemistry killed my GPA.. No matter how hard I tried, I failed. There id no way to pass this class unless you pass the exams because its 70% of the whole class. If you can avoid this class, please do.

Had to drop class. It was the hardest thing ever. The average for the first two exams were in the 50's and that was out of 800 students! AVOID THIS CLASS. Take it at a regional campus or a lower level if possible.

Professor Selampinar is a little difficult to understand but you get used to it after the first few weeks. I always attended lecture and found them to be extremley useful. That combined with her review sessions before the exams helped solidify my knowledge on the material. Definely do the problemsets for practice problems and study for lab quizes.

Both 1127 and 1128 are taught by terrible teachers, and the Chem department has no idea what it's doing. But if you had to pick one, Selampinar is the only professor worth going to lectures of (people skip their own teacher's sections to go to hers) and that's saying something. Basically avoid gen chem if you can.

Nice lady, bad teacher. She doesn't explain well. Gives handouts and then just does them on the projector without explaining her steps or thinking. I take thorough notes from the book to help me understand and OWLs actually help you understand better, too.
Best professor I had all semester, she does a great job of explaining examples and making sure you fully understand before moving on. Gives plenty of review for exams as well. Highly recommend.

Professor Selampinar is outstanding. She gives great eamples during lectures and is more than willing to help if you see her during office hours. Tests are difficult but if you review her notes, read the textbook, and do the review sheets you will be fine

Switched halfway through the year into Selampinar's lectures. She is by far the best professor/lecturer of all the 1127 professors. She also holds alot of power and knows alot of information as she is head of the department

All she does in lecture are examples from her own notes that she neither explains or elaborates on. You must assume where she is working from, it is very unclear. Then she puts problems on her exams that we have never seen before. It is no surprise she is on academic probation for failing too many students.

She uses a projector while she lectures to write notes and examples. I didn't like this because she moved quickly through the examples without explaining the steps she took to get the answer. The exams are much harder than the examples shared in class. I ended up teaching myself everything using the textbook, which was very time consuming.
nice lady, easy class. didn't buy the book and got an A easily just by attending lecture and doing practice exams.

She was a great professor. She genuinely cares about her students and is always available to help. The course isn't necessarily a breeze, but if you put in the necessary work, its really not too tough.
She's a decent professor, especially in a hard course like chem. You will have to study a lot to see good results however. Went into the class thinking she would be horrible, but she taught well.

Despite what some people say about her, Prof. Selampinar is actually the best chemistry teacher I have ever had. Her style of teaching worked for me. I hated chemistry to begin with and now I'm declaring it as my major. Give her a chance and you won't regret it.

She is an absolutely wonderful professor and person. She really cares about the students and she wants you to understand chemistry. Chemistry is hard, and it's not any easier with anyone else. Best chem prof I have had so far, she teaches you everything you need to know for the exams. She's always really helpful and emails back SUPER fast.

Dr. Selampinar is the best chem teacher I have had, and I have had Morey and have gone to Oppenheim's lecture. She is a nice lady who is very approachable and helpful. She teaches you what you need to know for the exams. I mean come on, you can't expect a weed out college course to just hand you an A. If you put in the time an A is doable.

I am a Chemistry major and I personally didn't like the way she taught. Though she does know her material she quickly gets off topic, preferring to make jokes with the people sitting in the front row. Do all of the problem sets and if your TA is not helping you go to her office hours, but be warned she will consistently call on you in lecture.

Such a good professor. I loved her teaching style. I took both chem1127 and 1128 with her and she is the best. She is hysterical in class as well as extremely helpful during her office hours. By far my favoriate professor at Uconn. Definitely take gen chem with her.

Gen Chem is a weed out course, tests will be extremely thorough. Know your material and be able to do it fast. That said Dr. S is a fantastic teacher. She is very thorough in explaining material is very approachable and provides good extra study materials. I strongly recommend her to anyone taking gen chem.

Took in Spring 2011. horrible teacher. Doesn't know how to connect to students in lecture. BUT a great help during office hours. Knowing how 2 work the practice tests is not enough at all. Listen, gen chem is a weed out course. Hundreds of kids will get C's and D's & nothing will change. You gotta work hard for a high B or A. Plain and simple.

She is a really sweet and funny lady. The concepts are easy to understand in class but they are nothing like the exams. You really have to put a lot of effort into this class. I really liked her as a lecturer but her examples weren't that helpful when it came time for the exams.

Does not teach well. Uses overhead projector and writes notes (which you often can't read). It's easy to understand her accent, but she's so dry and boring. Nice lady who is willing to stay after to help you study, but very unclear in the lectures.

Completely useless, you'll quickly learn how pointless the lectures are. She doesn't teach anything well or in a comprehensible manner, while still going at a snails pace. Fortunately the class is pretty easy as long as you do all the work assigned.
Her lectures are worth going to and clarify the problems sets, etc. Despite her accent she is easy to understand. Makes herself available to students and will respond to emails quickly.

I got an A in this class, because I went to class, did the problem sets, did ADDITIONAL problems on my own from the back of the book, and went to tutoring sessions for chem. She is VERY understanding, she curves, she adjusts the weight of your lowest exam. I got a 60% on an exam and still got an A in the class

Yeah she's bad. Do the problem sets, owls, practice exams, and go to lab. Don't go to lecture except for the second exam material. I tought myself everything. She doesn't really do reviews in lecture either. One time she called me out for leaving lecture because I needed to study. Embarrassing. Bad.

Don't expect an A-- this class is meant to be very difficult. A weed-out class for sure. Read the text, do homework and OWLs, and pay attention in lab. The lecture is absolutely useless. She goes way too fast and I can hardly understand her. She doesn't put up any notes on HuskyCT. Its hard to keep up.
bad bad bad

I never went to lecture & taught myself everything using the textbook. I also took AP Chemistry before taking this, so it was a lot easier for me than it was for most people. Everyone I know spent a lot of time in the Q center with the tutors.

Never answered my emails, and enforced an unreasonable regrading system for the exams. Class is inconsistent through the years. Last year the class had bonus problems on every exam and the grades were curved, this year our exams were longer and harder with no bonus or curve.

I never had a good Chem teacher in high school, so Fatma was a step in the right direction. Although it was very hard, it was very rewarding at the end of the semester to complete the course. I only recommend this class to people who are strong in math and comprehensive reading. Do not take this class if you are not strong in either.

Really nice lady, she will help you if you ask for help. However, the exams are really hard and not comparable to examples done in class or review sessions. I have a strong math and chem background, but do not do as well as I hope on most of the exams. Best 1127/8 teacher though.

She is very difficult to understand in lecture and it is very hard to keep up with her pace in class. The class is a mandatory gen ed, so I would try taking it with either another professor or on the off semester when there's not as many kids.

Best professor to teach the specific course in the university. She's also the one who makes the exams for the whole department. The class itself requires a lot of time and studying. Prof teaches well!

Best professor to teach the specific course in the university. She's also the one who makes the exams for the whole department. The class itself requires a lot of time and studying. Prof teaches well!

She makes the tests for 1127 and 1128. They are mcuh more complicated than the homework, and other examples she gives you. I did like how she puts practice exams online for us, they are very similar to how the test looks and how hard it is. I had a tutor and mostly taught myself. Its definetly a weed out class.

VERY HARD CLASS! teacher is the best one youll find though. helps kids and spends hours out of class helping them. HOWEVER.. EXAMS ARE EXTREMELY DIFFICULT. not taught problems at the level of difficulty on exams in class which is unfortunate and does not prepare you well for exams. which are most your grade.
Be prepared to teach yourself how to do chem

Lectures dont help. Dont go. plain and simple. Stay home and read the book. Do the problem sets at the Q center and figure out how to actually do it. Owls are probably the most helpful way to learn. She responds to emails quickly and nicely. Seems like a very nice lady although i've only been to class a handful of times. Caution:second exam is hard

Very challenging class, going to lecture is useless since she goes through the material way too fast. If instead of going to lecture you stayed home and read the book for an hour you would be learning much more. DO YOUR OWLS and PROBLEM SETS. The Q center is the only reason i got an A in this class. Watch out for the second exam, its tough.
Avoid taking her classes! Her exams don't make sense and have problems she doesn't teach you how to do

Selampinar is a great professor as she really helps us understand the material. First of all, you aren't expected to learn everything from the professor, you still have to read the books. She uses a lot of the homework problem examples in her lectures which is very helpful. Overall she is a good professor.

Lecture is necessary, she goes over everything and makes outlines to follow along. Does a lot of examples and explains them step by step. Her accent is a little hard to understand but it is not too bad. Lab is easy. Do well on quizzes, problem sets, and owl. Study past exams, it helps a lot. I recommend buying the workbook too.
She is terrible at explaining the course material. No reason at all to go to lecture, just learn from the book and the packets she hands out. Mad hard exams, gotta study a lot.

Horrible, horrible, horrible.Class is supposed to be general chemistry but exam average was a D+(she called it a 70).WORST CLASS EVER, have to put in hours upon hours of work. Take it over the summer at a different campus or take AP Chem.

AVOID HER CLASS AT ALL POSSIBILITIES!!! She singles students out in class, she tells you she is available for help, that you just have to make an appointment, but after the first class you are too scared to even send her an email. Doesn't speak english well, OWLs are the best way to understand material
Her lectures are somewhat boring, but she will do anything to help you pass. She's always in her office and loves to see students. She's definitely the better gen chem teacher.
As long as you go to the lectures, do OWL, the PS before the tests, and get help for the problems you don't understand you will do well. A lot of outside work though.

tests way too difficult! shes a very nice lady but she teaches via problems and examples which is helpful but she neglects to teach theory as much as she should so when you get her exams in your hands with problems that are way harder than the problem sets or what she did in class you are stuck. she does have extra help time and problem set reviews

Her bad rap is undeserved! Chemistry is a hard subject fundamentally and she does her best to help students along. She does care about students especially if you put in the required effort . Her review sessions are extremely helpful as well. Study the problem sets for the exam and you should be fine!

Very boring. Doesn't really try to make lectures interesting. Very hard too. The tests are way too long for the time given. Never had any time to check my answers. Do well on the homework and quizzes because they're easy and help your grade a lot. Try and keep your tests in the C/B range and you should be ok.

I studied so much for this class but got a C-. She's an okay professor and goes over problems well. If you do OWLs and the labs and homework, they should boost your grade. Exams were horrible and brought my grade down a lot.

I put so much time, effort and studying into this class but only pulled off a B, which was better than I did in Chem 1127. I don't think Selempinar is a great teacher, but she's the better of the two choices. I appreciated the PS sessions & chpter outlines. Exams are always the killer- too long and too complicated to complete in the allotted time.

chemistry is a hard subject, it's not something you can get away with by not studying. looking back on past exams, at least half of the questions come from the problem sets. i think she is fair and very helpful. her problem set sessions are AWESOME. she wants the best for everyone and understands its hard. go to her office hours if you need help :)

Lectures are absolutely horrible. She talks at changing pitch, going from near whisper to shouting from word to word. Personally I learned more from the book than I did from lecture, and others have agreed with me. Lab is your grade saver, and make sure to do OWL. It's repetitive and annoying, but it boosts your grade. She's the best of the worst..

low grades bias professors ratings, but the program is respected by employers and grad schools. excellent teacher. skilled at dealing with discouraged students and keeps them on track.respects attendance.boosts your grade if attend every class.your lower-than-preferred grade will look better than a higher grade from another schools easier chemistry

Fatma was an okay teacher. The class was tough but in lecture she would give a handout on basically the entire section we would be going over for the week that we were able to follow along with. Tests were hard and she always put the hardest questions possible on them. If you study hard, do OWL and do good in Lab you'll get at least a B

She's the best professor ever. Noone wouls stay extra hours every week to help students to solve problems. if you do all the homework and OWL, study them carefully , u should expect a B at least. She's a nice person. I love her.
Horrible teacher. cant understand her accent, impossible exams, no grading, and will test you on things she never taught. Homeworks suck.

Thought that this general intro chemistry course was going to be managable, but boy was i wrong. she is the one who makes the tests that are impossible to complete with a satisfactory job. If you ever meet with her she is rude and difficult to understand. The lab portion of the course was ok, but it was the tests that will finish you offf. So dont

started going to her lectures half way through the semester b/c my prof was a worse teacher. She gives out worksheets in class and does practice problems. It's difficult to understand the accent for a while. Although she will meet with you in her office, my experiences haven't exactly been very welcoming. Hard course, hard exams.
she is the worst professor i have ever had. her accent is incomprehensible and lectures are useless. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!
Does not check email frequently
This woman is awful. Her tests are impossible and doesn't curve.

the best general chemistry teacher although she herself is not very good. Her accent is not bad and only does the MOST basic examples in class then exams are just ridiculous. expect to study A LOT. does not curve the class so unless you are naturally good at chemistry or spend a couple hours a day studying don't expect anything close to an A
She is SUCH a good teacher. The class is very difficult but she really cares about her students. She is very helpful at her office hours and is very nice.
Her exams are tricky and she does not care about her students at all. If anything she'd rather see us fail and her idea of a curve is adding five points to a 250 point exam.
absolutely terrible teacher. does not care abhout students. likes to make her students fail. went to her during office hours and she was grumpy. kept the last review session a secret.
it is hard to understand her and she does not take the time to review questionable material

Really knows the material and really tries to help students to understand it. Lectures can be a little slow sometimes and can fall behind, but then she usually fixes the exam to accommodate that. Hands out notes and reviews which are helpful for exams and also has review sessions which are awesome!
Good teacher although the course is tough. I also had her for 128 and that was even tougher. She is very willing to help out when you need it.

Selampinar is probably the best of the General Chemistry teachers at UConn. For each chapter, she creates handouts that you can only get if you attend class. She does many examples in class which are reinforced by the text homework questions. Exams are difficult, but if you put in the effort and practice all the problems, you should do well.

She cracks a couple of good jokes every once in a while to keep it interesting. She's extremely nice and obviously knows what she's doing. If you pay attention to what she says, and look over the textbook a little bit you will do fine on the exams. She has an accent, but I haven't met anyone who has had a problem understanding her.

A very bad teacher. She knows alot about chemistry but can't explain it for the life of her. Her heavy accent is excruciating, evening coming from someone with a foreign parent. Why does uconn hire so many people that can't speak English properly? Only the students suffer.

Such an awesome professor! Really helpful especially if you see her after class and show her that you are interested in learning. Exams are extremely difficult but fair. If you want to get an A she will help you until you feel comfortable with the material.

Definitely the best chem teacher but 128 is so much harder than 127. Have to go to class to get the outlines. Exams are extremely difficult but there is no reason why you should fail the class if you do the work. Little accent but she speaks so loudly that it's never a problem.

A good chem teacher. Have good notes but you have to go to class to get the notes. She teaches you to do some problems which may appear on the exam. Hold review session. A little bit accent, but that's fine for me. The exams are mostly designed by her. Why take other professors' class?

I took 127 with her and liked her a lot. 128 is a lot harder. She doesn't do as good of a job explaining it. She's not a bad teacher but she spends too much time teaching the easy stuff so you don't get a good understanding of the harder stuff. Tests are hard It is a weed out class. You need to put a lot of effort into this class but its passable

I can honestly say that this is the worst person that has ever taught me anything. Her lectures are useless; all you go over are unused examples that she makes up. What's worse is when she teaches something to you, and you're absolutely sure you know it, the exams are impossible. The class average right now is a 53% and that's sad.

She's a really nice lady and funny. She has very good notes although you need to go to class to get them because she doesn't put them online. It's chemistry so it's not easy but if you go to class you should understand it pretty well. I'm doing very well I have an A in the class right now. She's definitely the best chem professor.
She was a good teacher, you have to be able to work, probably a good idea to check out her problem sessions, she pretty much answers everything that you need to know.
She is a great professor. She is willing to help when you need it. Its Chemistry so it is going to be difficult
She creates the tests, definetly take her, she's the best of the bunch!
Although she has an accent, she gets everything acorss really well and hold plenty of review sessions where she acually does the homework with you.
her problem sessions are extremely helpful and she responds to emails really fast. she's really interested in her students and you can tell.
she's one of the best professors i've had. shes cool and funny and gives a lot of extra help. notes are very good. should go to her problem sessions, they are extremely helpful.
She is extremely nice and is always willing to help, she's very approachable. She gives really good examples in class but it is chemistry so the exams are generally difficult.
The class in general is tough but she tries to help you as much as possible. I thought she was a great teacher
she is very helpful but the class is extremely hard and sometimes it is difficult to understand her because she is foreign
she's cool
NOT GOOD

She is awesome. She is very helpful and tries to get students to come for help...and if you do..she might just give you a few extra points. She is extremely intelligent and knows exactly what she is talking about and tries to put it in terms her students will easily understand. Great Chem professor.

Dr. Selampinar is very good when it comes to helping students. She dedicates a lot of time and effort into making sure that her students understand the difficult material. Her lectures however, can get boring as she sometimes speaks in a monotone voice.
You definately to work hard in her class (let's face it's chem). If you approach her she is very helpful. She does everything possible to make you understand the subject.
The accent made it tough at times, if not humorous, but she really cares about her students. It sucks because it's chemistry, which is possibly the worst course anyone has to undergo.

Holy crap, when I say she goes over every little thing, she goes over EVERYTHING. I don't know what everyone else is complaining about, besides maybe her accent, but she is nothing but an amazing chemistry teacher who helps out. Do your best to get her, especially if you're not that good at chem!
she's not that bad and will help you when you need it.
No Comments
wow...........what can i say.... this lady should not be allowed to teach. Her bias is rivaled only by difficult tests. BEWARE.

I really don't think she was a bad teacher. I'm purposely trying to register to get her for next semester. She may be hard to understand with her accent at the beginning of the course, but once you get used to her speaking, its fine.

Prof. Selampinar is a no-nonsense good chem teacher. Though she might not always understand American humor and is not overly entertaining, she knows her material and it is very thoughtfully presented. She has my respect.
When students talk to her she acts like she is in another world, completely clueless almost as if she cannot comprehend the words that you saying to her.
He's rude in one on one sessions and goes on several of tangents

Cady is the best lecturer for 1127 and 1128. Although it's a difficult subject, he gives many helpful examples during lectures and seems to go at the right pace. Is very attentive to student suggestions, and his office hours and completely worth it if you're struggling. Gen Chem is tough, but Cady is the right prof to take it with

I had a different professor for chem and he was so bad I stopped going to his lectures and started going to Dr. Cady's instead. As soon as I started watching Dr. Cady's lectures and learning from him, I did SIGNIFICANTLY better on exams, although it was too late in the class to bring my grade up very much. If you're going to take chem, take Dr.Cady

Cady is the best chem prof IMHO. His lectures are the most thorough and helpful because he's the one who makes the exams for the class. I didn't even technically have Cady this semester for Chem 2 but I went to his lectures anyway because I preferred them over my actual professor. There's online HW, pre-labs, labs, 3 exams, and 3 quizzes.

Clyde is very good at explaining things, but he is very boring, homework every week is very easy, and tests are also easy. Attendance is not mandatory but it is probably the best way to learn the material.

Chem 1128 is a difficult course and the grading structure of the exams don't help students. However, Cady explains concepts clearly and concisely. He teaches by example problems. If you have to take chem 1128, take it with Cady because he writes the exams, teaches it very well, and does similar example problems to what is on exams. 10/10 teaching.
He is the best out of the chem 1128 profs but the course is very hard. Since he posts all his lectures, I would suggest rewatching them for exams and utilize him during his office hours.

Imo, the best professor for both chem 1127Q, and 1128Q. Only one who prioritizes practice problems that are similar to the exam bc he writes the exam. Only critique is he's very boring, and some of his slides are useless. Recommend watching his online lectures on 2x speed asw practicing hw and exam review problems
Dr. Cady is inconsiderate about personal issues that conflict with exam times. He is not a good person and will not be accomodating to you. Go straight to the Dean of Students if you have conflicts.

Dr. Cady is a good lecturer- there's not a lot of energy in them but he explains concepts well and the examples are incredibly helpful, often extremely similar to exam questions. He's accessible outside of class, and always posts lecture recordings in case you missed something. Exams are fair, and the workload is very reasonable.

If you're taking gen chem, take it with Cady. He explains things really well and his lectures most accurately reflect the concepts on the tests and quizzes. He makes lectures more enjoyable with jokes and demonstrations. Use the homework and SI slides to study, since they are often very similar or exact replicas of test problems.

I had a different professor, but attended Cady's lectures because he is the only chem professor who actually teaches to the exams as he is the one that makes them. The online homework is a pain, but if you start early in the week it will be okay. You HAVE TO use the SI material and do practice problems if you want to do well.

Professor Cady is an absolute wizard in the realm of chemistry! From the moment I entered his potion-filled laboratory, I knew I was in for an enchanting academic experience. His lectures are like magical incantations, turning complex chemical concepts into an elixer of knowledge. Enroll if you want to embark on a fantastical journey.

Gen chem is difficult no matter what, but Cady's lectures were straightforward and made the content more digestible. He was patient and helpful during office hours and took the time to explain concepts. I also found his jokes kinda funny

Professor Cady is the best chemistry professor. I had friends who had other professors but chose to go to his lectures. He is the main professor who creates the exams so his lectures most accurately cover the exam material. Just a note the online homework platform can be a pain sometimes. But don't be afraid to ask questions to Cady or your TA.

If given the choice, chose Cady over all other professors. His class if pretty straightforward, but not easy. (Gen Chem is a difficult course for everyone) Out of all the lecturers Cady explains topics the best and also is who creates all the exams for 1127. As for the quizzes, good luck! They are impossible to study for and are super hard.

As a student of Caldwells, switching over to Cady's lectures honestly saved my grade. He explains things clearly and his tests actually reflect his material which is rare for professors, he is very kind and willing to explain concepts. As long as you stay on top of assignments and attend SI you will do well in this class

It's gen chem, it's not going to be a cakewalk. But Clyde eases the pain a little bit. He answers questions, sometimes re-explains material, and makes the objectives of the course clear. If you're going to go to any of the (optional) lectures, go to his. Regardless, get ready to study a lot if you want an A.

The prior reviews scared me of taking the class, but I really don't see what other people are talking about. I've talked to Cady before, and he's not rude as most say he is. Tips to ace the class are stay ahead 24/7, go to SI, office hours, and practice problems in the syllabus. Be prepared, Gen chem is not just a class you can slack off in

Dr. Cady is a great guy- clearly passionate about chemistry and obviously knows what he's talking about. Having already taken AP Chem in high school, the class isn't that hard, just attend the lectures and use the SI content/Q Center if struggling. His office hours are flexible as well, and he's always willing to explain more about a topic

This incompetent teacher has no social skills and hardly helps you. If you want help you have a better chance of going to the TAs, or even your classmates, than to him. He downgrades you belittles you while trying to teach and expect you to know practically all the things covered in his course. GET ANYONE ELSE!!!

Chem 1128Q is an exam-heavy course. The homework is harder than the exam material. Lectures are clear and concise, and posted online so you can skip class if you can't make it (or simply aren't feeling it that day). He is not responsible for exam regrades anymore, so file for regrades every exam and you're likely to get points back.

Obviously CHEM 1128Q isn't the easiest course, however I feel that Dr. Cady makes this course very manageable. Beginning of the course is easy, and does a 180 once you get to buffers/titrations. Not sure if summer differs from a regular semester, but there were no surprises on the exams that he didn't cover in class. Curved where it was necessary.

I did well in this class solely by learning through the practice problems, homework, online textbook. This course is severely outdated, but more importantly, Cady is rude and condescending. He is unkind, unaccommodating, and unhelpful. No matter what professor you take this class with, everything goes through Cady which I think is very weird.

Out of the other chem profs Cady is probably your best bet. But he will not accommodate for illness, schedule conflicts, or technical issues with things like homework. Very exam heavy so GO TO SI, it is always very similar to the exams. Final is very diff from class exams and based on the ACS book so review that all semester if you want to pass.

Overall, Cady is a great professor. His class is very rigid for 1128, but it's very doable. His slides mimic the exam questions- and he does a great job of explaining what needs to be explained content wise. I had Papadim, but I just watched Cady's lectures bc while Papadim is funny, he's just not the best lecturer. Would take 1128q w/ Cady.
His lectures are good but his personality is horrible. He is very rude and condescending. I'd recommend taking it with someone else and just watching his lecture videoes.

Cady makes the exams for 1127 and 1128, so you're best off if you take the lecture with him. He's very unforgiving when it comes to family issues/illness/other circumstances out of your control. I had covid and missed a few assignments, he didn't do anything to open them back up for me. The course in general is also unnecessarily difficult.

I was scared because of the reviews but I thought Professor Cady was so nice and gave amazing lectures. His passion for the subject showed and his lectures were "dumbed down" so that everyone understood and the exams always looked like his practice problems. He also posts all his recorded lectures online so you can skip.

Dr. Cady truly cares about his students. Chem 1127 and 1128 were both very difficult classes, however Dr. Cady helped me the entire way. Utilize office hours as he will 100% explain any concept that you are confused about. Tests are hard, but using the practice problems from Dr. Cady's slides definitely help. He is the best chem professor.

Cady is pretty great I am just bad at chem. He uses good examples and his in class problems are almost identical to the exam questions. You have to really pay attention in class, but the exams are really curved so passing isn't a problem. I took him for 1127 as well and he is just a nice guy and very helpful because he actually wants you to pass.

ignoring his snarky personality, he is definitely the best chem 1127/1128 professor. he focuses on practice problems similar to exam questions (he writes the exams for every teacher) and records every single lecture. the 1127-1128 classes are all the same stuff except different professors. I liked cady's lectures the best by far for both classes

Loved Dr. Cady & his teaching style. His discussion of the material was in depth & he did a lot of useful practice problems. He once approached me after class (bc I had asked him a question at the end of the class) & brought me to a periodic table & answered the dozens of questions I had. I like his humor and he's a nice person. Highly recommend!

His lectures are good but his personality is absolutely garbage. He is extremely rude, condescending and insufferable especially over email. I've heard that he's made students cry. He's decent as long as you don't have to see or talk to him. I'd recommend to take the class with another professor and just watch his lectures.

He is by far the worst professor I've had. He has zero compassion for his students and treats them like crap. Speaking from personal experience he is very condescending and rude if you have questions or ask for extensions even if you have legitimate reasons. Maybe working with chemicals melted whatever humanity he had...

Professor Cady is overall a good professor! He does a good job lecturing, he explains the material well, gives you practice problems and has homework for you to do and practice as well. The only thing is that he is very strict, doesn't give you a chance and isn't very lenient in giving points back or allowing you to retake anything.

Good prof to have if you took chemistry in high school. Explains things well but does not go in-depth, would not recommend if you have a hard time w/ Chem. I didn't think the tests were that hard, if you can do the Hw you will do well on the tests. Posts all his lectures and videos of class online so I honestly didn't go after the first 3 weeks

ABSOLUTELY THE WORST PROFFESOR. stay away from him unless you want to hate life. His teaching style sucked. He put up presentations where he answered his own problem questions with NO explanations. His handwriting is awful during lectures to the point where I had to go get my eyes checked after the first week. Very rude over emails, has no empathy.

Had him for 1127 and 1128 and to give perspective, a girl in my class had found out recently that one of her family members passed and she was not able to take the upcoming exam because of that traumatic experience and because she missed the exam she scored a 0 on the exam...he kicks puppies in the morning

I think Cady is a good teacher. The class is hard, but he explains pretty well and he uploads all his lectures so you technically never have to attend class at the actual time. The weekly homeworks can be alot so you have to start them early. Once I started signing up for one on one slots with him on Nexus I started doing better on the exams.

Professor Cady is one of the best professors to take in the chem department. He is kind and very easy to talk to in person, and is helpful during his office hours. His lectures correspond to pretty much whatever is on quizzes and exams. Start the online homework early in the week and study for the quizzes and exams and you'll do well.

Probably the best professor for gen chem. He makes the tests, so what he teaches in lecture is a good indicator for test material. He has good office hours and seemed pretty nice. Material is kinda difficult, but not too bad. Go to lecture, study, and use the resources available to help you and you'll be fine. Lab is fun and pretty easy.

uhhhhhh I don't really know where to start. I failed every exam. he is nice and probably the best chem lecturer who speaks clearly and gives clear instruction on new topics. don't even take chem in general it sucks. lab is fun. take notes and do homework.

Not sure why he has so many negative reviews, he is a great lecturer, well paced and thorough explanations. Homework can be a lot, but its fine but DO IT EARLY ON IN THE WEEK!!! This will make it a lot more manageable.

I don't understand why Cady has all these negative reviews on here. He genuinely is such a sweetheart, and he made Chemistry actually enjoyable. He's super clear and thorough while teaching, and made me understand even the hardest topics this semester, and that's coming from someone who barely had a chemistry education in high school.
Lecture is different with homework, SI sessions/ homework/ lecture none of it help with the tests. Basically study on your own but the study material does not help with the test.
A terrible person in general and a relatively dry lecturer who doesn't go into much detail. Save yourself and take any other professor.

unfeeling robot, quite literally goes out of his way to work AGAINST his students rather than with him. there is a line between being a "tough grader" and "getting pleasure from making students' lives difficult," and he very much falls on the latter side. He does everything in his power to make sure you do not succeed. He is the anti-professor.

Do NOT take this class with him, I became ill quickly after coming down with Covid and mono and had complications that ended me up in the hospital, unfortunately, meaning I had to miss a lab period to which I emailed Clyde and he dismissed me of being irresponsible with my time,not understanding how to plan around lab and more(ran out of space)

Considering this class is really difficult, Clyde's lectures are actually pretty understandable and they prepare you well for the exams. But he does not give extensions no matter how severe your situation is and when you ask him questions he is very condescending, so if you end up in his class just hope and pray that your semester goes perfectly.

1128 was REALLY hard! By far the hardest class I've ever taken. Dr. Cady was a great lecturer and good at explaining things, but he designs the class to be really tough on purpose since it is a weedout class. He's very friendly in-person if you ask questions, but I would avoid sending emails since he can be kinda rude.

This is a 3215 rating, don't get confused. Overall the class was easy and interesting. Cady would come in every lab and is very friendly and will talk to you about anything; I had some fun conversations with him. My only critique is that the first 2 exams were ungodly arbitrary, very hard to study for, but don't stress bec the final is very easy.

Cady is very rude. I did not meet a single student who thought otherwise. Class itself does take effort, but it isn't that bad. I would recommend doing the online homework earlier in the week. Redo old online homeworks in practice mode and do the recommended book problems. If you can grasp BOTH the book and online problems, you'll pass. DO BOTH.

The class and chemistry department as a whole sucks. Unfortunately Cady is the best out of the chem professors and has the most straightforward lectures. There isnt much work for the class but the tests are hard. Just do the best you can, they call gem chem a weed out class for a reason.
Questionable personality, decent prof
I genuinely have never hated a man more in my entire life. I think that he is the most entitled and least understanding man that I have ever met. I want to slap the mole off of his bald head.
He's just out of pocket.

I don't know how this man has such a high rating on here. He is the most rude, disrespectful, and pompous professor I've ever had. He sent me one of the most disrespectful emails to the point where it had to be reported to the head of the chem department who had to reach out and personally apologize to me on his behalf. Do not take him.

If you had Angeles-Boza for 1127, I would take Cady for 1128, very similar teaching styles. Cady's notes I think are very good and his practice problems help you for tests. It's a tough course, but studying notes will definitely help you. Lab section is a little sloppy with the quizzes/pre-labs, but Cady does a good job with his lectures.

Honestly, I am still traumatized by what he did to me during my freshmen year. The worst professor ever.This man would have you dreading your whole existence.He is extremely rude in person and in email. The exams is was hard.I don't know why people gave Cady a good rating. I was fooled by this rating my freshmen year.AVOID THIS MAN AT ALL COST.
Does cool experiments in lecture sometimes. Occasionally his voice put me to sleep. Livestreams his lectures and posts recordings on HuskyCT. Weekly HW, prelab and lab quiz

He is overall a poor lecturer in the context of what we are assessed on, and is very rude in emails. Just read the textbook and use chemistrynotes, and make sure you understand the materially thoroughly, especially for 1128.

What can I say about cady that hasn't already been said? An icon on campus for all the bad reasons. Made tests unnecessarily hard and was rather rude in emails. Expects students to be deceitful. At least he teaches straightforwardly and clearly. Lectures were recorded.

Cady is very monotone and just goes through problems without explaining anything in lecture which causes you to learn straight from the homework or YouTube. Cady does not give extensions even if a family member passed or you have covid. Very unsympathetic and rude in emails. I had to drop the course and retake it with a different professor.
Bad lecturer, tests weighted heavily, mandatory labs every week. Homework through cengage was long and tedious

Solid professor. His lectures were very easy to follow and properly taught me how to understand Chemistry. What I do think is of note is his attitude towards his students. He speaks in a very condescending way towards everyone, particularly in emails. He was rude to me when filing my CSD accommodations for the final. Again, good prof but not nice.

Decent professor. Lectures were clear. Online hw every week (helpful), varies but usually around 15-20 questions, with 3 sub questions for each one. If you need help, utilize Q center and secret tip: the engineering building also has chem tutors (definitely the way to go the night before exams, Q center is packed and only allows a few students)

Many people complain about him, but I really don't see what's wrong with his teaching. I personally liked Dr. Cady for 1127.. he was a great teacher, and very good at explaining tough chemistry concepts. He was really nice in-person and in his office hours... if you took AP chemistry, this class will be a BREEZE! Loads easier than collegeboard exam

He is the best chemistry teacher for chem 1127Q. The class itself is hard but his lecture slides are the most clear cut and prepare you for the exams. Do not skip class, take advantage of the homework, and you will pass.

Dr. Cady is a very good lecturer and he 100% knows what he is talking about. This course is a bit challenging, but as long as you put in the work and study you will do well. Weekly homework is a bit time consuming but very helpful with enforcing concepts and preparing you for the exams.

I really don't understand why people dislike Dr. Cady so much. He truly cares about you understanding the material and is very patient when explaining multiple times. His lectures were also very clear and you can really see his passion for Chemistry. Although the course itself was challenging for me, Cady made the class much better.

Cady is easily my favorite professor I have. He seems like such a genuine guy who enjoys what he does, and he always tries to engage the class as much as possible. It is a hard class and you have to work hard to do well, but at least he made it more enjoyable. I purposely switched my class to take Chem 1128 with him next semester.

I like the professor but I'll say it can get difficult from time to time if you have a difficult time understanding the material. Lectures can go by somewhat fast but rarely does that happen. The grading criteria are unique from all the classes that I took. Chemistry for me is quite complicated depending on the subject and homework is doable.

Cady was overall decent, even though he can be rude in emails. I took AP Chemistry in high school (had a terrible teacher though), and was able to get an A with a moderate amount of work in 1127. His lectures are ok, but he tends to skim over some topics so make sure you read the textbook as well.

Anyone who rates this guy poorly is just not being honest with themselves. As long as you listen to what he is saying you will do just fine. He goes at a perfect pace and is the best at explaining complex concepts that I have ever seen.

A lot of people hate on Cady, but if you show up to lecture/ask questions, he will do his best to clarify or make things clear. Grading criteria, especially on exams, is very open and regrades are available. There is nothing ambiguous about the work due for his class, he is transparent and doesn't try to trick anyone, just wants people to love chem
A lot of work. Not enough time

Gets more flack than he deserves. The course work is difficult, but definitely doable. There are many opportunities for practice work if you feel the need for extra studying and practice. Good lecturer and idk why everyone says hes condescending; hes just more blunt and to the point, but not rude.

Chemistry is overall a difficult subject and Dr. Cady did not do much to help. His lectures were not bad- he was actually pretty good at explaining things and was always straight to the point. However, he tends to come off as rude. His tests were always difficult with low averages and he doesn't care when students fail. Don't take unless necessary

Like others have said, he comes off as condescending/passive-aggressive in his emails. This course was very hands-off for me in terms of talking to the prof, but nonetheless, he is not one to budge on things. All the exams/final are open-note, which is nice. Take good notes throughout the sem and you should do fine, bar the dreaded three MC exams

I don't understand why people hate on Dr. Cady. I liked his lecture videos compared to other professors who were teaching 1127Q and 1128Q. Also, he was always approachable and responded to emails quickly. Since we had three tries for each week's lab and pretty much an unlimited try for the weekly hws, those were helpful to boost grades as well.

chem is a hard class and professor cady doesnt help it in any way. the exams were hard and were graded very harshly and he never curved as well. the cengage hw is helpful and prob the only reason why i passed. cady is also rude in his emails and doesnt offer much help or leeway. highly suggest to not take this class w him
Clyde Cady is not my bro, Clyde Cady is my foe.
Probably the most mediocre professor at uconn, I would probably have taken Chem with someone else better than this man.

Though it isn't specifically Dr. Cady's fault the course is so difficult, he does minimally to make it easier for students. His emails are harsh if you ask questions, and the course offered very little prep for any tests (the questions were not similar types whatsoever).

Cady's lectures are usually really good and the lab videos he did were also helpful. His tests have a good range of easy to hard but the amount of question on the MC exam is so low that you can only lose two or three to still have a descend grade. LA is much better. Cady via e-mail can be really condescending and does not really make exception.
I felt like Cady is good at teaching the material, just the exams can sometimes be difficult . It is still doable, however.

Nightmare of a class. Cady was both rude in emails and VERY unreasonable as an instructor. He gave very hard exams every other week and NEVER curved even when the whole class failed. Prepare to dedicate your weeks studying for a class you will only barely pass with a bad grade. Please do not take this class, it was honestly the worst.

Beware it's a lot of assignments and test heavy. It is manageable, but definitely VERY stressful to take even if its your only difficult course. He is extremely rude through emails, but is very kind through his WebEx one on ones. advice: take a different professor, watch SI sessions, make a meeting with him if you don't understand, start hw early

people hate on cady but i honestly think the work is totally manageable. i'm not a chem god by any means so i have to put in the work to get a good grade in this class, but i don't watch any lectures or read the textbook and i've gotten A's in both chem 1127 and 1128 in this online format. as long as you do the hw and lab and do decent on the exams

If you're taking this class online, good luck. All of the chemistry professors take turns posting lectures weekly, but they never coordinate so it's impossible to keep track of what's going on. Tests are impossibly hard compared to homework and labs, and if you email a professor all you will get is a snarky response.

I have never met a professor as bad as this. Dr. Cady makes it clear that he doesn't care about about his students. Having accommodations, I had to ask for an extension because of issue with my health and Cady said to work harder as if I can predict health issues. He wants people to fail. The average exam grade is a 60. He should be fired.

I've never had a professor who made it more clear that he didn't care about my grade. This man cares more about his statistics than his students. His lectures were straightforward but boring. I wish I picked literally any other professor for 1128.

Even as a chem major I thought 1128 was difficult. It's definitely doable, but don't blame Cady for teaching a hard topic. I did the practice problems at the end of the syllabus and went to the Q center for whatever I didn't understand. If you're honest with yourself about what you do and don't know, and study effectively, you too can get an A-.

Definitely not the nicest to email with. Videos were dull and tests were confusing. If you're generally okay at chemistry you'll be alright. Gave an extra credit opportunity but it was only worth 0.6 points which was annoying.

He is very clear about the content and the course while online is very straight forward. There is a fair amount of work but if you manage your time it is manageable. There are no surprises in the course but the content can be difficult. Not very flexible so you need good reason to have late work/exams. Make sure to do the assigned work.

I took chemistry in high school and that's why I did well in the course. Professor Cady is the type of professor that does not really care about the students. He was very strict and was not understanding of technology or other problems at all. In all his emails he comes across as condescending. My best recommendation is to go to SI sessions.

Due to COVID, the class was different but as long as you watch the lectures and do extra practice problems you will be okay! Take good notes and do practice problems from the book, powerpoints posted on husky ct, and SI sessions.

The class was run differently because of COVID obviously, but I think the department did the best they could (and Cady since he seemed like the one in charge). Yes, the material is kinda hard, but you have to do a lot of practice problems from the textbook and the internet. I didn't think the class was too bad, but it was a lot of work.

fall 2020 semester. Loved that his lectures, homework, labs were all asynchronous. However, be prepared to study hard for this class. Beware that the current notes and lectures are on different chapters than the exam. On his long answer exams, his grading criteria is very strict to get a perfect on each problem. His emails back are often very rude.

Never met this guy bc of COVID but he is not understanding at all, somewhat rude in his emails, and made the class miserable. The weekly homework assignments were not even close to the material on the upcoming tests, i feel like i learned nothing. Also schedules exams for 6pm on Fridays... cmon
He clearly knows a lot but his class is very very difficult.

He is very to the point but is tougher than other professors for late work (e.g. extension requests) and grading in general. Although his lectures may seem dry to some he explains it extremely clearly, which I like. Make sure you do all of the homework and not just the portion that gets you full credit.

Some tips to succeed in the online course - watch lectures but don't stress if cant understand - finish HW and Lab asap and very easy to get 100% on them lab 3 tries - go to SI ask questions - LIFE SAVER - actually, study for the exam by doing practice problem from si, and if u have time textbook - watch khan vids help alot

Hours of lecture videos each week. 90% of the content covered in the videos isn't what's on the tests. Most of the content covered in lectures don't help with homework assignements. HW is extremely obnoxious because there's 20 questions per homework assignement, each question consiting of 3 sub questions.

Although I never got the chance to meet Cady due to COVID, he seems like a great guy outside his lecture videos. His style of teaching through videos is nothing spectacular, and personally I am not a fan of his 6pm tests. If you're planning on taking chem with Cady, plan on scheduling your Friday outings around your unit exam.

not a bad prof, but rude in email responses, lots of hw, exams every other friday, mult choice exams horrible bc lockdown browser and webcam, i fail these sometimes not because i don't understand material, but bc i feel intruded and get anxiety so i mess up a lot, if u look down for too long, u can get flagged for cheating

The tests are very hard in this class. Doing it online, there was not much help from the professors when we started to do bad on the tests. The only thing that got me through the class where the SI sessions.

Chem 1127Q is taught by all chem professors in the online format (teacher you pick doesn't matter). Cady is very passive aggressive and rude over email, but in person he's very nice and helpful. SI is a MUST for this course, Ryan is EXTREMELY helpful and I relied on his reviews to study for exams. Study, go to SI, and you'll pass.

The man is inconsiderate and kind of rude. I had an issue with my power and wifi at home and missed an exam because of it. I emailed him and he responded and it took me another 12 hours to respond because I was overwhelmed. I explained this to him and he chose to be petty and passive aggressively commented on my "late" response. Fine teacher.

He's a very smart guy and gives good lecture, but he is just rude. There was a couple of times that I would reach out for help from him, and he would give sarcastic replies. As a student, it really does not feel like he cares about me.

I am not sure if this is just because the class was taken online, but have fun taking tests at 6:00 PM every. other. Friday. night. The amount of tests for a class like this is absolutely absurd, and especially when you have to take a test at 6:00 PM on Friday. Tests are also a problem because they take place weeks after the lessons they represent.
Not really too understanding when it comes to personal issues. Make sure you watch the lectures. Cengage homework assignments can be long so do not save it for right before the due date, break it up.
