Have not had any interaction with Dr. Cady so can't say much about him. Work is posted in a weekly task folder, consisting of lectures (sometimes long, pretty detailed), fairly easy labs with lab quizzes, and Cengage homework assignments (usually tedious), exams every other wk. Wouldn't have kept up with the online set up if it wasn't for AP Chem.
Not good understanding of personal problems impacting school, especially during COVID, very good at teaching the material, though.

I haven't had any bad interaction with Cady myself but a lot of my peers seem to dislike him. In emails I have seen, he is extremely passive aggressive and unhelpful especially during a time like this. The content isn't necessarily hard but you just have to dedicate a lot of time to the class. Go to supplemental instruction!Ryan is better @ teachin

Tests every other week, one week multiple choice the next open ended. The Cengage homework are long and tedious but it's an easy 10 points a week. Pay attention in labs and discussion. Also do the discussion worksheets for bonus points at the end of the semester.

Dr. Cady is a solid choice for CHEM 1127Q! He's really nice with you during the office hour and willing to answer any question you have (although people do tend to complain that he's a little bid rude with emails). Overall, the class was easy (reason is that I took AP Chem in high school). His lectures are pretty straight forward.

I honestly cant say anything abt dr cady bc ive never talked to him. the lecture videos are different people every week. the online setup is terrible, so easy to get confused and fall behind with no place to go for help. many kids arent passing his exams. literally changing my major bc of this class. if u dont like chem, dont take this class!

There's an exam every other week switching between long answer and multiple choice. They aren't too difficult. The weekly lab was all online so we only had to watch a video and take a quiz on it. His lectures were easy to follow and the weekly homework is easy if you take the time to understand the material.

I do not know if it was just because of online schooling but this class was horrible for its incredibly terrible structure. Every week you are assigned a couple of hours worth of lectures and long homework assignments on top of an exam every other week. The worst part is that the labs, lectures, and exams are all on completely different topics.

Extremely mediocre professor, especially during COVID. He lets all of the other professors do the work, while he kicks back and does nothing. He is difficult to reach if you have any concerns or exam conflict, I can't even say if he's a nice guy or not because I've never had the ability to talk to him. He's sent about three or four emails in total.

Usually I would never post a bad review of a teacher, but seeing that nobodys posted about how hes been during covid I feel like I have to. This class is asynchronous and Im teaching myself through YouTube videos, and Dr Cady hasnt been understanding at all. Everyone who emails him gets a rude response and everyone failed the last test.
had him last semester. not the best, not the worst.

Cady overall is the best intro Chem professor no doubt! His lectures are a bit dry but you can't expect much from the chem department anyway. His example problems on the lecture are extremely helpful for exams! If you watch lectures weekly and understand all the problems on homework and lecture slides, you will get an A.

All lectures are posted online so you can watch them whenever you want, but stay up to date. Do all of his practice problems because some of them do end up on exams. The MC exams are difficult but the LA exams do allow for partial credit. He is a decent guy, but often the material on the exams is much harder than the questions that he explains

An average professor. His lectures are dry, but clear to follow and he posts them so that's helpful for the exams. LA exams are easier than MC ones. Cady covers the content, but not all of the types of problems that appear on the exams so that's why many struggle. I found that going to SI/doing the SI practice tests to be helpful for problems.

Cady is by far the best chem teacher. He does tons of practice problems to help teach each topic and prepare students for the exams. He puts his lectures (audio and slideshows) online right after class so if you miss class/ want to listen again, it is available on huskyct. The class is very difficult if you do not have a solid chem background

He's a good teacher but he's so boring that I can never pay attention. He also over covers stuff that doesn't matter while rushing through the stuff on tests. Everyone stopped going to lecture because the homework was more useful.

Raise my hand during lecture. Timed it one time, hand was up for 2 minutes while he continuously looked up, stared at me, and went back to doing the problem. Finished the problem, stared at the class, and then switched slides. This man does not care about you.
He gives lots of example questions in class and I just watched his video every week and never go to lecture. His video helps a lot and I just review those example questions before every exam.
Really really really bad professor, learned nothing from him
Really bad professor

Cady is the best 1127 professor out there. He teaches at a quicker pace than the other 1127 professors, but gets through all the material and does lots of review before exams. Clearly explains concepts during lectures and does all types of practice problems. Study these, and you'll be set for the exams. Great guy, always willing to answer questions
Clyde Cady is an amazing professor who makes chemistry easy to learn and understand. Unlike other professors, he goes through entire practice problem sets to get students prepared for tests.

Dr. Cady is the best chem professor at the school. He gives good lectures followed up with examples that he walks through. He also occasionally does demonstrations or brings models to go along with the notes. Tests are structured every other week. If you miss class, he posts lectures with audio and notes online.
best chemistry professor
Worst chemistry Professor
I am so glad I took him for the summer session . He is so smart but doesnt wear it on his sleeve .
He is best Chemistry Professor you can have !

Cady was a good professor overall. He went over practice problems and never failed to explain a topic that would be on the exam. However, he was pretty boring and dry and it made sitting through lecture tedious. If you don't read the textbook and act if it's more important than the bible, you won't pass this class.

Dr. Cady is one of the better professors to pick for the General Chemistry sequence (1127Q-1128Q) being that he basically designed the course. That said, he is a bit boring in lecture, but his examples are useful in terms of preparing you for the exams. Overall, good professor in terms of teaching the material.
The purest professor at UConn honestly.

Dr. Cady is a very good professor. He makes chemistry easier to understand and the class is very straight-forward. The exams are difficult, but Dr. Cady prepares you well for them. It really isn't as bad as everyone says it is. If you can take gen chem with Dr. Cady, DO IT!

Dr. Cady was a great. I had many friends who had other profs for 1127 and would often come to my lectures instead of theirs. He does a lot of practice problems which are helpful. You may have to use the textbook a lot and do some self-teaching, but if you come to lecture, pay attention, and keep up with the work, you can succeed in this class.

Cady is a one of the better chemistry profs. UConn has to offer. He is very approachable and will stick around after class to answer quick questions. He uses many different teaching styles to benefit all learning types- (listing how to solve a problem, doing examples, demos, etc.). Grade is 15% online homework, 15% lab, 45%/25% final/exams.
He's a good professor! Clear about the topics and example questions. However, the example questions he gives in lecture are usually much easier than what you'll see on exams, so look out for that.

Cady is overall a nice person and knows his stuff. He is very clear in his lectures about topics you need to know and what will be on the exam. He can get kind of boring but if you pay attention its not too bad. The exams are usually pretty hard and will try to trick you. If you took AP Chem in high school its very doable. If not, good luck.
The sole complaint I have about Dr. Cady is that his handwriting isn't very good, so you may need clarification on the examples he writes.

Honestly, chem 1127 and chem 1128 taught by anyone sucked. Specifically 1128, exams did not reflect the textbook at all which they told us to use as a reference. The department doesn't communicate with each other so some classes are ahead and others will be two chapters behind. Cady is a nice person but lectures aren't useful. Chem sucks.
Really nice guy, as boring as possibly imaginable. Teaches well, spent lectures doing online homework. If you have to be enegaged to be focused you will fall asleep.

Dr. Cady is the shining star of the UCONN Chem department. If you go to his lectures and force yourself to pay attention, do ALEKS, and do the problem sets on time, you will get a good grade in the class. Clyde does a lot of cool demos and makes jokes that explain concepts during lecture to keep students engaged.

Probably the best professor to take for 1127 or 1128 with. He goes through all the material that is on the exams and also goes through really hard examples which help when studying. He's a bit boring to listen to but it's worth it

This was the first time Cady has taught 1124. I thought that he was very helpful with his notes that he takes in class. His office hours don't always seem very accessible, but if you go to the office, he is usually there. He lectures very thoroughly, but you must attend lecture to understand.

If you did not take AP Chem in high school this class will definitely be challenging, but it is doable. Lectures are good for getting examples of problems he goes over, but it is better to teach yourself or learn from other students. Exams are tricky, they purposefully try to confuse you. Do well in lab and on the quizzes, it will help!

Goes over most concepts in class, but not a lot of the math. Does not give out note packets like Selempinar does. Does not really seem to care about his students or whether they pass. This is a tough class overall if you do not have a strong background in chemistry.

Dr. Cady is adorable! He is definitely the best teacher to get because he is not hard or intimidating at all. His lectures are really important, I don't even use the textbook that much. He goes at a great pace so everyone can easily understand. Chem is difficult, however his examples are so helpful. The tests are fair based on what he teaches us.

Cady moves at a slow pace and lecture gets super boring. You might get more out of discussion and homework than lecture. Cady is one of the best chem professors, because he takes time to explain problems, but even then, he is disorganized and confusing at times. Doing practice problems from the book/worksheets are the best way to study.

I did not find him to be a very good professor in general. He was quite monotonous and disorganized. He wouldn't upload all of his slides online and was generally quite misleading when it came to preparing for exams. I would not recommend taking Chem with him as it is already a hard class without having an incompetent professor.

The tests are really tough and the class in general absolutely sucks, but Dr. Cady makes it a lot better. His lectures are very helpful, and he's always available for help. The class is literally awful and I barely finished with a B- so avoid at all costs.

Clyde is a great man! He tries to be funny almost every lecture and it usually works, except when it is an 8am lecture. He is very clear in his examples and if you need to ask a question he will stop his lecture and go back for you. Always asks if he is going too fast and makes sure all students are with him. Made chemistry easy!

You need to attend class because that's the only way you will get the notes. Textbook wasn't necessary, but definitely a good reinforcement and easy read. Make sure you set aside plenty of time to study EVERYTHING. He gives you everything you need, so utilize it all if you want to pass his tests.

Even though its the easier chemistry class at UConn, tests are still tricky and often confusing to students. He provides many examples in class but isn't great at explaining the concepts we learn. However, he is always willing to help if anyone has questions. Doing well on homework and labs is crucial to do well in the class.

Dr. Cady is genuinely a good professor. The class itself is tough and relies a lot on independent practice. He teaches at a very good pace, but always leaves time before an exam for at least 1 full day of review. He is blunt about what is on exams. It wasn't an easy class, but he makes it much more manageable.

Comparatively, one of the better chem profs at UConn. Lectures are kinda boring but he does do some cool demonstrations during class. Lecture is filled with bad jokes and example problems. I didn't feel his lectures were thorough enough and I definitely had to read the textbook to supplement.
He's a great lecturer and person, Chem 1127 is just a ridiculously difficult course.

How the class is graded: 3 Tests (100 pts. each), 1 final (250pts.), lab/discussion grade (150pts.), online quizzes each Sunday (100pts.), online homework each week (150pts.) - due on Sunday available all week, Participation/Attendance at lab (25pts.). Attendance is not mandatory for lectures but for lab/discussion absolutely!

I have him for 1122 and he's very straightforward with clear grading criteria, is relaxed and approachable, and teaches well. However, I've heard that he's much harder on students in 1127, so I guess it depends on which class you take.
He's very fair about expectations and just a very nice guy who tries to make it interesting. Would definitely recommend!

Having seen AP Chemistry almost destroy my GPA in high school, I was weary of this class at first, but Dr. Cady is a great professor. He explains things clearly and does so at a good pace. He goes through plenty of examples as well. He's very accessible and will talk to students in office hours. I'm taking him again for 1128; he's still good.

I'll preface this rating by saying I suck at chemistry and I ended up dropping the course to evade an F. Cady clearly understands chemistry, but his lectures are hard to follow; I found myself frantically scribbling instead of listening. No PowerPoints online either. Tests are notoriously difficult. I've heard he's better than other chem professors

Prof. Cady seems to really like teaching his classes, and there are lots of cool demos and stuff. He's pretty funny, and any time anyone needed help or just needed a quick question answered he'd give his full attention to them no matter what. I would purposefully rearrange my schedule to take a class with him again.

Very nice, modest professor. You can tell he is more the research type of professor though as his explanations are very shallow and he shows much disinterest while teaching. Cady does in class demos which are cool. However, the class in general is tough and the tests are difficult. There is no curve on your final grade so don't listen to rumors!!!

I absolutely loved his lectures. The class itself was pretty hard, especially tests, but the way he taught definitely influenced my performance. The whole class is dedicated to example problems, and he is very enthusiastic and willing to answer questions.

I have Cady for chem 1 freshman year and I really like the way he teaches. He's very thorough during lecture and answers all questions the best he can. The aleks assignments are really annoying but they do help you understand all the topics. Make sure to go to the discussions and labs, to boost your grade.
Awesome guy, great professor. Let's you know everything you need to know for the exam. Must take!

CHEM 1127 is a hard class but he is definitely the best professor that teaches it. His voice is soft even with the microphone, just sit close to the front. He has no accent and is very clear and understandable. He does not care if you attend the lectures or not. Labs and Disc are mandatory, though. He is a very understanding and nice man, too.

He puts up practice exams to help study and gives you the equations on the exams. He doesn't put the notes up online because he wants you to go to lecture, but his lectures are very straight forward. This is class a class you need to take time to do the work for. But make sure you study and go to lecture and take notes and you will do well.

This class is unreasonably hard. I studied out of class for multiple hours a day, did all of the problem sets, all of the homework assignments, attended lecture and went to office hours. All of this and I got Ds on all of the tests. Extremely difficult, do NOT take this class.

I don't think Dr. Paxton's class was atrocious and an A is attainable if you work hard, but I wouldn't recommend it. The whole grading system is unnecessarily confusing, based on a pass/fail system, and dependent on passing exams more than anything. Dr. Paxton is super nice but she needs to rethink her "flipped" classroom approach.

While Paxton is very nice, you have to play her game if you want to get a good grade in the class. You have to watch the lectures on your own time and come into class with a good understanding of the content. You should always have her check over the in-class assignments, as she normally won't give you credit for it if it's not perfect.

Out of all of my classes this semester, this was by far my hardest course and it's only a level 1100. I received so many unsatisfactories on in-class activities for only getting one small part wrong. I managed to meet the A criteria for every part of the grade bundle except exams. Because of this, my grade was a B+. Ridiculous.

If you need to take this class, wait and take it with another professor, I regret not listening to RMP. Everything is a U or an S and you need an S on both actives to get credit for the day if not you get a 0 for the day as if you weren't even there. She bundles your grade, you can have a 90 on exams and not do well on classwork and fail.

I think I skipped this class once when I was sick, and I did all my work, but because the grading was either satisfactory or unsatisfactory it was absolutely impossible to maintain a good grade bc one little mistake you would get the whole thing wrong. Assignments were also very confusing and you have to teach urself the content outside of class.

NONONO. do NOT take this class. You could go to every single lecture, do every single assignment, do well on every single exam, I DID, and still receive a poor grade. She grades things as satisfactory or unsatisfactory, and if u get an US it is a 0. She is a VERY hard grader and will give u an US for the smallest thing. DROP BEFORE ITS TOO LATE.
She is very nit-picky about grades, and if you do not do everything exactly to her standards every day, do not expect to get above a B+ in this class.

The flipped classroom and the grade bundle setup might seem like a lot. But, it's not as bad as it seems, if you keep on top of things, you'll be alright. Dr. Paxton's pretty chill about it all. All you have to do is ask her at the end of class to look over your assignment (Learning Relection) she 100% would. Thats a big way to ensure you get an A.

Horrible grader. Specifications grading ruined my grade in this class. It is so hard to get an A because she is insanely strict with grading and specific with what exactly she's looking for on in class assignments. All in class assignments are groupwork and if your group is bad, be prepared to do all the work or fail.

Dr Alex is although very nice, she has a ridiculous grading policy. Everything is "satisfactory" or "unsatisfactory" which is basically pass or fail. Lectures are for group work, and all lecture material is done on your own which is very time consuming. If you fail one of the exams, you need to scramble to pass the retake. Way too much work.

Not as bad as people make it seem. For homework you have to leave 5 "high quality" comments on readings but they were not bad once you got the hang of it. Open note, no lock down browser exams. I did not find them to be very hard. Actives were annoying but you have so many opportunities to redo them if you get unsatisfactory on your first try.

if you do one thing wrong in an assignment then you get unsatisfactory which means you get no partial credit for the assignment and might have to redo it. you will have to try to find out what exactly you did wrong because she won't tell you. there is barely any teaching in class so be prepared to teach the material to yourself beforehand.

Save yourself a lot of pain and take PSYC 1000 with any other professor. There's a quiz and a group project every single class, and the projects are graded harshly. If you get stuck with a bad group, you're screwed. The grade bundles are super confusing and make it difficult to get an A in the class. Unreasonable amount of work for a 1000-level.

I took extremely detailed notes of the textbook, video lectures, and lightning lectures so I could keyword search during exams since they were open notes. Yet they were still extremely difficult and I would often barely pass. Good luck if you get stuck with a bad group for projects. Also, you'll fail assignments for missing minor details. AVOID!

I loved this course! Dr.Alex was very enthusiastic and was happy to help any student who asked. I loved the "flipped" classroom because it made it possible to go back to lecture materials after the initial class. Class time is used for group work. The only critique I have is the grading scheme, it was very confusing.

Professor Paxton despite being a very nice person has an interesting class. You basically teach yourself everything and she has this grade bundle system that is so complicated and unfair. In class you have group assignments where if you do one assignment wrong you get unsatisfactory. I would recommend NOT taking her class.

Despite Dr. Alex's friendliness, her class is structured in a confusing manner. No in-class lectures, comically time-consuming class preps, difficult tests which include content unrelated to material provided. The amount of effort used to get an "A" bundle in this gen-ed level 1000 was honestly ridiculous. Save your time & don't take it with her!

She's a nice person, but that honestly made it worse bc she graded so horribly. The class is a Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory basis where you could get an Unsatisfactory for the smallest mistake in a multi-step assignment. A 74% on exams is a U (basically a 0), and there's a reason no other prof does this. Bad criteria for how much a student knows.

This class was a joke. Each class there is barely a lecture, half the time the lecture does not even relate to any of the content discussed for the module. The grading system is ridiculous and she is a tough grader. It is difficult to get in touch with her. She does seem nice but the way this class is run is very confusing and hard.

Dr. Alex was very friendly, but it was almost impossible to get an A in this gen-ed 1000-level class. The pressure and stress I had from this class alone, when I went into it thinking it would be one of my easiest since I had a background in psych, was ridiculous. Exams were so difficult even though they were take-home, open note, open book.

I really wanted to be optimistic about Dr. Alex, but this course is really time-consuming and difficult, even for someone taking this course as a Psych pre req. The class is taught in a way that works for a small class, NOT a 200+ person lecture. While it is not as bad as some people claim, I don't recommend taking if you JUST need a gen ed credit.

This class is annoying but doable. You MUST take detailed notes if you want to pass the tests (which are heavily weighted in the grading). Lots of extra credit opportunities in the form of "tokens", make sure that you do as many as possible. Don't bother emailing her, bring any questions to office hours or before/after class.

Super friendly professor, but you'll have to teach yourself everything on your own time and do group assignments in class. The grade system is forgiving, since you can basically stop going to class after you finish a certain amount of assignments. If you fail something, you can submit a token to redo it. Pretty easy, but time consuming.

I took this course 3 years ago with Dr. Paxton, and I still to this day talk to others about how terrible it was. Completely bizarre test bundles and tests are all application based, and she considers a 74% failing (she will NOT round up). She is a horrible professor to teach an intro course. 3000 & 4000 level classes I took weren't this hard.

She is a very nice person, but that is really it You are required to go to her lectures but she talks for 10 minutes and then expects you to do a quiz and mini-group assignment about the material that you had to teach yourself. If one thing on your group work is missing you fail the entire assignment

The class was extremely test-heavy, and the grade bundle was impossible to achieve. She was not accessible outside of class, making it difficult to get help or clarification on anything. I would not recommend taking this class with this professor if you have the option. It was a frustrating and overall horrible experience.

Horrible course. Prof is clueless and lazy. Group projects every class, horrible if you always carry as 1 mistake fails entire group. Pass/fail but "criteria" is arbitrary and just what TA feels like. Doesn't understand own material and blatantly answers questions incorrectly w 100% confidence. Exams contain vague, poorly worded questions w typos.

Getting A's on every assignment and averaging 74%'s on exams will give you a C in the course. On what planet does this make sense? In EVERY other course at UConn, this would give you a B+/A- range, especially in what should be a holistically graded course like 1000 level psychology. A complete joke of a class.

I took this professor last year. 8 grade bundles, and I had an A in 7 of them. Got a 73, 74, 74 on three exams, and it was deemed unsatisfactory because it was below a 75. Because of these, I could "not get above a C," because the lowest grade bundle is the max grade you can get. A+A+A+A+A+A+A+C=C?

Her syllabus is the most convoluted document I have viewed during my time at UConn. Nothing is intuitive, reading is ridiculously long, and her "flipped classroom" approach is personally not my taste at all. Save yourself the distress and time.

comically hard gen ed. unfair grading "bundles", never seen anything like it before, and it makes sense why NO other professors use it. unrealistic amount of work for a 1000 level class. i'm a 3.6 student and am likely ending with a C, an absolute GPA tanker. If you don't need this class, don't take it. it's that simple.

her teaching style is not fun at all, she doesn't teach during class time, but instead expects you to work In a group, giving you about 30 minutes to complete a quiz, learning and reflection. She grades unsatisfactory or satisfactory which is very opinion based. She doesn't really make things clear and kind of contradicts herself.
Will give you an F for missing the smallest part of an assignment
Hilariously bad.

the low reviewers are just pissed that they didn't take careful notes of the textbook or have it open while taking the exam (she said we could do that). literally just take notes and you'll be fine. class is stupid because you have to go to do the knowledge checks (just need to get a 100 on one of three tries) but she doesn't teach. easiest prof.

Did all the work throughout the entire year and even made the most detailed study guides however just because I got a 73 on two of the four exams I ended up getting a C+ in the class instead of an A. Don't take it at all costs it will drop your gpa!!!

Although Alexandra is really nice, her lectures are painfully unengaging and barely informative. The grade bundle is nonsense and the exams are difficult, often covering stuff we haven't discussed. Her token system is unreliable, and I've emailed her twice regarding the tokens not working with no response. DO NOT TAKE PSYC110 WITH HER.

I got A's on every assignment all semester and averaged a 74% on all exams and will still end with a C because of her grade bundles. She refuses to answer grade questions over email, and uses the "Three before me" rule. Lectures are pointless- "Flipped classroom". Exams are difficult: 30-40 multiple choice questions with only 50 minutes to finish.

I already wrote a review for her but I'm writing one again to help you guys avoid this terrible professor. I just took my final exam which would determine whether I finish with a C+ or an A that's how dumb her grading bundles are. You guessed it didn't get the satisfactory and so I finished with a C+. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Dr. Paxton was definitely not my favorite professor. Her grade bundles are unfair and confusing, and her "flipped" classroom method is horrible. There are at least 4-5 hours of work outside of class only to go to lectures and do think-pair-shares for 50 minutes. A failing grade is below 75 and the exams are challenging. USE YOUR TOKENS!

doing well in this class is dependent on being organized. With exception of exams, every other bundle should be an easy A. For exams: I recommend taking in-depth notes of the lectures, and have a copy of the online textbook (the search bar on it is your friend during exam) to get a 75% or above on the exam. Use Quizlet too. Easy A on exams then

The best part is when she explains in her closing email that she listens to SET evaluations but that is a flat out lie and I want my time and energy back. For the love of god and all that is holy do not take PSYC1100 with her.

Do not take this class! Unclear grading, you don't know where your grade stands until the midterm and final mark (until it's too late). She is kind and will answer questions, but absolutely not worth taking. The flipped classroom teaching style is AWFUL and makes class not worth going to. Take a different professor.
Yeah I straight up would not take her for PSYC 1100. It's not a hard class but the grading is mind numbing. So weird and you never know where you stand until it's too late...

This is a "teach yourself" class and get thrown into exams. Prof Paxton does not teach in actual lecture and her exams are graded "satisfactory"/"unsatisfactory" in which you have to get an 75 or higher (seems easy, is not). She has "grading bundles" that make it difficult to get anything higher than a B- if you're lucky. Don't take 1100 with her.

The main problem with this class with this teacher is that she doesn't teach the material she makes us do OUTSIDE of the class. You need to take time out of your day to watch her online lectures so you have a chance on passing the class. Second, the tests are ridiculously hard and you need to get a 75. Bad methods and NOT understanding at all.

The class is a "flipped classroom" where you take textbook notes for homework & submit 5 comment annotations for a grade every class. The lectures are "think/pair/shares" with no genuine instruction. Exams are open note, but are timed & require deep thought, not just definitions. The class wasn't bad, but I wouldn't take Paxton, although she's nice

Her grade bundle is a joke, I thought the reviews were over the top when I decided to register for the class but I assure you they're not. AVOID THIS CLASS. What was meant to be a gen ed and the least of my worries has turned into the class with the most work, the hardest exams and one which has damaged my gpa for the semester.

I recently took PYSC 1000 with Professor Paxton and found it to be one of the most challenging courses I've ever taken. Paxton is a demanding teacher who expects a lot from her students. Either you pass or fail, never again will I take a class taught by her.

Absolutely the worst professor on campus. Exams determine your final letter grade and they are pass/fail which means anything below a 75 essentially gives you a zero for that exam. She does not answer emails because of her stupid "three before me" rule. If you receive her as a professor then withdraw from the class immediately.

Weird flipped classroom. there is nothing wrong with traditional, you have to teach yourself, and nothing gets taught in class, so it's basically an online class, and the grading is weird, you either pass or fail an assignment
Nahhhhhhh

Surprised at how poor her rmp is. Her grading is strange at first, but definitely made my life easier, as I could ignore this class during times I was too busy without any effect on my grade. Her exams aren't the easiest, but you only need 75% on three to get an A so not bad. Most of the content is nearly common sense if ur a science major.

I will never take another class with Dr. Paxton ever again. If you do not do well on one test, your grade drops an entire letter and it is impossible to do well in unless you have previous knowledge of psychology. She does not answer emails, and when emailing her you are supposed to give 3 reasons why you are contacting her. Avoid at all costs.
Actually the worst prof at uconn, u better hope you get good grades on the three exams or you will fail

The exams are incredibly difficult and your entire grade depends on them. Your grade on the exams decides your letter grade (A-D) and all the other assignments decide if you get a + or - attached it. All these reviews are not dramatic avoid at all costs. Grading system is TERRIBLE!!!!

Grading bundle system is TERRIBLE. She is unwilling to be flexible with her grading system and there is no wiggle room to improve your grade. We have to teach ourselves all the information but are forced to go to class to take knowledge checks. Waste of time, doesnt give lectures just makes you "think pair share" the entire class, not helpful

This was the worst class I have ever taken. Paxton treats us like middle schoolers and has implemented the WORST grading system ever. The class was boring and a lot of busy work. I didn't learn anything and only did the work to pass. I wish I had taken this class with any other professor. Do not take psych with her if you have the option.

The grade bundles are not forgiving whatsoever try to get another professor. The only way can do well in this class is passing each exam with over a 75 without retakes. Lecture is a joke and a waste of time would not recommend going. Essentially all the work is completed at home besides small in class quizzes which can also be done at home.
Avoid at all costs she is worst professor I have ever had. Her tests are impossible and they are basically the only thing you are graded on.

The ratings you see here are true and not dramatic. Her style of grading makes it difficult to get a good grade in this class, you either pass or you don't. Her gradebook examines way too many criteria (not just exams and hw). The exams are application-based (not easy at all). The whole "flipped classroom" idea is not ideal at all.
Such a stressful class. Do not take this class it will drown you with work. If you do all the work outside of class you can still easily get a bad grade.

I have never had to put so much effort into a 1000 level course in my entire college career this course is not hard however, her grading is the most outlandish, BS, unreasonable scale known to college.
I have never met a worse professor in three years of being here.

Definitely one of the worst professors i've ever had. Please don't take her class, especially if you aren't a good test taker. She doesn't like it when you email her so you have to email the TA which sometimes takes forever to get back to you. Her lectures are so unnecessary and her "grading modules" is what can make you fail the class to problem.

Her grading is the worst thing I have ever come across. Extremely difficult exams and she does not prepare you for them at all. Exams are open note but it does not help... she also does not curve them when half the class is failing them. For an introductory course this is ridiculous.

I would not recommend this professor to anyone who actually wants to have a career in psychology. The grade bundles are confusing and ridiculous and I have yet to actually learn a single thing from this class. Furthermore, Paxton is not the best at responding to emails. Would honestly rate a 0/5 if it were an option.

Professor seems like a nice person and is very enthusiastic about psychology. However, this is a flipped classroom so going to class is pointless and you don't learn anything by going. The grade bundles are extremely confusing and unclear. Tests are extremely difficult even though they are open note and even if you do all the homework.

A very nice person. but her teaching style is very different. It's a "flipped classroom" where you do the work on your own and are supposed to talk in-depth about it in class. You spend 50 minutes doing "Think, Pair, Shares" and really get nothing out of it. The exams are your grades If you get unsatisfactory, you get a D. Don't take this class.
This class is very frustrating. Her grade bundles are very unfair and I did not like them at all. I wish I had taken a different professor. DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!
Just don't enroll please....unless u want a challenging class.
Grading policy is awful, DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.

Paxton outlined her "grade bundles" from the first day of the course which told you exactly what you needed to complete in order to get specific grades in her class. If you passed the first three exams you would not need to take the final, as you only need to pass 3 exams for an A. Exams were online and you had all day to take it, with notes.

Don't take if you're bad at exams! The exams were pass/fail so if you didn't get above a 70 on the exam you failed. You could get 100 on every single assignment but if you fail the exams you will fail the class. She took forever to email back aswell.
I once had to email her 6 times before she responded to me and it was in regard to an exam. Terrible class, avoid at all cost

this class made me question if i was in the right major. her grade bundles were very unfair, and the tests were very hard compared to the information given in the lecture slides. she seems nice, but she is not at all lenient with grades. if you could take this class with a different professor, do it! just thinking about this class makes me angry

She does a "flipped classroom" where you watch lectures + read before class. In class (optional) you have discussions with your peers which are not useful. She does grading bundles which are quite confusing and stressful bc she is very picky about her criteria when grading. Tests open note open internet, not too hard. Not the best not the worst.

Paxton herself is an amazing person - she is kind & caring, however I despised her class. I went to two lectures and never went again because they were pointless, in my opinion. She does this 'think, pair, share' thing, where the entire 50 minutes is just talking to your neighbors. Tests are open note and not too hard to pass, but you should study.

Her worst flaw is that it's impossible to get in touch with her outside of class, I loved her specification grading because I got around an 80 on all three exams but because I passed her requirement I got an A in the class. The tests are very hard though and basically your grade depends on them so if you don't do well with tests dont take the class

The specifications grading is more hurtful than helpful. 75 is considered "passing" on the grade bundle, and if you "fail" ONE exam, your grade drops like 4 letter grades. She is a very nice professor, but the way she structured the class is just absolutely awful. AVOID TAKING THE CLASS WITH HER, CHOOSE A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR!

If u dont test well DO NOT take this class!! U have to make a 75 or above to pass the exams. I failed 2 of the 3 exams because I made below a 75 and I did all of the assignments and got an 83 on the final and somehow have a D because of grade bundles. She never posted my actual grade until like right now so I never knew what I had in the course.

Grading is literally the worst thing ever. Heavily depends on tests so if u dont test well DO NOT take this class. I failed two out of three exams (below 75 is failing her exams) and my grade was a D. I even took the final exam and got an 83 and it didnt do anything to help me. I took this class in hs and made an A in it and now Im gonna cry!

If you take her class be prepared to play her games, which go by the name of "specifications grading" if you want a good grade. This means all or nothing style grading that will crush your mental health all while she pretends to care about mental health.

The worst professor I have ever had. Completely inaccessible, doesn't put her email in the syllabus because she doesn't want to hear from you. Failing a test is anything under 75% and if you don't achieve that you get a D. Lots of busywork most of it doesn't relate to course material. Again she is the worst professor I have had don' take her class.

DO NOT take this teacher if you are enrolling psychology 1100. Her grade bundles are the worst form of grading I have ever experienced. To pass her exams you need at least a 75 but they are HARD. Loads of work and even if you get As in everything but fail the exams you will get a D at the end.

LOVE THE STRUCTURE! Flipped classroom, optional class discussions are VERY HELPFUL. Specific grading structure gives a lot of leeway for students. You can skip assignments and still get an A. You need to get a 75+ on 3 out of 4 open note exams but the median grade on most of the exams is a 75 so half the class doesn't pass each exam.

Quite possibly the worst professor ever. If you don't test well, avoid this class at all costs. Just don't take this class regardless actually, quite impossible to get a good grade with her way of grading.

This is one of the most difficult classes I have ever taken. The grade bundles are absolutely ridiculous. She is never accessible outside of class and provides no support to her students. You cannot see any of your exam answers so there is no way to learn. I am doing better in my calc & chem class than this psych class.

Did not learn a single thing from this course. The grading is almost impossible in order to succeed. If you do the homework, your grade wont improve, but if you dont do it itll drop. Avoid taking Psyc1100 with Paxton.

Prof. Paxton assigns so much pointless and busy work, that essentially has nothing to do with the course, especially the leaning reflections If you do it your grade will not improve if you don't do it your grade can drop. The lectures are posted online, but are not engaging and long while the actual class time is wasted on "builing on the material"

If u have a choice DO NOT take this course. The grade bundles are absolutely ridiculous, and exam passing grade is 75%!! Even if u pass on a 2nd try ur grade won't improve. Ridiculous, especially for a gen ed course. I had a joined psych major, but switched bc of this course. I've never had such a bad professor If I could rate her 0 I would.

This class was quite possibly the worst class Ive taken of all time. The grading bundles are absolutely ridiculous, and are only based on exams she makes impossible for the students. I have taken multiple psychology courses in the past and still have failed almost every exam in this class. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

Dr. Alex made PSYC 1100 painful. It is an intro level class, but her way of grading through grade bundles is completely unfair. You can put in the effort and show that you're trying, but you will essentially drop down a letter grade if you fail to meet her crazy expectations. Avoid if you can.

Dr. Alex was quite possibly one of the worst psych professors I've ever had. She's a super nice person, very energetic, but her class structure was confusing at best and her tests are almost impossible to pass. I think I passed one this entire semester, and you need to pass all three to get an A. All of the other work is busy work and barely counts

Don't listen to some of these reviews. This prof is NOT accessible outside of class. She is nice but her grade bundles are extremely hard to maintain, especially for an into level class. There is also so much work, I ended up spending 3+ hours a day to just finish what she assigned. If you're looking for an easy gen ed, do not take this class.

Dr. Paxton runs her class "flipped classroom" style where she posts the lectures online and the in-person "lecture" is just discussion. Many people didn't like this, but I really did. She is super enthusiastic about psych and can tell she loves the subject. I did not find exams to be that hard, but even though they are open note please STUDY.

Grade bundle system is what ultimately screwed me over. They're pass/fail (75% to pass). I kept getting 70% and would have to retake. Assignments really don't help your grade at all. Personally, I disliked her flipped classroom approach. I really don't recommend taking the course with her.

Paxton is genuinely one of the worst professors I've ever had. She posts all of the lectures online in pre-filmed videos to use class time for 'peer engagement', which consists of around 30 out of the 250 students in the class sitting, bored and confused. She's incredibly difficult to access outside of class and assigns an INSANE amount of work.

Prof. Paxton is a very nice person, but she is a terrible teacher. She is doing a thing where you watch her lecture videos before class and then you "build up" on the video. I hate it, it's like having online classes all over again, not engaging or interesting. The grading is very harsh, if you fail one exam your good grade is done for.

If you're looking for an easy A this class is not for you. Dr. Paxton is an extremely nice woman but her class is probably the worst I've ever taken. The grading system seems fine at first but she is not lenient with points. If you are not a good test taker DO NOT take this class. Also, there is astronomically more work given than with other profs.

Do not take this class with this professor. She makes it incredibly difficult to get an A, and wont give extra credit for anything. Going to class is optional but they don't help you learn because all lectures are done for homework online. Tests are very hard and if you fail 1 you get a D. Good luck!!

She's a nice person but her grade bundles make absolutely no sense. You can fail the class even though you passed all the assignments. Just today, she failed one of my assignments because I was 2 words over the word count, so I'm here in a fit of anger right now. The readings aren't horrible but this class is near impossible to pass regardless.

I think she's trying to make things easier with the grading bundles, but it does a lot more harm than good. The workload and the exams are way too much/difficult for the level this class is. You might be better off doing this at a community college and transferring the credit. If you need to take this, take it with a different professor if you can.

Dont take a class with the prof. I currently have an A with her grade bundle, but if I get below a 75 (which is an F according to her) on one of the exams I have left, that could easily give me a bad grade. Dont have to go to class but you have to watch 6-8 lecture videos a week. Also never responds to emails. Wish I switched when I had the chance

Tests are extremely difficult but were open note this semester. Bundled grades so above a 75 on all 3 exams is an A but it's not easy to obtain. She uses a reverse classroom so you don't have to be in class. She's super nice but the class is full of work and definitely not one to take if you just need an easy A.

Her grading style is complete BS. It is not fair that if u fail 1 exam that u automatically cant receive an A in the course. The grading bundles r incredibly stupid and just a reflection of her lazy teaching. She posts the lectures online instead of actually lecturing during the class, which is proof of how lazy of a professor she is. DON'TTAKETHIS

I absolutely loved this course, and Professor Paxton definitely had some of the best lectures I've ever encountered. There is required textbook reading for the class, but it's an online textbook that's available for free.

Dr. Paxton genuinely wants her students to succeed and offers review sessions and office hours. I recommend doing all the assignments that are paired with the lecture the day they are posted to stay on track. Lectures may be long but are pretty engaging. Tests are open book but you should start studying a week in advance. Not an easy nor hard class

Dr. Alex was really understanding of certain situations throughout the semester. Her tests are fine as long as you study for them. Dont forget to do any of the knowledge checks. Sometimes they dont pop up on the calendar so you have to really look for them. Most of the stuff thats covered is on the slides.

Her class is extremely hard and the grading contract is terrible! Even if you pass the lab section to the course and all other assignment but don't pass at least 3 exams with a 65% you will be receiving an F for the course. She also isn't very understanding if you have personal things going on during these times. Honestly, good luck.

Hardest class I have ever taken! Be ready to fail this course. Grading system is awful, if you receive all A's on your assignments but don't pass any exams you fail the course. She also isn't lenient if you have personal things going on and just sends you mental health resources. All I have left to say is good luck charlie!

Honestly she is a good professor but her tests are way too hard. Her grading system seems great at first glance but in reality it is horrible. Her tests have really nothing to do with what was in the lectures and even when I had all the notes it wasn't enough. All her homework is easy though and the class is easy but the tests are the worst part.
as a person is very nice, lectures very detailed although if this class wasn't online im not sure if i would be able to keep up. her exams are wayyyyy too hard and hard to study for.

do not take this class with Dr. Alex. it is way harder than it should be for an intro level course. her grading system is terrible and makes it hard to pass the class. her exams are near impossible and her "curves" are by 4%. everything is application based. her homework is pointless as it doesn't help gain more understanding of the topics.

Very understanding within the pandemic and cares a lot about her students and their performance. Grading is based on the amount of assignments you complete, and if you watch all of the lecture videos and attempt to understand the content you should easily get an A. I really liked how she ran the class in its online format, definitely recommend!

If you want a professor with a fair grading system, Professor Paxton is not the professor for you. Her grading bundles are all revolved around her tests, which are extremely difficult and are most of the time not even knowledge-based. I do not recommend her as your professor if you are required to take this class.

Dr. Alex is a great professor. Her class is difficult, but as long as you do the work you should be fine! If you reach out to her she is very helpful and kind. Her tests are very difficult & you need a 75% to pass. She offers many opportunities to retake & resubmit work & exams. If you stay on top of your work & do well on exams you will succeed.

Her grading "bundles" are difficult to achieve, due to the fact that you need a 75 to pass the tests, the test questions aren't easy, and the fact that you don't get to see what you got wrong. Do not take this class. Her teaching lectures online were fine, but the information on the test was not in the lectures or the book sometimes, too.

Dr. Paxton is very nice and occasionally helpful however her tests are incredibly difficult and make no sense. You only need to get a 75+ on all the tests to get an A but I would barely pass because they were so hard. She also never shows you what you got wrong so its hard to improve. Her lectures are somewhat interesting though.

Paxton was a nice lady, I think she has the right idea in what type of atmosphere she wants for a class. Her workload just doesn't really reflect that. It's a lot of reading and lectures so be prepared. The way she has her grading sets up does help, but you don't really have room to slack off....

This class was made way harder than needed. Her exams are difficult and focus more on application than knowledge. I do not like the grading bundles as it's difficult to get an A. Below 75% is a fail on exams. There are a lot of assignments that are more like busy work. She is very nice and cares, but I don't recommend this class with her.

She is nice. However, her exams are way to hard. Its a shame she doesn't make them more like her knowledge checks. She tries too hard to make the exams application based, they're awful and so hard to pass. I also do not like the grading bundles, if you get under a 75 on the exams but a 100 on everything else you automatically cannot receive an A

Paxton seems like a genuinely nice person. She really cares about her students during this time, and for that, I really respect her. In terms of the class, it is definitely content heavy. Her lectures and the readings are both important. The specifications grading system is helpful, but her exams are application based and can be difficult.

The class itself is easy but her lectures are way too preachy. She's hard to listen to and difficult to understand because every other word out of her mouth is "um" and she goes on and on about unimportant information. She also tries too hard to make her exams application based. Barely even tests on actual information. She's super nice though.

I would scream from the rooftops about how much I love this woman. She is the most accommodating and understanding during Covid online time out of all of my professors. This semester she did grading bundles, so to get an A you need to pass a certain number of each type of assignment -each grade pass/fail. Grading is clear, lectures are interesting

I'd say this is one of the easiest classes I've ever taken. For this class she did grading bundles and they were pretty reasonable. All you have to do to get an A is pass three exams with a 75%+ and a bunch of other stuff but it's clearly laid out for you. Overall, Dr. Paxton is a solid choice.

Attendance was not mandatory since class was adjusted to an online format. However, the readings you have to complete prior to watching the lecture videos, did not always match up with the lectures itself. You have to be sure to read the textbook and take your own notes. A lot of textbook material was NOT included in the recorded lectures.

Her lectures and slides were very detailed and easy to understand. But I took it online so I think if she taught in person she might be a little fast. She is nice and passionate about the subject. Her tests haven't been too hard because they have been open note but if it wasn't, it would be really hard.

She is a great professor and loves what she teaches. Very energetic and fun class to go to. The only down side is the exams are so hard and are a lot of compression and none of my 6 friends or I got a grade above a 75.

Her tests are unnecessarily hard. She tries too hard to focus on "application" to the point where the questions themselves are just confusing, not even the content. I did better in bio 1107 with Abbott than i did in this class with her.

Don't be scared by all of the reviews!!! Paxton's exams can be a little tricky but she curves all of them. If you go to all the lectures, take good notes, and really study those notes you will definitely do fine. She also allows you to bring a page of hand written notes to the exam. There is also an optional final that can only help your grade

Paxton is a good lecturer, but she goes insanely fast and if you miss something you'll be left in the dust. Lectures are optional but if you want to do well in the class you need to go. The tests are some of the hardest ones I've taken at Uconn so be prepared to study a lot.

Professor: Nice, caring, accessible, and understanding The course: Not an easy A The exams: Dense but, you can bring a page of notes and get partial credit The textbook: Read for people/vocab/concepts (Don't buy it because she gave us a free PDF version) Lectures: Confusing out of context, so don't skip class and take notes Lab: A total joke (easy)

Tough professor in terms of tests. They are difficult if you haven't taken a psych course in the past before. This was intro level but it was very difficult because of the amount of content we cover throughout the semester. I recommend showing up to every lecture and doing optional final exam. Nice, but office hours are always busy with students
Exams are a bit of a mess, she usually focuses on lecture content but there is some info from readings. She gives 3 exams, but you only get graded for the 2 highest grades you get.

Paxton is not the worst but this is not a class that you can miss and still get an A in. Her lecture slides are 90% pictures so going to class is important to get context. There is opportunity for extra credit, the exams are curved and the final is optional. I recommend doing all the readings. Exams are application-based sometimes so STUDY.

Take psych 1100 with any other professor if you can. Paxton goes way too fast with her lecture slides and she makes the exams near impossible and does not give a study guide and is unclear about what to expect on the exams. This class really hurt my GPA.

This class wasn't terrible. She posts the slides after every lecture but they tend to only have a few words and pictures on them so going to class can be helpful to supplement them but not always necessary. Allowed to bring sheet of paper to the test with information so really not too bad if you find a way to fit the slide information onto a paper.
Worst class. interesting topic but exams are way too hard. Do not take this class if you want to keep your sanity.

As a psych major who has taken other types of psych classes and exceeded in them, I am warning you at how AWFUL this class is. Paxton is horribly disorganized and talks way too fast in her lectures. She doesn't offer study guides, so you're pretty much screwed for her exams. Please protect your mental health and choose someone else for this class.

I cannot advise against this class / professor enough. The pace of her lectures make it very hard to take notes, and the slides are useless to study from. 75% of the the final grade is determined by extremely difficult exams. She posts no review materials or study guides. A supposed 'GPA booster' ended up being my hardest class. Avoid at all costs.

Her lecture slides are messy and don't help. Her exams are close to impossible for people who didn't take psych in high school. Questions on them are very specific and there's no way to prepare for them. Doesn't answer questions after class, just tells you to go to office hours. She doesn't tell you what's on the exam, you have to study everything.

Dr. Paxton focuses on big data, ethics, and cognition. This beginner PSYC class is going to talk a lot about biopsychology and I'd recommend it if you're interested in that field. She goes fast during her lectures and the slides don't make sense sometimes, but if you do the textbook readings and pay attention you'll do well.

Claims lectures aren't mandatory, yet slides are empty with only a few photos and no definitions. Allowed a one page cheat sheet into exams but that doesn't really help because questions are way too specific. Exams were extremely heavy with material from guest lecturers.

Don't ever take this class. Paxton lectures wicked fast and doesn't allow enough time to write notes. The lectures are boring and tedious. The exams are impossible - with the curve I managed to get a C on each exam. She allows a cheat sheet to be used on the exams - might as well not have it cause the questions are so specific no notes can help.
Take another professor... they all provide thorough study guides showing what you will be tested on whereas I have over 30 pages of typed notes that likely wont even cover enough of the exam material

Lectures are fast-paced, but slides are posted after class, even though they're not too readable. Unengaging. Exams much more difficult than anything else, seem to test a lot of "optional" material. I didn't like psychology going in, but this class confirmed that I really dislike it. Only upside is that the textbook was open access and free.

If you want to learn the material this class is for you! The professor is an amazing lecturer but more than that she seems to care about her students. She is very approachable and will help you whenever you need it. I recommend taking this class if you want to understand the material not just regurgitate it.

Be prepared to read, attend lecture, and study well to pass this class. The 3 exams (about 75% of final grade) are all application based, which means you have to really know the material to do well. Bonus is that she offers extra credit, makes the final optional, is a dynamic lecturer, and answers questions thoroughly during office hours.

She says her class is non mandatory but she will mention things in class not on slides or in the book and ask questions about it in her exams. She also asks questions about things in the book and other assigned readings and videos that she doesn't teach in the class. Avoid her at all costs.

Her tests are way too hard compared to what/how she teaches. You will get several test questions that she did not teach in class or even on her slides. So you have to truly read the book, watch all videos, and readings she assigns. She assigned a challenging 30 page reading and a lot of people did poorly on the exam. she killed my gpa

I would reccomend taking psych with ANYBODY other than Paxton. The exams are beyond difficult. You have to read the textbook, go to "optional" lecture, do supplementary readigns, and the exams are still impossible. She wont answer anything over email and if you miss monday office hours dont expect to see her that week. She flys through material.

Take any other professor. Exams are way too specific and on things she doesn't teach/ aren't in the book. Exams are so specific and long theres barely enough time to finish. Her curve also does not help. They are 5 points at best. Exams are way too hard for an entry level class and make no sense. Killing my GPA.

This woman nearly ruined my GPA because her exams are impossible, she always needs us to read the book and her lecture is painful, exhausting, and unattractive. Yes, she uses this smarty pants curve but it doesn't make anything better because, under her overwhelming and confusing test circumstance, we need 20% increase instead of 4 %.

Paxton is really nice but I got nothing out of her lectures and stopped going after the first exam. Got an A on both the 1st and 2nd exam and failed the third exam. The exams are way too specific and use a lot of weird vocabulary that doesn't appear on her slides or in the textbook. The only reason I did well in this class was because of AP Psych

For an entry level class this was way harder than it needed to be. Her exams are nearly impossible and she talks way too fast for her own good. You have to memorize at best 4 chapters of information for the exams, and the curve she gives does not help at all. She grades exams on points out of 125, not 100. Careful of that when you see your grades.

I am an engineering major so I am a pretty good student, but this class is terrible. She talks way too fast, you cant take notes fast enough, reading the book doesnt help, and her tests contain material that she doesnt even teach and then expects you to know, but doesnt tell you you need to know it. Take any professor for psych BUT Paxton.

Overall, Psych 1100 is very difficult regardless of who you take it with here. I will say that she is ok with lectures at best but her exams are impossible. I am a straight A business student and this is way too difficult for an entry level class. The curves are actually garbage and at best gave me 7 extra points. This class has killed my GPA.

Even though her exams were pretty difficult, if you study enough you will do fine. She gives big curves too which helps, and lots of extra credit options. She is a very nice person and seems really passion about psychology. If you can set aside enough time to study hard for the exams I would definitely recommend taking it with her.

Her exams are difficult but she curves them A LOT. She gives up to 20 points extra credit and the final is optional and can replace your lowest exam grade if needed. She definitely is very passionate, but she does speak way too fast when she lectures.

HORRIBLE class. Exams are way too hard for a GENERAL psychology course. Do not take this class. Paxton makes it impossible to do well on the exams and I fell asleep in almost every class. Pick any other professor- for your own good.

The exams are ridiculously specific and you basically have to memorize the entire chapter that she tests you on. Dont count on the exams being based on what she actually focuses on in lecture. The whole smarty pants curve is ridiculous because if the highest grade is a 98, everyone only gets 2 points added. Basically, do the bonus to pass.

Even though I got an A in this class, it was still miserable for a basic general psych class. Best way to prepare for exams is to make concept maps and relate all the info together. Make sure to do all the bonus quizzes and participant pool as the extra credit is necessary! Also read supplementary articles and watch all the videos she posts!!

Paxton is very nice and is clearly very knowledgeable about psychology. However, she talks extremely fast. Her exams are also hard af. I would study all of the slides + read the txtbook and I would still come out of the exams feeling like I hadn't studied at all. She had to curve our last exam 27 points because it was so hard, so there's that.

If I could go back I would have taken any other psych prof. The exams are all application of material, and the materials range from lecture, to textbook, to supplementary readings. You have to put so much time and effort into this class and you will still get an okay grade, for a gen ed do not take this PROF.

Alex Paxton is the best professor I have this year. You can tell she cares about the students and wants them to do well. There is a lot of material gone over in class. Exams are not the easiest(drops lowest one). read textbook, attend lecture, & study pretty well A. if you dont B+ max. decent extra credit though quizzes and pysch study

Paxton is a very nice Prof, but what she teaches in class isn't what you are quizzed on the the exams. All exams are MC and is based off applying knowledge. She does curve a lot, around 5 pts every exam. If looking for an easy A, this is not the class.

Dr. Alex is the best kind of professor - down to earth, incredibly informative, and truly wants you to succeed. The lectures are well organized and always put online. The exams are difficult, but are always curved by 5 points or so, and the final is an optional opportunity to replace your lowest exam grade.

Listen well.Bruno is not my biochem professor but it's all her fault that future students like us in MCB2000 had to suffer in this class even after she's gone. Dr. Dre is teaching this class right now and I am not blaming her but I am blaming Bruno for starting this charade. This class will make you regret the day that you decided to come to UConn.

DO NOT take her mcb2000!!! The worst class I have ever taken. Dry lecture, tricky exam questions. Her exams are extremely tricky and the multiple-choice options are a and b, b and c, a and b and c, etc.....

If you can avoid this professor/class, I would not recommend taking it. Professor Bruno does not care about the students genuinely learning - evident by her lack of office hours and enormous class size. The exams are meant to trick you, rather than enhance your learning.

She seems like a nice person, never really met her bc it was all online but the exams are way more complicated then they need to be in my opinion. They don't really test your knowledge of the material more than they try to confuse you.

Bruno gets a bad rap because the course itself is really hard. She is extremely knowledgeable, and it's good MCAT prep. REWATCH the lectures. For people taking it in person I recommend recording her and re-listening before each exam; she rambles & the slides don't have all the information. Carve out at least a week before each exam. Good luck

Her exams were created to trick you, not test your knowledge. She always says she's too busy to meet with people, and she can be rude if you do have the chance to meet with her. I studied so hard for this class and never got higher than a 73 on an exam. Don't take this class with her if you don't have to.

Bruno is a great professor. DO NOT fall behind. Go to office hours every week to ask questions or just listen - she takes the time to meet with you, but you need to dedicate your semester to this class. I took an L on the first exam but learned how to effectively study for each exam thereafter. Comparable difficulty to Tanner's enhanced PNB exams.

By far the most difficult class I've taken at UConn, but definitely doable. Taking the class online was helpful to listen to lectures before exams that made up 75% of the course. Getting used to her test format is difficult but the final replaces the lowest grade which helped a lot. Labs are very time consuming but will bring your grade up.

She's nice but her exams are brutal. By far the hardest exams I've ever taken and most work I've ever put towards studying as well and still ended up with the lowest grade I've ever had in a college class.
Exams were SO DIFFICULT. Wording was confusing, answers were always "All of the above, none of the above, just A & B, just A & C." Go to SI if you want to understand anything going on.

genuinely one of the worst professors i've ever had. it feels like she does not care about students and just reads off slides like she wants students to fail her class. SI is the only reason i had a grasp on what's going on in lecture. she made online schooling harder than necessary.

Dr. Bruno is an amazing professor. Her exams are very hard, however, but it is because she wants to assess your understanding of the material. I 100% believe that reading each section of the textbook before the lecture helped me do well. She is accessible outside of class too. Keep up with the material and do the practice problems. Good luck! :)

Dr. Bruno seems to go out of her way to make her exams stressful and complicated to read and understand the questions. Exam grades make up 75% of the course, so if you aren't a good test taker you're screwed. Lecture material is also not well organized to be understood. Plus she says she's too busy to meet with students and check email so good luck
4 Exams, 1 Final Exam. Extremely tricky questions on exams. Multiple choice with A, B, C, A&B, A&C, B&C, etc.

I've taken hard classes before but let me tell you something, Mary Bruno will make you regret the day you were ever born. I have been fortunate to basically get all A's during my time here at UConn until I took this class. I studied weeks in advance for every test and the best grade I could pull was a 76. The devil works hard but Bruno works harder
Her exams are almost impossible. Even studying weeks in advance won't help. Avoid.

Even if you went to lecture, watch the lecture recordings, especially if you're in the 10:10 section, as she does not repeat all of the same, vital information to the second section. Not everything she tests on is explicitly on the slides. There's nothing to prepare you for the actual test questions. Good luck.

Biochemistry is an inherently difficult course, but professor Bruno seems to make it her life's mission to make the course even more difficult. For most of the exams I would feel prepared, and I thought I knew the material, but her exam questions are ridiculous. She was also not at all accommodating when we moved online

Mary Brunos lectures can be a but dry, especially the second half of the course. The material is quite hard so be prepared. Youre gonna have to know everything thats covered in order to do decently well. Her multiple choice questions are very tricky so read them carefully. Id suggest watching AK Lectures on YouTube and attending SI sessions.

Bruno is the hardest teacher I have ever taken. But its her job,she needs to weedout premeds. She talks slow but just put her lectures on x2. Shes brilliant and incredibly passionate about biochem. Make this class your life, and dont underestimate her first two exams like I did. Memorize and understand EVERYTHING on her slides and you'll get an A.

Biochemistry is a tough class either way and Bruno's exam wording forces you to know the ins and outs of everything. The class is great for MCAT prep and Professor Bruno is undeniably tough but fair. My critique is she doesn't return tests except by appointment so you don't know where you went wrong a lot of the times.

This class is made to be hard but Professor Bruno makes it harder than it needs to be. She will blame students for not doing well by saying "you're not thinking enough" even though I personally have gotten similar grades regardless of my level of study. I have so many negative more words to say that I cannot fit into this 350 character limit here.

She was extremely unwilling to help her students. Tests oddly target specific information that is barely covered and expects you to extrapolate ideas to an extraordinary level. She also blames students for getting poor questions wrong because "you're not thinking enough". The actual content of this class isn't that bad but her exams kicked my butt

If you're not religious, go find God before this class because you're gonna need all the help you can get. Fascinating class, loved the material, awfully difficult exams. Tons of trick questions on exams, will ask in depth questionS about a small point under seemingly non-important picture on her slide, so know EVERYTHING!! No office ours w/o appt

Biochem is one of the hardest classes here at the university and I believe that Dr. Bruno gets blamed for it. I was able to do a decent job by recording and ACTUALLY listening to her lectures as well as going to SI sessions as they were really helpful with reinforcing the information (it helps to hear things more than once). You got this!!

As many reviews have said, the class is definitely difficult, but she was a good lecturer and very approachable, even though she might seem intimidating. SI and revisiting the material every few days helps a lot. Tests are difficult, but are manageable.

Bruno is very knowledgeable and the class is very interesting... I enjoyed the content. Definitely the hardest class I took at UConn, the amount of information you need to know is very heavy, but she gives it all to you. I didn't get the textbook. Take good notes in class, her slides are vague. Lab was time consuming but a grade booster!

I did terribly in Bio 1107 and PNB. I was convinced I would fail this class but did well on exams by taking notes in lecture, recording and re-listening to lecture, and going to every SI session. Practice problems and understanding concepts is the best way to study. Study the lectures, not the textbook. Lab is very annoying and time consuming.

Biochem was a very difficult course. Bruno is a decent professor- she explains things well in lecture, but there is a lot of very dense material. I did well in the class by recording lectures and re-listening to them twice while taking notes and drawing diagrams. SI was helpful as well.

Mary Bruno is honestly a good person, if you meet with her after an exam you'll see she genuinely cares for her students. She wants her students to work hard, but if you pay attention in lecture you can tell what to focus on when studying. Definitely go to lecture, her slides won't be enough explanation!

Bruno gets a bad rep because her class is hard. Even though that's true, I thought she was a great educator. The class went at a reasonable pace and she explained topics really well. Her exams are hard and she tells you that on the first day of class. If you study a little bit every day, it's not hard to do well in her class. Hard class, great prof

Worst class I have taken in my life! This is her class exam average for the Fall semester: Exam 1 Average:69 Range:24-97 2 Average:73 Range:24-100 3 average:72 Range:23-100 4 average:74 Range:6-100 She wrongly assumes everyone in that class is going to med school. Test questions require TOTAL UNDERSTANDING of every facet to even have a chance.

She does not genuinely care whatsoever about her students. If you are horrible at multiple choice like I am, good luck. And she won't help you. Going to her to "review the exam" is her way of taking any form of confidence a student has and completely tearing it down. I mean unless you're a pre-med student here to kiss her butt for a rec letter.

Ridiculously hard exams for an "Intro" class. If you cannot extrapolate/apply what you learn in lecture you will do horrible on exams. Study off slides & use the study guides/practice exams she gives you. There are old practice exams all over the internets too - use them. She teaches at a very reasonable pace and the lectures are very interesting.
Horrible. Exam material is foreign compared to her lectures. Worst class I have ever taken. Take this class somewhere else.

Grade is 75% exams, 25% lab. Material is extremely interesting and relevant, but there is an extreme amount of material covered in a very short time. Exams are very specific and very hard. Good luck...

I had Dr. Bruno for Biochem and Cancer Biology W. She is truly a wonderful woman who wants students to succeed. She will make you WORK for every grade but at the end of the day, if you put the time and effort in, both courses are doable.

why on earth would you possibly even want to take this course with Mary Bruno? She makes fall semester easier and hates pharmacy students therefore punishes everyone in the spring semester by being a horrible professor. 10/10 would not recommend to anyone! But hey good luck if you take it be ready to cry a river.
Information is fascinating, but the exams are challenging

Well you probably heard what this course about and it lives up to its reputation. Biochem was really a hard course and I had to put in a lot of effort to get a somewhat decent passing grade. Find some people in the class who you can study with or ask questions, but you got this. Professor Bruno does hold the mic too close to her face.
