Exams are easy since it is open note, most questions can be found in the textbook, and quizlet helps as well. This class was an easy A!

I took this class over the winter session and it was really straightforward and easy. She gets grades back to you very fast and its easy to get an A as long as you put in minimum effort and do all the work. Her grading is pass/fail, so as long as you pass all the assignments, you can do well! Also course material is super interesting.

Very easy and interesting class if you put in the work. Definitely, definitely do the weekly readings before anything else. 3 exams with a 70+ needed to get an A in the class along with discussion boards and other assignments. I learned a lot of real-life applicable material. She'd often show up late though which got annoying but she's a solid choi

Class is wicked easy and only has about 3 graded assignments, which are all extremely easy. The only hard thing is the last day the teacher does a class where each student has to discuss something specific about the readings so just be prepared for that class. Other than the last day the readings are useless.

This class should be an easy A. I literally only went to class the first couple weeks and still got an A. Each week is really repetitive so just stay on top of your reading and work and you should be fine. Overall though, when I did go to class, she was very passionate and cared about her students!

Easy professor. You don't need to even show up to get an A, just stay on top of the work. She is easy to understand and is very knowledgeable in her field. It is kinda sus we have to pay for the textbook she wrote, but she has resources if you are unable to pay for it. Accessible with office hours. All work is done online including exams.

Professor Weaver is one of the only professors that actually just wants her students to succeed. I forgot to attend class for a good two weeks and honestly my grades are doing fine. The work is consistently the same so as long as you are on top of it you will be fine. Both quizzes and assessments are taken online, very low stress class.

Her lectures are really interesting, I always looked forward to going to class. This course prompted me to become an HDFS minor and I'm taking another class w her next semester. Her grading is really fair and as long as you pay attention you'll get an A. Only annoying thing is paying for the book that she wrote, but hopefully they'll change that.

Wicked easy class. She has a unique grading system so that you don't have to get all A's on exams to get an A as a final grade. Has a lot of activities that add to the final grade so it's not just exams. Lectures were recorded and uploaded. Very relatable and understanding.

Weaver is probably the worst professor I've had at Uconn. She demands in her lectures to make sure to double check your activity responses for grammatical mistakes but doesn't seem to do that in her own textbook writing. Also be sure to be on the lookout for a "good morning" email at 11pm through out the course.

Professor Weaver is known for not responding to emails and demands that you only email through Husky Mail but then ignores those emails too. 90% of her textbook talks about irrelevant things in her life and the other 10% are definitions buried in giant paragraphs. Be prepared to watch 2 hours of lectures plus 15 hours of note taking per week.

i think its dumb we have to pay for a textbook she wrote but its whatever, idk why we have to read her book then watch her lectures that say the same stuff plus a few random facts hidden within that alwayssss show up on exams. pretty easy material just do the weekly reading (40ish pages) and youll be good, easy A

It is very easy to pass this class, though at times there is a lot of work to do. The textbook is online and is one that she made, so it's free! Her personal anecdotes in lecture can be awkward at times, but they do help to understand the concepts she is using them to illustrate; they are rarely tangents.
Such an easy and informative class. All you had to do was get over a 70 on all three tests, quizzes, and reading assignments and you get an A. Online layout was really easy too.

I loved this class! For an online class, it's quite easy. But be prepared to read 1 or 2 chapters, listen to lectures, and do a quiz each week. The class is a P/F grading system, so essentially get above a 70 on the exams, do all of the other assignments, and you'll get an A. The class itself is pretty interesting too; I definitely recommend it!

Dr. Weaver's very nice and approachable, she's not hard to get in contact with. She talks very fast and is often hard to keep up with. She wrote the textbook herself, which has all hw assignments and quizzes attached and you're forced to pay the $90 for it, which sucks.

I enjoyed taking a class with professor Weaver overall. She is very clear and straightforward and knows what she is talking about. Lots of extra credit opportunity. She always tells us to value sleep and our well-being first, and that anything with class can be worked out!

She talks very fast and slides only include bullet points so you must show up to get all the info. There are several opportunities for extra credit but exams and HW are fairly easy. Must get the book in order to to the embedded HW and quizzes after each chapter. She drops the 2 lowest scores for HW and quizzes. She likes to have students engage.

Her lectures are unbearable. She speaks so fast and goes on tangents. Way too in-depth for an intro/GenEd course. The exams are oddly specific, but there are study guides to help know what to study. She wrote the textbook herself and it's grammatically incorrect everywhere. HW and quizzes are pointless but boost your grade along with extra credit.

I'm not even three weeks into the semester, and I'm already crying my eye's out from this class. It is SO HARD. Matter of fact - the HARDEST class I have ever taken. The work-load is insane, and I am easily spending 5+ hours completing the reading, assignments, discussions, and group projects for it weekly. Wouldn't recommend it to ANYONE.

I did not really enjoy attending Professor Weaver's lectures. She spoke very quickly, went off on tangents, and often confused me. I only went to lectures because she would give random quizzes some days. The online work came from mostly the book and the online readings. The class was easy but not my favorite

literally so boring and there is way too much information for an intro class. I was excited to take this class but im just happy it is over. The online exams are very specific and don't assess your knowledge of the information. you have to attend lecture or else you will fail the exams.

Her lectures are scrambled and we will go over like 3 slides per class. Shell stop in the middle of a sentence and go off on a tangent and never go back. Online activities and quizzes are easy, but I would never go to lecture if it wasnt for the weekly in class activities because its impossible to actually take notes and pay attention

This semester was the first semester we did online exams. you can use the textbook and notes during your exam but she makes the tests lecture based. But during lectures she goes over about three slides a class so you have no notes in lecture. The the exams are super specific about one thing she mentioned in class. Not the easy A you think it is.

Dr. Weaver made class interesting by sharing examples and occasionally videos of relevant information and studies. The textbook is written by her so the information is very relevant to what we needed to know for exams. The exams were all open note and online. She wants her students to do well and constantly told us to value sleep and self care.
online assignments weekly but are pretty easy, open note tests

Professor Weaver gives a good amount of work, but is all pretty much based on competition and should be an easy A. All the homework and quizzes add up to count as another test so even if you don't do great on the exams the homework will really boost up your grade. All tests are online and taken out of class. She drops two lowest quiz grades.

Shes a nice person, but not a great lecturer. However, you should go to class because there are random graded activities and exam material only covered in lecture. She uses her own online textbook that you need for homework activities and chapter quizzes(which can be retaken till 100%). Exams are online and open note, same with the final.

online textbook that she wrote, assignments every week (activity and a quiz) in class activities that will bring your grade down if you miss. online exams are timed and doesnt give enough time, have to go to class on exam day and teaches exam info still. Im failing a 1000 level course as a bio major and junior, always says um and sort of.
As I have said before, I love Shannon. She is amazing, her class is informative and easy. Love this lady <3

Shannon Weaver is by far the best professor I have had so far. I think that she is funny and relatable. She teaches the class in a way that makes students feel comfortable asking questions. She is very down to Earth.

The hardest online class I have ever taken. The assignments are doable, but you definitely need a book! Group project requires way to much work and she grades them very hard. And you won't get a grade on it back for more than 3-4 weeks. AVOID at all means.

Dr. Weaver gave us a lot of time and guidance on what she expected from the group project. There are weekly quizzes based on the readings that are pretty difficult but she gives a lot of extra credit at the end of the semester to make up for low scores. She also gave us an open-book, open-note final with a study guide.

She is very passionate about the courses she teaches but her lectures sometimes get really boring and difficult to follow along. A lot of the exams are based on the readings too which we don't learn in class. she also talks way too fast and during class, she reads off her computer making it very hard to learn. exams are also harder than u think.

class is not that difficult if you do the online reading assignments and study for the tests. BUT she talks 100 mph and doesn't post her lectures which gets super frustrating for taking notes in class. I don't think it is possible to take written notes as I can't even keep up with her while typing my notes. She also says "sorta" every 2 words.

Fasten your seatbelts, kids! Get ready for one helluva lightspeed lecture. Think of the parents in Charlie Brown talking but 10x as fast and harder to comprehend. I know more about her family than I do about the actual subject (not complaining though). But for real, I think she tries (and succeeds) at relating to her students! Take her class!!

Definitely, need the online textbook. Lectures are very vague; one slide on a topic in class an entire section in the book, so read. Lectures are good for examples through which show up on the test. Record lecture because she talks fast. Gives lots of extra credit and tests are super easy if you read and come to lecture. The material is logical.

Class is pretty straight forward. Lectures are given in class but aren't posted in class. Also, the lecture slides in class aren't filled in so you must pay attention and decide what is and isn't important. Study guides for the 2 mid terms + final exam are given. However, way too many questions. Besides that she is a very nice woman/professor.

Class is confusing at times, it is an online group project, and you receive no feedback on your project until the end and you have a week to fix 12 weeks of work. Grades come back slow and she is hard to get a hold of. I went about 3 weeks with receiving no grades even though we had 3 things due a week. The book is absolutely necessary. AVOID

I am a senior and figured this would be an easy class, wrong! It is very very lecture based, book is only used for online quizzes, and slides are NOT posted. Studying for exams is nearly impossible, thank god for quizlet. She talks very fast so be prepared to write a lot and hope she decides to repeat that day. Nice woman, terrible professor.

In the beginning, it was a hard time adjusting to the class. The modules outline the lecture and the study guides are very helpful for studying. You will do well on the exams if you study the study guides. There are a few extra credit opportunities and the online activities help your grade. Also, her lectures are interesting and engaging.

She is an amazing prof. Very engaging and interesting. She presents material in lecture that is not in the textbook so lecture is mandatory but lecture is always worth going to because she is simply amazing. I would take a class with her again. The class presents a lot of material but as long as you are engaged it is not too difficult.

If you have taken any psychology course this should be an easy A. Going to lecture is helpful because then you don't have to read any of the textbook. Online almost weekly quizzes are easy and she is a nice teacher.
She gives a lot of good examples in class. The exams aren't hard if you fill out the study guides and attend lectures.

Took this class as a senior since I thought it would be interesting. I just couldn't believe how difficult it was to study for this course. Her study guides are obnoxious. Each question would have multiple questions within it. Literally no direction as to where to find the answers to said study guide. Studying for my science courses was easier.

She is one of the worst professors/teachers I have ever had. She doesn't use the book's chapters in her lectures, instead decides to make up her own version and split up her lectures into "modules" instead of going along with the chapters of the book. She goes off on tangents about her children and her Irish catholic family instead of teaching.

Professor Weaver cares about each and every one of her students. She tells stories that apply to the material and make it so the topics are easy to remember. You're responsible for online quizzes each week, but you have unlimited tries on the questions and they help with the tests. Tests are very fair and the class is easy if you attend.

Dr. Weaver is one of my favorite professors thus far. She has a lot of spunk to her which makes class interesting. Yes, it is important that you attend ALL of her lectures. However, she gives extra credit for attending class. Her exams are straight forward and she gives helpful study guides. Easy A if you put in minimal effort.

The books are very important. If she runs out of time then you may still be responsible for the material she did not get to. If you go to class then you should do great because she uses the same examples she says on exams. She says powerpoints are online, but it is actually just a rough outline of the powerpoint. She lets you argue for points.

If you don't go to class she DOES NOT post the slides online.. just print outs of the overview and you're supposed to fill in the notes for yourself... really stupid considering all her lectures are slides. She usually gives long definitions not on the slides and she says them so fast that you can't write it. She says "sort of" every 5 seconds.

This class is kind of tough. Requires more effort than you might think. She talks very fast. Go to every class, take notes, DO THE READINGS, and study hard for the exams, because they're very specific and have a lot of short answer questions.

Absolutely awful. Extremely unclear and provides very limited help. TAs teach the class, you rarely see her. She specifies things that only should be discussed with her then never responds to your emails. Work is so unclear you lose unnecessary points here and there. Easy class, bad professor so the format is tedious and confusing. Grades SLOW too.

Doctor Weaver was overalll a great professor who helped studentdo well. She made study guides for all exams. She does not put anything on the exam that was not on the study guide, therefore it is your own fault if you don't recognize material on exam.She gave extra credit for showing up to some lectures. She is enaging and course is interesting.

Terrible lecturer. Too much outside coursework for a 1000 level course and she is not very helpful either. I would not recommend taking this course with her. I didn't gain anything from her lectures other than that she's frequently unprepared and scattered.

Terrible class. So hard to follow with excessive amount of assignments. She doesnt even teach the main class, the TA's do it all. The assignments are tedious and never-ending. Would never take it again and wouldnt have taken it if i didnt have to

Lots of material and the study guide is frustrating b/c it doesn't narrow down anything; in fact it adds more material from the book. Lecture is bearable but there should be more real-life application. I felt like all I was doing was memorizing useless definitions and facts. Soo much studying has to be done for the tests; memorize everything!
She does talk way too fast and often has to repeat the lengthy definitions. But overall her class is pretty interesting, but you have to really study to do well on the exams.

Irritating. Her quiz & exam questions are often poorly worded, she tends to give awkward or insufficient definitions in class. Too much expected time dedication for a 1000-level. All multiple choice, which is inappropriate relative to the material (more of an essay type of class, or at least half & half). I felt obliged to warn others here.

I understood everything we learned in lecture, but the exams are impossible! I study so hard in this class but her exam questions are so tricky! I wouldn't recommend taking this class even though she's an ok teacher.

she talks fast but will repeat if you ask. her study guides come out to be 20+ pages typed, so they aren't useful although she says they are. I studied for this more than my biology class, which shouldn't be the way it was. It was an okay class, but it's a lot of memorization because thats all this is about

She talks very fast and says sort of a lot, but is understandable. She outlines exactly what she will ask on exams and presents the material in an interesting way. You need a copy of the book for the online reading quizzes and for material not explained in class. An easy A if you study everything on her studyguides, which can be confusing.
She talks way too fast, and says "sort of" after every word. the study guides were absurd, and the textbook was a $200 pain.

Reading the book is very important. She will put up a study guide for every exam, which if you study carefully should be enough to get a good grade, although you still have to look through the book for bolded words. A lot of material and a lot of work, but worth it. Also she does an in-class extra credit assignment.
She talks extremely fast and you will have to ask her to define her definitions for key terms.
Very sweet, definitely interested in her field, talks a bit fast but very clear. Go to lecture, she gives exam hints. Good class!

Relationships was an interesting class, she gave extra credit twice during the semester if you were at her lecture that day. She holds review classes but the best part about her is she gave a review packet that covered the exam completely, nothing was left out of it. Have to study, but A is definetly attainable

Excellent professor! She talks a bit fast but is more than willing to repeat anything if you just ask her. Really nice. Gives clear study guides for every exam, so as long as you know everything on the study guide, you'll get a 100 on the exam. Great class. Highly recommend!

Although she did kind of talk fast, she wasn't impossible to understand as long as you paid attention. She's a really nice lady with a lot of energy. The exams are extremely easy. As long as you go to class, and do the reading, anyone should get an A. This is a really good and easy gen ed course.
She has a lot of energy and so she keeps you awake in class. There's a lot of information but you can use it in every day life. A great class.

okay, so she tells some jokes and talks about sex pretty openly. HOWEVER- DON'T let her little jokes fool you. If I had a dollar for every time this woman said "sort of," I'd take that money and buy her a speech therapist. If you have to take this class, brush up on the reading terms for the exam. Go to extra help. Study up. Good luck.

Her study guides are helpful, and she gives out a lot of extra credits. There's a good amount of reading involved, but lots of the content is common sense. THe class is focused on "breath not depth" as she said.

Nice lady. Basically easy to pay attention too. Exams are not as easy as I thought them to be. You need to do the reading because theres online activities every week. The exams are mostly on the lecture but have a few random questions from the book. Says "last but not least" a lot. Very nice person, but just an okay teacher.

Weaver is an ok professor. She speaks very fasts repeats herself a lot and constantly says sort of. To me the most interesting parts of her lectures are when she talks about real like examples. Constantly is reading off of and referring to her notes. The class has a lot of content, a lot of studying is required.

She was a great professor. She was also very funny. Dr. Weaver also gave extra credit for showing up to class one time. She is also very helpful in preparing students for exams. She has study sessions before the exams and tells us everything that will be on it.

Ugh I am retaking this class she is the only one teaching so I really have no choice but I hated her and found it hard to concentrate in her class. Read the book, go in for extra help, and study the study guide even though i disagree with everyone else knowing everything on the study guide is not good enough to do well on the test. So read.

Would have been a great class if this lady could stop saying "SORT OF" after EVERY WORD. You think professors who say "um" and "like" a lot are annoying? You haven't experienced life with Weaver. Not only does this nonsensical phrase undercut her degree, but it actually prevented me from being able to concentrate. Take HDFS with someone else.
She is an amazing teacher and should truly consider being a standup comedian because she is hilarious. I would recommend any class taught by her.

she's clear about what you have to know for the exams - she even gives you a study guide. if you know everything off of it, you'll do fine. she's extremely fair about grading and drops the 2 lowest application activity grades and even gives the class many chances with extra credit. definitely take a class with her! :)

she wants you to do well- she gives extra credit, but its so hard to understand a word she is saying. i HATED going to class because she is so unclear and the class was so big. the topic was so interesting before i joined the class...while taking the class i hated it.

True, Weaver comes across as a friend versus a professor per se. The downside of this is that the class (mainly obnoxious underclassmen) tends to walk all over her, openly conversing during lecture, answering phone calls, it's really quite ridiculous. The fact that Weaver does little to curtail this blatant disrespect aggrivates me to no end.

Best teacher I have ever had. Came across as a friend rather then a superior. Very flexible, easy to understand, clear, helpful. Very sweet. Makes every class interesting with movie clips, song lyrics and jokes. Not just a great teacher, but an awesome person.

She was a very good teacher... and i didn't dread going to class ever. The one thing is, the material is very easy... so you dont really have to go to class as long as you can get the notes from someone else. But overall its a good class to take.
A great teacher...shes makes the day fun
excellent teacher. easy to understand. good sense of humor. great class too, highly recommend it. probably the best class and teacher i have this semester
great teacher
very clear/straightforward. does not design exams to trick you. gives comprehensive study guide. fair. adds some anecdotal references for memorable examples and humor. highly recommmended

I would NEVER take a class with this man again. Video journals were brutal, exams were tough, and he holds review sessions outside of class and says youre lazy if you dont go. Tough grader, even met with him to talk about how I could improve, he just was very critical and talked my ear off for a long time and said some people had it worse than me.

This class was awful, very difficult, and the professor was not kind. I went to an exam review, that was held out of class time and he called me out in front of the whole class and asked me a question even though I didn't raise my hand. I said I didn't know the answer and he then gave a snarky passive aggressive response that was uncalled for.

I took this as last semester as a freshman and boy was it a rude awakening. If you aren't reading the textbook and staying on top of class attendance, You. Will. Fail. The 14 movie journal documentary is absolutely killer and takes up all of your time. He literally made fun of me when I tried to ask a question during exam reviews too.

I thought I was taking Intro to Sociology, so the first day was a surprise, but that's on me. Lectures are long, but are posted on HuskyCT. The 14 video journals were killer. You really have to invest in the material and reading the book helped a lot. Prof was kinda rude but passionate and gave study guides. Written responses must be perfect.

Was a lot of work, rude sometimes, tests are easy if you study the study guide, video journals sucked they were so much work for no reason I got an A on all three tests but missed one video journal entry so my ending grade was a B, it was my fault but still sucked

Don't take this class unless you need to for your major or you are actually interested in the material, it is not a blow off class. Studying is essential and you will not pass if you don't put in a good amount of time and effort. If you can, go to the weekly movie screenings because the extra credit will help save your grade.

I studied the exact way he told us too, and reviewed the study guide constantly. I also used the tactics he told use to use on the exam. I still somehow did bad on the exams. He is quite the tough grader. The exams expect you to remember every little detail of the course. The video journals are not bad to do in my opinion, but are quite tedious.

really interesting class, not too much work or anything. just 2 midterm exams, a final , and 3 submissions of movie reviews. prof uploads class slides to huskyct and gives rly clear study guides. u will do well if u put in effort. lectures are a bit long but I enjoy the material so it was fine for me. I wouldn't take this if u hate politics tho

Prof. Wallace is funny and likable as a person but a horrible educator. Tests are heavy and based on both lecture and readings, as well as things he has just mentioned randomly. Requires us to watch 14 full length movies over the course of the class and write essays on each. VERY unclear grader and a bitter man when it comes to the class work.

I will never take a class with professor Wallace sociology again. Wallace is just a nasty old man. He is so one sided about the content it's not even funny and he said he would look at both sides of the argument on day one. He also is one of the hardest graders I have ever had. If you don't give him a word for word def on exams then it is wrong.

NEVER EVER EVER ATTEND THIS CLASS IF YOU WANT TO MAINTAIN YOUR GPA!!!!!!! My accumulate GPA is 3.8. I never get any grade less than B+, but I fail this class. It suppose to be an easy class with interesting content, but not with this professor. AND HE NEVER LISTEN TO STUDENT'S FEEDBACK, HE IS SUPER RUDE!

This man is the worst teacher I have ever had. He is extremely rude and annoying. His tests are awful and no matter how much you study you probably won't do well, you cannot win with him. He moves so fast in the lectures and half of the stuff he says in class aren't even on the slides. The movie assignments are such a waste of time. WORST MAN EVER!

While taking this class (fall 2019), I really disliked the prof and told my advisor I wouldn't take another class with him. He requires you to watch movies/go to movie sessions outside of class which was super inconvenient, but he offered extra credit. Tests are fine, just study. I really enjoyed the course material & I still reflect on it today :)

If you are taking this class regardless of what grade you will get, then take it. Otherwise, just go find a better professor. My cumulative gpa was 3.7, never ever got a c in a class, but he is horrible.
The most boring professor I have ever had. If you care about grades then go find another professor, do not destroy you gpa because of his stupid grade system.
Please dont take it, especially if youre a premed student. He is going to destroy your grade no matter how hard you study.

For a Gen ed. class this professor exams are very difficult when you're a non sociology major. His TA even quit on him! He rants during topic with his own opinion, he is not very welcoming, so reaching out for extra help is hard. Don't waste your time on this class if you don't need too.

This dude is so rude, first of all, and second of all the lectures are all majority about HIMSELF. It's insane, I've never had a class where a teacher talks about himself so much. His stories don't even have a connection to the test material, and all he focuses on is baseball and college basketball. Specifically cinci reds and Indiana U basketball.

I will never take any class with this professor. He moves way to fast through the lecture. He only gave us points on exams so if you don't do well you will fail the class. He offers one point on the exam if you show up to these movies every week but if you get the trivia question wrong he doesn't give you the point, so you sit there for an hour.

Professor Wallace is passionate about the subject. The class is literally called "Problems with American Capitalism". Go to class and take notes on what he says in addition to the slides, and also read the book. His exam questions are just answers to the study guide essay questions. If you outline each essay topic and give examples, you'll be good

Test are multiple choice, matching, and an essay. Gives you a few days before to do the essay but you have to be very specific on what he wants to be answered. Many pop quizzes that play a large role in grade. Not very open to feedback, worst sociology professor I have taken.

One of the worst professors I've had. He was the toughest grader that I have also had. Gives no rubrics for essays and gives very little feedback. The wording of the exams were also tough. Otherwise, laid back class.

Uses connect which is an interactive book. You MUST read and do the quiz for each chapter and sometimes there are multiple a week. You get to pick the other assignments you want to do and it just has to add up to 8 credits (12 credits worth of options). I'm doing well but average is lower so I'm not sure it's an easy A. Interesting though.

STAY AWAY! Hes the hardest grader Ive ever had and its only a 1000 level course. You have to attend the lectures because he quizzes on what he says not whats on the slides and he moves so fast that you barely know what hes saying half the time. And the video journals are the worst. And hour and a half to two hour video every week. NO THANKS
If your taking this for a gen ed, DROP THIS CLASS NOW. its not worth the massive L.

Oh Nah never again will I take a class he is teaching. If you know you can handle work back to back with a teacher like this go ahead but I pray for you. There is so much readings and the video journals are annoying as hell, like this aint it chief. Yeah I learned more information on the US and things but my exam grades beg to differ. Good Luck!

Probably one of the worst professors in the sociology department at UConn. I took a class last year with another professor and loved it. WALLACE RUINED. Extremely opinionated and is probably one of the most hated professors here. He takes forever and a day to grade anything and he is awfully self-centered. The grading scheme is fair though!

1. Wallace is extremely annoying if you do not agree with his ideas 2. Exams are FAR TOO LONG. 40 MC questions, 5 2-5 sentence definitions AND an essay in 75 minutes is absolutely ridiculous 3. It takes FOREVER for him to grade exams; 2 weeks at MINIMUM 4. Even my TA hates the class (u know its bad) 5. Weekly videos are excessive for an elective

Probably the worst professor I have ever had. A few things: Wallace takes FOREVER TO GRADE. My TA even hates this class (he told us when Wallace wasn't there) Wallace is such a hard grader and makes things so much more complicated than they need to be. Also, he is kind of strange. Just don't take his classes (SOCI 1251 at least)

I had him for Work and Occupations and yeah he had a lot of readings and quizzes but if you just took like an hour to read em you could do well on the reading checks. His tests weren't unfair but I had to study a decent amount. His lectures are dry but he puts them online so you don't have to worry about jotting it all down.

I'm a straight A student & this class nearly killed me. the only grades for the class are 2 exams & final, & every week you had to watch a movie and write about it. if you do bad on a test it's hard to bring it up. No matter how much I studied I couldn't get an A. I studied more for this class than my bio major classes. DONT TAKE HIM

Class is okay, but you need to work hard. Make sure you go to lecture because all of his test questions come from the power points. There are weekly quizzes on readings which I though were very tricky because they would be on a specific point and vague. He says he gives a lot of extra credit but all he gave us was one assignment the entire semester

He's a good professor and nice from a distance, don't ask for favors because he's mean about that. Sociology 1001 was pretty easy, if you study everything you'll ace the exams. you have weekly quizzes which are extremely vague and annoying at times.

This class was a horrible experience for me. I will probably retake a dif one bc my participation grade dropped dramatically from high because I missed one 8am discussion I had never missed before and contacted my TA and the professor..... overstrict and ridiculous amount of work for a 1000 level course

His tests were pretty straightforward- if you study what he says in lectures (in addition to what's on his slides), you won't need the textbook. What hurt my grade was his weekly reading quizzes- the information you have to recall is very random and the questions are worded oddly, so they're difficult to take.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS AT LEAST NOT WITH THIS PROFESSOR. He's extremely rude and grades so harshly. Makes the class so so so much harder than it needs to be.

I have never felt more disrespected by a professor. He was extremely rude and not willing to work with me when I missed a quiz due to a university excused absence. He is dry and boring and doesn't let you take notes. He makes this class way harder then it needs to be and he is a jerk. He is not helpful at all and only talks about himself. The worst

Gives 60+ pages of reading every class, we have to memorize ALL OF IT. Exams are tough. He's a pain about paper topics. Disconnected with the class and never considers the syllabus may be too complicated and the work may be too much. It's way harder than it needs to be. Wouldn't have taken it if I knew it was gonna be this stupid and ridiculous.

The class was interesting and it is obvious that he cares a lot about what he is teaching and knows a lot about it. However, for a class that is an elective for many, it is a lot of work with long movies to watch every week and journal responses and he is a bit stubborn when it comes to grading. His exams require a lot of studying but are doable.
Terrible lectures and he is extremely opinionated which makes it that much worse. He makes the class a lot harder than it should be

Prof Wallace gives great lectures. I showed up to every class so my grade benefited from it. The test are midterms really. 8 chapters at a time. But, he gives plenty of extra credit chances, and he averages out your worst test score. So overall, grading is pretty generous. Don't really have to read the textbook if you listen and show up to lecture

By far my worst class. I studied for the tests and got Bs on multiple choice but failed the writing part, so ended up getting Ds on them. Even when you think you know what you're doing in this class... you don't. I wouldn't take by choice
The content taught in this class is super interesting, however Professor Wallace is very monotone and hard to pay attention to. The exams are super hard, like close to impossible.

I literally loved the class. It was honestly so interesting and educational. I could talk my butt off about American capitalism. That being said, if you've ever taken a class that always asked the questions you didn't study for, this will be familiar. Tests are INSANELY hard. First test I got a D. 2nd and 3rd I got Bs. HARDCORE STUDY!!!

This class was very very tough. I am really interested in sociology but this class nearly killed that interest. You learn a lot 'cause you study your butt off for the exams. I did well in the class, but not without VERY large amounts of stress and confusion. DO THE STUDY GUIDES! They will help, but be ready for some random ?'s that seems trivial.
Hardest class over ever taken. I can understand all the material and it will never be good enough

That class is extremely boring. In all honesty, you will learn because you spend your time trying to memorize everything for his exams. Although, he is the toughest grader ever. Everyone who says they like the class are people interested in the material. If you don't care for politics/social issues this class will be a living nightmare, I promise

He is one of my favorite Professors I have had. His class is so easy, understandable, and taught me a lot about how the United States ACTUALLY operates socially and politically. I HIGHLY recommend a class with him! I have a hard time understanding why people give him bad reviews on here.

You learn a lot in this class but its a lot of material. I study very hard for the tests and get 90's on the multiple choice section & 40's on the open responses, meaning he grades harshly. His tests are difficult, the video journals are also suppose to be grade boosters. Offers extra credit and does grade leveraging( gets rid of worse test grade)

I learned so much in this class, and the tests are easy as long as you study. Slides are online because he will not get to everything in a lecture. Class is based completely on the book. Great examples are given, he makes sure you understand the concepts
He's very boring. He assigns additional weekly papers to be done on top of everything else. He does give out extra credit; but it is not beneficial since the exams are so hard.
hated everything about this class. worst teacher ever, super hard. i studied non stop and went to my t.a office hours and got a D+
Worst teacher I ever had. Is not there to help you succeed. I regret the day I put this course in my shopping cart. Avoid him at all costs!

"Sports and Society" course was interesting. All the material was online, textbook is barely necessary. Lectures are long and skimming through slides. Though occasional current events tie in and extra credit in lecture.

Went to 4 classes, the first day of class, the second day of class, and the 2 exam days. Everything is online, and his lectures are painfully long to sit through. Have the option to not take the final if you are okay with your grade. A lot of assignments to pick from and drops the lowest 3 including an exam (final exam for me) Easy class overall

Do not take this class. If you decide to take it, don't buy the book, it is a waste of money. Going to class is a must, however, he did put the slides online. I think he records everything he says and then quizzes you on his exact words.

WORST PROFESSOR LITERALLY STAY AWAY. I took his class last semester, attended every single lecture, but he moves so quickly from one slide to the next that I actually had to take pictures of his slides so that I wouldn't miss anything. Gave 200 terms to study and 8 possible essay questions and he would only post 2 on the exam. DON'T TAKE IT
If you read and go to every class you have a better chance of doing well, you need to write everything he says down.

Rough class. You NEED to attend lecture, but reading isn't crucial. Exams are very specific but there are extra credit opportunities so an A is possible. Complete his study guides as much as possible to study for exams and hope for the best!!
Slides aren't online, need to go to class to learn information because the book sucks. Wallace moves fast, about a chapter per lecture, and wont review material in class

Took Social problems with him. Easy class, tests are very straight forward and right from the lectures. No need to read the book as long as you go to class and review the material before the exam you'll get an A. I only studied about 2 hrs for the exams. Starts of lectures with music videos and commercials. Extra credit available too

literally terrible. this guys lectures are necessary to go to because he asks questions about what goes on in class, but picks out very very small topics and sections from the book and asks about them on the test. i got around 50 percent for multiple choice on all of his tests, and i know its not me because i got As in all my other classes

This man is the worst, i went to class every day, payed attention, read from the book, his exams were ridiculous, you have to read 2 long articles per week and get quized, they were the worst quizs ive ever taken, dont ever take this class for intro to soc
Easy to get an A, lots of extra credit, but I would recommend going to class. Does assign a lot of work though... have to read two long articles for every discussion. Otherwise, not bad.

To do well in this class it's important to go to lecture. If you study the notes you take in class you'll do good on the exams. Prof. Wallace knows what he's talking about in lecture and is especially helpful if you go to his office hours. Not the easiest class, but not the hardest either.

He wants everyone to do well! TONS of extra credit opportunities. There's lots of readings and quizzes that are due in discussion and online each week, but they're SO easy if you read and use the online book. Exams aren't bad at all as long as you review and it's a good idea to go to lecture, but you don't really have to if you read.

I thought this class was really easy. As long as you go to all the lectures and take notes you will do fine. There are so many opportunities for extra credit too. I got 13 points for the final and didn't even do all the extra credit.

People are complaining because he's straight out not a good professor. Far to many quizzes for an intro class (2-3 per week) and along with that he never post the grades you get on them till months after you take them. Exams are sometimes confusing and he can be a real prick if you try to talk to him. I wouldn't take his class if you have a choice.

I don't know why everyone's complaining. If you go to class, take good, comprehensive notes, read from the book, read for discussion quizzes, and pay a LITTLE attention (which are all typical student tasks), you'll be fine. He's also very approachable and nice!! Favorite class, makes me want to minor in sociology. Take this professor for sociology!

Definitely not easy, you actually HAVE to read the textbook and attend class to get all the info he tests on. Acts like his class is the only class you take, and tries to turn the entire class into liberals. Doesn't teach any other views except whats on MSNBC.

Confusing class, originally were going to have three regular exams, ended up having them all take-home so they were easy you need the books for them though. the grading is a little confusing but overall easy

This class is simple IF you are decent at math and didn't mind intro stat. Lecture style is old fashioned, calling on people to answers, but he gives you notes to fill in and if you do that you shouldn't need the book (except for tables) Also gives a TON of extra credit/practice. The class reviews basic stat topics, sadly nothing modern/useful

Prof. Wallace is a really nice guy. Don't know why all the bad ratings up here. He is straightforward and gives elaborate, clear definitions for topics in the course. One large term paper (15 p), rough draft to turn in, meetings with professor. It is as easy as you make it. Note cards help study for exams. Not challenging for hard working students
terrible terrible terrible. avoid him if you can, very rude, judgmental and he is out to make you fail
BOOOO!!!

sociology 207Q is a 200's level statistics course. its unbelievably hard and professor wallace shows no mercy. This is the last class i need before i graduate and i'll probably fail becuase im not mathmatically inclined. He knows the subject well but the work is grueling. take this class somewhere else

Avoid taking this class by all means necesarry, take it at another college. Has nothing to do with sociology, will bring your gpa down tremendously. All about advanced statistics!!! No way in world to get a good grade in this class.
he is terrible!!!!! do not take this class...he gives pop quizzes on the long chapters he only gives you 2 days to read...he's absoultely ridiculous, avoid him at all costs

Intro to Soc is boring and hard with Wallace. He seems to want to make his class as difficult as a 200 level. You have to read long chapters in advance to be prepared for the pop quizzes, and then once you get to class he teaches STRAIGHT from the book.. he even tells the same stories. Avoid him.

Professor Wallace is a terrible teacher. He holds over the lectures by at least ten minutes every class. He gives pop quizes in an intro level class. He grades unfairly. He makes you outline 7 essay questions for each exam. He makes his class boring. He cares more about the sound of his own voice.

Wu is not a good teacher, he does not explain concepts well and it not receptive to struggling students, which is most of the class. He is impossible to reach outside of class and never responds to his email. Probably will be better off with anyone besides him.

extremely hard to understand, teaching is kind of odd. he doesn't really engage class that well just does examples that half the class doesn't understand then just goes through it and doesn't help the students understand. I already took AP physics 1 and got a 5 and can confidently say his teaching is questionable at best.

never take this class with Wu. He is very hard to understand and if you ask him for help he will pretty much make you feel stupid if you don't understand anything. He doesn't post his slides till after class and there have been times when he hasn't posted the slides at all. The Ta's are a lot better so make sure to see them for help.

Professor Wu doesnt explain the concepts too clearly. He leaves after class during the lecture and lets the TAs (who are great and explain concepts better than the prof.) handle helping during the tutorial problems. Participation is necessary for iClicker and tutorial problems. Make sure to explain as much as you can on the labs to avoid losing pts
dont take

lessons are incoherent and labs are rarely similar to classwork. handwriting is illegible and is difficult to understand. Consistently leaves class before it is over and leaves everything to the TAs. Does not help students with problems, instead tells them to look at posted slideshows, which are always incomplete. AVOID IF POSSIBLE
Avoid taking class with this professor, he doesn't know what he is doing, get ready to study the materials by your self, TA is the best way to reach out for help.
Assignments are structured in a complicated way (tutorials, labs, hw, etc), professor doesn't help at all, and encourages reading the syllabus for every question instead of doing his job.

You must attend the lecture simply for the participation points/labs/"tutorials", BUT study concepts on your own time, b/c material and questions are presented in a way that people don't understand what's being asked. ExpertTA, the actual TA's, and other online sources are the best resources for success. Would recommend a different prof. Good luck!

Xian Wu is possibly the worst professor I have had at UConn. He explained everything very poorly, and all the students in my class just went to the TAs for help because no one had any idea as to what was going on. This is a difficult class, so I would suggest taking it with any other professor if you can.

I only had 8 people in my class, so the professor was able to get in touch with everyone. Most of the physic stuff requires you to know lot of things beforehand. He can be funny from time to time but he does seem serious about teaching physics. This class is pretty hard in general but, exams shouldn't be too hard but professor can be a tough grader

He is very hard to follow and he does not seem to actually care about the class. He does not stay for the whole class and when he is there he does not help at all. The homeworks are nearly impossible and the tutorials and iclickers make you come to class even when it is impossible to learn. You will only do well if you study the topics before class
Save both your gpa and mental and do not take physics with him.

Whether unintentional or not, he is very funny. He posts half the lecture slides before class and the other half after class. He won't slow down or repeat himself because of that but it means when you get lost you stay lost during lecture. Also when he posts the slides afterwards he doesn't always post solutions to problems.

Professor did not care about students learning. TAs graded everything harshly and it felt like they wanted to be superior then everyone even though they did not know the correct answers themselves. Homework was complicated and lecture content did not help you with the homework. There was no review sheet/practice test for exams.

Here's the thing, I walked into this class with very low hopes and its a good thing I did. Anton and Xavier (TA's) were only thing that kept me afloat. This class was unreasonably hard and its safe to say I will probably have to retake it. Lectures were pointless, went for iclicker. Exams make or break your grade (VERY HARD) :) good luck!

Lectures in this class were a nightmare to get through. He would go way too fast for anyone to reasonably take notes on what he was talking about. When this was brought up in class by several people his response was "don't take notes on the stuff in class". He published incomplete lecture slides later and told people to read those. Real helpful.

His lectures were fast and hard to follow and he didn't make the presentation slides very accessible outside of class, meaning you have to take notes very quickly or fall behind. The homework barely compared to the classwork or exams.

This is a difficult class made worse by a bad professor. He seems like a nice guy, but man, one 10 minute YouTube video is enough to cover an entire 90 minutes of class time. (and in a more organized way too)

An asshole that gives lectures to hear himself speak. He is an awful teacher and makes concepts more difficult than they need to be. He does not understand what students are asking him and gives them incorrect information. You learn little to nothing and attendance is mandatory. However, exams are decently reasonable and there isn't too much work.
He was such a hard teacher. I couldn't understand the material that was being taught, and he made it so complicated for no reason.

You need a solid foundation in algebra, trig, and some calculus to do well. Sometimes lectures were confusing, but Dr. Wu is really nice and accessible outside of class for help. Some TAs were helpful, some were not and the lab grading was harsh/confusing. Extra credit was offered. Exams were based off the HW and were mostly straightforward.

Dr. Wu is a nice guy but that's where it ends, he sucks at teaching. His lectures are the most useless thing on the planet, I usually always left there more confused. If you don't already have a good grasp of physics you will hate this class. The final exam is easy though so I guess there's that.

3 "midterm" exams and 1 final. Participation points earned by clicker question participation, which is part of your grade. Difficult course, only chance for extra credit was doing 2 surveys for 0.5 points (that's only if 80% of the class did it) or for 5 points on your exam if everyone in your group scores above a 75 on one of the exams.

You need to fully understand calc, geometry, and trig before you take this class. He says he teaches the math but that's not true. The TAs are rude. He's a nice guy, but the class is so hard. You have to do so much inferencing and higher-level thinking that never gets discussed in class. Way too hard, unnecessary for pnb/bio majors.

Physics is not for everyone and some will need to put in more work than others. Dr. Wu did not make it easy to grasp the concepts and the lectures were long and sometimes confusing. Homework and tutorial problems are the most useful for studying. If physics does not come naturally to you, you'll end up putting in a lot of time to do well.

The lecture time is used for reviewing the material and not so much teaching it; so be prepared to learn most of the material on your own time. There are numerous midterm exams and some of the questions are very unclear, not to add the tough grading and lack of feedback given. The final is easy, but I would not recommend this class at all.

I found that the hardest thing about this class was how useless attending lectures was for me. I always attended and took notes but I still felt lost. Wu is kind and is willing to help but I struggled a lot with his explanations. He goes fast.

His lectures are useful sometimes, but they are often quite boring and I think he would be a lot better in person. If you have him online I would not recommend Professor Wu, but if you have him in person you will probably do well as long as you focus and care about physics.

Seems nice and smart, but just doesn't know how to teach. He treated the class like a review of the concepts he's supposed to teach; I mostly learned from the textbook and one of my TAs. Exams were difficult, and he refused to give opportunities for extra credit. Overall, really wouldn't recommend.

His teaching definitely wasn't great. It was hard to understand him sometimes but he started using closed captioning which helped. The way that they graded was harsh because they would take 10/15 points for a problem if I didn't write one equation but still got to the right answer. The labs are easy for the most part and homework isn't too bad.
Awful professor. I could not really understand him and he does not explain things clearly at all.
He is a good teacher, trying his best to help every student. I am ashamed of not getting good grades in his class.

Nothing to say. My suggestion is to master calculus and trigonometric functions before going to class. It is best to have some basics of physics, otherwise you will learn very hard. Good professor, but I feel that the progress is a bit fast, the accent and the way of speaking are a bit difficult to understand.

Well, the class was very hard, and the professor confused me. He is fine, but needs to improve his teaching and speaking skills. We have quiz every week and clicker question. The worst thing is sometime you need to answer the clicker question before you learn it.
Bad teacher
just bad nothing more to say

His lectures were hard to understand and follow at times. Not great at going through examples. Learned mostly from youtube videos. Took forever to get exams back. Mandatory clicker questions that are pretty hard.

He gets a bad rap, but he was an amazing lecturer and I loved listening to him. He had no power over the fact that the class was ridiculously easy, making it boring, but had a bunch of real-life physics demos. He is very funny and likes to make jokes and I love his laugh. Every other review is just butt-hurt because they can't do simple physics.

Mediocre professor. I only went to class because of clicker points. His slides are good but he's just okay at teaching. Not very good at going over problems. I found it better to teach myself the info. He gives 10 extra credit points on each exam, which are made up of multiple choice and open response. Lab is so annoying and honestly pointless.

This professor really cares about the students' feeling. Some students try hard to go to him for higher grades, and he always made them happy even though it seems very unfair to other students. My suggestion is to try your best to have close contact with him every week (email him, go to his office, and ..), and it's very easy to get a great grade.

Worst decision to take this "Doctors" class. Literally have to go through hell and back to understand the notes and lectures. The first day of class he states that this class is very light in math but he must be some sort of math genius because the amount of math in the course is insane. Worst teacher I have had at UConn so far. Please stay away!

I had to take this class as a requirement gen ed and it has been a trip. He is reluctant to explain further on questions when students are struggling to understand. He has no listed class hours on syllabus and he canceled our final week of classes so we never went over the final practice exam. If you can switch out, I would.
I took this class because it was listed as a Q course. The professor was hard to get ahold of and the material was quite difficult and I don't think it should have been listed as a Q course.

You most likely have to take Professor Wu for both 1401Q and 1402Q so after the first semester you'll get the hang of how his class is run. The exams aren't bad and there is 20 possible extra credit points on each. The labs are pretty terrible, unless you get one of the few good TA's. Practice graphing in excel and writing tedious reports.

Professor Wu is a great choice for 1201Q. He really tries to help the students understand the material. The first exam was fair and the second is a pair exam. He drops the lowest if your final grade is higher than either of the two.

Took a class previously with him and felt he was a nice guy but a poor professor. Taking a class again this semester and he has improved greatly. Possible he read these reviews and made some changes. Gives examples and group work in lecture, tests are fair, and he wants to see his students succeed. Glad he has made improvements for the better!

Wu has definitely improved since most of these reviews. He really wants his students to learn and not feel pressure to cram before tests, which is why there's so much extra credit. His slides are informative and he says he teaches to the MCAT. Before each quiz, TA's review in lab and he has a review session. Lab and half of each test are in groups.

Professor Wu is not very good at explaining lecture material. He basically just goes over the pre-lectures and class, and doesn't explain them well. He also doesn't answer questions well in class. This makes his classes very hard to understand.

I had Wu for 2 semesters and I can safely say that this man cares. Yeah, his first semester was very rough, and his teaching needs work, but i see so many professors at this school just not care at all and will hand out As for nothing (or fail everyone). Wu is definitely trying to learn from his mistakes, and with time, will be fantastic

Took the class because I had no other alternatives. The class was a joke from the beginning. Each test had a max score of 120/100. On top of that, the entire class had a max score of 110, with a 93/110 being an A. The test questions were all from homework and lecture. Needless to say, this was by far the easiest class I have taken at UConn.

Pay attention to the online lectures because he will go over more in depth during class and will answer questions then. His tests are also very fair, many questions are very, very similar to practice exams and example problems gone over in lecture or the online homework assignments (also gives a lot of partial credit on exams).

Unless you get Diego, you don't really have good options for physics professors (as of Fall 2017). Xian Wu has a THICC accent and is not the best at lecturing. Clickers are worth a lot, so you have to go to class(or switch off with friend). However, a good grade is achievable. Exams mainly draw on homework and practice exams, and are curved.
Wu focuses heavy on derivations, but if you learn how to do those then the tests are cake. He's a fly guy, just listen to him and do tons of practice problems

Why is this man allowed to be a professor here? He literally told us if we need help, go to the Q-Center instead of telling us his office hours. He doesn't really explain his handwritten notes as he does them. Hard to understand and not worth the stress. If you have to take this class, avoid this man at all costs. Your GPA will thank you.

Terrible professor. Unclear, mandatory lectures, illegible notes, and very little structure or guidance towards what is on the exam. Feel like I've learned nothing at all about physics and we are now a full month into the semester. Please, take any other professor except Wu if you care at all about learning or your GPA.

Worst professor on campus. Hasn't lectured one day this semester and when students complained about not being able to learn through his teaching style, he put together a presentation about why his style is the best. Hasn't solved one problem in class. Handwritten notes with illegible handwriting. Mandatory attendance for no gain. Avoid if you can.

Professor Wu worked extremely hard to ensure that all students understood the subject material. His exams were fair and usually came directly from the homework. I think students struggled when they memorized homework and lecture questions instead of trying to understand them. Lab, homework, and clicker questions helped to bump up everyone's grades.

I have had the unfortunate pleasure of having Xian Wu for two semesters in a row. He does not know how to teach, his accent can be hard to understand, and his exams are blindside you. On the final he put one problem that was in sections he explicitly said would not be on it. I would not recommend him to anyone. Take any other physics prof
Go to class, study the homework and the class is cake. Wu is the man.

He's honestly the worst, and I say that neither lightly nor ironically. He's a terrible professor and he's kind of rude, especially if you question him. I was unfortunate enough to have him for both 1501 and 1502. 11/10 would not recommend.

Professor Wu is easily the worst teacher I have ever had. I went to every lecture and did not learn anything. He is confusing, difficult to understand, and overall terrible. Having no textbook doesn't help either. Exam grades are so low he had to scale one around 40 points. Do not take Xian Wu if you want to learn something

Although he tries to help students out and wants you to succeed, it's hard to say he's anything better than a bad teacher. No one felt good about the exams and he refuses to curve. You better be a physics god or else you're in trouble
He's a terrible lecturer, his slides are pretty ugly, but I' ve heard that he's helpful in office hours,

First year teaching. Overall not bad, physics is just a tough subject. He gives pretty good curves. Grades clicker questions. I recommend looking at the problems he covers in lectures before exams. To be successful in this class you have to put in time as well as understand concepts of the various topics.
Never ever take him. He is the worst.

has had a really rough first semester. thick accent and below average lectures. first exam average was a 60, next was a 50. i hope he gets better because he seems to care a good amount, but as it stands, the class wasn't very good at all
DO NOT TAKE HIM. He is the worst professor that I have ever had. If you have him you will learn more from google and yahoo answers than his god awful teaching.

Thick accent and hard to understand during lectures. Bad handwriting. More work is required on your part to study, go through the slides, and do practice problems. Going to lecture wouldn't have been necessary if he never graded on participation and clicker questions. First exam averaged in the 50's.

He sometimes makes me uncomfortable. He said the reason he didn't derive equation was we even stuck on algebra but the equation needs calculus based. Physics is not calculus, what he said makes me not feel very well. We mad at first midterm since our ave grade is 50+ and he kept modifying question during exam. but 2nd is better. He is doing better
this professor is really really sucks.

He honestly isn't bad, but isn't great either; people are just mad over the midterm. If you do and understand the online pres and hw, the tests are easy. I got used to his accent after the third pres, and he doesn't get his material wrong that often. The way he counts class participation is dumb tho, he asks trick questions a lot for clickers.

Are heavy accents your thing? Looking for a professor that is very unhelpful in lecture? Do you enjoy teaching yourself the material by scrutinizing online presentations? Are you aroused by unprofessional test administration and teaching practices? If so, Xian Wu is your guy. Need to be self reliant and teach yourself. 1st exam average in the 50's

Honestly the worst professor I have ever had. Very heavy accent, hard to understand. Frequently gives wrong information and is corrected by students. He cannot explain any of the material well enough for students to understand. Surprised he is allowed to teach college students. 1st exam our average was 24 points lower than the other profs class.
Worst professor I've ever have. He gave us little time to finish midterm.
Slight accent; overall ok teacher. First time teaching at UConn so I cut him some slack.

She was a pretty okay professor. This class had a lot of reading but I also skipped a lot. We never really had a midterm or final it was more reading and taking quizzes and some projects. Our final was to create our own religion. The class can be boring at times but most of learning about different religions was interesting.

I was really excited to take this class. The information and topics were interesting, but the teacher was horrible. Very rude, didn't interact with students at all (like weekly check in's), besides replying to discussion board posts. The teacher ruined the class for me.

I never really showed up to class or discussion section and managed to get a B+. The only thing is it may be important to read the one book that is assigned but it's a good read anyway. Grade also depends on discussion TA heavily.
The exams are very easy, but lectures are a mess and seem like she does not have a set lesson plan ever. Not much in the lectures are useful and there is a lot of reading that is assigned.
This class was pretty scattered and lectures were all over the place. However, it is very important to attend discussion and the exams are pretty easy!

horrible lectures, very disorganized and off topic, and she is arrogant and rude to students. There is a lot of reading and work for such a low level course but still very easy. Do not take anthropology with her try to get another professor.
She is very passionate about her work but she talks about things that are not relevant. Everything is online and going to lectures is boring sometimes but studying is pretty easy.
This class has an unnecessary amount of readings that are long and time consuming. The lectures are unorganized and boring but she will mention one or two things that you will need to know.

She is a horrible professor. Rambles on in lectures, most of the times not relevant to the class topic. She also thinks very highly of herself and that bothers a lot. Discussions were the only thing saving my grade. Quizzes are very specific, exams are a little easier.

Professor Linnekin assigns a ridiculous amount of reading. During the lectures she rambles and nothing she says is important. For each topic covered she says the same things every class. There are other professors to take, if you can avoid her at all costs. Also she thinks so highly of herself and constantly brags about how she's a professor.

Prof Linnekin is undoubtly a brilliant Anthropologist, but she is not an effective professor. Her lectures are disorganized and ineffective and she fails to fully explain assignments before we are to carry them out. The most frustrating part of her teaching is that she feels very annoyed by students questions.
Goes off on tangents a lot. Super easy class and easy material. Easy A. I attended class, but I probably could've skipped and still done fine. She puts all the material and powerpoints onto HuskyCT.
lectures were off topic and didn't help. too many long readings in the class
She is a very quirky and funny woman, but can be very off-task. Most of the material will be covered in discussion.

No need to go to the lectures. Everything is online that you need and follow the syllabus. Sometimes the readings are a lot, but can go along with the slides she posts. Discussion is important to attend, just do the work and pay attention. Skim read.

I'm in the class right now and didn't write a single note all lecture. There are 4 quizzes and a midterm and final that count for the majority of the grade. Participation in discussion counts as 20 percent. There is no point of going to lecture, she spends the whole time off topic and puts everything online.
Never ever take this class with her. Way to many reading. Please listen to me and take an easier Anthro. She is horrible and rambles during lecture and goes off topic.

Linnekin is easily one of my favorite anth professors at UConn. She really knows her stuff and has a lot of interesting things to say especially in this class (peoples of the pacific islands), considering it's her life's work. That being said, you MUST go to class in order to pass and you MUST take notes on what she says in class (no power points).

She is crazy and just rants about random stuff in class. Lecture is pointless because of this. I would not recommend her to anyone. Discussions are mandatory to pass this class though and involve a lot of reading.

This class is really easy but the professor is quite weird. In the lecture she just rambles about random things and asks the class a lot of questions that are not relevant. The lecture is the only important part and there are quizzes every few weeks that are based off of readings that are manageable. Don't stress though, you get credit for ur name.

As an intro class, don't take this class your first or second semester. Professor Linnekin assigns way to many readings and every two weeks we get tested on them. But they are straightforward if you follow through. Discussion is the only important part. If you participate, it will help you pass the class. Quizzes/midterm/final are straightforward.

Professor Linnekin is by far one of my favorite anthropology professors. She is hilarious and really cares about her students. There were mishaps with HuskyCT and she more than accommodated everyone to our benefit. She has a great sense of humor and genuinely wants to create more well-rounded, woke students! I would 100% take a class w her again.

Linnekin is hands down the worst professor I've ever had. She rambles in lecture, thinks way too highly of herself, and is disrespectful to students. As an entry level Anthro class she is extremely unwelcoming. Don't take her class but if you have to you don't have to go to lecture. Just read and go to discussion.

Professor Linnekin is self-centered and more focused on making her class difficult than actually teaching anthro. My TA saved me. That said, Linnekin is rude, stuck-up, and unrealistic. Skip her class if you can.
Don't take this. Just don't.

Professor Linnekin is just weird, to say the least. An intro course is built to welcome students into a university and to show them a hospitable classroom oriented around what they want out of their college experience. She doesn't really provide that, she is often hostile towards students and acts superior to them on every level.

Linnekin is probably the craziest professor I've ever had. Assigns way too many readings per week and rambles during her lectures. Lectures have nothing to do with quizzes or the midterm/final. Very funny and nice, but too smart to be a college professor. Only take this course if you really really love anthropology.

Linnekin is pretty greak, an expert in her field. She has a great sense of humor. The course is very lecture heavy, so make sure to go. You can maaybe get away with not reading, as long as you go to ALL of the lectures and discussions.

The professor Rambles a lot and most people don't show up to lecture since she only goes over the slides randomly. Slides are all posted online and are on the quizzes and tests. There is a ton of reading but my TA was very helpful. But if you participate in discussion it will help you get a good grade and helps you pass. Quizzes are straightforward

Don't want to show up for lecture? No problem. Nothing she says is important anyway. She can get very rude. Gives TAs a "script" of what to go over during discussion. DO NOT MISS DISCUSSION! Quizzes are given in discussion. Your TA makes or breaks the class. My TA went over all the readings for the quiz. The quizzes are super simple.
So many readings required for this class
If you love dog breeds and boots without buckles, or want to complain about Greek life then this is the professor for you!

The class is easy, but her lecture material was usually random and unrelated to the exam. You could tell she was that know-it-all, stuck-up nerd that everyone hated in middle school. Decent sense of humor occasionally. Just read what's posted online and take your discussion section seriously and you'll get an A.

Professor Linnekin rambles A LOT in her lectures. She gives very clear study materials on HuskyCT though. Lectures are not necessary but be sure to attend ALL of your discussions. Her final is really tricky and almost completely off the study guide but the class is an easy A.

She goes off topic in every single lecture and makes references unrelated to the material. You could essentially teach yourself the course if you read the slides on HuskyCT and go to discussion- it's not a hard class and not worth going to every lecture.

She is a very smart woman and you can tell she knows it. She's a bit impressed with herself and goes off topic a bit, but as long as you go to class and discussions the class will be a breeze. I barely used the textbook and barely studied for her exams and got and A for the semester, probably the easiest class I've taken.

Lectures are very boring, i fell asleep in all but 3. I still fall asleep thinking of anthro. Professor rambles a lot in class, but quizzes can be tricky if you don't read the articles online. Besides tricky TF questions the exams weren't bad and the final is extremely easy. Midterm is composed of MC,TF, & short answer , the final is only 30 MC
She was self-centered during lectures, and would ramble a lot. The exams were easy and all slides are online, so you don't have to go to lecture.

I took anth 1000 with her and it was pretty easy so I took 3030 and it was also not too difficult. As long as you WRITE DOWN EVERYTHING SHE SAYS IN CLASS you will be fine. I found that most of her questions were from lectures, but definitely read the books as well. Exams and quizzes were not terrible. I actually really enjoyed this class.

I personally did not like her teaching style. I thought there was very little structure to her lectures and she went on random tangents. At times I even thought she was quite rude and insensitive. If you're looking for an easy A take this course. Don't if you are actually interested in anthro.

Most of the classes will start off with a lesson but then she goes completely off topic and ends up confusing the class. The class notes are very unhelpful, her grading system is not consistent and you have very little guidance on the assignments. The books are helpful, but necessary. I would not take this class if it is not a requirement.

One of the worst classes ever. She is so vague in her explanations of assignments. She veers off topic every class, poor explanations. I had to take the class, but if you don't have to, DONT DO IT. Boring, and her grading system sucks, like what does "OK" or "OK+" mean. Hated it.

Terrible. CLEARLY had favorites when it was an online class so thats just ridiculous. Rude comments from her in messages or when I would post she would be so b*tchy. Random questions on quizzes that you won't find in any of the reading. TOO much unnecessary reading. Asked us to buy 3 $100 books for and ONLINE ONE MONTH CLASS. bad bad bad
Literally easiest class i've taken so far. Didn't read at all and looked up all the answers to the questions online and got an A. If this class is offered online again TAKE IT!

She is the worst lecturer I have had so far here. 90% of the time she starts talking about off-topic material irrelevant for this class and rambles. She posts notes online which is nice, and is important for the quizzes/exams. She throws a few curveball questions on exams. Discussion is more helpful than her lecturers. She also has an inflated ego.

She's a character and very out there, but don't let her fool you, her exams can be tricky. She is specific and especially for ANTH 3030 if you don't know the foreign words you're screwed. Take diligent notes and DO go over the extra materials she suggests. Extra credit available foe 1/3 of grade.

She is all over the place and hard to follow.Hundreds of pages of reading each week and it is never discussed.Quizes and tests are a combo of undiscussed readings and class notes.There are always trick questions and things that you have never heard of on quizes and tests.She seems to have a good heart but her classes are frustrating and confusing.

Memorize the vocab and go to discussion.Do all that and you'll get an A. Lecture is a waste of time because she rambles on about nothing. She's famous for putting a few trick questions on the tests and then telling you that you're overthinking the questions. If you want an easy A take the class, if you actually want to learn something skip it.
THIS CLASS GOT HARDER. I took this as a pre req expecting an easy A, and although my GPA is 3.6 I barely managed a B

This class is pretty easy, but the professor does not help very much. She is all over the place and always off topic. The exams are a combination of multiple choice, short answer, and true and false which I personally didn't like. A lot of the questions on the test have to do with the stories she assigns. All the notes are online... no need to go
