Awful class, you have to attend lecture because she says a lot of random things that are on exams. Overall, its really boring, its not a really difficult class but avoid taking if you can

Discussion is ten times as important as lecture. She gets off-topic roughly 75% of the time, and is a rather annoying, opinionated lecturer. However, her exams were cake and the textbooks great. Overall, it's an easy class. You don't need to go to lecture to get an A. Pray you have a good TA, because discussion is where the learning happens. Easy A
Very boring lectures, she does get off topic quite a bit
REALLY BORING REALLY EASY

She can be very annoying in lecture and often gets completely off-topic. Most of her notes are online but I recommend going to class. Even though there's not a lot of material that she presents, I found both exams to be relatively easy as long as you go to lecture. There's also not much work for this class outside of a little reading for discussion
She's....interesting to say the least. But lectures are basically useless. MOST THINGS WILL DEPEND ON YOUR TA FOR DISCUSSION. That's really where you learn most of the material.

The class seemed very difficult for a 1000 level class. I was expecting to do well after doing all of the reading and going to all of the discussions. I received a failing grade on the midterm as did many of the other students in my discussion. The notes she posts online are messy and the study guides don't cover everything. Not an easy class
Awful awful awful!!!! She talked about the most random things, and they were NEVER relevant to what she tested us on. I would NEVER take this professor again!

Very nice and interesting prof. She covers everything she grades on and she gives you a study guide before every test. I found her area of expertise very interesting and she kept the lectures interesting

Must go to discussions, don't bother with lectures. Just do the study guides before tests (it's all in the book and notes) and you'll be fine. Reading was completely unnecessary, as long as you go to your discussion!

Going to class was extremely useless. She rarely talked about anything that would be helpful to pass an exam or quiz. Study guides are given for each exam so you have to teach yourself everything because she didn't. Discussions were mandatory.

she was extremely boring, i went to the class to catch up on my soduku calender and that was until a got a 101 on the midterm upon which i stoped going to lecture. i didnt read either of the mandatory books and I got an A-. if you go to discussion and do the study guides and glance at online notes youll be fine.

this class was ridiculously easy. she basically gives you the whole test as a study guide... however, this is the biggest waste of time i ever put into a class. i did all of the readings and went to all of the lectures, but she would constantly talk about things that were completely irrevelevant to anything at all. easy a, but extremely boring.
This online class was nowhere near as easy as anyone I'd talked to said it was prior to taking this class. I would not recommend taking this online with her.
Didn't help to clarify material. Difficult quizzes. Wouldn't recommend taking online.
well any class you can get with Jocelyn is a good one... yeah this lady rocks
veers off topic frequently, posts all notes online, gives detailed review sheets, you'd have to be a moron (not study/attend lecture ever) to get less than an A/A- in this class.
No Comments
No Comments

One of the best professor's I ever had. I struggled with precalc in the past but she made it so easy. Very nice and funny woman who cares about her students and will even teach you calculator tricks to help you with the exam. Explains the material really well so go to class! Take precalc or calc with her and you will make your life so much easier.

Cav is the best Calc professor! If you're taking Calc I, you NEED her. She holds practice review sessions before each exam. GO TO THEM. She practically GIVES you the questions you'll see on your exams. Hilarious woman who always has the best class average out of all Calc 1 sections. Love her to death.

Cav is hilarious and great at what she does. She has been teaching the exact same lecture for years and it's cuz it works. Lecture is copying down exactly what she does for practice problems. Always has the highest test scores, average is always atleast a 90

Calculus 1 is not a very difficult class, especially if you've taken it already in high school. Cav holds very informative review sessions that prepare you for the test alone. Lecture is always informative, but often not necessary due to the reviews.

If you have to take Calc 1 TAKE IT WITH CAV. She is a great professor that makes a difficult subject easier to understand. She is very funny too. I'm terrible at math, but the way she taught made it easy to understand the material. She really wants her students to do well. One of my favorite professors at UConn. Wish she taught Calc 2 :(

Very, very clear on expectations. Goes through everything you need to succeed. No learning is expected outside of lectures. Course structure spreads out your assignments well and facilitates strong learning. It was Pre-Calc so it was pretty easy, but her and Amit Savkar (Sakvar?) are solid Calculus teachers as well by all standards. Highly recom
Great lectures! Clear what will be on the exams, fair exams. Lectures are useful but not mandatory. Not a bad class. Great professor! Funny too.

Organized lectures. I did not realize how helpful her lectures were until I took classes with other profs. She is not very accessible but replies to emails quick. Solid choice, super clear, nice review sessions.
Teaches you really well and clearly. She makes sure you understand the information and is happy to help you outside of class too. Easy to understand and makes lecture fun.

Cav is the best. She makes calc easy and simple and guaranteed to make you laugh every class. She uses clickers so you have to go to most classes, but you'll want to any way. She is definitely the best professor for the course and always has the highest test average.

I took Calc 1 with Cav and she made a difficult class much easier. No matter what this class is decently challenging, especially if you haven't taken a calculus class before. However, Cav's lectures do a great job of preparing you for the tests while keeping you entertained. The homework amount is the same for every professor in this class.

Cav does a great job at making sure you know what's going on. Really cares about the students and makes concepts simple to start with. Thoroughly enjoyed her class and I would recommend that everyone who has the opportunity should take her class

She is great at making the concepts easier to understand, with helpful tips. shows how to use your calculator to double check your work. Lectures never seemed rushed and she is very organized. If you show up to lecture and do the work, passing this course shouldn't be hard.

Cav is great. Just show up to lecture, do your work and you'll do great. She has decades of experience, she cares about us knowing the material and more importantly passing the exam. Most if not all of the problems she goes over during lecture were on past exams over the past 10 years. She also does guided note taking sheets for some lectures.

Cavs was a great professor! I never did to bad in math but she made me do amazing. Lectures are straight forward and if you attend class, take notes, and pay attention, you'll do great. Spends a good amount of time on the hard stuff and makes sure her students understand the material. I 100% recommend her for math if you're able to get her.
Cav is my favorite professor here at UConn so far. I took calc 1 with her last semester, and now I'm lost in calc 2. She has a true passion for teaching, and loves to see her students do well!

Made Calc 1 easy to understand. I took the class with a different professor the previous semester and ended up having to drop it. With Cav, I noticed it coming a lot easier right away and aced the first exam. Just go to lecture and do WebAssign and you'll do great!
Pay attention to the problems she does in class theyre similar to the ones on the exams
Very good lecturer, she makes math easy and clear. She makes jokes at times which help make lecture not as boring. Discussion wasn't very helpful but wasn't bad overall.

Cav was a great calc teacher. The material isn't too bad if you're half-way decent with math, and she makes going to lecture fun with her jokes and stories. She gives you tips as to what to expect on exams, and she tries to prepare you as best as she can for every possible problem you will see. Overall, a great professor, highly recommend her!

Cav's lectures clicked with me and the way she explained concepts made precalc so much easier than i expected. Her review sessions outside of class are beneficial and cover stuff that is usually on the exam, even though she doesn't make it. The homework on web assign is time consuming but if you have to take precalc, take it with Cav!
Funny in class the few times that I did go. Do not take 8 am discussions for this course.

Cav is a good professor but doesn't make the exams, Savkar does. First two exams were fair play cause they were similar to the practice exam. Final on the other hand was brutal. It was cumulative but the practice exam seemed nothing like the final. Final brought my grade down by so much. Daily WebAssign sucks! Retaking the class but at a branch.
Cav is such an amazing professor. Not only does she give great lectures, but if you need her help, she is able to give great one on one feedback!
Great professor. Class was not easy but she made the curriculum manageable.
She was one of the best teachers that i have had. The class overall is tough but she made it a lot easier. She's funny and knows how to teach

Most people love this teacher, I don't understand it. It's department coordinated(pre-calc) so the tests are the same for every department and she's extremely rude and unreasonable when it comes to extenuating circumstances experienced by students. Made me provide ridiculous documentation for the passing of a loved one. Left me in tears.

She's super condescending which is not appreciated. We aren't dumb. She takes down to the class and uses the most condescending voice I've ever heard. Her lectures are okay, but I get the feeling she doesn't respect us, and she makes you show work for everything even if it is really easy.
She is a great teacher who can make student don't like math into math are fun. She speaks clearly and makes you understand hard problems in an easy way.
She is awesome.
Cav is a great professor. She prepares you the best for the exams and she's hilarious.

I was in a unique circumstance, as I had already gone through the course curriculum on my own time and was well into Calc II by the time we reached limits. I opted to skip a few classes because they were beyond review for me and apparently there were "bonus quizzes" on those days. So despite getting an A on every exam, I received a B+. mean lady

I failed calculus I during Fall semester, so I retook with Cav. Her methods of teaching are super clear and straight to the point. She's really funny too, and you won't even need to use the textbook either because she's that great of a professor. I would definitely take her class again if I could!
Honestly she is an awesome teacher. If you miss a quiz or homework she wont let you make it up so make sure youre there. But overall she is a great teacher and really makes math understnadable.

Cav is the best calc teacher I've ever had. I would not take this class with any other professor. She turns the calc bull into English. Exams are hard. Webassign HW and Quizzes are annoying but necessary. Tough course, tough subject, but phenomenal teacher! GET IN HER CLASS

Cav is a great teacher and her tests are not too difficult. Only thing you have to watch out for is the attendance in the lectures. It can make or break your grade because clicker questions are used then graded to check attendance. Other than that it is a moderately difficult course but as long as you do the homework and pay attention its okay.

Great professor with a great sense of humor. She teaches to the exam well! She doesn't explain where concepts come from all the time. She just expects the students to memorize it and apply it. She also is not fan of deep level questions if they do not have to do with the exam.

If you want a teacher that will not only teach you calc, but help you understand it, take 1131q with cav. I took calc in high school but didn't understand anything but once Cav taught it to me, it was crystal-clear

Professor Cavanaugh was by far my favorite professor. I've never been a math person but I felt like I fully understand what was going on in lecture and did well on exams/homework. Strongly reccomend her. She keeps lecture interesting with her witty comments and jokes. Definetly recommend taking Calc 1 with her but go to lecture. It's so helpful.

Best Calc teacher I have ever had! Cav is great she explains things really well. A lot of people skip their lectures just to come to hers. She makes difficult concepts easy to understand and really helps prepare you for exams.

One of the best, if not the best, professor at Uconn. It is impossible not to learn math if you have Cav. She knows most of her students by name and she's very friendly. I enjoyed going to her class and I actually enjoyed calc. She also has to highest averages on exams than any other professor. Take it with Cav or don't take it at all!

She was an amazing teacher who was able to teach calculus 1 to people who are not good math. She did not use the clickers at all, but I would recommend always going to class because she is really interesting and very clear on teaching style. Also, she would tell you what is on the exams and her take on possible test questions. I WOULD RECOMMEND HER

I had never taken a calc class before hers but she made it clear from the start that she would teach the class as if no one has ever seen calculus before and she did exactly that and I ended up doing fairly well in her course. She is honestly the best math prof probably at Uconn but she only teaches one section so shes a hot commodity.

Cav is awesome. she makes calculus seem not so hard and she can predict whats going to be on the tests pretty well. the test are the same for all 1131 but they weren't too bad. take her she really helps!

Cav is the sweetest in the world. She will help you out even if you're struggling, no judgements. She breaks down calc into real people terms, and has an uncanny knack for calling what will end up on the midterms. Take her for a math prof that actually cares!
I completely suggest anyone to take Cavanaugh, you will learn calculus, even if you're terrible at it
She has the greatest sense of humor and makes class fun. Makes it easy to understand some of the difficult material
Very great teacher, made things easy, but the tests are a little difficult. Just gotta practice. (But the online homework is VERY annoying)
great calc professor! easy to understand and learn from
Cav made everything extremely interesting and was clear and helpful. If you have an option to take a class with her as your professor then take it!

one of my favorite teachers ever! teaches the class at a fast pace but speaks clearly and explains everything really well; teaches everything you need to know for the exams and answers any questions you have

She must be the best math teacher i've ever had. She's hilarious during lectures and does an excellent job teaching the material. She explains everything so well that you get a great understanding of the math. I would recommend her over anyone else.

Cav is a GREAT calc professor. I've taken calc last year and I did not fully understand it. But with her, she clarifies and teaches everything we need to know for exams. Shes a funny lady and it keeps your attention during lecture. I would definitely recommend her as a calc professor. Her section always had the highest averages for exams.

Absolutely hilarious and a great teacher at the same time. If you can take a class with this woman do it. If math is not your best subject, she will make sure you understand it. she only teaches you what you need to know. don't buy the book.

She's a good math teacher. Another thing she's good at is talking to us in the most patronizing manner possible. If you can ignore that then you'll be fine. The online quizzes we take are terrible though; there are only three questions and if you get one wrong, it's an automatic 60.

A great math teacher, if you have trouble with math I would definitely suggest her. She's funny and makes coming to class not so bad. Didn't need to use the book at all. Gives great notes. Really prepares you well for tests.

Cav is the best math teacher I have ever had. I did take calc in high school so the class was easy but she cleared up some material that I had trouble with in high school. She definately makes the effort to make everything as clear as possible like making worksheets to take notes on when doing a hard section. The book isn't necessary at all.

She can be a little full of herself, but she is a very good professor. Not exactly an easy class, I was one of a handful of kids who didn't take calc in high school, but I managed to pull off a B-. The practice exams can be a little misleading, but overall very good professor.

Probably the best, most helpful teacher I've ever had. It's a shame that it was a lecture because I think having her in a small class setting would be even better. Not much else to say. She gives you everything you need to do well. The tests are fair. If you have the chance to take 1131 with her don't pass it up.

Great Professor who loves what she does. Didn't take Calc in high school and luckily by having Cav, I was in the same ballpark on the exams as all of my friends who took it in high school. Try to get in her class if possible, she goes over countless examples and gives big hints as to what the exams will look like.

She makes a difficult class as easy as possible. She does not make the exams, but she goes over what we need to know for it. Probably the best math teacher I have ever had. She is funny and normally is ahead of the other professors teaching the same class. She lets class out early most of the time too.
Tells you what you need to know for exams
An awesome teacher. Material was somewhat difficult but she made taught it well. Very helpful too.

She is by far the best teacher in the university. She understands that the point of the class is to get an A+, but wants you to learn and understand as well. She is incredibly funny. I laugh in her class every day. Absolutely get Cav if u can, don't think twice. You'll be happy, trust me. She really makes the material easy to learn.

She's the BEST. She makes jokes and it's clear that she has a lot of fun teaching. She's like a cool mom. I generally enjoy math anyway but she's fantastic. Her lectures are clear and straight forward. She's always willing to help if you're having trouble. I would definitely recommend her, she's fantastic!!

She was an awesome teacher. She doesn't make it completely easy but will help you with anything you need. She won best teacher of the year once. Her quizzes are really fair and shes great at telling you what to study for the exam. She's pretty funny too. I would recommend her to anyone!

She is a great teacher! Although the material is difficult, she explains it well and is very helpful (she provides good curves on grades, too). As long as you don't skip class and make sure to do the online homework, you should be fine. Her lectures aren't boring, either. It was a good class!
Not about Trump at all. Professor Best is very annoying and a poor educator. His course is a very shallow and boring exploration of U.S. politics. Don't waste your time with this guy.

The class is called "Trump Presidency", but the course does not focus on Trump or his presidency. The class is mainly a regurgitation of high school civics with a mishmash of contemporary issues. Prof. Best doesn't even seem to be an astute observer of politics. It's sad because a real Trump presidency course would be interesting and important.

I took this class in the 16 day summer intercession and got an A, the class is just watching movies, answering quizzes and writing three 5 or more page papers. Class was kinda mid, but I attribute that to fact that the class was so condensed, that's usually the case for 16 day classes. But, I think professor Samuel is still decent professor.

Professor best is a great professor. He knows exactly what he is talking about, and it shows when hes lecturing. His lectures arent as boring as everyone makes them seem. He almost always lets lectures leave early, ad he uses real world examples to help you understand the lecture. I would take all of the courses professor best offers.

Take notes on every lecture, and you will pass. Weekly quiz is just "watch this movie and answer a couple questions about it". You have no excuse to get something lower than an A in this class. Learned lots of interesting things in his lectures. He does his best to keep it engaging and really drive home the key lessons.

Best was the easiest most straight forward professor ever. This Trump legacy class was only watch videos, take quizzes on the videos, and go to class for the lectures. The lectures are long and boring. but the class is so easy so it makes it easier to get through. Overall, he's a very down to earth guy anyone should be able to pass easily.

I LOVE PROFESSOR BEST!! I genuinely found his lectures super interesting and love the way he teaches. His Trump course was awesome - don't let the title scare you, it's really just about current political events. I was able to take hand notes for the entirety of the lecture and not get bored. Really good class, and I'd kill to have him again.

Prof Best is cool. His Trump Legacy course is barely like the title but is still interesting (new major political topics each week). The movies are interesting and the movie quizzes are manageable. The final covers a lotttt of material but is also manageable, just attend lectures and take good notes. His lectures can get dry at times, though.

Good class, I don't agree with all his political opinions but that's just the way of life in poli sci. He says he grades attendance but he usually forgets to. I kind of nuked the first movie test but the lowest test score is dropped and you learn how to rly take the exams later. Interesting topics that change every week, easy grade.

The class is really easy, just weekly quizzes on the movies we watch each class and 3 five page essays. As long as you turn everything in by finals week you will be fine, barely any pressure with due dates. The films are also great, and align with the topic presented each week in class. Professor Best is really chill as well, very easy to talk to.

A surprisingly easy class for such a high-level course, but it's informative. Obviously, the best way to pass this class is to never take an exam in person and only online. He also accepts late work and gives extra credit. He makes his class pretty relevant too, and one time when I and most of the class was sick he ended it early. That was kind.
Informative and thought provoking class. Professor Best is a great lecturer and keeps everyone involved.

POLS2998 taught me more in one half of a semester than I've learned the last two years in any social science classes at UConn. His class focuses on current issues, and the causes behind those issues. He is a completely unbiased professor. He gives straight information, and presents argument from all political beliefs. We need more classes like his.

I took Prof. Best for the Trump Legacy course. I found that this course was incredibly helpful as a polisci major. A lot of courses for pols here are very focused on the past or history of political science, but in reality for someone like me trying to go into American politics this class was more helpful than any theory class will ever be.

Great class teaching about contemporary and important issues relevant to our lives. Teaches students to recognize faults in both sides of political parties and the overall system of government while also examining complexity and possible solutions. Eye opening and different than other classes in the best way possible.

This class was one of the best I've taken at UConn. Professor Best is an incredibly passionate lecturer who makes the course material engaging and exciting. Would recommend. Only critiques -- wish he took more time to get to know his students and that the class was less quiz heavy (no essays, just 6 book/movie quizzes, a midterm and a final).

Instead of assigning textbooks, he has us watch a documentary every week which we all really appreciate. Discusses a new topic every week, which is fun and unique. His lectures are long (but I don't think that's his fault), and don't sit in the front because he instead of using a microphone he just yells
Great Professor, one of the best classes I have taken at UConn, majority of the grade is weekly movie quizzes. If you are interested in US Politics you will enjoy this class.

This class isnt too difficult, but its not an easy A. Lectures are useless b/c he just goes over his incredibly long slides. Grade consists of a midterm, final, and movie quizzes. You dont do much during the week besides read the weekly article and watch the movie. Need to memorize a lot of info for the 2 exams. Overall a boring class.

Lectures were super long for this course, but Professor Best always made them entertaining. The movie quizzes were easy and the movies themselves were fun to watch! Only complaint would be that he is hard to reach through email and in general as this class only meets once a week.

Super long lectures, but Best does a good job of presenting them with energy to keep you engaged - the most entertaining poli-sci prof I've had. However he doesn't seem to care about his students or want to be there - if he responds to ur emails at all, it's brief, short, and rude. Just watch all the movies and pay attention to the powerpoint text
Incredible lecturer. Makes the material come alive. Very responsible and engaged. Take this course!

This guy's final exam is a joke. 80 question final in 60 min with no backtracking is ridiculous. Can't check your work. Barely have time to think. Absolute meme. Do NOT take this online unless you're forced to. Doesnt even respond to emails. Don't let this guy's paid vacation ruin your GPA.

He is amazing. I thoroughly enjoyed all his lectures, even though they were virtual. Very informative and interesting. Also almost half of the grading components was the movie quizzes, which were very easy and he picked good ones, so this class was extremely fun.

I took Election of 2020 and it was INCREDIBLE. He is knowledgeable, clearly explains everything, and helps you to really understand the topics. Two exams and weekly movie/reading quizzes. The lectures are long but he is funny and keeps it interesting with visuals. He also hosted weekly sessions where he would speak more in-depth about the info.

I really enjoyed his election class & will be taking his Politics in Time of Trump class. Lectures are extremely long but the class was super interesting and Professor made himself available weekly on WebEx. Weekly readings & documentaries with quizzes on the documentaries. Recommend following the study guide for exams and using notes to answer it.

Took Best for POLS 2998 (The 2020 Elections), easy A. He gives you a study guide for the midterm and final. I recommend that you actually don't fill it out in your own words, just copy and paste info from the slides directly onto your study guide because the exam questions are pretty specific, and so you don't want to leave out details.

I had him for Politics in the Time of Trump (last semester) and The 2020 Election. Obviously, his classes are better in person--super entertaining and witty. Online, there wasn't much interaction outside a weekly Q&A. Difficult to reach via email. Both courses were graded on weekly quizzes and midterms/finals. I learned so much from both courses!

The class would've been better in person, but when it comes to the difficulty online, you can find quizlets everywhere anyway. There are five modules, each with a self-test (MC), exercises (open-ended), and module tests (MC), and the final (MC).He gave extensions on due dates as well as extra credit on the final. Fine class, if not a bit annoying.
Love this guy. Better in person. Don't take online as you wont learn the same. But covids a bummer so I guess you'll have to take online for now.

Great online class. You have 1 reading, 1 documentary film, and 1 lecture per week. Professor Best gives very entertaining lectures with interesting insights. Holds a weekly Q&A and answers emails promptly. I strongly recommend you take the class. You wont regret it.

Nice person but he does not seem to care about his students. I have emailed him several times and he hardly ever responds and when he does it's short and rude. He has great ratings but honestly, I would not take him if you commonly look to teachers for clarification.

Samuel Best is the BEST ha. Took a special topics class on 2020 elections. Weekly assignments were a 10-page reading, a movie, a 20 MC movie quiz. MC midterm and final. I am so happy with the format of this online class during a pandemic. I learned a lot and the class was pretty chill. Wish I got to experience this class in person. :)

Best is an amazing lecturer. I've taken 2 of his classes now, Politics in the Time of Trump and the. 2020 pres election- the trump class was 2.5 hours long but i was rarely bored because his lectures are so interesting and entertaining. I learned SO much from this class especially.

I had Electoral Behavior with Sam in the spring and at first I was skeptical. That was until I had a question and stopped by his office hours. For 2 hours we had the best convo I've ever had with a professor. He answered all my questions, talked about his background, gave me career suggestions. One of the most genuine people at uconn, hes the man.

Class overall was fine but there SO MUCH CONTENT he gives you a review sheet before the exam which is great but it is a full single space 12 point font page. I ended up giving up on the book quizzes because there were too many books. He also likes to word things to be tricky one word can affect the answer. He ended up curving tho.

Electoral Behavior is probably my favorite poli sci class I've taken so far! On the first day of class, I did think Best was a little standoffish, but you honestly get used to it and see how funny he is with his lectures. I was expecting a B but I got an A- :) You can do okay without the reading (there are quizzes), movie quizzes are easy. 10/10!

Sam Best was one of the BEST professors I've had at UConn so far. I took his Politics in the Time of Trump class. Even though the lectures were long at 2.5 hours, his presentation and speaking skills make the time fly. He makes the course content easy to understand and is pretty funny in doing so. Graded material is fair and enjoyable. Take it!

Amazing lecturer and hilarious. Overall really chill guy. There's a lot of material but even if you're not interested in polling, he'll make you interested. You have to read a book every two weeks and take an online quiz for each but they're all interesting. 2 exams and 2 assignments. Absolutely love this class and am taking him next semester!
Take this class!! Professor Best is one of the best lecturers at UConn and his class does not disappoint. There are weekly online quizzes and writing assignments, but they are pretty easy.

Best is a fantastic lecturer, and makes the material as interesting as possible. However, while he's a direct and funny guy in class, that translates to really not caring about his students. It's not an act. When I went to office hours because I was confused over a test question, he was angry and rude, even though I just wanted clarification.

Professor Best is great. I happily sat through his 2.5 hour lecture on Politics in The Time of Trump. You have to read 6 books each around 300 pages every other week, then take a reading quiz. I didn't read and was able to guess and have a quiz average of 85. Discussion papers on the weeks you don't have a book quiz. Final is 100 M/C.
Best is a really good professor, took his 2998 class which was 2.5 hour lectures every week and was never bored for any of it.

Best is definitely the best. Awesome lecturer, makes a 2.5 hour long class interesting for the whole time, and really breaks down and explains the issues. There is a lot of reading (about a book every 2 weeks) with a book quiz, and a paper every other week. He does drop the lowest grade for each, and I skirted by with just Sparknotes for quizzes.
Took his Trump class. Learned so much. He breaks down the issues, giving both the historical background and different political perspectives. Its one class you wont want to miss.

Took Best for "Politics in the Time of Trump" course, and it was the best decision I've made @ UConn yet. The material is all very relevant and interesting, plus he is absolutely hilarious and easy going. 1 week you'll do a reading quiz and the next a short discussion paper, very easy. No midterm, just a final w/ a clear cut study guide. TAKE CLASS

Dr. Best is THE BEST lecturer I have ever had at Uconn. He made the historical development of voting rights one of the most interesting things in the world. I wish all professors were like him. Assignments were straightforward and tests were fair. Fun video project at the end.
His last name says it all.
Really tries to help you out. Simplifies everything as best as possible.

As everyone says, Prof. Best is a great lecturer and orator. He drills important material into our heads repeatedly, and will take note of important things in lecture (and has catchphrases for that). His projects (a paper and group video in my class) aren't so bad. Study guides are very useful, be warned they're term-heavy, so do them in advance.

I took the polisci Q course with Best and being someone who is absolutely terrible at stats and couldn't even make it through stats1000, I pulled a solid B. he puts things in very simple terms, straight to the point and made it understandable for me. One of the best professors I've had at UConn, I really enjoyed his class and learned a lot.

One of, if not the best professor I've ever had. I had the pleasure of having 2 classes with him. He's a great and inspirational lecturer. Very clear. Very funny. A lot of material and a lot to remember, but he gives a clear study guide for the 2 exams and there are no surprises on the exams. Just a very cool guy.

I am horrible at math and he was always helpful to help me understand things more. Great professor and started out the semester making it clear he would make things as simple as possible. If you're not good at math and want to take an easy math course, don't make this your first choice. He is so funny and helps make the class more enjoyable.

Best Poli Sci Professor on campus. He is awesome and his class wasn't hard at all. Just a midterm and Final which are multiple choices and the 2 papers which are worth 20 percent of your final grade are only 5 pages and he gives you the entire semester to do it which can be done within a day. Everyone needs to take this class. He is the best!

His lectures are really funny, sarcastic and applicable to the real world. He really just wants you to learn the material and openly states he doesn't care about grading or what his department thinks, etc. All of his tests are so cut and dry that you couldn't possibly fail, and attendance isn't needed at all but you'll want to show up just for him.

Sam Best is the best poli sci professor at uconn and arguably the best on campus. He is absolutely hilarious in a sarcastic deadpan sorta way, which I love. The class itself taught me more than I've ever learned in a class before and made me feel very engaged. I'm taking every class he offers before I graduate - wish I'd found him sooner.
The best teacher I've had at UConn. So smart and makes material accessible and really easy to understand. I wish I could take every class with him for the rest of my undergraduate career.

He's a great lecturer, but if you're looking for a discussion class, this one isn't for you. He gives study guides for the mid term and final, which make up 80% of your grade. Overall it's a pretty easy class.

Polling in America. No need for the textbooks and hes just an awesome guys. Gives review sheets before every exam and has two papers. If you talk to him he'll move around dates for everything to accommodate people. Highly recommend this guy.
Best teacher ever
This man is a BOSS. He to poli sci what Michael Jackson is to pop music. Enough said.

Absolute gem of a professor. Very funny and very intelligent. Gives awesome review sheets before exams and posts his slides online. If you do the paper and complete the review sheets you'll certainly get a B or higher. Don't buy the book if you plan on going to class - he covers almost everything you'll need to know.

Prof. Best is one of the best professors that i have been with. VERY reasonable, Teaching is very interactive, so you don't get bored. Lectures are easy to understand and fun! if you miss class there is always notes online. Understands problems, But dont take it for granted.

As someone else said, he is probably one my favorite professors I've had and I find that even though it would fine to skip a bunch of classes, he is actually interesting to listen to and I find myself going every day. He literally gives you a sheet with what you need to know for exams; he is very straightforward. He's funny too, which doesn't hurt
The best professor i have ever had. His class makes me want to come, and have fun learning about polling in america...

The material is hard, but she cares about your grade and your success. Go to office hours if you need help or have concerns, she is very perceptive. Hardest part about the class is the content, she has an accent so make sure you go through and actually understand everything. The tests are online, kind of tricky, and a big part of your grade.

Professor Chen was a good professor but her lectures were tough to understand and she kinda just jumps all over the place. But her exams and quizzes are much easier than her counterpart Tanner who also teaches this class. If you attend lecture and review the material, then the quizzes and exams will be fairly easy. (she will save your grade)

I found Chen to be very disorganized throughout the semester. Quizzes were every week and hard in my opinion. Lock down the browser, in person, and usually didn't align with the practice quizzes. Exams were not too difficult but made up the majority of your grade. No extra credit with iclicker questions. Class was not mandatory and was recorded.

PNB 2775 was okay...they took away bonus points/extra credit this semester. You constantly have to study, the exams weigh a lot and the quizzes weigh a lot. I did fine, but 5 questions each quiz, 1 wrong = 80, 2 wrong = 60. This weighs down your grade a lot. They're medium difficulty but it is stressful going in each week.

Dr. Chen is a really straightforward professor; she gets straight to the point and doesn't test on extra stuff that wasn't discussed in lecture. She is really sweet and wants her students to succeed. There are a couple extra credit opportunities and make sure to study for the weekly quizzes because they are lockdown with camera.

A lot of the content in Chen's half was terminology but because lectures were disorganized, her portion was difficult to grasp. Exam and quiz questions were sometimes confusing, as the questions were sometimes vague. Clicker questions during lectures counted as extra credit. That being said, she was very nice and genuinely wanted us to do well.

Chen gives such good extra credit as long as you go to class and engage in the iclicker questions. Her lectures are a bit less organized though and she doesn't always focus on things that are important for exams. Her exam question could be specific to something not mentioned. But she is extremely nice and understanding towards student needs.

Chen's lectures were disorganized and would regularly fly by important subjects expecting students to understand them. Lectures were disorganized, and would rush through. I would to watch each lecture at least three times before understanding them. If you somehow understood the lectures you should do fine. Tanner was so much better imo.

Compared to Tanner, Chen's lectures were way more confusing and not as clear - it took me so much longer to understand the material than with Tanner. However, she is way more approachable, and kinder. Her quiz/exam questions were also way more straightforward. Gave way more EC opportunities and saved my grade.

Do not listen to listen to any of these reviews. Her exam questions are extremely vague and worded awfully. The class is designed so poorly with limited ways to practice the material and no real feedback on quiz/exam questions you get wrong. Chen gives minimal practice questions.I personally preferred tanner overchen because his lectures were clear

Chen covers the second half of PNB 2274/2275. IMO her exams are much easier since they have more memorization based questions. She offers lots of extra credit (up to an extra 5% on her exams), so be sure to do her assignments. Regardless, this class is very content heavy, so be sure to prioritize this class and review her recorded lectures.

Dr. Chen was a very nice lady, but the class itself was one of the worst I've ever taken! She designs the lab portion, and I will say it is by far the WORST designed lab I've ever taken at UConn. Totally disorganized, and I feel like the teaching method hinders student learning rather than helping it. Despite doing well, I despised every moment.
Dr. Chen is very sweet and makes a hard class a little more bearable. She is a refreshing change to Dr. Tanner's portion of PNB 2275, and it feels like she really wants you to learn.

I found that I didn't understand Chen's portion as well as Tanner's, but that may be because I was heavily burnt out by the end of this course and didn't take her half as seriously. Her exam questions are a bit easier, but that doesn't mean that slacking off on studying for them is a good idea. Exams were on a lot of content so early prep is key.
very helpful, caring, organized. not an easy class, but she's a great professor

In PNB2274, she was the professor who handled the second half of the semester, and was the reason why my midterm grade of a C turned into a B. Her lectures are much clearer, her exams are much more straight forward and less conceptual, and she offers much more extra credit-on her exams, you can increase your score by 5 points.

She literally helped boost my grade so much. Her exams are based on the powerpoints so if you study them you will do fine on the exams. She provides a lot of extra credit in the form on clicker points and if you take her weekly lecture quizzes. Her lectures arent necessarily the best but she provides a lot of resources and is very organized.

I personally enjoyed Dr. Chen's teaching style more than Dr. Tanner's, but her slides/lectures did seem a bit disorganized at times. That said, I think she clarified the most important points pretty well, especially through the clicker questions. I also enjoyed that she fully uses all of class time without having us do group work outside of class.

Chen is a very sweet person and cares a lot about the students; however, I found her lectures hard to follow and the information seemed scattered at times. The exams were relatively easy though, although the wording on some of the questions could be confusing. Overall, study the powerpoints and take good notes and you'll be fine on the exams.

Dr. Chen is an amazing professor! It's safe to say that she is one of the few professors who took the time to see how you're doing. The class, however, is very tough and requires a lot of time being spent outside of class. Like the other reviews say, attend office hours and do not mess up your lab grade!

Dr. Chen is a GEM & understanding. However, this class is challenging! Extra credit is offered. Attending class is a must as active learning participation matters. Her content is memorization based from slides and lectures! Lab portion is important. Attend her office hours, lecture TA, and undergrad TAs office hours. Class is doable, but is ALOT!!!

Her class is challenging - one of those classes all premeds dread, among the likes of biochem and orgo. She has 4 exams (and one optional) over the semester - these are the ONLY grading points besides the lab, treat them like a vial of nitroglycerin. Drop all of your plans because you are CRAMMING for these things.

Dr. Chen is a GEM! The material in the class is difficult but Chen is really understanding and cares about her students. Study often and from the lectures/ slides and you should do well. Very knowledgable and passionate about her subject!

I never met a professor so compassionate and caring about her students, in this difficult time she always helped us as a class and granted extensions on exams because she understood how hard it can be. Not only were her lectures straight to the point, she always made it clear to us that we can reach out to her and motivated all of us.

Chen is such a relief from the first half of the semester. Her teaching style is much more organized and her exams make so much more sense. Something that I picked up from one of my friends that is helpful is writing down the slides before class starts because she will say things that are not on the slides that will show up on the exam.

Chen is a really good professor and definitely cares about her students. Lectures are fairly easy to follow (although dense). This class is hard and requires lots of outside studying but she offers lots of extra credit and is a good teacher.
Dr. Chen is so nice. She really wants her students to do well. She offers 5 points extra credit per exam. Much more straightforward exams than Tanner's.

It's been a few years, but I've returned to say this. Prof. Chen is kind and cares about her students, but I hated PNB 2274 & 2275 more than any other class at UConn. They're both hard and the 8 AM timeslot is ridiculous. I attended her office hours often, and though she teaches well, I regret taking these classes and despise them to this day.

Such a phenomenal professor. Dr. Chen truly cares about her students and wants each one to succeed. Her powerpoints are straight to the point. While her exams can be tough for some, going to her review sessions is the best advice. Offers extra credit to 5 points to each exam. If you know her slides, you're set. Truly caring and understanding. A+!

Dr. Chen cares so much about her students and will do everything she can to help you succeed. Her lectures are tougher to follow because she puts minimal information on her slides, but her exams are very straightforward if you really pay attention to her lectures. She teaches you how to study and is almost always available if you have questions.

Chen is an excellent professor, and a truly caring individual. She likes to utilize the textbook far more than Tanner does, so her slideshows are often more vague than Tanner's (she will verbalize information). Exams are difficult but she gives extra credit for participation. Cared so much that I accidentally called her mom once.

I absolutely love Dr. Chen. As soon as she started teaching the second half of the PNB course, I got A+ in both exams. Although she has an accent, I understood her explanation of everything in lecture and once you do understand and go over everything in detail, you'll be sure to get a good grade in her exams. She definitely brought my grade up.

Classes are generally lecture heavy, but she incorporates clicker questions and other group activities. Sometimes she is difficult to understand (accent). If you're not familiar with the lecture topic beforehand, you will struggle to get anything from her lectures. Her tests are among, if not, the hardest I've taken (including ochem). Good luck.

Dr Chen is probably one of the most caring professors at UConn. She is not as tough in grading as Dr Tanner, but still be prepared for a challenging course. Remember, this material is supposed to be tough. However, Dr. Chen does her best to guide us through it. Though she has an accent, she told us she takes american English classes.

Sometimes she is hard to understand during lecture, but if you read the textbook, it should clear things up. Going to lecture and doing weekly quizzes definitely helps boost your grade. I didn't have trouble staying awake because she had clicker questions and different activities that kept me awake.

Honestly, I really wanted to like Chen but I had a terrible experience almost every time I went to meet with her for extra help. When I went to ask for advice on study strategies for this course, her response was that she wished her course was the only course that students would focus on during the semester. Thats not really helpful or realistic...

Dr. Chen really cares about her students; she wants students to do well and to succeed. She makes it a point to be in her office all the time available for questions. The content of the class is difficult so be prepared to work for the grade you get. If you don't spend time reviewing the material outside of class, you're only screwing yourself up.

2274 & 2275 are hard classes, but the reviews below are of the content, not Dr. Chen. If you don't particularly care for Anatomy, the class is dry. Dr. Chen is one of the most helpful and kind professors I have had. She cares deeply about her students, and really goes the extra mile to help you succeed. Constantly study the material as it comes.

Does try to go the extra mile with lectures, posts videos of each lecture with live commentary after every class. Slides are not specific and what you get tested on is very difficult to pull out of her lectures. Very difficult, did in fact ruin my gpa. Would not take agian, but I have to for the next installment of PNB. Good luck.

The exams seemed fair- however points are lost quickly. Final was tough. Lab is extremely intensive and practicals were super hard. Chen cares about her students and is willing to help so definitely use her as a reference.

Professor Chen is amazing! I recommend recording her lectures and listening to them over again, since she does have a tough accent to understand. She always wants to help students learn, and if you go to lecture and do clicker questions, you get extra credit points for her tests, which really boost you up. If you work hard, you should do well.
Heavy accent. Slides are not helpful, and neither are lectures. Reading the book is your best option for passing the class. I preferred Tzingounis over her in the anatomy sequence.

Chen is a sweetheart. She's an angel who wants to help all her students. Don't even think about missing even one lecture because I promise you, you'll regret it. Exams are tough only because of amount of material, not the content itself. Please don't try to cram, that's just suicide. Start 5-6 days before the tests. Study for the practicals too.

Chen also has an accent and can be hard to understand but not as bad as Tzingounis. She tries to engage her students more and likes Clicker questions. Her exams are terrible. Only 40 MC, but you literally have to memorize EVERYTHING from the lecture slides b/c you don't know what she'll actually test you on. Really hard to get a passing grade.

Dr. Chen is by far the best teacher in the anatomy sequence and saved me both semesters! She truly cares about her students passing, has clear slides (best to print them out and add notes in class). Recording the lectures & rewriting your notes is extremely helpful. The reviews down below are not true of her but the other teachers of the sequence!
Dr. Chen is an excellent professor. She is very clear when she lectures and is always there when you need help. The class itself it very dense and tough but is doable if you put in the work.

Dr. Chen clearly cares about her students and wants everyone to do well. I never had any problems understanding her, and I found her teaching style very easy to follow (excellent logiccontinuity to her slides). The material is dense, so be prepared to study, but Dr. Chen does everything she can to make sure you have the opportunity to excel.

I don't agree with the previous rates. Chen is so sweet, and willing to help. Getting an A is not impossible. Download her notes and add what she says in class to them. GO TO CLASS, record the lecture, add everything she says onto it. Know absolutely everything, and ask her what you're confused on. She wants you to succeed, believe it or not.

Dr. Chen is a far better educator than the vast majority of professors. The class is difficult, but blame the material, not the professor. She offers the tools to succeed, but you need to put the time in. For her exams, if you can write a brief essay on each of her learning objective topics, you will probably get an A.

Everyone on here is so critical of Dr. Chen! She's a really nice professor and is really there to help you succeed. The class is really difficult and there is a slight language barrier, but she gives chances for extra credit and is willing to meet outside of class to help you. For the hard material she has to cover, she does a great job.

Dr. Chen is a great professor. She is a little hard to understand, but nothing that would hurt your chances of doing well in the class. She genuinely wanted all of us to do well, and gave GREAT extra credit all semester .The class is hard, but you wont fail if you put in the time.

If you are attempting to enter medical school look no further for a profession. Become an anatomy professor. You don't have to speak English, can fail students, offer no mercy, ruin their academic careers and still get paid! You don't even have to grade a single paper. The computers will do it all for you. No studentteacher interaction.
Ruined my academic confidence. Will consider switching my major. I am a junior. Have never done so badly in a course in my life. Unwilling to help. Was originally highly interested in course.

Did better on exams that I did not study for. Gave up on studying after failing exams because no matter how much you study you may not get the material. I am now stuck at Storrs for an extra year and cannot transfer out. There is clearly a problem if I did well in all classes other than this one.

Ruined my gpa. If you get a 69.99 she will refuse to raise your grade. No matter how simple it is she "won't be able to do it". So don't bother asking for her help with grading issues-especially following the end of classes. Don't try to fight a grading issue, she won't be willing to help you out. Remember, it's not about the student.

Horrible professor. Get ready to photographically memorize her slides, or you won't do very well in the course. The textbook is added information-she'll quiz you on verbal material anyway-even if you memorize everything the book has for you. The best part is that you cannot understand her.

Dr. Chen is a really great professor who knows the material and is very willing to help students during her office hours. Exams are hard, the class is hard, but that's due to the material, not the professor.

Wanted the best for students but language barrier caused a lack of clarity and made the class even harder than it would have been. Exams are hard but she gives up to 6 extra credit points. Not a class to take if you don't need it. Be prepared to memorize many small details in order to understand exam questions on larger topics

Chen really cares about her students, and the opportunity for six points on each exam helps a lot. There is a ton of material and exams are tricky. Some find recording lectures helpful. The book helps understand the basics and she'll then go into more detail. Read the book before each lecture and review notes immediately after to avoid cramming.

This class isn't easy, especially if you want to just breeze through it. The type who like to study 2 days before the exam (like myself) will not do well unless you really attend every class and put in the work the entire time, in addition to studying everything two days before.
Professor Chen is really a nice/kind person who really wants her students to do well. She offers clicker questions and activities for extra points on exams for both 2274 and 2275.

She is a wonderful woman who truly cares about her students. However, the language barrier at times can be unbearable. I understand the difficulties with teaching A&P in a foreign language, however, it is often times difficult to be in the audience. She is very enthusiastic, and seems as though she loves to teach.

I really enjoyed this class. It was difficult for me to make it to lecture because it was 8 am so I probably attended half of the lectures. I only studied the night before the exams and it was manageable. Her tests were very fair and the lab portion of the class is an easy A.

I enjoyed her class, she reads off slides true but she explains it well, you dont have to attend the class. there is just lots of info to remember. go to TA review sessions highly recommended. lab is a lot of work and assignments but my ta's were nice. overall good class but don't take if you are taking 2 sciences(orgo-pnb) already!

During lecture, she literally reads off her slides that she posts on HuskyCT, including her famous Microbe Minutes, so you can skip class. Final grade was based on 4 exams (non-cumulative), online assignments, and lab. She also offered extra credit. As expected, the class was 100% solely based on memorization

Not sure why there are so many bad reviews. Dr. Feldman's course is a relatively easy A as long as you keep up with the lecture material and go over flashcards. She is a very nice professor and I am glad I did not listen to the bad reviews and took this class. :)

She needs to have some synchronous classes to answer questions/review. And not read directly off the slides. Her exams are okay but the amount of info on each makes them hard. If I could back, I would have waited until this class was in-person again. I knew micro was going to be hard, but having no contact with the professor made it so much worse.

She seems very nice and lays out what is going to be on the exams in nice outlines. Definitely doesn't do any curveballs but there is a lot of info so you have to study a lot and be good on time management. Lab was a mess they had no idea what was going on but i'm assuming it will get better with each semester.

Dr. Feldman was a great professor that went out of her way to help me when I had questions about a topic. She organized her lectures well and provided a study guide for each exam which was very helpful. She elaborates on slide content that appears on exams so it is important to watch her lectures.

I had her for MCB 2610 and she wasn't the best so I was hesitant to take her class again. I was pleasantly surprised this semester because her class is based all on writing papers and she gives good feedback. She lets you do extra drafts and is a very easy grader on the final papers. Definitely recommend for an easy W course for MCB or bio.

Don't take this class online if it's asynchronous. You really need good time management skills to keep up with the lectures on your own. She just reads off the slides in the videos though. Perks: Total HW grade counts as an exam grade and the lowest exam is dropped. There's also extra credit.

This is the worst class to take online. All she does is post pre recorded videos for the semester, talk really fast through all the material, and does not have one synchronous class to answer any questions or concerns. She is unhelpful and clearly does not care about her students.

This is the worst class to adapt from in person to online. First of all, she does not even put in the effort to make brand new videos for her students, she is reusing the ones she made in the summer. Second of all, she is not accessible at all, seeing that you can only meet with her in person. Lastly, all she does is talk and she goes way too fast.

She is very sweet and wants people to succeed. The homework is worth a test grade, so make sure you do it! The tests can be hard because she can ask very specific questions. Also do the extra credit because it saves your lowest test grade.

Professor Feldman is a sweet lady who cares about her students. Lectures can be confusing and I often felt myself losing concentration during class. Wiley plus assignments are all on quizlet and lab is the easiest science lab I have had at UConn (even easier than 1107). Go to the extra credit movie & study the microbe minutes/guest lectures.

All she does is read off slides, go for the microbe minutes at the beginning of class. Exams are exactly like bio1107, 50 specific multiple choice questions. Class averages were usually high C's or mid-low B's. Lab is pretty easy, there are weekly quizzes in it that are 2 questions only and barely impact your grade at all.

Hardest MCB class I've taken because she teaches wrong information and does not explain processes well (I've gotten A's in all the MCB classes I've taken). The class is pure memorization of slides, so you need to memorize everything verbatim. 60% tests (4x15%), 15% online hw, 25% lab. You will probably hate this class and learn absolutely nothing.

Only have to go to class to get microbe minutes because all information is on the slides. She is a good professor but exams are very hard and no curve. Lab and online homework is a huge grade boost. Tough class but doable.

Professor Feldman is the sweetest lady there is. She's one of those cool grandmas, her lectures are always funny and super intriguing. She normally has classes at 8 am because the microbe minutes. If you don't attend class you'll miss those and that is always on the exams and should be easy points. Just a great GPA booster

The lectures are not very useful, except for the microbe minutes in the first 5 minutes of class. The exams can be tricky. Memorize every single slide and don't skip guest lecturer presentations and you'll be fine. Lab is a joke.

I think Kathleen has a bad rep, but I think this class was an easy A. And by easy A, i don't mean you can't study at all and get an A, I mean if you study everything, you will get an A. I studied a week in advance and got an A in the class. And I don't mean non-stop, I mean maybe 2 hours a day. Make the right choice and choose KF.

reads off slides, but go to class for microbe minutes. exams can be tricky, but usually straight forward if you read the slides in depth. gives 4 pts extra for one exam as extra credit for an extra assignment. she is monotone.
Exams are tricky. She reads off the slides, only need to go to lecture to get the microbe minutes. A lot of material but not extremely difficult.

Doesn't respond to emails, condescending in office hours and a bad lecturer. Reads off slides and make everything in class seem so simple and easy but ruins your life on exam questions with specificity. Hated this class. Learned nothing.

Very nice, sweet woman. If you have taken science classes before specifically biochem/genetics this class is extremely easy. You do not need to attend lecture (except to get microbe minutes). Lab is easy. Exams are fair, lots of extra credit. Overall easy A, definitely one of the easier MCB classes

Feldman reads off of the lecture slides so the only reason to go to class is for the microbe minutes at the beginning of lecture, which appear on the exams. Go to lectures when there is a guest lecturer since some of their Powerpoints are confusing. The Wiley assignments boost your grade and there is extra credit so the class is an easy A.

Feldman is not a good teacher. Her powerpoint slides are very unorganized, and she reads right off of them in lecture, so if you are confused about something, the lecture will not help as far as clarity. But you have to go to class because she does Microbe Minutes which are on the exam. Exams are tricky, but I've definitely had had harder classes.

Nice Lady. The material is simple and straight forward. Downside: She procrastinates in writing the test, so the questions are unclear,garbled, and confusing. She also tries to be clever in making the test questions harder than they need to be-she fails at translating the intention of the question, leading to more confusion.

She's such a sweet lady and really cares about her students. The material is pretty straight forward and the exam questions were very general. Just be sure to study the microbe minutes and the guest lecture for the exams. The lab was an easy A.
She's super nice and helpful. Will clarify anything you don't understand. Great class.

Feldman is a nice woman, but her teaching skills are meh. She lover to trick students on exams, and you're essencially forced to go to class to get microbe minutes and guest lecture notes. Labs are kinda fun but the weekly quizzes are obnoxious. theres a weekly online quiz assignment that averages to an exam grade which is nice

Look, you're basically screwed for Microbio no matter who you take. But "technically" Feldman is the better option. Exams are very difficult and she LOVES to trick students. "Microminutes" are at the first 5 minutes of class and are on every exam. Also, you're probably going to fall asleep in her class.
Poor lecturer, unless you enjoy seeing professors read off slides.

There are 4 exams in the class, along with online assignments that count as 1 exam grade. Lab is really easy. Practical 1 is just a gram stain. Practical 2 is everything combined. She is HORRIBLE at lecturing, but you have to go for the microbe minutes Questions from microbe minute and guest lecture are on the exams. Exam 4 is the hardest.

Dr. Feldman exams are have medium difficulty level. You should know that the First and the Third exams are the easiest. While the Fourth is by far the hardest. If I could give you one tip, it would be pay attention to the guest lecture (record it) and listen to it later. A lot of the points you'll get taken off will come from the guest lecture.

Overall this class is easy if you attend the lectures.You do not need to read the textbook because her exams only cover her lecture material. Although her lectures get very boring, key in on what she reads off the powerpoint and take note of anything she mentions "would be a good exam question." Attendance saves you time and effort.

Her exams are 40 questions long, with about 25 questions pulled from like 300 slides and the questions can get specific, but I've taken much harder classes. Also, lab is really fun and you actually learn a to there. She is a really nice woman, just boring...

Overall class is pretty easy. Her lectures can be kind of boring since she reads right off the slides. Her tests have some rigged questions where it could almost go either way. I absolutely love the lab (my TAs are awesome and I like the work).

Horrible class. She does NOT care about you or anything. She reads directly off the slides. Lab made up for some of the bad parts of the class, I had awesome TA's. Get an A in lab and on the online homework and you will be fine with a B or C exam average.
HORRIBLE CLASS. Worst prof I've had. She reads off her powerpoints. Exams are challenging, no curve, and her "bonus points" are crap. Lab was okay, the practical was super annoying.

Got an A in this class, only because I self-taught myself with materials she threw off. She reads right off of the slides during the lecture and uses dirty tricks (microbe minutes and guest lectures) to MAKE IT MANDATORY for you to come to her class. You need to do WELL on both lab and exams. Labs were super interesting and easy. Overall easy class

Just super boring...going to lecture is unbearable. Exams are pretty tough, but studying off online homework is the easiest way to prepare. Lab can be very make or break depending on your TA...not a terrible class, but hardly a fun class

Fairly easy class. Focus on the powerpoint slides along with microbe minutes and guest lecturer material (you need to go to class for these) and you're set for exams. Lab experience depends largely on who you get for a TA. Homework is rather easy but filled with erroneous correct answer choices.

She is super nice as a person, but never reply to your eMails. The class is interesting, especially the lab. The exams are 40 questions (28 on course materials, 4 on microbe minutes, guest lecture & reading). The exams were easily, if you do your wileyplus assignments, Which is the curve (super easy online assignment, that is weight as an exam)

No curves, no review lectures, bad attitude in office hrs. Massive material covered between exams but are only spread upon 28 questions. Other 12 are on guest lectures& microminutes in attempts to get attendance for her class. Reads off her slides word for word. She pretty much sets you up to fail. Horrible teacher. A is doable but is self-taught
Ridiculously easy class to anyone with a genuine interest in biology, but she plays dirty tricks to make you go to class. Guest lecturers and spotlights for interesting microbes make it worth it.

Most boring class I've ever taken and exams are hard. Lots of material so you have to put a lot of time into studying. Just studying the slides can be confusing, so reading parts of the book can be helpful but it's not completely necessary.
Easily the worst teacher I had at UConn. You never even have to go to class to get an A in this class. She does nothing to stimulate interest and is just a terrible teacher.

Exams are standard 50 question multiple choice. You can EASILY get an A without opening the book as long as you know the PowerPoint material (the questions are fair). Lab can be hard if your TA is a harsh grader (avoid Emma), but the techniques were interesting to learn. Overall I'm happy I took this class and found it to be a mildly easy A.

Most boring human being I have ever encountered in my life; so ironic considering the fact that she uses the word "interesting" to describe just about everything she teaches you. Lab is stupid, time consuming, and your TA will essentially determine your grade based on factors you have no control over. Biggest joke of the MCB department.

She is horrendous. This lady shows absolutely no interest in the class, which makes the class so much worse considering how deathly boring it is. Lab is essentially impossible to do well. This class is my only complaint about UConn and the only thing ruining my 4.0. Expect to study for days for tests and only get a B/C...NEVER TAKE.
Reads right off the slides. Aside from the Microbe Minutes, the class is useless. She adds absolutely nothing useful in her lectures. Personality seems dry and uninterested. Very uninspiring class.

Lecture was boring and pointless- She read off the slides. Take the online quizzes because some of them are on the exams. Lab was hard, TAs were not helpful and rude. Harsh graders. Dreaded going to lab.

Not a terrible class, but not the easiest. Reading the slides are probably the best way to study, and the online quizzes. Lab definately depends on your TA. Feldman is really nice though and very helpful if you go to her office hours. Final wasn't cumulative, which was awesome. I wish the exams were a little longer, but it's possible to do well.

Lecture is beyond boring and not an bit helpful beyond getting the microbe minutes. Exams are composed mostly of questions anyone with a pulse could answer but there are just enough extremely obscure questions to make getting an A difficult. Prepare to study plenty but learn nothing.

Nice lady but lecture is like torture. The head of the lab for this class is a humongous d-bag so try not get involved in anything that has to do with him. Other than that the lab for this class is very fun and interesting!
Lectures are useless except for the first five minutes were she gives microminutes. Tests are weird. Went to her office hours and dosen't seem that helpful. Horrible

She is a very nice lady but the class is just deathly boring, that being said its not hard at all. Her tests are all fairly easy and the only hard part of the class are the lab quizzes which are made and graded by the TA's.

She reads directly off the slides and the only reason you have to go to class is for the microbe minutes which she doesn't post online. The tests aren't too difficult and you should do fine if you study even a little. The labs depend on your TA of course but they're not very hard.

idk why everyone is giving her such a low rating.. sure shes boring but if you read and take notes from the book then youll ace the tests no problem.. I had a 95 test average. the only thing that pulled down my grade was the lab.. TAs grade very harshly. other than that this class was gravy.
Pretty boring, read off the slides and that was pretty much it

The most boring class I've ever taken. She reads right off the slides and everyone just falls asleep. You learn nothing. Test questions are right from the textbook, but they can be super specific, so be forewarned. The lab is a pain in the butt and the TAs grade harshly. I would never take this class if not for my major.

Terrible professor. Didn't even attempt to make lectures at all interesting. Read straight from her slides and circled every other word. Completely useless. Used questions straight from online self-quizzes. Asked questions irrelevant to material presented in-class.

Such a easy professor, she does the participation thing during the lectures with a code so go to class. She basically teaches off the slides so everything you need to know is on huskyct. Hw due every week online and there's 2 online exams. Ver easy gen ed

This class is a very popular gen ed for people who need to fill their requirements, and is treated as such, it is very easy, one short homework assignment per week, all online tests, very easy grader.
Nice professor, participation required, your grades is mostly depends on your discussion TA, some of them are tough graders, but professor is caring and nice.
Very easy coursework, but weekly assignments can get tedious. Quizzes and exams are all open notes, and attendance at lectures is needed for an easy grade boost.

Have to attend lectures to get credit, but submissions were very easy, along with weekly writing assignments. I went to every discussion, but many others didn't and will probably be ending with similar grades.

She does require attendance, but her assignments are pretty easy. She uploads her lecture slides ahead of time which I liked, and she livestreamed the class so I would just take it from the library. I did really enjoy the course.

Honestly, kind of annoying. She is teaching environmental studies but is an anthropology professor. She doesn't seem to know what she's talking about and some of the things she says is just wrong. Talks about anthropology too much in an evst class. Fine to take for EVST but its going to be super boring and not as fun as it could be.

Professor Fredlund leads a good lecture and a very easy class. She is noticeably one-sided towards certain ideas and lets her opinions occasionally bleed into lecture content, showing a lack of scientific objectivity. Otherwise, she is very passionate about her work and usually sticks to the idea cultural relativism, of which I respect her for.

I took ANTH1000 in Fall 2023. Two lectures and one discussion per week. MANDATORY attendance in enforced via iClickers with end of class code. Discussion varied on the type of TA. Group projects were exclusive to discussions and a mandatory pre discussion detailed summaries of readings. Quiz/Midterm/Final are all online and open notes. Easy course.

It is a really easy class with easy exams, and there are short quizes, thought questions, and I3's that boost your grade really well. The textbook readings aren't really long as well, so it's not textbook heavy at all. If you attend lectures most of the time, it's an easy A right there.

Jessie is an amazing prof and person! Their course was very interesting and promoted great discussions as well as a safe space to speak. 20 page readings twice a week with discussion post. Midterm and Final are open note short essays. Two projects and 1 presentation. Participation & Attending Class is key. Dr. F is the best and so approachable!

Amazing!! Such an insightful class, no regrets. There are 20-page readings + very short discussion posts before every class, but the reading content is great and she gives 3 freebies. Midterm & final are open-note short essay format. Two projects + 1 presentation. Dr. F is a wonderful person, highly recommend!

Professor Fredlund is very passionate about her subject and knows what she's talking about. Attendance to lectures and discussions is graded. The class moves very fast and covers lots of material but Fredlund presents it in a way that's easy to understand.

An easy A!! Weekly discussions that you will have to do a group presentation in once. Weekly online open book quizzes and thought questions (which are kinda a pain, but easy enough). Participation question submissions in class, so attendance matters. Her political views reflect her opinions on material, but not too bad. Recommend as an easy A!!
Lectures can be attended online, and there's a check-in for every lecture. Discussions are also mandatory. Weekly worksheet and weekly quiz. Class is okay if you want something easy.
Lecture consists of her just reading off slides so kind of boring, but an easy A if you take notes. Lectures are also live streamed, but discussion sections are mandatory for participation points.

Great class and an easy A if your ok with the 4 assignments due every week. I3's each class, discussion submission every week, quiz every week, and the discussion section. Its also open note for exams and quizzes so it's very easy and straightforward.
Wonderful professor Informative class

Fredlund is great, her lectures are entertaining. There are about 2-4 assignments a week, but are not hard at all. The only thing I do not like is how bias she is, she is very one-sided to a point that it becomes annoying to listen to the content, which is mostly opinionated stuff.

Easy class. She is super nice and understanding. Attendance is graded but can join livestream if you dont want to go in-person. Grade is based on weekly homework, discussion participation, presentation, weekly quiz, and midterm & final. All quiz/exam are online, open note, no lockdown. Not a lot of work and interesting topics discussed.

Take this class!! This class was very easy and the lectures were easy to follow. I took the honors section which was easy honors credit with 2 papers instead of your typical midterm and final exam. Overall, though the material is easy to follow and there's so many parts to your grade. Thought question assignments kinda annoying but not bad.
