Ended up loving it because Magley is such an engaging professor & made the material so interesting! 5 easy homework assignments, 6 online tests, & a cumulative multiple choice final. Only thing is you have to go to lecture bc she doesn't post slides

She doesn't post her slides online so be prepared to get notes from a friend. All of her classes are early in the morning, 9am being the latest. There is also a lot of rambling and instead of defining and explaining the terms, she gives one example and moves on to the next topic.

She is a very sweet person. She has a fun mom energy. Her class consists of a few easy homework's, 15 question online quizzes and a final. Her lectures are really interesting and easy to follow. She's a little weird but in a good way. Also she is very intelligent and passionate.

Exams recently put online, you do still have to go to class cuz you don't have enough time to look all things up and some questions only make sense if you go to class. Lots of extra credit. Lectures are pretty interesting. She hates people walking in and out of class and computers, so bring a notebook.

Her lectures are not terrible, just very boring. Slides are not posted online, so make friends. Recently started giving exams online & open notes. The exam questions are VERY hard tho, so dont think that means you wont have to study. Read the interactive textbook with questions for extra creditits so worth it. Overall her class is fine & doable
Great teacher!

Doesn't post lectures online and tests you on things she never mentioned in lecture. Discussion section was a waste of time but really easy. tests on husky CT so that was a plus. This professor is closed minded and thinks she is better than everyone else talks about her kids way too much. really easy A though lots of extra credit for textbook HMWK

Tests are online open note. She also gives a lot of extra credit for doing textbook assignments or extra particpant pool studies. Her lectures are clear but you definitely have to go to class because she doesn't post things online. She is terrible at being accessible by email. I have emailed her 3 times and my friends have too, she never replies.

Good professor, very clear in her lectures and good at explaining things. Simple content in this class. Exams are taken online, open book/note/internet. Easy A, but you have to go to class to take notes. She doesn't post slides online. Online textbook (problems) is extra credit. A lot of extra credit opportunities.
Online out of class tests which make up most of your grade, which most of the answers can be found on the online textbook if not in your notes. Offers many extra credit opportunities.

Her exams are "conceptual". Understandable, she wants students to apply knowledge however it is a basic class. She moves fast, writes her own slides (which r not posted) with important info (tho dont rely on her notes or the textbook for exams). If it werent for the exams being difficult this class would have been more enjoyable.
She is the sweetest person but lectures are extremely tough and boring to sit through. Also the quizzes are really difficult but she drops the lowest two grades so that helps.

Does not post slides online, so come to class. I found the info. to be interesting, and who cares her slides aren't sometimes finished? She elaborates when speaking. Also responds to emails quickly. Her TA though grades ridiculous and for quizzes there is always more than 1 good answer, but she says "there is a best one". Tricky, NOT an easy A.

Would not take another class with this professor, the material could be very interesting but she talks about it in the dryest ways. She goes off on a tangent every 10 minutes and says every concept is 'so interesting' but never expands on why. Does not respond to emails and her power points weren't even completed for lecture.

5 quizzes and a cumulative final. The book is necessary for most of the class, but she goes over a good portion of the material. Kind of boring, always talks about children, can go off on tangents sometimes. Uses internet videos sometimes which is good. Has a hard time operating electronics.
Could be an easy, simple class, but she made it boring and difficult to concentrate or do well. I've avoided taking any classes with her since.

Had her for both Psych of Women and I/O. I got a B after final grade curves. Her TAs do most of the grading. Instead of exams we had 6 quizzes and one cum. final. It just meant more studying and having to read every night. Doesn't allow computers, so you have to go to class & take notes by hand. Talks off topic a lot. Would not recommend.
Lectures are kind of boring and discussions involve a lot of participation. Exams aren't too bad as long as you study a decent amount.

Exams are hard but gives plenty of extra credit options to balance out your grades if you do poorly on the exams. Calls student out if your on your phone or using your computer. Will take the entire hour and 15 and not let out early. Pretty easy overall if you attend lectures.
She is the nicest person, she cares about her students!! Although her tests can be tough, she gives several extra credit opportunities. It is definately a good decision to take her for gen psych
Don't be fooled by the lectures the exams are hard
Great professor, she's clear on what she teaches but her exams are HARD. Study a LOT.

It'd be helpful if she put the lecture slides online in the event that people have to miss class due to prior engagements. Psyc 1103 overall is harder than it has to be and should be made to be at least a little bit easier to understand
Extremely hard test...bases on extremely difficult application questions. Still manageable if u print out the chapter outlines...read her notes and the book thoroughly

She's fine. Her grader, however, seems to be out to take off points wherever possible. I got 6/10's on homeworks that, when we went over them in class, matched the answers exactly. Avoid, avoid, avoid.
easy, but really boring. goes through the material slow. quizzes instead of midterms
don't take- terrible teacher.
COOL TEACHER. TESTS AREN'T THAT BAD. ATTEND DISCUSSIONS, THEY HELP. LECTURES ARE INTERESTING. TALKS ABOUT HER CHILDREN A LOT LIKE A PROUD MAMA!P TAKE GOOD NOTES.
TERRIBLE TEACHER!!!! IMPOSSIBLE TESTS AND DOSENT HELP AT ALL. I HAVE BEEN TO EVERY CLASS ANS STUDIED MY ASS OFF AND GOT DS ON MY FIRST 2 TEST. DROP THE CLASS BEFORE ITS TO LATE

I thought it was the easiest class EVER. We had 6 quizzes instead of midterms, but she DROPPED 2 of them, and she went through the class individually and dropped a THIRD for some people!!! I don't know how you can go wrong with that. She took class time a lot to learn all of our names, it was crazy, but good if you like individualized attention.

Gives a series of 6 quizzes and a final instead of a mid-term and final. The book was somewhat necessary as a couple of questions on each quiz came from material in the book that wasn't in her lectures. Quizzes were straightforward, the exam was a little bit more tricky, but not too bad. Her concern for her students is evident. She is a little flakey, but worthwhile. Her class made me want to pursue this field of psychology instead of the crim justice field.
she is boring beyond belief, always talks about her daughter, and says um like a million times during lecture. tests arent bad.
Stop talking about your daughter

whats really weird about this class is that the material is sooo easy and even her notes are easy but she makes the exams soooo incredibly hard that even for a psych major they're kinda difficult. i wouldnt recommend her.
Tests were extremely hard. Did not teach in lecture, instead rambled about how rich he was. The curve does not save you!

The worst professor for orgo 2. He is all about your percentile and ranking in the class than understanding the material. I hated how there was only one discussion question at the end because I felt like it would always be the topic that was unclear to me. I don't think he cared about the class anymore since this was his last semester teaching.

Professor Sotzing does not work through anything more than what you see in his lecture slides. Going to class is useful but only if you read the book (which he says is not helpful but it is) on your own time beforehand or after and then relate that back. His grading scale is simply trying to outrank your class mates, not about learning the material

Sotzing is one of the weirdest professors you will ever have, but that makes his lectures very interesting. The exams are very difficult, but they are always curved up so the average is an 80. There is very little homework in this course, but the exams require a lot of studying
Goes on quite a few tangents. Not the worst professor but if you have the option to take another you will learn more.

Awful. Learned nothing with him. Frustrating if you want to actually learn. Exams very hard and averages are 50%. People stopped showing up to class because you leave lectures more confused. All he likes to do is talk about himself.

If you actually want or need to learn organic chemistry, do not take it with him. His slides have almost no useful information. During lecture he rambles on about the slides without writing anything down or pointing to them, so it is very difficult to understand what hes talking about and to learn new material. Unorganized and bad at explaining.

Dr. Sotzing is a rockstar. Staying after lectures to ask questions and talk was an incredible experience. He inspired me and helped me find my passion. He emphasized what do I enjoy doing and told me make connections to it. His research was fascinating, and taking his course will be blessing. He relates current things to what you're learning.

Funny person, bad teacher. Reads slides. Doesn't do practice problems in class. Review session led by other students taking the course at the same time as you. Does not answer qs adequately. Easily distracted. Clearly states exam expectations. MEMORIZE HW Qs. Txtbk saved me. Never felt confident/prepared for exam. Teach yourself. Learned nothing.

I took this class as a summer class and everything was really fast which was expected. Professor Sotzing often got off the slides talking about application of orgo which was really helpful for generating interest in the field. The course is catered to pre-med students which is tough and a lot of memorization but mostly expected.

He gives homework problems and almost half of it will be the same or similar problems on the exams. Go to review sections as he emphasizes what is going to be on the exam and stay until almost everyone leaves for similar exam problems. If you show that you care, he will help you. I only wished he used visual aid as I am not an auditory learner
Dope person, bad teacher.
He was a difficult lecturer and he teaches like everyone knows what he talks about and everyone learns the same. He is nice but he does not know how to teach.

I don't know where any of these positive reviews are coming from. Sotzing is the worst professor I have ever had. I learn nothing from his lectures and need to teach myself everything. All he does is explain what is going on on a powerpoint slide and doesn't do any practice problems, which this class requires. I regret taking his class so much.
He's a bro, but make sure to study a lot for his exams. Those open ended questions are tough as all hell

I am terrible at Chem and absolutely hated even going to gen chem (like had a pump up playlist hated it) but this was my favorite class last semester. Sotzing is so funny - it makes lecture super entertaining and easy to pay attention to, and I found myself caring about the class way more because of it.

Orgo sucks (SUCKS!!) and is really really hard but if you have to take it Sotzing is a great choice. He tells a lot of funny stories to break up the material and actually sparked an interest for me. I didn't really understand what he was talking about but I wish I did!

Professor Sotzing realized how hard the subject of Organic Chemistry was, and he makes things as easy as possible. Listen in class as he will tell you questions that may be on or similar ones that will be on the exam. He gives EC questions on each exam and can be simple as a word. Study you HW half of the exam are questions identical to those ones.

Orgo 1 and 2 are hard classes which require lots of work, BUT when I retook Orgo 1 with Sotzing I had the best experience. Exams qs were from hw or ppts. If you go to class everyday, pay attention (don't go on your phone), do the HW (not with Chegg), ask him questions, and review a lil everyday, u r set for an A or A-. He also gives a HUGE curve

Definitely take for Orgo 2 - makes his own final and does not use the national exam like other professors making it a lot easier. Half the exams come straight from homework and always doable extra credit if you attend lectures. Class is still hard but he is very helpful if you're willing to ask and put in the work

Hardest class I've ever taken. His slide shows have barely any words on them and he talks so fast its impossible to catch everything he says unless you tape his lectures to rewatch later. He acts like the info should all be obvious to us. I had to teach myself all the material on my own. Lecture is only useful for future extra credit answers.
only pics for ppt, does not teach well even it is my required course but still have to drop with a W, REGRET TAKING HIS CLASS
Smart professor, but doesn't explain the material fully. too much jokes. if he jokes around just a little bit and actually teach organic chemistry thoroughly, his class would be so much better.

Overall, I thought he did a great job teaching the class! He jokes around a lot and tries to make a difficult subject fun(er). He gives a lot of extra credit on exams and is really helpful if you ask him questions! There's a lot of online homework but its guided towards what he wants you to know for the exam.

Very fair grader, gives lots of opportunities to succeed. Very laid back demeanor which is either refreshing or puts you off guard for how difficult organic chemistry actually is. He often gives hints about what will be on the exam and about bonus questions during lecture so I would strongly suggest going to them all.
Don't be fooled by the tangents, they are really interesting and helpful.

Prof Sotzing's a fun dude to listen to, though he does tend to ramble, he's obviously well-versed in o-chem so you're bound to learn a lot. He's a professor who understands there's a whole person attached to the brain he's teaching, which I appreciated
Very fair! I highly recommend taking Orgo with Sotzing. He tends to go off on tangents for most of the class, but offers extra credit and a reasonable grading scheme.

I've taken orgo with 4 different professors and Sotzing has by far been the best for me. Took this class in the summer; he covers the material at a good pace, always willing to answer questions thoroughly, exams are fair and manageable. Would recommend attending class for material & things related to extra credit.

Took the class during the summer. Professor Sotzing did a good job of covering so much material in such a short amount of time. He gets carried away on tangents during lecture, but they're always humorous and he takes extra credit questions from his stories. Go over lecture slides and work back of book problems and you will easily pass.
I appreciated the amount of information he gave us during class on what to focus on for the exams.

Makes orgo pretty manageable because he has a chill attitude about a class that generally stresses people out a lot. You have to work for the grades and do a lot of homework but it's organic chemistry so what can you expect. Exams are part multiple choice and part free response with some extra credit. Online homework is 10% of final grade.
Keeps the class fun with random jokes and life stories but its still orgo so you definitely need to put in the work.

Professor Sotzing is possibly the most unusual professor I've ever had. His train of thought is constantly flying off the rails, so if you value intense organization you might have a hard time. Overall a good guy and totally brilliant. If you can handle sitting through all his stories you'll find that you will learn a lot!
good teacher

awesome dude, teaching for 2ish hours is too much for him (he even admitted not having an attention span to teach for that long so i struggled to stay focused most lectures). book was close to useless, studied slides and problem sets. learnsmart sucks.
I took the class over the the summer and he was a great teacher. He lectured the class well and weighs your exams based on what your higher exam grade is.

The class is organich chemistry, it is not easy. Sotzing makes it so its possible to actually pass the class. Do not read the book just look at his slides and do the homework because that is worth points on the test. He is an alright guy. Goes off on tangents which makes it hard to follow along sometimes.

He made the class feel less grindy by sharing interesting stories. Makes chemistry more appealing by introducing applications. Uses powerpoints to teach, but isn't too bad since 2244 is mostly memorization. Not very organized, sometimes cancels class but with late notice, frustrating for commuters. Pretty laid back.

You either have a feel for it for you don't. Luckily it made sense to me. Prof. Sotzing is a brilliant guy, knows his orgo and is close to a genius with it. Nice guy, lenient with grading, extra credit etc. But his teaching method is eh. His slides have reactions but he assumes you know a lot more than you probably do so wont explain. You'll be ok.

Material isn't easy, but Sotzing makes it interesting with hilarious anecdotes. You should go to class, as he tends to give hints about his exams and go over problems that aren't in the slides he sends out. Homework is an easy 10% of the final grade, with the remaining 90% being split between 3 tests, so make sure you study. A great guy and teacher

Orgo is tough really really tough. It does not help when your professor does not teach. Dr. Sotzing is a great guy but I all he did was put the Student Solutions Manual in a ppt format. I managed to scrape by in this class but so many kids had to drop or take the W. Try to take another orgo with another professor

Funny, personable, brilliant researcher, worst teacher of my academic career... Dr. Sotzing just goes over problems from the SSM and does not actually teach. I skipped 80% of his classes and just showed up for examsfinal. AVOID at all costs! I really want to like the man but I struggled through this semester teaching myself everything.

Take it from someone who yet to get one B here at Uconn: AVOID SOTZING. He is hands down the worst professor I've ever had. Doesn't teach, just goes over book problems. My book was my actual professor. I have no idea why he gets good ratings, he's a jerk. Other professors will teach you and be easier. Drops lowest exam grade, extra credit often.

Nice guy. he moves very fast and does all the questions in the chapters. so if you have an idea of the material before the lecture (by reading the textbk), you are golden. gives a lot of extra credit. like you just have to hit submit the homework before the exam and get 20 free points. also drops hints of Q's on the exam during lecture. SIT INFRONT
Extremely bright guy, makes organic chemistry more interesting with various anecdotes and facts.

This guy is a legend in the making. Orgo is a hard class, but he makes it possible to get an A. You get 25 points on every exam by just doing the homework (you can get every question wrong and still get the points). Read chapters before class because he solves problems during the class. Records all lectures. Drops lowest test and curves at the end.

Great guy, bad professor. He gives online homework that counts for 25% of your exam grades (except the final) and is based on completion. The downside is that the homework's don't help as much as you expect. He doesn't teach the class, he just spends the lecture just doing problems. Avoid if you actually want to LEARN something in lecture.

He's really funny and interesting. I loved the extra 25 points on the exams and he always makes the practice tests harder than the real ones so it really helps to do them and make sure you understand them. Don't blow off the online homework, either, even though it's based on completion because he hand-picks those problems.

Great professor. To do well, always read before lecture. Online HW based on completion worth 25pts on the exam. Practice exam questions similar to real exam questions, with some being identical. Exams may be VERY difficult if you cram or try to memorize everything. Extra credit. Curves. Drops lowest exam. A's definitely possible. Would recommend.
I'd rather you pick some other professor. His tests are usually hard and his lectures don't help at all. Other classes tend to have easier tests with higher averages too.
Good lecturer, hard material.

He tries to make himself available for outside help, and you can tell he really does want his students to do well. However, he is a very busy man. His tests are hard, but he gives pretests and curves if nessecary. Overall, a very nice man and good teacher.

easy class, i read the textbook, but it's unnecessary if you watch the lectures. meet very seldom for 50 min. weekly discussion boards and a paragraph about each movie. you don't have to watch the movie if you can find a good synopsis/review, but I liked watching a movie and still being productive. she talks like shes talking to kids though

She was so sweet. Easiest class, maybe because it was all online, not sure how her real lectures would be. Easy work and her grading is clear. Just get your stuff done on time, it's only 3 assignments a week so she's dead set on due dates. Would definitely recommend.

Professor Von Hammerstein is a wonderful professor. She made the atmosphere feel very smooth when everything was online. The lecture content was very straight forward and organized. I was really entertained by the different movies and the quizzes were quick and simple.

This professor is generally quite easy and kind, but gets frustrated very easily with participation and will call on random people. However, she WILL NOT accept late work, even with a valid excuse (like internet outage). For online classes, she closes submissions for both discussion posts and papers at 11 exactly, and won't accept work by email.

Out of all the film classes I have taken this is definitely the best one. She is very organized. The movies that you watch for this class are actually fun and interesting. All you have to do is take a quiz a week and write a short analysis on the film. Expecting an B+ - A.

The class only consisted of 3 meetings with the professor and the other times you were supposed to answer questions by the TAs on a discussion board. When I did have her meetings though she was super helpful and encouraged students to participate. She's a very nice lady and doesn't grade harshly either.

Consistent work load, no more than 45 mins. Quizzes are straight from the lecture so just pay attention to them. Films can sometimes be boring, but I liked most of them. Does NOT accept late work. I joined the class 2 weeks into the semester and I already missed 2 quizzes and she wouldn't let me make them up. Only grades 4/12 film reflections

GERM 1171 is easy, I never read the book or watched a single movie and did fine. I took it online so the film analyses and discussion boards were the majority of my grade. If you take in person and actually get to watch the movies there is no reason to not get an A. Definite GPA booster of a class

I do not recommend this class online. It was an okay class, but it just felt more mentally draining, and when it's online all the movies must be purchased with your own money. I didn't use the textbook at all, so if you do take this I don't recommend buying the textbook. Overall it's okay for a gen ed, but it's just "meh".

Professer von Hammerstein is wonderful. Especially during coronavirus she has been quick to make students feel at ease and make sure everyone can be successful in the class. If you are looking for a gen ed requirement this class is definitely worth taking in terms of level of difficulty and a great professor.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND! I took three courses with Dr. Hammerstein (German film, culture & Afro-german) and she is a super nice lady. If you do what she tells you and show up in the class, then it would be a solid A. ezpz
boring
Awful

Katharina is an amazing professor. Her class is pretty easy but only if you actually show up. I got a 97 on the midterm from just showing up to class. The class times suck but I guess somethings gotta give for an easy A. Used the pdf of the old book version and readings are important. Everything is easy. Just show up.

The class is once a week. For the first hour she lectures on the film's history and general film knowledge. Then you watch the movie and discuss it after. Pop quizzes are usually every 2-3 weeks, if you write down something on each line you'll probably get a 100. Exams are easy, participate once in a while so she doesn't yell in her german accent.

Once a week, really attendance strict, must participate, no phones or computers, will call you out. Tough grader, but easy mateial, wants everyone to get an A, some weekly readings. She's a little crazy, but entertaining, most movies are good.

Cares a lot about participation and attendance. Yo won't get away with much, she catches everything. I mean EVERYTHING. She knows if you left for a chunk of time or worked with someone else. Not a hard class, just skim the readings because she gets frustrated and calls randomly on people sometimes. DIdn't study, got an A

Take this class !! Professor wants everyone to get an A. Movies are interesting and the discussion really makes you think. The pop quizzes are easy if you just look over your notes before class. Exams are super straightforward and she tells you everything that will be on them. Favorite and easiest class at UConn so far.

Professor Hammerstein is a great professor and the class was extremely interesting due to the fact the movie took up half of the total time. She wants all of her students participating even though the class has nearly 200 kids (I never participated, so going to class every week must be what she focuses on more). Journals for every movie, easy A.

Easy A. Show up, raise your hand once in a while, and you're good. She LEARNS NAMES, even in a lecture hall of 200+. I enjoyed going to class because the movies got good. Beware, there are pop quizzes, but if you look over your notes and skim the reading for 5 minutes before class you are fine. Have fun with it, being a science major I did

I absolutely loved her. She was so cute and always put me in a good mood! I didn't buy the textbook or read it. There were 3 pop quizzes but they were really easy if you went to class (and she drops your lowest). You won't do well if you don't go to class, try to avoid missing one. Most of the movies were really good. Totally recommend!

Professor Katharina Von Hammerstein is AMAZING. I highly recommend. You must go to class and participate and she does give out pop quizzes but they are fairly easy. Take this class! It was very entertaining and she is SO nice and funny!

TAKE THIS CLASS! If you need a GPA booster this class is the one for you. Class meets once a week (for 3 hours :/ ) but most of the time is taken up by a movie each class. If you show up, listen, and look over notes before class you should have no problem. There are pop quizzes but they're extremely easy.

Take german film, one of my favorite classes I've taken this semester. Some movies were good some movies were bad, specifically the ones in the beginning that are in black and white. Later on you watch really good movies and you actually learn to analyze film. not much studying is needed for any of the exams, if you listen in class youll be fine.
There's more work than there should be for this class and the pop quizzes are tricky. Really interesting class though, and you will definitely learn more than expected.

The class is very long but it's really not bad at all since you watch a movie for the majority of class. I am not really a movie buff but I genuinely enjoyed this class. She takes note of who participates and it counts for a good chunk of your grade. The exams weren't too bad if you paid attention in class and studied a bit before them.

I know nothing about history let alone German history or film. You learn a lot. The exams do not have specific questions and are broad which make them easy to answer. If you go to class and listen you do not even have to study, she asks no specific questions. Easy A.

Professor Von Hammerstein will very possibly give you a rough first impression. However, once you get to know her, she will become one of your favorite professors. She truly 100% cares about her students and also cares if they learn or not. She loves participation and will get you out of your comfort zone. YOU WILL LEARN A LOT. Just participate

Easiest A. Definitely take for general education requirement. The classes are long but there's only 14 of them total for a semester.. Not bad at all. As long as you watch the movies and stay around for the discussion you'll succeed in this class. She's a great professor and I actually learned a lot.

The 3.5 hour long lectures once a week isn't that bad when Von Hammerstein is teaching. She is very engaging in lecture and gives you all the notes you are going to need to review for the midterm and final. Course is very easy and I would recommend to take for a Gen Ed, however participate and sit in the front of class! Her movie selection is good.

If you like movies and are looking for a fairly easy A, consider this class. Dr. von Hammerstein is very passionate of the subject, which helps get you through the 3.5 hour (once a week) lecture. Participation is a good chunk of your grade, SO MAKE YOURSELF KNOWN. There's a good amount of reading, but the content is easy. She gives pop quizzes!

Demands respect from her students, but also tries to get to know them and cares about them. This is a small course (20-30 students) and participationclass discussion is highly valued. If you don't do the readings, you're screwed. Besides that this class is really unique and Prof. Von Hammerstein is one of the most engaging and awesome professors!!

Go to class, pay attention, participate, and do the journals. Easy A. She's slightly intimidating but overall I really liked her as a professor. The only bad thing is having to go for 3.5 hours, but it's only once a week. She also gives about 3 pop quizzes so be prepared by reading the textbook. I'd recommend this class.

Not a great instructor. Repeats herself so much for no reason. Class is super long and dreadful (3.5 hours). Although exams are easy, pop quizzes will give you anxiety, and you DO need the textbook! Requires analytic journals of movies. Do not recommend for an EASY A (I'm aiming for a B-, which is saddening). Take Italian film (ILCS 1158) instead!
German Civ is a fun class, and Prof. Von Hammerstein is an amazing teacher. Definitely take this class if you can.
One of the best professors at UConn.

Such a wonderful professor. Takes attendance so attendance is mandatory. Super easy exams (gives study guides in advanced). Don't let all the class materials scare you-you do use all of them, but If you don't have time to read it that week, don't sweat it. EASY A!

Go to class, pay attention, do the minimal amount of work she asks for, study a little, and you will get an A. You should participate in the class too, which might be tough since it's a lecture. I enjoyed the movies we watched, they were interesting. And the quizzes and tests are easy if you pay attention. Its an enjoyable class.

I dont know why everyone says this is the easiest class ever. I am a straight A student and I dont think Im getting higher than a B. You DO have to read, quizzes are not all based on what she says. Her slides are basically empty and you have to fill them in yourself. If you want an Easy A take HDFS 1060 or something. DO NOT TAKE!!!
Nice woman, comprehensive readings and involved discussions.

The class was extremely boring, considering it was 3 1/2 hours! She can get ridiculous, especially when I had to leave early to catch the AVS bus for a broken ankle and she had a hard time excusing me. The class was easy just not entertaining at all. Also, most films include Germans screaming at you so be prepared!
Class is REALLY easy, but boring and long. You need to attend class, no doubt about that. Pop quizzes and journal's happen every so often.

The class wasn't so bad, although I must admit that attendence and participation is a must if you really want to do well. Also be prepared for pop quizzes, but you figure if you read most of the time and take good class notes you should be ok. She will know whether or not you particpate so don't try to hide and slack off!!

Easy class if you go to class every class and take notes. The more notes you take the less reading. It is really easy stuff to learn like camera angles, shots, frames, point of views, why directors edit..etc. If you want an easy A take this class, but just get ready to sit for 3.5 hours once a week. Take it with a friend.

Fun class and very funny professor. It is true this class is long, but if you love foreign films you don't mind. She isn't bad to look at considering her age either. If you want an easy grade, take this class.

Fun class and very funny professor. It is true this class is long, but if you love foreign films you don't mind. She isn't bad to look at considering her age either. If you want an easy grade, take this class.

Basically, it's an easy class. The price: 3 and a half hours in uncomfortable chairs. You must go to class to do well, as the tests rely on watching the movies. And don't think about getting out early. You'll have to stay the full 3 1/2 hours every time.
Couldn't remember the number but it was German Film. Class is pretty straight forward. Don't need to study that much. If you do bad in this class that is kinda shocking!
No Comments

She talks a lot, but then, isn't that what one is supposed to do in a lecture? She explains things well (and doesn't hesitate to wave a briefcase "camera" around to help us understand camera angles), and her slides are very useful when studying for tests. She's very clear on what she wants from students in tests and journals.
Why the hell does the school pay her so much. Waste of Breath.
Rude and mumbles A LOT, also is difficult to work with. Poor communication skills and very vague on what needs to be done. He is super fidgety and can never stand still long enough.

I did his class in spring 2023 and while I did well, I can say that for a gen Ed, it is a ton of reading and the TA's mark pretty hard so be prepared for that, but professor Lansing is pretty chill and his class and readings teach you a lot. Only do this class if you love WW2 history.

My only issue with this course was the lack of visibility for grades. Not once the entire semester was my HuskyCT updated for the grades in the course, so I never knew where I stood with what I needed to improve on and what to seek help for.

Class wasn't hard (material very interesting), but much more work than it was worth. Each week was probably a minimum of 100+ pages of assigned reading with a 3-4 question worksheet. The entire grade is based on participation, 2 papers (4-7 pages each, not hard to write but graded harshly), and the final (handwritten, outline given 2 weeks before).

gave it a 3 star not because of professor Lansing, but the class. way too much reading each week, few notes on ppt slides, strictly graded essays by the TA's, and overall too much of a pain in the butt for a class 95% of you are taking as a gen ed. Good professor, not a good 1000 level Gen Ed course at all.

(HIST 1450) I really liked him as a person, he is nice and funny and cares about his students. he knows what he's talking about and offers differing perspectives. grades off 2 essays and a final exam with 5 IDs and 2 essays. 10+ pages of reading due every MWF so get ready to read, the one thing is very little info on lecture slides so listen up

Amazing class, definitely don't take if you don't enjoy history. You have no tests but about 3-4 papers for 4-6 pages each, and a good amount of reading. He gives good feedback, and his lessons are rarely just him talking at you and very discussion-based. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is a history major or enjoys reading and writing.

Excellent professor, was very accessible, syllabus was clear on what was to be done and what was required. The essays were enjoyable to write, and the books were interesting, just be prepared for a lot of reading in this class and discussions of readings. Overall a very nice guy and a very enjoyable class.

This was one of my lower grades of the semester, but I wasn't caught up with the reading as much as I should've been. As long as you read all the books he asks (all in the syllabus with the schedule) then you should be fine. 1 creative assignment, you had to do 5/12 reading responses weekly, plus midterm and final paper. Going to class will help!

Professor Lansing is a great professor! Had the online format bc of COVID, classes are synchronous. Subject matter very interesting, and as long as you do the readings and participate in discussions, you'll be good! 2 Papers, take home essay final, and 1 map activity. I'd take his classes again!

I liked Professor Lansing. He's a nice guy and made an effort to be friendly with everyone in the class. I wasn't a huge fan of the course content- a little bit heavy for a gen ed. Discussion helps you understand A LOT so definitely go. The exams are just essays so not bad. I would take again, just beware it's probably not an easy A.

Goes over the concepts of the books in class and power points too. No info on the power points, just names so very dull. teaches this class like a core class. HEAVY READINGS, take up a lot of time and treats this class like a core class. AVOID IF YOU CAN, good thing im putting this class on pass/fail if i dont get a B for this semester

60 percent of your grade is 3 different papers. No mid-term or final since two of the papers count for that. The papers are only 5 pages, so not difficult. During the semester you need to answer 10 one page responses on huskyct. Go to class and read the books or you will struggle on the reading responses. Fav class at uconn.
I don't know why people have a problem with Professor Lansing, I thought the class was very interesting as well as easy. Just do your readings and participate and the class is an easy A.
Extremely repetitive and its hard to follow what he is saying since he doesn't have lecture slides. Kinda boring as well

He is a nice guy, don't get me wrong. He grades like we are scholars and if one little thing is wrong then your assignment's grade will be dropped significantly. He is also not very clear in his feedback and responses.

I'm glad I completed this degree requirement and no longer have to worry about this guy. He does not clarify assignments or how they are to be done. He's boring and has a hard time regarding opinions that differ from his. He's one of the few professors I can honestly say I did not like at all.

I came into this class thinking that I liked history and came out of it glad that I'll never have to take it again. He makes the class too difficult in the way that he doesn't clarify assignments, has poor presentations/lectures and is too hard on the grading. He expects students to retain knowledge of over 1500 pages of material as well.

He is one of the worst professors I have ever had. He is way too dull, makes students read over 100 pages a week, and constantly walks up and down the stairs which is annoying. His powerpoints are boring and so is the class.

Charles Lansing is by far one of my favorite professors! He makes some parts of history that would be seen as boring and making them truly interesting. This class was what he focuses on and writes about, which defintely added to his vigor and interest. He tends to ramble, but he makes up for it with choosing really good books :)

All in all, an excellent professor. Although not a natural orator (he lacks a captivating voice), his lectures are clear, concise and never dull. He is enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the subject he teaches, and he truly cares about his students' intellectual development. He does, it is true, assign a lot of reading but not an overwhelming amo

He gives way too much reading and expects too much from students who are not majoring in history. The final takes far too much preparation. He seems to think that it is your only class and doesn't care how much time you need to spend on history to complete his requirements. don't take him if you are just trying to fulfill your requirement!!!
DO NOT TAKE HIM IF YOUR JUST FULFILLING A REQUIREMENT AND DON'T ACTUALLY LIKE HISTORY. He would be great if history is your thing. He is harder than alllllllllll other History 1400 profs.
Uninteresting and difficult. If looking to fill requirement, look further.

i dont see why people had such a problem with this guy. Yes there was a lot of reading but the quizzes in discussion are a joke and he gives you the test questions beforehand. The 2 essays we had to write werent difficult either
Worst class I have ever taken. Way too much reading. TA's grade really hard. Too much work for a 3 credit class.
Very Smart Professor. I did not have much previous interest in History but if you just listen to one of his lectures you will learn a lot. The TA's grade fairly difficultly though.

Nice enough guy, but if you are expecting class discussion to be on a more intellectual level, don't take the class. He settles for basic, assumed knowledge of the material and doesn't really leave room for anyone who wants to actually analyze the material. So right about the reading from the 10 page paper, but he's pretty enthusiastic.
clear on most things, dont really need to go to class because he gives you all the tests, yes the tests before hand. he knows his schtuff. theres alot of reading though

do you love reading? if yes this class is made for you. if not, i will recommend you to take another class. during the fall 07, we have six books to read. you can not escape it because most of the discussion is based on the readings.he even surprised us by assisting in our discussion class. midterm is easy as long as you studied for it.
this class was like torture
i can understand why ppl dont like him but he gives the test ahead of time so it could be a lot worse... i agree that the ta's can be too harsh on essays though
Very easy class but extremely boring. The TAs grade pretty tough but final exam was extremely easy because all questions were given ahead of time.

I don't understand why people say he's a bad teacher, personally I think he's an ok teacher, and he can be funny. It's not easy to teach a 400 people lecture so go easy on the guy, and he practically gives you the exams so relax, it's not that bad. His TAs are hard graders on papers though.
Really nice guy, practically gives you the exam. Verrrryy easy
worst class ever
Class is extremely boring but he is a nice guy and doesn't make it too hard. If you just do the reading and take some notes you should do well.
o
No Comments

The most boring class I have taken. I would fall asleep every class A lot of reading, beware. Most of it you had to do. 70% grade is from the midterm and final. The midterm was a lot harder then the final, there were 10 ids, 3 essays you picked only a few of each. For the final all essays and id's were given in advance so no excuse to do poorly.
The most boring class I have ever taken. Ever. Not very hard though.
HE IS THE MOST BORING TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD, AND YOUR GRADE IS ONLY DETERMINED BY A MID-TERM AND FINAL

I don't know how anyone can rate him very highly. The guy really didn't show concern for students and would spend 2 weeks on the parts of history he loved and quickly mention everything else. He needs to loosen up, tell a joke, and care more about the students rather than trying to be a big shot.

Horiible teacher.. has no heart... all he does is read from his 10 page paper and walk around in front of class.. he puts up powerpoints but most of the points he doesnt talk about... dont take class with him
very boring, alot of notes, easy to get a B in the class,
Good guy, interesting to talk to him out of class. Notes seem a little disorganized at times, but for the most part it's fine. If you attend class and study, you'll get at least a B.
No Comments
the lectures are full of notes, but if you go to every class and take good notes on what he's saying you'll do fine

He is a little boring, but he makes up for it by using clear presentation and well organized information. He tells you when you don't have to take notes on what he is saying, and is generally a great professor. I wish he would do something about cellphones though, 3 or 4 go off every class...
No Comments
Awful! He stands in front of the class and reads while periodically changing the powerpoint! AND he mumbles!

Professor Santiago is a caring professor. I was going through some mental struggles this semester, and he met with me after class in order to go over subjects I was falling behind in. yet, the material he was teaching was way too abstract and completely irrelevant. He is super close- minded and says offensive things during the lecture.

He is quite smug and closed-minded, making him a tough grader. I recommend attending lectures so you know exactly what to write, otherwise he will not like what you have to say. His lectures are hard to follow, however, with no slides at all. He just jumps around in books and preaches his beliefs. The final exam was relatively easy, however.

graded on four things all semester. class is just him presenting people's arguments on Puerto Rico, then stating they're all stupid and he's the only radical thinker that disproves them. this class is him inflating his ego. He interrupts class to tell us that politicians or newspapers are blowing up his phone. Grades extremely harsh and unclear.

My favorite professor ever, I've taken two of his classes. I understand why he isn't for everyone, he's a little sassy at times. If you go to class and do a little bit of reading, you'll pass. He is easy to contact out of class, if he doesn't answer, email him twice and he will answer. He is super willing to stay after class and help you.

Has a clear and set agenda which makes him close minded to other opinions. Is smug and sarcastic in class. Attendance is not mandatory but I would say the lectures are importance to attend because he practically gives you the answers to all the assignments. Will give feedback before the due date- but be ready to write in accordance with his beliefs

A truly terrible professor. He thinks he's teaching an upper/grad-level course; harsh grading and opaque criteria. Lectures are some of the worst I've ever heard, he shows up to class late, is impossible to get ahold of outside of class, laughably straw mans students ideas and those of theorists he disagrees with, & creates a toxic environment.
very condescending sad little man. Has such a complex he needs to talk down to others to make himself feel important. Tries to act woke but is an entitled condescending chauvinist

Bad and annoying professor. Really smug and not very kind at all. Claims to be some sort of whole leftist figure but lacks empathy. Nasty dark sided man who thinks he is intellectually superior to Einstein. Avoid like the plague.

The class itself was interesting, but I didnt like the way that it was taught. Professor Venator is very opinionated and has very little tolerance for differing views. There was a lot of reading and writing but hes a relatively fair grader. The lectures didnt help me at all and they were painfully boring the TAs were my saving grace.

Lots of readings, but his lectures were very helpful to get a better understanding of the reading. Takes a long time to grade things, but grades fairly reasonably. Very hard to reach outside of class. No midterm and very easy final.

Took Law and Ideology. Very slow with grading. Well prepared for class and very knowledgeable. Writing assignments are not difficult and he allows you to submit drafts for early feedback. Content can be long and difficult but concepts are clear. No midterm and final was super easy. Glad I now have the knowledge he taught.
This has got to be the worst professor I've ever had for a general requirement class. If you do not agree with him on your paper, prepare yourself for a bad grade.

Dude loves this class, he just pushed his political views onto the class for the entire lecture, proceeds to not even read what you turn in and gives grades, easy class to get CA out of the way if you do, but please do not let him indoctrinate you, I actually agree with him on a lot of things, he refuses to acknowledge any other perspective at all

I really dislike Professor Venator. His grading was unfair and his class was based on his political views. I was completing assignments to agree with his views so I'd get better grades. He was really boring and it was a hard course for just a GenEd. His revision notes were always confusing and he was not very organized throughout the course.

Professor Venator knows what he is talking about. He's been involved with politics for most of his career and it shows. He assigns a considerable amount of reading/writing, but most of it takes less than an hour to complete. He seems to enjoy teaching/his students/the subject which is always a plus.

hard grader, you can get away with not doing the readings if you attend lectures and take good notes. Interesting lecturer but very hard to reach outside of class. Easy to talk to and pretty understanding.

He just posted lectures once a week and there was usually a journal response due for them (first 5 due mid of semester, second 5 at end). He never emailed about class/due dates so you have to stay on top of things, he assigned an essay over spring break and is very vague with his guidelines which isn't very cash money of him
Great teacher and a great class - highly recommend!

Charles Venator Santiago is a very intelligent man. He knows a lot about what he teaches and is fascinating to learn from. He is very politically biased and the lectures really reflect his personal views. He is hard to reach outside of class however it was an easy A. If you attend all lectures and take good notes you don't need to read.

I have taken two classes with Professor Venator and he is an amazing professor. He hold a lot of knowledge and although he may go on some tangents they are filled with information. He is very straightforward with assignments and explains exactly what he want's.
Awesome and funny. Very passionate about the subject matter. Very approachable and will work with you so you will understand the material. Sometimes hard to reach outside of class.

So I would like to start by saying that this was his first time teaching this class so at times it felt a little disorganized. But he is so passionate about the topics and I loved going to lecture because of this. There were kind of a lot of assignments but they were very simple/opinion based. He just really wants you to get involved

2.5 hours once a week class. No homework. Going to class is important in order to do well. Basically, he stands in front of the class and discusses the topics, does not call on anyone, but allows anyone to add to the discussion. So no pressure. Very responsive to questions. Great guy overall and very approachable. Loved the class. Totally recommend

His class was an easy A. Lectures were interesting and he's nice. Journals were easy (just do them and show some understanding of the readings). If you go to class you don't have to do the readings because he explains it all to you. Midterm and final were easy multiple choice. Santiago's picky about the writing assignments though so be careful.

I never thought I would say this about a professor, but this one is awful. He's a nice guy, but maybe teaching just isn't his thing. His grading policies are vague and poorly worded. The midterm and final consisted of 35 true/false questions. If you're a great test taker and a perfectly traditional writer, than maybe this professor is for you.

Understand now why he's so low. Have to follow his format for everything to the absolute letter or it will cost you big points. Class seems like a joke and he doesn't really care, but his grading is somehow incredibly difficult.

I don't understand how he's ranked so low... Seriously one of the easiest classes I've taken. Minimal work at all, but class can be pretty boring. Still, he's a really cool guy and stimulates really interesting discussions. It doesn't make any sense that his rating is so low. Unless missed something big, you have to try to fail with him

He is absolutely inaccessible via email at all times. He grades essays with the intent to fail you, and his comments are virtually impossible to read. He looks for every way possible to take off points. You can regurgitate the arguments he gives in class and somehow it will be wrong. Unless you write exactly what he wants to hear, he deducts points

The difficulty of exams wasn't reflective of the intensity of class discussion, study harder than it seems like you should! Incredibly nice, brilliant guy, very knowledgeable about the subject. Also very openly liberal, wouldn't suggest taking the class if you'll have any issue with that!

True, this prof is a hard grader, but all he wants his students to do is read, digest and then argue a point about the readings. Agreeing with him doesn't matter, just be able to engage in an educated debate, not sound bites heard on TV. Key to passing: be able to understand the main points of the assigned readings, period.

He is ridiculously hard. He doesn't have a text book, doesn't give notes... Just assigns 3 20-50 paged articles to read every week. Attendance is mandatory since there are pop quizzes. Midterm was 20 T/F Qs based on 20+ articles. Grades papers ridiculously hard and takes off maximum points for minimum errors. Not recommended at all.
He is ridiculous. I would give him zeros if I could. Exams too hard for class, doesn't go over readings. awful.

Test materials are not reflective of what he claims would be on the exam. Extremely opinionated. Class average on exam was a 62, he thinks,and he said that was a normal distribution. What a joke. Don't take his class, ever.

hard class to stomach if you are not a staunch liberal. his opinions are incorporated into his teachings which doesnt give you a well rounded learning experience. class is a little bit all over the place with class time purely devoted to students talking about their opinions, which doesn't really teach me anything.however, he is very knowledgeable
Very opinionated, don't try to disagree with him, it won't go well in your favor. Was not a difficult class but was tiresome as I disagreed with almost everything he said.

Terrible teacher. Ended the class with 105 average, but it was not without countless sleepless nights and a lot of hard work. I put more work into this class than any of my other ones, trying to please him since i did not agree with his views. To get an A, you need to put your view aside and mask his. Don't take if you are opinionated.

In class, it's kind of his way or the highway. Harsh grader, because unless you do EXACTLY what he wants and use a certain terminology, he deducts points. However, going to his office hours is a smart move. He's actually quite helpful if you talk over your paper with him. And I think everyone gets a better grade than they expect at end of semester.

A lot of students give him a bad reputation because he is a harsh grader. Indeed, he is. However, I received an A in his class because I did what he wanted. I agree, he is extremely difficult to reason with. The key though is to suck in your pride and to do exactly what he wants. As hard and manipulating as that sounds it will land you an A or A-.

basically, even if you try your hardest you wont do well. I went to every class and took notes, and did all the readings but still got D's on the papers. Its almost impossible to get an A on them. Dont take this class

you can either go to class and take notes or read the books, but you dont need to do both. I suggest you just go to class because all you need to do is write exactly what he wants to hear and youll do fine. however youll still need the book for citations. he is opinionated, arrogant and annoying, but write what he wants to hear and you have an a

Do not take this class I am only in it because I transferred in and it was the only one left open to fill a requirement. He is possibly the most boring man alive. Grades solely on papers and grades them hard. If your paper doesnt end up in the hands of the TA expect a failing grade. He is a joke
Average class, hes a pretty tough grader. make sure to start you essays early, and do not wait last minute, he can tell and he'll grade you accordingly. you have to try pretty hard to pull off an A

This guy is EXTREMELY arrogant. He asks for students opinions then will laugh to himself and almost try and "school you" with his knowledge like his opinions are superior. Grades only on papers so use MANY quotes. Its an overall easy class. Just grin and bare it for 16 weeks.

If you pay attention and take notes during class you dont really have to do the reading. Use a lot of quotes in essays and make sure you reread notes for exams - they are relatively easy especially if you study
The lectures are boring but the class is easy to pass. As long as you doing your essays (Use many qoutes)you should get an A. Show up for all lectures he gives extra credit on fridays.

Don't ever hand in a paper late. I missed the due date by 1 day and lost 4 points for the paper being late, AND another two points because I didn't ask for an extension. The paper was out of 20 points. And if it's late the Professor grades it not the TA's which makes a HUGE difference. That one paper tanked my final grade. I went from an A to a C+

Lecture was not fun, pretty much bored to death.. But if you did the readings, you did pretty well on the papers. Usually the TAs do all the grading, if you get a bad grade just go to his office and he'll change it for you if he thinks you deserve it (I went from a C to an A on one paper) All around, he's a good guy, and it's an easy GPA booster.

don't take this class! the class is graded purely on papers you have to write, and venator took 1 point off of a 20 point paper (5%) for not stapling 2 separate parts together! he just wants to fail his students

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU VALUE YOUR GPA AT ALL. The 200+ person class is literally a discussion between the same 5 people giving the same exact opinion every single class. Since there is no discussion section, grading is based solely on papers and journals, and Venator just looooves to fail his students. I know from experience.

I love this man he is a great professor. He used textbooks but I never looked at one and did fine. All exams are take home open note and there isn't any homework really. He is super engaging and nice definitely would take his class again

Very passionate about what he teaches, fun storyteller. Lots of reading assigned (and 2/3 sources aren't available online for free) but I only skimmed some articles during the exams and did just fine. Attendance not mandatory but he might post his slides on the later side (not very tech savvy).
Nick's the best

Professor Bellantoni is one of the best professors I've ever had. His class is graded on 33% average of two exams, 33% final, 33% discussion section (just showing up once a week!). One of the nicest professors with great stories. He came out of retirement last semester, and I've heard he may go back soon, easy A, don't pass on this class.

He is truly passionate about anthropology, and you can see it when he lectures. For someone not super interested in history, I loved his class and found it very engaging. One textbook and class content mirror each other, making the class fairly easy though it covers a lot of content. The exams were also online & open internet.

Great guy, he's funny and super passionate about the subject. He can get off topic pretty easily though. His exams are open note and online, and super easy. Assignments were also really easy, and the textbooks were word for word his lectures.

I'm so glad Prof. Bellantoni came out of retirement. This was my first class with him and he made Anthropology very interesting. Theres 3 required book but his lectures were almost exactly what is written in the textbook so I recommend reading the textbook before class so you can just make small notes. He's so funny and an amazing teacher.

Dr. Bellantoni is very passionate about what he teaches and lectures are very interesting. If you go to class, take notes on what he is saying (not just the slide material), and read the extra articles, you will do great. There's three tests, open-note, online, and the final is also in that format (not cumulative). 10/10 recommend!

Really really amazing professor. Take him if you can because I have heard that he could retire at any minute. He is so inspirational and yes the class is an easy A but you'll leave each lecture feeling so inspired. He genuinely cares about the subject and students. He also tells many interesting stories. One of the best professors for sure!

Best class I've taken at UConn, assignments are straight forward and fun and it is very easy to understand his syllabus and grading criteria (unlike many other professors). Dr. Bellantoni is THE BEST.

Dude is very passionate about anthropology. This was my favorite class of the semester. I highly recommend this class. The midterms are open note and not on lockdown browser. There was like 2 homework assignments in the whole course. 10/10 love Nick Bellantoni

Class was pretty easy. all the exams are open note and fairly easy. he posts the slides online, but adds more detail about the slides in lecture. very passionate about anthropology and shares a lot of his experiences and stories in the field in lectures.

Forget about Brady, this man is literally the goat. Bellantoni makes what at times can be dry material into amazing lectures. He has so much wisdom and imparts it on his students that I wish he were my life coach. Also tests are mad easy and getting an A is cake.
I love this man.

I love this guy. He made lecture super interesting and enjoyable, and he explained the material in depth. It's clear he knows what he's doing, and I'd recommend this class to anyone looking for a fun gen ed.

Dr. Bellantoni is clearly passionate about the subject of Anthropology and it is shown in his lectures. Many found his lectures to be very inspiring and on multiple occasions we clapped at the end of a lecture. The tests are not too hard as long as you study the powerpoints and reading materials.

A real gem. His stories made me laugh and some of them made me cry. He has a huge heart and is not only a anthropologist, but a humanitarian. He might retire soon sadly. I learned so many valuable things from this course. You have to work for your grade, but the topics are so interesting that it's not bad at all. Love love this class and this man.
this man is so caring, funny, and honestly an amazing professor. 10/10 always tells stories and makes lecture worth while.
Awesome

Everything in the lecture slides is hard to distinguish what's important and what isn't and he goes through slides too fast. Exams are full of what seemed to be irrelevant questions about the unimportant articles we had to read weekly and the class is too focused on pointless Native American stories and why some dude named Black Elk had visions
Professor Bellantoni makes all of lectures extremely interesting. The two midterms are very easy, and the paper you have to write is not too bad.

Amazing professor, made a pretty boring topic interesting for over 2 hours. Pretty easy class especially if you do the 5-point extra credit paper. Responded quickly to any emails I sent him and remembered me out of a class of 100+ students. Would definitely recommend.

Nick's a funny guy, and even though his lectures are long, he tries to make them funny and engaging, while teaching you at the same time. The tests are decently hard if you're aiming for an A, so don't take them as a joke. I got a B+ on my first 2 tests, but aced the final and ended with an A. Overall, he's a great teacher and actually cares!

He is so sweet and loves teaching! The only thing that sucks is the length of the class, it would be much better if it was a couple times a week instead of one night, he usually cuts it short though. This class is easy if you go to class and pay attention the entire time! He talks quickly but is passionate about everything! Read the articles!!

Oh boy are you in for a treat! Not only is Dr. Bellantoni an awesome professor, he's a real stand up guy. His charisma and his mustache will make you swoon and wish you weren't wearing any pants. If you're taking class with him, you better be ready for the time of your life!

Dr. Bellantoni is an amazing professor and I'm so glad I got to have him before his retirement. He is so passionate about his work as the state archaeologist and besides being very fast-paced, he makes the lectures interesting by incorporating lots of personal stories. Looking forward to taking another anthropology class because of him!

He's the coolest! I had absolutely no interest in anthropology; only took it to fill content areas. But his enthusiasm and charisma made me actually look forward to lectures. While I wouldn't want to pursue the subject further, now I get why people are interested. The tests do tend to be a bit trickier than you'd expect, though.

The professor is really good, but the assignments are insane!! They expect way too much for just an intro class! Don't take it if you are looking for an easy class/a class to fulfill your gen ed requirements! It's not worth itâ€¦it's also kind of boring.

As long as you pay attention in class or go over the slides he posted, getting decent grades is not hard. Very easy material. It's obvious that he really enjoys teaching and knows what he's talking about.

First few weeks of class were a bore, but after mid terms the lectures seemed to get more interesting. He tells his TA's to grade the exams harder than they should be graded. Would recommend this class. Would also recommend writing down every single detail you retain from lecture and reading on his exams
He is very easy to understand and follow, very "into" his subject. But exams were a little more challenging than anticipated but I still got an A-.
Interesting class. The professor had interesting lectures that were easy to understand. Make sure you do ALL the reading and take notes on EVERYTHING!
Great teacher! Really enthusiatic about the subject and always keeping the material interesting.

BELLANTONI! he was one of my favorite professors. he is super enthusiastic and VERH fair. He is clear in his expectations and wants his students to succeed, most professors don't care what so ever. i would do anything to take another one of his classes. GREAT GUY, GREAT CLASS!
Very good teacher, If you study the material the night before and know it very well, you will ace all of his tests. Would definetly take another one of his classes.

Great prof. He loves what he does, and he seems to really love teaching college students. He directs his lectures toward the age he teaches to and he presents very relatable material. There is a lot of reading but it's not terrible and most of it is covered in discussions

He's a great professor, and he loves the material he covers. His enthusiasm makes the class worth going to. The exams were pretty easy, as long as you skim through the articles from the textbook and go through all of his lecture slides that he posts online.

This class is pretty easy, except it requires A LOT OF READING from the textbooks for discussion. But going to the lectures isn't mandatory since he puts the powerpoints up online. If you put the time in, you'll do well though.
Bellantoni was awesome.. Tests were super easy and discussion wasn't bad either.
This class was awesome. Even though it is a large lecture he makes you feel like its a small class. His lectures are worth going to and the material is not hard. This is an easy A.
phenominal teacher. makes every lecture interesting, and a very fair grader.
He is an awesome professor. He's funny too. Definitely take this class. It's not hard and he makes it really interesting.
Very good teacher. I definitely recommend him if you are going to take an anthropology course!
great teacher. Very charismatic!
He makes the lectures fun and interesting. You learn a lot but you're not bored to death. Relates lectures to real life incidents and his own life. he's really cool.
No Comments
No Comments
He is very animated, makes class interesting. If you go to class it is an easy A
Was not easy to work with .

I can't speak for other classes but Paul does a good job with 3610W, maybe because it's not so lecture heavy. It's a smaller class with a discussion format. You do need to read a lot, but he grades pretty easy. If you go ask him about feedback he can clear things up (his handwriting is really bad). Overall nice guy, pretty fun class.

Professor Herrnson was a great professor. He does provide a lot of constructive critisim. However, he just wants to see you succeed. Work with him and he will work with you! He is easy to reach and is helpful during office hours.

I thought he did an overall good job. Prof. Herrnson didnt always have the most clear instructions, but he never asked anything unreasonable of me, and was always willing to talk things out with you when need be. work with him, and he will work with you

He is the most vague professor I have ever encountered. He's very unclear about what he expects from you in his assignments. I could never use his edits and notes in my paper revisions because I straight up couldn't read a word he wrote. He never made it clear when things were graded and when they weren't, leading to a great deal of confusion.

The key to success in his classes are to show up and try to participate. Honestly not difficult to get an A in his class if you do the assignments, he's not a tough grader, there is just a lot of homework. He can be a harsh critic, yet when it comes down to grading he's pretty generous. Just do the work and participate and you will get an A.

I took this course as a junior, but if I had taken it as a freshman it would have put me off of poli sci for the rest of my life. Herrnson makes everything way harder than it needs to be. The final exam is literally worth 60% of your grade. If you are reading this having signed up for this class, I am begging you, find another one. Save yourself!

Professor Herrnson is one of those professors you'll have in your life that will question why you're even in college. What could've been a fun and interesting topic changed dramatically into something that was tasteless and boring. Assigns stuff a day before due. He grades you on almost nothing, and your final is worth 60% of your grade. Literally.

He was very accomodating to the issues I had experienced and I appreciated that. Whenever he gave feedback it almost felt insulting the way he would talk to me. He made me feel like I didn't deserve to be at the university. Even though I was a freshman in a senior class. He's vague with his feedback and I can never understand his handwriting.
Wanted us to say the pledge of allegiance during class even though this is college and we didnt have a real flag, only a PowerPoint slide with a picture of the flag

Herrnson was pretty good with giving me accommodations as I was dealing with a heavy personal issue this semester. This class did not have many opportunities to raise my grade. only a couple of assignments and a final worth 45% of our grade. He is very vague and does not really teach. I don't recommend this to non poli sci majors.

Do yourself a favor and never take a class with this professor. If I could rate him a 0/5 I would. I am a senior and this is by far the worst professor I have had in my entire undergrad. Does not give any feedback, expects way too much out of students, changes around syllabus with no regard for students concerns, barely teaches. steer clear
Rarely lectures, unspecific directions, assigns arbitrary readings, does not respond to emails, seems like he does not want to be teaching

He rarely gives lectures, refuses to respond to student emails, assigns extremely long readings. His grading methods and feedback are inadequate, which makes it difficult to improve your grade in the class. He often gives out assignments a mere day or two before they are due. He made a concept that is incredibly interesting extremely dull.

Do not take him. He changes the syllabus on a whim, and gives late notification. He forces students to participate, and rarely lectures. His grades rely heavily on group presentations, which he is very unclear about the guidelines. Overall a terrible professor

He's so bad. He changes the syllabus to move papers due the next day. He fosters debate in class but then only lets people talk who don't talk. It's frustrating. He gives a ton of unnecessary reading. He's just bad. don't do it

Taking his class now, first day we were assigned a paper due 2 days from then based on the book. Recently, we did a group presentation and when some members of a group were sick, despite emailing him about it, he still made those groups. He then told the members that weren't to "grade them accordingly" on student grading. Worst professor I've had.

After reading all of these reviews, I was really concerned about Professor Herrnson. But I really don't see why he's rated so low. I could see how non-polisci majors could find his emphasis on the details and the pop quizzes annoying, but you'll be fine with a general knowledge of politics and government. I liked discussing current events as well!

Quizzes are ridiculously specific and hard, No lecture slides posted because he says if you don't show up then that's it. Exams are bubble exams, he treats his 1000 level class (introduction to American politics) as a much higher level. I would recommend finding a different class to fulfill your genEd

The worst ever professor in my life. Terrible and boring lecture, unclear directions and explanations about contents and exams. He doesn't seem to know how to communicate with students and even really doesn't know how to deliver the lecture itself. The department should not let him teach the class again. It will be another disaster for people.

Hard Grader. Unclear presentations. All he does it talk about things without reviewing them or going over them. If there is another teacher that teaches this class take it with them. Also, if you're a Republican, you are going to be singled out by the teacher.
SOOOOOOO boring class. This class is ridiculous demanding with ridiculously unclear directions.

If you are disciplined enough to do all of the reading (which is a lot for an intro course), you'll do just fine in Prof. Herrnson's class. Lecture is dry and unhelpful, but don't skip it -- there are pop quizzes on the readings. Your grade is based on the quizzes, an essay midterm, and a MC final (which also has questions about the readings).
terrible lecturer, doesn't use powerpoints or give handouts. not helpful at all. worst class I've ever taken, avoid at all costs

Paul seems like a nice enough guy however he is a god awful lecturer. He does not post his slides online and on top of that there is nothing written on them except a few key phrases. He tends to tangent and provides no study guide for the exams which make up 80% of your grade. All I can say to whoever has him is good luck, you're gonna need it.
He doesn't post stuff online and almost never writes anything on the board. I have trouble paying attention to him.

I hated this class, but Ill try to be objective as possible. Pros: curve, easy final, approachable prof. Cons: unnecessarily difficult pop quizzes (if you do poorly in the class, these will be why), impossible midterm (essay test), tons of reading, boring lectures that dont prepare you for exams, useless discussions, no study guides

Limited opportunities to do well in this class. The only things graded for this class are two exams, in class clicker questions (ridiculously hard), and participation. Lectures were very bad- goes through slides too fast and doesn't upload slides after. Much of what is covered on exams is nowhere to be found in lectures. Don't take this class.

The one thing I'll never forget about Prof. Herrnson is when he said, "you're not supposed to do well on the quizzes." By far the worst class I have ever taken and more difficult (for me) than CHEM1127 and MATH1131 combined. Keep in mind this was an INTRO LEVEL GEN ED unrelated to my major. Class is structured for failure. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!
Discussion is pointless. Herrnson is a pretty good lecturer though, but we could do without the clicker quizzes. Prepares students for upper level classes.

I love everything about American Politics, but Paul found a way to make me hate it. Maybe I just hate him. His pop-quizzes are nonsense, the midterm absurdly difficult, and half of the questions on the final didn't relate to the course EVEN MINIMALLY. Worst professor in the department, has no clue how to teach. No wonder he is a "college dropout".
Awful class. I didn't learn a thing. His study tip is to "just read the textbook" on a cumulative final. Lectures are useless. Pop quizzes at least once a week on SO MUCH reading

Paul Herrnson has lost all my respect as he refuses to send out study guides for the midterm and final. You have to read about 2 chapters a week as well as memorize extra articles for pop quizzes. He only grades on participation in discussion, pop quizzes, and the midterm and final. Hardest class I have taken here by far. DO NOT TAKE IT.

Paul Herrnson seems like a good guy, great heart, and has overcome alot. Saying that, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! Discussions mandatory but useless. Lectures are empty of content. Pop quizes on details on over 60 pages 2x a week. Midterm was an essay was curved 85-100 was an A. No study guide, tells you to memorize all of it. Final is MC. AVOID THIS.

Very heavily relies on lectures, which are very vague. Hundreds of pages of reading and vague pop quizzes that make up much of grade. Very little leeway on grading, based off of lectures that go all over the place

Not only could I not hear him half the time (and I sat toward the front) but he gave these very specific pop quizzes. I missed a couple classes and my grade suffered because I missed like two quizzes. Doesn't even give back quiz answers and no study guide for exams; which are also pretty hard. Don't even know how I would go about studying.
u have to participate but the proffesor is a really tough grader ! i took a writing class of his
