Do yourself a favor and take this class, it will change your life.
Very Interesting Lectures. Test are hard but your allowed a cheat sheet. Pay attention to the songs she plays in class lecture when you do go. Make sure to attend your decision
Great professor, very interesting lectures. You must read the book and do the papers to succeed.
She was really an awesome professor. Her lectures were always interesting, and the tests were fair. If you read the textbook, do the homework, and go to class, its impossible to do poorly.

She was an awesome professor, one of the best i've ever had. Not a class for those who skip often or don't read assignments. overall very involved class, and she clearly knows her stuff and makes it interesting. definately a reccomended professor.

Loved her, she's so sweet very approachable. Very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about history. Fun class. Her papers were tough and the questions were a bit confusing but the over all class was fun and easy. I recommend it.

This professor is absolutely useless. She does nothing fairly. She does not give clear directions on papers she has given and marks you off for going a page over the limit. Rudest professor I have ever had. I would suggest not taking this course or selecting another section.

Milvae was amazing as a prof during the pandemic. He really tried his best to create a level playing field for the tests with some people in/out of quarantine. His lectures can be a bit disorganized but he's always available for questions after class. He was always genuinely excited about the topic and tests were never about just memorizing.

By far the BEST professor I have had at UConn so far. Took Repro online. He recorded his lectures, and they were very detailed and exactly what you needed to know for the exams. Hilarious stories! Going to lecture is a must. The exams were very doable. The final was just 1 question, and he let us drop the lowest exam grade. 100% recommend!!

I would take any and every course this man teaches again if I could, just for fun! He is the BEST professor at UC! He knows how to TEACH, genuinely cares about your learning, and might be the best story teller I have ever met (and he features a lot of these stories in lecture!). Amazing lectures + very straightforward helpful reviews before exams.

It's been a little over 2 years, but I had to come back to say this. He's easily one of UConn's finest. He tells a lot of funny stories (that I still tell people about today), and he gave us all 95s for our final exam, just for showing up. Lab Animal is fantastic and one of the best lab experiences I've ever had. His class is absolutely golden.

Best professor I've had at UCONN. Truly cares about every student and wants everyone to learn and do well. Obtained a thorough understanding of repro - not simply memorizing facts for exams. Fun class even at 8 a.m.
Amazing guy. Extremely caring and involved, goes out of his way to talk to students before and after class and tells amazing stories. Very reasonable lectures and exams. Lab is very interesting.
Awesome professor. Tells hilarious stories in class and just wants you to learn and succeed. Gives lots of extra credit and is super open to answering questions. Lab is super fun and easy.

Best professor I've ever had. Honestly if this man taught Mandarin, I would take his class. He is just THAT great at speaking and generating interest in his topics and engaging with the whole class. I had him for lab animal science and repro and they were by far the best. The repro class is an 8am, and I was so excited to go to class every week!!!!

Took him for lab animals and repro. Amazing professor, one of the best I've ever had. Exams can be tricky, but are fair as he tells you what will be on them. Hilarious man and cares a lot about his students. Makes the material interesting and wants to make sure you learn things, not just memorize information. Expert in his field, knows how to teach

Dr. Milvae is hands down one of the greatest professors I've ever had, he keeps you entertained and his exams are relatively easy as long as you go to class and take good notes, tells you what you should study for the exam, also took lab animal with him super great would recommend to even none animal science majors

Milvae is super knowledgable and passionate about his field. He tells a lot of funny stories in class and even though it's 8am it's not bad. Exams are based off of lectures, you need to go to class because his powerpoints aren't great. Everything besides exams are an easy 100.

Great guy. Makes going to class and learning about this subject easier and sometimes actually pretty fun. His exams aren't easy but he's very fair with what he asks. But he genuinely wants everyone to do well, so he gives lots of opportunities to boost your grade if need be. I would even recommend this class to students who don't HAVE to take it.

Hands down the best teacher i've ever had. He is a smart guy and has accomplished a lot in his career and it really shows when he teaches. He genuinely cares about the wellbeing of every one of his students and even takes money out of his own pocket to do certain things that benefit the experience for the students taking the class. Also hilarious!
Great teacher. Best professor I ever had. Truly cares about every student.
One of my favorite professors. Loves to make risquÃ© jokes on the material. Go to class, you won't regret it. Tests are hard but fair - if you go to class and take notes, you'll be fine.

Dr.Milvae is the best professor ever!!!! This is the best class I've ever taken. He made repro interesting. He is a very kind person and really stimulates interest in the topic. Some portions aren't easy, but it was a really rewarding experience. You do not need to use the book, but it really helps little details. Page 122 is a life saver.
Dr. Milvae is a great professor who is passionate about his students and the subject matter. I learned a lot and thoroughly enjoyed having him as a professor.

Hands down the best professor I've had at UConn. He genuinely cares about his students in and outside of the classroom. He keeps lecture interesting and will show you random videos or tell stories so you don't get bored. Makes repro really interesting, too. Tells you exactly what will be on exams because he just wants everyone to get an A.

Dr. Milvae is the best! He is my all-time favorite professor, he is very funny and tells great stories but he also deeply cares for his students and wants everyone to learn. He tells you exactly what to study for his tests which aren't bad at all if you know that stuff and gives a lot of extra credit. He is a great guy,would take him again any day.

He is one of the best professors I have had at UConn. He covers difficult material and his tests are very challenging but he genuinely wants everyone to do well and offers a lot of bonuses and extra credit. I was surprised to find that an 8am class on reproduction has turned out to be my favorite class this semester!

Dr Milvae is by far the best professor I've ever had in college. He is one of the few teachers who actually cares about his students: the only professor to ever remember my name. He gives numerous extra credit opportunities and grades extremely leniently. He is extremely nice and is full of interesting stories. I completely recommend this class.

Great guy. The information isn't super easy, so it does require some studying...but Milvae basically tells you what will be on the exam the class before. Odds are if you're taking this class, you know he's a total boss...and he is.

The best man you will ever meet. He is hilarious and really cares about his students. Very enthusiastic, you can tell he loves what he teaches. Exams are fairly easy as long as you study and attend lecture.
One of the best professors, I enjoyed his class...His tests were extremely hard, but had lots of projects to make up for it...I would retake this class just for the stories...
Dr. Milvae is the best professor I have ever had. The exams can be hard but as long as you study you're fine. I learned more from Dr. Milvae than I have in any other class

Milvae is one of the best at UConn. He is very passionate about his work and his students. He is an awsome professor who isn't at all what you expect. very funny and light hearted. Exams and material can be tough but he's very helpful
Awesome professor. Stories are great, exams not too bad. Definitely recommend taking his classes.
Hilarious, smart, easy to listen to
Best teacher at UCONN - loves his students loves his subject and really cares about everything - easy A so worth it!

One of the best courses I've ever taken. He loves the subject, and more importantly, loves teaching, so the class is engaging and interesting. The tests are difficult, but study hard, and you'll be fine. I highly recommend this class!
Best Prof. you will ever have- he is funny, helpful and just a great guy. His exams, well you have to know stuff, but if you study then its not an issue. His stories are the best :)

FABULOUS professor; tells great stories, really cares, chose a wonderfully written and well organized textbook. Stresses important concepts over rote memorization. Just be sure to go to the pre-exam study sessions for an easier time with the exams. The studyguides are a big help, but a bit too broad. The sessions focus on key concepts. FUN class!
Lectures were not helpful. Take with another professor.
One of the worst chem professors avoid her at all costs I used rate my professor and that was a horrible idea. does not teach material that will help with exams and lab.

worst professor. I don't know why her reviews are so great when what she teaches is nothing like what you get on the exam, It'll help with the homework but not the exam. Would avoid her at all costs. The only reason why I'm passing is because I went to see other professors for help.
take any professor but her. lectures not very helpful and don't expect a review before exams. expect to fail if you don't attend SI
hated this class. she's just not the best with students. does not want to make time to help students succeed
not a very good at lecturing. be prepared to fall asleep.

this class was just not great, I felt no communication between her and the class. she was not available outside of the class! basically if you want to learn chem on your own and struggle through the semester then I recommend you take her 100%

Don't trust rate my professor always. it lead me almost failing. Her reaching style was not so great. Wasn't to involved with the students and very not understanding of students situations. Before exams don't expect her to do any sort of review or any help. Went to other professors lectures to help me pass the class.
took her class and attending only two lectures because her teaching style wasn't for me

Trusted rate my professor and failed this class with her. Caldwell is way better! she is no help outside of the classroom, gives you 5 minute breaks in lecture. and for hw she gives no help, she recommends going to the q-center for a simple question. for exams don't even get me started gives examples that is nothing like exam questions.

Literally chemistry for dummies and I loved it. I'm not good with science and chem was a difficult class but she keeps you engaged and reminded me of my mom lol. If you're taking 1127 take her shes the best.

Class and exams were easy, just practice the cengage and review her notes before exam. all the chem 1127 profs lecture material can be accessed through huskyct regardless of which professor u have. she is also very nice and engaging. final was significantly harder but i also didnt study because my grade was fine.

Dr. Q. was awesome. She wrote all her notes by hand on the projector which was best for me. She is very charismatic and is interested in what she teaches. She explains everything during lecture. From everyone I have heard from, she is best 1127 professor and I lucked out with her. Also, attend in-person lecture because she is entertaining.

Dr. Quardokus's style of teaching was great if you liked to follow along on problems step by step since she "writes out the problem" on the "board" with markers rather than going through a traditional powerpoint presentation. Seemed to be genuinely interested in what she's teaching and cares about her student's success. Not accessible out of class.
Best professor for Chemistry 1127 by far. She goes into an insane amount of detail and explains concepts very clearly. Disappointed shes not an option for 1128. Take her if you can.

I didn't have her as a prof but since the class was online, she also posted lectures for my course and she is the best! she is so sweet and understanding and really wants you to do well. She will also hint at what topics are going to be the exam and helps you prepare. Her lectures are clear and to the point!

Loved Dr. Q in Fall 2019, the way she lectures is very helpful and informative, not boring at all. She writes everything out so you understand it and even draws diagrams to show how formulas are used. Don't skip lecture (or at least watch it bc she posts the recordings on HuskyCT), you'll regret it if you try to learn only through the textbook

Out of all the chem professors for 1127Q Dr. Q is the absolute best. Learning chem from all online has been really difficult but Dr. Q is the only reason I am learning. She holds office hours and explains EVERYTHING in insane detail. All of her lectures are so clear and easy to follow compared to the other professors. She's the reason I passed chem

Dr. Quardokus writes all the notes on paper which is really helpful and easy to follow along. Definitely a hardworking professor and is willing to lecture every week even though she's not required to during the COVID-19 semester! Would definitely recommend to those who struggle at Chem a lot!

Amazing Professor would love to have her for all my chemistry classes. She really tries in lecture and makes sure everyone is ready for MOST exams. Had many exams in my opinion but out of all the 1127 professors she is by far the best one. Speaks loud and clear in lectures and writes out the problems with you which gives you time to write it down.

Dr. Q is great in Chem 1127Q. She asked for feedback and gave us many examples to better understand the materials. And review practice problems before every exam really helped. This course is not tough, but you need to spend time.

You can tell that Dr.Q really wants her students to do well in chemistry. In lecture she takes time to answer questions, handwrite all of the notes, post additional resources for studying and extra help, and all with some good humor and excellent drawings. She is also extremely accessible with office hours time to talk before and after class.
a real gem (and a great artist). hundo p recommend.

Very nice lady, not intimidating and willing to help if you go to her office hours. Shes very fast on the lectures and it's hard to keep up but she posts them online. I think the best thing to do is listen in lecture and not focus on only writing stuff down and then read the book before exams. The first exam is easy but the rest is very hard.
much better than some other 1127 professors. does fun demos. willing to answer questions during and after class. highly recommend taking dr. q

Dr. Q is the best! This was a grad level class, and she made the material really interesting and easy to learn. We play jeopardy to review for exams, which is really entertaining and also helps us review. She's always accessible outside of class and willing to answer questions. The homework assignments are helpful for exams. Take her class!!!!
she's the best 1127 teacher of the options, does in class examples which help for exams, also holds review sessions before exams

In reality, any STEM class is gonna b hard. U cant rely on getting a "good prof" for 1127, u gotta do alot outside of the classroom to get a good grade. Quardokus isn't so great tho. She often makes mistakes on her work and can be contradicting. Tbh didnt ever really go to lecture lol, if you get her as a prof jst go to a diff lecture time w/ CADY.

She's very nice and approachable. Responds to emails in a timely manner. Probably one of the best 1127Q professors this semester, as she can break down and explain concepts very clearly. Chem is rough; you definitely need to self-study in order to succeed. Also, go to her review sessions before exams. Very similar to exam questions.

Dr. Quardokus was hands-down my favorite professor this semester. She is extremely willing to answer any questions outside of class and is willing to schedule appointments if you can't make office hours! Also, she keeps PowerPoint use to a minimum. She uses DocCam a lot, which makes it WAY EASIER to follow along. All around, Dr. Q is a great person

She writes out examples on notes on a doc cam which is WAY better than trying to follow them on powerpoint. Did a cool explosions during lecture. She also draws pictures and tells jokes to make this class more interesting. definitely the best 1127 prof this semester. Go to office hours it helps.

Quardokus is a frustrating lecturer. She will write notes and examples up on a doc cam, and will leave them up barely long enough for you to write them down. Class moves quickly with very little time to catch your breath and not very clear explanation of topics. If another lecturer is available I would advise trying to switch.

She lacks enthusiasm for the material she teaches, focusing more on easing her own workload than genuinely educating the students. The quizzes (6 in total) and exams (1 midterm, 1 final) offer no extra credit, making it tough to boost your grade. Despite extensive studying, I barely scraped by on the midterm.

She is very passionate about the material she teaches and wants the students to learn and not be stressed out. There is substantial extra credit on the quizzes (6 in total) and exams (1 midterm, 1 final). I got 110% on the midterm without any extra studying, so they're not bad at all. Some of the readings can be a little bit long though.
Ruined my semester with this grade. Unclear with how the essays are graded and does not give help to students outside of class.
She deserves two bad ratings. It is a shame my beautiful university lets somebody like her teach their courses.
Never had a professor so stuck up and egotistical. It is impossible to get any help from her.
Rambles the whole class and does make instructions clear on assignments. Avoid if possible.

She is very passionate about what she teaches and the workload is fairly light. You watch a movie weekly, usually in class, and have a quiz for each module plus a midterm and final. The quizzes and exams are based on very specific things about the readings and movies. She prioritizes participation and sometimes takes attendance. But overall, easy.

Way too many writing assignments with very little grounds for what we were actually supposed to write about. Very vague feedback on essays and never seemed like she cared at all about what her students were writing about. Never taking her classes again.
Basura

She needs to improve their teaching style. Lectures lack a clear grading rubric and criteria that she can stick to, making it hard to understand the what students are supposed to complete on assignments. They seem disengaged and grading is unclear. More organization and engagement are needed for a better learning experience.

She seemed disengaged from the class, showing little enthusiasm for the subject matter, which made it challenging to stay motivated as a student. The grading system was somewhat arbitrary, with unclear criteria for assignments and exams, leading to frustration among students who were unsure of how their work was being evaluated.

She had some areas where improvement is needed in their teaching style. While their subject knowledge is evident, their communication and teaching methods left something to be desired. The lectures often lacked clarity and structure, making it difficult to follow along and grasp the material.

I am writing this review to express my utter disappointment with her teaching abilities and overall performance. In my experience as a student, I have encountered various educators who have inspired, motivated, and guided me towards success. Unfortunately, she falls far below the standard expected of an effective teacher.

Class was pretty easy, everything is open note when it comes to quizzes and exams. I personally got bored with the content but Professor Miller loves teaching and engaging with her students while lecturing/discussions. She is pretty laid back and as long as put some effort into the homeworks and complete the quizzes and exams you should get an A.

Absolutely loved her! Was so nice and understanding and you could tell that she loves what she does and what she teaches. Would take this course again. Few homework assignments that are graded for completion, the tests and quizzes are open note.

Pretty easy class all the quizzes and exams are open note and she posts the slideshows. The classes can be pretty boring as she talks A LOT but she definitly cares about her students and want to get to know each one. I took it with a friend and it wasn't that bad.
So Boring. and ALOT of reading. Otherwise thought it was easy I was just so bored.
You watch a movie in class once a week and then talk about it during the lecture period. Not bad, easy if you take it with a friend.

Don't have any complaints about Professor Miller. You can tell that she loves the curriculum she teaches and tries to get her students to feel the same. The 4 quizzes and 3 exams are open note and online and as long as you pay attention in class and do the homework assignments you will be fine. Also gives extra credit for early homework submission

Prof. Chiappetta-Miller is awesome! She is really understanding and tries to make the class as easy as possible for everyone. The module quizzes/midterm/final are very very easy as long as you watch the movies and do the readings. She is really engaging during discussion and facilitates great conversations. Overall, loved her and her class.

Her online class was really organized and had lectures and readings on there. The zoom lectures seemed redundant but they're mandatory. Overall, if you take notes on the readings and lectures you'll do fine.

You can tell she really loves teaching about Italy/Sicily and offers plenty of reading on it, which are usually optional. 5 exams in total and they're all online/open note. Her slides are usually summaries of the readings plus whatever topic, so just showing up and taking notes is enough.

Very kind and passionate professor. The workload was not heavy, and I actually learned a lot. Tests and quizzes are online and if you read the assigned reading and show up to the film screenings there is no way you cannot get an A. Super interesting material. I am even going to take more classes with her. Also, ILCS 1158 is a double dipper!

Extremely easy class. I always went, but if you can get the movies outside, do the readings, and look at the slides that should be fine. All exams are online, open book. Still, she makes it informative and interesting. She'll get very agitated if you're disrespectful and talk over her though, so don't, and you won't have any issues.

She is awesome. Nicest person going and makes her class super interesting. Class is pretty easy with a ton of online quizzes and exams so there's no question you should get an A. Only downside is there are a lot of readings but she gives you a heads up on the ones you need to do for quizzes. Definitely take a class with her.
Chiappetta-Miller is an amazing professor. She is SUPER passionate about her teaching. As long as you attend each class and pay attention the exams are fairly easy. They are online and open note.

She is an amazing teacher who is very passionate about the Italian history of Sicily. Her lectures are entertaining and as long as you pay attention in class and have the powerpoint slides available, you will do fine in the class. The readings are optional, but are really enjoyable if you have free time. Highly recommend this class.
She is really nice but the quizzes are difficult. The exams are also difficult. They are online so I recommend having a friend in the class so that you can bounce ideas off of one another.

Professor Chiappetta-Miller is a very nice woman, she really wants everyone to do well and as long as you take notes you should have no problem since all the exams are online. It's a pretty easy class

Hate studying? Take this class. The midterm and final are open book online. You do have to pay attention to the movies to know some questions. For each movie you write a very easy 1 page double-spaced paper. Lastly there is a 10 page paper at the end but she gives you a deadline for 2 pages than a later one for 5 pages so its never overwhelming.

90% of your grades come from online exams, which sounds easy, but are actually very difficult as they question very specific information from random readings and videos. Lectures are long and boring and the material was very dry. She does offer some extra credit, but the best option is to get assignments or quizes from previous years.

This class was an interesting topic, Sicily. But it was a lot of work; readings almost every night for class. Then the tests were online and hard to do. Even if you went to class and took good notes like i did, you still didn't do great on the exams. So study beforehand for the online exams, because they are 90% of your grade.

I loved Professor Minklers class! It can be a bit boring since he does assign long readings but every class is dedicated to going over them so it ends up being less work than it seems. He honestly cares about his students and wants you to be engaged. Participation does matter, he takes attendance faithfully everyday and this does effect your grade

Professor Minkler is great. He knows economics and is always relating everything to beer. Homework is difficult and time consuming but it helps in relation to understanding the material for the exams. He is always there to help and he is very witty. Would love to take one of his classes again.

You can tell Minkler is highly intelligent in the field of economics and really knows his stuff. Mid-term was 8 questions and the final was 15 questions and were both challenging. If you put in the time and really study you should be able to get a B or higher. Plus he gives a very generous curve for the class. Good professor, tough material.

The class was very challenging and this isn't his field of study. As a professor Minkler is pretty good, he wants you to understand the material but he sometimes falls short with his real life examples. There were 3 long homework assignments that you can't do the night before. His exams are fairly difficult but not too bad if you study. Go to class

This class is tough. He's an interesting guy but exams are hard with no room for error (only 8 questions), lectures are long and boring and not very helpful most of the time. Homeworks are time consuming and basically the only way to bring a grade up. While his curve is good (can get a D- with a 40) his class is tough and I wouldn't recommend.

If you go to class and take good notes you should get an easy A. The exams were open book open notes so without the notes you wouldn't do well. Also, prepare for reading assignments for every class and to be called on at random to ensure that you did your reading. He is a smart guy, fair grader, no quizzes only mid-term and final.

Lanse Minkler is a good professor. The class is early but you get credit for just showing up so that's an easy 20 percent. Exams are hard (all essays) and he grades pretty subjectively but there must be a pretty generous curve at the end because my 85 turned into an A-.

Dr Minkler is a great professor. He's extremely intelligent and very knowledgeable on economics. The class is tough and fast paced, but he is helpful and wants students to do well. If you like economics, take his class.
Went into the course expecting a challenge. He failed the majority of the class on the first exam, and the class average was low most of the semester. I wouldn't recommend this professor to anyone.
Worst Professor ever. Wont recommend anyone to take class with him. Definitely not a good teacher and his homework assignment are very hard.

Horrible teacher. Beer, pizza and mexican food make me sick now. He is boring, uses a cheap book (explains why it's horrible). The quizzes are ridiculously hard to make up for all of the cheating that goes on, so I guess it doesn't benefit you to be honest. Avoid this horrible professor at all costs.

I received zero credit on one of the two required papers for this class because he disagreed with my topic. Makes lots of reading assignments, each with a relating homework question. Makes you purchase 4 books for the class totaling about $200. Ended with a C+ after a ton of work. Avoid.

The structure of this class changed recently so TAs are no longer a factor - worst mistake UConn has EVER made. If you're an auditory learner and you can sponge everything he says up at obscene hours of the morning, go for it, but otherwise, opt out. This man made even beer a confusing topic for me.

Class was hard. 6 online quizzes worth 60% and one final worth 40%. You would think the quizzes were easy, but they're not...even with a book open and people helping. So unless you get 100% on all the quizzes, and decent on the final, it's hard to get an A. Mandatory for lecture..you'll get lost without. And read the book for sure.

Assumes you have taken Macro and refers to it all the time. Not clear with graphs. Talks to fast for you to write anything useful down. Provides no help on any assignment. Assignments are not available for reference after they're graded. Only way to see what you answered incorrectly is to go to office hours, so if you have a class you have no idea.

class was really boring, and he flew through the material. doesn't use powerpoints so you should go to lecture and discussion. book doesn't help much. he seemed nice and the curve saved me, but i'd recommend a different professor.
Tests were tough but he drops the lowest one. Lectures are boring but you should probably show up. The class come pre-curved so it isnt that hard to get a decend grade.

Don't worry, if you have any interest in economics, you will do fine. TA and discussion helps. He doesn't use powerpoint slides and you can't zone out in class or you'll miss something. He seems friendly in lecture not rude. Great curve!
I liked the class..it wasnt hard following the lecture unless you zone out a lot..discussion section helps too..curved grading method.overall recommended

Doesn't use slides, so I relied on Discussions which were the most helpful. I don't feel going to lectures was relatively beneficial, but I had a good TA. Minkler wasn't very approachable. If you're interested in subject, you'll do fine. AWESOME curve! And lowest dropped test grade.
Real hard to follow the lecture. Homework is not clearly explained in class. Real tough exams.
Good teacher and great guy. Knows his stuff and if you like the material you will love class. Get to use a page of notes on test and that can help a lot.

I had him for both principles of economics and microeconomics, and he has definitely improved his teaching skills. His lectures aren't bad, and he is very nice. If you yell something out in lecture like slow down, or reexplain - he will. Also his class has a huge curve, you fail if you get below a 40 - and one out of 3 tests are dropped

Great professor. Pay attention in class and take notes on everything he says and you will be fine. His tests are a little hard but as long as your prepared with the lecture notes you should be fine. Reading the book to help explain some of his lectures can also be helpful. Overall he is a very good professor and is great for an econ 112 class. Howe

Minkler is a nice guy, but rather lucklustre. Definately knows his stuff, but hes kind of boring. Doesn't move around or write enough on board or use slides enough. PAY ATTENTION IN CLASS or hell loose you.

Really tough class. Minkler's a nice guy and definitely knows what he's talking about. But his lectures are hard to follow; he doesn't really explain what he's doing. Overall, it's not a bad class but I wouldn't recommend it.

Guy knows what he's talking about, but his teaching style isnt ideal. Doesnt use slides at all except to demonstrate graphs, and if you zone out at all you will probably miss something importand which is bad because its very easy to zone out with him. Discussions are very key for this class. Overall, its not a bad class and hes not a bad professor.
Suprisingly hard class for a 101. Exams are very hard, trick questions killed my grade. Best thing about class is the small discussion, only time I actually learned anything. Boring lectures.
Good class, if u attend lecture ure fine

You can tell that he loves economics. The lectures are sometimes difficult to follow, and if you daydream for even a second, you might miss his entire point or subject. It keeps you interested for the most part.
excellent class good teacher
I had Layman last year and wish I had him again...I learned a lot more in his class.

I took this class in Fall '21 so my memory is foggy, but Layman is both a tough professor and a really great guy. Readings are difficult but you can probably skate by without actually doing them. Has high expectations for your writing but gives good feedback. Don't expect an easy A for low-quality writing.

The topics in this class were really cool. I liked looking at "love" from different perspectives and really feel like I learned a lot. I worked harder than I expected to and my writing improved more than I expected it to. Not an easy A, but if improving your writing is important to you, he's the 1007 prof to take.
Not an easy A. Lots of work, but lots of feedback. Take this class seriously and you'll be a better writer. I really liked the material, but I think it changes term to term?

I did not dislike Professor Layman, he is very smart and funny. His assignments were just brutal with tons of reading and unclear essays. He has specific grading criteria but I dont think you can feel it out until after turning in your first paper. I didn't love my time in his class or the very weird topics of love we covered.
My writing is much better after this course. I feel prepared for upper level classes now.
Switched professors for the course I originally had him for.

He was very smart however I felt like I was not able to connect to the content and felt like I was constantly lost. I felt like writing essays in this class went against everything I had previously in my life and that was very frustrating. I had to take this class however if I had an option to not take this class I wouldn't have.

Prof Layman is a nice and knowledgeable guy, but this is not your typical freshman intro-english course. Almost all of the readings were extremely dense and confusing, and the points he made about them made no sense. Do not take for an easy A - I had to work my butt off for this grade. Super confusing and time consuming. Material not clear at all.

Professor Layman is a good person, but many of the readings made no sense, and the points he made from those readings were very unclear and open-ended. His assignments are also very open-ended and when I asked for explanations, his answers were also open-ended or didn't make any sense.

The class was really hard and there was a lot of work. Like I get this guy reads a lot, but I felt like the assignments were a bit overkill for a freshmen English class. He did give really good feedback and seems to care a lot that we actually learned, so that was nice. Don't take for an easy A, it's not.
Great professor and class. I learned a lot

There is not much homework for this class besides a few papers and smaller discussions. He was really nice and honestly a decent grader. The only issue I had was that I could not really get ahold of him unless I went to office hours.

Take an early class with Tom! The people who don't care won't show up and you'll get to ask him questions and learn a lot. He knows so much, having a small class felt like a boutique lecture. You'll read and write a lot, but he gives really thoughtful feedback.

I had class early and not a lot of students actually came. I feel like those of us who did got a lot out of it, and those who didn't complained that the assignments were too hard or they didn't know what Tom wanted. He is one of the most compassionate profs I've had and really wanted us to learn. He's also weirdly smart, like on every topic.
Very caring and considerate professor, tried to engage students but was also good at reading the room. Gives good personalized feedback and is fair with grading.

He's a really hard graded, but he gives A LOT of feedback. I had to work really hard, but my grades got better through the term. There's a lot of reading, but there's a theme through the whole class. I thought it was interesting, and would rather read more and have it be interesting than less and have it be boring.

sept 19 '22 rating is accurate. this is a freshman level intro english course and he assigns the worst topics. also is a tough grader. he gives u feedback on papers but then still tells u u did bad on ur final draft even tho hes the one that said it was good or told u what u need corrected. maybe try someone else but you can get an A if you try

pretentious. class topics suck. he doesnt really give clear feedback or guidelines for most of the papers. he offered ec for one of the easier papers which was good. boring lectures. he doesnt really explain things well. assigned WAY too much reading. kind of a tough grader. didnt help in office hrs. below average i wouldnt take again.

three weeks into an intro english class and this guy sucks. the class sucks the readings suck and theyre confusing. literally who wants to read about plato, socrates, and eros for a whole semester in a FRESHMAN, INTRO LEVEL COURSE. avoid this class w him dont take it. we havent even had a paper graded yet but i already want to kms bc of this course
Hard grader, but clear feedback. Do the readings and don't try to write the papers the night before.
I wish he taught more classes! Super tough, but really good!

It took me half the semester to realize I had to actually work in this class....so I got a B, and that was probably generous. Once I started trying (putting time into papers, taking feedback, paying attention in class) I started doing a lot better and I think my writing improved a lot.

This was the hardest I've ever worked for an A-, but I learned SO much! Tom gives extensive feedback. He prepared an interesting and unique class. I feel like I got so much more out of this than my friends in the easy intro classes. If you're just looking for an easy A, I would try to avoid Tom, but if you want to be a better writer take him!

Confused about this instructor's grading criteria, I modified my draft paper by his requirement, but when I submit my final paper, he mark other problems with my paper. I don't understand why he gave us so difficult assignments, if you want your first two years of your university life to be happy, don't take his course.

Just a English PhD student with a MASSIVE ego. Grades a LEVEL 1 English class like he's grooming the next Virginia Woolfs and Mark Twains of this generation knowing these 1st year kids are trying their best. If you're not a perfect reflection of his gargantuan ego and impossible biased standards, you're not getting a decent grade.

Course material and assignment prompts could not have been more unclear. In addition to this, he his incredibly hypercritical and an inconsistent grader. Imagine having a 1500 word essay graded out of 15 points!? This is a BEGINNER class and the man expects his students to churn out PhD quality work. STAY AWAY! I think he's bitter and depressed :/

please do not take drama with him. The lectures are pointless, wastes 50 mins of my life talking about nonsense that doesn't even relate to the papers you will be writing. His papers are the only grade you get, and there are like no instructions. Even if you revise your paper and have him look at it ahead of time, he will still give you a bad grade

I guess it's related to philosophy. So it may be difficult for a non-native speaker. However, he gave me three re-submit chances for my paper. That's really kind. It's my only A- course because it's really difficult for me. You need to write four papers, the third one and the final one almost decide your final grade for the course.

He is a very inconsistent grader. Even if you revise your paper based on his comments for your draft, he will come up with new ways to justify a mediocre grade that was never even mentioned in the draft.

We spent constant classes discussing essays/books that were utterly irrelevant to the papers if we chose to focus on other sources. Hence, I feel like he didn't really spend enough time on discussing what a successful paper looks like, and decided to focus on class discussions that didn't add any value, especially because no one bought into it.

Tom definitely meant well, but he did not hold up as an instructor. There were never clear expectations for assignments, and honestly his 'conference sessions' before papers that were meant to get rid of any confusion left me befuddled every single time, as he would dismiss my ideas and suggest a much more difficult/confusing topic.

She is a VERY nice professor and has good communication, but she takes FOREVER to grade simple assignments, and she cancels class or turns it online ALL THE TIME For the final 4500-word paper, her suggestions made me question if she had even read my paper While I enjoyed Pappademos herself, I didn't enjoy the course or the disorganization she had
The 4,500-word paper at the end is so unnecessarily draining, do not take her.

Prof. Pappademos is an amazing person and is quite knowledgeable in Cuban history. The course is graded mostly on a paper (first+revised drafts). It also has readings that can boost your grade. The 1 thing that made this class more difficult than it should have been for me was that her HuskyCT wasn't organized, making it hard to find assignments

I hated taking this class, the professor is really unorganized and the homework she gives out is so hard for literally no reason. I took this class to learn something, but I left learning absolutely nothing.

No Quizzes or Exams but a lot of homework. The professor is a decent person who seems to care about students. She gives extensions on almost everything and doesn't expect essays on each homework. The only real downside is that this class is being taught in a building with no AC :( so you'll feel that for the first couple weeks.

The only upside about this class is that there are no tests/quizzes but just be ready to read. Each class there is a chapter of reading due along with six questions and half the times these questions do not help you understand the text further. She hardly ever responds to emails and is always changing the syllabus.Just stay on your toes.

The only real upside to this course is that there is no quizzes/tests. Other than that, she is possibly one of the toughest graders I've ever seen. She WILL NOT give you a 90 or above under any circumstances. You have a 15 page essay due at the end of the year and she will also grade tough on that as well.Expect to end this course with a B or lower
this woman is so unorganized and gives no guidance whatsoever. DO NOT TAKE HER

never had such an unorganized prof ever. Her grading scheme makes no sense at all, she'll take credit off of assignments and give no feedback at all. I thought I could deal with it but it will just drain you. don't take this course with her

please do not take this class with her.she is beyond unorganized. waits till after 10pm to put up submission links and rubrics the day its due. she is not responsive and when confronted about her mistakes, she makes stuff up that isn't in the rubric or syllabus and makes so many excuses. just save yourself the frustration and don't do it.

Professor Pappademos was one of the best teachers I have had. No exams or quizzes. About 8 open ended homework assignments and one pretty long paper that she gave us 2 months to do. I would definitely recommend her despite all the other reviews.

Has us write a 4,500 word paper- this is not a 'W' course. Doesn't answer emails. Does not give lectures. Asks us what we didn't like about other professors, and then proceeds to do exactly those things. Completely, absolutely, terribly, unorganized. Nice woman but this class is beyond stressful when it should really be interesting.
Zero organizational skills. Wouldnt take this class again even if someone paid me. If you take a class with her, good luck.

For a W credit, so much unnecessary work. Many of us have paper topics that are not related to material she assigns, which is an overabundance. No clear structure to the class, not sure when things are definitively due. Unclear about what to do to get an A. Arbitrarily docks points without clear feedback. One of the worst classes I've taken.

Shes one of the worst professors Ive ever had. Im in her online class right now and she has absolutely no structure to her class and rushes the final paper process. When she lectures theyre boring and monotone for the most part, and she calls on people when she feels like it. She cant tell anyone how to get an A in her class directly.

DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS. She's incredibly unorganized and half the time I didn't know what was going on in the class even though I went. Makes you read 30-90 pages between classes and write unnecessary papers. Doesn't respond to emails. Have to watch too many movies. Barely used books total waste of money. Gives the same useless lecture repeatedly.

Absolutely insane amount of reading. Syllabus kept changing. Assignments due online at *5pm not 12am or 11:59pm so plan accordingly. Grades are very slow to post and most emails will not get a response. She is very knowledgable but doesn't have much of a visual for lectures. Luckily for my class she didn't do quizzes, only lots of essays.

Once a due date is set, make sure it stays that way because a lot of the times it was changed and my classmates and I were unaware, making our assignments late. It stressed me out not knowing exactly what was due when. Overall, I felt this class was unorganized and stressful when it really did not need to be. There is a lot of writing and reading.

Definitely one of the worst classes I've taken. She's extremely unorganized and changed the syllabus at least 3 times throughout the semester. Lectures without powerpoints. Doesn't know how to use HuskyCT. Was rude a lot of the time. Unclear about assignments and exams. Annoying semester long group project. Content's not difficult, she's terrible

worst class ever taken. lecture notes based on her talking & putting vague words on the board, no powerpoint. HUGE group project assigned at beginning of the year due at the end with little instruction/guidance. quizzes on 20+ page long readings that only open 20 hrs before due & timed 8 mins. study sheets have topics not covered. can't use HuskyCT
Absolutely loved this class, such an amazing professor who is so passionate about her field. I learned so much from her
Professor Cruse is sweet and fun to talk to, and her class isn't too hard or easy. Just do your work and you'll ace the class.

Amazing teacher, always using examples and videos to make her concepts more understandable. It's apparent how passionate she is about her line of work, and that enthusiasm extends to her students. I wish we had more activities instead of a quiz once a week, but she gives lots of opportunities for extra credit.

sooo easy i love her shes so funny in lecture and her class is a great gen ed and easy A, she posts two videos each week with a 10 question quiz you have to take every friday, u get 2 attempts on these with the same questions both times, no reading at all and the content is super interesting her exam had exact questions from the quizzes! Take her!

Nicole is the best. Weekly quizzes that you get 2 attempts on. Spring 2020 I had her class at 8am, it was worth it. Smooth transition online bc covid. Very passionate about what she teaches & makes the class entertaining. 3"big" assignments, 1 being a paper she gives feedback on before submitting final draft. No exams! Take notes & you will pass

Professor Cruse is one of the best professors I've ever had. She's extremely organized and made online class easy to follow. There are 12 quizzes and she drops the lowest 2 scores, plus she offers a weekly bonus question for extra credit. There is also an extra credit paper. The midterm and final are open notes (but you have to attend lecture).

Every professor should be like professor Cruse, literally. I learned so much from this class and it was never a stress at all, I actually looked forward to the videos each week. She wants you to do well and gives you so many opportunities to do so. She is so open, transparent, funny, engaging and kind. She truly cares about everyone.

Really interesting class. Adapted class well to COVID. Every week theres a quiz and a bonus question based on the lectures that week, and you have two chances to take the quiz. The midterm and final were open book and easy.

Literally the best ever. I wish all of my professors were like her!! She handled this semester so well, even while having a baby during a pandemic!!! She's so funny and I always look forward to her lectures, they honestly feel like a break compared to my other classes. Grade is based on weekly quizzes and 2 exams, and she gives extra credit!!! <3
I LOVE Nicole!!! The BEST professor I've ever had at UConn. So sweet and kind, and very funny

She is the best!! Such a sweet woman, very understanding and fair and her class was by far my favorite this semester. Her lectures were so interesting & she is so funny and fun to listen to. Also her kids are the cutest! One of my favorite professors at UConn, absolutely take her class!!

Prof Cruse is so passionate about the material that she teaches which makes the online lectures pretty fun. That being said, I took the course online, and even though I was in a distance learning course, the teaching style is essentially asynchronous. The class is basically just taking notes on videos and then open note quizzes and exams. Easy A

I wasn't sure how an online class would go, especially with recorded lectures, but Professor Cruse has done a great job keeping the content interesting and easy to understand! She uses lots of videos as part of her lessons and wants everyone to succeed. She even made a mid-semester survey to find out how we're doing, which shows she really cares.

She is very sweet. easy easy class tbh. Her quizzes have two attempts each and same quizzes are given. Just weekly quizzes w a bonus question and one mid term and final. Her lectures are v long, but if u write them down all quizzes n exam are open note. Her two exams are times the rest no. V easy class. Would recommend everyone to take it for elec.

This was my favorite class so far that I have taken at UConn! Professor Cruse was such a caring, kind, and funny teacher, who made lectures very interesting. She doesn't post her notes which you need for the open book exams, so you have to go to class. Amazing class please take it!

She is one of the kindest professors at Uconn. I had her for an 8 am and I would actually wake up to go to class (i am NOT a morning person at all). Very genuine and transparent and WANTS you to succeed. If you take her class you will not regret it. She also has the cutest family she talks about all the time. I literally love her!!!!

If you're taking SLHS 1150 definitely take it with Professor Cruse, especially since it fulfills two content areas. You'll definitely have to attend class to take notes for the weekly quizzes, but if you aren't feeling well you can ask some of your classmates on the discussion board for them.
THE meanest PROFESSOR THAT I HAVE MET SO FAR especially on the grade of paper. if you don't like writing paper, don't take this course.
QUEEN. Best professor youll ever have. So funny and makes her lectures so enjoyable. Class is easy and very interesting. I love her. Shes the best. Point blank period. Uconn give her a raise thank u
This teacher is so mean!!!!!!!!!!Worst professor i've ever met.

I have no idea what was going on in this class. He would be in the middle of a problem and literally stop. And not finish it. You have to teach yourself with the online assignments. He mumbled so much and would literally start yelling if too many people were answering wrong.
Best class you will ever take at UConn
Awesome
Great curves and lectures.
One of the best professor at Uconn
Good Teacher, skilled and human
Ver y nice
Best Course ever
Best teacher ever. extremely easy exams. And if necessary, gives out ridiculous curves.
A must have professor. Easy class and you learn a lot. Extra credit is given.
Best teacher ever. This is a must have class with him. Big time extra credit and curves. Is willing to help the students in need.
Awesome teacher. really cares for students. Guranteed A if you pay even little bit attention.
only one word for the experience in class, AWESOME.
Very nice person. And even great teacher. Extremely recommended. Got an A
Very nice professor. Goes out of his way to help students. Curves grades if necessary. Very lineant grader. One of the beast teacher at uconn.
Great
Very excellent professor.very clear and thorough. He made calc seems like a piece of cake. If you are not planning on trying harder, just keep in mind that 60 is an A in this class.

Definitely one of the best math professors I've had through college. Homework and quizzes were all online through web assign and his exams were only 10 problems. If you needed extra time on an assignment, he'd give you the extra time. He was quite funny in class. He curved quite generously.

Did not explain anything too well and moved really fast through the material. Gave quizzes every week. I had to re-teach myself everything using the book after class and had to get a lot of help from friends as well. He is a nice guy but made a hard subject even harder.

One of the best professor I ever had. The best part about his class is the homework policy. It online and easy. It is a great grade boosters. He also gives lots of points in curve. It is an easy A in his class.He also has a great sense of humor.

professors.name: Donald Sheehy
professors.department: computer science and electrical engineering department

reviews.review: Of all 3 of my years at UConn Don is the best professor I have ever had. Many people don't like his class because it is difficult, but it is hard to find a student that doesn't hold him in the highest regard. He was an all-around great teacher and great guy. He is very funny, makes topics interesting, and reignited my passion for computer science.

Don was not the best, but this can be related to the content of the course. Data structures was bearable (a lot of live coding) but learning about run time got boring and confusing. However, you don't have to know the "why" for run times - just remember them Exams were semi hard His book was good for learning from if you miss class Decent curve

Sheehy is a really good guy. Probably one of the best cse professors. Really funny and he is also very clear in his instructions for the class and material. Homeworks were hard but never impossible and they really helped me learn a lot. I totally recommend him as a professor you wont regret it.

Don's a very good teacher. Funny and smart with high expectations. Going to lecture made concepts easier to understand. Homework's were definitely tough, but if you see him or the Engr tutoring center, it's very helpful. Going to labs would give an initial hint on how to do the homework. This class may make you contemplate your being a CSE major

Took 2050 with Don and was the best class I have taken in the CS department yet. Lectures were very informative and really made you think deeply about the topics which is important because they are crucial fundamentals of computer science. Lab was not required and not worth going to if you don't need help. Great professor and also pretty funny guy
Really enjoyed coming to lecture as I thought her was very funny, however the homework is generally difficult. Lab assignments aren't bad
Smart but not smart enough to know the material is new to students. Lectures like students know what he knows. Spend lots of time with TA's if you want to pass.
worst professor i have ever had. guy tried to teach and just didn't do anything beneficial. treated it like a 4000 level class when it was relatively close to an intro class
There's no doubt that he's extremely smart, but he lectures that way too which makes it hard for students who aren't as advanced to understand him. Homeworks are hard, so go to TA hours.

Honestly, this was probably the toughest course I've taken at UCONN. It's definitely a CSE weed-out. Make friends in the class, because the homework assignments are nearly impossible collaberation. The lectures are interesting, but theory-based. That being said, there is a huge curve at the end of the semester, so if you fail a test you'll be okay.

Sheehy's lectures are informative and his notes/example code (posted on HuskyCT) are useful, but his test questions can sometimes suck. All of the questions on the final were fair, but the midterms had some very obscure questions. He's always available to talk to and is a great guy.

Great professor with really interesting lectures. He always seems very enthusiastic and keeps the class involved throughout the class so it doesn't get boring. Obviously really cares about teaching and is very approachable if you need help.
Theory of comp is one of the better classes I took at UConn, Don knows his stuff and is always willing to help. Get ready to write proofs. If you read the book you'll be more than fine.
He is a very good programmer. He is not such a good teacher. Full of sarcasm. Avoid if you can.
Simply not very good at teaching but a great juggler. Learn to code on your own because you won't learn that in class. Lots of theory offered in lecture, but not much more.
Knows his stuff but can't teach it. Does not prepare you for his exams. Tons of tough assignments. Recommend you try another Professor if possible.
CSE2100 is a difficult class. That being said, Don teaches it in an accessible way, you just need to put the work in.

He gives two very hard programming assignments per week. Most can't finish the work before it is due. He is not very helpful. He tries to be funny. He does not tell you how the exams are or gives only a hint as to what to study. He has tons of code on the exams and expects you to write code by hand. He is a GPA killer.

Don is an awesome professor. Like most CSE professors, he's not just going to hand you an A but if you show up to lecture, read the online text and do the homework/lab assignments, you're bound to do well. His exams are really fair as long as you know the material and the homework's take forever but I've learned so much from him.

Don's class was incredibly hard but really worthwhile. It seems hard at first but in the end you are graded with respect to how the other students did and the curve is tremendous. All in all I would definitely recommend him. He is really enthusiastic and definitely has a ton of interest in the subject. Also, he is extremely smart yet relatable

Writes fast and sloppy in lectures, not entirely confident in the material that he is teaching. Tests are nothing like quizzes. Office hours do not help. A good thing is the amount of homework and follow-ups to help boost your grade. That doesn't work because quizzes and exams are hard. Doesn't curve. Use lots of outside resources to pass.

Mike kinda da goat fr, but if I had to say one thing he got no BS. U could prolly be two bites in to your lunchable pizza and my boi got the plans for the Great Wall of China rizzed up on the board. Mind U tho, prolly only about two people could actually read it, but nun-da-less he eat and sleep chemistry like Tony da Tiger wit Frosted Flakes.

I think Kienzler is a pretty good professor. His quizzes saved me, they were pretty fair quizzes. The exams are definitely what get you with the random ass questions he throws on there but I was still able to pass all of them. He gives an extra credit assignment and allows you the option to skip two quizzes which is nice. Personally, he Is good.

Orgo is very difficult, but Dr. Kienzler made it harder than it had to be. There was content on the exams that we've never seen before, and he does not curve. There are lots of office hours throughout the week, but even the TAs can't answer all of your questions. Lectures are pretty fast paced and it is hard to get all of the notes down.

I was scared coming into this class with him, but he is very passionate about chemistry and doesn't deserve the hate. Got good grades on the quizzes through lots of outside studying, TA office hours were very helpful, his office hours were good to know what to know for exams. Exams were very difficult though.

I would not take this professor again and if you could pick another one. Kienzler's exams and quizzes were blindsiding. Studying the entire week w/ outside material and reviewing the things he gives you is not enough bc it will be entirely more difficult- there'll be words you've never seen before. Not enough resources outside of office hours.

Professor stood directly in front of what he was writing on the board and wrote fast, be prepared to still be taking down notes on what he wrote 5 minutes ago while he switches topics. Exams not like the homework. Failed the course and retook it with Anwar Beshir in the summer and got an A.

I agree with past comments, especially about tests & quizzes. This class can be super frustrating, but for me the challenge got me to understand the material better. Take this class if you're able to support the challenge, but if you just need the credit, there are easier options. The subject is hard, but also doable. 350 character limit sucks.

The exams are the complete opposite of the homework and practice problems. It was kind of blindsiding when I took this class in the spring with him. I'm now taking this class in the summer because I had to withdraw. And it's easier to understand with another professor that can write clearly and takes their time to answer everyones questions.

Not the best lecturer, but he had good office hours and fair exams and homeworks. Couldn't ask for more from a teacher for such a difficult class. He also gave us two points of extra credit, which was very nice. Overall would recommend!
Dr. Kienzler is goated

While I respect him as a person, Kienzler wasn't a great professor to have for this class. I felt like way too much material was covered for just one class, and he went very quickly through some material during lectures. I'm retaking this class at community college and transferring the credit.

Real rating is probably ~3.5, but his score needs boosting. Dr. Kienzler is very understanding and is a pretty good lecturer. Lots of things count towards your final grade, including homework, adaptive quizzes (which are effectively effort graded), quizzes, and 3 tests + a final. Go to office hours if you are struggling, they are very helpful.

He is very good at explaining things and has great lectures. He deeply cares for his students and truly tries to make everything as easy as possible for them. It is simply a hard class, exams are rough.

Dr. Kienzler was by far the best chemistry professor I have had so far at UConn. Orgo is a difficult class, that being said, you need to work for a good grade. Exams were very fair and he gave extra credit opportunities. He was very accessible outside of class and office hours were especially helpful for me. Study hard and go to office hours!

My 5 rating is only to boost his overall rating. Real rating is probably 3.5. Long story short, class is hard and the professor provides a basic form of teaching. Nothing too outstanding but not horrible either. Tests question are fair with a few critical thinking questions not seen in homework mixed in, but still reasonable.

Orgo is a hard, visual class, and he always had models ready to show us to help. A lot of people are complaining that his tests werent directly hw problems, but if you really understood the answer to the homework/textbook you could pull a B on any test/quiz. He gave clear study guides and held office hours twice a week (very few people went).

One of the least accessible or caring professors I ever had. Im aware that orgo is a hard class, but he made it SO much harder than it needed to be. When the class was struggling and reached out to him about giving more practice, his response was basically study harder. The HW and quizzes dont help, his exams are so hard. DONT TAKE ORGO W HIM!

He was great at explaining visual topics and was very helpful during office hours. He had a lot to teach in a short amount of time, so you did need to read the textbook for better understanding of some concepts. His exams and quizzes were very fair and not too bad as long as you devoted time to actually study and understand the material.

Dr. Kienzler was not a great professor. His notes are difficult to follow, and what he says in lectures isn't always clear. The exams are hard, and the only good part about his grading breakdown is that the homework, adaptive quizzes, and in-class quizzes are weighted a lot and that makes a pretty significant difference in your final grade.

I honestly loved her class. Yes, it is easy to fall behind because there are reading assignments due every class, but, if you stay on top of homework, you will do well in the class. Lectures are more laid back and she is great with answering questions. Really listens to student's feedback on how the class should be structured. Would recommend.

Professor Hettinger is a rude professor. When asking her to clearly define concepts, she gets frustrated at your understanding and veers off course. She then tells you only to refer to the textbook as she wont take any time to help you clarify her teaching.

Wonderful mentor. Equally wonderful instructor. Clear grading criteria and lets you redo assignments to improve yourself. Ignore the bad ratings. If you are willing to put in the work necessary, you will find great success with Prof. Hettinger.

Professor Hettinger is one of the best professors I've had throughout college. She is very understanding and easy to communicate with if you're struggling. While her grading process is different, it becomes very easy to understand and keep up with the grade you desire. I'm taking two of her classes next semester. She's very passionate and fun.

her judiciary class is based around simulation activities and a few big projects/papers, there are no tests. Her style is super unique and it is a lot of work for those projects but the material is so interesting that you will feel prepared to do them. She is so passionate and kind, though her assignments can be a bit unclear she offers redoes.

Professor Hettinger is a very passive-aggressive professor so be aware. When asking her to clearly define concepts she is teaching she seems to get frustrated at your understanding. She then tells you only to refer to the textbook as she won't waste any time to help you clarify your issue. Her grading scale is unusual as it is not on thletter grade

She really enjoys teaching the class and talking about the topics. Quizzes every week but they aren't too bad. She is very nice and explains thing thoroughly and clearly. There are also retake opportunities. Would definitely take a class by her again!

She's an amazing professor, there's just a lot of content and you really need to read the assigned readings in order to do well. The material's interesting. Grade consists of three tests, online quizzes, and book club. I really recommend this class!

She is a wonderful professor who truly cares about her students. Her passion for what she teaches in inspiring and she is a very fair grader. Class discussion is encouraged and the 1st part of the semester is focused on a simulation activity. I definitely recommend this professor and course to anyone in need of a POLS course.

If you love case law, you'll love this class. I took it TU/THUR and had readings due every class with online reading quizzes most days. Midterm and final are both essay exams (closed book). Definitely something you have to study for. She occasionally does participation assignments unannounced in class, so don't skip. Overall it was a good class!

amazing professor. You have to actually work in her classes (shocker, I know) but it is so worth it. She is very knowledgable in her field, and a great mentor if you are looking for one. If you are unwilling to do challenging work, you should not take her class, and you should probably rethink the whole college thing??

Prof. H will help you & prepare you well for your honors thesis. But, this class can be difficult since it's very independent. Your grade revolves heavily around the semester-long project; pick a topic you like & know about. Readings give interesting insights, but you may not use all of them in the project. Work hard; diligence will be rewarded.

Professor Hettinger is very intelligent and articulate, but very demanding as well. Extremely harsh grader and very nit-picky. I aced the objective parts of her tests and did not do so well on the subjective parts. She wasn't very polite to me either whenever I went to talk to her. I question if she was always objective in grading.

Very intelligent and interesting professor. Go to class for the notes and because the time goes pretty quickly. If you take the time to do the large amounts of reading, you'll be fine. I learned a lot and would definitely take a class with her again
Nitpicky grader! She is very intelligent and articulate, but treated me with contempt every time I spoke to her. Expect to know your stuff borderline perfect or drop the class.

She was right when she said you need to do the reading, and probably half the class dropped after the first exam. If you're willing to put in the reading time, she knows the material really well and will make clear what you need to show on the exams. Online quizzes on the reading due for most classes.

I took 3822W with Professor Hettinger. The class was interesting and taught well, Prof Hettinger gave a lot of good feedback on essays and the midterm and final were very straight forward. She encouraged students to meet with her and maintained a good classroom environment. If you need a W, I would definitely recommend this class

Hettinger is a very good professor, but grades rather harshly; very strict about details. Excellent and well respected teacher, and will write you a letter of recommendation upon completion of a few of her classes, but you must work hard for an A.
Very rude teacher. Is incredibly bias in her teaching and is full of herself. Class was boring, tests were incredibly confusing. Incredibly rude when ask for help.
Rude, not helpful at all. I usually love all of my profs and something about Hettinger she thinks she is better than everyone else.

Mulkey is an interesting professor. His lectures are great, but he needs to elaborate on content as well as his lecturing skills. Course is applicable and learned alot. Should be 3 credits, not 2. Class is graded on 2 exams with some extra credit. Make sure to attend class, take great notes, and study. You have to put in the work for this class.

A really nice and knowledgeable guy. Class is only ten weeks, and is graded by two exams. However, even though the material is dense, as long as you pay attention to the lecture and go to the review you'll be all set. He is a nice grader and offers extra credit too. Definitely recommend the class!

Class is graded by 2 exams worth 50% each. Dr. M is a fair-easy graded but the material is challenging and his lectures were confusing. Often just going to lecture was not enough for understanding. Watch the recorded lectures and take good notes. Class was only 10 weeks long which was nice.

Dr. Mulkey is a great professor, he is extremely knowledgeable about he's teaching. PNB 3500 is one of the most interesting classes I've taken at UConn! You must attend lecture and take very good notes in order to do well in the class.

Professor Mulkey is an amazing professor, he is one of the smartest people you will ever meet! He actually cares about students learning and not just regurgitating things onto an exam that no one will remember. He gives you the most up to date info including recent studies and actually treats you like an intellectual!! Take this class!!

Professor Mulkey is a super smart guy. He is also a very nice and wants his students to do well/learn, he is not trying to hurt anyone's grade! He is a fast talker and sometimes his slides can be hard to follow. Overall I enjoyed this class and learned a lot. The exams are super fair and Mulkey tells you exactly what you need to know for the exams.

This was the first time the course was offered (Cardiorespiratory Physiology) and is was so disorganised! It would have been helpful to have a clearer outline of what we should have known. Also, the final exam was a complete mess. It was open book/internet, but he wasn't present and we could have taken it anywhere if we wanted to!

Dr. Mulkey was a disorganized nightmare! His slides are all over the place & he will constantly talk way ahead of where he is supposed to be &then when you get to the topic says we already covered it. He also talks extremely fast so recording lectures is a must! To top it all off his tests are the hardest I have taken at UCONN. God bless for Chen!

Dr. Mulkey is a very nice guy, but his lectures are disorganized and it's difficult to follow his logic. He gauges student understanding by clicker questions, but doesn't realize that the clicker question answers are in the notes. Overall, he really doesn't do a great job of focusing on difficult concepts, so you'll probably need the book.

He is an overall nice guy. He talks really fast, so that's why I recorded the lectures. I didn't touch the book. I studied everything on his slides and what I recorded. I took notes as we lectured, went back to listen to the recordings, added EVERYTHING he said onto my slides, and went to office hours. Material is tough, don't blame him.
Guy is terrible, really can't teach the subject,sorry to say. Very unclear, goes through slides way too quickly. no extra credit. Exams are harder than any exam i've taken.

Dr. Mulkey went so quickly through the material that I could hardly get half of it down. I am typically an A+ student in biology classes, but could hardly pass Mulkey's exams. Completely ruined my confidence and chances of getting into med school

He flies through lectures shouting out terms before we even have a chance to process what he has said. I dont learn anything from his lectures. Sometimes he will only read his slides, which have no information on them. I have to add to the notes from the textbook, or I wouldn't learn it. Worst professor I've had so far.
He's a nice guy, goes too fast through lecture though. Definitely go to his help hours and he will clarify for you. The first exam is a killer, but the second one is much easier.

Professor Mulkey is a really smart man but he's just not a good professor. He flies through his lecture's. His first exam is extremely difficult however his second exam is pretty easy. You pretty much have to attend lecture because he talks about a lot of information that are not mentioned on his slides. Probably the most difficult professor in PNB

Ugh Mulkey. He literally flies through lectures. He's very bland. I did fine in his half but I must say Exam 1 was extremely difficult. He makes it hard to concentrate and hold interest with all of the graphs. Overall I thought he was awful but tolerable if you buckle down and focus and accept him for what he is as a professor...
Brilliant lecturer.He'scise, and detailed.The exams aren't easy, but if you do the practice exams and memorize them, you'll get a good grade. Definitely the best of the PNB profs.

Best professor of A&P. Listen,this will prob be the hardest class of your undergrad.Key for success: record lecture, write out in notebook all the notes on the slides & write everything he says in addition. Reread those notes atleast twice before exam and your good. Trust me, only go back to slides for diagrams.I got an A, & didnt read the txtbook.

He gets a bad reputation because this class is hard. It's the enhanced version, and you're in college, so he's expecting that you perform at a collegiate level. There's a TON of info, he flies through lecture, so I'd suggest recording them. Ppts on HuskyCT. Textbook only supplemental. Study past material every week so that it doesn't get rusty

For those who study 2 nights before an exam, don't expect to do well. He is very content heavy with his materials, but this is ENHANCED pnb. For those who can't keep up with the work, should just drop out.
Literally one of the best human beings in the entire world. This man DEDICATES his life to helping those around him learn. One of a kind individual -- I really can't recommend him enough.
What a legend

Patrick really cares about his students. I often dropped by without an appointment and he would usually have time for me. If you put effort in to working through his class he will equally put effort in to helping you learn.

Gives very difficult homework which is not from the book, but gives helpful hints in class. He teaches very well and is very willing to help students outside of class. Very flexible with office hours and seeing students at other times. The homework really ensures you understand the material and how to apply it. He makes sure you learn a lot!

Excellent professor. I had him for honors calculus II and failed do to poor effort. Requested him for multivariable. He will take endless hours ensuring that you understand the material. He is very passionate and cares deeply about his students. Unfortunately his contract was up and UCONN chose not to rehire him next year, I am very disappointed.

Worst professor I have had in 4 years at UConn. Incredibly arrogant and degrading, treats students as if they write at a 2nd grade level. Way too cocky and immature to be a teacher at this institution. Heard he's getting fired by UConn, no surprise.

Pat was the best professor I've had here! Amazing at explaining concepts, teaches what it means to be a good student on top of mathematics. Funny, cares about students. The class is very hard and requires lots of work outside class. If you don't do recommended exercises you will suffer. If you struggle with calc 2, this class is not for you.

Pat is a very tough professor and a hard grader. That being said, he is also the best professor I've had at UConn. He makes even the most boring of material interesting, and makes sure you know the material. His homework and exams can be a little tough, but it's fair.
