Only take Pat if you're ready to put the effort in. It's worth it though.

Really can't give the best review for him. He's a smart person and is very knowledgeable when it comes to the topics he cover; that being said there are a number of hurdles that made me switch to a different professor. Homework problems and tests were exceedingly difficult and the lectures only covered principles and easy examples. Avoid if you can
Dragon is very hard. Curves at the end, but weekly homework is difficult. Weekly quiz is not too bad. Go to his office hours.

Very hard class. Make sure you go to q-center and office hours. Quizzes / Homework every week. Quizzes are okay, homework is very hard. He is very enthusiastic and if you need to know the material he will make sure you know it.

Pat is a very hard grader and his quizzes and exams are extremely difficult. But he is also the best professor I have had. If you take pat you will know everything on the syllabus and more by the end of the semester.

Worst teacher I've had at UConn. An impossible grader, thank god there's a curve...Treats you like crap if you don't understand what he's talking about and nobody ever understands what he's talking about
AVOID THIS GUY!! He's rude to everyone in class and arrogant. He may get what he's teaching but doesn't get it if you don't. Very hard grader, if a curve didn't exist most of the class would fail!!
The best teacher I've had at UConn. HIGHLY recommended.

Took for both linear algebra and multivar. He has high expectations of his students but you will learn A LOT. Attend every class and go to office hours for further understanding. Will not give you the answers during office hours but will make sure you have clear understanding. Exams are very hard but he reasonably curves the class. Excellent prof.

I have taken some very difficult classes in my college career. I did not think Multivariable Calc would rate high on the difficulty scale. Wrong. Pat is an unforgivably harsh grader, and while he is excellent at teaching and explaining concepts, the exams are far too difficult for a 2000-level class. Expects way too much. Avoid if you possibly can.

I took Pat's linear algebra class. He isn't easy, but he is the best teacher I have had at UConn, by far. He is a very smart guy with a passion for math, and more importantly, a passion for teaching. If you're looking for an interesting class, take Pat Dragon. If you're looking for an easy class, get over yourself and take Pat Dragon anyway.

Pat is a tough teacher, but a great one. Attend every class to ensure that you don't miss any material. He is extremely smart and explains the concepts very well. It is critical to utilize his office hours. He also curves grades based on the overall performance of each student. Strongly recommended for Math majors.

Where to start. THE worst "professor" I've had at UConn. He comes to class everyday looking horribly unprofessional and is immature - no shoes or socks, dreadlocks, graphic tees. On top of that, he's a jerk. Is rude to students looking for extra help, swears all class long, yells...treats students like high schoolers. How is he teaching? STAY AWAY!

Really funny guy who made learning chem effective and entertaining. He has a bit of an accent but it is very easy to understand what he is saying. Out of all the CHEM1127Q professors, he is the best one.

His lecture slides are the most important thing for taking this very hard class. All the practice problems he does in class are at the level of difficulty of what the tests will be. If you look over these practice problems which he posts and review the homework's before the tests you will get an A.

I hated Chem 1127. It was awful. But most people taking it are required to, so I would recommend taking it with Papadim. He is very smart, caring, and treats his students with respect. He is funny and has a Greek accent but it is not hard to understand. He can sometimes overestimate students background knowledge and jump into difficult topics.

Papadim is not the best option for 1127. His slides are just the textbook copy and pasted. If you want concepts explained and practice problems done that are similar to what you'll see on the test, go to Cady's lectures. For all 1127 professors lectures are recorded and attendance is not mandatory. SI is a lifesaver.

AMAZING guy however the exam I did best on was an exam that I watched the female professor for 1128 to learn the topics. Nothing against Dr.P, his teaching style was more like the students already knew what they were doing and he was reviewing, whereas the female prof really started from the beginning with each concept and walked you through it.

as a prof he's fine, it's the chem dept as a whole you need to watch out for. they don't teach you everything you need to know for the final and don't care that they don't. use the suggested textbook problems to study but beware that the textbook has some mistakes. i would recommend investing in chegg. good luck.

Papadim isn't the best lecturer- but if you want a MWF for 1128, go for him. He's truly a kind guy and funny asf, but he could be better man. The class wasn't hard for me and I did fine, but that doesn't necessarily mean he's a good teacher.

Papadim treats his students like his children and he wants you to succeed. 1128 has some tough topics to grasp, but it truly is not a hard class. Going to lectures won't be enough though, you'll have to re-teach yourself majority of the course for understanding. Papadim is also the only MWF section.

Dr. Papadim is a very caring and kind professor. I wouldn't say he is a hard professor, it is more the class that is really difficult. He doesn't give review sessions before an exam like Caldwell, but you can tell he really likes to teach Chemistry. The tests are really difficult but as long as you do the work and the homework you will be fine.

Dr. Papadim is a great professor. Chemistry is just a difficult subject. You can tell he loves teaching and if you fall behind you can always access the lecture notes and recorded videos. Very accessible outside of class. **for gen chem, the tests are made by the Chemistry Department head Dr. Cady and everyone takes it regardless of professor**

I love Papadim. He has a real passion for chemistry and you can feel yourself being more engaged during lectures because of it. 1128 is definitely more boring than 1127, but it still is essentially math puzzles and pretty fun if you get in the right mindset.
Professor mumbles, and gives extremely difficult tests.

The chem department at uconn is terrible but if you have to take chem, take Papadim. He is the most encouraging professor and genuinely wants his students to do well. He doesn't make the exams but lectures do relate to information that is on the tests.

I honestly didn't go to lectures for chem 1128Q. It's not that Dr.P is a bad professor, I just hate the Uconn chem department. The course load is hard and its not taught well. I don't like chemistry but if you were to choose a professor for chem 1128Q, choose Dr.P. His accent is thick which makes it kind of difficult to understand but he's solid.

If you need to choose a Chem 1128 professor, I'd probably recommend Papadim. His slides are straightforward with some good example problems. He does have an accent that can be hard to understand at times, so beware of that. He seems to care about the students a lot, and he knows the class is really hard. Really tries his best to help. Not bad!

Dr. Papadim is great. His lectures can be a bit dull, but he is a great guy, and has some valuable learning strategies. Ask him questions! Chem department has some very structured guidelines, and so it's easy to know what you have to do, but the work is tough and you need to put time in almost every day to get results.

Dr. Papadim is one of the best chemistry professors I've had. He cares about his students and keeps the material engaging by throwing in jokes. Difficult class but he does a great job explaining. I recommend doing a lot of practice problems and attending the SI sessions to keep up. The material can be hard, but definitely take it with Papadim.

Papadim is a very genuinely nice guy. You can tell he loves what he's doing and cares about our success, however he just doesn't have the best lecture material. You would do better in the class if you skipped lecture and watched another professors lecture videos instead. The tests are very hard so prepare to work hard.

Papadim is a great guy, he clearly wants all of his students to do very well and tries to help as much as he can. The tests are just ridiculous and none of the professors are on the same page. If you're not good at chem avoid this class at all costs and take it a community college over the summer.

Papadim. Loved him like a father. he always connects the chemistry to real life situations. He loves to explain the meaning of life which is nice and he can throw a few jokes in there as well. He says you have to study a lot and he's not wrong. Definitely suggest taking him. he's a great guy
She makes 1007 a lot worse. She's rude to students when they don't understand her weird assignments and makes everyone do pointless busywork that I didn't learn anything from.
The content she teaches is not useful at all. It is pretty much a high school class. While that is not entirely her fault, she is extremely condescending and rude to the students.

What a weird experience. The work was super easy, assignments didn't take much time. She expects you to buy a textbook and read it but never does anything to check if you do that. Can be very rude to students. Saw a student ask to leave 10 minutes early (2hr class) so they could get to their next class on time and she made a face and said no.

Bronwyn is quite possibly the worst instructor I have ever had since attending the University of Connecticut. She attempts to cover her lack of knowledge surrounding her class with pointless assignments. Bronwyn deserves to be teaching in the elementary school setting, if anything.
A lot of homework every week, so many writing, when you asking something about the homework, she couldn't explain to you clearly, which makes you more confusing..... don't take this class with her.

she doesn't even care any a bit of her student, a lot of homework, and writing. i don't even know why the school required to take this course, it's wasting of all of the students time, i think university should consider to drop this requirement for all of the student. do not take english with her, waste of your life!!!!
Useless course, useless professor, wasting your time to take this sarcastic class.

She didn't really know how to teach clearly, things she taught were useless and a waste of time. I feel like she doesn't care about her students. I really don't know why she was given the job of teaching English. Didn't learn anything useful in this class. If she doesn't like you she will just ignore you. Avoid her.

This class is pretty easy so far but the work seems very pointless not beneficial. She can be really rude in class and talks over students when they are answering a question. Honestly, the work done in the class is equivalent to a middle school level. My freshman year English class in hs was more difficult than this.
Definitely need to be very attentive in class, expects everyone to enjoy English as much as she does

Professor Diperi can be very sarcastic towards her students. The class is dragged out way too much. It' s a 2 hour lesson that could be completed in less than 15 mins while gaining the same knowledge. There is an abundance of redundant and 'busy' work both in the class and in homework. I genuinely have not found any benefit from this class

wouldn't ever advice anyone takes her class. We are going to be learning about places and spaces for the whole semester and every assignment she has us do is a waste of time and takes way to long. She will also make it obvious if she doesn't like you and is horrible at answering questions she just talks in circles. DONT TAKE

It is never clear on what she wants done on the assignment for English Studio. She would claim that she was flexible on what your project can be on, but she ends up telling you what she wants you to do instead. The English studio is way too long and very boring. You never really get the feeling that you're learning anything useful.

I had her for the studio section of my class and she is very nice and sweet. She has a clearly planned out class and explains assignments perfectly. If you dont get the assignment right she gives feedback and allows you to resubmit for full marks. Her class was simple and easy I r recommend !
I think the professor is really nice. While the portfolio is somewhat of a pain to get by, it shouldn't be as hard if you follow the guidelines and the online quizzes are very easy.

Professor Diperi provides a lot of work for this course. I understood that this course was a four-credit course and that it was mostly out of her hands when it came to the class, however with this in mind she still did not make the class any easier for us. Get ready for lots of reading and busy work if you do take this class.

Although Prof Diperi seems nice and kind when you first meet her I wouldn't get your hopes up. If she doesn't like your group its a constant bombardment of her saying your opinion is wrong about opinionated questions. She is terrible at responding to emails, a skill you would think an English teacher would excel in. The work is painfully boring.

Truthfully, I didn't learn anything in this class. The material is about fairy tales, and the class is not interesting. Professor B is very critical about your work and will edit it negatively during the conferences you have during the projects of the semester. Although it was an easy A (if you do your work) this class is not worth your time.

This professor absolutely ruins all english classes for me. Her focus on fairy tales really makes the class dull. If I could have any other english professor I would gladly choose them over her. When you sit in her class you feel your eyes slowly closing because she is so boring and tiresome without giving any enjoyment to english as a subject.

This class is about fairy tales. She assigns long readings that you have to write an essay about. Sometimes there are two essays a week. There is so much reading and writing in her class compared to other english teachers. The subject is boring and she grades pretty hard. I would not recommend her. Take english with another professor.

Dr. Barshay is the best! Weekly homeworks and weekly quizzes but they are very easy to get 100s on. Definitely would take it again. The lab was very easy and you were given all the formulas that you need.

Barshay is amazing. Very caring and funny. He truly wants you to succeed, and caters to your needs. Going to lectures is preferred, but if you miss a day he always posts his lectures. Class is graded on weekly quizzes, dropped lowest 3, lab, homework and the final. Very fair grading. Has a grade plan if you have higher final or quiz average.

Great chem teacher. If you miss a class he always posts the recorded lectures so you won't fall behind. Talks a little slow but it's nothing that can't be fixed by playing it in 2x speed. Very thorough at teaching topics, always helps if he sees a wrong answer on a quiz, will let you take it back.

Nice and funny guy, I liked him although I heard that other people didn't. Lectures were useful, but I think they were recorded and posted (taken fall 2019) which was rare at the time. Really wanted students to learn. Lots of exams and hw, but it's all so you can maximize your grade

This Professor helps you understand chemistry a lot more. Definitely go to his office hours if you are struggling and the homework helps you understand what is going to be on the quizzes. Great Professor!!

Really nice guy and easy going (willing to extend hw due dates if you ask). He knows his stuff and is always willing to answer your questions throughly in lecture. He's passionate about teaching and very accessible. CHEM1127 is hard for a lot of people regardless of professor, so take the negative reviews with a grain of salt.
Great Guy, best 1 credit class Ive taken

This was easily the hardest class I've ever had. You need to stay on top of this class. However, Dr. Barshay is a great guy and a great lecturer, and I would 100% recommend him. He tries to make the material a little easier to understand, and his lectures are very easy to follow. He's very accessible outside of class. I wouldn't take anybody else.

Dr. Barshay is a great guy. TAKE HIM FOR GEN CHEM. He cares about his students, and tries to help out a lot. Go to his office hours. He's a great orator, and his deliveries are the best. He spends a lot of time on his slides, and always gets his point across and teaches you the material. You need to pay attention in lecture, and read the book.

Barshay tries his best and his demenor/effort was the only thing that kept me going. He makes himself available as much as possible, and his slides are amazing cheat sheets to study from. Goes slightly off topic, but I usually didn't mind. You get the same tests/labs as any other CHEM class, why not go with the lecturer that really cares about you?
His teaching style was terrible, he would get off topic frequently and his examples would leave me very confused. His class made my grade drop from learning it on my own.

Dr. Barshay is a great professor. He posts his slides and prints copies out for every student at lecture. His notes are super helpful/full of examples, but a little repetitive. Only complaint is that sometimes he goes through topics too slowly but overall a great professor and an easy class. He allows 4 late OWL/prelabs too. 1127 lab is also easy.
Lectures are very helpful, he hands out note packets.

Professor Barshay was a nice guy, however he was not a great teacher. He explained things in a confusing manner, and sometimes seemed confused by what he was explaining. However he does post videos of lecture online which is helpful.

Dr. Barshay was a hilarious professor. I took him for CHEM 1127, and he would get me to laugh every time I showed up to lecture. My buddy and I visited during his office hours during finals week, and he helped us through the SI review, he constantly checked up on us and wished us good luck before we left. He's like the grandpa I never had.
Personable, kind, MIT grad that goes out of his way to make the class easier for his students.

Dr. Barshay is a very nice man who's really passionate about chemistry & wants to see students succeed. You won't learn all you need to know from his lectures but that's the case with all chem professors. Read/learn from the book, do hw, & do decent in lab & you should be fine. While it may require some self teaching at least he's nice & helpful

CHEM at UConn is known to be dismal, but Dr. Barshay tries his best to make the class understandable, and enjoyable. He is very willing to accommodate to your schedule, and understands that we are students with other classes. I am a horrible test taker, and they are manageable!! There are weekly quizzes, ALEKS, an lab which all bring your grade up.

While Dr. Barshay is a super nice dude, he is a horrible professor. He spends way too much time sweating the small stuff in lecture, so you have to get down to learning material on your own. The entire CHEM1127 course just blows, you can only rely on the QCenter in the library when you desperately need help because all the professors/TAs suck.

Dr. Barshay genuinely cares about his students and loves his job. He has a great personality and love for the subject, however he often gets somewhat off topic and focuses too much on easy topics during lecture. This class was mostly self taught for me.

He's a very nice guy and teaches as a choice. He's brilliant so I feel like the chem he's teaching is way below his level so sometimes he can forget how to do the super easy stuff. Overall, I learned a lot and recommend you take the class. Pay attention in lecture for hints on exams because they're difficult. This class definitely isn't a joke

It doesn't matter too much which professor you take for 1128, they all give the exact same tests and Aleks homework. Barshay is a nice guy and enthusiastic but in my opinion Dr. Cady is a better teacher. Barshay is really flexible with Aleks and prelab deadlines though so that's a plus. Aleks homework is a pain, the tests are difficult, go to SI!!!

Barshay is good if you've never taken chem. He's super slow across almost all subjects, so he kinda drags compared to the other chem teachers. ALEKs is a majority of the HW. Do the problems at end of chapters tbh. He had a really weird method for balancing acid-base reactions, it's best to learn from another chem teacher/friend in another class.

Barshay is a great person. I found out after first lecture however that he was extremely slow in lecture, and would spend so much time on insignificant details that the other sections would have passed us. Bottom line is if you take 1127 with Barshay don't go to lecture, its a waste of time, just make sure you do Aleks and problem sets, not hard

Doctor Barshay is a good person. Great personality and often warns you about what will be on the tests. However, I do agree that the examples given during class are way simpler than the ones tested on. He is quite flexible when it comes to deadlines, especially Aleks.

Lecture was usually not worth going to - but I took honors chem in high school. Barshay is a great guy and he knows his stuff, but he moves very, very slowly. My advice is to actually do the ALEKS, yeah it sucks, but don't complain about it, it's how you learn the math - practice problems in lecture are far easier than the exams.

Such a nice guy. One of my favorite professors. Moves slowly, but I found the pace very helpful. I always understood the concepts. You don't really have to go to lecture because the slides are online, but he tells cool stories sometimes. Recommend using Cady's slides to study for exams along side Barshay's slides.

Barshay is a really nice guy, and doesn't want to leave anyone behind. Unfortunately, the rest of the department gets way ahead of him. You have to learn most of the stuff on your own (ALEKS will save you in the end). Barshay gives easy problems in class, and the test is way harder. Lab helps your grade in the end though

He was a nice guy and knew what he was talking about but his class went by so slow. If I didn't take AP Chem in high school I surely would've gotten an C in the class by attending lecture and studying. You could skip lecture because we would review for half of the time then go on to the next chapter the other class already passed
Great man, made learning easy. He printed out his powerpoints before lecture which was helpful. He's also an understanding professor so don't hesitate to ask him for extensions on ALEKS
Easy Lectures; lecture slides are printed for you

One thing you'll learn early on is that lecture is pointless. The problem sets are a waste of time, but I found the worksheets given in discussion very helpful. Read the book and take notes, do ALEKS, do the worksheets, and go to some review sessions and you'll do fine. People who say this class is difficult probably should have started with 1124.

There's only 3 exams and a discussion section. The discussion section requires 3 papers, but each is only 2-3 pages long and are very loosely structured. The textbook is interactive and very helpful. Lectures aren't mandatory as long as you study outside of class and on your own.
Prof leach is pretty awesome. Great lectures, you don't really have to go but it'll help studying for exams. Only 3 short informal papers throughout the semester overall a great class

He gives you the lecture slides, but lectures are pretty important to attend. There's no homework, just discussion and exam grades. Definitely study! He always takes a few questions from the book so it's worth reading. His lectures are very informative.

Lectures were dull. Basically just reads from the power point. The online book and practice exams have material not covered in the power point sometimes. Says tests are easy, but I would say they are average. Some questions are tricky.

He was a great prof but I was slightly boarded by the material since I had already learned most of it from other classes. I brought the online textbook and I absolutely loved it! He customizes it for his class. It comes with flashcards of what we need to know as well.

Prof. leach has a voice that will put you to sleep. Just study the powerpoints for the exams-and read everything in the footnotes-and you should be fine for the tests. 3 tests total, non cumulative. You can get up to 7 points added to your lowest exam score by doing additional psych experiments (highly recommend)

He is clear the first exam definitely sucks but everyone after is easier. You definitely have to study for his exam however you can definitely get at least a B in this class as long as you work hard. His exams can be worded weird, I enjoyed his class, he wants you yo succeed you just have to work for it. He doesn't just hand out A's

The class is not too bad if you study well. I would say lectures aren't mandatory, but they are interesting and help you to remember material. Definitely read the book & take notes on PPTs & look at power point notes BELOW the actual slide, it'll help A LOT. Go to discussion, its easy assignments and fun discussions with classmates.

You can tell he puts a lot of effort into preparing for this class, he's a really smart guy and very clear if you go to class. Powerpoint slides don't always make sense, but I read the book for any classes I missed and did well on exams.

Class wasn't extremely difficult, never went to lecture. Please go to discussions and do the assignments if you have them, its a free A that's 25% of your overall grade. Exams weren't really hard but I kept getting Bs-B+ on them studying just power-point. The book increases your chances of getting an A. In conclusion I would recommend this class.

Highly recommended class to take. Easy A. U don't have to go to lectures to pass his exams PLUS, he post all his slides online. I rarely went to lectures after the 1st exam, and still got an A on the exams. No trick questions. Exams are very straightforward & 10x easier than Lundquist's exams

Did not particularly enjoy this class. You don't have to show up to class as long as you study the lecture slides he posts online before the exam. He does not offer support, tends to be very combative with students asking for clarification in class. The first practice exam online was helpful and the other two were not.

Great professor. You can tell he enjoys teaching, and does his best to include interesting studies and make jokes to keep you interested. He's very helpful, and always stops to double check that he isn't going too fast and that everyone understands the material. He has very reasonable expectations of what we can handle, and gives tips before exams

Great professor. As a psyc major, I really looked forward to this class. He explains everything clearly. I only used the book at the beginning and then I just used the lectures for the exams. If you pay attention and go to class, A is not difficult to get.

The textbook is actually pretty interesting and if you study this and the power points you do not need to attend lecture. The lectures are slow paced and are common sense. Dr. Leach doesn't show much enthusiasm either so that can make class drag on at times. I got the impression he didn't take the class seriously, so why should we? Exams are easy.

I don't know how it's possible to think this class is hard. Like, if you need extra help, there is something wrong with your brain. Leach is very friendly, I almost felt bad the few times I skipped class. I hate multiple choice exams, which is all you have, but there's 70+ questions so at WORST you shouldn't get less than an 80. I'd recommend him.

I really enjoyed this class I thought Professor Leach was a great Teacher. It's easy enough to do well in this class as long as you study and pay attention in Lecture. I think most people will find the content much more interesting than 1100

Dr. Leach is a great lecturer. Awesome. He's completely intolerant of phone and non-class-related Internet use during class. He will call you out. He makes the material interesting. Exams are very easy if you've been to lecture and paid attention. Writing assignments in discussion are short and so easy.

Leach is a pretty good prof. He's willing to help students out and he always answers questions in class if people ask. The tests have 75 questions, so you can still do well if you get several wrong. However, the lectures are kind of boring because they're no different from reading the book. Easy class overall.

dont need to go to class, its not a boring class, but id rather be sleeping than be in class. notes are online.i never went to class, memorized notes before exam and skimmed the designatd chapters in the textbook before the exam and got an A in the class. exam is veryyy straight forward, but you have to know the material. basic memorization.

Leach is a good teacher. He's clear when he reads the powerpoint and his tests are very fair. They're 75 questions, so if you get a few wrong you can still easily get an A. Attendance isn't mandatory, his powerpoint are self-explanatory and you can go through them on your own. Overall, his class is interesting and he's a friendly, humorous guy.

I think he is a pretty good teacher. It is a lot of material but he tries his best to explain it. The test are around 70-75 questions, but they are truly common sense. He doesn't try to trick you. It is much more interesting than PSYC 1100. He is a very interesting professor overall.
boring, ranting lectures. not much help when you meet with him one on one.

Average. Not terrible, not great. Nice if you talk to him one on one during his office hours. Tests are hard, and there's a lot of material. For a class that isn't supposed to be a hard psychology class, it's very difficult and frustrating. Textbook is awful, and it confused me way more than helped me.

Not a fan. Nothing is really clear, questions are tricky and hard to know what was going to be on the test. No study guide provided. He doesn't even go over what is going to be on the test. I was not a fan of getting in small groups to talk about the question he asked either, it is aggravating and silly to do in a class of 100.
good teacher, not as interesting as miller, but not boring either. Tests are also less tricky/misleading compared to 1100

Not a bad professor. Makes helpful study guides and provides power points with notes. Just put in the time to study and an A shouldn't be hard. One down side is that he never really answers questions in class. Exams are pretty straightforward. He doesn't try to trick you.

Boring class, dense amounts of material to go over before each exam. There really is no way to avoid taking this class if it's required so just make the best of it. It's not the worst class, but it definitely could have been better...a lot easier that Psych 1100

Not that bad. He gives out helpful study guides, it's just a lot of material to review before the exams. If you study and attend class, an A is attainable. He tries to make the exams as clear as possible.

As a teacher i wouldnt say that he was was great at all, i went to his office hours once and he was not willing to help at all just told me if i wanted more clarification to read the book again. Everytime a question was asked me would say "ill get to it" and never did. I didnt like him at all learning for me happened with the book. Dont take him!

Not too bad if you just go to class and go over the SLIDES and attached notes. an A is easily attainable if you just study. Also, dr. leach bears an uncanny resemblance to john legend, which can make for some pretty entertaining lectures.

Awful professor. No study guide, disorganized powerpoints, rambles through lecture. Makes his exams tricky - tests you on your exam taking ability instead of knowledge of material, but will take hours to try to blame the 300+ students and teach them better test-taking skills rather than realize the problem is his tests. Worst class ever.

Professor Read is an amazing professor. She really enjoys lecturing and you can tell that she wants to help students learn. She is sometimes hard to reach over email, but if you just wait two days or ask her in class she will get to you. Grade is the average of 3 exams (optional final) and exams are easy and open note. I recommend this class 100%.

Interesting class but boring professor. Didn't show up to classes and got good grades on the exams. All that's graded is 3 exams and that's it. Very boring lectures. Taught myself with the book and reading her lectures.

Took sensory neuroscience lab expecting an easy A, and it was. One assignment per week, a few quizzes, one midterm, and a final. No work outside of class. Every assignment is coding in MATLAB, but nothing too bad. Heather thinks she understands coding but she doesn't, so hope you have a good TA. Mine, Ahmad Osman, was awesome. Overall easy class.

Very confusing lectures. You only have to study the powerpoints and you'll do fine. You have to beg for help. She gets mad when people don't understand and is easily offended. The class is easy if you review powerpoints multiple times. She offers little extra credit. Material is really interesting.

She wasn't the most helpful professor and gave very little extra credit. Even though the lectures are only 1h15m, they feel like forever. The content for the course isn't the most interesting, but it almost felt like she went out of her way to make it even more dry. The tone of her voice was boring, and a lot of students would drift off.

Professor Read is extremely helpful, so ask ANY questions you have during or after class. The concepts can be difficult. If you come to lectures and pay attention, do and understand the practice exams, and generally put an effort in the class, you will get the A.

I thought this class was going to be a lot more interesting than it actually was. Lecture was boring and somewhat confusing. Her lecture notes were not very clear and difficult to study off of. Nice woman but her voice is quiet and not very engaging, I found myself daydreaming more often than not. She does provide lots of extra credit though.
I took this class for fun. Big mistake! It was harder than some of the science classes I was taking, and I am a bio major! On the bright side, she is very sweet and curves A LOT!

One of the hardest psychology classes I've taken, but it's also the one I've learned the most from. It is a hard class, but definitely worth taking. By far my favorite teacher I have had here at UConn.

Professor Read is a fantastic person and always in a good mood. She wants students to do well and gave us so many options and curves to increase our grade that it's almost impossible to walk out with anything lower than a B-. The material can get confusing, and requires at least some effort to understand, but her extra credit assignments help.

I definitely regret taking this class. As some who is going for a BA degree in Psych I found the material difficult to comprehend to begin with. Her teaching methods do not help the cause even a little bit. The lectures are jumbled and hard to get anything from. Avoid at all costs if you can. Afraid this class will kill my GPA.

im a psych major with a 3.8 gpa and i can say this was the hardest psych class i have ever taken. the only plus side is that there is no textbook and her notes are online. however, the notes are all over the place and formatted horribly similar to like a word document. I highly regret taking this class.

Doesn't require a textbook which is great, but she uses confusing weblinks that have way too much writing instead of powerpoints. Extremely nice but lectures are frustrating- her teaching style is poor, she mostly asks questions instead of actually teaching. Tests are fairly easy but most of the work relies on you learning the material yourself.
Heather is a great professor. She really knows what she is talking about and does NOT require a textbook which is great! She is pretty funny too! Always tries to help students.

she is very kind and approachable but her teaching style is off key. I just learned more information using Youtube than reading her website objectives. her teaching style is not concise and clear Idk what everyone below is talking about. goes on tangents.

Fun, easy class. the subject matter was really interesting and i learned a ton. everything you need to know will be on the class website. Dr Read is super nice and approachable and is genuinely interested in what she teaches

If anyone wants a manageable course in which they will actually learn something this is it. Her lectures are straight forward and the tests come right from the lectures. Plus she is funny it a quirky way and def will do whatever it takes to help you

Prof Read is kind, helpful and funny. Her lectures are all concise and clear, and designed to help you really learn the material rather than just memorize it. She does a good job pacing the class and is more concerned about everyone learning the material than covering everything. Her tests are fair and if you put in some work you will get an A

As someone who does not identify as a sciencey person, I was really worried about having to take this class. However, Heather is a wonderful professor who really takes the time to teach you the concepts and breaks it down into the basics. I've never learnt more in a class and it was not difficult to get a good grade if you put in a little effort.

Excellent teacher...all her lectures are on her own website page and the exams come STRAIGHT from them! You can very easily get an A in the class if you go to lecture and make sure you actually understand everything on the lectures.

I do not understand how so many people have a negative opinion towards her or her class. Her lectures notes are all organized online and are clearly explained in lecture. You still have to do work to do well. The class is NOT impossible by any means, and too many people are making it out to be terrible. Fantastic professor!! Would take it again :D

The class is moderately difficult therefore you need to take the time to actually understand the material - it is not an easy A. But if you take the time to approach Professor Read and ask her to help you, she is more than willing to make time for you. The class is interesting when you apply yourself.
Seems like she knows her stuff but doesn't know how to effectively teach it. Often becomes confused with what she's trying to say and confuses the students. Her study guides are not helpful.

Sensation and Perception was packed with content. If you are looking to challenge yourself, take this class. If you want to fly through college, skip it. Fair tests. So-so lectures. Shes a smart lady who definitely knows her stuff (but doesnt always teach it so clearly)

She is a very knowledgeable about her subject matter but often seems to know too much which confuses her. She is always available for extra help, grades fairly and will throw out exam questions that the majority of the class gets wrong. She is a little disorganized but will repeat the material that is most important and quizes are very helpful

She tries very hard to make the material eary to access. her website is set up so that you don't have to buy the $120 book if you don't want to. She will address any question that you ask. And yes, she curves the exams so that if you are failing you'll have a better chance of passing. Funny that people above complain about that curve!
its all basically been said. shes a terrible teacher and has to curve all the exams because everyone does poorly. do NOT take this class!

DO NOT TAKE ANY COURSE WITH THIS LADY !!! Do yourself a HUGE favor and avoid being on the learning end of her "teaching". Everyone hit the nail on the head: 1- Her webpage is terribly unorganized and possibly the worst format for a college class. 2- She messes up details/slides/spelling and tries to cover them up (rather unsuccessfully). 3- She inc

She is extremely ditzy and has absolutely no idea what she is doing. Lectures are confusing and she often gets flustered. She emphasizes general concepts in class and then stresses trivial facts on the exams. Seems more concerned with her own personal research and self-promotion than being a good teacher. Avoid her!!

must use texbook because she can't teach.. yes i know she is technically a "teacher" but she is more like a talker. She is smart but assumes every1 understands things too much and can't convey messages properly.
Smart but doesn't know how to get her point across to students clearly. Uses "like" and "um" a LOT. Incredibly boring.
Great intellectual teacher.

Content is really complex, but he makes it easier to understand by giving practice through notes, hw, quizzes, etc. It's a lot of work but you need the practice to understand the concepts, so I didn't mind it. The ppl who disliked him probably weren't putting the effort in, bc if you stay on top of it it's manageable and he really tries to help you

The class is challenging because there's extensive material, especially the tax return projects that are extremely time-consuming. It demands significant time and effort, but he's willing to provide alternative explanations and post videos. If you don't get it, ask questions. It's really hard to catch up so stay on top of the work. Good luck.

Overall this class wasn't too bad, I could have gotten a better grade. I would say Utke's organization is confusing. I did not find the provided note packet useful, I ended up taking my own notes. He says its a flipped class, it's not. He spends most lectures going over said notes packet (which are for credit). This class could be better if he was.

This guy is robotic. He will send you ~30 emails before the semester even begins. Beware pop quizzes and note checks. The content isn't actually hard, he gets off on confusing his students. His entire personality is accounting and fantasy football. If you ask him a question, he answers only in riddles or not at all.

Professor Utke's class is very challenging so you have to come in with a mindset of being ready to work hard. The course is curved at the end, so you can do pretty well if you stay on top of things. Attendance is mandatory to get participation credit and there are also pop quizzes.

Professor Utke really makes you work for your grade. This course was for sure a lot of work but I would for sure rather taken it with him since he is the one who creates the course at UConn. Taxes are complicated but he manages to fully explain everything and answers any questions you may have since he has so much experience in accounting/taxes.

Utke is a great professor but this was definitely the hardest class I took at UConn. Would rather have taken this class with his thorough explanations of hard material and clear expectations instead of taking it with an "easier" professor who confuses students with the material. Got a B+ while taking 17 credits, an A is doable but a lot of work.

This class was not easy, but I felt Prof. Utke did a real good job with thoroughly explaining things to people and making sure to answer questions if they come up (if he didn't initially know the answer, he would go and research it). I only got a B+ because I forgot to do the peer review for the group project which was half of the grade for it.

I have never written a negative review here, but Utke is an exception. He makes a relatively intermediate accounting course unnecessarily difficult. The biggest challenge of this course is not navigating the material but professor Utke himself. He is extremely rude and sarcastic responding to any student seeking help. take with ANYONE else!

Professor Utkes course is extremely well-organized. If you follow the prescribed weekly study plan, you should be fine. There is a good balance of resources available. The book is hard to understand (because the tax code is too) but it pays off to complete the notes before class, come with questions, and benefit from the repetition.

He is fine as a Professor however this class is very hard, one of the hardest Accounting classes at UConn besides Advanced maybe. You must do extra work to get a decent grade in this class. I wish I did the smartbook assignments throughout the semester to help myself with extra prac. and wished I went to office hours more often when I fell behind.

Honestly just don't take him if you don't want to have nightmares with him every night. I was super active in class however he did not give me full points in participation. Not only that he gave us a memo to do in the finals week. I dedicated so much time to this class and forgot about other classes. Really unfair.
He is killing his students by assigning a research memo during final.

Professor Utke is very passionate about taxes, but his class is super intense. Be prepared to spend hours of outside time per week and 10+ hours on the tax return projects. Personally, I find the subject interesting but the course is very hard.

Professor Utke knows a ton about tax, and it shows. Exam questions can be tricky, but so are taxes in real life so he is truly just preparing you for the subject he is teaching. I would recommend taking Tax with him as he makes the exams, and his lectures are tailored towards exam questions, whereas other professors attempt to teach his exams.

Federal Income Tax is a very challenging course, however, Professor Utke knows the material extremely well. While the material in itself is not too challenging, there is A LOT of it. Follow his guidelines on how to succeed in this class and you will. Exams are open notes so preparing enough should earn you a good grade. Excellent professor.

Professor Utke is incredibly smart. The material is difficult, but he did a great job presenting the information in a way that was understandable. You will have to work hard, pre-class reading and participation is required. Beware of pre-semester quizzes. Exams are open note, but not open book, so make sure you have good notes.
GOAT
Worst professor I've ever had, avoid if you can.

One of the best professors I have ever had. He gives students everything you need to succeed, and is constantly available and willing to help during office hours. Expects students to fill out notes before class and come prepared, but that way the lectures are easy to keep up with. If you blame Utke for your bad grades maybe accounting isn't for you
Avoid.

Class is extremely difficult. Be prepared to study if you want to succeed. Utke is a nice guy and knows what he is talking about. Participation is graded and there are a couple of group projects. Tests are cumulative, and get ready for pop quizzes. Homework is done online.

Steve is a genius but it to be honest it seems like he takes pride in being way smarter than everyone else. We fly through the material, tests are insanely difficult, and participation is graded very seriously. There are huge group projects throughout the semester which are very hard and he does not provide any assistance, even if you reach out

He isn't that bad, but the class is hard. The exam averages were pretty bad for the class, and there were tax return problems that were pretty bad too. Altogether though, he wasn't a mean guy and he wanted the students to succeed.

The class is going to be hard regardless of who you have just because of the amount of material covered and the amount you need to know, but he is a terrible teacher. He flies through lecture and the Tests and Group projects are insanely hard. He does make himself available for help, but this dude is so awkward. All quiz questions are online though

This man is a genius and if its one thing he's good at its answering questions that have to do with projects. The projects are extremely easy and don't too long to do. He goes very slow throughout the lectures, and is an all around perfect teacher. No one has inspired me more than this man. And he played football in college, how cool is that?

Coming into a tax class, its expected it will be difficult. Utke will help you if you seek it but there just isnt enough time in class to cover all the material you need to know. He stresses the importance of your effort, which is accurate because for any class after Gen Eds student effort is the difference between a good grade and an average one

Stevie's tax class was hard -- there's no denying that. However, it has a lot more to do with the course than him as a professor. If he was teaching a different class, everyone would be giving him decent reviews. He expects a lot out students, but you can get a B, or even an A if you give 110%.

This class in general is a pretty difficult class, while I do believe he goes a bit fast, he is always willing to answer questions throughout the lecture and generally expects students to be prepared for class. He give the notes out before hand so we can fill them out and have a general understanding during class.

Utke is an interesting guy. I thought this class was not going to be that hard but I was wrong. There is a ton of material which is expected for a tax class but he doesn't teach it well. He prepares notes for us to fill in which is nice but what is covered in class doesn't match well with homework and quizzes. Intentionally tricky questions. Avoid

Thinks it is funny when he tricks students on quizzes/exams and they get the questions wrong. I wouldn't recommend taking him at all. All the work is online for an in person class which means he doesn't want to do any grading and could care less about helping students out and giving partial credit. Stay away!!!!

Honestly avoid him at ALL costs, if possible. I will never take a class with him again. Goes WAY too fast to allow students to comprehend what he's saying (which he just reads off Powerpoints) and then refuses to put PowerPoints online for student access. All homeworks, quizzes & exams are online (in class) so no chance of partial credit.

AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE! The instructor mostly reread assigned readings while veering into historical tangents that didn't relate much to the course material. This teaching style was ineffective. She has a patronizing demeanor and ineffective office hours in which she poorly answers questions by going off on tangents to then not answering them at all

I took English 2407 with Professor Sanchez and honestly, I can say that I walked away with a lot of information that she lectured; she is very intuitive and brilliant when it comes to educating her students. The only downside for this specific class as of recently is that there are 2 midterms and 1 final exam only for grades. Otherwise, I loved it.

This class is very easy. If you are looking for a class you will not enjoy, but could be passed with the skills you developed in elementary school alone, you should take this course. Moderating anarchist Tuesday, participating & reading online summaries are sufficient. The professor, however, is not friendly. The final is pretty ridiculous too tbh.

do not take a class with her unless you wanted to be talked down to and disrespected, she thinks she is some higher being because she reads books and focused on english. This class should be an easy A but she hates giving out As. not a single person in my class could stand her and we would all talk about her before and after class bc she was rude

She is a super tough grader and gives very little advice on how to improve. She is condescending and lectures are pretty boring. A lot of reading and every week the homework each week is one full page single-spaced. It was honestly a fine class, but if you can pick something else I suggest doing that.

She is the most condescending and hypocritical prof I've ever met. If you don't agree with her POV, you will fail this class in addition to being put down by her in front of the entire class. She basically tells you that your opinion is wrong and she is right because she is a prof. Disclosed information that def violated HIPAA to the whole class.

Extremely rude and condescending to her students. The content of this course was fine, whatever, but the way she interacts with students makes it clear she thinks everyone but herself is an idiot and she is doing us a favor bestowing her knowledge upon us. Also her exam format barely actually assesses what the course is teaching??

I have never had a bad experience with an ENGL prof or received bad grades in an ENGL class until now. She reads each student's grades to the class as she takes attendance, discloses private info, and threatens to fail you for the entire semester if she sees you on your phone once. really unfortunate experience

Lisa Sanchez is the worst professor I've ever had at Uconn. She reads your grades out to the whole class and gives you a zero if you are on your computer or using your phone. She teaches her class like a high school english class. The class is fine but the professor is rude, boring, and downright disrespectful. If you can avoid this woman please do

Worst class I've ever taken here at UCONN, period. Very inaccessible outside of class and the fact she doesn't use HuskyCT is aggravating. Coursework is loosely related to course description and syllabus is a set rule but she will change it and expect you to still know even though she doesn't tell you she changes it's AVOID AT ALL COSTS I BEG
Really boring lectures, annoying assignments but if you do them right, you'll get an A. Wouldn't take again but also, not a terrible choice of a professor. There are worse ones out there.

Lecture recordings were long and hard to follow what the key terms were. The readings were always confusing but luckily many of them have summaries online. All of the assignments were basically giving your opinion in relation to the key terms. She was really nice but all over the place.

She is genuinely so sweet and I loved the stories she chose. As long as your responses meet the length criteria and you participate in the class you will do well. Most of all though she's just so kind and really creates a community in the classroom.

Terrible professor who lacks nuance in thought. She is highly misinformed on many issues which fuels the misinformed agenda she pushes in class. Her teaching style revolves around class discussion which is good, but she herself lacks any sort of proper insight and ability to provide stimulating discourse. Books were good.

There was hardly any structure to the "lectures," she would often just read passages from the book she was reading and the information she presented was not on any exam or anything. Every week you did have to do research and write about it as well as read a lot. The "final" was a really long paper but overall this class was okay.

Sanchez doesn't use HuskyCT so you don't know what your grade is until she posts it at the end of the semester. That being said, if you show up and talk you get an A. For the term paper make sure you go to her office hours - she will literally read your whole paper and fix all your mistakes. Anarchist Thursdays were a pain

Honors Apocalyptica. Interesting topic, picked good books to read. 1 class/week "lecture", other class open discussion between students. 2pg papers due each week. Professor is ok but kinda know-it-all, makes ppl feel bad who disagree w her. Gives chances to get points back. Participate lots. Not a big fan of her but I rly enjoyed the class itself.
Really smart and interesting! Never a dull class (as long as you like reading and participating). Easy to do well as long as she knows you're trying.

Terrible class. No structure. We're only talking with each other basically so I barely learned anything. Constantly griping about rich people. Slightly condescending. Final grading not clear at all. That said, she is nice and there's no way you can fail unless you are truly terrible, but you will only get an A if you agree with her 100%.

Professor Sanchez is amazing. Her book choices are interesting. She's beyond flexible with deadlines. Her teaching style makes it seem like you are not learning, but you really are. She has "Anarchist Thursdays," which is where you do research on the book you are reading and get credit. Class discussions are student lead. Really interesting.
Describes her own style as "anarchist pedagogic," which effectively means she's flexible with deadlines and lenient with grading, especially if you agree with her politics. A lot of writing.

Show up to class with some knowledge of the reading and you are bound for an A. Any Extra credit opportunities must be done the week of or the following week because she is strict with her deadlines. Students are allowed to voice their own opinions in their paper with some evidence of reading attached. My favorite class take as an undergrad.

I have taken 2 classes with her. (ENGL 3218 & 3607) She is passionate & knowledgeable about the topics. She picks good books to read to bring the topics to life & make it easier to learn. Papers are easy (2 pages) if you read and have an opinion that you can support with textual evidence. Seems strict, but is helpful. Show interest in class & read!

She's very passionate about the topics. I feel like she might like the students who agree with her more than the ones who try to give their own opinions. There are a few short essays in total, plus a reading due every class. It's not too bad.

Very friendly and has a good sense of humor, which makes the class more enjoyable. Papers are not too long and you will get an A as long as you do the reading and can articulate your thoughts and understanding of the material within your work.
She's not fair at all. If you don't agree with what she says in class she will resent you and she won't give you higher than a b+, even if your writing is really good.
Students who willingly participate in class will be very pleased with her, as she just wants to see some element of thought from students.
She's pretty nice and has a good sense of humor. She gives weekly quizzes (at least in English 112) which are totally easy if you go to class and read.

she seems like a hard ass in the beginning but as the semester goes on shes not bad...weekly quizzes are easy as long as you do the reading..gives tons of extra credit opportunites..overall= not as bad as she seems
So vague and flaky. I feel like I didn't learn anything at all. She needs to actually plan lessons and lectures.
Horrible professor, avoid her courses at all costs.
wonderful person but too vague & hippy

Only grades are 3 exams worth 75% of your grade and 25% discussion. Honestly for an elective exams were unusually hard and specific, but if you study itt should be an easy A or just pass fail it. Almost zero weekly work since there are no assignments.

This has got to be the most realistic professor I ever met. He is super funny and just has a huge heart for teaching. I would totally recommend it, the content is very digestible and he loves answering everyone's questions.

Professor KD is goated. Easy class as long as you do the discussions well and on time. Exam information comes from the Wall Street Journal and lecture content. Lectures are both online and in-person for your convenience.
Such a nice man. I took him for Public Policy 1001 and it was a really easy course. The content is extremely straightforward and pretty easy, but he's a great lecturer and cares about the class.
Knows what hes talking about but its very lecture heavy and could get boring because of that. However, he is very clear and makes sure he discusses whats going to be on the exam.

Responds fairly quick to emails. Lectures may be called boring. Going to class and taking good notes does help. Nothing complex if studying is adequate. Few online discussions for homework where class isn't held that, day but that's it. Exams aren't bad if one studies well. Don't get mixed up by my grade, I was irresponsible, honestly.

Prof. Dautrich is great! His lectures were clear and easy to understand, plus all the audio from lectures are posted online. Graded by three exams and discussion posts. Exams are easy if you pay attention and discussions are a breeze. No textbooks, just keep up with the news. Plus sometimes he brings his dog to class. Highly recommend!

Easiest class, basically high school civics. However the lectures are so boring but thankfully they are recorded so you don't have to go. Only graded by 3 exams which are very easy and discussion posts. I found this to be a very easy class.

This class was the worst combination - a lot of work and I learned very little. It's an online class with no textbook, no lectures, and very little feedback. The class mostly is "comment on stuff from the Internet" and then comment on other students' comments via the bulletin board. You have to check in for the class multiple times a week.

He is an AMAZING lecturer. That being said, his slides are posted but they are the bare bones of his lectures so it's very important to go to the lectures. He requires that you read the WSJ for class and he will ask about that so it's important to read. His tests are fairly easily worded, but there are very few things to be graded on.
I loved this class. Definitely go to class because the slides/presentation is just an outline of the lecture. His lectures are interesting and he explains things well.

Professor Dautrich is one of the best professors I've had at UConn. He is extremely approachable and flexible. His class is comprised of 3 exams and 4 discussion boards. If you go to class, listen to what he says and take good notes, you will do well on exams. You can opt to take a short answer exam vs a multiple choice one. He rocks!

This class was very easy and Prof Dautrich has very clear guidelines. This class requires a very basic understanding of governmental policy, show up to lecture as the power points lack the information that will be on the tests. But if you show up to lecture and put minimal effort into the four online discussion assignments, you'll get an A.

I found this class super interesting and covered really important topics about policy. Dautrich is a super nice guy and makes the class easy to sit through. The tests are a little tricky but definitely manageable if you study. I would recommend this class if you're at all interested in politics and need a good elective!

Great Class! Come to class, take good notes from slides, and read the Wall Street Journal (or just watch the news daily) and you'll get an easy A/B. 3 exams( 33 multiple choice) or if you want a (short-answer exam) 4 easy discussions on HuskyCT. Very knowledgeable, very kind, and willing to help students get a good grade. TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!

I honestly struggled with the class when I took it last year but he is the sweetest and most understanding professor. As long as you show up to the class and make an effort he is very accessible and willing to help with your grade. He doesn't give points away but he definitely wants to see you do well.

This man is the kindest, most caring professor I've ever had. It's like Santa Claus is lecturing me. He loves his students and wants you to love what he teaches. Wish I could take every class with him.

Dautrich could not make this class easier. A general interest in the stuff and a will to get things done on time, Just make sure to read the Wall Street Journal for the midterm and final, as he asks some questions from there. Overall a great guy and easily my most interesting class yet here at UConn. Everyone should take one with

Was very clear and could tell that he was interested in the subject which made lectures more bearable since they are otherwise somewhat dry. However lectures are essential to passing and worth every minute when it comes to exams. Exams are on average easy, and if you study a little an A comes easily.

Attendance isn't mandatory but you do so much better by showing up because his lectures are super clear and very easy to follow. He's extremely fair and gives 4 multiple choice exams, but will even offer a written exam for the students who prefer it, so he's really accommodating. I highly recommend.
Lectures are kind of dry
Great teacher. Must attend lectures to do well on exams. Nice guy too. Keeps it interesting even at 8am.

dautrich is a WICKED good teacher! it sticks its at 8am but suck it up and go to lecture and you will do fine. you have to read the book, but its actually a pretty good book. if you put in a bit effort, youll do fine. plus, he is a nice guy and if you have any questions he will get right back to you

PowerPoint slides are black and white which makes you want to fall asleep, especially at 8am. No homework or quizzes, just 3 non cumulative multiple choice exams. If you want an A you HAVE to read the textbook!!! Tests are roughly 40 questions; roughly 5 questions come from the book and regard something NEVER mentioned in class.
Very good prof! Willing to help, very clear in lecture. Have to go because he does not post specific things he says in lecture. A little bit of studying will get you a good grade in this class

This was a very easy class. If you need a Gen Ed for Content Area 2, I suggest this one. Just attend class and take good notes, and you will do fine. I disagree with the other person who said the book is a waste though. It is cheap, and it is worth a few points on the exam

Loved this class! I had no interested going into in, but it was an easy gen ed and I felt like I learned something without having to invest a lot of outside time in the class. Solid if you need an easy gen ed.

Very good professor, he has an interest in the subject and knows how to teach it. He is very lenient with work (for two tests he had a writing component, the rest is multiple choice). Buying the textbook is a waste, just attend lecture regularly and you'll do well.

Exam questions come straight from the lectures, so attendance is mandatory. Didn't think I would like this class when I signed up, but turns out I absolutely love it! Professor Dautrich makes the subject really interesting. As long as you go to every class and briefly review your notes before the test, you'll do well! Definitely take this class!
Bases all tests on the lectures (even small details) so going to class is a MUST! Also - buying the textbook is a waste of money, just take notes from the lectures.

Ken is a fairly bland guy bet he is very straightforward. The tests aren't terrible they're very short and to the point. At first it seems like polysci for middle schoolers but it gets more in-depth as it goes. If your looking for an easy class i would say take this one.
He was pretty bad. You need a C+ for senior standing in this class, and he makes it much more difficult than the other professor. Beware of this professor and take ECE3101 during the Spring semester.

I'm not sure why Dr. Escabi gets a bad rap. His homework is very straight forward, and his exams are very similar to the homework. He could do more examples, and slightly more complex ones at that, but going to discussion helps with this. He does ask for MATLAB, but provides you with a guide. Plus the textbook contains plenty of MATLAB examples.

Monty is a good professor, teaching the concepts pretty well, but may fall short of doing enough examples. His exams a based off the homework and the lectures, which, if you have done them yourself, should allow you to get a decent grade and higher on the tests. Discussions are useless if you understand the topic and the matlab project was annoying

Monty is completely disinterested in you learning or getting a good grade in his class. In lectures he doesn't really teach, but will give erratic examples where he'll skip large chunks of the solution. Don't believe what he says, exams aren't like anything you'll see in homework or class. Matlab final project. One of the worst, avoid at all costs
Imagine giving a final project in MATLAB to a class that learned Python instead in CSE 1010.

I cannot stress enough how much you should not take this class. Basically no instruction provided in class, and no availability outside of class, so get ready to read the esoteric poorly written textbook from 1998 to learn everything. Pop quizzes in discussion, which is somehow less helpful than the lecture
Take this class in the spring.
bad professor, hard exams, not accessible , don't ever take his class, the discussions are terrible

Probably the worst professor I've had so far and I've had a lot of awful professors. His lectures don't make sense and his exams are super difficult. He says the exams are easier and similar to the homework but they aren't. He doesn't care about the success of his students. He even laughed in class about how many poor reviews he receives each year.

Monty is a decent professor. He is very smart, almost to a fault. He can forget how complicated the material is at times and go through very difficult things fast. People who are saying he was awful are more saying that cause the material was just so difficult. Monty himself isn't terrible though.

Exams are tough, does not curve even though the average is poor. Very hard to convince for points back on exams. Expect pop quizzes in discussion, and a final project. Hands down the toughest course EE majors have to take imo.

I get the Napoleon Complex comment but it's still rude. Sometimes Monty will not call on you even if your hand is raised ten feet in front of his face. Spends too much time doing integrals and needs to explain concepts more. Ecsams were not bad but you have to wait five years until the course is audited to review them.

Monte is a good lecturer but a terrible professor and downright rude at times. He does not care at all about the success of his students. He told a friend of mine that she could not move an exam because a friends funeral was not a valid excuse to move an exam. His exams are extremely challenging and he is hard to locate outside of class for help

I didn't think that Monty was as bad as everyone made him seem. My TA (Mina) was really helpful and prepared us pretty well for the exam. Monty's lectures are kind of confusing and he doesn't put them online, but the book is helpful. Exams were hard, but not impossible. I though Signals was a lot easier than Circuits.

ta's and professor are not on the same page. They contradict eachother on how a problem is to be solved. and the tests are brutal. do homework for days on end and the tests are not of the same material. doesnt make sense!
I missed two classes and was a bit lost after that. Exames are difficult, partical credit is hard to find. plan on studying for 15h a week or more.

Professor Escabi seems better than a lot of the ECE professors at UCONN, but watch out. His lecture notes are usually helpful, but he consistently writes them on the board incorrectly, and he doesn't cover many aspects of each concept. If you get at least 70s on the exam you'll be fine, otherwise you're going to be retaking 3101. There's no curve.

Worst class I've ever taken at UConn. He assigned huge HW assignments and would only post the solutions manual which everyone has access to already. Tests were very difficult and his preparation was vague. Point deducted with no explanation whatsoever. Made us give tests back, went in to the final nearly blind. Napoleon Complex maybe?

He is not only a very good teacher, but also a very good person. He is very knowledgeable,expert in his major. he makes you interested in learning & helps students if they have any problem. He puts so much time to help students with their problems in person or even via email. I'm so grateful to have him as my professor to learn things from him.

Knows what he's talking about really well, but he only touches on concepts and gives easy examples in class. Homeworks are very tough and the exams are even harder. Doesnt give partial credit or curves the grades.. Almost impossible to reach outside class

His lectures were pretty clear and he gave a lot of examples. The exams were harder than the class examples though and you need to know how to do all the homework to do well on them. In my opinion, the first exam was a lot harder than the other two so dont get discouraged.
Professor Escabi is extremely knowledgeable about the subject and is a clear presenter. However, the homework is extremely difficult and time-consuming, and he is difficult to reach outside of class.
Hard homeworks, and even harder exams. He goes over the simplest example possible in lecture, then proceeds to give you hard homeworks, followed by even harder exams. Doesn't curve either.
Great at explaining concepts but impossible to follow homeworks and difficult exams

I am dissapointed in all the previous comments. This professor rocks. He goes over all the material you need for each exam. And his explanations and examples in lecture are crystal clear. That said, that means you gotta go to every single class. Exams are straightforward (except the bonus) and we only had one project this semester. Sweet!
One of the worst. Hard exams, no curve. Enough said.
Hard homework, hard exams. No curve.
No Comments
No Comments
If you haven't taken ECE 202 take this guy he's really easy as hell and his curves a lot! got an easy A!
Carasteristically speaking, Monty gives very tought homework and even harder exams, while only teaching very simple examples of the work in class.

He says some out of pocket stuff but at the end of the day he really, really cares about what he teaches. He goes above and beyond to make sure you learn it. Lots of very easy homework. He insists that every class he teaches is arranged in a circle facing inward.

Thor was an incredible professor. He made time to meet with me outside of class and gave really great insights. He required a decent amount of work, but he didn't grade particularly hard and was understanding about work in other classes.

He was one of two professors for GSCI 1050, he created a whole bunch of videos, powerpoints, etc. that illustrated what was required during each section of the course. He isn't some standout professor, but he's a nice guy and an average professor. Very passionate about the course and what he teaches.

Honors Geoscience is honestly an amazing class. He may seem a little bit eccentric, but it's easy to tell that he is very passionate about geology and just wants to share this passion with the students. Classes were set up a little differently than traditional lectures, which was hard to get used to, but overall I really enjoyed it.

Course covers a lot of material, but Professor Thorson usually makes class interesting! The online class requires a lot of preparation for individual quizzes and discussions, but they aren't extremely difficult.

Honestly, try to avoid him. Felt like he was purposefully trying to make simple concepts as confusing and weirdly worded as possible. It left me, and I know I'm not alone in this, feeling like I was stupid , despite doing well in my other classes. He's really disorganized and boring. He's nice it just felt like listening to my grandpa blabber.

He's passionate about the subject & a nice guy overall. Gives reasonable feedback on HW. Lot of writing (5 papers) & many readings. 5 field trips, including MA! Tips: No need to take long notes during lectures except for info to use in essays (no tests). In discussions, share personal takeaways from readings (can sometimes get him sidetracked).

The course was about his passion, Thoreau. Incredibly dedicated to the course and his enthusiasm is infectious. If you are interested in geoscience, history, or philosophy, then this is a good professor for AMST 1700 (honors core)

Thor is a sweet guy. He's passionate about geology + loves what he does. But, he is not a good prof. He is horrible with technology, which is tough because most of the class is online. He's not good at communicating, + would respond to my long emails with a one word reply. I know he has a lot of students but he doesn't care about the individuals.

Thor is a cutie, he is very intelligent but is not the greatest teacher. He is super passionate about geology and his lectures are entertaining. But this is not an easy A lab science expect to work just as hard as any other entry level science or arguably harder to get an A which is attainable but not just by showing up you have to put in the work

This class was a great way to get rid of the honors core requirement, and was usually genuinely interesting. It had student-led lectures, which definitely isn't for everyone, but Thor was always there to answer questions and clarify. He was a very generous grader, and the midterm and final were replaced with "essays," which were tedious but easy.

Took this for my honors core class. Overall, it was a great class. I felt like I learned a lot and he is really passionate about the subject. I hate writing papers and discussions so when I found out this was like an english class, I was disappointed. However, he made it bearable. The papers weren't too bad, but the readings were tedious.

This is a difficult course. It's abstract and not your regular lectureregurgitate info class. The different type of thinking and technical text can be frustrating. Stick with it though, an A or B is definitely possible. You need to put a lot of time and effort into your final project. It goes without saying: don't procrastinate on the project.

Quite literally the hardest class I have ever taken here, much of it due to his poor teaching, insane grading scheme, ridiculously abstract exams, and non structured lab. You will work to the point of tears on your final project/presentation, which is 40% of your grade. An A is obtainable with a good grade on that project, he curves based on that.

Thor is by far the worse professor I've ever had at UConn. He may be clever and very knowledgeable, but this man CANNOT teach! His exams are ridiculous and he assigns a ton of reading from a graduate textbook that is very hard to decipher. Absolutely hated this class! Good luck!
Exceptionally interesting and intelligent guy, but really hard to follow. Assigns a lot of reading. Don't be afraid to go to him for one-on-one help.

Had Thor for his honors core. Class was incredibly boring; wish i had taken a different one. his "grading" is incomprehensible and maddening, very unclear and contradictory. Seems to take pleasure in presiding over a classroom that has a very disorganized and unstructured feel and flow. Some people may like this but I didn't.

There is certainly nothing to complain about in terms of grading because Thor is so lenient. Gave a free answer on each exam, and has a "drop question" from each exam. Drops the lowest quiz, curves each exam, and the overall final grade. Gave me extra credit for my exam essay because he liked it so much, and called me personally to say thank you.

He is very opinionated i thought coming into this class I would learn about geology instead i learned about Thor's Hartford Courant column. His lectures tend to be long rants on his opinion of our state and country. Tough to follow. Exams, parts were straight forward other parts you wonder where the info came from.
