She grades so you can improve, so expect nothing higher than a B on the first paper. Also, go to the Writing Center (she likes it). I am very scared for my GPA now.

She is serious and sometimes a difficult grader, but if you show her that you are willing to participate in class, act friendly to her, and you do your assignments, she will absolutely value you as a student. She is a very, very understanding and nice person if you just take the time to talk to her.

A nice, passionate lady but an absolutely terrible professor. Her exams are nearly impossible, as she is an extremely tough grader and tests memorization more than analysis . Don't expect to very much in class since she just goes on huge, useless digressions with no pertinence the course material. I do not recommend taking this class.

She's very condescending, assuming we couldn't understand the plot to the plays, and classes were mostly her summarizing the action. She says she wants student participation but her style really does not encourage it; I would have written this on her evaluation, but she never handed them out. I was expecting a lot more out of a 3000 level class.

I was highly dreading this class going into it, but she makes it interesting. she get's so excited in what she says, she often goes off in random tangents. she can be a tough grader, but is very friendly and eager to help.

She is extremely helpful and available to you. I took her over the summer so class size was very small. Tests were easy if you do the assigned reading, impossible if you don't. I received an A-, would take one of her classes again!
Her enthusiasm was really sexy. I loved the class.

I took 3 classes with her and she was my Honors thesis advisor. She knows SO much about the time period but also loves it when you can bring in new knowledge and research. Best advice: go to class, participate, and talk with her, and she will love you. You might think she hates your writing style, but really she's trying to push you to be better.
Can be the nicest lady one day and the meanest the next. Very tough grader and almost tries to weed out students who want to be English majors. I would never take a class with her again.

Terrible -talks on endlessly and thinks what she is saying is interesting, but really she makes useless observations and insights. Loves to hear herself talk regardless of whether or not what she is saying is relevant, helpful, or correct. All over the place and hostile to you if you are late or excuse yourself to go to the bathroom. Biased grader.
very interesting class and she made me enjoy shakespeare...

I hate shakespeare but her class was actually interesting. Shes so into shakespeare and she gets really excited so its easy to get involved. Fair grader and youll do fine if you go to class. Id reccommend her to anyone

I enjoyed Liz Hart so much that I asked her to be my English advisor after taking Shakespeare I with her. If you need a better English advisor, she's really dedicated, especially if you've already had a positive relationship with her in a previous class.

She loves to laugh @ obscene jokes (usually, she's the only one who gets them cuz Elizabethan humor isn't as funny 400 yrs later). Assigned too many txtbks: they were mostly bks on culture not actual lit, and they all said the same thing. She's really nice & was extremely interested in material. Not my fave class / professor, but it wasn't that bad
She really cares and is sympathetic towards the students. she's a nice woman and good teacher. i really liked her even thought i disliked the material.

By far the worst professor I've ever had. Both for poetry and Renaissance lit., she tests memorization rather than historical significance or meaning. Grading is very nitpicky, assignments are unclear and difficult with little to no guidance.
No Comments
Great teacher! His lectures are very good and fun. I highly recommend him.
Great Course! His lectures seemed a bit fragmented in the beginning, but everything builds up toward later. You do need some level of independence to do well in the class, which is fine.
Does not care about his students and grades homework like exams. He did not offer practice problems outside of the textbook except for one time.
Professor Forghani is very amicable, patient and funny. I loved his class!
Excellent!! He always was well-prepared and had a plan for the entire semester. I learned a lot in his lectures.
He made linear algebra very interesting and enjoyable. I wish my other math teachers were as good as him.
The best teacher ever!!! I realized that math can be fun.

Professor Forghani has a great personality with a pleasant sense of humor. He is a good teacher and genuinely cares about the success of the students. The course is not easy, but you won't regret if you follow his instructions.
The best math professor ever!!! He is definitely funny and makes the lectures very enjoyable. The exams are not the easiest, but very fair.
His lectures are very entertaining and enjoyable. Exams are not very easy but very fair. I am looking forward to taking other courses with him.

At first the class isn't so bad with basic stuff you learn back in high school and whatnot, but then the second exam comes around and as a class we did so poorly that he wouldn't tell us the average. You can tell that he knows what he's doing, but he isn't great at explaining it. So unless you like learning on your own, don't take it with him.

Great person. Very straightforward. Hiliarious. First half of the semester is easy content and it is easy to explain. Don't be fooled by this early expectation. Second half isn't terribly hard but the professor doesn't explain it as well. He gives fair but difficult exams and very little partial credit.
Professor Forghani is very patient. He makes sure that everyone understands the concept before teaching a new one. I was very happy to take his Probability course.
He really taught us the concept of probability. Hi is very friendly and approachable. I would strongly recommend him.
His teaching style is different than other math teachers that I had. His lectures are entertaining. I don't know why some people complained here, but his exams are very fair.
One the best math profs ever I had! Never got bored in his lectures.

People are being overly critical. The class itself - the material, the content - is incredibly easy. Yes, he may be difficult to understand at times and he may not be the best at explaining, but he's good. The tests are fair. He's clearly very smart. If you're taking this class to become an actuary and it's hard for you, reconsider your major.
He is a great teacher and he is a very funny person.
Not clear at all. Going to class was most unhelpful and a waste of my time. Attuned to every class and still had to learn 99% of the material outside of class.
Terrible. Not clear. Offers no help. He realized he messed up when the whole class failed the first exam. He tried to offer extra credit, but his teaching style wasn't good

Hardly explains concepts during lecture and moves through them very quickly (textbook is more useful than lecture), so the only reason to show up is to watch him solve the homework problems. May just be a fault of how much material is in the course, though. Lots of homework, which isn't graded but extremely useful. Tests are apparently curved well.

Cclass is similar to Kasi's. Show up to lectures--he works through every homework problem. This sometimes means that the lecture sucks, but he's helpful outside the classroom. 4 exams and 8 labs, and he drops the lowest grade of each. Skipped my last lab and didn't have to take the final even after getting a 55 on Exam 2--he curves like crazy.

The night before our final he posted a practice exam with no answer key and then I emailed him about it and got an automated reply saying he would be out of the office for the next week (again this is the night before our final)

His course is set up the same as Kasi's 1147. Not the best lecturer, but if you read the textbook and do the homework, you'll do fine. Tests are graded fairly -- he offers a LOT of partial credit. Always do the homework problems and practice tests as most exam questions are taken from them (he provides video solutions).

Lectures are very brief and often end early. I would recommend reading the book because the lectures do not cut it. The homework is optional but the questions may appear on the exam. The exams are very similar to the practice exams. He does curve down though, as an 89 and 80 will be calculated into your grade the same way.

Took prof. Adamson during covid. Useless lectures. Just study practice exams and homework probs and read textbook. Weird way of grading exams. He actually curves down in some cases, for example if you go. If you get an 80 you get a B, but if you get an 89 you also get a B. He said he just "gives letter grades for exams" ??? very weird

His lectures weren't useful at all and I relied very heavily on the textbook. Labs are very easy and almost an easy A. Be careful with the T/F as it could trip you up, but he often takes questions directly from the practice exams. It was nice that he put up grade distributions so you could clearly see the curve for individual exams.

Professor Adamson's lectures during COVID are really not that helpful. The practice exams are exams from previous years, so the actual exams are very similar. The course is easy, he's a decent prof who seems like he'd be better in person. His grading is very confusing, however, and can actually hurt your grade in comparison to normal grading.

A lot of people say he is better than Kasi (who taught 1147) but I have to disagree. During distance learning, his lectures have been absolutely useless, he just reads off his slides and ends class early without working through any practice problems or anything.

Adamson is very lazy. Although he is much better and more understanding than Kasi, he never teaches the 75 minutes of class time. The lecture could be 25 minutes and that would be all he had to say. The exams are 90% the same as the practice exams which is very helpful especially for the true/false. If you need to change your grade he will.

Definitely take honors with him. His exams are never tricky and simply test if you understand the concept. If you attend lectures and do your homework, you will get an A. The key is to do the hw and make sure you understand every problem, because the problems are often based on that. Class easier than 1147.

Hes a lot easier than Kasi. He also curved individual tests so you know where youre at throughout the semester. The way he averages the tests together is strange, but whatever. Make sure you do the homework, although it doesnt count as a grade, it will help a lot if youre stuck between two grades. And thank god for his equation sheets.

Adamson is a pretty solid professor. The exams are hard but about 1/3 of the class gets in the A/A- range so far better than the distribution in the regular section of general chemistry. Also one exam of the four is dropped. A lot of true/false and then free response. Lab is a booster and accounts for a quarter of your grade. Fair test regrades.

75% of your grade is exams, 25% lab. Its super easy to get an A in lab, but the exams are difficult. He gives a lot of true and false, never any multiple choice, and then numerous long response questions. The practice exams are not that helpful except for learning the format. Hes relatively approachable but definitely not my favorite professor

I think Dr. Adamson is a great person and willing to take time to help and his grading is actually quite fair unlike what the person two comments below mentioned. I believe that although he can be a little rude, he is overall a great professor. Exams can be tricky with the true and false so make sure you TRULY understand concepts and HW problems.

Definitely take honors chem with him, it is easier than 1128. Exams are homework problems verbatim, it's an easy A if you do them. Grading is always curved, usually at least a 90 is an A. He is willing to help and cares about his students and wants you to do well. Make sure to read the textbook because it helps you understand lectures better.

Given that 1148Q is an honors course, you should expect more independent learning and a faster-paced course. Adamson does a good job at going over the material, but you'll have to read over the fine details from the textbook (which he goes over). Tests are based off of homework problems. Drops one test and one lab grade. Tests are always curved.

When considering 1147/1148, make sure you took and understood AP Chemistry. Dr. Adamson basically runs you through the text without doing a great job of clarifying anything. If you don't understand, SPEAK UP! He won't elaborate unless you ask. Tests are hard but curved a lot. You won't fail but you might not understand unless you read the text.

Lecture was helpful but often slightly boring. I was able to get an A by reading every chapter in the text before we went through it in class. He greatly curves every exam and even drops your lowest exam grade (which could be the final)The content is challenging but it is not difficult to do well in this class.

Defiantly have to read the textbook. Goes over all information that will be on the test during lectures, and test consist of homework problems varying in numbers. Tests are completely fair and you can do well if you study the material. Super great professor!

I am appalled by the reviews here. Dr Tiky is my favorite professor ever and I have taken him multiple times. Anyone who says something bad is either lying or doesn't take their work with 25% sincerity. I will defend him until I die. He is the greatest Professor and you should be grateful to take him. Long live Lembe Tiky!

Not an understanding professor, you're graded by really only a few things, so if you mess up on one test, it will tank your grade. He also isn't very responsive to emails and difficult to get ahold of. If you can, take another professor for the course.

I think Professor Tiky is not a bad professor overall. He is a really nice guy, and understanding when you have to miss class. The class itself is easy, do your journal entries and you'll be good. The tests and quizzes are not hard at all. Although he can be unclear at times, I think it is worth taking his class.

Professor Tiky is great! I have taken him for a few classes. Participation does not really matter but he does appreciate it. It is only 15 journal entries for the whole semester that you submit at the end before finals. Its about 3 quizzes, 2 tests then the final. He may not know all of the deadlines but he's great.

Professor Tiky was ok I guess. It's all lecture based with slideshows having text directly copied from the book. There's only three exams, all take home, and most questions come from Quizlet. Although it is an "easy" class, I still didn't really learn much compared to other students taught by different profs.

The professor is nice but shows slides he literally copies and pastes from quizlet and Barely explains the content. Let's you do the quizzes at home, which you will find word for word, again, on quizlet, so at least you get good grades. Is very disorganized and confusing. Over all very chill class but you don't learn much

Doesn't grade enough assignments, you'll never know where you stand in his class. Has roughly 2 exams in the class, and a few quizzes randomly placed in the middle of a unit. Goes through lectures too quickly, doesn't post them on Blackboard like he says he would. Do the journals weekly like he says you should, even though it's not mandatory,

I would take Dr Tiky's class because its an easy A. Every quiz was take home and there was 2 exams the entire semester. The final is open notes and only on one chapter. Very easy class, all you have to do is take notes and he is a really nice person!! I hardly did anything for this class and it's my highest grade.

Do not take this class. Even if it's for a gen ed, choose something else. It's not worth the confusion. He does not give clear instruction, and NEVER responds to email the exams are never on what he teaches in class and he doesn't post his lectures online so you have to copy everything quickly in class. this class is not worth the stress, terrible!

Current events journal in class worth 40%. "Suggested" on syllabus to "type entries in electronic file", so I kept them in a folder on drive. Turns out we needed to post them on Blackboard. Got a 73% on it, asked TA who said that I would've gotten 100 if I posted them. Unclear instructions, dropped average from A to B. Emailed prof, no response.
Worst professor at Uconn. Exams are not what he teaches. Boring lectures and never give feedbacks.

Tiky is a nice, funny guy and is an expert on the subject. Class was honestly not that difficult if you take good notes and study for a couple hours before the quizzes/exams. You will learn a lot. You NEED to go to class if you want the notes or to know the dates of quizzes/exams, grading criteria, etc. as he will not ever post this info online.

Wow, this has to have been the least attentive professor ive ever had. Man doesnt respond to emails, is dismissive in person, took the syllabus of blackboard. Even when emailing his TA's they cant get through to him.

Professor Tiky is a really good guy. Slides are hard to condense as all of his slides are full of long sentences and concepts. He doesn't post notes online so go to class. Quizzes are easy but tests are extremely hard but doable. 40% of your final grade consists of 15 journal entries which is an easy A.. He really likes talking about current events

nice guy but do not take this class if you're just trying to fulfill a GenEd. Lecture slides are not posted online so you pretty much can't miss a class, pop quizzes and midterm/final were insanely hard, and if you do poorly on one, you're pretty much screwed for the rest of the course since there are only 4 things graded for the entire semester.

Professor Tiky is a nice guy, and if you get him on a tangent somehow, he has some interesting perspectives. Unfortunately, 99% of the class is just him reading off the slides very slowly and repeating himself. Therefore, the classes seem incredibly long and boring. Still, all the tests are multiple choice and pretty easy. Doing well isn't hard.

Very nice and respectable dude who possesses a fascinating backstory of his earlier life in Cameroon. A shame he reads off useless bullet points for nearly all classes. If he talks about political processes and made all assignments written (and not multiple choice), this class would easily be a 4/5. Instead, the class is full of boring/useless info

Professor Tiky is a nice man but would not recommend this course. Only teaches off slides and does not post online. Slides are super confusing... assignments are confusing. Constantly felt lost in what was going on. There are pop quizzes and exams are hard and not super fair. Do not take if you do not have to.

Prof. Tiky is a pretty easy professor. Exams can be vague but are based entirely on lecture and chapter assigned. This midterm is 25% and final 15% . 2 Quizzes 15%. and Journals 15%. He is willing to correct mistakes by offering ec on exams. Overall it was an interesting class and the professor's specialty in African politics is interesting.

Professor Tiky is alright. This is a very average political science class - long lectures, a little dry, and you know what you need to do to get a good grade in the class. Missing a lecture or two won't hurt you, and Prof. Tiky knows the material pretty well. Can't say I'd recommend this class, but it's not mediocre. The Cars 3 of classes.

Patrick is a great guy and super helpful. if you get lost, definitely go to his office hours because he will explain it WAYYY better than the TA. discussion is boring, but youll find that with any stat class. plus he doesnt make you buy a book like the other profs, and his lectures are high quality. take states with him!!!

Tough material but if you make a good cheat sheet (which are allowed), it should be pretty easy. Homework quizzes and minitabs were basically free points, and he gave free points on exams. Nice guy, not very punctual or responsive to email, but worth taking.

The book was useless. The exams were difficult, but the cheat sheets make it easier. The professor seems sincere. The quizzes and homeworks were incredibly helpful to my grade. Overall, it was a good class/ professor.

This class was rediculously easy. Exams weren't difficult and he gives you free points. Minitabs and quizzes are easy and count for a good portion of your grade. Absolutely no reason to buy the textbook. Takes forever to grade multiple choice exams.

material is hard but he really gives you so many opportunities to get back points. 5 pts on every exam and 10 on the final. replaces lowest grade with final if you have 100/100 on hw quizes (2 multiple choice questions, about 5ish total depending on the semester). didnt like him at first but hes actually a great guy. i was his last stat1100q class

Was a good teacher until it came time for the final. I had permission to take the final later and it took him 3 weeks(night before finals started) to finally get back to me and gave me one day to do it which I was not available. Totally not helpful in this regard, takes forever to answer emails it seems.
Hes very nice. Lets cheatsheats on exams and also gives everyone an extra 5% on each exam. However, pretty boring. But an easy A-B range if you try.

'Paddy' explains everything clearly and gives so many examples. Everything is explained. All notes online as well as partial HW solutions. Exams are IN CLASS. Great guy, easy class if you actually make an effort. And I'm not a math person. DONT BUY TEXTBOOK OR NOTES. ONLY MINITAB
i didn't know what was going most of the time, and this guy was not much help. i relied mostly on others in the class to explain the material. the test was fair.

Hes a good guy, but he is really bad at making this stuff relatable. he was incapable of teaching it in english, he was just constantly writing symbols that nobody understood. That being said it was a super easy class, I just had to teach it all to myself on my own. No textbook and I stopped going to class halfway through.

Patrick is a very nice guy. Although the way he teaches the class is not very helpful at all. I had to teach myself the material before coming to class and that is the only way I could keep up with him. He goes very fast and confuses students often. He states that you should not purchase the book but it is a good idea to do otherwise.
Patrick makes this class so easy. Cheat sheets are allowed on all the exams, and as long as you make them ahead of time and go over the MANY examples he gives in class, you'll be fine.

Patrick is a really good teacher. He gives you charts, draws things out to make sure everyone understands. I'm terrible at Stat, but I got a 100 on his first exam. I still had to study, but he is really reasonable with his tests.

He rocks!! He is very detailed and effective in teaching the material. I admit I'm good at math, but by allowing cheat sheets on the exams Harrington made the class ridiculously easy. (if math/stats is not your thing be warned the class average is like 75-80). Plus STUPID EXPENSIVE BOOK OPTIONAL. Do have to buy Minitab book tho (relatively cheap)

Cheat sheets on easy exams. Makes sure you understand the material incredibly well before moving on. Very friendly and helpful. Gets excited when the class understands and responds. But he never figured out how to get the calculator to display on the projector, which would have been much more helpful.
A terrific professor. He makes everything clear and is extremely helpful. He allows cheat sheets on exams and the exams are pretty easy. No surprises on the exam either.

Patrick is definitely a new professor. His notes are detailed, but he doesn't always explain the meaning of certain things. Very nice guy, helpful. Notes allowed on exams, so those aren't hard. I learned more about stats in my high school class, though.

Patrick is a bit awkward but he's the nicest man ever. he'll spend a whole class making sure you understand the most basic probability problem ever. he jumps a bit when we walks in front of the class (especially when hes excited about the class understanding) Cheat sheets on every exam! Its SUCH an easy A. Take stats with patrick!
The greatest professor ever to walk the hallowed hall of the University of Connecticut. The fact that such an amazing man can be so successful, renews my faith in the American Dream.
Paddy is the man! The class is an easy A even if you don't go to class. He is the nicest person and is extremely helpful in class and out of class.

4 credit class felt like 6 credits. Everybody said their ENGL 1007 was easy and light work. It was NOT light work. Towards the end of the semester, I decided to come on here to see her ratings. Everything said on here is true. The workload is a lot!. This class felt like ankle weights on my GPA in a swimming pool. A nice person but a bad professor
An insane amount of work expected for an introductory English class. She also took months to get grades in. Highly recommend taking this class with any other professor.

Ive never felt the need to use this site before, but for the sake of future students reading this do not take Huey. This course drained me and I still got a low grade. Take any other professor and youll be fine.
DO NOT take this class with Tina Huey. She is such a harsh grader for NO reason. If you have her switch teachers immediately.

She is the worst teacher I have ever had in my years of schooling. She took an easy course and made it extremely difficult. If you reached out to her for help she would make you more confused in the end. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HUEY!!! Worst decision of my life.

The worst regret of my college experience so far. This woman complicates the easiest topics and chooses the most dense readings to follow up with that. The topics in class are so unimportant in real live and have no meaning yet she analyzes everything. Other ENGL 1007 professors teaching the same material have given easier work for the same topics

I wasn't supposed to have her as a professor and she came in to replace someone. That being said, she was dealt curriculum that wasn't hers and she tried her best. But as a professor, she often let her opinions and ego get in the way of being open minded. She wasn't available to criticism and a fair debate. Wouldn't take again.
Was not clear about deadlines and then penalized for not having things done. Was rude to students over email after they were simply trying to clarify assignments.
Just go to class and do the hw and you will be fine.

I personally would have loved the class a lot more if she hadn't taught it. When they say the class depends on the professor this is very true. She's super condescending and is a difficult grader even if you try your best. Don't take her whatever you do.
She was super nice and I loved the class

Extremely tough and boring class, lots of free writing in class, lots of reading, and lots of homework. Even in the snow day youll still have online live class and need to answer many questions which count as participantion grade. Give intelligible homework, never understand what the requirement of the paper is. Give useless unreadable feedbacks
She's class is very boring. Also, she cannot gives you a fair grade, it is better not to take her class
I heard there were better english professors to have but if you land in this class just get it done and over with.
honestly... the amount of work is ridiculous. you gotta go to class and youll have such a headache

This class is pretty rough. She is very condescending. Half the stuff she attempts to teach you learned as a freshman in high school. There are lots of papers and she isn't necessarily an easy grader. You have to put a fair amount of effort in this class to do well.
I personally loved the class and the teacher tbh, I don't like all the reading but it is an English class. I got all A's on my assignments and most of the time I finished last minute .

My favorite professor. Assignments are relevant to todays world and offers a lot of help and feedback. Its easy to get a good grade as long as you do what a student should; participate in class (not excessively but a fair amount), show up to class, and turn in the assignments on time... What you should be doing...

The format is stupid making the course really difficult. You have to read essays from the book, write 6 page essays about something the essay in the book doesn't talk about, using ideas from the essay to propel your paper. Can't find something the essay don't talk about, you're screwed. Might happen with the 2nd essay. Terrible class. Don't take it

Friendly first, but then condescending. Assigns huge papers and assignments due almost every class. Get ready to read whole books in 2 days and 6 page papers too. Gave us P.h.D level work and expected us to read it and understand it, was snarky when kids had a tough time. So unclear about everything and will criticize your paper like crazy

Knows the material very well but the lectures can drag on sometimes. Exams are straightforward - tells you exactly what to know. Don't need to go to class because the lectures are posted online. Easy A course. Unfortunately, Prof. Clifford passed away on his way to class in Fall 2014 so no one will be able to take his class again.

The Propaganda Films class was very easy, but I think he's tougher on the final exam. He's boring. Midterm was an easy A, but for some reason I got a B- on final. Who knows. You can pretty much watch all the war films at home and Wiki whatever you don't get. Long class but good for maintaining your GPA/good for fulfilling the Poli-Sci requirement.
Not the most stimulating lecturer, but a very obviously knowledgeable guy. Fair exams.
Great professor. Exams are very fair. His lectures are not always thrilling, but very informative and can be pretty interesting. It is clear that he knows his stuff - it's actually really impressive.

John Clifford is an awesome professor. He is like a book. Actually he did write a book (that you will be reading in his class). You don't always have to attend class, as long as you read and know the questions that are going to appear on the exam, and he will tell you what they are.

I took him for Pols, Propaganda & Cinema and it was the easiest class. The movies were interesting, for the most part. He lets you do extra credit AND have a cheat sheet for the exams. He can come across as condescending when you answer a question b.c he is that knowledgeable about the subject but I'd recommend this course. Don't buy the books!

Great professor, very accommodating. The class requires you to go to some of the films in order to get an A. Allows you to do an extra credit paper where you can earn up to 10 points on your average. Easily one of the best classes offered at Uconn.

Awesome guy, pretty funny, really knows his stuff. Can be a little dull when lecturing at length. The movies are all hit or miss. Hands out essay questions for exams, the short answers aren't too difficult if you watched the movies. I've had him for two classes: A- in both. Definitely a gem in the polisci department.

WORST professor I have ever had. All he does is stand in front of the class and drone on monotonously for hours. He knows his stuff like nobody's business, but it's painful watching him pace in circles & stare at the floor while going off on some mumbling, barely audible tangent. Puts a PPT on screen at the start of every class but never refers to
Don't go to class!! Just read the book and you'll be fine
Best professor in the political science dept. And he's soooo funny when he does his impressions of past presidents. I seriously recommend taking a class with him if you can get in.

Prof Clifford may be the best lecturer I've had in 3 years of college. He knows his material inside and out. The only knock is its hard to keep up with notes during lecture so you have to do reading on your own. If you dont mind doing some reading on a good topic though, he is one the best you can get.
American Diplomacy and Politics, Propaganda, & Cinema are great classes. Teacher knows his material, tests are easy if you take notes or read his book. You watch good WW2 movies in propaganda class.

a very nice guy. show interest in the class and he will take care of you. he gives you the essay question on the test before hand, so it could be worse. you NEED to read, but its not to much so its not a bad class at all
A very easy and interesting class. Highly recommended. Just do the readings and show up occasionally to class and you should do fine.
very interesting in class! loves what he is teaching and keeps you interested with the small details about the wars and Wilson and Roosevelt. Very easy to listen to and a joy in class!
Clifford's propaganda class is fun, but like most of his classes, it's straight lecture (although here most of class is filled with movies) and not especially difficult.
very picky on identification terms, lectures can be rather scattered. this class is his baby, and it can be interesting - covers all the stuff you never get to in hs history courses

Lectures are engaging historical narratives. He is reasonable, and students need only to read the text in preparation for the lectures and his essay tests in order to do well. There is no "busy work" or gratuitous assignments in this class.
he is kool, fiar, and very interesting to listen to.

I. Love. Her. She is completely fair and ends up changing the syllabus so you get extra credit and lowest exam dropped. Always willing to help. Utilize her office hours, it will be the best decision you make. Easy exams with infro straight from slides. Go to lectures because she hands out extra credit points when attendance is low!
Hard teacher. Doesn't care about students. I only took this course for the credits.
Very friendly and welcoming woman. Her jokes and material can come off to be very DRY! Prepare for a lot of info at once and exams can be very tricky so be on your toes
idk what people are complaining about, she is an awesome professor and teaches things clearly, i mightjust think his because i actually like nutrition tho
She's a very nice woman and she's very knowledgeable but the material can come off as dry sometimes.

Exams come directly from powerpoint slides - no need for the book. For some reason, grades aren't too high but since enough students complained, she decided to drop the lowest exam and give extra credit for attendance. Since most did well on essays, is focusing mostly on that. All in all, not the worst class if you keep up
Awesome professor does everything she can to help you get a good grade.

Unjustified complaints - the class is easy if you have an IQ greater than your shoe size. You can read the lecture slides once, go to the exam, and do fine. Half the questions you can answer with common sense. Essays were a joke and the final was open notes. Boring but easy.
no need for the book..for she literally reads right off the slides she posts online..no need to go to class

if you have no interest in nutrition dont take this class! she basically will test on anything and everything she goes over. if she says its not guna be on the exam it very well may be. make sure you do the recalls because thats what will help you pass this class, there was never any other hw except these which kinda sucked.

Overall she is about average in terms of ease and teaching ability. She pretty much just reads off of her slides (Which are pretty much just copied from the book), but she does cover all material completely. Her tests are fairly straight forward, but require a lot of memorization and sometimes throw out questions on rather obscure facts.
she is awful!! Dont take nutrition 1165 with her!she makes the class wayyyy harder than it needs to be and she does not explain things well at all!

Prof. kinda stinks; very hard to follow along in lectures, as she goes thru slides very quickly. All slides online tho, which is cool. Your very lucky if she responds to an email, cus she is so "busy." Exams multiple choice, but cover boatload of info. No reading necessary, she offered extra credit after 1st exam (which entire class bombed).

ok so I had her for 166. Like people have said, all her notes are online and there really is no need to class, but I went anyway. Slides are really just a slew of unrelated facts and tests and multiple choice, t/f questions consisting of random bullets from somewhere on any slide. She is very flexible with allowing make-ups. NO need for the book.

The notes were all online. However each exam covered a lot of information. Some homework assignments were given but they were really easy and you get to watch a movie about once a week. Make sure you attend class on movie days because questions on each movie are given out and graded.
Everything you need to know is online. There were a few homework assignments and the exams were pretty easy. I recommend taking the class.

Her classes are pointless because she puts all the notes on huskyct. don't go to class and just print out the powerpoints and read them yourself. Tests are hard. The other guy who taught the class is much better (Richard Mancini)

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR LIKE THE PLAGUE!!! TERRIBLE! I was told 165 was a very easy class, but she is ridiculous. Exams impossible (with about 10 exceptions, entire class ended semester with C's), just reads off Powerpoints in lectures. TERRIBLE!!!
An overall interesting class. Doesn't give out study guides or anything so make sure you know your stuff for the exams. Would recommend to anyone with a biology background for an easy A.

Class is more difficult than I expected coming in. The first few exams cover the biology of nutrition rather than interesting stuff, but you get to that later. You really do not have to go to class at all, just print the lecture slides off the internet that she posts after each class. Not too bad of a class.

Textbook is useless. He does everything on Excel, which makes it difficult to actually understand the material. If you memorize how to do all of the problems on Excel, you'll do fine. The MC questions on the exam were difficult, but they're only worth 30% of the exam.

Great professor who talks out the material with you. Uses comprehensive handouts which make sense of the material. Also loves to talk about Xerox. I would take the class with him again if I had the chance.

I hated managerial. I got over 100 in financial and this class was a challenge. Lecture is a bunch of confusing handouts and sometimes he goes way too fast. If you do the readings and actually know whats going on in class its should be ok. The tests are hard and some questions are confusing af. He offers EC and the hw should boost grade

I took managerial and cost with him. One of the toughest professors in the accounting program. His exams are hard (especially multiple choice) and material is difficult to grasp. Very nice old man, but doest give any help or guidance. Every time you ask a question he will ask you back, "well what do you think" and never give you the actual answer.

ACCT 2101 can be difficult if you don't stay on top of it, but if you survived Financial, then this class shouldn't be that bad. Understand the online homework, prepare for the exams, and DO THE BONUSES. I can potentially get an A in the class now just because I did all the bonus assignments. I personally liked this class way more than Financial

Cliff is an awesome guy teaching a decently challenging class. Tricky exams. The lectures can get kinda boring so it's tough to pay attention or even show up to class sometimes, but there's a ton of extra credit opportunities so if you put in the hours the class demands during crunch time you'll succeed.

Cliff is a brilliant and nice older man who is there to help however he zips through lectures and unless you really understand accounting you will be lost during class. Exams are soo hard and also tricky. Put in the work for managerial and you'll do decent but if not you will fail. Book doesn't help, must learn material from handouts & on your own.

Nelson really makes you learn the material. He may not give as many hints on the online problems or bonus assignments, but his classes always average higher on the exams. Definitely do the practice exams and keep up in the book. Managerial is not as tough as financial accounting!
Don't know why he gets such a bad rep on here. Good guy, decent teacher, but the subject can be confusing.
Tough course if you aren't interested in accounting. Do all of the bonus assignments! Make sure you study for the exams, either read the book or do the practice exams he posts.

Material at the beginning of semester has overlap with managerial acctg, but it gets much tougher after the 1st exam so keep up with the reading and hw probs. exams are harder than practice tests posted but similar to in class examples/spreadsheet projects. If you go to him for help on assignments, his only response is " well what do you think?"
The man grades assignments to the xx.01. Who does that?! Horrible professor and is never clear. I have never met a professor who wanted his students to suffer as much as him

Just a terrible professor and I received an A in the course. Goes out of his way to make incredibly easy practice exams and then slam you with the real one. Questions on his exams are unclear and if asked to clarify, he answers, "you'll just have to make an assumption on what you think I mean". Bar none, this man is the worst professor I have had.
very good professor. tough but keep practicing ang go to him for help. one of the most fair accounting classes.
acct

Cliff was a great professor. The material was more difficult at the end of the semester, but he did a very nice job of clearing up any mistakes. It wasn't mandatory to go to class, but you get participation points if you did and paying attention in class for his problems really helped with all the assignments due. Boring class but relatively easy.
great guy. Really wants to make sure you understand the material.
makes the material 10 times harder than it needs to be
Good teacher, just a lot of information to process.
He is a great teacher!

One of my favorite professors ever. So kind and flexible. Participation is most of your grade, but its easy to participate in his classes. He genuinely wants us to learn spanish rather than stress about grades, making it so much easier to focus on actually developing spanish skills rather. Amazing class and teacher, easy A

Prof. Lebel was pretty good. He was super flexible with exams and due dates (a little too flexible). I feel like I didn't really learn much, but he was good. He gets a little frustrated when people don't participate, so try your best to talk in class. He encourages us to be creative which I like and as long as you put in effort, you will get an A.

Charlie is an amazing professor. This class was by far one of the only classes I have actually learned in. Sounds strange because it is a random literature class, but coming from a STEM major, this class has taught me way more than any class ever has. Seriously. Everyone should take this class at UConn as it provides so much insight on our world.

Charlie is a great professor, one of the best I've had at UConn. It's clear how passionate he is about what he teaches and he genuinely cares for each one of his students and wants them to succeed. I never was too passionate about literature but his excitement made me want to learn. Pay attention to what he says about each reading and participate.

I was not looking forward to this class at all but Charlie did make the class more interesting. However, he does not show up to class often, has the TA's teach for several classes, and class was on zoom every Friday. The tests and quizzes are a big portion of your grade and the material is not very similar to the material we cover in class.

This class should be easy, but it is not. He hardly shows up to class himself, and when he does the classes are meaningless. We never have lectures that relate to the things we're actually getting graded on. His quizzes never make actual sense. Every time I bring this to his attention, he sends me a prestigious email back as to why I am wrong.

This class is great if you are very invested in the topics being discussed, if not than this class may not be a bit boring. I wasn't super interested in the class but you can tell this professor really cares for his students and loves to teach this subject.

Best Spanish prof I've had. Charlie is caring and genuinely wants to see his students succeed. I had him Fall 2020 and he was super accommodating and always asked for feedback on how the class was going. He gave me an extension on an assignment. Participation is a grade but he gives a variety of ways to get those points, with extra credit possible.

He was very adept at lecturing about the subjects and introduced them in a very clear and passionate way. Super invested in student learning and was very understanding with work. Grades based on participation, that can be done in many ways, simple quizzes, short reflections and a final. Read the textbook and engage with it to pass.

He is so knowledgable and he cares a lot about your education, but to a fault. The class that I was in was one of the ones where almost everyone in there was taking it to fill a requirement, not to learn, so they didn't care about Spanish. This definitely frustrated him and you could tell. That was the only bad thing, but it effected th class a lot

I really, really didnt want to take spanish this semester but now i am very happy that i did. prof lebel totally changed the way that i see language in general, and i catch myself thinking about stuff i learned in this class just about every day. i only wish my classmates could have taken the class more seriously...

Professor Lebel is very passionate about what he teaches He tends to be fairly forgiving when it comes to classwork and he's very knowleadgable. But, his explanations can be a bit confusing and he often comes across as irritated and annoyed. His class is fairly easy, but I started to NOT look forward to his class as the semester wore on.

Really wasnt a fan of him to be honest. The class is easy but his personality just didnt work for me. He was kind of sassy and rude sometimes. He is not lineament or flexible at all, and loves to refer people to the syllabus.
If you just do the assignments and show up to class you are pretty much guaranteed at least a B. He likes it when people participate. Do the readings and the online discussion boards!

Great teacher, by far the best spanish teacher I ever had. I went into this class terrified because I had never had much success in spanish. Take him no matter what, you will never find a cooler, nicer, or better spanish teacher.

I had not taken spanish in 4 years, but I was a decent spanish student in high school. Professor Lebel was the best spanish professor I have ever had, and he made understanding the material very easy. I had the class 3 times a week, and I missed several classes, but I still got a good grade without putting much out of class work in.

I did very well in his class. Charlie knows the Spanish language very well and is easy to understand. He definitely has an ego which made it hard for me to approach him or talk in class. I think he really cared about our class and wanted us to learn.

I absolutely loved Charlie. He is so incredibly knowledgeable about the language and definitely knows what he is talking about. He has been so helpful in helping me to perfect my spanish and I definitely recommend him and this course to anyone who is serious about the language.

Easy to understand because he's a native English speaker. Kind of has a big ego. Tests are pretty easy, he gives you study guides telling you exactly what to study for. If you participate and put in a good effort to study even if it's just for 10 minutes, you should get a good grade in this class.
Very nice, understanding and helpful. Makes sure class is not boring. Dreaded taking this class before the semester started but Prof. Lebel was actually a pleasure to have!

I've had Prof. H for 3 semesters. Great guy and cares about all his students. The readings are always interesting, and he's very passionate about it. We had short discussion posts weekly, as well as 3 essays (which is standard for a W class). Can't say enough great things about him!

I think we watched like 20 films throughout the semester, and some were on the longer end of 3 hours. All you have to do is submit a blog post on either your viewing notes, or a reaction to a review or article.

I took British Literature I. 80% of your grade is discussion posts and 20% is participation. No exams, no papers. Readings varied from taking 20 minutes to taking me a couple of hours. This class is good for people who want flexibility with their assignments. Overall, he's not a hard grader and he's very nice. I would recommend for a gen ed.

A wonderful and caring professor. He understands the college workload and allows for extensions. He loves when people participate and chooses the best readings for his classes. Very funny and by far the sweetest man on campus!

Has a likable personality but at times can be disorganized. Quizzes are assigned weekly but he is very lenient when grading them, and students are chosen at random to read passages in Middle English or ask questions at the beginning of every class. Yet he is very approachable so he can help you prepare for those.

I had Fratzi for the History of the English Language, aka a very dry subject. Most of his assignments are busy work but they boost your grade. His midterm was take home so taking good notes really helped. Go to class 'cause attendance counts and participate once in a while. He is very helpful if you ask for help and just an all around good guy.

Professor Hasenfratz's class was both enjoyable and interesting. He truly cares about his students and is always willing to let you redo work or help you in office hours. He does assign some busy work assignments but they boost your grade. GO TO CLASS! Participation is a huge grade saver. He is obsessed with MLA! Take this class!

Probably the best professor I've ever had. He's just so awesome! Super funny, a procrastinator himself so if you need extra time on assignments he's more than willing to give them to you. He makes class fun and will make cookies for the class if you ask. I would definitely recommend taking one of his classes.

Hasenfratz is nice and laid back. He's also really funny and tries his best to make class enjoyable and to be approachable.However, I found many of his assignments to be busywork. I also found his strict MLA format grading to be a little ridiculous. Lectures can be dry when talking about structural and theoretical topics.

Extremely nice guy! I loved him as a person and his class was low maintenance and fun. Must go to class though, the reading material was a little boring, and he gives b's on pretty much everything but you get a chance to redo. Super enthusiastic and caring, although obsessed with perfect MLA. TAKE HIS CLASS FOR 2600, OTHERS ARE IMPOSSIBLY HARD
I can't say too much because I had him for an honors INTD, but he's a cool guy and shows concern for his students nonetheless.

I never once read anything for class, did all of the assigments last minute, never participated once and got a B. I was on facebook the entire time fi I went to class. Take it, it's boring but he's very helpful. The reading never corresponds with the work, it's kind of strange, but he's cool! He made us cookies, too
Busy work and classes that are pointless. Better make sure your works-cited pages are perfect because he is obsessed. He did give second chances to get points though.

Though he appears jovial, he will make your semester hell. I had him for Literary Studies and had a terrible experience. He teaches NOTHING in class and assigns monumental amounts of BUSYWORK and reading to make up for it. Thinly veiled New Criticism agenda. Petty obsession over works cited pages. Fixation on the Grapes of Wrath. Hated it.
DUUUUUUUDE! BOB ROCKS!!! ****TO CLASS! YOU WONT REGRET IT!!!!! ahhhhhhhhhhhh!
Amazingly smart and wonderfully helpful. Completely worth the class.
A brilliant and funny professor. Let's face it: most of us are not medeivalists. He brought in recordings and recipes and made Sir Gawain, the Canterbury Tales etc. come alive
This guy rocks!
brilliant, funny, exciting--one in a million!
very talented man

Speaking/lecture wise, Ray is awesome. I always left his section feeling like I had learned something amazing. HOWEVER, he expects a LOT from you. Not very friendly for those who cannot spend a lot of time in the studio. I wouldn't take his classes again but I think that's just because I didn't vibe with him. He's very sweet.

ART1010 + 1040: Very nice, offered constructive feedback, and taught me great tips. Grades quite harshly (an A is hard to achieve). WATCH OUT FOR HOMEWORK LOAD. Must do 2 drawings per assignment. NOT FRIENDLY for those who go home on weekends (I had to b/c of work). Too much expectation on students to have access to the studio at all times.
Tries too hard to be inspiring comes off more as a know it all. If you like boring, dragged out, hard to understand lectures on the meaning of art and life. Then this class is for you.

At first it might be hard to get used to the class. However, if you pay attention to what he says and his comments, you will most likely gain a lot from each session. You'll be fine as long as you do the work and not skip out on/rush the homework. Start the class with an optimistic view.

Much better than his drawing class, but projects can take hours outside class. Usually dismissed class early (just participate in critiques of HW & discuss simple topics). Few short writing assignments. Chance to work w/ clay & learn what makes a good sculpture in a basic sense.

He gives short demos & vague advice. He doesn't use HuskyCT, respond to most emails, or go to office hours, acc to classmates. He's talented but unclear & doesn't give out As often. Tips: Draw all class (ask for help), have all supplies, don't take breaks, & do HW - critiqued in class & submitted later in sem. Don't take this class "for fun."

A lot of people don't like him but those same people tend to be lazy and out of touch. Sorry but its true. My art seriously improved after just one basic class with him. He incorporates the body and spirit into lessons. Easily one of the most special profs in the UConn Art program. A bit crazy but better than boring, especially when it comes to art
I never EVER go out of my way to give feedback on a professor but if I can save at least one person from taking his class, DONT TAKE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!

For the first five weeks of the semester I not only hated the class but I very much disliked Ray. He is often vague in his teaching methods and it can be very frustrating trying to understand the advice he gives you about your drawings. Don't give him an attitude. Once I started listening and stopped ignoring his words I realized he is a genius.

A very popular teacher who unfortunately, doesn't seem to like me very much. I always came to class on time, worked hard & asked questions if I was unsure. Without fail it was always met with sarcastic remarks & a condescending attitude. I'm not a sensitive person but he really managed to hurt my feelings on a few occasions.

Ray was awesome! He was very hard to please but really challenged the class as artists. He is DEFINITELY an artistic genius so take advantage of his wisdom and learn everything you can from him! If you make it very clear that you are trying your best, he will like you and he definitely does not accept any bull from his students.

Ray is the best. He truly cares for the well being of his class. I am a Communication Design student and I took his advanced wood sculpture class because he was teaching it and that was it. He has a personality and a way of teaching that gets taking used to but I seriously love this guy! HIGHLY recommended.

Interesting guy... Either he likes you, or he doesn't. Stay on his good side and maybe you'll get a good grade. He can be verrrrry vague sometimes, but if you just pretend you know what he's talking about, you're golden!

Best teacher I have ever had in my life. I had 7 years of College between undergrad and grad school, Ray is by far a "true artist" where knowledge, heart and soul are part of the process he teaches. Some may find him harder to follow, but it could be they are not on that level yet. I have seen some neagtive reviews, and can only offer than Ray has
lame teacher, frequently lying, uninteresting, his way or the highway, regardless of interest
AMAZING TEACHER! AMAZING ARTIST!
Best teacher I ever had...
Amazing professor. Amazing person. If you have the chance, you should take his class. Very thought-provoking.

Ray is an amazing teacher, but frequently frustrates excessively "western-minded" students. If you think it's a good idea to stretch/meditate before an art class, this is the type of teacher you want! Perhaps my favorite art teacher, ever, and the reason I continued to the MFA level.

Prof. Gabriel is an amazing professor with a wealth of knowledge on African American history and studies. While the class may seem tough (especially with pop quizzes), it all works out in the end. Exams are not that difficult and he drops a bunch of assignments. Doing the readings and studying are extremely necessary in this class.

Great guy, very enthusiastic lectures and very knowledgable about film and American history regarding slavery. Class felt more like a conversation rather than lectures. Weekly GROUP 2-page papers (easy if everyone helps out), 3 book presentations, midterm and final exam. I reccomend!

4994W is a hard class, but this professor helped make it manageable. The huge paper is broken up into pieces with a good foundation. I found the lectures interesting, and Professor Gabriel was engaging and made it more interesting. You do have to present to the class, which I didn't like.

Loved him! He cares about his students learning and he'll love you if you participate. The reading was around 10-30 pages for each class which was super manageable. He covered a lot of the material in the textbook and he does quizzes(super easy one question) based on the readings. Can't say more great things.

He is honestly the BEST professor at UConn! Even though it's History, his lectures are never boring and the content is interesting. There's a fair amount of reading and pop quizzes, but you'll almost always get 100 because of how straightforward the question is. He is an amazing talker and articulates himself well so you understand the material

Professor Gabriel is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is very knowledgeable about the topics he teaches, and you learn about important, yet interesting topics. He is easy to follow, and he is a great lecturer. I highly recommend that you take at least one of his courses during your time at UConn.

Professor Gabriel's lectures and content were interesting and I really enjoyed the class. I will say, there are a lot of reading but if you manage your time well you will be perfectly fine. Also, there are group projects which can be hard with an online class, but manageable. As long as you put in true effort, your grade will be fine.

Honestly the best professor I've had/course I've taken so far. He assigns a pretty heavy workload, there are two discussions due weekly as well as other assignments, but as long as you keep up with the readings and lectures everything will be fine. He was also very forgiving towards the end of the semester with extensions for late work.

If you are looking for an easy 3 credit class, take this one. It is very content-heavy, so you will need the textbook. Reading the assigned chapters is the key to passing with flying colors. There was a midterm and a final, and there were two discussion posts due per week. Aside from the assignments, this is a great class. with a great professor.

Professor Gabriel gives so much work it's absurd. I had him for distance learning and the class was completely online (asynchronous) and we had to do GROUP projects. He also makes you do discussion boards twice a week with three readings minimum and about 6-7 questions per reading. Plus 2 responses. You have to do that twice a week! Absolute absurd

Professor Gabriel dished out an absolutely brutal workload, consisting of long readings and discussion boards that amounted to writing about two pages every week just to get full credit. Certainly a knowledgable guy with lots of material at his fingertips, but gave zero consideration to the sheer mountains of assignments/readings he gave.

Professor Gabriel is knowledgable and passionate about African American history and presents lectures in a very engaging way. You do have weekly group timeline projects, but it's super easy. He gives critical thinking questions for each class/readings and if you understand those you will pass the class with a good grade no doubt. Highly recommend!

He is a nice professor. This class is an easy A but its a lot of work so I would not recommend taking it with a heavy course load but its a class Is definitely worth taking. Topics are interesting and your grade comprises of group projects, pop quizzes, very easy midterm and final with 5% participation. excel in those and you have earned an A.

I recommend taking any of Professor Gabriel's courses. His class is very easy going, he is very organized, and has a great sense of humor. He does have pop quizzes but it is usually one question and super easy. The weekly timeline submissions are a breeze and are perfect in building a high grade. I recommend taking him 100%.

Prof Gabriel is awesome both personality wise and as a lecturer. He makes the lectures very engaging and basically just goes over the assigned reading. It is not hard to get an A in the class, just keep up with the readings and make sure you understand the material. Exams are pretty easy, no trick questions.
A class that's not too difficult, but requires you to attend and actively learn the material if you want to succeed. I took a lot out of this class he's the man.

Great Professor! The class consisted of a midterm, a final, weekly "timeline submissions," pop quizzes, and in class assignments. The class is group based and he gives a lot of opportunities for extra credit. Professor Gabriel is super knowledgable and made going to class fun.

This guy's great. It's a pretty easy class. There are pretty much weekly readings and papers BUT the papers are only 2 pages and done between a group of 4 people. The group project stuff those plus one other paper. Lectures are good, and part of the hw is to watch movies so not painful at all. He's pretty chill and the class isn't really hard.

lectures boring just read off slides. attendance mandatory when there are in class assignments but they are usually announced at the beginning of the week. posted lecture slides for my class. exams harder than should be but you should be okay if you go over notes and actually know the material a decent amount.
never again.

The material being taught is fine and pretty easy to understand, however her tests are very hard. I did okay on them, but the concepts she wrote on the study guide and talked about in class were completely different from what was on the test. She was also rude to students. Its an easy level 2000, but I don't recommend.

Honestly, horrible professor. The concepts given to study on the study guides are completely different from what's actually given on the exam. This class may look easy because it's geography, but trust me, you will be doing yourself a favor if you don't take this. It's literally impossible to get any grade higher than a 60 on exams so good luck.

Boring professor that doesn't really know how to run a class. Doesn't post slides so you are forced to go to class. Forced to buy the most recent edition of the textbook for homework and other assignments. Exams are in lockdown and 50 multiple choice questions, closed note. Advise taking a different course to fulfill a Gen Ed or other requirement.

I should have dropped this class immediately. Do not take this class. Professor is very cold and midterms and final were extremely difficult. Lectures were incredibly vague compared to what was expected on tests. Overall, not understanding and not easy to work with. Listen to these reviews, find a different course to fulfill your requirements.

Content on the study guide is only about 60% of what's actually on the exams. Make sure you pay attention to extremely small details in the class. Got the same score on each exam regardless of how hard I studied. Devastating.

Do not take her class. Her lectures are horrible, she gives a ton of assignments and will take points off for the dumbest things. Gives in class assignments that feel hardly relevant to the topic at hand. Doesn't even teach half of the time and instead has guest speakers come in and talk about their research that frankly, I dont care about.

Lots of in-class assignments/homework that weren't very helpful. Exams were WAY harder than they had to be. Full of obscure questions that were said once. Study guides weren't helpful and lectures were BORING. Fell asleep almost every class and it was 2pm. Hard to get a hold of and isn't always available in office hours. Just take GEOG2100 instead.

Not only was she rarely available for extra help, when she was available, she failed to provide any helpful information to help me improve my grade for the class. Her practice questions before the exam were much easier than the actual exam questions. She never seemed enthused to teach and she never posted the slides.
Tough grader, some hard tests, not very engaging, and does not post any of her lecture slides and takes participation so going to lecture is basically mandatory.

This class is boring for sure but if you study you can get an A. I got a B+/A- on the the tests (there were like 4) but 5 minute class assignments and HW add up and balance out the grade. my class convinced her to post the lecture slides about midway through the year, she's new so she takes advice. overall easy gen ed

Boring lecturer that just reads off of slides adding nothing to them. Has random in-class assignments to try and trick you into going to class. During review she will not answer your questions and instead have other students call out the answers, without writing then down. Exams are based on memorization of random facts barely brushed over at all.

She's a really sweet person, just hasn't quite nailed down how to give engaging lectures and mostly reads from slides. They're not fun to sit through, but lectures are where majority of exam q's come from. Study notes and you'll be fine. Also, I found the textbook on vitalsource, so poke around online a bit before coughing up $100 to the uconn gods

Passionate about the topics, likes participation when reviewing, helpful lectures. All 3 exams are not cumulative but there's a lot of material to review on each. Provides a study guide but sometimes puts additional content on the exam, so it's best to study anything you can. You only have to go to 4 of 8 in class assignments. Very nice professor
The tests were so heavily weighted and they were difficult. Did all of the work and still struggled with the tests. I would take a different class if you're just trying to complete your CAs

Dr. Abu is a new professor at UConn so she is very open to feedback. She's kind, has a sense of humor, and loves when people participate. There's not a lot of homework in the course, just one assignment every couple of weeks. The tests are tricky and she gets her answers from both lecture and the textbook. Just keep up with work and you'll be fine.

She is a great person and clearly cares about what she is teaching. However, her powerpoints can be a bit scattered and leave out a lot of important information that is only said verbally. The assignments are easy and straightforward, but the exams are difficult. They are super specific so make sure to study all your notes !

Probably the worst class I've ever taken. you can understand 1 out of every 10 words the guy says, and his lectures are extremely unclear. You can tell he's an absolute genius but may be a little too smart for his own good. You won't pass if you don't keep up with the readings, he gives you sample questions for the essays on tests but that's it.

He doesn't speak clearly and often goes on tangents. I'm sure he's really smart and if he wrote a book about his thoughts it would be great and all, but he kind of stutters over what he's saying and never finishes it or gets it out clearly. Hard to follow. Scatterbrained. His class is easy enough but I don't recommend taking it. not worth it.......

Retaking this class with Shapiro after failing it with Wheeler the first time, and the difference is astonishing. He clearly knows his stuff, but he went off on too many digressions to be of any help in class when discussing the nearly impenetrable Presocratic philosophers. He offers very few notes and sometimes just loses his train of thought.

Do the readings, trust me on this one. Do them. I took an Ancient Philosophy, the readings are often confusing and long. He does outlines which is good, but you should always attend class and do your readings.
wheeler really screwed me big time. arrogant old man.

He need to prepare for his lectures. He often goes off on tangents, he gets lost, and confused. He'll start saying something that seems important and then he'll get side tracked! It is nice though that he gives out outlines to help you follow along. Also gave out practice quiz questions.
The more understandable of the two professors. Emails the outlines, but they're kind of a mess, so take notes. Keeping up with the readings is recommended.
Long lectures. Emailed powerpoints to student after, however notes were pretty hard to read. Very unclear. Tests were hard.
Wheeler is God.

Lectures are pretty easy to understand, and all the notes are on his website. Exams are tough, with a handful of tricky multiple choice counting for a large portion of the grade. He gives a lot of power to TAs (50% of the grade) -- mine graded essays harshly and gave difficult quizzes, so it became pretty frustrating.

Lecture is bad. Cannot understand him or what he is talking about. Don't really have to go. He puts class notes online though. Read those, plus the books and go to discussion and you can do fine. Tests are pretty easy. Short answer and multiple choice. Asks easy questions.
Easy tests, but lecture does more harm than good. Read the books, the online notes, and go to discussion and you'll do fine.

I used to talk to him in his office and he gave me books by Donald Barthelme, Italo Calvino...a few others. He's into art as well. Maybe he's a better conversationalist than a professor, I'm not sure.
brilliant man, horrible teacher. tries hard, but maybe he's too smart for his own good.
No Comments
had lecture notes on web. Overall a decent fellow
Can't speak in coherent sentences, jumps all over in lectures - need web notes

You are Pretty much learning on your own. He never explained his material well but tests are straight-forward from the homework assignments. However, he never reviews for exams. Cool professor but horrible at teaching.

Enderle is a waste and his program is a waste. He makes you think he is a prominent figure in the field, but he is not. He has not accomplished anything in terms of his research. His classes teach you nothing and do not prepare you for grad school, med school, or a job. His book is awful too. Do not major in BME at Uconn
The class is an easy A. Even the final is a joke (I finished it in less than 40 minutes). Also, he gives a lot of extra credit and everything in the exams is taken from the HW.
Gives a bunch of extra credit and scales ridiculously.

John Enderle is the man. He likes to give out As, and will do everything in his power to give you the highest possible grade. Extra credit is handed out like candy...it's almost impossible to do poorly in his classes.

Dr Enderle is not hard, but you have to put some work in. You have to do well on the homework, and there are weekly quizzes on the homework. The tests are straight forward. The material is hard, but you can get LOTS OF EXTRA CREDIT. If you like to work, he is great. You don't need the text. We didn't use it at all this semester.

Extremely intelligent in his field which actually hurts the students to some extent. He doesn't really understand how to answer questions when students are confused. However, from the ridiculous homework you will think the exams and final will be hard but they are very easy. Go to seminars too; it brings your grade up a whole letter grade.

he is very intelligent in his field, but expects you to be too. the homeworks are hard, but only 5% of your grade. tests are somewhat straight forward and be sure to write fast during lecture. overall, a respectable guy.

Overall a good professor. The homeworks are really hard, but just study the solutions online for the quizzes and exams and go to seminars for extra credit and you will do fine. He is very nice, but sometimes the way that he explains things is not very helpful. Since the material is so easy for him, he doesn't really understand why no one else does
Had him for EE Senior design project, he was rough, he might know alot in EE field but have no idea whatsoever is going on with hand-on experience.
terrible at explaning things and is extremely boring.

He is very bad at explaining things and makes a lot of mistakes. Homeworks are hard but gives tons of extra credit for going to seminars and exams are very easy, straight from the homework solutions on the website.
hard as hell..homeworks are crazy
Okay professor..class was pretty easy.
Boring class but very informative.
Senior Design sucks with him...new students should be happy he is gone
He's alright .... a little boring with the powerpoint presentation but easy class

I have NO idea why she's gettting these bad ratings... Intro anth is not a particularly riveting subject ANYWHERE. But Professor Erikson is really nice, and her grading is very fair. The exams are easy and the quizzes are a really easy way to assure an A, since they count for so much. I'd take her again in a heartbeat.

Very boring lectures. She puts the slides online so it is not necessary to go to lectures, although sometimes she mentions important information for the weekly discussion quizzes. The discussion is based on the readings from one of the texts and are kind of tricky at times. Overall a super easy class, the exams were simple if you study.

Her lectures were sometimes hard to sit through because there was so much information on the slides. There is a lot of reading and weekly quizzes which are based and on lecture and the reader. Lecture attendance is not really necessary as long as you skim the slides online and the reader. Tests were pretty straightforward.

IF you need a general education requirement you would have to be a fool not to take this class. You don't need to go to class or read, just look over the study guide the night before and you will get an A. Who cares if she stinks at talking because you never have to listen, just read the slides on your own. Take this class or be a fool. ANTH 1006

Pretty much the worst lecturer ever. The slides are paragraphs almost straight from the book and she just reads them aloud at light speed. They're posted online though, so don't bother with lecture. My final grade = 104
SUCH an easy gen ed! Just make sure to skim the readings and go to the discussions sections. I found the class pretty interesting although the lectures are a bit boring. EASY A!!

This is literally the most painful and ridiculous class I have ever taken. She has the most monotone voice and reads directly off her slides which is directly from the text book. She requires so much supplementary reading each week which you are quizzed on and those quizzes are 20% of your grade. She is also extremely rude when you ask for help.

Professor Erickson is very nice and the TA's are funny at times. Always go to discussions, review slides, and try to get a 90+ by not studying the night before :) Oh ya and quizzes are 20% - 2 points each...don't fail any

Looking for an easy class whose lectures you can skip? Look no further! Only the discussions are important. I read over the powerpoints on HuskyCT the night before the exams and got 90s on both. So easy.
Easy class. Make sure to go to discussion weekly. Quizzes are sometimes tricky, but the midterm and final are straight from the slideshows and reuse quiz questions.

Very easy class. Going to lecture isn't necessary but you should definitely attend the discussions (because of the quizzes and attendance grades), and it's almost easier to read the textbook as opposed to the powerpoints which are rather wordy. Prof. Erickson is very nice and an easy going teacher for this gen-ed.

Worst lecture I've ever had. She literally reads her slide word for word, and it comes directly from the text. I didn't go to lecture once after the midterm, and still got a 93 on the final. Just read the book and you don't have to go. Exams are really easy, just use the study guide and it's impossible to fail.

Professor Erickson is useless... she literally copies sentences from the text book and puts them on powerpoints, then reads the powerpoints word for word during lecture so fast that its extremely difficult to take notes. The exams are somewhat easy but she asks you to know way more than you actually need to for the tests.

Basically she has powerpoints literally overflowing with words that she runs through. Going to lecture is kind of pointless because she reads to fast to take notes and says nothing other than whats on the slides. Easy enough class but luctures are a drag.

It was very disappointed. It was her first time teaching that class when I took her and you could CLEARLY tell! Her notes are STRAIGHT from the book, and she FLIES through them during lecture. The first half was awful; the midterm sucked. However, I think she got the hint that it sucked by noone ever showing up, and the final was a breeze
Sweetest person ever!! Her TA is equally amusing! =) Great class, very laid back. Very interesting assignments. Would recommend it to anyone. Fair graded.
cool, liked her a lot, would take her again

Great class, definitely recommend it as a lab course. The lab aspect can be tedious with complex and sometimes overboard lab reports. However, the TAs are pretty open towards providing assistance. Onto the lecture, Getty's great, he genuinely wants to help his students succeed, you just have to be willing to work for it.

If you're looking for a non-lab science class, take this one. Patrick is a really good professor and explains all of the material very well. All the homework is online, and you get multiple tries. He offers tons of extra credit, even a trip to Dinosaur State Park. Participation with your iClicker is mandatory, and he uses it every class.
