Professor Getty is an awesome professor! He's super passionate about the material and even cracks jokes now and then. He offers extra credit assignments and structures his class to the benefit of his students. He's also great at explaining material in case you didn't understand it/need clarification.

Professor Gonsulin-Getty is great guy & made this class on 'Natural Hazards' a good one (contrary to what I heard). The topic of the class is interesting and relevant to everyone's life; he adds to this by having great lecture slides and visuals. He is very passionate about the information he is presenting and his grading is very straightforward.
Iclicker questions make class mandatory. All material is on the slides that you need to know for the tests.

His tests are a bit difficult, but there are a lot of opportunities for extra credit. Lectures are boring but all the info you will need for the tests are on his slides. There are no tricks. He is really interested in what he's teaching and cares about his students.

Class is fairly easy. Exams are straight from the lecture slides, and the online homework is a joke. You can't skip every lecture though because he does iclicker participation. The only bad thing about this class was the lab (if you take it). It's really long/exhausting and gives an unnecessary amount of work, but it's not difficult.
He's a good professor, nothing to complain about. If you pay attention in class and study a little bit that's all you need to get an A

I liked this class and most of the material was pretty straight forward. The exams are multiple choice so as long as you study they aren't too bad. He also offered an extra credit field trip to Dinosaur state park for anyone who wanted to go.
Very unhelpful overall, despite demonstrated interest.

Patrick is a great guy. He is engaging and cares about his students. This is a decent class if you put in the work. Lectures are somewhat interesting. Easy homework, but you have to study a bit for the exams.

Exams are based off of the lecture slides. If students don't do well on the exam, they clearly didn't even try to look over his notes. He gives extra credit opportunities and is always willing to help. Great person. Give him a chance and you'll see it isn't as bad as you think.

Class is interesting and is a great way to get non lab science credits. He puts diagrams in the textbook on the exam so if you bother to look at the book you are at an advantage but book not necessary. Getty is a great guy and provides extra credit to those who show an interest in their grade. You have to come to him, he is super available!

Really intelligent professor who knows how to bring the knowledge down to our level. The exams can be a little tricky, but study the powerpoints carefully and you'll do great. With that being said, attendance isn't mandatory if you study but if you don't then go to class. Book isn't necessary at all.

Nice and easy A. As long as you look at the slides (I used flash cards), you should have no problem with his tests. He is a good and passionate lecturer and truly cares about dinosaurs. Take if you are looking to get a Non-Lab Science out of the way.
Most boring prof ever and grades unfairly.
He is the worst professor I have ever had-avoid this class at all costs!

I love this professor. She is probably the nicest person you will ever meet at UConn. As for her class (Spanish Lit. in Translation), as long as you do the reading you will be fine and she goes over the reading in the next class. There is extra credit so its kinda difficult to fail her class and she drops quiz grades. All in all, phenomenal.

I took this class because of the reviews on here mostly. I am a straight A student and I'm getting b's and C's for this class. It's ridiculous and I can't stand her grading. Don't take this class if you're expecting an easy A. This class is gonna bring my gpa down. I'm struggling with this and I have an almost perfect 4.0. Ridiculous.Can'tnd it
I was excited about this class until I realized that she grades unrealistically. Im 4.0 kind of student so i do not understand why i am getting mostly b's and some c's on her quizzes and essays...

Professor Bucklin was a pretty easy professor, but she is not a native speaker of Spanish, which makes the class feel less authentic. She was good natured but she pushed group activities and projects a bit too much. She rarely checked homework and she gave a lot of easy A's
She is very helpful and patient. Just review the powerpoints she goes over and pay attention in class. Homework is minimal. Take the investigations seriously.

I went to lecture a grand total of three times and still got an A in the class. The class was a joke, but was a gen-ed so it was a nice GPA booster. I didn't open the book even once and the slides were online so the only thing important was going to discussion sections.

Go to class, pay attention, at least skim the readings, and you will do well. Pop quizzes are easy if you at least skim the readings, writing assignments are easy, and if you come to class, you should learn everything you need to know for the tests. Just pay attention. Don't skip class - attendance and participation count.

Professor Bucklin is such a sweet woman. I enjoyed her class so much because though she is soft-spoken, she is always enthusiastic. It is very easy to get an A in the class if you read the books. She gives out pop quizzes and they are really straightforward. Her exams are fairly easy too. I highly recommend everyone to take this class!!

Great professor, fairly easy class. Very easy to understand and an easy grader. Class attendance is mandatory though, but that didn't matter to me because i loved the class discussions and the professor. There are weekly quizzes (easy), hwk assignments, one oral midterm presentation and a final (oral+2pg essay) this is a great class!
About halfway through October, I stopped going to class, yet I still pulled off an A- in the class. This is a great CA 4-Int. if you're looking for an easy one.
Easy class. I slept through most of the lectures and just read the powerpoints and have an A in the class easily. The quizzes are simple and the midterm was very easy.

Easy A! HOmework and tests are a breeze! I didn't have to crack the book or come to lecture all semester, just studied the powerppoints she posted. Discussion sections are easy too, just write your weekly homework about something from the powerpoint and raise your hand a lot in class.

This was possibly the easiest class i have EVER taken as for Prof B, she really didnt know what she was doing. Her TA's do all the work and it makes the class seem a lot less real. she reads from the powerpoints that she puts online. Its very easy and quizs are a joke, If you can deal with a fairly boring lecture and decent hw load, take this class

Awesome, awesome teacher. Super easy work and super easy to understand her when she speaks. I even missed my oral final exam and she let me come in the next day to take it! No other professor would be so nice. Really need to attend class, though. But that wasn't a problem for me because I loved that class so much.

I wish there was a rating for "talent" or "instructional ability" because I would NOT give this prof a 5 in that category. To be fair, she's really nice, but oh man, is she ever boring. I LOVE literature, and I have trouble staying awake in her lectures. Also, she runs her class like we're all in high school, which I find disappointing.

great professor. very friendly and makes you feel comfortable speaking in class. this was a fairly easy class and she grades the projects very easily. not the most interesting spanish class, but I do recommend it if you want to perfect your grammar and sentence structure.

Prof. Bucklin is a really nice lady; her personality makes you feel comfortable in class. The class itself is boring because it's entirely analyzing literature. However, she tries to make it interesting by having group work and showing the occasional video clip. Kind of a tough grader on essays, but overall a pretty good professor.

Prof. Henning is very boring. His teaching style is monotone and he doesn't explain things well. Class is graded by a few assignments that don't have very good guidelines and explanation. No exams but a lot of projects.
Rude and condescending

Graded by a few, vague assignments with no clear guidelines on what needs to be done to get a good grade. Midterm and Final are loosely guided papers. Lectures are so boring. The prof himself is a nice guy, and I get that he loves his field, but he sucks at teaching it. The final has almost nothing to do with course content, no rubric either.
Lectures are so boring. Assignments are minimal but they are hard. He's teaching style is monotone and he doesn't explain things well. He just rambles without any real structure to his lectures

The lecture is boring, exams hard. I try studying but the material is so unbelievably boring I can't retain any of it. It's not just his in-class lecture. He'll assign online reading that will be on the exam but he doesn't touch over all of them in class. He is very picky about how he awards points on open-ended exam questions.

Honestly a nice guy but not a great professor. Professor Henning doesn't use/post slides online and if you're not paying attention during the whole class, every class, taking good notes, the final and midterms will be rough. This class is boring and professor Henning dials far into minutia. Rough class.

Pretty easy to get an A if you do the readings and show up for class. Exams are heavily based on what he lectures. Definitely need to study for his exams a little bit to get an A. His grading is fair. Not as difficult as people say.

Dr. Henning is great at his job. Human Factors Design is by far one of my favorite courses I have taken at UConn. While the material is not necessarily "easy", it is very interesting. Dr. Henning does a fantastic job relating material to real life scenarios. I would take another class with him in a heart beat.

There is a lot of reading for this course and it helps to read the assigned chapters BEFORE the lecture so you already have background knowledge of the material. He doesn't really use powerpoints and when he writes on the whiteboard, it's usually just one word about the topic. Make friends and study groups for this class!!

Took several courses with him, served as his only undergraduate research assistant at the time. He knows his stuff inside out, not a particularly lively lecture but everything is more than fair. Great working with him learned a great deal and has shaped a lot of my current research interets

No slides. All exams depended on his oral lecture and he was pretty specific on exams so you need really good notes. Class average for exams was usually in the 70's. He did curve and allow to argue why you chose your answers but he was very into his own ideas so sometimes he would just disagree. Would definitely take with someone else if possible.
Dr. Henning is a very nice person and an excellent professor. He wants his students to work hard and learn but if you are a good student you will be fine!
Very ambiguous material, does not clarify what he will test on, boring, not very passionate about material, and does not seem to care about his students.
Has delusions of grandeur; self-aggrandizing; obsessed with outdated theories. Lectures are as stiff as his wardrobe.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

professors.name: Hanna Aknouche
professors.department: computer science and electrical engineering department

reviews.review: She talks in a very monotone voice and reads words directly off slides in her videos. She shows no emotion while teaching and doesn't explain topics more than just what's on her PowerPoint. What was asked on HW assignments was much harder than what was covered. Much better choices of professors for 2050.

Her lectures are rather boring and not the best and homework assignments were often not very clear, but she was not as bad as some people say. She actually care about her students and it is clear she put in a lot of effort into this class. She is understanding and helpful if you need feedback. Not the best professor but she's trying.

Really makes me sad since this class has great material applicable to coding interviews in the future. The class itself is not bad but she is honestly the worst teacher I've ever experienced. She doesn't teach but just reads off slides and her monotoned voice puts me to sleep. Most of my learning came from watching youtube lectures

Dr. Aknouche-Martinsson's lecture videos may not be the best, but she really shines during her Learning Activities and Q&A Sessions. She is very helpful and always checks to make sure everyone understands what is going on. She is also very accessible outside of class. This class is going to be challenging no matter who teaches it.

Hanna is really not very good at lecturing, her presentations are dull and hard to understand. However, Hanna is very understanding, and I think she knows she's not the best teacher, as she gave many opportunities for extra credit, and it seems like she has a good deal of lenience on assignments. Also, the organization of the course was impeccable.

Hanna is a nice person with a good sense of humor, but she is not that great of a teacher. She teaches entirely off of her lecture slides which have a lot of info, but this makes it more difficult to pay attention and learn. However, she is aware of some of her shortcomings and offers good help with homework and some extra credit points.

She is very passionate and knowledgeable. However, she does not convey this during her lectures. I attended every lecture and could not stay awake for a single one because of her voice. I very rarely fall asleep in any class, so that's saying something. She is also very against giving partial credit. I failed a test and barely ended up with an A.

Hanna is a really nice lady who clearly cares about her students. She was always accessible and gave good feedback on homework assignments. Her slides are informative and straight to the point, but make sure not to cram as it is a lot of material. Overall, Hanna is a solid choice.

Not the best CSE professor but not the worst. The code for thoughts are frequent and barely count towards your grade. At least the homework/lab is a good chunk of your grade. Exams are hard, but not unbearable. Lectures can feel very long and pointless. She also said she didn't know Python well which is what the course was taught in???

She is clear and exceptionally well organized, which made it easier to understand and keep up with the course. Although her lectures are pretty dull, maybe a result of the content itself, she is accessible and provides good feedback.

I enjoyed the class I took with Hanna. She was a caring professor who wants the students to learn the material and do well. She focuses on the main points of the algorithms and is not unreasonable by any measure. She is happy to help students outside of class/office hours. I don't think people give her enough credit as a new professor.

I thought of concussing myself to get out of this class on multiple occasions. Two midterms and a final made up a pretty hefty percentage of the final grade. Unbalanced exams w/ half the grade dependent on the two last questions with no chance of partial credit. HW was the only reason I passed. She's absolutely awful at explaining the material YEET

We didn't even know our grades from the first exam until after we took the second one, because she said we all failed and she didn't want to make us depressed. She was actually the worst professor I've ever had I wish I could give her a 0.

Horrible Feedback. HW Solutions released day before exam. She explains all algorithms with mouth. Visuals are rarely provided. If they are available, they are wrong and she doesn't fix them after lecture. Exams are not given back. Memorize your solutions and compare them with the Exam Solutions to see how you could improve.

TA's grade homeworks way too hard that are worth half your grade and everyone failed both the second and first midterms. Really hoping she curves the test were way too hard with not enough practice examples in lecture.

This class is very hard she tried to make lectures interesting but the material is just so dry its hard to pay attention in class. The TA's grade the homework way to hard and its worth half your grade. Half the class failed our first midterm and probably failed the second exam as well i just hope she curves.

The material in this class is pretty hard but your chances of not failing the exams significantly increases if you actually go to lecture. Hanna's lectures describes the concepts in a much clearer way than the textbook does and she also makes it very clear as to what she expects us to know for the exams.

Dolan's math class is tough but rewarding as with all Calculus classes. There's a ton of homework, but it helps the material stick. His dedication makes the difficulty manageable. If you put in the effort, you'll come away with a great math foundation thanks to Dolan's excellent teaching. Highly recommend his class.

Dolan is a really funny and chill guy. The class has a lot of homework and is very test-heavy. Exams were considerably harder than the quizzes so make sure you study well for them. I would definitely recommend taking this class with him if you have the chance.
GOAT

Prof. Dolan is an awesome professor who really wants to see his students succeed. He is a funny person and very amiable. I have no problems with him (personality or jokes) but the class is heavy with homework. There are worksheets and online work that must be completed every week. It's helpful though because it requires you to write it all down.

Prof Dolan is very nice and fair in how he grades your work; however, his class is very test heavy. There is a lot of homework due each week, so you will want to make sure you do not procrastinate and get it done in timely fashion; however, it is helpful in your learning. The prof is accommodating and accessible so don't be afraid to ask questions.

I loved Professor Dolan! I took his class this past spring where courses were still virtual, but he made himself very accessible and let me have extra time on assignments that were giving me trouble. Tests are very heavy on the overall grade, so be prepared to study and use the textbook when studying/reviewing HW assignments! Great lectures.

I joined the class late and he gave me a generous extension to catch up. Lectures are very clear and uploaded online. Office hour class times. Work is through WebAssign. A lot of homework but it's to help you. Textbook is there for you to use if you want but it's not really "mandatory" per se. One of the best math teachers i've ever had.

I took Prof Dolan for Calculus 2. Calculus 2 is definitely one of the hardest math classes to take so you will have to put a lot of effort into the course. That being said Prof Dolan had worksheets that were due every week that were helpful because you actually had to write the work down. But exams were pretty difficult, just study and put time in.

Very straightforward professor. Lectures were good even when it was online. If you watch the lectures and do the webassign assignments, you should easily pass. Also gave me credit a few times when I made stupid mistakes. Great guy, great professor.
I don't know if it's just his online lectures, but they are very long and difficult to follow. 10/10 do not recommend.

I took him at CCSU, I honestly love his teaching, If you really struggle with math he genuinely wants you to do very well and help you understand rather than just pass and he will see that in you and you will definitely pass.

Best professor for math. He helps you so much when you need it. Lots of homework though but its to help you understand. Do not be afraid to ask any questions because he will make sure you understand it. I took him at CCSU but by far the best math teacher I have ever had in my whole school career.

Good teacher and chill course. He was easily accessible and easy to ask questions too. There are quizzes every Friday but mostly group quizzes and he makes sure you know everything for exams. Just show up to class and you will do well! He wants you to do well and is well respected.
Excellent professor. Explains things clearly and effectively. Cares about students and available after class.
Professor Dolan cares about students and he explains everything well. He will make sure students are prepared for the exams and is available for help after class.

The man's a god. I took his Calculus I class over the summer and He was honestly one of the best teachers I've had at Uconn. He teaches super clearly, he made the homework easy, his exams were highly straightforward. No joke, I got a 102 in his class.

Extremely a good professor, took him for summer session, it was my first time taking Calculus, stayed after class and he explain the material so well. I wish he was teaching calc 2 but he is going to teach calculus 3. He really cares about the students and will explain things until it is clear. No regrets taking his class

This is good class. There is definitely a focus on theory, but you learn some implementation details as well. I wish there was more practical programming (the most you will do is implement some filters in MATLAB), but you will learn whatever tools you need to implement future projects. 3 midterms, but your lowest won't factor into your grade.
Comes prepared to the class and conducts lively sessions.

Prof. Willett has been one of my favorite professors at UConn. He is very intelligent and explains the course material with both rigorous math and realistic examples. He covers a LOT of content, and he doesn't require you to be in lecture, but I would strongly suggest going as this is where he does examples. Exams are almost exactly like HW.

I took ECE 6122 in Spring 21, ECE 4131 as an undergrad with a different prof. Both classes concurrent. Willet covers more material than other professor. H gave examples where a certain technique is used beyond the textbook content. If we do math, he makes sure to say whether it's important or a formality. He is also the angriest Canadian ever.

Really great guy, lectures are very fast and I had to do a lot of extra reading on my own. But, he gives you all the material you need to get a good exam score if you study hard. Definitely recommend him.

Exams worth too much, no projects to enhance student understanding. Uploads many solutions but skips many steps and handwriting is unclear. Ignores parts of emails and refuses to answer some questions. Favored students who took the class in person as those who took exams online couldn't upload work! Likes to be vague, making studying difficult!

This is the worst class this year for me. Lectures were unfathomable with his horrible hand-writing and the assumption that everyone is always up to his speed. I did not like how he threatened to fail people when the 1st exam average was below 30/100. If you are in his class, make sure to attend OH, know your probability, and pray for your exam.

I had Dr. Willett for ECE4112 and overall my experience was pretty great. Dr. Willett is very inspirational and his English is phenomenal. The lectures are the BEST and I just love hearing him talk. The HW's and Exams are pretty impossible as they should be for a 4000 level class. He is also pretty chill to talk with.

He posted the wrong email in the syllabus. He refused to respond to emails over the summer regarding COVID-19 and how class would be run. He updated the syllabus three times and it still has the wrong email listed.

THIS DUDE THE BEST i highly recommend his english is great which makes the class an absolute joy. Also very passionate about the material. Delves pretty deep into the theory some times so get ready to take notes till your hands fall off.

Definitely the hardest class I've taken so far at UConn. That being said he is a good lecturer and made the 3hr night class we had bearable. Goes over examples in class and the exams are ALWAYS based on the homework. Homeworks are super tough but count for little. 3 exams with a final and one exam dropped. Only recommend if interested in material.

Professor Willett has remarkable English skills compared to the vast majority of the faculty which results in better comprehension. However, he dwells too deep into the theory rather than using effective examples to introduce understanding. You will learn more through the textbook than his lectures. Great guy, teaching skills need improvement.

Took Communications theory with him. DO THE HOMEWORK for the class! They're the only thing that will get you a good grade. His lectures are difficult to follow, and his handwriting's abysmal. He didn't upload any notes or ppts or even a copy of the syllabus with the chapters in the textbook, which made preparing for exams nearly impossible.

The exams were long for the 50 minutes we had to do them, I almost never finished and I knew the stuff. Besides that the class isn't too bad. He talks at the speed of sound when he lectures so get ready to write fast.

I think he has eased up a bit on the work load based on what I've heard about him from past years. I didn't think the class was too hard. As long as you study for the exams and do all the homework you should do fine. There were a few tricky questions on exams but there were enough fair questions that you can still do well.

Sadley, Dr Willet was better than most of the EE faculty when I went through the program there. At the time, he taught classes in communication theory, and I recall asking him if Marconi did this much work to invent the first radio. He said "yes" and believed it. UConn is great for theory, but you'll never learn how things actually work in practice
Tests were ridiculously long for 75 mins. Tested more on your test taking ability than anything. Quite hard to follow his lectures...

Genuinely a really great professor. Makes himself very accessible to students and roots for his students success. Also a really funny guy and makes a tough class easier to be in. Great guy, great professor.
I witnessed him eat the 2x spicy noodle challenge in his office and shrug it off...the final boss of spicy food. He's a great professor who wants students to succeed.
He's an amazing professor, and he goes above and beyond to help students outside of class and genuinely wants them to succeed. It's a hard course but he prepares you well for it.

Pierce is an amazing professor. He's always available for extra help and is clear about what will be on the exams. Come to class, give time to study, and you'll do fine. Chem 1128 isn't an easy course, but he makes it very manageable.

Be prepared to study and read the book. The tests are hard but doable. He is constantly available for extra help and wants you to succeed. Disregard the upset people below, they probably never showed up to class.

In my opinion, you will learn 70% of the material from the class and your expected to learn the other 30% on your own time. Dr. Pierce doesn't have time to go in depth with every unit that we end up covering. Overall, he's a hilarious professor and offers help outside of class. If you study hard in the class, you should end up with B+ or higher.

The best chemistry teacher you can have. He drops your lowest test grade, and offers lots of help outside of office hours. He's a humorous dude who just wants you to pass! Only downside about his class would be having a test every other week, but it gives you more of a chance to raise your grade rather than 1 midterm and a final.
Great professor! It's a tough course but he is always open to helping students after class and wants his students to succeed.

He was a nice guy, just didn't feel like an introduction course was the right kind of class for him to teach. Also didn't curve any tests even with the class average being under a 60 nearly every time.

Scott was good. He explains topics clearly, and he is highly accommodating to your needs. He is accessible outside class for office hours and extra help. The class itself was hard, obviously because it's chem. Scott is great. Good luck!
Dr. Pierce is the best!

Amazing professor! He is always accessible outside of class and is super helpful. Extends office hours to help students and wants them to succeed. The course is tough but is definitely do able, just pay attention in lecture and ask for help
He is very passionate about teaching Chemistry! Great professor.
Tests are super difficult, the drop out rate is high for a reason. He wants to help, but he can't teach. Don't take at ur own risk.
would not take this class again terrible at teaching.
0/10 would not recommend.
A good lad
Scott is THE BEST TA EVER. He makes lectures interesting and lab is really fun with Scott. TAKE HIS CLASS

One of my favorite professors in sociology department. I did all her assignments and showed up 3/4 of the times and spoke in class sometimes; received an A with ease. Just be careful that she will assign a lot of readings; skim through books but pay attention to shorter passages because she will ask questions about articles in exams!
Pretty easy grader. She assigns many readings, but doesn't go over them all the time or in much detail either. Do the written assignments and go over the slides and you should get an A.

Professor Katuna is a real sweetheart. She was a bit disorganized with keeping up with the syllabus but overall, it was a good. Getting up at 8am was difficult so I missed quite a bit of class but still received full participation points. Speak up a few times and keep up with the assignments and an A is yours.

Other than the fact that she does not go over the readings very much, Prof. Katuna is excellent. She teaches well, using many real world connections and visuals. We had to do a paper; its fine as long as your chosen topic. Shes also an easy grader, even in an honors class. Everyone regularly partook in discussions. A great class overall.

Dr. Katuna didn't really have a clear plan of what she wanted to do during each lecture for herself; she often would build her lecture off what other students would say in response to her questions. Super easy grader though.

Barret is hot. made me want to go to class, usually hard. seriously though shes a great teacher, clearly cares about the material and her students. grades the rough drafts of the 15 pg paper a little harshly but she makes up for it by giving great advice and rewarding you on the final paper and final exam. take it for an easy A- or A in a W class.

Barret is a super sweet woman who wants to see you do well in her class. She's extremely lenient in her grading of the few (3) tests that she gives throughout the semester, and values good writing/the ability to get your point across in any written assignment (be forewarned, there is a 10-page final paper). I could never say anything bad about her.

Barret is pretty boring. She doesn't seem to know how to come up with or express original ideas, and her presence added very little to the class. The entire course felt like a waste of my time, but at least she was an easy grader.

Class was interesting and she made it very interesting with actual speakers with cool experiences. Lots of reading, but only need to really read the stuff that has assignments (which is about half). 10 page research paper was only real hard assignment. Really really easy grader though, write well and youll get in the 90's on everything.

Barret is a cool professor. I took Sociology of Gender with her and it was your typical feminism class. The only assignments, besides in-class writing assignments randomly assigned from the previous night's readings, were two tests (mid-term and final) and two one-page journal assignments that are easy. Pretty chill class, but nothing amazing.
Young, new mother, personable. Discussion based so that classes are taught by both herself and the students. Good method if you like participation.
Took as an elective and actually liked it. Lots of discussion and help if needed, but honestly just read the book and you will do fine.

I really enjoyed this class; it's very discussion based but you don't necessarily have to participate if you don't want to, it's interesting just to absorb what everyone else has to say. Barret is very kind and teaches in a clear, easy to follow manner. If you like writing, you will love this class (though there aren't many assessments)
Wouldn't take it again but it wasn't awful.
Definitely take this class! Nice professor.A lot discussion, tests are open-minded.

We had a small class so there were a lot of discussions about the topics which was helpful. There was a 15 page paper which was killer but I got an A on it. Exams straightforward. Go to class and skim through the readings. Easy A. (i took it as a W)

I thought she was a really fun teacher! Her sense of humor kept the class going, and her notes were crystal clear. Study the packet of notes and keep up with the minitabs. Great professor to take stats with!

She does not answer emails and the tests are hard. The notes that you have to print out are super long and waste too much paper and money so I just would make the text smaller and minimize the amount of spaces used. Overall, she's a nice person and an okay teacher.

I didn't care for the class, or professor Benjamin. She never answers emails or texts so good luck with getting in contact with her. Tests were hard and class was so boring. She has you print out notes to fill in each weeks, notes are between 13-20 pages. Overall she needed to be more accessible and actually take some pride in her job and classes

She was clear and to the point. She provides students with the lecture notes ahead of time, so it's easier if you print them before class so that you know what she's talking about during lectures. Three exams, one of which was the final -pretty easy if you take good notes and comprehend the material. She is willing to help & allows cheat sheets.

If you ask for help Bahati will 100% do whatever you need. She may be the only prof that assigns every minitab assignment as homework but its not to bad, just time consuming. Lectures are bearable as she has a funny/cool personality that keeps it lively. Her exams aren't exactly like the notes, you must comprehend the material fully to do well.
shes the best stat professor at uconn! the nicest professor ever, super willing to work with you and very nice grader. Anyone that isnt great at math! This class is for you!
Really chill and sweet professor that is willing to help! Do the hw and pay attention and the exams will be simple and easy!

I took Stats at WeHa and she is probably the only professor that can make a 3-hour lecture tolerable. Professor Benjamin is a good professor who's really cool. She keeps the class interesting and the exams aren't too badm if you know what you're doing. She gives you a cheat sheet and goes out of her way to help students.

One of the best professors I ever had at UConn West Hartford. She was very nice and funny. Posted note pages online for us to print out each week and fill out as our notes in class which made it very easy to follow along and ask questions when needed. Also made studying an easy task as well. Allows a cheat sheet for exams which helped my grade.

Really great teacher, so easy. 2 page cheat sheet on every exam including the final, 20 questions that are basically the same questions as the practice exam. let's you out like over an hour early on long classes.

Lectures: copy notes verbatim into a "class notes" book you buy with the text. Gives out extra credit here and there. Potential for 20 EXTRA points to an exam. They are boring but better than reading the book. Tests are around 20 Multiple choice, and easy. Over all its UCONN saying here is 4 credits and an A+ take it, as long as you do the work

She was a great professor. She constantly stopped during class to make sure everyone understood the material. She was also very helpful if you do not know the material. She also allows cheat sheets for the exams.

Attendance not mandatory. Either you can go to class or read the book. All the information in class is presented word for word in the book. The lab is mandatory - but if you do not go to lecture, it serves as a classroom environment refresher. Tests were easy. 20 mult. choice - concepts on the exam were given beforehand and a sheet of notes allowed
Pretty much the easiest stat class there is, test are a breeze

Extremely easy class; don't need to go to class as long as you get the notes from someone. All we did was sit and copy notes from the overhead and discussions usually lasted about 20 minutes, if that. Easy A.

The class is really easy. Most of the time I like her, but sometimes she can be moody. She let's us out of class early a lot. She doesn't always explain things though so you have to go look in the book. Not the most interesting class, but easy and she tries to make it fun.

Professor Turchin is okay. He only taught the second half of the course and was an improvement from the first half. The material is a bit all over the place, but tests are open-note and he posts slides every week.

It's been a few years, but I've returned to say this. Prof. Turchin is, well, 'okay.' The thing is, I felt he did not measure up to Prof. Adams, who taught the first half of the course. While I wouldn't say Prof. Turchin is terrible, he's much more 'run-of-the-mill' than Prof. Adams is. Again, he isn't bad, but I wouldn't call him 'fantastic.'

Prof. Turchin is good at communicating material in the second half of the course. It's interesting when he talks about his research. The exams are tough though, because you need to have a broad remembrance of the contents of each lecture... with many examples seeming kind of distantly related to each other.

Surprised by bad reviews. Prof. Turchin posted all his slides and was very interesting to listen to. He had an accent but It wasn't difficult to understand him. Overall very interesting, approachable guy.

I'm surprised by all the negative reviews of Turchin. I personally really enjoyed his portion of the class. Like Prof. Schlichting, his tests are directly from his lecture slides. He also puts the Clicker questions on his tests, so make sure to write them down. If you show up to class, you should end up with a decent grade.

DON'T TAKE! It's impossible to do well. I missed 2 of the 22 painfully boring lectures, & still wound up with a B. No matter how hard I studied, I couldn't get over an 80 on any tests. He asks clicker questions in class, never tells you what the correct answer is, then puts those same questions on the test, expecting you to know them.

Focuses on specific examples on the exams and final! His section of 2244 is worth 75% of the final! CLICKER QUESTIONS COUNT GO TO CLASS! They tell you exactly what is on exams so just do study guides posted online! Read textbook! Heavy accent (Russian)

Great class. Dr. Turchin teaches the second portion of EEB 2202 along with Dr. Schlichting. It is not required, but I found buying "War, Peace, and War" helped as it gives additional insights and some chapters are not required, but it helps with the understandingexamples of the lecture. He is a really cool guy. Would recommend his class.

Turchin is a very smart man (seriously he has a Wikipedia page). But perhaps a little too smart to be teaching an introductory Ecology course. Exams are straight from the lectures 100%, and are somewhat clear, medium difficulty, some tricks. Overall, I would say try to avoid him, but I'm pretty sure he's the apparent Messiah of the EEB department.

Turchin drags on monotonously in lectures while making things as confusing as they can be. Even if you study his slides and read the book, many of the exam questions will be about his own research. I don't recommend him as a professor.

Evolution & Human Diversity is an easy A if you show up and pay attention, rather than facebooking during class. Gives points for attendance & extra credit for posting articles on a facebook group. A little hard to understand his accent at first, but you get used to it. Highly recommend this class to fill a CA 4 requirement.
Teaches the second half of Evolution and Human Diversity. What he teaches is the cultural side of evolution, his lectures were always interesting. Good gen ed to take if you're interested in science.

professor turchin is great. the first day of class i was like OMG this is going to be horrible. stick to it. his class is interesting. he is nice. the TA's are awesome (i had Kat) if you study your material, read, and go to class an A is easily attainable

Dr. Turchin was a bit hard to get used to, but once you know his teaching style, he is actually pretty funny. His Russian accent is hilarious. The quizzes were pretty easy if you did the study guides. He genuinely wants to help students and answers questions but I can see how he might seem intimidating. Sometimes lecture is boring though.

I had this professor for the W portion (the writing part of Ecology). He was such a jerk! He failed my first draft over a single misprint in my sources page. When I tried to sit down and talk to him about it on how to fix it, he acted like I was wasting his time and tried to hurry me out. He is rude and doesn't care about his students. Avoid him!

This teacher is AWFUL! He speaks very bad english with a very think Russian accent. Refuses to wear a microphone yet has a very large class. Doesn't quiz or assign homework but fails to effectively prepare students for quizzes. Is never available for office hours and if you do manage to track him down, he offers no helpful answers.

PHYS1502 is SUCH a difficult class, but he makes it as easy as possible. Smart, caring, & funny. Curve on tests & graded leniently. Final worth 16% & midterms worth 12% each. Hw & lectures helpful. Labs are frustrating but also educational. Lots of grade boosters like hw, readings, iclicker, & tutorials. Does exam review sessions. Highly recommend!

He's a solid choice for physics 2, I don't regret taking it with him. His exam reviews were great and I appreciate them, but his exams were still VERY difficult. He curved them. The class is very difficult and it has a lot of information, he kind of throws it all at you and puts it together later. He cares about teaching and I would recommend him.

Purposely makes exams harder but curves them to make up for it. AMAZING exam review sessions, honestly learned more in those than lecture. Exam reviews and practice exams very closely mimicked actual exams. Made some jokes in class, plus has a British accent. Understands that material is inherently difficult. Didn't give enough time for iClickers.

I really enjoyed Professor McCarrons class and the exams are EXACTLY like the practice exams just slightly different! For someone who hated physics in high school I did very well in the class. If you study and pay attention to the IN CLASS examples, you will do great. Only open ended on the exams.

Honestly really disorganized but a nice guy. Exams were easy except the final which had a few curveballs and dropped me to a B+. HW is not at all like the lectures but it's doable. Lectures weren't really helpful and were only on the really basic stuff

Dr. McCaron is a super smart guy, but explains simple concepts in a way that is way to advanced for a gen phys class. Other than the sometimes confusing lectures he makes practice questions for tests that are extremely helpful and adds a curve so that it takes a lot to do bad in this class. He also is very helpful outside of class if needed,

Professor McCarron does a pretty good job of teaching the material, even though the subject can be pretty difficult to learn. Clicker questions in every lecture so attendance matters. Labs are not very hard.

He's a great professor, and I highly recommend that you take any of the courses that he teaches. He genuinely wants his students to succeed and is more than willing to help you in any way possible. The course is pretty challenging... so if you're struggling, then take advantage of office hours! The British accent is a bonus!
The class is eh but he's a pretty good lecturer. Clicker questions count for credit so you have to go to lectures. Exams are kinda hard but he curves them.

Daniel is fantastic!! I really hate physics but I really loved him. He really makes an effort to explain difficult concepts. He also goes above and beyond to hold review sessions before exams. His exams are tough with no partial credit, but he does generously curve. Extra bonus of having a British accent. Would definitely recommend him to others.
Great teacher but his exams are hard. He curved pretty hard for my class on 2 exams as well.

He's actually a really nice guy and a good teacher but his exams are very very difficult and he is a tough grader. You're going to have to put a lot of work into his class or you won't pass. Make sure to study well ahead of time to do well. Even though the grading isn't exactly fair you learn a lot from him.
Great professor. Content is fairly challenging and there is a LOT of content. Really tries to do his best to teach us the content. Outside of class review sessions before exams are very useful.

Favorite professor I've ever had. The tests aren't easy and there's always a lot of work, but it's well worth it in the end. I learned so much, and he was always so willing to help during office hours. Concepts were very well explained. This class made me want to minor in physics (and Dan's British accent makes lectures even better).

He really is a solid choice. However the material is difficult. Everything for homework is online and he uses clickers in class. No textbook is required. He is very approachable and really wants his students to do well. He is helpful in office hours as well. It was his first year so he didn't make his exams as well as he could have so he curved.

Really good professor, brilliant man. This course is HARD, so make sure you attend lectures. He is very passionate about the subject which helps my overall experience. He gives good feedback and tries his best to prepare us for exams.

Whole class is not structured at all. Doesn't give deadlines/guidance then punishes students for this. like if no one volunteered for presentation dates, they would be assigned, then cancelled class because no one volunteered and even told a student that people who couldn't go bc of this would just not get a grade and it wasn't his problem.

There have been so many occasions when I was up late collecting data. The assignments are not graded promptly so its very difficult to gauge your progress in class. I have had to sacrifice much of my free time for this class and I would not recommend it if you have a busy schedule, especially during finals week.

This class really teaches you what it's like to do research. You learn a lot of skills and learn to work independently. It was unlike any other lab I've ever taken. BUT the course requires and intense time commitment. I often spent 15 hours per week in the lab and stayed past midnight quite a few times to get data.
Great class, great professor. Requires a lot of time in the lab besides scheduled hours. Expect to have to go in on weekends, etc.

Truly cares about students and is a very nice guy. Lectures are a little bland but powerpoints are posted online and are easy to follow. Problem Sets are a good guide to study for his exams, the review sessions help a bit as well. Exams are harder than the first half...but if you don't understand something he is very approachable Overall great prof

Great class, he teaches it with Zweifach. Both profs. are good about recording the lectures for you and making problem sets that help you study for the exams. His sets are less faithful to his exams than Z's but they are still fairly useful. Study for this class and you will do well, the professors give you every advantage. No book :D

Dry lecturer, though his slides are ridiculously detailed, so it's easy to go back and view a concept. The problem was that the problem sets that were supposed to be used to study the exams were released literally a day or two before the exam and that left little time to do and understand 80 or more problems. Definitely puts in an effort.
Great professor, really cares about the students.
Great class, especially if you plan on doing research/grad school. Cares about his students and class is pretty easy material wise but erquires a time comittment.

Awesome and a great teacher. Qu's from the exams come from problem sets (non graded) so make sure you do them for yourself. During the review session they go over answers to the problem sets so it's good to go to those otherwise they dont post the answers til last minute. Final exam was not cumulative, and they dropped the lowest grade.

Dr. Knecht is a great professor and one of the most caring in the MCB dept. For the people who complain about test scores, you have to note that this is an upper level undergrad course and that you have to apply yourself. Its your major for crying outloud, deal with science or choose another major.
every tangent imaginable...

Just about the worst bio teacher. He tells you he doesn't go into details, but then asks you the fourth step enzyme of a 7 step reaction. Go figure. Also everywhere with his teachings, this is a while ago but on his second exam the mean was a 58. yeah.
No Comments

He's not hot(!!) but he's extremely nice, smart and seems like he cares whether you learn and are interested in the material. He's probably the best teacher i've ever had in a biology course. (I'm a grad student.)
No Comments

I have taken multiple classes with Dr. Gage. He is a Professor that cares more about you learning the topic than getting a grade. Due to this, the exams require very little effort to study for and you're given a bunch of extra credit. The papers he chooses are interesting to read and he clearly knows what he's talking about. Would recommend.

Dr. Gage is a nice person and is willing to help you if you seek it out. However, he is not the most organized and is not the best when it comes to technology. Most of what he says in lecture is on the whiteboard and not on his slides. Therefore, if you don't show up then you won't be able to do well unless you get notes from your peers

The class material was interesting, but the professor is not the best with technology. He always lectures using the whiteboard and never records class, so you are screwed if you skip this class. As long as you have taken some sort of microbiology course the content isnt that hard. The majority of the tests come from the problem sets he gives out.

No... just--no. Class is so disorganized. You will get lost in lecture 20 minutes in. The best you can do for yourself is read the textbook. But even then, he's barely specific about exactly which textbook sections correspond with lecture material, and not all the material he expects you to know is in the text. Enroll with caution.

Don't take this class. Gage and Graf have absolutely no idea how to teach a class. The grading criteria is so unclear that at the end of the semester you see a B/C in the class and have no idea what went wrong in that class. Never posts any grades on huskyct and labs are super annoying.

dr. gage is very full of himself, i will admit that, but he is an amazing professor. he is intimidating, so it's hard to ask for help, but when you do he will. gave me an extension on an assignment. all the exams are essentially the problem sets. even though its 8 am, go to class because he talks outside of the powerpoints. my fav class at uconn!

I thought he was very clear. Most of his exam was based on his problem sets. He had homework that was based on what was taught. I was one of the undergrads in the course so we had a weekly discussion separate from the grad students not that they couldn't attend. It was an overall good course that I remember well.

seems very full of himself. you can tell he does not spend much time putting the exams together considering some questions do not even have the right answer as an option. curves really well but that's only because the questions on his exams are ridiculous. kids dont learn anything because all they have to do is look some answers up to problemsets
Good teacher overall. No answers given on practice problem sets makes the class much harder than it has to be. Really like how he uses handwritten notes on overhead because it keeps a realistic pace.

I don't remember much, but he was a boring teacher, and kind of a jerk. Didn't learn anything new that wasn't in genetics or general bio.. The crazy older man who taught the first half of the course was MUCH better.

you judge for yourself: a professor who yelled "stop sleeping in class" to a student who asked him to clarify what he just said. A professor who told his students that he doesnt care what students wrote on the evaluations because he wont be fired anywayz.

He's really clear and explains things and you can expect whatever he teaches to be on the exam. He doesn't teach off a powerpt only, mostly writes things out on the overhead, which I liked. The notes still correlate with the slides he does use, which he posts online.

I really like this professor. Unlike most professors, he didn't use Powerpoint and focused on writing on the overhead himself for all the notes. He explained everything clearly and was "perky" for 8am in the morning. The tests are easy, but what's wrong in that?

Dear Dr. Gage, maybe your class is full of idiots, but I aint one of them! (I think everyone else feels the same way too.) You can't be a proffesional without treating your class like professionals. and PLEASE please please please please, stop asking stupid quesions on exams. Maybe do something athletic too (hiking doesnt count).

Big dork and a hothead. Saw him swear at a kid in a test cause he sat in the wrong seat. Explains clearly but maybe too clearly- always "talking down" to you at lecture... impressed with his own intelligence relative to sophomore class. Avereges 1 question/exam with no right answer! Probably reads this website.

He seems nice and that his topic is easy, but its not. You find this out on his exams. Although his lectures are pretty clear and he moves at a nice pace, he's boring! Just a very plain guy that gives exam questions that weren't really explained in lecture.

Awesome professor - goes out of the way if you ask to make sure you understand material. Very fair grader. Practice exams are identical to regular exams. Does not curve, however normally not necessary. Second class I've taken with her (Linear Algebra and Multivariable Calc) and loved it. Boring-ish lectures but great explanations and pacing.

She's not the worst professor in the world, but she is absolutely relentless. As soon as the class starts she will start doing problems way too quickly to follow and she will not stop until a minute or two after the class is over. She is willing to help, and if you go to her office hours to ask about a worksheet she basically gives you the answers.

She gives out typed notes where you fill in the blanks. The course is generally pretty easy and she's a very good teacher. Quiz every week are based on the optional homework she assigns. Great teacher but she tends to lose track of time and so you have to remind her when class is over.

I have gotten an A in every math class I have taken here at Uconn and I got a C+ with her. She is extremely boring is hard to pay attention to. Then when you do pay attention she spends most of the class trying to correct her own algebra mistakes. She gives way too much work and takes off a lot of points for the smallest mistakes on everything.

She gives you guided notes and fills them out with you during class, and they cover everything that will be on the test. The tests are basically HW questions from the worksheets she gives out and webassign with different numbers, and you are even allowed a notecard worth of notes. Very good teacher, easy exams, easy class.

She lets you use note cards on tests, quizzes are directly from assigned homework and worksheets. If you do the work, its such an easy class. I took Multi with her and am taking Linear with her now. Amazing professor, lots of office hours.

Is honestly one of the most confusing math teachers that I've ever had-- Googling questions was more useful than sitting through lecture. Will need the textbook to study for the exams, do attend the discussions (the TAs are generally more comprehensive than she is)

I took Ela for Multi variable Calculus. Honestly, I would recommend taking this class with another professor. Ela makes a lot of algebra mistakes and grades tough. Also, she assigns hw and worksheets that take up so much time. She harps on the wrong concepts in class and always goes over the allotted time. Take a different teacher and get an A.

I didn't hate this class nor the instructor. In my opinion Professor Celikbas did a good job this semester. Yes, sometimes she was fast and she made a few algebra mistakes. But she was also very good at pointing out the important parts of the topics. Office hours were very helpful.

Do not take this class! She teaches WAY too fast in class and does not answer student's questions because she doesn't understand them. She literally teaches so fast that she gets out of breath during lectures. She has everything for lecture pre-written, so she expects people to be able to write like 3x faster than she teaches. You have a lot of HW.

I really hated this class. She's not a bad person, she just isn't a good teacher. She makes a lot of mistakes during her lecture and we end up having to start all over again. She uses difficult explanations for simple problems, and there is online homework 3 times a week which gets really annoying. Tests are okay though, gives a study guide.

she often shows the hard or long way to solve a problem instead of the easy way. she never seems organized and ends up rushing through the material, which then I had to use to Q&A center or the internet to figure how to do the work . she uses web assign for homework, which is more frustrating then helpful. I do not recommend her

Ela is a very boring, unorganized professor. Often she would spend class time going through proofs of theroms that we did not need to know. Then she would try to crunch all of the important info into the last bit of class, and almost always went over the allotted class time. Avoid if you can.

Professor Celikbas was an amazing profesor! Her lectures slides were very specific and in class she went through every slide thoroughly and wrote every step down for the student to understand. She made office hours constantly available and encouraged students to assist discussion hours which were very helpful. She also has an awesome sense of humor

Decent professor. Goes through lecture slides ridiculously fast, kind of expects you to know how to do everything even though that's why you're taking the course in the first place. Online hw every week but gives you a lot of time to do it. Exams are multiple choice and doable. Very helpful if you go to office hoursoptional discussion hours.
Good guy, really helpful, and his lectures are very clear and easy to understand. Exams arent that hard either if you have a basic understanding of the topics.
Prof Plante is a really good teacher. He's super nice and he makes the material really easy to understand. If you go to lecture then you shouldn't have any problems in his class.

I like prof Plante. He is not a tough grader. you have worksheets graded on completion, webassign, and exams. The exams aren't crazy. He seems like a very kind person and he teaches well. I recommend him.

W Proffessor. He teaches very well and very clearly. He is passionate about the topics and also knows them really well. His grading is very relaxed and the class is set up well. He is very forgiving and wants to help. If you are taking Calc 4/ diff eq take it with him.

This class was very easy - honestly, it felt like middle school math. I would recommend 1020Q to anyone studying humanities looking for a Q credit. However, this professor was very disorganized, often did not teach methods completely, and then asked you to explain them on exams. All of his lectures were from the book, so you can teach yourself.

LOVE HIM! Hes such a great professor and it is super evident how passionate he is about what he teaches. Attendance isn't mandatory but his lectures are always very helpful and I really appreciate how he engages the class the possible. if you have to take this class make sure its with Matthew!!!!!

AWESOME teacher! He's one of the best math teachers I've ever had, and is THE MAN when it comes to explaining touch concepts. Some of the midterm exams can be hard, but the final is usually easier. Do the webassign a week in advance though, since those are the most tedious part. Most of the content was easy, but beware of Laplace transforms!!!

Matthew's lectures were always good and easy to learn from even at 8am. He forgot to carry constants a lot, but it never took away from the actual differential equations. Tests were always fair, and he usually hinted at what type of content would be on it. If you are able to do the worksheets and WebAssigns, the tests should be easily doable.

Lectures were absolutely 10/10. He is VERY good at teaching and does a fantastic job doing that. Everything else is pretty meh. Its hard to get material to study for exams and adding the Worksheets and WebAssigns means a LOT of homework. It got to the point where I prefer the quizzes in Calc 3. But he really does an amazing job at lecturing.

Plante is a good professor. His lectures are pretty nice, on the better side when compared to other professor I have. He explains the concept pretty well, but sometimes it gets confusing and hard to follow. Fortunately, he has pre recorded lecture videos which clears up all of the doubts I have. Overall one of my favorite of my college career.

Professor Plante is a cool guy. Most of everything you learn are from the lectures and he truly makes the class easiser to understand. Three exams including a final and webassign homework every week. There are two presentation problems which are a piece of cake. Overall great class and great professor. Take him if you can.

I had Plante for Differential Equations, and found him to be a very good instructor. He wants everyone to do well---the two presentation problems are pretty much free points. His lectures are very helpful, and he is flexible with office hours. The exam format is rather strict but can be done in the allotted time.
Dude has no idea how to teach. He's the worst professor I've had at uconn and I hope he doesn't get rehired.
Hes a super nice guy. Not at all intimidating. Very approachable and laid back. He is a very tough grader though. You have to answer exactly how he wants you to or hell take points off.

He's a super difficult/specific grader. Marks you down on exams for not answering questions he didn't even ask. Is definitely looking for very specific answers and doesn't accept anything else even if it's correct.

She gives note packets during lecture w classwork on tu and a short quiz every thu + weekly homework. The work is manageable, but it kinda felt like I was in high school the way she taught. 2 exams + final, and she has exam reviews before each. She's a good prof, she cares abt her students, but there's also better profs who teach this course.

Wonderful professor! Always willing to help you outside of class during office hours. Professor Fiore is awesome! I would definitely recommend taking 1020Q with her, she really takes the time to help you understand the context of the class. Also the projects we had to do for class helped connect the context to the real world, which is great.

Professor Fiore was awesome, but MATH 1010Q was sooooo boring. If you're looking for an easy class, this is it, just beware that it can drag. She's great at explaining the content, and grades are clear. Every week you either take a quiz or do a project, along with homework problems online.

Great class for those not interested in math. Quizzes every two weeks, projects every two weeks, homework roughly every week. Midterm exam with cheat sheet allowed. Final is choice of project or exam. Very straightforward and decently digestible course content.

I took this class to satisfy my Q requirement. She really cares about her students and the class itself is easy and the material isn't hard at all, also coming from someone who absolutely hates math. She does make some mistakes but overall good professor.

It's an excellent course for people who aren't big fans of math and need a Q course. Dr. Fiore does a great job at not lecturing the material but teaching it to you and truly cares that you know how to solve problems and understand the topics. She creates fun projects and assignments as well! She does post the notes, but I recommend going.

Doesn't post exam reviews in time, doesn't cover extra examples in class, constantly makes mistakes and has to get corrected, WOULD NOT recommend if you are trying to learn this material for the first time.
Makes so many mistakes and never explains throughaly

Lectures and note shells provide only the fundamental info, and Dr. Fiore taught at a slower pace than I would like. With that said, the worksheet material and exam reviews were more than sufficient to pass every exam. Homework assignments are online. and require you to wrestle with Cengage. This is the only shortcoming of the class.

I didn't really like the way she lectured but I think that might be a personal thing. She had really good notes. I used Steve Crow on YouTube for all the lectures because he uses the same textbook and I liked his teaching style better. But I would also take notes from her lecture notes after watching Steve Crow.

She is super nice and uploads very detailed note guides for every lecture. She definitely wants her student to succeed. The only thing I would critique is that exams are worth a lot of your final grade, and they are usually about 20 questions, so each question weighs pretty heavy on your grade- but that's just a MATH department thing, not her

To be very honest, I didn't really like her way of teaching. I usually skip lecture and teach myself the content. If you took AP calc in highschool, you don't need to worry about MATH 1131Q to begin with, because I could do a lot of it from memory. Quizzes and Exams are pretty easy and reflect what you did in the worksheets.

I really enjoyed Dr. Fiore this semester. She really seemed like she wanted us all to do well. She uploads extremely detailed notes to HuskyCT. The only critique that I have is about the tests. Each test is only out of 20 points, so each question really matter, but I am not even sure if the test outline is up to her. Overall, she is great!

I really liked professor Fiore. She was super kind and understanding, her lectures were easy to follow with the note packets. There is a bunch of homework and assignments, but it is so helpful towards studying and learning the content. She really cares about her students well being.
Ms. Fiore is a great professor for Math 1131Q. She creates note shells for the lectures so students can follow along during class. Quizzes are every week but they are manageable.

Some of the material can be dense and difficult to get through in the allotted class time. I attended office hours somewhat regularly and found Prof. Renfro clear and helpful. Definitely attend class and ask questions. Would absolutely recommend his classes.
He knows the subject matter and explains it very well. If you want to actually learn thermodynamics take it with him.

Definitely one of the best professors I've ever had. He is a great lecturer who is very knowledgeable in thermodynamics. I found his classes to be very interesting. While I know some people found the class difficult to do well in it definitely provides a strong basis in thermodynamics.I was on exchange in UConn from Ireland.

Had him for Thermo 1. The lectures are extremely important for understanding, the textbook turns out to be kinda difficult to understand. He is fairly good at teaching and cares about you actually learning the material. Exams are hard, do the homeworks and understand them. They are important. He grades tough but fair.
I hate this guy so much. He will make your life more difficult.DO NOT USE THE SOLUTION MANUAL.
awesome teacher.. go to class and dont use the solutions manual (he will fail you), material is not hard if you pay attention

Renfro was a good professor. Even though he was very hard at grading he was fair. Class is fairly boring but you learn a lot. Do your homework and DON'T use the solutions manual, it will only hurt you in the end (he looks for students that use it).

Very poor professor. I thought he was a TA at first and then later found out he was a professor. I found his method of using each class to do a problem or 2 on the overhead to be extremely useless. Kind of professor that makes you think you're wasting the thousands of dollars you've spent on the University. I recommend avoiding him at all costs.

Renfro has been one of the better professors I've had here at UCONN. If you actually go to class, make use of the notes AND practice problems he gives out before tests, you will do well. He is NOT an easy-grading professor, but you will learn a LOT if you work hard. People probably have bad reviews because they aren't willing to put the work in.
horrible teacher. probably the harshest grader i've ever had. avoid class at all costs.

The bottom line is that Renfro is the worst professor I have had to date. He teaches class mainly by "showing off" how quickly and easier he can complete problems, offering minimal help to students. He isn't helpful outside of class and doesn't respond to emails. He grades homework harshly and gives hard tests. Do everything you can to avoid him.

worst teacher ever, if you have to take any class that he teaches take it with someone else!!. hard tests, grades all hw harshly and gives hard pop quizzes. doesnt curve and just not someone who should teach stay away from him if you want to continue in engineering

Renfro doesnt mess around with those who dont want to give his class a shot. He is personable and very concise with material, and he tries to learn everyone's name by the second week. On that note though, if you are realizing you can toss in hw rather than attend class and miss the recap quizes, he will be able to recognize those who dont care

Bad bad teacher. makes you use a program no one in the entire dept uses. Makes hard tests that are nothing like the hw. does't explain hw. very bad prof, he just wants to do research and doesn't care about class.

This class has me at my wits end. I feel like he's not even trying sometimes. The slides he reads off of didn't make sense to him today so he told us they might be wrong. Then never corrected them or told us what to do. The exams were both horrible. The project is turning into a bit of a nightmare. Idk what to do anymore this class depresses me.

I'm gonna be honest when I first saw the format of this class it terrified me. 85% of your grade from exams and quizzes?? yikes. However, I learned so much and have come to love both the subject material and Dr. Goberman's teaching. To top that, the exam was actually insanely easy and quizzes are always fair. You can't go wrong with this class.

Great professor, he makes a 2 hour class at 5 pm exiciting and you can tell he loves what he teaches. Uses lots of case studies to explain how the concepts taught in class have been the cause of many material failures in the real world. Decent amount of content to study for exams but he keeps the questions straightforward

Great professor, but does NOT believe in ANY extra credit. Also, he makes a lot of inappropriate comments and claims he's not politically correct to justify his actions... he should stick to just MSE. Regardless, great guy and wants you to succeed in his class.
Best professor I've had. You'll learn so much.
Awesome dude

The greatest human being alive. Genuine person and really wants you to learn the material. His foundations of engineering class is very straightforward and very interesting. Goberman is very easy to talk to and tells hilarious stories. I wish UCONN had more teachers like him.
Superfantastic

The most amazing Professor in the engineering department that I have met yet. So funny and loves what he does. Knows so much about the material and can answer pretty much any weird question you could have. I look forward to his class every tuesday and thursday. Tests are easy so it makes it easy to enjoy the material instead of stress about it.
Amazing Teacher, really knows the material. Straight forward tests.
The most perfect human being on the planet. Just the greatest class I have ever had.
Great teacher. Good sense of humor. Wicked easy. At least half of the exam questions are directly from the HW, literally word for word.
fantastic teacher. its a very interesting class, and he makes it incredibly easy. exams are pretty much right off the HW. also, hes a hilarious guy
Excellent Teacher!!!

Resul Cesur is one of the worst professors I have ever had, he's a nice guy but terribly lazy professor. His class is based on two exams and a final. Students are asked to hand in 1-2 questions for extra credit and he uses these questions on his exams. He literally is too lazy to create his own questions. Would not recommend.

Doesn't use class time well. Class is boring and he mainly draws graphs and doesn't post any informational slides except his confusing class notes after. It's hard to stay engaged in class but class is the only place to get relevant information. Even then, he tests concepts not explicitly discussed in class and not in the book. Exams are awful

I cannot stress this enough... DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH RESUL CESUR. I had him for two classes this semester- HCMI 3243 and 3240 and they were two of the hardest classes I've ever taken; they weren't hard because the material was hard, they were hard because he does not know to teach or communicate with students. 10/10 DO NOT RECOMMEND.
Was upset when we ask questions, upset when we don't. Test heavy and overall has a bad attitude towards students. Blames students when they don't understand a topic

The professor is very unorganized. He would say we were going to have a quiz on one day and not post it until very late or not at all. Some days he goes over the same topic excessively (making it more confusing) and other days he flies through lecture. Incredibly test heavy. I am smart but I feel stupid in this class!

BEST PROFESSOR EVER. He is disciplined, straightforward, and has high expectations. He cares immensely about students learning and knows the subject matter inside and out. Very much so a Turkish genius.

For teaching some of the most important classes of my major, you would expect him to take grading seriously. I almost never went to class (multiple classes with him) and never got below an A-. If you submit your work you'll get a good enough grade regardless of quality. Senior paper (70% of grade) was terrible by my own standards and still got an A
He required a term paper, which could be done as a small group of 3 people. He gave poor guidance on requirements for term paper.
Unclear and seems very unorganized.

Cesur is a great professor. He breaks down the material very clearly and makes sure everyone understands everything. Exams are fair if you study the concepts. No homework; no textbook needed because he posts chapters on HuskyCT. Two brief news articles which are leniently graded. Definitely a course I'd recommend to anyone interested in healthcare.
Very lenient with his exam grading. If majority of class doesn't get the problem, he won't count it. Very clear on what you need to know for exams, interesting course overall
Questions on tests poorly phrased, confusing. Hard to know what he is asking.
ONE OF THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD. HOWEVER, HE IS SRICT, RIGID. GRADES ON CURVE.VERY KNOWLEDGEABLE .Dr Cesur is the best. i highly recommended. EXCELLENT CLASS!!!!!
Pretty easy, just attend class because he will try to know your name. Group project is large part of exams. Exams from the book material, powerpoints, and lectures.

Introduces topics without background, instead jumping right into example problems. Impossible to get a conceptual understanding from lecture. Course does not follow the textbook, and no course outline by chapters is provided. Does not post lecture slides or other study aids. Very unfair exams that test material not covered in homework or examples.

You do well if you put in the time and go to the lectures. All of the answers to homework problems and expectations for exams are told to the class during lecture. First few weeks may be more challenging but in the end, he really made up for it by giving plenty of partial credit for exams. He expects you to know Matlab but gives scripts.

George is odd: very quiet with super high expectations. That said, he makes the exams fair for those who attend lectures, and offers extra credit (a max of 14.375 % from exams). He made the final super easy which I think everyone appreciated. HW is useless (10%) and takes forever. Project (20%) isn't bad. Two midterms + a final: 15%, 15%, and 40%.

This class had 11 hw assignments, 2 midterms, a project, and a final. *exams/final (open everything)* The Professor is very quiet when speaking, and lectures are paced weird. HOWEVER, HE IS A FAIR GRADER. IF YOU GO TO CLASS, TAKE NOTES, AND MAKE A NOTE SHEET OUTLINE OF WHERE TO FIND ALL OF YOUR NOTES, YOU WILL BE FINE!

Do NOT take linear systems theory with this man. He is so rude to students when they try to ask question or get help. His exams are impossible to finish and he goes over class time by 20 minutes and insists that you stay. I went to office hours to get help on homework and he said "I went over that in class, you should've paid attention."

Very hard to understand due to mumbling. Lectures rarely make sense. You never know what you're learning about because you are looking at how to solve the problems right when you start a new topic. There is no background provided.

INCREDIBLY condescending. No one in class ever feels comfortable asking questions bc of this. He is horrible at explaining and doesnt align notes with classwork. Avoid at all costs if you want to preserve your GPA. even if you work for a good grade its near impossible. This is the worst I have EVER experienced in a Uconn class.

One of the first things that this professor said to us in lecture was something along the lines of, "a lot of people think this class is pretty useless" and that was probably the last thing I ever really understood that came out of his mouth. I haven't learned anything from his mumbling lectures, I'll be trying to teach myself in order to pass.
The best way to explain this class is, "it is like that because I said it is". George does not care about his students and openly criticizes. He will not help you if you ask for help.
