He's a nice guy but his standards are unfeasible; other sections are way easier.

Sent an email to this guy and bro sent back a paragraph with so much attitude for what reason??? I ****ing hate this dude but the class is extremely easy. I only skimmed lecture slides and was able to get like a 98. Good luck yall

2 homeoworks every week. He does not speak fluent english so his lecture videos are with microsoft text to speech. I used professor Biro's videos that he also posted and worked out fine. Mostly all practice exams are like the actual exam, besides the final.

Very easy for me but that was no thanks to Luan. Many people struggled on tests, but I got over a 100 on most of them. He gives you a website for the homework and the textbook. I taught myself through the videos on the website. I didn't pay attention in class and it didn't affect me because he was a bad teacher anyway. The videos were more helpful.

Prof. Doan was pretty good. There were times he came across as rude, but he was very generous with accommodations and schedule changes. Mainly learned from videos attached to homework. Attendance was only 5% of grade. Final was a paper. Chapter quizzes every other week, not difficult at all. Lots of extra credit chances. Easy Q course/gen-ed.

The class was online so a lot of people just muted lectures or didn't show up which obviously made them think the class was really hard, even though it is totally the opposite. If you attend lectures and do the homework you'll do fine. He is understanding and gives a lot of opportunities for extra credit. He also drops your lowest quiz grade.

He takes a little longer than expected to answer emails, but was understanding and allowed me to take an exam that I missed the due date for once. He uses AI text-to-speech for online lectures, which he said was due to his accent. 5 regular exams, and a cumulative final. HW due every Friday with extra credit for submitting before Thursday at 11:59.

Luan is a nice and funny guy, you will laugh a lot in class. However, he is not a good teacher at all. His slides were often unorganized and had many pieces of inaccurate information that he needed to fix but never did. I taught myself everything on my own via YouTube videos and the homework platform that we had which I did not mind. Final = paper

The course itself is rly easy if you take time to study the material, but Luan is so beyond rude to his students. He blamed us multiple times for his connection issues, and wasn't considerate of students. Made us feel guilty for not understanding his math. I recommend this course but not luan. I got though it by watching the videos attached to HW.

This was a very interesting experience.. Prof is nice (most of the time) and seems genuine but he doesn't seem to know how to teach?? He is new, so he is likely to improve, but a lot of students just skip the lecture and use the book to understand. Aside from that, the course is generally easy if you learn on your own rather than from the prof.
She's a great professor. Easy to approach, easy grader, interesting lecturer. Several 400 word posts, 4 two page papers, and one 8 page paper. Highly recommend.

She is not an easy grader so paper grades won't be the best however there is plenty of opportunity to get a good grade. She grades generously on discussion posts which are worth a decent portion of your grade. The class itself is extremely interesting and I highly recommend it. Just make sure you show up to class or your grade will suffer.

Two papers 6-8 pages each and weekly 500 word discussion posts based on decently long readings. She takes attendance every class so you can't really skip. If you email her before class and say you're not coming for some reason she'll excuse your attendance for that class. No text book but there are a few novels you need to read.

Catherine is definitely a good teacher. At first, her assignments and expectations are quite unclear. However, as the semester rolls on things become more understandable. The mid-term and the final are all written and you are given the questions ahead of time. In addition, there are two papers, five huskyct discussions and two response papers.

I have taken this professor twice. If I could, I would take her again! Professor Page is really nice, funny, and smart. Her lectures are always interesting and the discussions are always stimulating. I leave every class learning something new (and see it in society). Expectations are clear. She grades a little hard. TAKE HER COURSES. She's awesome!

Straightforward and humorous professor. Class materials (power points) were posted online but it was fun to come to class. Lectures were clear and concise -- often class was dismissed early. Test and essay expectations were well-defined.

Great teacher who likes what she is teaching. In class slides and other materials on Internet. Does these participation things that some days (announced in advanced) where you need to be there (id recommend going anyways). She has a good sense of humor which can keep it interesting. Expectations with regards to assignments very clear

Worst history teacher that I have ever had. I am a history major and took all AP history classes in high school and taking this class was a nightmare. If you don't know anything about history its really easy but if you do, she leaves out important facts. I corrected her on more than one occasion and she was unhelpful with paper revisions.

Her class was pretty easy. I don't get the way she grades though. You can e-mail her a rough draft of your paper, she'll send you comments, you'll fix the paper and still will get a 90 at best. She never clarified what constitutes an A, B, C, etc. Overall, though, it's still easy. Hard to get an A but an A- is doable if you put in the effort.
Good instructor. Uses clear powerpoints with the test questions taken directly from the notes.

The only History teacher Ive ever had that didn't make me want to kill myself. The text book was easy to understand and we read a few short books that were easy too. For the test she gives 20 key terms & 3 essay questions. She puts 7 terms on the test, you choose 4 & she puts 2 essays you choose 1. Very very easy and helpful. Lecture is interesting

Sweetest women in the world. Young and teaches the class great. Exams consist of terms and one essay (basically just show up to class to get the terms) Papers are cake if u put logical thought. Teaches the class easy if ur used to taking history classes, Freshmen have problems. 20% of grade = class participation
Would never take her again. Absolutely terrible.

Had fatima for both 1124, 1125 now, and going to take 1126 in the fall for my major, but honestly cannot stand the woman. there is so much work in the class, MUST go to lectures, and the labs are tiresome and long. thank god for all the homeworks, otherwise i would be failing the class. do not expect 1125 to be like 1124, scared for 1126 next fall

I had Professor Salampinar for two semesters now. Last semester she was much better. This semester asks extremely hard questions on exams that are aimed to trick students. While she does offer extra credit, most students did not succeed in her class. During lecture, she can be rude and condescending.
Very difficult course however she is sarcastic in a good way, and was very generous to extreneous circumstances. She does want you to succeed, however expect the class to be a nightmare.

Dr. Selampinar has been one of my favorite professors thus far. She has very clear grading that is fair, gives extra credit, and curves the final. She wants her students to do well. If you attend lecture, go to lab, do the worksheets, and practice the problems she gives in class, you will be fine for the test. The SI sessions really help too.

Dr. Salampinar is HILARIOUS and intelligent. She explains things thoroughly and slowly. The exams and quizzes are fairly easy as long as you study and understand the different concepts/rules/problems she taught. Pay attention to whenever she says something is going to be on a future quiz or exam--she means it! Lab/discussion is easy but helpful.
AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

She explains concepts okay, but i found reading the textbook chapters much more helpful than her lectures. She puts a few trick questions on each test, but they are doable. OWLS (online assignments) are extremely annoying. Problem sets are helpful and she goes over them in class.

Testes are based off of problem sets (mainly) or anything else she can try to trick you with. Class was kind of boring and hard to pay attention to, not due to subject. She seems to be nice but not the greated test-giver/teacher. Use the book and go to chem club for help with problems (or the q center) and you'll do better.

She was strict but went over the materials well during lecture. She gave a lot of examples and note packets every week. She makes the exams for all classes so she makes sure to cover everything that is on them.

Oh god this class was awful. the lecture is completely useless, but she makes you attend by threatening with random attendance. i never felt prepared for the lab, because by the time she was "teaching" the stuff in the lab, we'd done the lab a week ago. her "teaching" was going over problems, which was also useless.
A little scary

Professor Trump cares more about his students than any other instructor I have experienced here. He's not perfect by any means; sometimes, he goes on very long tangents, which are fun to listen to but take away from learning about the important stuff. But despite that, he is super approachable and very helpful.

Lectures aren't required, definitely attend them, he makes you want to learn. Made me wish I was an astro major and not taking this class for my Q/science. Always open to questions, very willing to accept his (or the homework system's) mistakes. No exams, just quizzes! For trans students: Used correct pronouns for me, only had to say them once.

I loved him and he made astronomy fun. There are "pop quizzes" every week you just don't know which day they are going to be, but they are only 5 questions. Labs are easy if you follow directions but some are difficult. Has no tests and just weekly 20 question homework. No final just an observing proposal that is 40% of your overall grade

As a non-physics major, I admire Prof. Trump for his passion for astronomy - you see it in the way he teaches and it makes lectures enjoyable. Pro-tips: make sure not to skip class - there's usually a pop quiz once a week. The homework assignments have some math problems, and it can get difficult, since he doesn't really explain the math in-depth.
He is very passionate about astronomy and you can tell! He is also very fair with grading and gives extra credit opportunities!

Trump is a professor who clearly cares about his students and wants them to do well. His homeworks are tough, but he encourages collaboration and is accessible during office hours. Exams are very similar to the homework assignments. His lectures are very helpful, and he posts his notes online. Overall he is always willing to work with his students.

Prof. Trump is incredibly humble, always open to feedback, and super accessible for help on homework and exams. The coursework definitely felt impossible at times, but due to his allowing of collaboration, it's often possible to work through it. Lectures really deepen your understanding of topics you may have brushed over in earlier courses.

Prof. Trump is passionate about what he teaches. His homework can seem impossible towards the end, but he's always willing to help out as much as he can. His exams were pretty difficult, and some of that material seemed like we had never explicitly learned it in lecture. He encouraged collaboration on homework even after we were sent home.

He really cares about the subject, is a good at teaching, and also does not believe in exams. That's right- DOES NOT BELIEVE IN EXAMS. If you have basic math skills, go to labs, and sit through lecture enough to get the basic information you'll be all set in this class. Lots of extra credit opportunities and the final is a group project.

Awesome professor! Really shows interest in the topic and made learning about space and time really fun and interesting. Online homeworks and pop quizzes in class, but usually on material just covered that day. The class revolves around group projects and homework. He gets to know your name and is very accessible by email. Great guy!

Great guy and a fairly easy gen ed. All of the homework is online and there are no exams, only weekly pop quizzes. He drops your 2 lowest homeworks and quizzes and offers observing hours for extra credit. Final is a group project.

This is his first semester teaching and he's super passionate about astronomy. He knows his stuff and uses student feedback to choose interesting topics. No tests, group project for the final. Overall a great professor 10/10 would take again.

The class was very in-depth and intense, but if you do the weekly response and watch the lectures you will be fine. I really liked the format, as you could listen and take notes at your own pace. Professor Gouwens is really nice, accessible, and he has a great sense of humor to make things interesting.

Took class fully online and met on zoom once a week. Very passionate professor. You had to listen to al of the lectures before hand and then come to class to discuss. Don't take the class if you unsure if that is how you can learn. Very hard to stay focused and find the motivation to watch lectures on your own time while taking this class.

Courses like these are prime examples of why discussion posts are terrible assignments to give students. The professor's feedback to many assignments seemed moreso about taking points away and making the class difficult than constructive criticism. I have had many tough courses being a senior, but this is easily one of the hardest i have taken.
lots of homework

Professor Gouwens seems incredibly kind and it's clear he is passionate about his work. However, the class itself was really difficult. There are multiple reading tasks and short essays every week. Some of the lectures are also a bit lengthy. It was hard for me to stay on top of the work because there was just so much of it.

Professor Gouwens is by and large my favourite professor at the university. If one attends office hours, one will be blessed by his kindness and generosity. He's witty, out-of-the-box, and fiercely independent, willing to question the powers that be in the university and society at large. Not an easy A, but you'll learn to study well.

Prof. Gouwens doesn't post anything online, so if you aren't willing to take notes in class, this is probably not the class for you. He hands out outlines and discusses about it for the whole 50 mins of lecture. Discussion we interpret texts relating to lecture. Exams are nothing crazy, if you like history and good at it, this class is good for you

He talks for 50 minutes straight. Nothing is posted online so you'll need to attend to take notes. Discussion section was only used to interpret texts that were written during the time periods we were learning. Felt very chaotic. Three exams are mostly based on essays written in class so get ready to write.

Gouwens isn't the worst: he gave outlines, lectured straight w no presentation, whatever. The discussion period is where things get messy. In order to get a good participation grade, you MUST do the weekly readings, or at least find summaries. You also must show up for not only discussion, but lecture, since that counts toward participation, too.

I took this class on whim for credits I needed to graduate and boy am I glad I did. Dr. Gouwens is truly the greatest professor I have ever had at UConn. He is knowledgeable, witty, and really loves his subject matter. I found that I was engaged during lecture and learned not only about our western roots, but important lessons of humanity. Gotoclas

There was quite a bit of reading but the majority of it wasn't all that hard to get through. He takes attendance/participation randomly by giving simple quizzes on the reading which you'll ace if you read at least some of it. The midterm and the final were fair He is an understanding professor and but expect you to understand too

Not a horrible professor, but really dry material. If you read (both) books and stay awake in class, it's not hard to get an A in this class. Attending class is a must, unless you read AND get notes from someone who attended. Good teacher in the sense that his view isn't always right. Trying hard and showing him you are will get you a better grade.

This was a very interesting class. I learned a lot. Class project was fun and good learning experience in working as a team. Professor is a fair grader. Exams were a bit challenging, but if you put forth effort you can definitely succeed. Enjoyed Professor's lectures. Unfortunately this was his last semester at UConn. Will be missed.

Knowledgeable guy, who is interested in the subject. Not a hard class, you just have to do the work. Test can be tricky at times. He tells good stories. He's moving to the west coast to teach though so he wont be at UConn much longer!

I really enjoyed this class. Professor Gunasti makes lectures interesting and interactive. He is well traveled and knowledgeable and uses his experiences to teach the class. He provides a lot of examples to explain theories and terms that are really helpful. His online assessments are a good study guide for exams. Fun and pretty easy group project.

Great class, no textbook required. Tests can be tricky but you'll do fine if you read the slides. Final project was fun and he grades it easily as long as you put some thought and effort in it. I highly recommend for both marketing and non marketing majors. I learned a lot.
respectful to students and super nice. ton of real life examples. spends too much time with cultural stuff - make sure you memorize the slides for the exam
very interactive and fun class
best professor you will ever get - period.
He was one of the best professors I ever got. I missed many classes but still got a B+ because he does not take attendance.
I learned so much in this class.
definitely recommend. cool guy, interesting class, fun project.
great professor, possibly the best I ever got. makes the material interesting with lots of fun examples. very helpful to students. some questions were tricky but he was an easy grader. I got an A-

Hes nice and cares about his students. His tests are tricky, but everything is off his slides. No textbook or final exam. He gives a class project that he grades a little tough, but I managed to get an A.

So far the best professor I ever had at UConn. Easy grader, accessible to students, teach things clear. Doesn't take attendance but you will learn a lot in her lectures so don't skip. Easy A for diffeq.
She is the best math professor I've ever had period. She's very approachable and funny, and makes the math extremely easy to understand.

I had her at UBC & she is amazing! She really cares about her students & wants us to be involved and learn everything we can. She is really passionate about math and is really funny. I would always tell my friends about the funny things she would say in class. She is super helpful, clear lecturesnotes, and gives you everything you need to succeed!
Great class. Easy A for multivariable.

Tingting is the best math TA/professor that I've had so far. Her lectures are helpful and she explains everything thoroughly. Her quizzes aren't that hard and she gives you practice problems that will be on the exam with different numbers. At the end, she let us do extra credit problems to replace one of our exam grades. Easy A.

She's a great Professor. You think all the math is easy because of her, but once you open the book I guarente you will feel lost! So attend her classes, they make Diff. Eq. a piece of cake thanks to Tingting!
One of the best teachers out there. Exams/quizzes were very straight forward. She's also very into her lessons and gave candy out every class.
One of the best math teachers at UConn, could not have been happier with her as a teacher. She was incredibly helpful and grades fairly. Definitely take this class if given the option.

Tingting is awesome! She made the material super easy to understand and gives everyone 10/10 on every hw as long as you do it. weekly quizzes are easy and help your grade! She has reviews before exams and you know exactly what's coming. Highly recommend her!!
Best math professor I've ever had. Like everyone else said, go to class, do the homework and you'll do great. Plus she handed out candy every class.

If you go to class, take notes and do the homework this class we be a breeze. The quizzes are easy if you do your hw as well as the tests. She offers extra credit on each test and makes it very easy to do well. Not difficult to understand and an overall great professor

she is the best math teacher ive had so far, she is nice and very clear at presenting the material. her tests are fair and her quizes are easy if you do the home work. she teaches so good you dont even have to open the book because she gives the homework problems on handouts and she explains the math wayyy better then the book. plus she hot
Absolute godsend of an instructor. Weekly quizzes, preps you for the weekly quiz, clear grading method, will discuss mistakes made on the quiz, helps with HW. Absolutely amazing professor

Dr. Boyle is a really easy going chem professor. He really cares for his students, and makes sure to go over quizzes and exams. Provides practice exams and quizzes that are almost identical to the real tests/quizzes. His labs are fun, homework is flexible and easy. Makes learning chem very tolerable!!! One of my fav professors here at UConn Waterb.

By far the best professor!! He always tries to help his students earn their best grade by reviewing before quizzes or exams in class a week before the actual test. He always posts practice exams or quizzes to help you study which is super helpful. Keep up with the pre-labs and homework he assigns and you should get a good grade in his class too

It's a hard class to fail as long as you do the homework and the pre-lab quizzes. If you do well on the homework and optional practice work, you should do well in class. He is always open to explaining something again if you need it. If you have to take this course, take it with him.
BEST PROFESSOR AT UCONN BY FARRRRR

TAKE THIS MAN FOR ORGO HES AMAZING. Gives practice exams and the ?'s are the EXACT SAME on the real exam, just with different compounds, reactions, etc. I'm actually taking chem 2241 (orgo 1+2 in 1 sem) and he makes the class SO DOABLE. He also drops the lowest exam and quiz grade and the class has a huge curve (86=A-,74=B-,62=C-). ABSOLUTE GOAT

Very intelligent man and a kind professor. Lectures go really fast, so you have to do a ton of studying before/after. Youtube helps a lot. Practice exams and homework are straightforward and ACTUALLY reflect what the exam will be like. Orgo seems intimidating, but Boyle makes it manageable! Make sure to attend lectures and study beforehand.
Best chem professor I have ever had

Dr. Boyle was a fantastic professor. His lectures are well done and he always available to answer questions. If you do the homework, practice quizzes, practice tests, and labs you will do well in this class. He provides many opportunities to practice and study for the exam. For it being his first year at UCONN, he did a tremendous job.

dr. boyle was a great professor to have for chem this semester. i thought the class was kind of tough content wise, but he took time to answer questions, review, etc. his practice exams helped a lot, and his exams are very straightforward. good mix of classwork, homework, lab and exam grades. definitely take dr. boyle if you have the chance

Dr. Boyle is an amazing professor! Hes understanding and clear with this lectures and his handouts. He gives out practice quizzes and exams that help us better prepare for the actual quizzes and exams. He made organic chemistry easier and more fun to understand. I learned a lot during the semester.

Professor Boyle is the best chemistry professor Ive had the pleasure to learn from in my Uconn career thus far! Lectures are easy to follow, questions are encouraged by him and always answered to the fullest. Practice exams are available and reviewed in class . He made organic chem easier to understand than gen chem and that says a lot.

Dr. Boyle is a great professor. Really clear with the lectures, instructions and expectations from the class. Outside of that he's very accessible outside of class and always willing to help which mixed with the number of reviews he holds before an exam, is very hard for a student to get a bad grade! A real good teacher, especially for a new one.
Raging antisemite and disgustingly biased "activist" excuse for a college professor.

There is just an incredible lack of awareness that we are college students who have other exams, other classes, other essays, and personal lives. In our final week, we had the 5 essay long final exam AND a 10 page paper due AND hours worth of discussion post homework. Way too much work, more than any class I've ever taken in my four years.
At first some of us were concerned about him but he actually was really kind and helpful during this semester of covid stuff and I am really proud of the work I did.
He demands a lot and early on it feels confusing at times but it all adds up if you pay attention and do the reading.

He was not in the country for the entirety of the semester, and this affected his ability to grade, answer emails, and give clear assignments. There is an 8 page term paper due at the end of the semester (page limit was given two weeks before it was due with 0 guidelines) and we also had a final exam with many essays and 20 identifications.

Gary's very interested in his students, has tons of experience in theater, and knows people all over the world. He likes to initiate discussions in class and is more interested in you learning than giving a hard exam. He does take a little getting used to but he's one of the best professors I've had here.
Just show up, read the plays, and write the papers. Done.

I went to his office to ask him a question. He blew me off for no reason. Hey, students walk into professors offices all the time. I was just looking for some help. Just rude. Plain and simple. Good teacher? Probably. Human being? Hardly.
If only he would turn in his grades on time... it has only been 6 months so far.
Very idealistic, and commands respect for work.
No Comments
Argh!
Ok
Did not like her teaching style but loved her, tests are very hard even though they are online

Queen. Very friendly, tries her best to explain everything, and is very good with feedback. Any HW problems or test questions you get wrong just go to office hours and ask her to explain. Tests are hard, even though they are open note. Take notes before going to class so you can jot down extra things she says. Use her as a resource! Very funny too

LOVE HER. Yes, I ended the class with a B, but she is so considerate to all of her students. She wants us to succeed. GO TO OFFICE HOURS. She's very helpful/ funny! Her exams are very hard, but they are open note. Take detailed notes on the practice problems because they will save your life!! The course code says 1201Q but I took 1202Q with her.

Professor Scanlon really cares about the success of her students. She is very willing to help anyone who is struggling in the course outside of class. She is a little bit of a harsh grader on exams and takes off credit for small things, but explains exactly why she took off points which is nice. You will do well if you put in the effort.

If you are a science person, you will easily pass the course. If not, you will still pass. Professor Scanlon's lectures can be tedious but if you pay attention, you will get a lot out of them. Professor Scanlon gave lots of assignments, which seemed overwhelming at first, but ended up giving me the chance to make up for the ones where I did poorly.

Love Dr. Scanlon! Although her lectures are "basic" and not very detailed (that's she recommends reading the textbook), but that makes it easier to understand the material. She honestly cares about students and answers ALL questions, in fact, I encourage asking a lot of questions. Routine-based, which I like. She uses iClickerReef for participation
Incredibly physics professor. If you need to take physics, take it with her. Really cares about her students, wants you to do well. Even in an online environment, she really was the best.

If you have to take Physics online, Professor Scanlon is definitely who you want to take it with. Group assignments every week and group exams which help so much with work load and she is extremely accessible outside of class and will make sureeeee you understand physics. One of the best professors Ive ever taken at UConn!

She is the GOAT. The best stem professor I have had at Uconn. She cares about her students and willing to help outside class time. The class is hard if you don't put in the effort you won't be able to get a good grade.

Dr. Scanlon is a wonderful person and a great professor. She cares very much about her students and wants everyone to succeed. The class is hard and there is a lot of work, but she is always accessible outside of class and will help students understand the material.

Even online, it is clear to see that Dr. Scanlon cares very deeply for her students. Her lectures are interactive via the use of clickers, and she takes multiple short pauses to ask if anyone has any questions. She explains things very clearly and is extremely good at lecturing in an understandable way. Definitely would take a class with her again

Class was Econ 3461, professor wasn't clear with any grading criteria. Entire class was based off group work and exams. Homework was presented weekly in groups, and you had two exams as well as a group project. Professor lacks communication, barely answers emails or questions and doesn't even have a syllabus. Class overall just is unorganized.

Professor was pretty average. She would often just read her ppt slides during lecture. Tests make up 50%, project 25%, and participation/HW 25%. Found her tests to be much more difficult than the HW. Also her grading criteria for the project was unclear.
Worst professor I've ever met! In lecture, she only read her slides without any explanation! And the slides itself was unclear. Worst! Unclear homework, and very confusion quiz!

Super caring about students, extremely easy class. Had two easy group projects, and two quizzes because she dropped two of them that people did poorly on. Basically, if you participate a little and show interest in the subject you'll get an A. Interesting material but can be confusing if you don't pay attention during class

If you're looking for an honors core, take this one. There are no formal tests or quizzes that you'll have to take in class, and group projects are super simple. Lectures can be pretty dry and slow with lots of repetitive material.

Great professor. Can be a little rude when it comes to feedback, but the class if definitely worth taking (it's Game Theory without all of the complex math). Participate every now and then, and beware of pop quizzes (she'll say something like "Be sure that you guys know all of this"). Homework isn't graded, but she'll ask you to answer/participate

This is probably the easiest class I've taken in college. As long as you go to class and participate once every few days you'll get an A, even if you just do other stuff on your computer the entire time. The lectures are incredibly boring -- she'll talk for 30 mins straight sometimes -- but nonetheless a very nice lady and extremely easy class.
Interesting Honors Core class, I was hesitant to take it at first, but I'm glad I did. Prof is really nice and wants you to understand how everything works.

Excellent Honors core class to take. Recommended if you are at all interested in thinking strategically/game theory/problem solving. Professor Knoblauch just wants to spark interest in the subject - it is a pretty easy A, just go to class and participate (even if you don't know the answer). She is incredibly smart and respected by her students.

If you're thinking about taking Knoblauch, would highly recommend. Her Game Theory section is your best honors core option out of all of them (trust me here). Lectures based on powerpoints, grades based on participation on projects. She is very knowledgeable about her field, fair, and flexible. It's a good gig.

I really like Dr. Knoblauch and think she is very personable. I sometimes had trouble following her lectures, but after doing the problem sets my questions were cleared up. There was never an overwhelming amount of homework- just enough to get a better understanding of the material. Assessments are few but group projects are important.

Professor Knoblauch is a leading Mechanism Design researcher, and her expertise is extremely helpful in clearly presenting ideas in the classroom. The course itself takes an understanding of abstract themes and mathematical proofs, but will be fine for those who have interest in behavioral economics and a drive to understand new concepts

Ting doesn't teach anything. She gives unhelpful, basic videos or makes her TAs (if she has them) teach for her, but she really doesn't do any of the work herself. She also can be really harsh and not helpful at all with critiques, and if your style differs from hers then she will straight up tell you she hates it. Wouldn't personally recommend.

Class is a lot of tutorials, but so long as you apply the skills & use her feedback, she will grade you well. Half the class was a poster design, half was a group rebranding project. Lots of free time in class to work, just don't slack. Ting wants all her students to succeed and is an amazing asset if you are hardworking and respectful! Super nice!

I personally loved Ting. She was very kind towards her students, and truly cared about the projects each person or group was working on. There's group critiques, and oftentimes she sounds very harsh in her feedback, but that might be due to a language barrier. Her feedback has always been useful, and you can tell she wants you to succeed.

I love Ting! She is one of my favorite professors. She knows you by name, answers your questions willingly, and wants nothing more than to watch you succeed. She easily picks up on your style of creativity and helps you bring it to life in your work. She believes in you, which is everything you could want in a professor:)

Great professor that cares about her students. Some people will claim she gives bad feedback, but it's mostly due to a language barrier; if you ask for clarification she will give you good advice. She can be a little blunt sometimes with critiques but if you want to improve at design, that's what you need to hear. Leave your ego at door.

Professor Zhou is the best professor I've had at UConn. She's so sweet and cares about her students so much. Her feedback on projects can seem intense but will 100% improve your design skills if you listen to it and talk to her about your projects. Sometimes her assignments can be unclear, but it's really not bad, just ask questions. I love her!

Ting is hard, but in the way that she pushes you to do better. She's a good design teacher but the way she phrases critiques can sound harsher than she means. I would take her again, cause I know what I'm getting.
If you ask her a question, you will not get an answer. She will just say empty words at you until you sit back down and pretend what she said made any sense.

This class was not hard. A few projects, a few papers, some Photoshop exercises. She would say that important announcements she made would be online, and then didn't put them there, so always write stuff down. For trans students: She did not use the correct pronouns for me all year, even after a few reminders. Didn't seem intentional though.

Not a bad professor, but gets slightly annoying when it comes to feedback on projects. I do like the group critiques that she holds for the classroom for each project. You can tell that she does care for the class and allows a lot of freedom for what you're working on.

Shes an okay teacher but she is terrible at feedback. Shell normally give suggestions that are so slight it wouldnt make a big difference or she doesnt like what youve done. Shes can be passive aggressive in the group critiques we do, so be prepared not have a professor that can aid you creatively.

There was no communication. Whenever I would email her about the syllabus, schedules, or grading she would just sub email the entire class to just show up to class. You are graded on 4 projects and that is your entire grade. ATTENDANCE NOT MANDATORY! EVEN IF SHE MAKES IT SEEM IT DOES. JUST PRRESENT YOUR PROJECT WHEN SHE EMAILS YOU ABOUT IT.

Free snacks, bubbly personality, always responds to emails and gives multiple chances to fix mistakes on assignments. Downsides are he rambles a lot in class and is hard to follow, and gets lazy with grading on time. Also need to do extra assignments outside of course requirement to receive an A.. they're not the easiest too.
Very nice guy, lenient with late work.

His great professor ever ever... he really care about his students, if you doesn't understand the homework, he will explain to you super detail, also he is a super super generous on grading. TAKE HIS ENGLISH, such a wonderful english class every!
Love this man, he is so sweet! Every class he would come in with snacks. He was the one professor who I felt really cared and got to know me- I will miss him!

Such a great professor and guy! He's really understanding and wants to see his students succeed. He's a little unclear about expectations for essays but if you ask he'll clear up any confusion. Highly recommend!

Joel is a very nice man. I have taken two of his classes for my freshman year and both got good grades. I feel he really cares about students and gives good lectures. The essays were not that hard but you do need to put efforts in. And I like the "Empathy" topic he chosen for our class.
A really good professor! I hope I can take his class again.
Really nice pro, highly recommend

Really nice professor. Participation counts toward final grades. The only thing that bothers me is that his essay prompt can be confusing. But he is being really helpful even on other academic things that is not about essays. If you turn in your essays on time, and have some basic knowledge of writing essays, you will get a A.

He is a really nice guy, and sometimes his classes are fun and interesting. Most of the time he makes no sense. I was never clear what he was looking for in essays, and his assignments were as vague as his classes were incoherent. I would have skipped this class every day if I wasn't in a small class.
Great Prof. very clear, and when I don't understand something, he has taken the time to make sure I understand what is expected. All you have to do is ask.
The class is interesting but I find it difficult to understand what is actually required of us for the essays. It isn't clear what he wants us to write about and is usually confusing.
He does math good

He is a cool guy once you get to know him, took his 1132 over the summer and found it pretty straight forward. HW was a must since they best reflected exam items. It really depends on how much time you put into the class but Jeff was a good guy. He has a type of satirical attitude, and may seem intimidating but is approachable and caring!
very reasonable class..homework is optional.. exams are quite manageable.. as someone else said, if you like math, youll like him; if you dont, you wont
he is an extremely harsh grader and rarely gives any decent partial credit
he is awful! he is an unreasobably harsh grader who doesnt care at all about how you do.

By far the worst professor I have ever had.. He does not care about what you learned prior to entering his class and he never sympathizes regardless. Strongly do not recommend, avoid this professor!!!
Good guy, really helpful. Go to office hours he's always there willing to help

The teacher does not have a good teaching method. He writes paragraphs on the board when he's explaining things. Extremely harsh grader. Takes off points for points that doesn't need to be taken! Laid back, but not a good math teacher

Jeff is a great teacher, he gets the point of the material and is able to translate the underlying concepts from math to English. His notes are incredible if you actually write down the words he puts on the board and not just the problems. Look at your notebook once in a while and ask questions in class he will make sure you get it.

Jeff doesnt try at all, he gives me the impression that he he doesn't care about his students and ultimately the class. The test averages for his class are always low because he doesn't bother to teach the material. He's a really laid back kind of guy.

Jeff is a very nice guy, but he flies through material as if it is second nature for everyone. He doesn't explain things clearly and to make matters worse he's very unorganized.Throughout the entire class people were misinformed and he could barely remember the assignments.If math is a breeze for you then you'll like him, otherwise not recommended.

Hanson really wanted us to learn. He was generous with grading and allowed us to push back deadlines if we needed. Classes were interesting and flew by. I cannot say enough great things about him. He cares about the students.

Hanson is one of the rare professors who actually cares about students and their mental health. He was flexible with everything and valued the importance of learning over grades. His passion for teaching made me want to go to class. The material can be confusing but to no fault of Hanson's. I was in the honors section and it was enjoyable.

Hanson is a great professor. This class was quite challenging for me but Hanson was amazing at explaining and made the math sound much simpler His passion for math is motivating and really shows how interesting math can be. He also takes time to preach about the importance of learning and what we can do to combat bias in math, which was inspiring!

He's young and still has the spirit of a teacher that truly wants you the learn and think rather than just have you memorize content. The course was weird and abstract at times but he taught it better than I can imagine any other teacher would. He encourages curiosity for math and is just a great professor overall

Hanson's passion for math is clear and he is one of the best professors I've had at UConn so far. He really tries to help you understand is very accessible outside of class. He's a really cool guy and I would definitely recommend anyone to take his class

So I'm still taking the course, and in all honesty I don't expect an A because I'm pretty stupid... However for the average student Professor Smith is excellent for teaching the course content. He clearly really cares about math and will talk at length about theory and the more interesting parts of the subject.

Hanson is one of the best professors I've had at UConn. He is very accessible out of class and will help you understand hard concepts with easy to follow examples and explanations. Lectures aren't mandatory and recordings are available afterwards, but I recommend attending them, as they are enjoyable and will help your understanding.

Hanson has to be my favorite math professor at UConn so far. He is relatable, cares about his students and their grades, and is available for help. Lectures were easy to sit through, and the notes and recording were available afterwards. Quizzes were pretty easy, exams were pretty difficult, and hw was unlimited attempts through Pearson.

Hanson is an amazing math professor. His teaching style made me excel through linear algebra and he is accessible outside of class, super understanding, and all around an awesome guy. If you are taking MATH2210Q this is the guy to have
Hanson is a great professor and really wants his students to do well. He has plenty of office hours and is more than willing to re-explain concepts outside of live lecture. Take him if you can!

Hanson was a really good professor and a really cool guy. His lectures were organized and easy to follow. There were homework assignments due twice a week, but it really helped improve understanding of the material. Unlike a lot of online classes, I really feel I learned and will retain the material.

Took this class this past semester. More of a history class than an economics class and mainly focused on history concepts. Was graded on 3 midterm exams which were manageable as long as you studied and went to class. Exams were multiple choice with some open ended and he graded fairly. You were also graded on discussion posts so you had to go.

Professor Cosgel was nice in terms of chatting to students, but we were only graded on the two midterms, one final, and our daily group discussion boards. Professor Cosgel will not curve the grades, but there are multiple choice questions on the exam and max three open ended. It's only hard due to the amount of info he puts.

Taken for honors credit. Course load was very light and this class was not a big worry for most students. Fairly heavy on reading, a few exams, a 10 page paper and a presentation. It sounds like a lot but it didn't end up being much. He is a good lecturer but my section was 2.5 hours long so I would lose him.

This class seems scary at first, but it's really not so bad. Dr. Cosgel is a great lecturer with a good sense of humor. Everything important for the tests is on the slides, which are available. He also lets you bring a cheatsheet to tests, which are only worth 10% each. The other 80% is presentations, papers, discussion board which aren't hard.

Professor Cosgel was a great professor. It's the TA (Ha Kyeong Lee) that is so harsh on the grading system. Every discussion post is graded out of a 2.5 and the highest she has given me was a 1.9. Tbh I wish I had a different TA.

Honors course. There is a lot of writing in the class, and 6 big projects that come in pairs (3 presentations + 3 papers on those presentations). There's a textbook but it's not worth buying and I didn't read it. Cosgel is forgiving of people who don't show up, but a lot of your grade is based on participation. He bought pizza for us, too.

Prof Cosgel is super nice and understanding! A lot of the assignments are based on completion at the beginning of the semester and he focuses a lot on peer-review. There are no exams and there's pretty much multiple drafts for each assignment, which is a great learning opportunity and a grade boost! Super engaging class with a great prof (:

Amazing professor. Really cares about what you are talking about. Class consisted of weekly journals for the first half, then 2 papers the second half. The papers were easy and fun to write, and the class as a whole was enjoyable and interesting.

Grade was made up of online-in-class discussion posts, research paper and a presentation, no exams which was nice. Attendance is a must or you will bomb your attendance grade which combined was about 50%. For presentations and papers make sure your sources are scholarly or you'll get a lot of points off. Overall enjoyed the class. Smart guy.

His tests are 3 or 4 open ended questions, he's not open to changing his testing strategy. His lectures are literally reading multiple paragraphs off slides. Should go to class to get the discussion question which u have to post by EOD. Memorize all slides to pass the test. His review days are pointless, literally gives no insight to tests.

I'm indifferent on Cosgel. The lecture and discussion were basically different classes so much of your grade is determined in discussion by your TA. Cosgel just presents from the slides. The material presented is nothing like the quiz material but they're easy. Lecture question every 2 weeks and two 8-page papers. Not a bad class, I'd recommend.

Metin taught my thesis writing course 4494W Spring 2017. He genuinely cares about what your topic is, how you will go about it, and who you can go to for more specific help. He doesn't really like giving out tedious homework, he is more concerned with participation and feedback from students, especially when going over thesis topics of students.

Prof Zhang is a solid choice and this class is interesting to a certain degree. If you do not have a liking of history/geography/urban development, maybe this class isn't for you. Other than that, once a week get 1 assignment that answers a prompt or two. Exams are fair. Seems like he would be a good prof in person.
Easy A. Make sure to be ready to write weekly essays but as long as you put in couple hour you should be fine

Good class to take for a gen ed - professor is nice, weekly writing assignments are pretty simple, exams were open-note, and there was one term paper. Provides a lot of extra credit opportunities, and grading is pretty lenient to begin with. Overall highly recommend taking this class for a requirement.

Definitely one of the easier classes I've taken. Pretty lenient with Covid going on too. Easy grader as long as you answer the questions fully + add citations. Had 2 short 200-250 words reading responses of textbook/lecture each week. A midterm, final, and end of the year essay. too. You can find the textbook online for free.

Read one chapter of the textbook a week and have to respond to two questions. A very easy elective and an easy grader. 10/10 recommend for a low stress class. Only tow exams (final and midterm) which were open note and then the term paper.

Solid Gen-Ed choice. 3 straightforward exams, weekly chapter assignments and 1 term paper. Pretty easy grader. Just show up to lecture because he typically doesn't post the slides. He gives fill in the blank notes and study guides for the exams.

A great course to take to fill a requirement. It is lecture heavy because he doesn't post the slides online, but there is lots of extra credit opportunity. Tests are straightforward and require minimal studying. An easy course with a nice professor.
Excellent professor

Bo cares about students and made this gened class easy. There were so many extra credits added to the final grade during the semester and be sure to look at the uploaded sample questions (only a few questions but all the same in exams). Although attendance is not mandatory, I would say attending will help you save a lot of time. Highly Recommend!

Really great professor and no need to attend class. If you attend the review sessions before the exam, he goes over the entire study guide giving all the answers you need to score very high on the exams. Really recommend this class for an easy Gen-Ed.

This was Bo's first year teaching and he couldn't have done better. He knows what he is talking about. All he wants is to see his students succeed. Go to class when he has a review for the exams: he gives you everything you need to know. Online assignments each week but they are very easy and he grades very easily. Highly recommend for gen ed

Prof Volgushev is passionate about the content, but there is so much content in the class that it was overwhelming and complicated. He has a slight accent that at times was hard to understand but got used to it over the semester. Tests every Thursday, and exams are hard. NOT an easy class, but interesting content.

Professor Volgushev was great lecturer who took a subject that I wasn't sure I would be interested in and made it quite intriguing actually. Going to lecture is essential to understanding a lot of the concepts in his course and he gives weekly quizzes that are difficult to make up. So make sure you go to class and do his extra credit; it's helps!

First things first,DO THE EXTRA CREDIT! I didn't miss any lectures & still struggled on the exams, the EC saved my grade. In-class quizzes once a week, again it's easy points don't miss it! Was intimidated by this class as it's very science-oriented & a high course code,but the prof wants u to do well, lectures are confusing at first but get better

The biggest tip I can give to anyone taking this class is to utilize and keep up with the textbook readings throughout the semester and don't wait to cram them before each exam. I crammed and while it was useful, there is too much content to be able to get it all in a few days. I found the exams very challenging, however, lots of extra credit!

One of my fav professors. Gives lots of extra credit that probably saved my grade. Is so precious and cares about students. Has always been respectful to me. Content is hard but if you study the slides and do the extra credit you will do fine. Wish I could take him for other psych classes.

Really great professor that deeply cares about what he teaches, as well as making sure his students are learning. He assumes you know a lot of background on the class going into to it, so I would highly suggest doing PSYC 2200 (physiological psyc) before this class- will help a lot. Great class if you are more interested in neuroscience

Absolutely bonkers. First week I was panicked because lectures have SO much content, and slides are chaotic. However, he is OBSESSED with extra credit- to a degree I have never seen before. I didn't study a single second for the final exam and got an A+. Ended the class with a 105. That being said, you will be SO LOST if you skip class, so GO!

Overall I think Maxim is a good professor. If you show up to class and pay attention, you will do well. His lectures are confusing at first I'm not gonna lie, but once you get into the swing of his style it gets much easier to follow and is very doable. He cares a lot about his students and gets excited when we do well. Def possible to get an A.

Good professor, but the lectures are confusing. He assumes you know a lot of prior foundation. Without reviewing the concepts he brings up, or even explaining them fully, it's very difficult to follow along. Hard to study and fully understand the lectures and slides. Extra credit is available but it is also complex. Office hours needed to survive.

His lectures may seem confusing at first, but they are actually really good. He gives practice questions, feedback, keeps track of your grade for you and explains things well. Material is boring, but he does his best with it. Gives PLENTY of extra credit, so even if you struggle with the material, most people get an A. Overall, solid professor.

Great professor! Sometimes the lectures can be confusing but he's very good at responding to emails and available outside of the class. I recommend taking physio psych before this class since he mostly goes off of what was learned there and doesn't go much into detail about the foundational stuff. But super helpful if you ask for it!

Ashley is a wonderful person who is passionate and fun. She truly cares about her students, is easy to talk to, and wants everyone to do well. Two exams and a final exam, weekly three questions quizzes, and gives lots of extra credits. Everything online open notes. The slides and lectures are very good and she explains everything very well.

Such a sweet professor that truly just wants you to do well and not add additional stress. All exams and quizzes are open-note and she explains the content really well in lectures, with slides that have all the information which she later posts. 1000% would take again and recommend.

LOVE Ashley. Super fun and relatable. Cares about her students. Gives up to 6 points ec on your final grade. One quiz per week, 2 exams and a final. Each quiz is only 3 questions and the exams are super easy. All open note online. If you can, take her/this class for a gen ed. Loved this class.

There are not enough characters to explain how amazing Ashley is. The workload in this class is not heavy at all (weekly quizzes that are open notes and only 3 questions) and offers up to 6 points of extra credit. Other than that, she is a sweet and relatable person and radiates positive vibes overall. Take this class with Ashley!

Ashley did such a great job keeping this class interesting! The workload was never too overwhelming, but I still felt like I learned a lot. You can really tell she's passionate about what she does. I wish all my professors were as wonderful as she is.
Ashley is the best professor you will ever meet at UCONN. She's so helpful. She really cares about her students like no other professor! 10/10 and I would def take her class again!

Ashley is the absolute sweetest professor I have ever had. I'll even go as far as saying she's the best I've ever had. She is super accommodating, especially with online lectures. Quizzes are weekly, but they are super basic and go over the most important things! She truly cares about each individual and is the most organized professor I've had.

Ashley is actually the best professor. She really teaches her class as though she is a student and doesn't pile on the work just for fun. She gives you extra credit opportunities, clear instructions, and is always in contact with her students on Blackboard and through email. TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!
Shes amazing. So super understanding and organized. Class is super easy and shes so helpful whenever you need it. Would recommend her class 10x over. Shes so personable and makes class enjoyable!

One of the top five professors I have taken at this university. Extremely nice and caring. Lectures are organized logically. The professor also has a really great personality, just pure good vibes in this class. Would highly recommend

I love Ashley!! She is sweet and caring and it all about learning and not all about grades. Shes a grad student so shes young and relatable. She genuinely cares about her students and individualizes the experience to best work for everyone. Instead of taking points off when you get things wrong, she helps you fix them. A gem!!!!

Poetry was... an experience. Raffa is a good guy and if you talk to him about poems, he will definitely like you. he wants you to try and to put in effort, and if you do that, youll be fine. people walk all over him and i felt terrible - he is a genuinely good guy who loves poems. you wont learn much, but if your taking it for a gen ed, why not?

amazing gpa booster. midterm is extremely easy. final is a take home. research paper is not bad at all. stories are actually pretty interesting. bring your laptop to class and chill but listen to him summarize the stories cause it makes the semester easier. google the analysis of each story

Yes class is boring, but he knows what he is talking about and makes it easy to get an A. Only a midterm and final, essay form and choose between 2 topics. 1 paper or presentation, if you choose the 30 minute class presentation, you get a half letter grade higher (B- to a B+, B to an A, etc). Strongly recommend.
Painfully boring, class itself was very easy- attendance not really needed. However will sometimes try and grade unfairly if he notices you not in class. Overall wouldn't recommend
Boring but there's only a midterm and final along with one paper. Have to read only a few of the stories to do well. I would highly recommend this class. Very easy.

Teacher "uses" book a lot but when it comes to the midterm/final you don't need to have done all the readings just a few you like - he takes class attendance but there is no credit for it so you might as well not go, teacher is boring class is useless but easy way to get an A or an A-

He's annoying. He gives A's to kids who slide their way through the course and he gives A-'s to the kids who actually work for an A. If you have to take an English gen ed, take him but avoid him otherwise.

Raffa is old-fashioned and not very approachable, but he knows the material. He tends to talk a lot, easy to zone out in class! Only 2 exams and an essay, but he's not a harsh grader. You've probably read a lot of the stories/books in high school (Hamlet, Great Gatsby).

Raffa knows what he is talking about, he is very intelligent but often goes off track and is hard to understand sometimes. However he is not that hard on grading papers and exams, but is sometimes hard to understand what he expects from you.
No Comments
No Comments

One of my favorite professors at UCONN. I took both Criminology and Revolutionary Social Movements. I can't believe all of these whiners complaining here about how hard his classes are. Lazy!! These aren't gut courses. If you attend the classes, take good notes, and study for the exams, you will do well. But that's kind of a given in life isn't it?

had him for criminology and revolutionary movements. he does wear the same thing every day and his tests are hard as hell. however, his classes are extremely interesting if you are into the subject matter. DO NOT MISS CLASS!!
No Comments
very hard professor. however, his classes are extremely interesting and the lectures are thought provoking. you cannot pass if you skip classes!
No Comments
Tests are hard, must do all of the reading and keep up with the work. If you're really interested in criminology he is very knowledgable.

Notice how the negative comments here complain about too much work and style of dress. DeFronzo's lectures would only be boring to people who don't think about the world. DeFronzo is brilliant, helpful, and, yes, demanding.

The exams in this class are impossible- he loves to include all of the above and none of the above on every question which gets very mind numbing after awhile. He literally wears the same outfit to every class and stuffs his back pockets. DROP HIS CLASS

Very dull class, teacher is extremely self-absorbed and should pay attention to the huge wallet in his back pocket which absorbs more of the classes' attention than the lecture material. I would have enjoyed this class if he been more focused.

took both Crim and Rev mov. with him if possible TAKE PASS/FAIL! TESTS ARE VERY HARD! But interesting prof who is an excellent lecturer and knows his materials well, I learned a TON from these 2 classes more than almost any others in my 3 years at Uconn

This class, while interesting, was EXTREMELY HARD, the tests are provided on blurry old ditto paper, with the fuzzy typewriter print and all! It is a tight fit, a long night in the night class, and tests are pretty much pull it out of your butt

You really need to be extremely attentive, polite, and practice everyday for her ASL courses. She does not follow her syllabus, anything can happen at any day, she could be 30 minutes late one day, quiz the next class. You can get all C's for your grade and end up with a B+ if she likes you. You have to really, REALLY like ASL to get a good grade..

Doreen is a tough cookie. She can be endearing but overly opinionated. Her exams are difficult, she goes into way too much detail. Attendance to class not necessary as long as you read her slides and the articles she posts.
I love Doreen. She is a challenging teacher but she really cares about her students. She is very clear about what she expects, and if you work hard and practice you can get a good grade.

easy but the most boring ive had by far after 5 semesters the other day we watched a dead silent movie with subtitles for 57 minutes. sounds mean mean but honestly the class is just a giant sob story about how mean hearing people are. also this should be anth not ling cus she knows nothing about linguistics she thought chomskys first name was noman

This is my fourth semester straight with Doreen. I love her classes. They can be very difficult and time outside of class is mandatory for an A or B. It was very interesting and she is very funny. However, Doreen is completely Deaf and does not use an interpreter for her ASL classes!

Nice woman, but gets aggravated VERY easily. She's very blunt, which is part of Deaf culture, but it's to a point where it's hurtful at times. Exams and quizes are rather difficult. She expects us to understand ASL grammar easily but she doesn't understand how difficult the language barrier makes it. But if you really want to learn, it's worth it.
Boring class, but easy credit. Taught in ASL, which would have been good to know ahead of time. Recommended.

I signed up for this class after reading reviews however they left out one major detail. Doreen actually is Deaf and uses an interpreter. Not a big deal but would have been nice to know. Doreen is a very fair teacher, tests were fairly easy, obviously communication was hard and sometimes attaining class materials was impossible.

Interesting to say the least, fairly easy class, attandance is 20% of grade, and the rest is divided between the midterm and final; that's all you're graded on. One thing worth noting is that class is in ASL and you talk to the teacher through an interpreter. Alot of reading, but it's better than writting. Easy credit
she's the best. great personality and very helpful. good sense of humor too
Whata teacher! the best. Great if u need foreign language fullfillment. No writting needed for the class. it is entirely visual. Easy to learn ! A+

He is the BEST professor I've taken. He doesn't take attendance and uploads the PPT he uses in class. There are 6 quizzes and 6 projects, but you can not submit 3 quizzes or projects. The midterm is an exam; you can choose a project or an exam for the final. His quizzes and exams are EASY.

Jake is a grad student and is extremely kind and approachable. The class is easy as far as math goes, you are allowed to skip quizzes, a lot of your grade is just homework (100 if you do it) and projects where you can work in a group. Allowed cheat sheets for exams. He is super nice and wants to help everyone succeed. Lectures are very clear.
He is soooo nice. I am so so so bad at math and so far I have been doing great in his class. The review sheets he gives are exactly what is on the quizzes/exams.
Great professor, If you need availability and flexible hours to be able to meet take the course with him.

Nicest professor ever! His grading is clear, the homework platform is clear, and the math is easy! His lectures are super well-organized and helpful. He is also so inclusive and welcoming I loved this class and if you need an easy Q course take 1020Q with Jacob Brown

Jake is an amazing math professor and has made my experience taking a math course (as a non-math-orientated person) very enjoyable. His grading criteria and assignments are very clear, lectures are engaging and easy to follow (slides are posted), and he is very willing to help you in or out of class. I can't recommend Jake enough!

The lectures are very clear, he makes it clear what will be on the exams and what won't be. You don't have to go to class, he posts everything, but its definitely easier to do homework and exams if you go to class. There's a homework assignment every week, you get three tries. There were three exams that weren't hard, offers extra credit.Recommend!

Professor Brown is a very great mathematician. He knows how to really execute the work for the class & is very supportive. The classes aren't mandatory, only for the quizzes which are dated in the syllabus. He's a TA so he's very understanding when it comes to anything you need help with. Highly recommended.

The class begins off easy. It just tests your ability to command logic as the course name suggests. After midterm grades come in, the class becomes an Algebra, Geometry, Financial Literacy & Statistics course all combined into one. If you're good at those things, take this course. Brown himself is fine, just a graduate student though he does care.

The class begins off easy. It just tests your ability to command logic as the course name suggests. After midterm grades come in, the class becomes an Algebra, Geometry, Financial Literacy & Statistics course all combined into one. If you're good at those things, take this course. Brown himself is fine, just a graduate student though he does care.
Jake is the sweetest person who you can tell truly loves and is passionate about math. Jake wants the best for you and is very understanding and easy going which is very much appreciated.
He is the best TA that I have ever seen.

Dr. Schwenk is, without a doubt, an amazing prof. This was a seminar class and I suffered through having a bad prof just so I could take this class. It's my fourth semester taking a class with him and I would recommend any of his classes to students interested in vertebrates who aren't afraid of an old school lecture and a challenging exam style.

(Mammology) Somewhat disorganized, but the best professors are. Easily sidetracked. Need to take good notes, doesn't often post things online. He's a great lecturer and is very passionate about the material. His exams just about the only grades in the course and are... interestingly constructed, so be careful, but not so bad when you get used to it

Professor Schwenk is my favorite professor, and I've taken 3 classes with him now. He's not the most organized and none of his notes are online, but he's very engaging. His exams are very difficult, but once you learn his style, you should be fine. If you are at all interested in animals, I recommend taking a class with him, he's been at UConn ~40y

I've taken 2 courses with him and will be taking a third next semester. He's honestly one of the best. His lectures are easy to digest if you take good notes, even if he goes off topic. He's a delight to be taught by, telling students stories that will make them laugh. He's sincere and he cares about you doing well. Exams are tough, so study hard.

Nothing is online so you need to go to lecture. His diagrams often end up being more helpful than the ones in the occasional powerpoints he uses anyways. Lecture is great and he often drifts off course and ends up talking about random tangentially related things. His grading on exam short answer questions can be inconsistent and harsh.

Great lecturer. Well-paced, with diagrams hand-drawn on the board. He explains difficult concepts well and made me very interested in vertebrate anatomy (a subject I didn't previously care about). Don't skip, nothing is posted online (but you won't want to - his lectures are a lot of fun). Very difficult course tho - lots of material to memorize.

Dr Schwenk is a likable guy. I want to give him the benefit of the doubt and say that his problem was mostly in trying to teach a lab course online. I am an A student. I nearly got a C in this class. He is specific and nitpicky in his exam grading. On the final exam, I got an A after rigorous memorization. He is good and making info stick + funny

Prof. Schwenk had some trouble adjusting to online but was extremely helpful and still managed to teach us so much. He is really funny and really knows his stuff. He also really cares about your learning and will work with you a lot. 10/10 recommend any of his classes

Greatest professor I have ever had. I love everything about him and his teaching. His intelligence and concern for students are both excellent. I HIGHLY recommend taking a course with him. He will challenge you / the work isn't easy.. but it will likely be a very worthwhile experience.

Attending Dr. Schwenk's classes are 110% mandatory, and not just because he writes the notes by hand, but because they're the best lectures ever. Hand-drawn diagrams, steady pacing, great explanations, and he really puts in an effort for his students. The TA, Bill, also rules, and went so far as to make wicked long review videos before practicals.
Dr. Schwenk is the best teacher anyone could have. He has taught me so much in the multiple classes I have taken with him, and would recommend him as a professor to everyone.
Outstanding professor who truly cares about his students. EEB3273

Professor Sylvester is an expert in her field. She is worldly and wise. She expects her class to think critically, and engage with the material beyond surface-level. She grades strictly, but fairly. Don't take this class if you're used to skimming readings or skipping class. Take advantage of the opportunity to learn and challenge yourself!
Amazing class. Do the readings and go to class and you should be fine. I'm surprised she doesn't have a better rating on here.

Prof Sylvester is very knowledgeable and Gender and War was truly an eye opening class, I recommend it to anyone. To stand out, skim the news before going to class, she asked my class a lot if anyone knew what was up. Just pay attention, form opinions, have an open mind, and participate, even if it's just asking a question. Makes a big difference!

I am taking her POLS 2998, and the class is 1/4 participation, 4 papers and a presentation. Very flexible with deadlines and cares about her students. She also is very funny and lighthearted, I recommend for any Political Science class.

Took this as a related. Wrote 3 papers, 1 in class final essay. 1 random 'announced' popquiz. 1 group presentation on a specific war (you can choose or have it chosen for you). you're given 4 novels to read and keep up with. I got A's for all my papers and did poor on 1 quiz which resulted in an A-. she's relatively punitive to those who skip

Best proffessor I've had, probably ever. She's really amazing, makes you think about the world in an interesting way. There's a decent amount of writing but we were given relative autonomy to pick topics so it was not bad at all. Highly reccomend taking Prof Sylvester, she's dope.

I took a course that was POLS 2998/WGSS 3261. Overall it was really great but I did find that she would challenge everyone with various concepts and ideas to have stronger papers. Though we all learned much I felt that some of the group projects and prolonged discussions could have been made shorter.

She comes off as overly intense at first, but eventually you get used to it and she can even be kind of cute in an old-lady way. She has a ton of cool stories about her research in Africa. Definitely the most interesting class I've taken yet.
in the midst of studying for her 50 question short answer test... absolutely ridiculous because her info is so unorganized and general I don't even know what to even study. dumb.
Boring lecture. Final is 50 short answer questions from unorganized material. she blabbers on and on and on all class long. I guess it's an easy class but the test formats are just annoying.

Terrible professor. She'll be sure to give you her "worldly resume at every opportunity, teaches out of her own poorly written textbook, and grades very harshly. The entire class of "art and museums in international relations" is a subject that has enough substance to fill one class period. The rest is nonsense.

Boring lectures, easy exams. Kind of odd questions, particularly on the final (for example, "Would refugees like to have your problems? Yes/No"). Most of the material in lecture seemed irrelevant to the exams, but there was a decent amount of lecture-specific questions on the exam. Pretty easy though.

The class is super hard, but he provides recordings of all the lectures and all the notes you could ever want. He only tests on material covered in lecture. He's clearly passionate and knows his stuff. Some students were upset by the few supplemental lectures he put out, which is a fair criticism. If you're confused, talk to him. He's a cool dude.

Good lecturer, ok professor. 4 exams + a final and thats it. INSANE amount of material for each exam. Goes over class time almost every class, and posts supplemental videos you're required to watch on your own time when HE falls behind (so he can stay on schedule). Exam questions are very tricky in terms of wording, and can get super super specific

This class sucked all exams no other grades and he dumps information like no other professor I've ever met. Sometimes he talks so fast that he is incorrect and tries to correct himself but it just becomes more confusing. The final is 33% of the overall grade and cummalative. I know there is not another option for this class so prepare yourself.

Dr. Frasca is fantastic. He expects a lot because if you are taking his class you really need to know this material. Follow the learning objectives he gives you, ask for help, show up to lecture, and if you have to miss, just talk to him. Best professor I have ever had. Hands Down.

Very hard class, there is a quiz every week worth 30% of your grade (one gets dropped). His exams are very fair, it is just a lot of information to remember especially for the final. The book is pretty much mandatory, pretty good lecturer but tends to just read off slides.
Dr. Frasca is the bomb diggity. Definitely the most useful and rewarding class I have ever taken at UConn.

Very work intensive course. His quizzes and exams ask many specific and difficult questions. However, he is a very good teacher who genuinely cares about his students' learning. You will learn a lot about histology from taking his course.
Dr. Frasca is an extremely intelligent man! You must be a sponge and soak it all in!!
Very smart professor. Only problem is that he would fall behind and then would schedule class at other random times to make up for it.
Very into histology. Enjoyed the class. Must study and work hard but it is possible to do well.

Teaches histo pretty rigorously. Weekly quizzes are inconsistently difficult. Lab is not very enjoyable and lecture is kind of dry, but he doesn't go very fast (we didn't cover everything on the syllabus). Everything is straight from the main book and readings are essential because he doesn't post slides. Exams are MC and easier than quizzes.
Lectures are kind of boring, he does not look out at the class a lot. Nice guy overall though.

Professor Kravet made a difficult course both engaging and interesting. His lectures provided clear cut examples for every topic in each of the learning modules. He provided all the tools necessary for success, you just have to do the work. 10/10 class for a business student who wants to start a career in finance or accounting.

Intermediate 2 is not the easiest subject, but Todd does a good job of teaching you the material. The material can be boring but his corny jokes made it bearable throughout the lectures. The exams aren't too tough, but the practice exams are very similar to it, so as long as you get that down, you'll be fine.

The course content was tough, but the way that he teaches the information is very helpful and clear. A lot of emphasis was placed on doing in class problems that were helpful for the exams. It was a lot of information but I felt overly prepared.

Prof. Kravet is the best I have encountered in my acct classes. The material is tough but he explains really well, and is willing to help at any time. Many students did really well in his class, I am just not good at taking exams. You will learn a lot.

3202 is a hard course, but Professor Kravet organizes everything and presents it clearly. The material can be boring, but he goes out of his way to add silly things to the slides to make things better. Exams are basses off the course pack (which is really helpful) and there are opportunities to increase your grade if you're not a good test taker.

Todd is the best accounting professor I've had a UConn so far.
