The material covered is hard, but Todd helps a lot by providing in class guided notes and going over many problems in class step by step to help make sure you understand how to do everything. He throws in a lot of puns into his powerpoints to make things more lighthearted and enjoyable.

Todd is very funny, but the class material is difficult - especially exams. The grading rubric is clear and he gives extra credit, but the multiple choice questions WILL trick you on exams, almost guaranteed, when you're least expecting it. Take it with Todd but be careful/pay attention to details! 2 group projects. 10 students (of 120) got an A.

Love Todd as a person, but extremely difficult class. The material is very dense and requires a lot of practice. Go to class, read the book, do the quizzes and all extra problems you can. Exams kick your ass. Watch out for the final.

Todd is okay. Inter 2 was difficult! Exams are hard and require a lot of outside practice to do well. Todd is clear and tries to bring humor occasionally to some dry lectures. My only complain is that he should "dumb down" the material a little more because it is easy to get lost and confused. READ THE BOOK! It helped me prepare and do well

Professor Kravet is great. Not an "easy A," , but makes sure students understand the material. He makes corny jokes that help keep class interesting. Homework is optional, but make sure you understand how to do all the problems because tests are similar. He has the bookstore create a "coursepack," which has all his notes and in-class problems.

Professor Kravet is a really funny and enjoyable person, but he has ways to go before becoming professor material. He rushed through lectures without explanations, made students work on problems alone, and his exams were just impossible. So many students got Cs and Ds on his exams, which is ridiculous. He says he would curve final grades but didn't

Professor Kravet has a great personality. He is always talking to students as if they are his friends and likes to crack jokes. However, his exams are impossible to get an A on. They are just so difficult. I spent hours studying and ended up with a C on every exam. His practice exams are simple but nothing like his actual exams. Reallly hard class.
I took Dr. E as a graduate student. An awesome human being! She is fair in her grading and approachable about any content you may need help with. No matter how small. Learning from her is fun.

I wish Dr. Eaton could teach all of my courses. She is the most knowledgeable and passionate yet hilarious professor I have met. Pay attention to lectures because she highlights important info for exams. She will make you work for an A but she makes it very accessible.

I adore Dr. Eaton. If you have the opportunity to take a class with her, I highly recommend. She is thoughtful as a person and professor, very passionate about being a nurse, and a good teacher. There was a good amount of reading and discussion board posts, but they were mostly opinion based and on interesting topics anyway.

Dr. Eaton was the most caring professor I have ever had. I took this class as a gen ed and it was my least stressful class. Attendance isn't mandatory but I recommend going because it helps with the discussion posts and if you are in class she may say you don't have to do the post at all. Loved the class and loved Dr. Eaton.

Dr. E is everything you could wish for in a professor. Kind, understanding, committed to students inside and out of the classroom, and passionate about what she teaches, she makes you want to learn. Through engaging lectures and assignments, she creates a bright and supportive learning environment where her students feel appreciated and cheered for

Was such a sweet and kind professor. We read one book and watch some documentaries with discussion board posts every week. Discussion posts were easy and she was lenient with grading. 10/10 recommend.
The most caring and engaging professor I've ever had. Her passion for her job really shows and benefits all of us. Such an amazing learning environment.

Carrie Eaton is my favorite professor in the School of Nursing (honestly she is probably everyone's favorite). She has such a bright personality. Yes, OB is hard, but she is very validating and makes everyone feel like they are heard and not alone. She is also a great lecturer and is very transparent about tests, grading, etc.

As I am writing this, Carrie Eaton has just given us all candy because we are stressed for another exam. Quite literally, I needed this. She is the kindest woman who has a hard class yes, but makes it fun and entertaining. While the other half of this semester gives me infinite despair, Carrie Eaton is the light in the darkness. She is so nice.

Dr. Eaton is the best professor at the School of Nursing! Her lectures are amazing and she talks so passionately about OB. I genuinely look forward to going to her class each week and have never felt like I have learned so much from one class. Do yourself a favor and take a course with Dr. Eaton for your own well-being

Dr. Eaton was a lovely professor! The class is really easy as Dr. Eaton wants you to focus on the class content more than anything. Dr. Eaton always kept the class engaging and the content is very relevant and important. 10/10 class and 10/10 professor!
Very nice instructor. I enjoyed her class and exams are east (but there are 6 of them). Open book and not timed. Lab is a little bit of work but overall not a hard class. I enjoyed this one.
Awesome prof.

#teambeasley! Although this was a W course, the writing process wasn't horrible bc Prof. Beasley provided extensive feedback & help along the way. Lecture discussed a variety of awesome topics, class environment facilitated open discussion. AND she brought novelty donuts on the last day!

Great class! The professor really cares about student learning and works hard to create a open dialogue between different viewpoints. She was very helpful when I had difficulty with one of the readings. Great class for open minded thinkers.

Great teacher. Helped me make critical career decisions that turned out to be right on. Class is entertaining and an eye opener. Glad I got into her sec in the fall too. She caught a few cheaters in the act and had the guts to fail them. WTG. Good class and easy cause it was entertaining and interesting.

Class isn't that difficult but teacher doesn't follow syllabus and is very unclear in expectations for papers and exams. Assigned books and readings are not discussed in class. Do not expect replies to your emails. Also, the class is very disorganized. Not a hard class if you can push through the lack of clarity and lack of helpfulness.

Good, cool teacher, midterm and final were online and straight from the notes pretty much. go to class because she explains things well. I didn't use the 2 books at all though they weren't tested. a few short papers after watching videos online throughout the semester and some easy journal entries. enjoyed the class.

V. easy class. Doesn't post slides (they are kind of bland, in fact) Tests only on lectures (multiple choice); has review days. Has in-class activities based on the concepts, but feels like they fill up time because there isn't enough material! 7 easy-ish homeworks. Could improve class w/ use of published research examples, and a fun project.
She is a great teacher. Very helpful and not too difficult. Uses powerpoint and reviews before the exams. I recomend her
Cool prof, easy class!
This professor is very clear and entertaining. I felt like I learned a lot but did have to do a lot of work.

She seemed like she knew what she was talking about.her powerpoint slides were always neat.she didn't tell us what we needed to know.we had to write a 5-7 pg response paper but we didnt know what she expected from us, so we had to wing it. she thought this class was a W class and so assigned a ton of reading. the final covered material that was not

Took PATH2200 with Edan. He was given a tough and brand new class to teach so often, things didnt work and class always went over. I will say though he is one of the smartest, most caring, and most accessible teachers I have ever had. Always wants to make sure you're doing things right in the lab and is very committed to making sure you learn

Great prof, accessible, and genuinely wants you to learn. Lecture is thorough so you prob won't need the textbook. It is an intensive class and you will need to put in work to do well, so stay up to date with lectures or else you will miss out on a lot. The quizzes are fairly easy but be ready for exams. Don't miss out on the extra credit!

Great lecturer, caring professor, and overall really awesome! Anatomy is quite difficult, and you really need to attend class in order to do well on the exams. His powerpoints are extremely detailed and you won't need the book to understand the concepts. Do the extra credit! He's always available outside of class and answers any questions you have.

Teaching is NOT his calling, he just rambles on, but just write it down anyways and study that along side the textbook and you'll be fine. If you want an A in the class make quizlets for each system after lecture (keep up with it!) and study those for the exams (you got this). Overwhelming amount of info for only 1 semester. TA's are your go-to.

He gives quiz dates in advance so you know when to come to class. Lectures are boring and 100+ slides for each unit. Use lab to figure out how systems work before exams. If you understand and review the powerpoints you won't need the book to pass but it is recommended. The study guides for the lab are exactly what you need to study for lab exams.

Dr. Tulman really cares and it shows. Youll have to work for your grade but his PowerPoints have all the details and he is super helpful during office hours. Theres a bunch of quizzes and exams, but the quizzes are easy if youre not sleeping through everything but study for the exams. Go to the lectures and labs, asks questions and youll pass!

Dr. Tulman is an amazing professor. I am currently in his Anatomy and Physiology class on animals and he really tries his best to create the most detailed powerpoint with EVERYTHING you need to know. He gives quizzes during lecture that aren't hard if you review the powerpoint before class. People who complain about his class aren't putting in work

Not the easiest course but the professor seems to care. His lecturing style isn't everyone's cup of tea. He is very helpful during office hours though. Expect to put in effort, and don't take this class along other tough classes like orgo or biochemistry.

This class covers a lot of information in a short amount of time. As such, it is very easy to get lost if you miss even one lecture. Tulman is not the best lecturer, but a lot of students who dislike him are also not putting in a lot of effort. If you keep up with the material you will do just fine. Don't skip class like a lot of people do.

I enjoyed Dr. Tulman, but many of my peers were not fond of his teaching style. His lectures are long and boring, and he's a bit of an awkward man. But I think he cares. The topics he teachers are challenging, but he is great at explaining one-on-one. The exams are not too difficult but you do have to study well. There is a lot of information.

TULMAN IS THE LEGIT WORST PROFESSOR AT UCONN! The fact that this is a mandatory class for animal science majors, will literally destroy your GPA. He does not know what he is talking about so his lecture are pointless to go to and don't bother asking questions. Your saving grace is the TAs they will be your best friends and help you so much.

This guy pretends to be chill but is really just super disorganized and doesn't seem to care how well students do. He changed the grading structure in the last week of classes, and never responds to emails. His lectures are full of things that are just common sense so they're kind of a waste of time. I'd recommend taking this class w/ someone else

I loved taking class with Prof Lucia. He is super nice and knowledgeable. He focuses a lot of pubic speaking in this course, and coming from someone who HATES speaking in front of this class, it was actually very helpful and bettered my public speaking! Discussions are mandatory as you do an inperson assignment every week!
Super easy 2 credit class. 1 two min speech, 2 letters, and one group presentation and a couple discussion post make up most of the grades, super easy A
I think he's a harsh grader, especially for a 2-credit writing course.

Don't have to show up to lecture, but have to show up to discussion. Final presentation, no final exam. He's a pretty chill guy, but it's hard to get a really good grade because he picks apart your presentations and how you communicate. Not unfairly, just definitely harsh. Class is only 2 credits and it's true to that. Not too much work.

Honestly one of the worst professors I've had at UCONN. Assigns way too much work for a 2 credit course , provides no feedback for the pointless work he assigns, and does not do a good job teaching within his lectures. I genuinely can't imagine taking a less effective approach to 'teaching' a 2-credit course.

I really enjoyed Professor Lucia. I think he was engaging and really cared for his students. With that being said, there was a lot of coursework for only a 2 credit class. There were multiple discussion posts and assignments per week. The group projects were also a little annoying. However, I do like this professor.

Professor Lucia gives way too much work for a two-credit class. Most weeks I spent more time on BUSNW than my ACCT & FNCE classes. All assignments are pointless busywork that either has you watch a TEDx talk or read some obscure article the professor finds. The class lacks substance and is redundant to take as a junior or senior.

I took this class during covid w/ online lectures and an in person discussion with Lucia and the class was pretty much a breeze. There are a few different papers and group assignments but he's super clear about what he's looking for in each one, and was always available to read over drafts and stuff. Lucia is a really nice guy who knows his stuff.
Very caring and clear about the class. Your writing will notably improve by the end.

Tough grader. No patient at all. Lots of homework. The homework will be coved with lecture from class and what she thinks you should know (yup, without teaching you). Basically, if you want to pass the class you better be good at mind reading bc she won't tell you what she expects, but if you don't write it in homework, you will get points off.

Worst statistic teacher ever. She may know her field but the teaching is mostly reading her slides. Tough grade and with ridiculous reasons such as "Why not use this method" and cannot explain it properly.
Great teacher who went goes to great length to ensure that students understand material. Very helpful in and out of class. Piqued my interest in studying time-series further. Thank you.

I was one of a few undergrads in her Time Series class, and it seemed like I was one of only a few people who had any interest in learning something and asking questions. No wonder she's rated so low on here. Honestly, she's full of energy, and wants you to do well but more than anything learn the material. Best stat lecture I've had.

She's a great instructor; very approachable, reasonable, and helpful. I like her enthusiasm for the subject and her interesting questions about the topics being covered in class. In her excitement she can sometimes (unintentionally) be vague and unclear about the explanation. Her assignment/HW questions can occasionally be vague.
Her undergraduate courses are not nearly as bad as the grad ones as far as I've heard. Although, this is an easy course to begin with, shes not approachable and always seems angry.
should be fired!
Not very willing to give assisstance, expects A LOT of her students.
Teaching is not among her strengths...
should be fired, not caring about student, lzay

I graduated from UConn with a degree in English in '11. The question came up with friends "who was the best professor you've ever had?" My answer was so undoubtable Manning that I felt compelled to come here and write a review. He was probably one of the hardest professors I ever had but I definitely learned the most in his classes. Take his class

I took Drama with him and he's really a good guy, really wants to help you succeed. The thing is it is NOT an easy A. He spots the BSers a mile away and will not take any nonsense (such as below reviewers saying he rambled). Was always 100% clear about what to know for exams. I did great with him and will miss him.

Worst professor I've ever had. Never taken such a disorganized class. I was so excited for this class because I'm an English major and love drama but hated every moment of it. Boring as ever, barely spoke about the plays that we needed to read. Fell behind on the syllabus so much that the second exam was 18 plays. Horrendous and not recommended.
Guy probably was a good teacher a long time ago but needs to retire. Likes to talk about his days in London. Overall not to difficult a class.

Very good guy. Makes class fun, and has a great sense of humor. Class discussions are tough if you fall behind in the readings. Even though I might have failed, this was a very interesting and fun class.
Great professor, extremely knowledgeable, old school. Demands a lot from his students, but gets you to really understand the works.

most perfect person to teach willie shakes EVER! im taking shakespeare 2 next semester just so i can have him again. knows everything possible, it seems, and shows you the plays for their complexity, completely different from any other way i've read them. I want to be Juliet just because of his reading of the balcony scene!

He is a true scholar, the class requires a lot of reading (7 plays, 1 poem, all 150 sonnets), but the concepts explored are really interesting, even to someone like me who hates reading anything written before 1850. I would recommend this class
Manning is brilliant, and quite possible one of the most interesting people ever.
This guy is the coolest guy ever. Ever. The material really comes alive when he talks about it.

Joe is a great professor, he really cares and all that. He's super smart, too. But I don't think he understood the innate difficulty analysis poses to people that aren't inherently good at math. I can't prove to save my life and he sent everyone an angry email at the end of the semester about how badly we did. Only B on my entire transcript!

Joe is no longer at UConn so this review is for his students at his new school. Joe is extremely energetic which helped me stay focused during lecture. Analysis is a tough class no matter who you take it with, but Joe helps a lot during office hours and online sources are okay for the HW as long as you cite them. Very quick at responding to emails.

Good professor, I took multivariable calculus with him. His exams were a little tough, but he held study sessions and really wanted the students to do well. He is only a year or 2 removed from grad school, so he is very relatable. He loves UConn and will help you if you need it!

He's not very clear at all, and he seems to have gotten lazy since he got so many good reviews in the past. His class was incredibly hard, but at least he believes in a very generous curve. I'm a pretty good student and I never had any idea what was happening in Joe's class.

My favorite professor here at UConn. He cares about his students and truly want them to succeed. He also gives out interesting extra credit assignments. His exams could be vey hard but are always culturally related to real life examples. Anyways, Joe Chen is the man. If you could take probability with him, I highly recommend that you do.

Joe was a very exciting professor for probability. He tries to keep everyone engaged with his culturally related exams, he also offers a lot of chances for extra credit. Although I think Joe is a great teacher, I do think that he expects a lot of you during exam time. His exams are more concept based, so it can be tough. He curved the 2nd and final

Joe Chen is probably may be favorite professor so far here at Uconn. His lectures are straight forward and he teaches the material very well. His tests are some what difficult but he curves very fairly. Gives tons of opportunities for extra credit. Joe Chen IS THE MAN.

Really wants his students to succeed. He is a great teacher and I loved having him. He lets you use multiple pages of cheat sheets on exams and you can redo online homework problems are much as you want until you get them right. He has a great personality and always made everyone laugh.

JP Chen is the man. If you can take him, I highly recommend that you do. Multi is not an easy course but Professor Chen makes it as easy and clear as it can possibly be. Definitely one of the best math teachers I have ever had.

One of the best professors I've had. Very lenient on grading and homework and deadlines and he truly cares about his students and how well they do. You can use cheat sheets for tests and if you can do the practice exam you are fine for the test! Very enthusiastic and makes funny references to make learning more fun. Strongly recommend.
Such an amazing professor. He is so funny and sarcastic that the lectures just fly by

One of the best professors at the University of Connecticut. He truly cares about his students and tried to be funny. His lectures are AMAZING. He is very hands on and an overall fun guy. This dude even dressed up for halloween. He puts ALL other professors to shame. I had the most fun and learned the most in this class

One of the better teachers I've had. He tries to keep it fun which is always nice. It's a lab heavy class and they are worth 50% of your grade. Lecture is straight out of the book (he wrote it) so just take notes in the book and you'll be set. There are three exams and they are all short answer questions.
GREAT professor! Get to know him!
take this class, hands down the best professor I have ever had
Best teacher I have ever had anywhere at any time, if you have a chance to take one of his classes, take it.
Literally the best teacher I have ever had. Makes learning fun and stress free and you do learn a lot!
Really good guy. Just wants to see students succeed.

Great, funny, interesting guy. Very approachable and easy-going. If you turned in an assignment late he accepted it, extra-credit opportunities, really cares about how the class feels about material. Attending class is necessary because he does not post notes online. One of my favorite professors and a fun easy class.

Great Professor. He really knows what he is talking about and cares about his students. He only give two tests with challeneges your knowledge of what you learned in class. He makes it so everything that you need to know comes right out of the text book. Overall a great class. Highly recommended

I absolutely loved the information and content learned throughout this course, however, Mrs. Park executes it in the most boring uninteresting way. She shows no compassion for what she's teaching, she reads off powerpoints each class and all the information needed for the exams is in the book, but attendance is required for group assignments.

Mrs. Park is probably the most boring professor I've ever had. She lectures the entire time and her exams cover almost nothing in the lecture, all from the book. She has no interest in what she teaches/her students. I would recommend skipping on her.
Good Teacher but assigns alot of busy work during class, so you must go. Easy A if you do all the work she assigns, tests are easy because she gives the actual copy for you to look over during class.

Material is not too hard, lecture is straight from the book. She's not very helpful though and basically disinterested. Exams can be tricky and what's covered in lecture/book does not prepare you for them whatsoever. If you have the option take this class with someone else.
Yes, she's boring. You'll have to read the book to get the material.

Boring class, makes you do mind body exercises before every class which is a waste of time. Give alot of busy work and the class project is just a waste of time and alot of work considering its only worth 9% of you whole grade.

Dr Park is a very nice woman that teaches a class about the most interesting part of psychology, the disorders. I truly learned a lot and kept the book. Tests were not super easy, nor were they overly hard, unless you were an idiot as most people in that class tend to be. If you have a smidge of brain, you should do fine. She is a bit boring tho
She's a good teacher; you just have to work hard to get a good grade.
Boring, useless professor. Definitely do not recommend.
No Comments

Mike is a great professor, and I would recommend taking his 3201 course to anyone with an interest in accounting. He uses real companies which makes the material much more engaging. The class is entirely based on 7 homework assignments and two exams all of which are take him. They can be long, but that's the price you pay for no tests. 10/10 class.

Professor Willenborg was extremely knowledgable and gave so many real world examples to tie into financial accounting. I thought this class was difficult but definitely manageable as he shows you how to do all the assignments and sets you up perfectly for the midterm exam. The final project is lengthly but he gives you plenty of time to get it done

Extremely tough grader, he'll knock off points wherever he can and often the points taken off are not proportionate to the actual "mistake". Sometimes his advice can be misleading as he'll tell you one thing in office hours and then when you use it on the assignment he'll dock points. The assignments weren't too bad but the final project is lengthy

I had Prof. Willenborg for Intermediate I and he was fantastic. He has changed the course a lot because of Covid, and the assignments are graded very fairly. The course is based on 7 assignments, a midterm, and a final project. He is super approachable and knowledgeable due to his experience working at a Big 4.

You get two ways to survive. 1. Already knew everything (then why would you take it) 2. Record every lecture. Most of the exam are short answers which you cannot find answers from the book or his note. So, record every lecture and listen to that again and again until you can remember every single word he said. The exam is based on his talk.
He was my professor a few years ago at the MBA level and found him to be very knowledgeable and helpful. great professor

awful professer! Very hard exam which is all short answers. The question from the exam more related to the real work exprience rather than the concept knowledge from textbook. Easy to get A if you have working experience in accounting field

Very complex material. Professor does not give enough exercises to practice. Lots and lots of rules need to be memorize in order to solve multiple steps problems. Shorts answer questions are not really short as he asks 3 or 4 different things in the same question. Can't study from textbook as he uses different approach. Extremely difficult!!!

The worst accounting teacher ever! Don't take the class with him. He is really rude and not willing to help the students. The exams are ridiculous difficult and the short answers are really hard. It is impossible to get 90.He tries to make most people get B so he doesn't need to curve the grade. Try to avoid him!
Pretty easy class. He does in-class examples that help with the homework and they both help on the exams.

Amazing professor, super knowledgeable and passionate. Cares about his students and leaves great feedback on essays. Class is largely based on papers which he graded fairly harshly at the beginning of the year but gradually left better marks as the semester progressed. Participation is a big part of the grade, so go to class and participate.

There are easier double-dips. You can probably get an A without reading the book- just know the lecture powerpoints and show up to discussion. Do more than the 10 required responses for extra credit. Very easy. Sometimes the reading is interesting, but there's almost no need (especially if you're taking harder classes that have a lot of work).
Lots of reading, especially towards the end of the semester. Quizzes and exams are easy as long as you study the PowerPoints. His lectures are great and very interesting

Reading is necessary for most of the content. Some stuff you can find on the internet but hes much more clever than you, you need to read. If you read and remember the stories you'll do fine. Real smart guy, excellent lecturer. Be prepared to read the most boring stories you can find, stay strong.

Highly, highly recommend Dr. Bonner. He makes some pretty boring texts interesting in his lectures and shows you how they connect/contribute to other texts in class. He's super intelligent and will meet with you outside class if you need help, or just to chat about the texts. If you need any requirement this class satisfies, take this class.

I had mixed feelings on Prof. Bonner throughout the semester. Some lectures were very interesting and entertaining. Some weeks he made me laugh and enjoy class, some weeks I was pulling my hair out because of sheer boredom. The quizzes were tough and he definitely does not give enough time to complete as they were long and very specific.

Dr. Bonner is highly intelligent, super nice, and the class topics and discussions were really interesting! He gives limited time for quizzes, which are technical and can be difficult - but if you do the readings and attend class, you'll be fine!

Bonner skims over the plot in lectures, so reading is important. The quizzes were more difficult than I expected, but manageable. We had a 1-2 paragraph response submitted to the TA on the reading every week which were not difficult. Overall, the class was better than I expected and I got an A which I was surprised about.

Reading each story is necessary in order to get a good grade in this class. Prof. Bonner does not summarize the plot in lectures. Instead, he discusses literary techniques and provides examples from the text that you should know for quizzes/exams. If you read and know the terms/examples, you should be fine.

This class is, obviously, very reading heavy and sadly Sparknotes doesn't cut it. Bonner gives great lectures that are concise and helpful as they give you key terms to know and summarize the readings that were due that class. Downside, exams are impossible as the questions are so specific. Most everyone does poorly. But good GenEd double dipper...

Dr. Legrand is a very kind and knowledgeable professor. Grade was based on lab quizzes, a few assignments, midterm, final, and project. Lectures can be a bit dry but she is very willing to answer questions and help you out. She posts the textbook online so you don't have to buy it (for both 3830 and 3840). I took another class with her just for fun

Professor Legrand is really nice and thoughtful. She made taking this class online really easy and simple. There is a plant damage collection (collect 12 samples by the end of semester), but it's pretty leniently graded. Quizzes are not too hard if you review the slides.

There's only one midterm, and 3 projects. Exams are short answer and open ended, she does provide review sheets but it does not cover everything that will be on exams, so it is best to have a general knowledge of the lectures.

DON'T take this class if you are looking for an easy A/elective course!! Her tests are freaking all open ended like no multiple choice so you have to remember like everythingg and her questions can be specific and lecture based :// I legit dreaded this course. also there are two big semester long projects that are so unnecessary and extra

Honestly not that hard, but the lectures can be dry. There's a group project debate at the end, but not that bad. The tests are short answer, but if you do her review questions, it's fairly easy. She's really nice and gives a lot of extra credit. She posts all the textbook chapters online, so if you read those it really helps!

Exams are short answer and she takes the most random points. Actually very difficult for a gen ed. Also, you have to do a journal of all your encounters with insects over the semester which are like 2 paragraphs each which isnt too bad but tough to not save for the last minute. I just felt like the whole class was such a waste of time

Professor Legrand is very knowledgeable in her field, and a very good professor teaching you practical and useful material. Lectures can be a bit dry, but it is your choice if you want to pay attention, she isn't interested in disciplining you. Open for questions, and she is very pragmatic and accommodating. Tests and hw were easy but useful.

Shes hands out lecture packets with all the notes. She has a slight accent, nothing to worry about. Only four homework assignments, 1 debate, and two tests. Tests are all opened ended questions based off the review ones she gives. Class can be boring but its practical knowledge. The book isn't needed because she is approachable with questions.
A fascinating class and an amazing teacher. She made insects really interesting - I loved this class.

I love Dr. Legrand's class. She has structured the class to facilitate learning. Material for the class is outlined and clear. She makes a great effort to perk interest with props and she has fun with the material. She is genuine and really loves bugs.

She's a really nice teacher and her tests are fairly easy. While the first part of the semester is boring (you go through every family of insects bit by bit) the second part is much more interesting. You watch a lot of movies in her class.

This course was very interesting to me, and Raj's expertise in Randomization is astonishing. He teaches essentially from memory perfectly, answers all questions clearly and helpfully, without fail. The lectures are incredibly dense, so be prepared for a tough course. Overall, this was one of my favorite courses at UConn! Professor Raj is the GOAT!

The smartest professor at UCONN. Dr. Raj displays great passion toward his work and teaches the topics in class with great enthusiasm. It is also one of the most complex topics in the CS curriculum, but it was done in a way where I enjoyed the class. Recommend...
The class that I took improved my knowledge of algorithms. Professor is very knowledgeable on the subject matter. Exams won't be easy and would require some extra practice.

Not hard to get a good grade because 90% is exams, and they're based directly off of the HW/practice exams. Also, the prof is a super nice person! However, my main gripe is that this class is too theoretical (paper-only) and I don't feel like I learned a ton even though I did well. Lecture material was confusing. Check the syllabus before you take

Raj is one of my favorite professors at UConn. You can tell he is very knowledgeable about the subject and it's impressive that he knows all lectures from memory. The grade is heavily dependent on the tests, which are difficult but follow a similar pattern to problems done in class. Highly recommend!

Really smart guy. Class was centered on algorithms, basically sequel to 3500. Exams were hard, they required generating your own algorithms. Decent at covering stuff in class, but quickly got into complex things in each topic that got hard to follow. Posted online notes, also had lots of office hours. Final grade was relative to class performance.
Take his class and see how awesome a professor could be. One of the best courses I've ever taken.
Passionate to teach and make the students interested towards the subject.

Raj is my favorite CSE professor. He has a easy-going, friendly humor. His class is very organized, he returns exams the next class (no one else does this in my experience). The content is clear and he posts notes on his website. Homework is light, most of your grade is from exams- which scared me at first- but he provides practice exams.
GREAT PROFESSOR! TAKE HIS CLASS

Prof. Raj is by far one of the most respected professors in the department. As long as you do the homeworks and score above average on the exams(not too difficult) the curve will be ever in your favor.

Professor Gomes is a very generous grader who cares a lot about his students' success. He is very accessible outside of class. Quizzes and project are very straightforward. His lectures are very insightful so make sure you attend class. Overall one of the best professors I have had!!

This class is lecture heavy, but he is interesting to listen to, and easy to understand. He assigns a lot of reading for homework, but you can get away with skimming it. The exams were a little tricky, but he grades fairly. He's approachable and a very nice guy. This is a good class even if you're not proficient in speaking Spanish.

Miguel is an incredibly kind soul. He understood I was going through a lot of personal issues at the time and was an incredibly accommodating professor. It's important to participate in class discussions because that's what Miguel wants to see and you will get a good grade :)

Miguel is so so kind and tries to grade fairly to your spanish level. He assigns too much reading before each class, but you can get good grades without reading every story. Hes very flexible with deadlines and really enjoys lecturing. Only four 1-2 page essays and one 5-page paper, which is really easy for a W

I have professor Gomes online, and everything is prerecorded on power points. The power points are dry and long. The class is on a fairly interesting topic, but it seems hard because the readings and lectures both feel like homework. The tests are open note so they're not too bad, but the there are only 3 tests. The questions are super specific.
The BEST professor I've ever had. He is so nice and the class is actually very interesting and you learn a lot.
Literally the nicest and most caring professor I have ever had. I would recommend Miguel to any student taking a Spanish class. He is so easy to understand and makes the material interesting.
Grades fairly!
Professor Gomes is so nice and helpful. He is very lenient with grading, so if you are struggling in the class you can still do well. Awesome professor!

I loved Professor Gomes! Such a nice person and you can tell he really wants you to enjoy the subject and class and if you ask for help, he's more than willing to assist. Was harder than most courses because I'm not a natural Spanish speaker. No midterm just 5 quizzes and gives a study guide for the final. Also a presentation which wasn't too hard.

I absolutely loved Professor Gomes. He's the best professor I've had in my two years at UConn so far. He genuinely enjoys teaching the class content, and really wants to help everyone succeed. The class is very easy, there aren't even exams. He also really gauges your Spanish skills, and grades based on your ability. Definitely go to class!

Great professor and great class. Took this as a summer class (5-week, first session). Awesome material and learned a lot. It's a decent amount of work but only because the class is condensed into 5 weeks. Really lenient on late work if that's something you're worried about with taking a summer class.
Lenient with grading and eager to help. (note: this was an online summer course)

Dr. Libal was a very engaging instructor - she tends to be soft-spoken but she will still hold your attention. Used a variety of material to enhance learning and ensured class was always interesting. Highly recommended.
Super awesome!
Easy class but very interesting. She loves women's studies and presents a very unbiased point of view. Come into the class with an open mind and compassion for others.
Great teacher. No tests just two papers during may term.

shes really nice and is willing to help out w/ anything youre having trouble with. the class gets boring b/c its long and mostly about stuff u dont care about. but shes so nice it kinda makes up for it in a funny way.
Shes so nice and knows what shes talking about. the class isnt hard but it gets a little bit boring.

AMAZING professor. Exams are straightforward. Essay assignments require thinking but are interesting. Always greets you with a smile and is always willing to help. Takes the subject seriously and is very passionate about it. LOVED her class.
Amazing professor. Really lenient, understanding, and just a nice person. Class is very interesting, she encourages participation but is nice even if you're shy. Highly reccomended.
No Comments

Professor Clark is an amazing professor. I have never had a professor who cared so much about his students and our learning like he did. We read Walden and wrote a few papers, but you had plenty of time to get them done. Just read and participate and try your best and its an A!

UNIVs are generally supposed to be an easy and fun 1 credit class, but we had to read a 300 page book, write weekly discussion posts, have speaking points, and write a 5 page paper. I enjoy learning history, but we should not have had to do that much when other sections were making memes. Professor Clark is generally really nice though.

Such a nice professor! He stimulated lots of discussion and wanted to hear what everyone had to say. Even though the course was online he tried to get to know his students. Not having exams was nice but there's lots of writing. He's a pretty lenient grader though.

Professor Clark was my UNIV 1784 professor and we read East West Street and had weekly discussions on it. His discussions were always in-depth, and he never expected you to have a come back if he disagreed. He respected everyone's opinion and always gave good feedback. This UNIV was definitely more intensive than any others but it was fun.

He's fun & a great prof alongside Thorson. Gives good feedback on HW & makes class engaging. Genuinely cares about students. Lot of writing (5 papers) & many readings. 5 field trips, including MA! Tips: No need to take long notes during lectures except for info to use in essays (no tests).

Discussion oriented class, individualized experience. There is a lot of reading and more work than the average class, but it is well worth taking. Prof. Clark makes sure that students are prepared for the assignments, learn it well, and remember it. Also, there are no tests.
Classic history professor and he does it well. Get ready to learn. Get ready to be challenged.
Super cool dude
He is one of the best at UConn, funny middle-aged British guy who taught a course on the American Revolution. Very fair grader if you put in effort. Overall awesome class!

Professor Clark is excellent! The class is challenging, but completely doable. The 5 page paper, the thesis paper, and the 5 assigned books are overwhelming at first, but as long as you manage your time well you will be fine! He is extremely approachable to help you in your research, too. His English accent also adds flare to the class.
Very fun, very nice guy. Keeps class interesting with activities and genuinely cares for his students. Take his class if you can.

Professor Simmons is one of the best teachers I've ever had. Extremely knowledgeable about the subject and his lectures do a great job of explaining how to do things. Gives lots of feedback on everything you submit which is very helpful. Will answer any questions you have. You need the course pack, not the textbook.

Professor Simmons is a very passionate teacher and he truly wants students to learn the material. That being said he goes through content incredibly quickly and his lectures can be super lengthly. Your grade is based on weekly homework and three exams, which are all open book and open note. You only need the course pack NOT the other textbook.
Pretty good guy. Sends out some good pron recommendations in his emails. 11/10 would fap take again

This class can be very difficult if try to go it alone, but the professor literally goes through every homework question every week in his office hours, so those are a MUST-attend. Exams can be very challenging if you're not jamming for those, but he holds a big 3 hour review session before each one. Great professor, questionable taste in videos.
Really interesting exercises!! Morgan is the best TA ever!!! Maybe he will add a lab section next semester?
He is amazing. He sends out the most helpful links via email!!!! His TA morgan is also very helpful, that too at such a young age! Amazing professor and TA!
Keith Simmons is an amazing professor. The lecture he gave today was truly inspirational. For some reason, this class really spoke to me. His links are extremely helpful.
His exercises are a provide twist on philosophy. Just remember not to click on any of the links to them in public.
Good Professor, remember to look into some web links he sent out via email, you'll find out those online materials are extremely helpful.
Good professor as long as you don't open up any of his emails in a public place ;)
He's a pretty good guy and doesnt waste your time.

Peter doesn't leave feedback on tests. He writes a big X probably bc he was angry about his life then if you bring it up to him, he goes "Oh yeah you're right" and gives you the point back. He DOES NOT grade fairly.

Most incompetent teacher I've ever had. Made countless errors on the in-class examples he copied out of the textbook; often failed to get through a single one. Once I came early to ask about a concept we were to be tested on that day, and he didn't get it himself. Later was forced to cancel class when he forgot to bring this test. Avoid if you can.
Teaching is very unorganized, gives long homeworks every week that are graded for correctness, bad handwriting.

The course isn't hard, but he has no clue how to explain things in ways that make sense... I would go to lecture, leave 100% confused, and then read the chapter in the book and realize how simple it was. He gave pretty hard/tedious homework assignments and the exams were kinda hard too, but overall the class wasn't bad. I wouldn't recommend him...

MATH 2410Q. Craig Miller is a grad student not a prof. He doesn't give sufficient notes. There are barely any examples in the notes showing us how to solve DiffEQs and the notes he does write out are sloppy and illegible on the board. The textbook can help. Just read it and if you understand you'll do fine. If you don't understand...drop the class.

Summer class, I learned more from iTunesU then I did from this guy, spent 20 minutes stumbling through a section and then would move on. I really like Math and he jsut killed it. Maybe I'm retarded but I jsut couldn't understand him. Oh, and Blanchard's book is useless too.
Good guy, the first time he walked into class i thought Chris Farley was our professor. Holy Shnikies!

Excellent teacher. Really likes what he teaches and is thorough with notes. Exam questions are a little different than homework questions, only tough part. I got a pretty easy B by just going to class.
very helpful.
Good professor. Went over everything you needed to know and not useless junk. I would recommend him to anyone who really just wants to learn no frills calculus

Hes got a good personality, a bit obsessed with using different colored markers, overall a pretty good teacher, skips steps when doing problems sometimes which makes it a bit unclear, his tests were easy if you study, expects you to already know a lot tho
One of the best professors at UConn. This will be his last semester teaching, so sorry for upcoming UConn actuarial science student.

Trimble is the best. Concepts are simple just a lot to remember. Grade is entirely based off of 2 midterms, final, and pricing project. Somewhat interesting material and Trimble is an amazing teacher so it's usually easy to stay engaged. The optional homework is the best study resource. He posts the slides so class is optional but I suggest going.

Professor Trimble is my favorite professor at UConn. He made me really enjoy Financial Math and prepared me extremely well for Exam FM, which I was fortunate enough to pass first try. He is extremely approachable and is really dedicated to helping his students. He helped boost my confidence multiple times throughout the semester. 10/10 recommend!

Professor Trimble will give you all kinds of tips and tricks to help you pass FM, as well as help you learn from your mistakes while being hilarious along the way. If you want to pass FM first try then take 3615 with him, do everything he says, and work your butt off!

Trimble is an amazing professor and a great person. 3615 is very tough material but he gives it to you in the simplest way possible. You have to do the work and watch the lectures but the grading is very fair. quiz at the start of every class on the previous class's material. Hard but worth it if you dont want to self-study for FM

What other professor will stay late in the evening every day to talk to a long line of students that have questions for him? What other professor can take these hard concepts and make them clear for all his students? You would never learn as much with anyone else. UConn is blessed to have Trimble on staff. Take a class with him if you ever can.

Trimble is a great professor. He cares about his students and wants you to pass, but he's honest when you're not on par. As long as you go to class ready to listen and do your work, he will help you do well.

Professor Trimble is a great teacher. Things that made no sense in Math 2620 instantly become clear once he lectures on them. His grading scale is a bit strange, there are quizzes everyday, and his exams are impossible,but he does prepare you for exam FM

He definitely ain't easy, but he will prepare you for the FM exam and he is VERY fair. Great overall guy, he stayed with us from 6-10:30PM the Wednesday before my FM exam just to answer any additional questions we had. Nobody cares about his students and wants them to succeed more than this guy. Good luck.

Very hard class but Jimbo is very helpful. He will give students chances for extra credit every time a certain Mets pitcher who apparently has an inappropriate last name and first name is R.A. wins 20 games. He also gives free Tickle-Me-Elmo dolls to students who get A on tests.
He is not very clear with his lectures, i fond my high school course clearer, this professor's exams are extremely hard, you have to know it down cold or you will not pass.

fortunate enough to have taken calculus in HS. For those with little prior knowledge of calc, lecturesconfusing, makes 3-4 mistakesclass, screws up everyone who already wrote down his incorrect work. makes mistakes on exams, too, once showed up 15 minutes late on exam day, didn't apologize. 17 students on first day12 by last day. downright awful

Terrible professor. Quizzes and exams are extremely hard. 5-12 questions each, at least 10 points each. Although he gives partial credit for some questions, he has prewritten notes that he just copies onto the board without explaining, and goes WAY too fast. Overall, better off using youtube.

Possibly the worst teacher I have ever experienced. Every class he makes countless mistakes and easily gets side tracked. To save yourself some time and a letter grade drop the class and find a new teacher.
Bad
He started the class off with a story about his wife.... from there... my grade fell to an F. By the end of the class I learned more about his wife than calculus.

The worst teacher I've ever had. Made tons of mistakes, and never bothered to fix them since he would make more mistakes trying to fix them. Was rude and did not grade fairly. He even made mistakes on the exams. I regret taking this class with him because I hated going to his class so much.

Honestly, just save yourself from this kind of misery in a class...Makes so many errors while doing problems out and makes light of it every time. His demos are not relevant to what's being taught in class. Don't take this class with him, period.

Honestly, just save yourself from dealing with this kind of misery....Makes so many errors while doing out problems and skips so many steps in the process. His demos are not relevant at all to the subjects being taught and its just a way to waste time. Just dont take this class with him.

The material is really hard but he's always there to help you. Don't take this class unless you're genuinely interested in advanced calculus,; otherwise it will be a really miserable experience. He's really nice and helpful though so it's worth taking.

Harsh grader, does not make expectations clear, won't review for exams, only homework grades and exam grades to go off. Basically copies notes from the book. Awful professor, please switch if you can.

He's willing to help students out whenever he can. But going to office hours actually made me more confused because he never answers the question asked. He also stands in front of his writing about 99% of the time so it's basically impossible to copy notes and understand it at the same time. Big curve at the end though. Probably worth it.

Extremely difficult class. Great professor who understands what is being taught (almost too well that he sometimes misses explanation in detail). Homework and attendance are more than mandatory. Tough tests, but easy grading if you really care about and put work into the class.

A requirement for his class is X-Ray vision, since he stands in front of what he is writing and asks questions on it. You cannot even copy what he says because he changes it when he writes it down. Does not tell you what the format of the test will be, does not have set date for tests. Homework is graded harshly. Good luck or switch professors!

Graduate course: Did not teach what he was suppose to (prelim course), what he did teach was undergraduate math and could barely compute. Couldn't hear him and I was in the second row. Talked to the chalk board. Spent more time reviewing books than actually talking about math. No clear expectations for work, and got angry when asked to clarify.

Great guy; very difficult class but if you do the homework and go to his office hours he is more than happy to help. Tests are not easy, but he scales the grades based on how much you put into the class. Would recommend to anyone interest in theoretical mathematics.
so confusing
No Comments
The cases are sooo annoying and so is he.

I agree with the student below me. He might seem like a nice guy, but he is not approachable at all. He only cares about finishing his assigned chapters, and not whether you understand the material at all. He is a one-minded individual so watch out.

He seems nice and fun in the beginning, but you'll find out that it's like pulling teeth to get him to do stuff. It takes him forever to grade assignments/email. The case assignments were long and annoying. The class itself isn't bad. You just need his powerpoints, don't buy the book. Conceptual questions on the exam were tricky. Quizzes were easy.
The instructor is funny and helpful, but is a major course, so is hard if you don't like it. pay attention in class will get easy A, but if not then C, like me. XD
Great guy, great professor. Cares about his students and is willing to do anything to help. Pay attention in class and study the textbook to do well
The Pittsburgh Steelers "Steel Curtain" would be afraid of the real "Steele Curtain." Used class time effectively and was very helpful answering questions. Overall a great professor.
Really nice guy, class is hard but as long as you keep up you'll get no lower than a B. The cases are the most annoying part of the class by far.
He seems like a nice professor, but just watch out for him.

Prof. Steele is a great instructor. He is very clear and always willing to help. He does class examples each class that really help for the exams, and has a sense of humor as well. There is no nightly homework, but there are 3 case assignments due throughout the semester. I would highly recommend him, definitely a fun class!
She is a great professor. As long as you actually put in the effort required everything goes smoothly.

Horrible teacher. Ummm...yeah" is indeed her favorite phrase. She lost me so much between what she wrote on the board, what she was saying, and then what she "meant" to say. Had trouble in the class and went to her about it, and she was no help at all & didn't really care be; tried to use the book to teach myself, and it was pretty confusing too.
completely incomprehensible. i did a little precalc in high school and i don't remember it being this confusing. nice teacher but not good at conveying complex principles

Her favorite phrase is "sooo.... yeahhh" and essentially speaks as if she is addressing a class of middle schoolers rather than college students. Frequent mistakes proliferate throughout her lectures, and it is easier to teach oneself from the book. Her tests and quizzes, however, are not that difficult.
Teaches out of the book, when the book is already bad..all she says is yeeeeaaah, weeelllll, i dont know...

Prof. Mullen is a fantastic advisor, and will gladly go out of her way to help you in any way she can. As a teacher, she could use more preparation before lectures to cut down on mistakes during examples and confusion while explaining them. All in all, a good professor.

Bad teacher! She doesn't know what she's talking about because she gets confused when explaining. Also, she makes a lot of mistakes when showing practice problems and students are always correcting her.
If you do your homework and go see her during her office hours, then you are set to do well in her class.
No Comments

professors.name: Joseph Johnson
professors.department: computer science and electrical engineering department

reviews.review: Homework and exams were all through Cengage with the content evaluated being easily found on lectures from the professor or the Cengage online textbook. Homework is due biweekly which is nice, but typically have a bunch of problems (so best not to do them all in one day). Exams given are nicely made, they're similar to previous homework problems

Joe Johnson is one of the best professors in the CSE department at UConn, his lectures are thorough and engaging and are relevant to the coursework. I have taken two classes with him, 2500 and 4705, and in both he tested on only the fundamentals of the course (meaning if you pay attention in lecture and do the homework you will get an A).

The class was online and maybe it was only me but this class seemed pretty tough. Average for the final was around a 90. Seems like an ok class if you actually watch all the lectures. Hyperslate is brutal.

Prof. Johnson has become my favorite professor in the CSE dept so far. He gives very clear lectures and is very friendly and courteous towards his students. His exams and homework are very straightforward and he gives practice exams that are really helpful. He's just an all-around great professor who very clearly wants his students to succeed.

Homework's were easy for the most part, as long as you skimmed the (online) book you'd be fine. Final was 70% reused midterm questions. Giving the prof a bad grade because I went into this class expecting to learn something, but apart from the basics of prolog everything else was covered in previous 2000-level courses (e.g., very basic java).

The majority of the grade is homework. Tests ended up bringing my grades up. His lecturing was above average for the CSE department at UConn, but his slides are amazing. If you understand everything on the slides, you will get an A. No need for the textbook. JoJo has turned one of the hardest CSE classes into the most easily understandable.

He is super funny, relatable and engaging in class. He originally said that he would give pop quizzes, but we never had them because most people participated in class anyways. The material is presented very clearly and organized. Exam averages were always high and the homeworks are manageable. I'm excited to take another class with him

This class is awful. I thought I understood everything; I took good notes during lecture, I had no problems with the homeworks or labs, and then the midterm hit. 40%. Same story with the final, but I did improve to 60%. The midterm and final have material never even mentioned in lecture or lab. Engineers, prepare to start out with a tanked GPA.
Attendance isn't taken during lectures and he posts all the notes online so you don't have to go if you don't want to, but he explains things fairly well. Nothing special though.
Absolutely amazing.

An amazing professor. As someone who is going into the science/medical field this is a great class to take to help take a step back and look at the socialization of medicine, science, and how this relates to gender studies. Very discussion-based but about relevant topics so it was never hard to come up with something to say. Definitely take!!!

The only part of this class that I dreaded was the long readings, but make sure to take notes on every single one of them because they WILL help you on your research paper. She breaks it up into 3 parts so you don't even realize how long it is. She really cares about the students and gives amazing feedback. I would deff. take her for another class

Professor Mauldin and this class has changed how I think about the world. Her class was insightful and her presentation of the topics were fantastic. She is a great professor. 3 essays, participation, and a presentation determine your grade. If you put effort and show interest in the topics you will get a good grade.

Best class I've taken at UConn so far. Totally necessary for premeds nursing students in my opinion. Keep an open mind and you'll learn so much. One one 15 page paper which is broken up into 5 page papers over the course of the entire semester so it's never too much at once, and one easy A presentation. Best option for a W for science students.

Mauldin is a fantastic professor. She truly has a passion for what she teaches and makes class super interesting and fun. Classes are discussions and the only assignments are a small class presentation and an overall paper. She is not a hard grader but likes to see effort in the class and an overall interest in the topics. She is awesome!
Laura Mauldin is super nice and a great professor in general. Class is mostly discussion based, and papers aren't difficult. Try to take at least one class with her, you won't be sorry!

Professor Mauldin is an incredible professor. She cares so much about each and every student and is very passionate about what she teaches. Very interesting discussion based class. By far my favorite of the semester and that's coming from a science major.

She is an absolutelyamazing professor. I am a bio major and this actually made me like WS. She doesn't do tests, just papers which all of them I got 100 on. Pretty easy,no text book just some readings online that were sometimes long. Overall totally worth it. Great person just to talk to as well, very passionate.

Dr. Racca is a great professor. Acct 2101 is difficult and is definitely dreaded by many. Take the course with him as the professor. Course has no extra credit but he, quizzes, and reading assignments are lengthy but easy. Tests are 25 questions, study!
This class will be tough regardless of which TA you pick, so choose Racca (he heads all the other TA's).

This class is difficult. Your entire grade is based upon 3 exams. He is a really really good guy at heart, but he is awful at responding emails and helping out of the classroom. I found myself leaving the lectures feeling more lost than I originally was walking in. Avg exam score for all 3 exams was 80

ACCT 2101 will suck no matter who you take it with, but take it with Racca. He is the coordinator for the whole class and makes the exams. His classes also score higher than other classes. They reuse a lot of exam questions from previous years, so do as many study guides as you can. If you go to every class and study, this is an easy A.

Only take his class if he teaches the class personally and not if another professor teaches the class via his curriculum. Will end badly otherwise since they don't know what will be on exam's which make up more than 75% of the grade.

I don't like accounting at all but he made it bearable. He is funny and easy going. Grade distribution is fair so you'll have the opportunity to compensate for one bad exam. His class averages are also supposedly higher than other ACCT 2101 classes taken with other profs. The problems he goes over in lecture can be scary but concepts aren't too bad

I really liked managerial accounting with Racca. His sections also had the highest exam average throughout the semester, and I definitely can say we learned a lot of information. Brought up good examples in lectures, but you must read to pass this course, as he expects students to be caught up on reading. Put in the time and you'll do well.

Really great guy overall and knows his stuff. Lots of experience and talks about personal experiences (real life examples) in class. He is always accessible after class or during office hours and is always willing to go out of his way to help! Nice, caring guy overall, probably the best professor I've had so far at UConn.

Nice professor overall. Doesn't teach a lot, the lecture doesn't help much. He is a fun person to talk to. The exams are the same for all sections, can't really do anything about it. The class isn't too hard, but still you want to read the materials ahead of time.

Online, this class was very fair. The practice exams were able to be done for extra credit and they were so similar to the actual exam. The exams were open textbooks and notes which is one thing that made the class so stress free. One thing to note is that the lectures were VERY boring.

I personally liked this professor in the online setting. He wrote his notes out and posted his lecture videos every morning you had class. The class is grade is 90 percent exams so watch for that, but overall the exams weren't that bad.

Prof. Fan makes no attempts to keep lectures interesting. He always seems annoyed when people attend office hours. The biggest problem was him only using email. Without HuskyCT, it got difficult to study and keep track of grades. Very unorganized during lectures and tends to skip between whiteboards. Exams are only two questions each.

Since there is no textbook, no HuskyCT, no slides, and very little emailed review, it is necessary to go to class. If you follow the in class examples and the practice exams you can do well on the exams however they are very hard and he does not curve. There is a lot of theory and he often asks you to manipulate equations. Good lecturer though.

Professor Fan writes a ton of theory, which you don't use on the exams. I've learned to ignore everything but the equations and laws of thermodynamics. Also, his drawings are trash since he writes over them so many times. The exams are based heavily on the practice exams and on examples done in class. I think the only plus was there is no textbook

No-notes exams; averaged 62. Allowed notes for third exam and final. Hates numbers, loves algebra. You will not be using numbers. This makes exams a little more difficult, but you'll get the hang of it. EASY GRADER. No textbook. 4 exams are the only grades. Assigns homework to practice but it's harder than the exams usually .

Avoid! He is very intelligent but very poor at teaching. The entire class failed most of his exams. At the end of the semester he just curved the class to a C and called it a day. Fluids is interesting with the right professor, so find one who will actually teach it. Office hours are useless.

I really enjoyed Tai-Hsi's Class. He never gives long, convoluted examples or really difficult problems. He really wants you to have a good understanding about what you are learning on a base level. His tests overall aren't nearly as hard as he could make them. I would take him again.
Very good professor, knows the material really well and has great experience with fluids on projects he does. Exams are very conceptual and fair. Would really recommend him

Prof. Dono is the best! Their lectures and material/content are very interesting and cover topics you probably didn't get to learn in high school. Quite a bit of reading but it's manageable. Grade is from journal entries, open-note quizzes, and a final mini-essay. Some topics are a bit sensitive but they're good at providing trigger warnings.

Genuinely one of my favorite professors. They are super caring and are clearly very passionate about sociology. They inspired me to keep pursuing sociology. This topics are very important but are easy to understand. Wish I could take more classes with them!

Professor Dono is one of the nicest professors ever. This class was very chill and relaxing. There are a few assignments but they are fairly easy and opinion based. Quizzes are open note. We did many fun activities like watching movies, tv shows, and coloring activities. I would highly recommend as an elective or to fill a gen ed requirement.

Professor Dono is great, especially for people who've never learned about sociology before. She will assign reading from a book, but if you ask they will put it up online for free, and the class is mostly fun, low-stress activities. Final paper is a simple 7 page essay analyzing whatever media you want through 3 sociological lenses. Awesome class!

Easiest class ever. Some participation graded in certain classes, but don't really need to show up to every class. Only have 2 reading journals that you get feedback and can resubmit. A final paper but you work on it through semester, get feedback on, and isn't hard. A couple quizzes but open note and very easy 100s. Classes can be boring but easy.

Class is an easy A, you don't even need to read the readings every week to do good on the quizzes (since the quizzes are open notes). Only one big essay as your final, but other than that class is really easy, and you even get out of class early 90% of the time. Take this class.
Class is very chill and interesting, we watched movies and shows. As long as you do the readings, you will get a good grade.

Really cares for your well-being and is willing to stick after class for an extended time so that you understand what was covered in the class. She does super chill classes such as drawing or going to the Benton Museum for a scavenger hunt. The readings are required, but it's a few pages a week. Overall an awesome professor. Best I've had at UConn.

She is AMAZING. She cares about really making sure you understand the content of what she's teaching rather than loading you up with ridiculous homework. Her lectures are engaging and I learn a lot. Grades very fair. Didn't have to buy textbook either, she provided all readings. Really enjoyed this class. I never write reviews here, so take my word

This class is very manageable but does have a lot of reading. Does give you a lot of time on essays and projects making them easy to complete. Quizzes are relatively easy and they are open notes. Her lectures are very eye-opening and interesting. She cares about your well-being and will give you extra time on assignments if needed.

Prof. Villalba is amazing! She is a very easy grader and all of her assignments are very manageable. Her lectures are engaging and there isn't too much reading. She emphasizes public speaking and presentation skills so if that isn't your strength you might not want to take this class. Overall, she is wonderful!!!

Celines is a great professor and very knowledgeable about the course material. Exams are not that bad, but you will need to study to do well. The exams are totally based on lectures, so you have to be there, pay attention, and take notes, that is the key to doing well in this class. Quizzes are short and there is a fairly easy final project.

3 exams in person, pen and paper. 4 quizzes online, drops lowest grade, no answers on Google. All info on exams and quizzes based on what she talks about in class / the readings she assigns. Final is a project. 1 opportunity for extra cred. Class was difficult, wouldn't recommend taking just to fill content area or as elective.

Professor Villalba is a kind woman but honestly I couldn't pay attention to her lectures. Read the text and you will do great on the exams. She offers extra credit questions in her exams so make sure you study!
Teacher was amazing. The work you have to do is challenging, but as long as you took good notes and went to class, you can do well in this class. She is very easy to talk to!

I took this class to fulfill my CT1 Literature; knowing this is a literature-based class, you should go to this class with the mindset of literature things... reading & writing. Villalba is super accessible, and going to her office hours is helpful. She will try her best to help you succeed, but put in the work early- don't wait last minute.

do not take this class if not required. Professor does not care about the students or their grades. Paper exams with no open note. 20 or more page readings multiple times a week. Exams are hard because she does not explain anything. her notes suck. she does not give you answers to the review. the exams are so different from the review
Exams are hard. A lot of reading.

She never put dates on the readings/assignments, never posted slides, never specific about what she expected from us, and never clear about what would be on an exam until the class before it's supposed to be taken. She's very sweet, but I'd never take this again. She made it so hard for no reason. Not a very tough grader for exams. Just confusing.

If you need a CA4-INT class TAKE THIS. Lecture notes are your main source on the midterm and final paper and outside of those, there are basically no assignments. I loved her lectures and she is super sweet and very accessible outside of class time. Quizzes are easy (like 5-10 questions T/F or multiple choice)

Had her for the online econ course- lectures were really organized and assignments were all on sapling with 3 tries to get it right. The midterm was basically a longer Sapling assignment but was a little annoying we had to explain every answer, which took longer than the questions. It was really well done, considering it was an online course.

The absolute nicest woman. Always available outside of class and encouraged people to see her. Way too nice and gave a retake opportunity to those who didn't do well on the midterm and hw. Also very understanding. When I was stressed bc I had 3 exams in one day, she offered to postpone my test to give me time to study. Questions were also very fair

Shilpa is a really sweet, funny, and kind person. She cares about her students and if you ever email her or go to office hours, she will do everything possible to help. Notes were pretty clear and she gives you all the info you need for exams. Sometimes gives confusing answers to questions in class, but overall a great person and grad professor.

Prof Sethia is one of the best Grad Student Professors Ive had. The course material is pretty much the same for every Prof teaching the course and she teaches it well. If you have trouble, let her know and she will go out of her way to help you learn. The class is definitely useful overall too so try your best.

Shilpa was awesome teaching this class. I love that all of her material was very clear. Of course, to get a good grade, you have to work for it. She is very accessible if you have any questions, so don't be afraid to ask.

Shilpa's class is difficult, but she is a fair grader. She is also very approachable if you need help. I am taking graduate level micro economics now and it is very easy since Shilpa's intermediate microeconomics gave me a great foundation
Course is a little difficult but learning that material will help in the long run especially if you plan to go to graduate school

I know the class is not easy for some econ students who don't not have enough background in claculasbut Pro. Sethia tried her best to review the material students need to know for the exam. She is really nice and if you go to class, take notes and finish your homework, you should be fine with this class.

She is nice as a person, horrific as a Prof. Dont expect to get an A if you only plan on attending lectures, you will have to go above and beyond to decipher her work. For the love of god find another Econ 2201 Prof or avoid it at all costs. I dont even know why I took this class, I thought it would be interesting.
Dont get me wrong, shes a nice Prof as a person.

I would say that this professor is AMAZING, and does her best. I will say that attendance is MANDATORY (I was not able to attend much this semester), yet she was very lenient and tried her best to accommodate with me. She gives a lot of homework so try to stay on top of it!! Does frequent vocab quizzes so study hard!!

She's such a wonderful professor! Really makes sure you're able to learn and understand the material, and offers so many opportunities to improve grades for those who need it. She can be quite funny and also does her best to get the class engaged every class. Always one of the best parts of my day!

Professor Shin is legitimately the best professor I have ever had the pleasure of taking a class with. If you are worried about learning Korean because it's a tough language - it is a tough language but you couldn't get a better professor if you tried.

Such an awesome professor! The grade I received in this class and how much I actually learned is directly proportional. Unfortunately unable to take intermediate level courses due to graduation, but I'm sure I'll continue studying Korean on my own some day. Highly recommended.
She is a great professor and cares a lot about how well you retain the info. You can redo the dictation quizzes, tests are easy if you pay attention in class. It was a very fun class!

One of the best professors on campus, not going to sugar-coat it. It's evident in not only her teaching/lecture styles, but also in the amount of effort that she puts that she wants her students to actually succeed and at least learn something in the class. Definitely will respond to emails/concerns asap and is always open if you need help in class

Thoroughly enjoyed all 4 semesters with her, my favorite professor and classes at UConn. She cares about her students a lot and also cares about learning rather than just the grades. As long as you have even just a slight interest in the subject you are going to love it, wish I could have her again!
Best professor at UCONN

My favorite professor and class at the University. She is a sweetheart and prioritizes actual learning rather than grades. Cares about her students and generates interest for the language. Attending lectures is important but they are always fun.

Professor Eun-ju Shin has been an amazing teacher so far, it's clear that she loves to teach and puts a lot of effort into her lectures. The class isn't terribly difficult, you just need to make sure you attend the lectures/discussions because she fits a lot into them and it would be easy to miss something important. She's very accessible for help.

I don't understand what this professor's problem is. Extremely racist and judgmental. She says she wants one thing and then criticizes you when you do exactly what she asked for.
