Always wants to be right. Doesn't care about other people's opinions. Her words and actions do not match. Will make your life so difficult! Avoid her at all costs.

Avoid this professor if you can! She claimed she wanted constructive feedback but wouldnt listen to any feedback about how the exam questions were too ambiguous, and would even get annoyed. Also nearly every exam had errors. Poor performance would usually be blamed on not coming to office hours. Lectures werent engaging or interesting .

The grade is based only on exams and participation and we had to beg for an extra credit assignment. Shes not very organized. Shell state her exams are straight forward but are NOT. You really need to work in order to pass this class.
She was a decent lecturer but there were multiple errors on the exam and she didn't cater to what students felt. Only a little bit of extra credit. Would not recommend.

This professor seems to care about her students by emphasizing how often she holds office hours, but other than this, she does nothing to help our grades. There are major errors on exams that leave you questioning yourself and wasting time redoing the problem before she even tells you that she made an error. NOT worth it unless a required class!!

She was a good lecturer but the exams were a mess and harder than necessary because of errors in answer choices or questions that were worded in a confusing way. She gave back some points for her errors and had one extra credit assignment, but since the class is only graded on 4 exams and participation I felt like it was not enough; too much hassle

Awful. Terrible at responding to emails, careless with writing exams, and not understanding towards students. I wanted to like the class but she made it so much more stressful than it needed to be. It's so frustrating to disagree with her; she says she values our input but then fights tooth and nail when everyone in the class feels the same way.

Professor Hunter is not a good lecturer. She's extremely rude to students and has constant spelling errors and mistakes in her power points and exams. She comes off as standoffish and makes it difficult to learn. I wish I never took a class with her.

Dr Hunter is not a good lecturer. She laughs at people when they ask questions about the content and says she won't slow down for them, but she is also offended if people don't go to class. She has made multiple errors on exams but is extremely unforgiving when a student makes an error. Unless needed, I would not recommend Dr Hunter.
She's nice but kinda a mess. There were multiple errors on tests and it took her days to admit answers were wrong. Not a hard class but frustrating and not worth the worry.

Lectures are fast paced because the class is only one hour long. We usually spent 2-3 lecture periods on each unit. He frequently takes time to answer any questions. There is a textbook and tons of non-graded optional work you can do. We had 3 tests and no final.

Lectures are captivating, fun and interesting. Be warned that attendance is not mandatory, but he does not record lectures or post completed notes, only the blank slides. The tests are almost entirely memorization based, as there are no mechanisms to remember, only group properties and reactions. Use the textbook to study. No final in the course.

Bruckner is one of the best lecturers I've had but the class structure is garbage. For exam 1 and 2 understand all fundamental concepts, do the practice problems, and practice lecture and hw reactions. Exam 3 is much harder, you need to know about ALL lecture reactions, and some others too. Thick curves though.

As mentioned, the grade is solely the 3 exams. My biggest criticism of Prof. Brueckner is that he only puts the BLANK lecture slides online, and most of the class is remembering what he writes on the COMPLETED slides. So if you aren't in class to write what he writes that day, you'll never see that information again.

The class is interesting but very difficult. You think he would get the hint when no one ever answers his questions in class that are apparently common sense. This will be the first class I have not received an A or A- in and that includes organic chem. I would strongly suggest taking with another professor. It lowers your gpa!

Grade based off exams only - study hard for the first one especially, since it's supposedly the easiest! Funny guy, interesting accent. Gives lots of practice exams from previous years which are helpful, but the tests are going to be hard if you don't know chemistry. A lot of material is covered in a short time ( 1 group of elements/2 days),.

If you go into this class confident about your chemistry intuition, you could manage studying for only 45min a week. Write out the reactions over and over until it feels easy. His teaching is so clear and interesting, so definitely attend class (he writes reactions in lectures). Graded on only 3 exams but he prepares you with plenty of practice.

Difficult class, memorize all rxn and all diagrams. Guy knows his stuff and is willing to help students who need it. Don't be afraid to ask this guy for help because he is the nicest person you will ever meet
Terrible teacher. Do not take. His class is very confusing and he is very unorganized. You basically have to memorize a bunch of rxns. You do not learn in his class.

I only say attendance is mandatory because he gives you a general idea of what he's going to focus on for exams. Definitely study any diagram that he goes over in class. Exams were based surprisingly heavily off diagrams. He's very friendly so if you're confused office hours help a lot. Also very understanding. Hard class with a large curve.

Fernandez is a very nice professor. She posts her PowerPoints and during lectures you need to fill in missing notes so going to class is a must. She provides study guides that tell you the material that will be on exams, which are mostly open ended but she's an easy grader. Don't read/buy the textbook. There is a group project but its easy to do.

Dr. Fernandez is great. She's always prepared and organized, and she really knows her material. She's very nice and cares that you succeed. She goes a little fast with notes, so a laptop and typing skills are very helpful. Her exams can be tough but if you follow her study guide and go through her notes thoroughly, then you will be fine.

Hands down worst professor I've ever had and NOT because of my grade. Her tests are completely unreasonable, the material is useless, and her expectations set students up for failure. Attend every class or skip every class, it doesn't really matter. I tried both and got the same grades on every exam. If you have to take this class good luck

No doubt she's very intelligent, but the class is unorganized. You can skip, but if you show on days there aren't a lot of people you can get extra credit for just being there. For the exams, study EVERYTHING. Her exam questions can be random and don't always encompass overall topics. The class is definitely doable though.

She insists that class attendance is necessary since she "supplements" the material with other information, but in reality she can't teach without reading off the Power Points. The exams are difficult and require you to memorize miniscule facts, not actually learn the concepts. The final exam was absurd and she showed up 10 minutes late.

Dont buy the book. very nice prof but as previously stated... very unorganized. how she arranged the group project was ridiculous. overall an easy class. skipable because all pp notes. grades very generously i was nicely surprised many times. lab to go along with it is awesome :)
Very easy class, but you will have to study since there is a lot of material. She is very nice, and very reasonable and seems to love what she teaches.

One of the easiest classes I have taken at UConn, and it is not even a 'gen-ed'. Tests are simple, lowest is dropped. She grades almost to generously. Has an accent but you can understand her english easily. Very nice and very reasonable. One thing is she will try to push her opinions on you.

Anyone who has to take this class for a major can appreciate just how ridiculous it is. She moves at lightening speed through powerpoint slides with homemade drawings of molecular structures of food components. The most unorganized class I have ever taken. She is unfortunately incapable of using Web CT, a computer, and the english language properly
He was only a grad student at the time so I didn't expect much; but at the same time, I should have not had to stress over a general education requirement.
The exams were really hard. Overall not recommended.

He's pretty terrible. I can't even articulate why. It's just: I went into this class very excited, and came out thinking "this subject could be really awesome, and he ruined it." To me, the tests and quizzes were pretty easy, but the class average must have been fairly bad, because he put 10 extra credit questions on the final.

He is not clear about what he is going to test you on. He will tell you to focus on something for the quiz and then test you on something else that he never went over. Sometimes I felt like class was just a waist of time and he is rude to students. He really needs to get more organized.

I love this class! no lie if you show up and take notes its not that bad. Exams and quizzes are pretty much strait from the lectures not necessarily the slides so attendance is a must if you want to do well. As far as him not knowing what he is doing thats false i think he is an inexperienced teacher not really inexperienced in the field of CDIS.
AWFUL

In my opinion, he is a terrible professor. Does not fully teach materials to be testedm and tests on useless information not important to course. Flies through powerpoints. Class was never worth going to. Watched youtube videos and he was always late. Ended up with B- as a typical A- student, so whatever. Don't recommend having him as a professor

THIS IS THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED. I am a good student but found this class hard to do well in. He asks superfluous questions on quizzes and doesn't know what he is talking about. He is not willing to help students and simply answers questions by saying: "what does the book say?" Also he uses useless youtube videos during lectures.

I do not recommend this class at all. He makes it seem as though he "wants you to succeed" however puts absolute no effort into the class. He uses information from other textbooks on quizzes. He is rude and not helpful when you ask him questions. He comes off cool at first however dramatically changes as the class progresses. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS

Great professor, very helpful and engages with the class all the time. Funny and engaging. The only downside is that, unlike most other professors, he doesn't review the previous weeks content before the quiz, but he does cover next week and goes over 90% of next weeks homework in depth. One of my favorite TAs in my career so far; take his class!
I loved Professor York! This is me TELLING you to take him if you can! Best professor at UConn!

BEST. MATH. PROF. EVER. extremely hilarious and engages well with everyone. truly cares about his students and makes math FUN. he's the liveliest teacher out there. the class is generally hard tho. you have to study hard and attend his office hours. overall York is beyond amazing and the best professor at uconn!!!

Prof York is a really good professor; it was more the overall class instructor that made the class hard. There is a lot of homework assignments (based on accuracy), but York has plenty of office hours you can go to. There's 3 exams and the final replaces your lowest grade on another exam. STUDY FOR EXAMS AND GO TO OFFICE HOURS, & you will be fine.

1071 is a hard class, but Ben was great at teaching it. He is super enthusiastic and it is evident he likes his job and loves math. I thought he did a pretty good job teaching the material. Tests were complex, but they were all made by the course coordinator and so was the homework so it really wasn't his doing. If you have to take 1071, take ben!

Professor York is very enthusiastic and enjoys what he does. If you aren't a math person this class is perfect for you. He is very nice and the material is actually fun. There is a "textbook" but it's only like $20. You work a lot with the people sitting around you so be prepared for that. There was one group project but it was surprisingly fun.

He's very enthusiastic but treats students a bit like children. If you are confident in math (ex. calc) do not take this class, it's rather frustrating going from calc to a class that barely uses math at all. He is a tough grader, even if you show your work he will dock points if you don't write out an explanation (also extremely frustrating).

Professor York is enthusiastic about his work and it shows. He gives good feedback and is always available to ask questions. He works at a slow pace and makes sure everyone understands and if you don't, he has 10 other ways to explain it. I would highly recommend his class for any math level.

Professor York might genuinely be the most enthusiastic instructor I've ever had. He is incredibly fair and he explains things very clearly. My only complaint is that sometimes he will take a bit too long to go over a problem in class, but perhaps that's just what some other kids in the class require. Take MATH 1020Q with York if you can!

Professor Gu taught a class where participation matters, yet failed to engage a single member of the class. The lectures were long, and poorly communicated. The students remained disinterested and on their phones, (some with headphones on), for the entirety of the semester. She was a nice person when we had group meetings, or talked 1 on 1.

Exams are extremely specific, pulling out the slightest details of everything down to the individual word per definition. Her exams focus so much on understanding word-for-word definitions, that you lose track of concepts. They're also almost half your grade, so if you're not a good test-taker, avoid this class. Other than that her class was okay.

Teacher is not very good a lecturing, lecture length is very long although you do get a break in the middle. Exams are very specific and are difficult. Picking a good group at the start of the semester is essential for this class

Very boring lecturing class, I cannot stay engaged in class even when I try it is painful. Exams are very specific but they are online lockdown browser. Make sure you pick a good group because there are a lot of group assignments and projects.

Wasn't a huge fan of the lectures - 3 hours long on a Tuesday night, and basically just reading/copying down Powerpoint slides. But the exams aren't too difficult and there's a very light amount of homework. I would recommend the class only if you don't mind the lectures that kinda drag on. Prof is very kind & helped out our group project a lot.

What a bad teacher. Only reading ppt and the ppt itself is soooooo boring. Her class lasts from 17:00-19:45. Oh god, it is pure torture. Just imagine being in a hot sauna room with 100 people surrounding you, for 3 hour. Although people can still get A in this class, they will just get 10 years older after taking this. Do not do this.

Professor Gu was wonderful! Although her lectures were really long, I was really engaged the entire time. Participate in live class sessions, it will make it go by faster and you will get a 100 on participation. The exams were also fairly easy, I would suggest making a Quizlet based on your notes to study!

Class was taught for 3 hours late on a Tuesday which is very bad. She is one of the more boring lecturers at UConn and you will fall asleep during the lectures. The case studies and group project were fairly easy but the exams were very difficult. Not very clear on what will be on the exam and very detailed exams as well. Didn't learn a lot.

Her teaching style is to read off PPT slides for the entire 2 hours and 45 minutes of the class with the occasional case study - whose discussion is just as stimulating. She graded the semester-long project out of 5 points with .5 pt increments. She gives no feedback, doesn't go over exams, and doesn't pass anything back. I'd give her a B-.

Dr. Graf is without a doubt a world renowned expert in his field. He knows what he is talking about and is extremely passionate about the material he is teaching. He does pop quizzes based on the readings that were assigned for before class. However, at times he can come across as condescending towards students when they answer a question wrong.

Dr. Graf is so sweet. If you go to his office hours he is very helpful and explains the material well. Lectures are a bit long but if you like micro/infectious disease the material is very interesting. The lab is not too difficult for a biology class, and will boost your grade in lecture.

Do not touch this class with a 10 ft pole. The lab isn't bad, but the exams SUCK. They're not all multiple choice and they're just so specific. Dr. Graf definitely knows what he's talking about, but doesn't know how to teach it. You'll have to put in a lot of work teaching yourself.

Graf has quite a passion for microbiology. His lectures are dense, but he tries his best to make it interactive and engaging. Two midterms and one final are very lecture-heavy (the textbook doesn't help). Labs are well structured and guided. Not too responsive to emails, so ask questions in class or go to office hours! Worth the effort you put in!
Not a very accessible professor, wouldn't recommend.

He'll give you an ocean of information, tell you he's only going to test you on a lake's worth, and then actually test you on a puddle size. There is no way of knowing what that puddle will be. His multiple choice includes multiple-multiple choice, only the lineup goes to G. Wouldn't recommend this class.

I took this class as my MCB lab requirement and would recommend it. Exams are not that bad as he stresses what you need to know before and after each lecture. Reading is only required for the extra credit reading quizzes, everything else is from lectures/slides. He is very clear and nice. Lab gets harder as semester goes on but its not too bad.

The information in this class isn't necessarily hard but his exams are ridiculous there are open ended questions and an essay question and honestly those aren't even bad. its the multiple choice that's bad. they are pretty much set up for you to fail. they go from A to G and don't test your knowledge as much as your confidence in your knowledge.

Probably one of the best professors I've had at UConn. Definitely knows what he's talking about. It's a hard class and the exams are tough but that's to be expected of Pathobiology. Attendance is a MUST. Labs are pretty easy.
If you like Zach Braff, you'll love this guy. Great professor overall.

He's a great guy, open to suggestions and more than willing to help you out if you're in a bind. He cares about your writing, and helps you improve your technique. I can write a killer essay now, thanks to his suggestions. Also, he's adorable, and his jokes are weird but his reactions are priceless.
He tells jokes a lot. They're not as funny as his reactions to them are. He's a great professor.
Good class, great professor.
If you need an English class, take it with Gordon.
He really cares about his students and is really passionate about his subjects. He is also adorable.

Gordon is the most awesome guy ever! He loves his work and even if it's difficult you will love the class. Mostly though the guy deserves respect, and if you respect yourself you'd take his class. P.s. Finally got your pepper (he's like a 6.5-7)
He was really helpful with all my papers. I had a hard time writing at first and he took the extra time to really work with me.
Really fun professsor. You can tell he really likes what he does. :)

I thought Dr. Harvey was great! I was worried to take it because of the reviews posted, but theres nothing bad about this class. Sometimes her slides are out of order and contain some grammatical errors, but its nothing too big or confusing. Her review sheets for the exams are great and its an easy class. Take it!
She's a really nice woman but she is so unbelievably unorganized! All of her slides have grammatical errors and the lectures are really boring. The class is harder than it should be

Very nice and good sense of humor, but she makes the class more difficult than it needs to be. She can be very vague during lectures and though she gives good study guides for exams, she's very picky about how you answer certain questions. Powerpoints are no help.

During finals week, I have had to email her 7 times over the course of 6 days and speak with my advisor just to get a two sentence, unclear response from her regarding a BIG paper. VERY disappointing. Constant misspelling of words on PowerPoints and handouts, unclear assignments.

Her assignments and expectations were very unclear. Disorganization was a big problem throughout the semester. Instead of creating assignments and exams to encourage engagement with the material, it was all about regurgitating facts from lectures.

Being nice doesn't save her from being a bad professor. Changed our 15 page paper back to a 3 page paper 3 days before the due date. Disorganized, misgraded my exam and took off 18 points I earned. Take with someone else!
I didn't like her. Disorganized class, goes too fast on her powerpoints, assigns too much work. I would not recommend this class. It caused lots of anxiety and there's WAY too much reading.

Really nice woman. Loves the subject matter and exams are straightforward. Assignments are interesting but the readings can be a little much. Willing to work with students and wants them to do well. If you're looking for a 3000 level course that you can ace without trying too hard, this is the course for you. Awesome professor overall!
Extremely unclear. Assignments are pretty hard. I would not recommend taking this class

I took his class in fall 2009. He went over slides in class and rarely did problems out. I probably learned more in discussion. The tests were quite hard. When I took 1127 it was between him, Selampinar, and Hilario. Selampinar seemed slightly more competent. Dunno bout Hilario but in my experience ur on ur own for the most part in uconn chem.

Class was difficult. Teacher was useless, rambled on and on and didn't really "teach". Tests were extremely hard. Unless you're a God at chem, you definitely need to study all the time to do well. Seriously. Don't expect any grade above a C if you don't study. I taught myself since he wasn't adequate. Ended up with a C. Chem isn't easy!
He does not say much in lecture and sometimes stumbles over some concepts himself. All of his lectures slides are from the book, so I taught this whole course to myself.

EASY A. I never went to lecture after the first exam it is pointless and i ALWAYS go to all my other classes. Exams are from the powerpoints that he posts but I went through the book to teach myself. Barely any calculations just true/false about definitions.

It is interesting that the lower section Chem classes all say he is easy, but having taken 1127 as general chemistry the course was not easy. It is pretty clear from day one he is not confident in teaching the material. I went to other professor's lectures - too bad the CONN chem dept is on probation for failing too many students. Terrible time.

The class is super easy. Class was a joke. He puts all the slides up and the exams where easy and the finalwas made up of all the previous tests questions a few numbers changed). The Q center is excellent with the math questions; Sharp goes through it in class but I guess have to go lol. Talked a lot about nothing.

I'm not finished with the class yet but so far, its super-easy. His exams are straighforward and come straight out of the chapters or his lecture slides. He gives you what he wants you to know and nothing more. Some of his exam questions are dead giveaways- just study your notes and know the math problems. Overall a good guy

I started going to another professor's lectures because he doesn't really teach you much. "I'm new to the univeristy" is an unacceptable excuse for being unprepared. Sometimes unable to answer student's questions and didnt even know how to solve the FEW problems he tried in class. He's admitted his gen chem knowledge is rusty, WHY IS HE TEACHING??

Dr. Sharp is completely useless. He teaches from power points from the book. As long as you read the book you are ok since the power points are essentially the same material. I went to class maybe 25% of the time and still got an A for the course. Tests were ridiculously easy. He is REALLY easy and doesn't require in depth learning of concepts.

She is a nice person, but not the best professor I've had. Material is difficult, she kind of expects you to know everything before it's been taught. Lots of in class exercises, homework due once a week, quizzes graded on participation once a week. Studying is necessary for exams, not an easy course but somewhat interesting nonetheless.

SUPER duper nice professor. You can tell that she loves linguistics and she tries hard to make sure the class is interested. She talks about her young son Leo a lot, he's super cute. Anyways, I would definitely recommend this class. The homework is pretty easy as are the exams and there is extra credit.

Great course. Super easy and fun. PPPs were well done and easy to follow. Good Q class if you need it. I took it to fulfill the req, but now I'm going to take more ling classes. major? also, TA was hot. great t-shirts. very quiet. nice smile.

Q class, but I'm not entirely sure where the math came in. Took it to fulfill a requirement but actually enjoyed it! Wurmbrand is super nice. Phonetics, semantics, etc. PPT lectures are clear, homeworks are required, quizzes are graded only for completion. Lots of in-class exercises. Would definitely recommend to students looking for a Q course.
The powerpoints that they put up were crystal clear. Exams are fairly easy as long as you attend class because there are some questions that are only in lecture. Lecture outlines are also a plus!

Both professors were great in this class. The notes were clear and VERY organized. Although I did go to every lecture and took notes, I only studied from the online notes and did very well because of the discussion classes. also there was no textbook so I saved money as well. There are online readings, but I never read them and I did very well.

Extremely well organized teaching aided by clear, readable powerpoints. Attendance in lectures is very helpful, but study guides and lecture notes posted on HuskyCT help fill in blanks. With some minimal effort the course is extremely simple and you will learn a lot. It also helps that she's cute as a button, and is engaging.

Both Wurmbrandt and Bobaljik did a great job teaching this class together. I couldn't believe how clear and concise their powerpoints were. The material isn't always the most interesting, but they do a great job teaching it. No textbook, but you MUST do the readings and study guides posted on HuskyCT. I ended up learning a lot in this course.
No Comments

Excellent professor. Taught the topic wonderfully. Gave majorrrr hints right before the exam. Exams were arguably fun to take because your opinion was most of the test. Book is necessary, but since she's leaving uconn in the fall, she'll prob have a different course load than at uconn.

I took the w course for race class and gender. Professor Butler-Sweet is a very good teacher. Her topics and examples are relevant and current. She is very passionate about sociology and it shows. Just try to keep her on topic because issues with gender and race tend to get her into long discussions on oppression.
She is such a sweetheart and so enthusiastic! Attendance isn't mandatory, but she gives clues before exams as to what will be on it. Really interesting material for anyone!

This professor sincerely loves her subject and wants her students to as well. Shes very helpful and flexible if you explain to her any problem you have with deadlines or assignments. She repeats important topics several times to insure everyone understands them and her exams are primarily focused on the topics she emphasizes during class. DEF TAKE.

Class was challenging, creative, thought provoking, and informative. She is also a very kind professor willing to help and cares about the class. Attendance is mandatory because the exams are based on lecture and she expects quality work. Overall, an excellent class and I would definitely take another class with her if I had the opportunity.

She is a pretty good teacher and does a good job breaking down material. I took her in a W class and she is the toughest grader I have had in my 4 years of college. Seems nice... but heartless when it comes to grading.

I had her for Social Theory as well as Sociology of Gender. She's a great teacher and really clarifies and repeats main ideas often. She requires a 5 page paper, midterm and final. There's not too much work, just a lot of information. I definitely recommend her.
I loved this class! Prof. Butler-Sweet is really enthusiastic and clearly passionate about what she teaches. Lecture notes are the most important thing on exams - so attendance is important.

This was my favorite class this semester! Colleen is a sweetheart and easy to talk to. She only uses the book for reference and doesn't post lectures, so attendance is necessary. Take good notes and you'll do well. She is fair with grading, will give extensions if asked for in advance. Would definitely recommend her.

Dr. D'Amico is an amazing professor! Class content is super interesting and he makes it more understandable by incorporating videos, memes, and photos in class. He also tends to use dairy puns & jokes around in class sometimes as well. We get to make a variety of different dairy food products in class such as ice cream, cheese & yogurt. he is great

D'Amico is literally awesome. I love him as a professor. He legit brought us ice cream from the DAIRY BAR to have during our exam this past week... what other professor does that? I love how he incorporates funny videos into his lecture slides too. overall great professor that understands that we're all human

Really great class-- fun labs and lecture material isn't too difficult. Technically class is skippable but it will affect your participation points and he knows who is there, so I would recommend against it. Definitely not an easy A though, easy B.

D'Amico is a great professor, but does not give you an easy way out for the class (especially the W). I loved the class itself, but he is a really tough grader for the W section because he wants you to do well. He is a really nice guy and is very accessible outside of class time, I would defiantly take more classes with him if he taught more!

He's super enthusiastic and sarcastic, which I appreciate. He takes time to make sure you understand the material and will give you tons of opportunities to get points and make up tests and quizzes. Lab is a ton of fun, and he is a real cutie.

I absolutely love Dennis D'Amico. The class was engaging for a fairly boring topic. He's a bit of a tough grader for the W class, but is very accessible outside of class and will take the time to go over your papers and tell you exactly what to improve. He will also go over study guides with you. If you make a solid effort, you will do well.
He is so funny and a great lecturer ! Highly recommend this class. Although you may have to study for exams it is worth it to get to have this incredible experience. Amazing! Best class at uconn

Really nice guy, lectures are interesting however, his instructions are never clear especially for the W and he's a really harsh grader. I do not recommend taking Dairy Tech as a W a lot of work and it is very unlikely that you will get a good grade
Class is interesting, D'Amico is a funny guy so lecture is not bad. There's no textbook which is nice and the exams are similar to his study guides.

This class is pretty useless and I'm not sure if Shor is to blame for it. She gives a lot of busywork that just puts people behind rather than helping them with their capstone project. It also takes forever to get grades/feedback back. She was pretty nice though.

Let me preface this by saying I know that this class was not popular, but a lot of that seemed to be because seniors dont want to work our last semester. Professor shor was trying to teach writing, professionalism, and peer review which are all important for real life engineers. I thought this was an okay class.

You'd think a class for your capstone project would be relevant. Instead, it was a lot of busywork and filler homework that took away time from design. In addition, Dr. Shor can be rude, nasty, and unprofessional towards students. She also once made a joke about the girl who died in front of the fire house two years ago... Very unprofessional.

Her assignments are terrible and some are graded by your peers. Part of your project is to be graded by your peers in the form of a homework you hand into them about their project. The only saving grace is that your project might be fun/interesting. Avoid her at all costs if possible.

Absolutely terrible teacher. The worst teacher I have had over my 4 years at UConn, for being a senior who is looking for jobs and wanting to just do my design project this class was by far the most unorganized, waste of time that UConn has ever required me to waste my tuition on. If you see that she is teaching I recommend switching schools.
She makes sure you understand what youre doing and why rather than just teaching formulas. Learned the most from her

Teaches us to be Ana cruel Engineer rather than plug and chug. Those that don't like her just want to solve math problems and never think. She wants you to understand what you're doing and why. Great professor.
Makes class material harder than what it is,Thinks of her as a hot thing and can come very arrogant sometimes.
Great professor! Cares about the students and about engineering. Makes you think rather than just solve equations. You will learn a lot.

Dr. Altmann is great! He co-teaches the class with Dr. Yee and I prefer Dr. Yee's lectures but Dr. A is still great. There is a TON of extra credit. One double sided cheatsheet is allowed for each exam which are pretty easy with a good cheatsheet. I never used the textbook. He gives candy for participation which is nice. Would highly recommend!

Dr. Altmann runs a good class. The lectures are very interesting. The class is graded 25% on four tests (one of which is dropped) and the other 25 points are homeworks and a few quizzes which aren't too bad, but are far from gimmes. If you put in the work, getting an A- or A is attainable, but it's far from a sure thing. Don't bother buying the TB.

Great teacher!! If you show up to class and listen to the lecture you will be fine. There are three tests that determine your grade but there is a lot of extra credit which can push your test grades up 6% each. Also allows a two page cheat sheet for the exam. If you don't understand the material the textbook is really easy to read (he wrote it).

Grades mostly off of 3 exam grades with lots of extra credit. Very nice professor that wants to make the class interesting for the students. I did not use the book at all, save your money unless you need extra help

Dr. Altmann is very funny, but the concepts that he teaches in this course are very difficult. There is quite a bit of studying involved in preparing for this course's exams. Exam questions are very independent thinking-heavy, so you really need to understand the concepts to get the answers correct, so make sure to watch video lectures.

A really funny guy with a lot of personal examples and experience with the material. He obviously cares about the students and the course, and the quizzes for extra credit in class are grade savers. The bag of candy was a nice bonus too! Overall, him and Eiling took a normally kind of boring topic and made it kind of interesting.

Kind of pretentious. Way too obsessed with shoehorning examples from the current election into his lectures (every class brings a new joke about how terrible Trump is, like we get it). He's clear, though, and gives frequent extra credit quizzes that really help out with the exams

Prof. Altmann is pretty funny, and always seems to be in a good mood. He alwas got excited about the material during lectures, which I appreciated because it showed how interested he was in the subject. Tests are kind of tough, and require studying, but they give extra credit throughout the semester to bump up your exams.
Great lecturer. Gives you candy. Go to class because there are extra credit points available every time! Tests are tough so you need to really study

Professor was super great and easy. Just do the small 10-minute readings every night, answer the discussion questions and come to class. You'll have no issue passing the class. She genuinely cares for her students and tries her best to help you pass the class. She made the class straight-forward and I had no questions on what I needed to do.

Professor Holzer is amazing! She is very kind and understanding especially during the pandemic! Her courseload isnt too heavy: mandatory participation, one HW assignment/week (usually discussion post), easy final, and uses the token system if you need an extension (or three lol). She assigns readings also, but i never read and got away with it tbh

Professor Holzer is such a good teacher! She really cares about the topics she teaches and truly cares about the mental health and well-being of her students. To get an A in her class, you have to participate in discussion posts and go to class. She's super nice!

Easiest class I've ever taken, but I learned absolutely nothing. If you have a friend in the class you can take turns going because she makes you sign something in class for attendance which is basically your entire grade.

She's a really nice lady but her class is definitely one of the most boring I've taken. Attendance is basically mandatory. She had us in groups doing different Tactical maps every class... ANNOYING. Grade based on participation, a quiz (worth 40%) and a paper.

Interesting topics covered. She's a very nice woman and very easy to understand. Easy grader. Admittedly, the books were on the expensive side but some have e-versions through the library. Overall a decent class.

1) This class is incredibly boring. Don't expect anything else. 2) She made us spend far too much money for books we used for a week, or she provided PDFs anyways. 3) 35% of grade based on participation. I got an A- even though my paper/project grades weren't great. 4) Some of the readings are incredibly eye opening (especially the ones on India).

The most boring class i've EVER EVER taken. How can you make a class on human rights boring? it was terrible. However, i attended almost every class and put effort into my papers and got an A. If you can write well all grades are based on papers.

Take her class!! She is helful and you have no final exam just a paper. The topics are boring and confusing but she explains things good. Take notes and you will be fine. I recommend her, she loves what she does too and you can see it from her lectures

Chad is such a chill professor! There are weekly assignments that are super easy to get done, you should never get behind in his class. If you have any questions or are confused about an assignment, he emails you in a timely manner and wants to make sure you understand the material.
Chad was a very nice guy. We met every other week and never had to stay the entire class time. He made it very clear how we were graded and was very relaxed about late work.
Even though the class was online, he was very good with getting back to emails. There is a lot of work in the class, but he is a very easy grader. Take him if he is avaliable.
Professor Jewett is very caring and easy to talk to, his assignments can sometimes be unclear but he gives good explanations if you ask him.
The difficulty of the course is simple, the writing topic is interesting, and the professor is very good.
Professor Jewett's course was incredibly simple, and helped boost my actual English grade.

Jewett is a pretty solid professor. You just have to stay on schedule with his assignments and you should do fine. Nothing too difficult in this class and he is really understanding. Would recommend taking him.

Best professor I've had at UConn! Really helps to make your papers better and for you to become a better write as well. We would write a rough draft and receive feedback from peer groups as well as him before submitting our final draft.

Best professor I've had at UConn. He really helped make me a better writer and included great content in the course. We would write a rough draft and receive feedback from peer groups as well as him before submitting our final draft. I got As on all the assignments and finished with an A. The key is to read before class and participate!

Super nice and fun professor, but he is not good at teaching. He rambles the entire time and I felt that some of the questions that appeared on the quiz were not really talked about in lecture. You're better off doing some reading in the book if you buy it, that was more helpful for me.

Tough grader but AMAZING lecturer. So engaging even at 9:30 am and really cares about students. Tests are hard but he will help you if you're confused. Makes an effort to know every student, even in a huge class. His voice can be hard to understand (and makes me fall asleep in nearly every class, my bad), but he is wonderful

Dr. Yuan is a funny professor and is very animated during class time which makes it fun. He explains concepts pretty well but often assumes we know much more than we do (very genetics heavy in parts). Midterm worth 30% and final worth 44%.

Prof. Yuan obviously cares very much about what he is teaching, but he is not at all understanding when students tell him they are struggling. There are unfair exam and quiz questions, and even if the entire class tells him this, he will say that's because "he doesn't want the whole class to get an A." The final is worth 50% of your entire grade.

I think Prof. Yuan's class requires you to review and spend time with the slides. He is a great professor, but you can't miss class or not take notes and expect high grades. You have to spend some time outside class to review concepts. I am a graduating senior and among all the classes I have taken at Uconn, he is a great professor. Read the book.
Although enthusiastic about what he taught, he made some topics difficult to understand.
Syllablus was extremely unorganized and made being prepared for class difficult.

Prof. Yuan is an amazing professor who is passionate about the lecture and teaching. I found him to be engaging, knowledgeable, and caring. His lecture notes are important. I would recommend understanding the concepts. He doesn't flood you with useless information or slides, but want you to really understand and remember concepts. Great professor.

Great professor! The lectures are interesting and the prof. is passionate about the material. The powerpoint is clear and he tries hard to make it understandable. Overall, a fascinating course that is great for both Biological Science and EEB majors. It has only been half way, but I have learned a great deal from Prof. Yuan. Very happy to have him.
As someone who has never enjoyed science labs, Francis made Chem lab enjoyable by being very helpful and engaging, and making our lab section feel like a family.

Francis is an awesome TA! He answers any questions you have, is clear on his expectations, and is easily accessible outside of lab. He creates a very welcoming and fun environment, making lab a enjoyable experience.

Francis is a great TA who cares about his students and their success. He gives good feedback on assignments and is there to explain any issues in understanding they may have. He is patient with students in their pursuit of understanding Organic Chemistry. I enjoyed having Francis as a TA and recommend his teaching ability.

He was great! I would not have passed this class if it were not for his guidance. I would highly recommend anyone who takes chemistry classes to try and have him. He is so responsive, and spends time with you to guide you through information so that you truly understand it. Its rare to find a TA like him, and his students are very fortunate :)
Great TA
Great TA for my chem lab! He was nice and was accessible outside of lab hours. He was really helpful during labs too so you could ask questions and stuff. We had a fun lab section.

Took CHEM 1147Q with Francis as my lab TA, and hes the best! Super caring, friendly, funny and really tries to get to know his students in class. He is very clear about his grading expectations and lab instructions and is a reasonable grader. Labs are not my favorite, but he made class time fun regardless. Would definitely recommend him as a TA :)
He is a good TA. I highly recommend him.

tophat & beyond labz required. did not use any textbooks or anything else. this TA did not promote learning and was not really able to answer our questions. instructions were very unclear. take another lab TA if you can

Rude. She has a lot of assignments due close together, which is not accessible to the schedule of most students. When asked to provide accommodations through time extensions for students, her response was rude and accusatory. While her syllabus demands respect and courtesy from her students, she clearly does not deliver the same grace to students.

The class is fine, 5 modules, 3 discussion posts per module, and a midterm and a final. The problem is that she does not grade any of your work or give feedback all semester. Today is the last day before grades are due and she has graded 1 out of 5 modules. If you want to have anxiety all semester because you don't know your grade, take this class.

this prof literally does nothing but assign readings. there are no videos, no professor interaction at all but every three weeks she'll post the work due for each module and it just gets worse and worse. 6 chapters, 7 articles, 3 discussion posts at 300 words each in APA, a quiz, and a midterm. should've dropped when I had the chance

Not a good professor. Hurts me to say it but there were days where she was late to open the weekly readings on blackboard & she released the syllabus no more than 3 days prior to the course starting; She was disorganized & late. Students can't be late nor can you. A student's late they fail, a professor's late, you eventually lose work. Bad quality

Rios gave absolutely no feedback the entire semester. Her grading criteria was very specific and she expects a lot from her students, but you will have no clue how you are doing in her class until after it is over. She never answers questions.

This professor is the worst I've had at UConn. She has no grading criteria, she grades you based on how much she likes you. Shes also extremely rude in her correspondence with you and she takes forever to reply. I have no idea how she is still employed at this university.

Don't take this class. Just don't. This is coming from someone who is a double major with a 3.8 GPA who actually does the work... This professor is ridiculous, isn't clear, and requires an unmanageable amount of reading if you're taking more than 12 credits. Just don't do it to yourself. I'm going to crawl back into the fetal position now...

Great teacher! very Help full, she is willing to talk on the phone and help you out. I took her for her online class and even though she requires a lot of reading and writing it is not hard and it is very manageable.
No responses to questions, sets ridiculous standards. Isn't clear and then grades how she wants. Don't take class with her
Great professor. Only 4 papers to do, easy for a W credit. Easy, lenient grader. Nice person overall.

This class was really interesting and not hard at all. As long as you do all of the discussion boards and put the work in on the take-home midterm and final, there is no reason to do poorly. Patt is a great professor and is funny and engaging. Definitely would take again.

Professor Patt is awesome. His lectures are really informative and interesting. As long as you pay attention in class and do the weekly discussion, you should do well. There was also an open note take home midterm and a final paper. I learned a lot in this class.

Really great informative class. He only graded on four things, a presentation, discussion board posts, midterm (which was take home), and a final paper on whatever topic you wanted to do from the class. Great professor who accommodated to his students. He also didn't really care if anyone showed up, and after the midterm you didn't have to.

Prof. Patt is a fantastic professor. You can tell he is really passionate about teaching. Would I take him again? Maybe if he was teaching a different subject; only took this course to satisfy a few credits. Still, he makes the course interesting and comprehensible. The course itself doesn't intrigue me, but he does!

You can tell that Prof. Patt really enjoys teaching this class! He creates a space that encourages participation but he doesn't put pressure on us to speak. In terms of work load he tells you what you should read but you really don't have to. Discussion posts most weeks but he doesn't penalize you for being late as long as it's in by the end.

Prof. Patt is one of those rare professors who is an expert in his field, a good instructor, and personable. I learned a lot about the history of Israel and walked away from each lecture wanting to learn more. Prof. Patt sticks to the syllabus, and I always felt like he had a good grip on the course, which was highly necessary this fall.

Amazing professor, super understanding and his voice is so calming and smooth. Really passionate about Israel and lectures are very engaging. Very lax about deadlines and easy grader. Go to class, do the work, and easy A.

Lots of tedious busy work for homework and COMPLETELY inaccessible outside of class like will never respond to emails at all. Class is grammar focused and he does try to make it as engaging as it can be, but a lot of his explanations go over everyone's head and are confusing. Wouldn't take his class again, but he's not that bad.
He's a very sweet and understanding professor. You can really tell that he wants the class to learn.

He acknowledges that the course material is difficult, and therefore expects effort over results. He is willing to go slowly if that's what the class needs. Sometimes he can't find the English words he wants, but he explains concepts in a variety of ways so everybody can choose their own way of understanding things. Very nice and fairly funny.

Very annoying professor to have to take a class with. You basically feel like you in are in pre-school in his class. If you are an independent learner this is not a professor you should take classes with. You have to sit there in class and be treated like a pre-schooler to get any sort of decent grade.

Eduardo is such a nice man who wants every student to do as well as they can. He team taught this course with Antonio, but Eduardo always explained everything well in discussion and made sure that everyone understood the material. He can be very boring at times, but he is also far funnier than he thinks. I would definitely recommend him.
Excellent Professor! Very helpful and does his best to ensure that every student understands and is current with the course material. Very nice and very funny - class is always enjoyable.

In order to be true to the course material, he does everything he can to make this class engaging, interesting, and challenging...including his jokes, which are funnier than he thinks...not to mention his accent is adorable...CLARO COMO EL AQUA! = )
No Comments

Please don't take her if you haven't done math in years. I did and had such a hard time in her class from the large amount of homework due every week, and how fast she was going through each section. We were literally going through whole chapters in a week. Did not drop the lowest grades or allow calculators. Difficult to pass due to structure.

Not a math major. Gives out 0's and low point scores on tests if its not 100% correct. Class was the lowest grades I have ever gotten and I am a A student! Very vague on what will be on the tests, and has included sections not on tests to study for. Puts the difficult problems and oldest sections with multiple steps on tests.

One of the best math instructors I've ever had. She simplifies a lot of complicated concepts which makes it 10x easier to grasp. I would consider this class an easy B. The weekly quizzes are definitely what brought my average down. But as long as you practice the problems and study diligently you can get an A.

If you are not a fan of math, take precalc with her!! she simplifies it soo much and takes time to go over examples on the board. Of course web assign is required and she also has written hw from the book ( lowest is dropped) & they help with practice. 2 midterms and a final (no cheat sheet). She's caring and takes time to help you understand.

if u hate math, take it with her. her lectures are clear and she makes math understandable. she is easily accessible outside of class and approachable as well as kind. there are quizzes every week which are helpful to grasp the material and three exams, final accumulative. no cheat sheets however :( but overall, a good professor!!

She is absolutely amazing, she does multiple examples and goes over almost every single problem a student asks for. Her office hours are pretty fair and also does office hours by appointment if you ask her. She tries her best to get a student to understand however long it takes.
Take her anywhere you can she is amazing. Great teacher and a nice woman.

If youre looking for a well organized, structured course,look elsewhere. While Professor Naples is nice, that does not transfer to her teaching. Discussions- all over the place and drawn out.Assigns long readings-to be expected-however the content of the readings are boring and painfully wordy.Grading is ambiguous and harsher than necessary.

Professor Naples genuinely cares about the success of her students. There is a lot of readings, but if you put if you put in the effort, she's willing to work with you and make any necessary accommodations.

This class took my writing to the next level. Lots of great discussions, and Dr. Naples values participation. Some group collaboration. Final is a 15-page paper, but she will work with you every step of the way. There's a LOT of reading, but if you just skim it you'll be fine for class. If you participate and work hard you'll get an A.

There are a lot of readings about the relationship between gender and science, and there are usually more than 50 pages in a week. Even though most of the readings are interesting, try get the main points from them for discussion only. You will need to choose a topic to write a paper throughout the semester.
Honestly a great person, lots of work for wgss2105W, taken online distance learning fall 2020. A few shorter papers and 1 long paper, lots of reading each week. Not hard just a lot of work.

One of my favorite classes I've taken as a graduate student. I learned much more than I had learned in other grad classes. Dr. Naples is a great instructor and genuinely cares. The only way you wouldn't get something out of this class is if you didn't do the readings. But if you aren't going to do the readings, why are you even in grad school?
Lectures were always in a mess. Never expect full discussion of anything in class. Hard to reach outside of classroom. Unclear grading criteria and grades done by TAs.

Professor Eby has been my absolute favorite Professor since coming to UConn. The class is mostly discussion based but she is able to ask questions about the reading that leading to a deeper understanding of the text. Lots of reading, but the majority of it is very enjoyable. This class has broadened my world view and taking it was a great choice.

I absolutely love Professor Eby. I have never been more interested in an English class than hers. It's all discussion, and she's receptive to your thoughts while also sharing her own. I will take any class with her in a heartbeat. Truly the best.

Probably my favorite professor I've had in the English department. You have 2 essays, but she gives you extensive feedback on your rough drafts so it's easy to improve for your final draft. The class discussion was always exciting and she had so many interesting things to say about the reading. A lot of reading, but all great book choices.

Clare is absolutely wonderful. She may intimidate you at first but she is very welcoming and encourages her students to do well and think outside the box. She loves having deep analytical discussions of the text and her choice of readings is always impactful and informative to say the least. She is one of the best educators Ive ever had.

Clare may come off a little stern but she is such a delightful soul once you get to know her after a few classes. She is encouraging and wants to hear what you think and how you support that thinking. She loves it if you come up with a well supported point she hasnt heard yet. She was a an absolute delight and inspirational educator. Loved her!

This professor didn't do much of anything. The class was discussion-based and it was led by the students, and if I wanted to hear from other students my age with no degree I could do that without enrolling in a class. She graded harshly, although she gave really lengthy feedback on drafts. The class would have been the same if she wasn't there.

Clare Eby is one of my favorite professors Ive had. She may seem stern at first but once you start getting to know her in class she is very warm, open, and encourages you to do well. The class Ive had with her we had a significant amount of reading but let me tell you, it is worth it. The works she has you read are so impactful and enjoyable.
Very difficult subject matter. Textbooks are incomprehensible.

I had him for two courses, one my first year and then one my second. He was a really nice guy, and very interesting teacher. He taught me so much about the politics of the Indian Ocean region, something quite unfamiliar to me up until that point.

It was an easy class because I really didnt need to go to the class, he didn't talk about a whole lot and rambled, stuttered and has a monotone when he does. I sleep in class a lot. He seems like a good guy otherwise, and the tests are graded pretty easily.

All he talks about is Africa and is probably the most boring human being on the planet, especially at 8:00AM. But the class is easy... I never went and pulled off a B, plus was easily able to make up exams I "missed" on my own time.
Liberal moron who won't allow opinions that don't agree with his to be voiced. Refused to call on me once he knew I disagreed with his pathetic liberal whining. Only class I've ever dropped.
His class isn't easy at all.
Most liberal-minded, one-sided, America-hating teacher there is.
Excellent at helping you improve your reading skills, and your writing ones at well. He helps you build off your preexisting strengths, and never tears anyone down. He clearly wants you to succeed.

Professor Mroz has so far been my favorite teacher in college. His lessons are interesting, and he wants to see his students grow. He has taught me many valuable skills in writing as well. It is a lot of work, and can be easy to fall behind, but I highly recommend. Attendance is no "mandatory" but it will be more difficult to do well in the class.

So I took this class because English is mandatory and had to get it over with. I didn't realize I would be entering the worst class I've ever taken. English has never been my strong point and writing paper after paper and reading the most boring passages known to man kind really didn't do it for me. Expect to have homework for every class.

Matt is a nice guy but his class is not easy. Attendance is a must since you sometimes have in class work. He asks you questions in class and picks on random people to answer but you have to tell him to rephrase it because the question is confusing. Assignments are really vague and he is a tough grader. Make sure you do the online forums.

Matt is very nice and always willing to help you with your assignments if you e-mail him or meet with him. Sometimes it is unclear as to what he wants for the major papers. As long as you do all the work and attend classes regularly, you should be fine.

His assignments are confusing and he is not clear about what he wants for the major papers. Although he responds to emails quickly, he's not always helpful. Gives a lot of work! Also grades pretty harshly and hard work is not rewarded.
Matt is great! Very nice and understanding, always willing to help if you have a question. Lots of opinion needed on your papers, but not bad topics. Good class!

Dr. Kim is enthusiastic about the subject but the content is confusing and his explanations don't make sense. He just projects his handwritten notes and rewrites them on the whiteboard, skipping the important steps. So, a lot of the class was self-study. But exams are exactly like the practice exam with tons of partial credit, so still an easy A.

I never attended this class because I could never hear what Jeong-Ho was saying because he would be facing the board the whole time and just ramble on. The only way to get a good grade is to teach yourself from the textbook because he just pulls examples from the book for homework and exams.
I took basic structural analysis with him. He is a very enthusiastic lecturer, sometimes hard to follow. Says you need the textbook but you don't. Overall, great prof

Dr. Kim is a very passionate professor who wants you to succeed in CE 3610 - Basic Structural Analysis. Lectures are not mandatory however I'd recommend going to as many as you can, because he will give tips about upcoming exams. Always in a positive mood and he's a great professor in the CE department.

Dr Kim is definitely one of the better structural analysis professors. His exams are very similar to the study guides and he grades very nicely. He also allows a one page cheat sheet for exams. Lecture is needed to understand the subject since its a hard subject to begin with but he is very passionate about the subject and helping students pass.

He focused on MATLAB and STAADPRO for the homework assignments. Yes, I said MATLAB, although he basically gives you the entire code in class and tells you to plug in numbers (it's easy for me, who got a C- in CSE 1010). He gives a mock exam which is the exact same as the regular exam, with a couple numbers changed. He is my advisor: great guy

This is probably the best structural professor in the department. Very funny, always eager and full of energy. Exams and homework are easy, final is hard. If you have the chance to take a class with him, do it.

im a finance major, but needed a W course so I took HDFS. It was WAY out of my comfort zone but she as well as the TA's took that into consideration. The course was kind of boring but relatively easy if you just study the slides. Just follow your TA's exact comments on your essays and you'll get an A.
Easiest class I have ever taken. You have 3 papers, but they are worth up to 15% each. Basically write it and after feedback you'll get an A. 3 exams and all notes are posted online.

Prof. Lafleur is so sweet. She is the most helpful and caring professor I have come across at UConn. She really tries to make the information interesting. Just know the topics on the chapter outlines on HuskyCT before the exam, and you'll do fine. Also, listen to the TAs comments on your essays and your grades will go up on the next assignment.

Literally the nicest woman you'll ever meet. Really tries to make the dull material interesting. TAs shouldn't be too bad; it's easy to adjust to what they want. Easy A if you do the work, great professor!

Dr. Lafleur is great. Lectures are clear and well organized. Exams are fair and reasonably easy if you study. You have to study. But she gives a review sheet before all the exams that is very helpful. Unfortunately, this is one of those classes where a big part of your grade is in the hands of a TA. I hope you get a good one!
She is really nice and kinda dorky which makes class funny. Also, tests aren't hard...she literally tells you what to study. Just do the work.
class is boring but she tries to make it fun. very nice person and very helpful. exams are difficult just study and you should be fine
Tests are very hard, class is boring but papers are very easy. I don't think the TAs really care about what you write

Overall a good professor. He can be confusing at times because he often leaves out info for problems/calculates them incorrectly. Other than that the exams are pretty simple, definitions and problems straight from lectures

He's a very nice guy and willing to help you. However, he has no control over exams/grades. I believe he's a graduate students, so someone else creates the exams. The class isn't that bad, as long as you study.
Having taken this class, I can tell you that most of these reviews aren't real. No one is that inspired by the class...3 months after it ends.

Professor Wang always was early to class and eager to help. He never makes you feel stupid for asking questions or not understanding. Will walk you through until she knows you understand. Tests aren't horrible as long as you do homework and understand the work. Would definitely recommend this class to anyone.

Not only is Prof. Wang incredibly intelligent and articulate, he is also wholeheartedly dedicated to the success of his students. He has the upmost respect for his students and is a wonderful personal and academic mentor.

The BEST professor I have ever had! Great teacher! He explained everything well and if you try you should easily pass. He is always there for you if you need help. He was extremely nice! He cares about his students more than any professor I've ever met. Nicest and most caring professor I've ever had!

Professor Wang is a good professor and exams are decent, but his accent and his lack of clarity make it hard to understand concepts and how to do out problems. If you do not have his financial calculator that he uses, then you wont know how to solve any problems. This was my major problem but I was able to find out how to do stuff on my TI-84.
Honestly... good class in terms of the fact that his tests are incredibly easy and based off the review. Bad in terms of if you really want to learn the material.

Vanessa is one of the best professors I've ever had. Her lectures had great information and they we're enjoyable to attend. She's very relatable, smart, cares about her students A LOT. She would ask us how are weeks/semester was going at the beginning of the class. Work is super easy. No exams only papers.

Vanessa was the best "professor" anyone could ever ask for! If you have the chance to take this class with her, take it! Work is manageable and understandable. Vanessa is kind and understanding if you are ever confused. Readings are usually very interesting as well!

Vanessa is an absolutely AMAZING individual who caress about the wellbeing of students. EX: She stopped giving quiz's on reading because we were so stressed about it. Exams are easy and she lets you put your own twist on it. She actually cares about what the students take away from the class. She helps you see society differently. HIGHLY recommend.

Vanessa is one of my new favorite teachers at UConn. She is an incredibly lenient grader and really wants everyone in the class to do well. There was one final exam (which the class made the questions for) and two papers (one which was just an outline). Huge relief to my schedule and workload.

Vanessa is great. Currently taking her class for WGSS 1105. Take some notes on the main ideas for the readings and you'll be fine for the quizzes. Her lectures require you to speak your mind on topics, but it's very interesting and enjoyable. I highly recommend.

Coming to WGSS class with Vanessa was honestly a relief to my days and work load. She provides a relaxed but very intellectual classroom environment-- you should be prepared to speak your mind, but won't feel nervous about it. Tests are take home papers that require effort but she allows a very reasonable time period to complete them

Vanessa is an amazing teacher. She is a grad-student and she is passionate about teaching this course. Although the readings were mandatory, I only read a handful of them, but I paid attention in class and helped contribute to the discussion. She is my favorite teacher here at UConn and I wish I took more classes with her!

Vanessa was simply, superb. I beleive this was her first year teaching as an actual professor but she could not have done a better job. Class discussions were engaging and very informative. It's the sort of class where you dont really need to take notes but mentally take note of what is being said. The most lenient grader I know (she hates grading)

THIS IS FOR PATH 2720 ->NEW COURSE Dr. Garmendia is a good professor, he loves the subject, very approachable. Due to cirumstances the majority of the course was unorganized. Exams were difficult and most questions were confusing/worded wrong. Lab portion was needed. Syllabus said there would be quizzes but they did not happen. Hope it gets better

very nice man, very smart, incredibly boring. lecture slides were poorly organized and ugly, and included so much information that it was difficult to know exactly what to study for. he posts lecture slides so attendance is not necessary, and if you study the slides it shouldnt be too hard. i was just mad depressed and got a 52 on the final lol

Dr. Garmendia is a very caring professor and genuinely wants to help his students succeed, so if you're struggling please don't be afraid to ask for help! Lecture is not recorded or live-streamed, so attendance is mandatory. The material is fairly interesting, but there is a lot of it. Overall, I recommend this class!

was super excited about this class but am disappointed by how boring it is. he is nice but not a good lecturer and lecture powerpoints are poorly organized + almost impossible to interpret at times. graded off three exams (90%) and weekly quizzes (10%). i never went to class and only studied the day of the first exam and still got an 88%.

Dr. Garmendia was always available after class to help with anything I needed. He works really hard to make a difficult but fascinating subject accessible. Instead of making us buy a book, he condensed what we needed to know into easy module notes and powerpoints. The guy is a genius, I felt fortunate to have had him teaching me virology.

Dr. Garmendia is definitely more laid back with grading, exam dates, etc because of how small this class is. He asks when everyone would like to have an exam and even let us split the final into three "quizzes" so we didn't have to come in during finals week. As long as you go to class and communicate with him, youll do great. (study pics for exam)

Very disorganized class. Prof is nice but its very difficult to know what to study/know how youre doing in the class because he doesnt give tests or quizzes back. he also takes v long to grade scantrons. Material is all over the place. grades are basically 4 quizzes for 15%, 2 exams for 40% and the final for 45%. Tests are MC and very image based.

Dr. G seems like a nice person. However, he is the most unorganized professor I have ever had. He doesn't tell us when exams are until the day before. It takes him WEEKS to grade scantron exams. And if you are taking the W section, God help you. The entire semester he did not return a single revision, so we handed in final papers with NO feedback.

She is one of the best professors I have had at UConn. Her class lectures are more of discussions and she makes a comfortable environment to share ideas and chat. I have learned so much since taking this class and it has made me more interested in Law! Overall great professor, always wiling to help you if you reach out to her with any issues!

Interesting class for a gen ed, a lot of good discussion on controversial topics despite some slight biases. Class is very easy, go to class and skim through weekly readings to write a post. Midterm had list of questions given to you beforehand, final was take home essay. Paper gave some choice in topic and was not bad.

Lots of class discussion with a liberal bias. Tests were straight forward written responses. She gives you a list of possible questions. I studied for two hours before each exam and received an A+ on both. The group project was a little more work. Weekly essay responses to readings + participation- 20%, midterm-25%, final paper/pres-30%, final-25%

Extremely interesting class if you do the readings and participate in discussions. She places a lot of emphasis on participation and takes essay questions directly from discussions and readings. Easy to follow the class as long as you do the work, even though it was a lot of work. Really responsive to questions!
Final and midterm are brutal! 25 essay questions during the busiest time of the semester are not my idea of a good time. And then she picks ONE that we all have to write!
She does not respect the opinions of her students. She is always interrupting students if she doesn't agree with what they're saying. Very rude, and very close-minded.

She imposes her ideas on the students. Unresponsive to any ideas that are not her own. Boring class, she lectures at you w/o making it interesting at all. Easy to get a good grade, if you can stand listening to her force her ideas down your throat. Also, quotes statistics in every argument. Statistics are unreliable, give me some real evidence.
Her law and society class is a good one. Some very good articles used for readings that you will meet again in other courses. Exams are ok and she takes mercy when grading.
Best professor ever.

Mr. Beutel kept classes fun and interesting, even when some of the topics covered were dry. We watched three movies, had a research paper, speech, and two group projects. He is extremely nice and understanding and gives great feedback, would definitely recommend his class.

I had him for WRD 110 at university of Kentucky and the class was very interesting. The class was based on memory was a video heavy class so sometimes hard to stay awake sense it was an 8am. I would suggest takin his class if you can not much work but you have to do good on the assignments you have and put effort into group projects.

He's a super nice guy but if you're not seriously into film I would recommend avoiding this class/professor. I was SO bored and the class was way too easy. It's nice if you just want an A, but I was unbelievably bored.

I had Andrew for WRD111 at UK and he was amazing. He is very understanding of things that may come up during the semester that makes it hard to completely focus. He has no problem bending deadlines with good reason as long as you communicate your problem. He was more like a friend than an stuck up professor.
Very nice guy. Easy and one of the best professors I've had. Exactly what you want in college.

Overall good class his essays were a bit confusing but he told you what he wanted to be in it. Was very helpful and classes were interesting and helpful in writing the papers. Its not mandatory to show up but you miss several classes due to individual conferences.
GOOD!

Hayward is the man. If you can get into his class you are super lucky. He wants his students to succeed! He is funny, nice, good to look at, and extremelyyy easy grader. Threw a party for his students at the end of the year...he is the man
Amazing prof. Always willing to help and makes the class a lot of fun. If you go to class and study before the exams you should never worry. Pete is so reasonable and very knowledgeable!

Tests are exactly like notes. Gives extra credit. Must go to class to get notes or work with other people in class to get them. Extremely helpful. If you go to class and study a decent amount you basically can't get below a B+. It is realistic to get over a 100%. He makes class somewhat interesting. Is a Pittsburgh sports fan.
He makes everyone insterested in what he is talking about. i love him. my name is deena michaels
He makes everyone interested in what he is teaching and is very friendly and helpful. I love him.
Best class ever, so easy don't stress. U will succeed no matter wat no worries!
I really enjoyed this class. The test are easy as long as you study the notes. He's a really nice guy. I would recommend taking his class

Knows that it is a gen ed course and wants you to do well. Tests and straight fowrward, taken from the notes; Go to class because he does not post them. Also gives 20 bonus points throughout the semester, must attend class to get though. Really easy if you put effort into studying. Really nice. "Does somebody have a question"?
LOVE HIM.

Mikel is the best. Every time I needed help he made time to see me. Responds to e-mails. Grades very fairly. He drills the material into you every class so you learn. Book is used every class, attendance is mandatory if you're new to Spanish. He is very nice, but expects you to know the material each class! P.S. lots of partner work. Great prof A+
Awesome

Mikel is an extremely nice guy and a pretty easy grader. Sometimes hard to understand because of his thick accent, and he's not the best at explaining grammar, but he'll keep trying to explain things so you understand. Overall an enjoyable class.
Very nice and helpfull
No Comments
Very nice person, hard to understand because of his accent.
He is really nice and very inteligent ; Its very easy to have a good relation with him.
Vanessa is so approachable and personable! I loved this class. She is very clear about what will be on quizzes and exams. Great teacher, great class :)

Great teacher and role model. I'm now pursuing a double major in CDIS having no previous interest before the course. She made our 8am fun, educational and interesting. Extremely approachable. Ask her to tell you about the Buck Cherry concert she went to in her Keds and skort. Hilarious. Easy Class as well, study class notes.

I took cdis 1150 with this teacher. She is very nice but makes the class much harder than it needs to be. The class covers a whole bunch of stuff that doesnt have to do with cdis. Her exams are really tricky and she takes questions from things she says outloud in class rather than what's on the slides. I worked my butt off for a B.

Heartless teacher. Took this course to boost my gpa and I ended up getting a D+ screwed me over. There are two exams all semester (midterm and final). Reads from her pointless slides and exams contain A-E. Tricky as hell too. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS ID YOUR LOOKING FOR A GOOD GRADE. WORST TEACHER EVER
