Class is not as easy as people make it out to be, you do need to put in a good amount of studying since there is vocab that you've probably never heard of before and some anatomy too. An A- is easy enough to get but getting a straight up A is kinda hard. But she is really, really nice.
Very clear professor. Does not try to trick you and class is always interesting. I would recommend this professor to anyone looking to take a communications class.

Amazing teacher. Made the class very interesting for someone who had no exposure to the subject. She posts half-filled in power points online, so attendance is mandatory in order to fill them in when in class (a great way to take notes) class is very fun and she is a great personality. Her exam study guides are amazing and you don't use the book.
She is one of the best professors I have ever had. Very personable and makes the class enjoy what she is teaching. If you need a content area 2 gen ed, definitely take cdis 1150 with her.

Matt is the best professor ever. He's incredibly nice, understanding, and doesn't demand too much of you. Just make sure you go to class, do the readings, and are engaged in the material and you'll be fine.

I loved this class. The material is really interesting, and Matt made the class enjoyable. He's young, energetic, jokes around. We watched videos in class. There are weekly readings that aren't too bad-there were a few response papers. There is one paper for the class, but he helped out a lot and makes sure you are on track.
Parent is really amazing, made the class really enjoyable and I learned a lot. By far one of the best professors I've ever had.

Matthew Parent is amazing. I went in to my second semester as a History Major and he made me realize that I really wanted to do Political Science. Explains things well but do the readings if nothing else out of respect. He won't quiz you on them but participation is vital and it's just overall easier for the coursework. Very easy to talk to.
Great Guy! Loved his class.
A great TA. He is funny and made this class bearable. Matt definitely knows what he is talking about and is very available. I highly recommend Matt as a TA.

GREAT TA. literally the best TA i've ever had. very fair grader!! very clear. if you take POLS 1202 and he's a TA pray he is yours or switch in. Very difficult class, but he makes it 10xs better and is super funny

Takes a long time to hand back essays and ends up writing no feedback. Grading can vary a lot and is not clear cut. Pretty much tells you what to write for the 2 midterms and the final. Overall enjoyed having him as a TA. Would take again.

Professor Zhou is a good professor no doubt, but the issue is that she tries too hard. She changes her style each semester, so this semester was hybrid, Mon. online, Wed in person. Replaced hw with in-person quiz every week. Some of the chapter on the exam are harder then it should, makes you prepare for every type of problem per chapter.

Professor Zhou is incredible! She is a lovely person and an amazing teacher. While Cost is not an easy course she sets it up so that you can succeed as long as you do the work (which isn't too time consuming). She wants you to do well and is available every hour of the day on teams. Wonderful human :)

Professor Zhou was good. I probably should've done more homework to get a better grade. The exams are a mix of multiple choice and long problems, so make sure you know what you're doing for the calculations. Almost the entire course is based on 3 exam grades.

Professor Ying Zhou is great. I got COVID when taking finals. She was very easy to reach and responded frequently. She made sure that I was able to complete the course and that I could take the final when I felt better. Her course is not too hard if you pay attention, but the grade is mostly based on the exams. I recommend taking a course with her.

One of my favorite professors from my time at UCONN. She is very sweet and I thoroughly enjoy her class. A few people from class complain about the exams and the work quantity, but I find it to be fairly manageable. My only complaint is that she requires cameras on for webex. Overall a very nice lady

Professor Zhou is an AMAZING (I'm not kidding) person and professor. Yes, the material is hard in general like any high-level accounting class (hence the 4), but she made sure we did worksheets together and was always available during office hours. For exams, she gives partial credit for your work which is amazing. She acknowledges your hard work!!

She is a great professor. The class is relatively hard but she teaches the things you have to know to better prepare for exam. I suggest you take her. She is also really considerate if there is any unfairness in the reading you just have to talk to her.

She tries to teach a technical accounting course like a theory course. She takes a long time to grade the assignments at least a 2-3 weeks. The only good thing about her is that she gives partial credit for exam problems but that's about it.

I really learned a lot from her class, even it was not my major requirement course. The exam was hard and required a lot of knowledges from the textbook and her ppt, but once you spend time doing review then it will be easy cuz her outline for exams was very clear. I got 90+ every time.
Absolutely awful Professor. Has no control over the classroom and doesnt actually teach you anything. Basically just read on your own and show up for the clicker questions. Would never take her again

A lot of people didn't really attend class at the start of the semester... including me. Big mistake; the clicker questions are really important to grades! Also, she does give a lot of extra credit so it's really helpful if you have to miss class for reasons outside your control.

The clicker questions are there to keep you engaged. Exams were not difficult as long as you paid attention even a little. She is very approachable and genuinely cares about her students' success. IE: If someone asked a question in class, she would remember who asked and find them after class to make sure they understood the material. She's great.
Terrible teacher. She puts way too many clicker questions. The tests are excessively hard. She goes way too fast through the slides. Don't take this class with her.

Great professor. The class average was a 91. The test can be hard but she gives out very good study guides. You can skip class and as long as you complete the study guide you will be fine. The reviews below are fake and most likely from jocks who failed.

She does not teach in a way any human being can understand. Basically every other slide is a clicker question and really I learned nothing. She talks so quietly and doesn't use a microphone. Tests were all diagrams that made little sense. Good luck to any who sign up for this class.

Ran does a poor job of explaining lectures, basically reads off of slides on the board and the exams were difficult to answer with the information that she gives you in class. Attendance neccescary as there are about 10 iClicker questions every class. Would not take again.
He is extremely condescending and rude to his students. He does not guide his students well either. Would not recommend

Teaches 2nd half. Doable A, but definitely not an easy A. Unless maybe this is your only hard class and you can focus the majority of your time to it. You need to study A LOT. A 25 question cumulative exam is ridiculous and they don't give us any indication as what to focus on. We covered roughly 30 topics.

Teaches 2nd half. Explains everything you need to know on slides. Listen 2 lecture recordings. He is very nice, but his material is basically all memorization and facts, unlike Zweifach who is more conceptual. Make sure you do all the problem set ?'s and understand them. Very plausible to get an A, its just a course where you need to study alot.
Taught the second half of the class. He is a cool guy, gives out gummy bears for answering questions in lecture. His slides are much wordier, but it makes up for the class having no textbook.

He's a pretty good teacher. He knows what he's talking about and shortens everything to what we need to know for the exams. Maybe he doesn't capture student interest, but he outlines everything that will be on the exam in bolded and underlined letters on his powerpoints. Very clear explanations and actually is willing to help students out.

Expect a giant transition from Zweifach to Campellone. They are very different in terms of capturing attention. I can't tell if it was the material that Campellone is covering, but I was generally less interested and did not do as well on exams during his portion of the class. Nice guy, but needs to find a way to stimulate student interest.

For his first semester teaching, I think he did a pretty good job. Not always the most interesting lecturer (partly due to his focus being on the cytoskeleton), but you can tell he really tries to relate to his students.

Dr. Campellone is the man, he is so good with explaining concepts and makes the lecture really interesting. He is from Berkeley(so he ought to be good)and just got to UCONN, i hope he stays here coz i think he is amazing. this class is a breeze with his lectures.

Professor Ascenzo was my favorite professor this year, she is absolutely amazing, she has a lot of energy and compassion. She cares about her students, and lights up the class. Her class itself was pretty easy, the projects were straightforward and clear, there were not too many assignments.
Great, and full of energy

She is super nice, classes are small and have in class writings with others, very easy. She has told us she likes giving out A's and she does, it is very easy to succeed. She gives a lot of wiggle room with things and doesn't have that many big assignments. Has small ones to help grade. Very very nice and a good teacher. 10/10

Margaret is a very nice woman. She cares about her students and wants them to succeed. As long as you turn in your work for this class with some effort, you will get an A. This class is very project based and I could do each project in 1-3 days so not a lot of time necessary outside of class.

Margaret was awesome! English 1007 in general is very easy at Uconn. An easy 4 credit A in my opinion. She gives very good feedback and she only assigned 3 large papers. The class style is the same each week and the workload is very manageable. Definitely recommend her for first year English!!!

Professor Margaret is the sweetest and most caring professor ever. She understands that the class can be a lot of work sometimes, and is always there to help or extend the deadline when necessary. She is very responsive and wants us to succeed. If you do the work, you'll get an A.

Prof. Ascenzo cares about her students and creates a fun learning environment. There are a lot of poems to go through each week; she targets main ideas and keeps the workload very light. There are several projects throughout the semester, but they are spaced out and are very clear. easy A and would recommend to anyone who needs a CA1 Lit.

She is a good professor; she clearly enjoys what she teaches and cares about her students. The level of writing and reading in the class is manageable, nothing crazy. Also, make sure you don't miss class because the class size is small and the participation grade is based upon what you do in class.

Shes a really great professor and a very nice person. Her class isnt too difficult and shes very very clear on her work and expectations. Answers emails very fast and her grading feedback is the best.

By far.. the best professor at UCONN. And to be honest--it's not even close. Professor Gordon is honest, caring, and a true professional. She is understandable, gives great feedback and is knowledgeable on all things Political Science and Black Political Thought. She's an amazing writer, editor and gives great lectures. You'll love her class.

One of the most supportive and interesting professors I've ever had. She's extremely understanding when work is handed in late (just be sure to not take advantage, she'll notice). Lecture was long but she's amazing at creating a collaborative atmosphere. Gives great, specific feedback on assignment rough drafts.

Jane is a sweetheart. One of the most respectful and knowledgeable professors I've ever had at UConn. If you get the chance to take a class with her, do it. She genuinely cares about you as a student and her feedback on papers is unmatched. She fosters a classroom that makes for great discussion and always listens to what you have to say.

She's a pretty chill professor. She has a lot of writing assignments but her longest assignments are min. of 3 pages, and most of those are drafts. Then there are weekly one page assignments up until April which have to be about the readings, but pretty easy to do (even if you just skim the readings tbh). No final exam, just portfolio of your work

Professor Gordon is an amazing teacher. I took her W course that focused on "Women Political Thinkers" and she made this course (one that I initially was not excited about at all) extremely enjoyable. She made these very long classes tolerable by being so thoughtful in the way she presented the material and facilitated class discussion. Take her!!

Professor Gordon sends you the most cheerful, useful feedback on everything you do so if you're looking to improve, definitely take a class with her. There's a lot of reading but that's because she teaches high level courses, when you go to class she explains it all very well and highlights what you need to know. Would take again!

If you have the chance to take a class with Jane Gordon, consider it a privilege. I emailed her once with a question about a paper and got back a thoughtful analysis of all my written work thus far, plus a thesis for my final paper. The Theories of Enslavement class requires a lot of reading and participation, but it is WELL worth it! Amazing lady!
"The graduate should not have multiple choice questions for exams. " :)

This Professor is easy to angry. Always spend a lot of time on tech things like never can open the classroom computer or open the adobe pdf. Maybe he is ready for the class but not ready for the classroom.
Easily got angry. yelled at students to hide that he is not comfortable with explaining things in more details. Not really knowledgable on Finance.

I've taken this professor's class in UCONN stamford and I really dislike the way he delivers the lecture. He is so strict in a improper way and the atmosphere is terrible in his class. Nobody dare to say anything in class and all the people keep silence.

As the saying goes,"those who can, do. Others teach."If this guy was truly knowledgeable about the world of finance, he would not be a professor. It's basic economics. The opportunity cost of the truly best financiers in the world is very high and they are therefore not professors. If Chinmoy was a good financier he would not be a professor.
Extremely difficult. Expects you to know 100% of what he teaches, and maybe more than that. Exams are comprehensive and draining.
Read the book or die.
No Comments

Dr. Skoe is such a friendly soul who cares for her students. She loves the topic she teaches which gets passed on to us students. The material can get a bit convoluted at times, but she is great at clarifying things when you don't understand. You should be fine if you take notes and ask questions when you don't understand something.

It's been a little over 2 years, but I had to come back to say this. Dr. Skoe was a great professor. She gave extra credit assignments and was very clear with what she wanted from her students. She is very approachable, and straightforward. I would recommend using all of her study guides for the exam; you'll be fine if you do.
Loved her!!! Such a sweet woman who really cares about her students. This class was an easy A but I also feel like I learned so much! Would definitely recommend.

Loved this class and loved Prof Skoe. She is an absolute doll. You can tell that she loves what she does. Definitely helpful to go to lectures, even though they're not required. Once she gave everyone in the class extra credit just for showing up that day.

Great professor and great class. She loves what she teaches! Two fairly easy exams, a final, weekly quizzes (three to five questions), mini projects (takes 10 minutes), and 10 points worth of extra credit. One piece of advice: do all 10 points of extra credit because the final is a little difficult.

This was by far one of my favorite classes at UConn. She is such a good lecturer- she is very clear and explains this very well. This class requires a lot of memorization, but if you put the time in to memorize her slides, you will do very well. I learned so much. She also offers extra credit and group projects to bring up your grade. Take her!
Made class very laid-back and fun to attend. Learned a lot.

He is one of the nicest professors I have ever had at UConn, but when it comes to teaching he is just completely lost. His notes are confusing and hard to understand, he overcomplicates everything. Also, there is virtually no communication between him and the rest of the class. Do not expect to ever get an announcement or meaningful email from him.

The grading criteria for this class was incredibly unclear. But Norman himself is super chill. During lecture, he'd often run behind and then we'd only have one day to finish the homework because we didn't cover it the week before, and a lot of stuff on exams we barely went over in class. He rushes during sample problems, and tests are pretty hard.

Honestly. If you are looking for an easy A, this is the man. If you want to learn anything. Avoid him. Expect to have a lot of your time wasted, useless material thrown at you, and tested on material you never saw. Probably wouldn't take him again because just wasted 60 hours of my life over 15 weeks

Professor Garrick is a nice guy however his grading scale is incredibly unfair. An individual who was at the top of the course for the entire class can end up at the bottom just by the final. Not because the final was hard or heavily weighted but rather than because the final replace your exam average which is INCREADIBLY unfair.

with all honesty he's one of the toughest graders i have came across. I have attended all the classes and done all the homework, yet when it comes to the exams he will screw you up. All my exam grades were in 60's no matter how hard and how many hours i was in his office. Don't get me wrong he's a nice guy but he thinks you're a transportation wiz.

Love this teacher, greatly inspired me to choose transportation engineering. Also he is willing to help even if the question you have is not directly from the class. Such as helping out Senor Project. (when he is Not the adviser)

Really cool teacher. Quizzes make you think but take your time with them and you should be fine. Even thought all the notes are online, going to class is recommended; he tends to same some things that are important that he never posts online such as canceled class, change in dates of HW or quizzes or important info on the quizzes

Professor Lynne is one of my favorite wgss professors. They are always so helpful and respectful of your situation and will always make accommodations for their students. A very giving person and I always looked forward to coming to this class.

Lyn is a great professor who actually cares about their students. I took WGSS2250, and the course has no final, no work due after thanksgiving break, and only 2 major projects (that are pretty easy). I cannot recommend this professor enough.

Professor Lyn is a wonderful and understanding professor. They are more than willing to be flexible on deadlines and they grade generously. I really did not want to take a W class but they made it so much better than I could have hoped for. Definitely recommend!!

Lyn is one of the best professors on campus and really understands, especially in the time of COVID-19, that students may have to have other priorities outside of classes. They are extremely forgiving when it comes to deadlines, as long as you get in your work by the end of term. Open note midterm and project in lieu of final exam. Love them.

Lynne is AWESOME! This course was pretty dense but she was able to cover so much material in an engaging way through lectures, readings, videos, stand-up. Assists you through everything if needed. Not only talking about this course, but she actually cares about how your week was or will help you if you want to apply for grad school, jobs, etc.

Lynne is an AMAZING professor. She's in a graduate student here and understands that we likely have 3-5 other courses we're preparing for, and tries to make it so the readings are only what we need to know for the topic. She will allow you to re-submit essays with corrections for full credit, and provides extra credit opportunities if needed.

Lynne is probably the most understanding professor I've ever had. She realizes that students have lives and other issues outside of school and is super flexible when it comes to handing in assignments. I'd definitely take a class with her again!

"Quiz" 5 Â½ page: Who was likely to be a loyalist or at least not a Patriot and why? one sentence each for Europeans, Africans, Native peoples. Â½ page: Why did Civil War Breakout in South Carolina during American Revolutionary War? Â½ page: describe TWO specific examples that illustrate brutality of this war Quotes: 2 per topic, <7 words

I took an online class with her in fall 2020. it was asynchronous and I only had to dedicate about an hour or two a week to the class. Really great content and a sweet prof. I recommend for sure. Weekly quiz on the readings, plus a discussion post. 2 papers too

This class was awful. She sends home weekly quizzes to do, which may include watching 3 hour documentaries, reading over 90 pages of useless information, and reading up to 7 articles, just to answer a 10 question online quiz. The quizzes are timed, you can't go back to the question once you have submitted, 9 out of the 10 questions are irrational.

She is so amazing and intelligent. She seems to know everything that could be known and she just is *chefs kiss but intellectual.* The only thing is that she's a stickler, like you can't leave during lecture and she locks the door once class time starts, but you forget about all that once she starts speaking. Amazing, wonderful, role model.

Class notes help a lot when doing the quizzes/exams. 1-2 pg quizzes every week based off of reading (just answer her assigned questions). Three take home exams, and a final. Found her lectures to be interesting. Learned a lot about America's history and even CT history that had never been discussed in high school courses.

Professor Robinson is a wonderful instructor. Her enthusiasm for history is both contagious and refreshing. I followed her from one class to the next, until I had exhausted all opportunities to learn from her. Something you would not notice instantly: she has an awesome sense of humor.

Mostly boring, but sometimes surprises you with a joke or interestin topic. TONS of reading that you HAVE to do (assignments/quizzes/tests based on it), lots of quizzes. A lot of it actually is very interesting- really makes you question your perception of gender and feminism. Small class size. Hard, but good overall.

Initial pace of class rushed, quizzes & homework harshly graded, exams had to be curved despite it being open notes. Class itself felt long and boring.The TA didn't help much & was stubborn in grading. Previous comments are definitely deceptive.

The pacing of this class is very uneven. In the first four weeks of the class, there have been 3 homework that took hours to complete with little guidance from practice problems, 2 quizzes, and an exam. Additionally, he posts hour-long lecture videos to watch on top of the in-class lectures. The beginning of this course has been extremely rushed.

He cares about students and wants the best for them. The content can be difficult b/c there are MANY equations, reference tables, etc.. To succeed is to be organized and to understand how to approach each problem. He is a fair grader and willing to restructure elements of the class if students are unhappy. Homeworks can be hard.

Professor Imani wants his students to achieve. He is willing to change the format of the class if it's in the benefit of the class. He's a very courteous grader and just wants his students to walk away having learned something.

This prof was so nice and caring. Very easy to get in contact with and always ready to help. HWs and exams were extremely fair. I would take this class over again in a heartbeat with Prof Imani, he is amazing.
TAKE THIS CLASS!!! Very easy grader, cares more about how you solve a problem rather than the final answer. Not a lot of work.

He is fair and very nice but I don't feel like I learned a lot. Notes had mistakes in them often but he answers emails quickly and explains any questions you have. Posts lots of notes and practice problems. Exams are VERY fair. Sometimes quizzes were too long but he adjusts grades and is flexible if you talk to him.
Amazing professor! She cares about all of her students, gives great lectures, and really wants all of her students to succeed. I definitely recommend taking a class with her.

Linda is an amazing professor. She is super caring and is a really fast responder to emails. Honestly, it was sometimes hard to go to class at 8:00 am but the content was pretty interesting and the exams were very simple in my opinion. The class is based off of the midterm and final, and 2 small papers that you do at the end of the semester.

Linda is amazing!!! She is the most caring professor I have ever had. She responds to emails super fast and genuinely wants you to do well in her course. She gives awesome individualized feedback. Linda is the best take these classes even if you don't want to become an interpreter!

She is one of my favorite professors and her classes have been so helpful. She genuinely cares about everyone and grades on improvement rather than overall skill compared to other classmates. If you're willing to put in the effort you will get a lot out of her classes, and she makes you want to learn more. I cannot say enough good things about her.

She is a great professor and really wants you to pass, she gives good feedback on your signing and interpreting skills. I plan on minoring in interpreting because of her. There were few assignments and homework and she was always diligent about helping you out with signs you miss or don't remember.

Linda genuinely cares about each and every one of her students. She wants to see you improve over the course of the semester, and gives you individualized feedback to help you do so. She also lets you know when she's seen improvement! I love her in-class activities where you work with other classmates to do interpreting exercises.

honestly 10/10 professor, class, exams, etc. took 2 of her interpreting classes so far and planning on taking the other two. would recommend to anyone who knows ASL, she is amazing! (not sure why there are no ratings so far, so I'm glad to be the first!)

I took this class this year - he taught it half the semester and Richard Mancini taught the other half. I think Yangchao is the nicer professor, more humane professor. His exams and lectures can be slightly more tough, though. He can come across as tough, but he is very nice - talk to him after class or over email. He is also very smart.
The extra credit is what saved me. The project is pretty easy but the exams are not that easy in my opinion. He's a super knowledgeable guy

I LOVE THIS MAN he is incredibly accessible and willing to help students exceed whether it is in class or outside. He is one of those professors you will you can take only his classes until you graduate. Truly a great, well respected person and cares about what he does!

I think he made the class easier than normal this semester because of COVID. I know that usually he has pop quizzes during class time, but this semester the quizzes were open note & counted as extra credit on the final. Okay lecturer - reads off the slides. Exams are okay and he provides a study guide. 2nd one is the hardest.

Prof Luo is very approachable and wants everyone to do well. Grade is based on 3 exams and a final (drops the lowest). 2 in-class guest lectures and a group project. Gives fair amt of extra credit. posts lec slides online, so you can skip (but he adds a bit more detail in class which helps material stick). The second exam is the hardest. But Easy A

Great professor! Teaches a lot stuff that is useful in daily life. Tons of extra credits opportunity! Easy A class if you remember everything in review section and go to class frequently because there are pop quizzes. Very accessible outside of class, a super nice person to talk with. And his accent is easy to understand, knows a lot in his area!

Great professor! Sometimes is hard to understand because of accent, but he is able to make up for it with all the extra credit. Doesnt want any student to fail. Always clarifies all material when needed.

I took SOCI 1501W. Although Rhys Hall had a tough fall semester due to personal reasons, he tries his best to help students with giving the best advice about your fifteen-page paper. For the fifteen-page paper, we do it in three parts (proposal, draft, and final). Reading is long but easy. Lectures can be short or long and usually boring.

Rhys is probably one of the best professors/teachers I have had in my educational experience. Very understanding with pretty much anything and genuinely cares about his students success. I def recommend taking one of his classes as he presents each topic in a way to inspire people to join in on the conversation. Approx one journal post a week

truly one of the best professors, teachers, whatever I've ever had in my entire school career. take any of his classes if u can!!! super caring, passionate about what he teaches, gives amazing and HELPFUL feedback, very understanding, gives extensions if you give notice... can't say enough good things about him. such a genuine guy! I learned a lot.

Rhys really cares about you. He wants you to learn about ongoing events and fully understand going on in the world. He cares about you and wants this class to be stress-free as much as he can possibly make it. I highly recommend taking this class!

Rhys truly cares about his students, especially given the current circumstances. Rhys is chill about grading as long as you participate. You can totally ask for an extension in advance and get it as well. There are weekly articles to read to discuss in class but that's about it, besides a few papers and a final research paper. He's a gem for sure!
Probably one of my favorite professors. So insightful and welcoming which makes everybody want to participate.

Please take any class with Rhys. He is literally the most kind, encouraging, understanding prof. You can tell he genuinely cares about his students and the subjects he teaches about. Not a difficult class at all and the work he does give truly gives you deeper understanding of the material. Highly recommend taking any class with Rhys, amazing guy.

Prof Teufel is a real gem, the material of the class is somewhat tough but she's always available to help on assignments so go to her office hours; plus if you show interest in learning, she'll be more accommodating to you in time of need. Go to class cuz that's where she discusses everything and exams are usually bulky so beware. No curve!

Concepts aren't hard, but the class seems like it crams 2 smstrs worth of material into 1 smstr. If you're a proactive studier you'll be fine. If not, it's a struggle but doable. Chapter reading and hw assignment for almost every class. Tests are hard, largely because of the limited time. She is a very nice person and a good teacher class just tuff

The worst professor ever. This is not meant to be a difficult course, but the professor made the course way more difficult than it should be. I sincerely recommend you not to take this class if you really wanna learn with your professor rather than selfstudying for the whole semester. Only if you wanna chanllenge yourself, she might be a choice.

Professor Teufel is a great professor. She is clear in her expectations and wants to make sure her students succeed, whether in her class or in their careers. She is interested in what she teaches and her assignments are graded very fairly. Each lecture has a lot of content, so you have to attend class to do well, but I would highly recommend her.

She is a fantastic professor. She clearly cares about the topic and cares even more about her students. Gives good feedback and all her tests and assignments are very fair. Honestly I have nothing bad to say about her; definitely take any class you can with her and talk to her in office hours even if you don't need help. She gives great advice.

Patricia Teufel is a great teacher and has a lot of enthusiasm for the subject. I honestly learned so much in this class and can apply it to real-life actuarial practice. You have to go to lecture because she explains topics really well. The material gets a bit tough near the end and it's difficult to get an A with so many assignments however.
Great class, great professor. Learn so much about the actuarial profession. Crazy helpful for real-life implementation. Just great all around!!

Get ready to fail all the quizzes if you do not have the textbook. Her quizzes include fill-in-the-blank questions which come directly from the book. She is a tough grader especially when you are doing your speeches. Pay attention in this class and practice a lot before your speeches and you will do fine. If you do not like public speaking don't/

I took professor Simmon's class as a freshman and I had an amazing experience!!! I learned very valuable lessons on how to speak to audiences and she gave us time to prepare for all of our speeches. Professor Simmons started each class inquiring about our days and our mental states, followed by some quick meditation. She is very kind and caring!!
Mrs. Simmons always1,117.80 /1,345romoted a welcoming environment, and taught using power point and participation based activities. The class was not easy but I had an overall good experience

Hated this class. She graded way too harsh- I wish I would've taken back all of the time wasted on the stupid speeches and assignments and dropped the class because I would've saved myself the stress and bad grade. If you happen to take her class, make sure you do everything PERFECTLY... if you're lucky you'll end up with a C+.

Professor Simmons can be kind, but has a pretentious attitude. She teaches basic concepts but nothing particularly special or helpful. There is not too much work assigned for the class, but she is a tough grader. To the point where it's discouraging.

Very pretentious for a class with little substance or value. Simmons will spoon feed you a class that tells you obvious information like: "Do research before giving a speech". But don't think the class is easy, there is an absurd amount of braindead work. Don't take this course unless you like 3 hour participation lectures with mind numbing content

She is very pleasant to have a conversation with and always puts in effort to say good evening and ask how we are. I took a hybrid class with her because of COVID and it was still an interesting class. It is very participation forward, but she will not call on you if your hand isn't raised and makes the classroom feel like a safe space.

Extremely disorganized and unclear of what he expects of you from homework to the midterm group project. Curved everyone's grades because he wasn't happy with the classes overall score, which is nice, but you don't learn much as a result. Took at CCSU but there is no profile of him on there. Do not recommend.
He is really bad teacher, teaches nothing but expect you to do all the work. his class is unorganized

He hands out A's. If you show up and demonstrate that you want to get a good grade then he will make sure you do. Lectures are extremely unorganized and the overall course is relatively unstructured. He'll let you redo assignments to bring up your grade and he gives a take home midterm and final. It's impossible to get below an A-.
"TIS ALLL ABOUT DA CASH FLOW!"

Cover is confusing but if he knows you care about your grade and you show interest and effort in learning the material you will do well in the class. He is actually a really good guy and I really enjoyed my semester with him! Don't buy the text or if you do split it with someone. its helpful when you need it but you can get by without it

He is a good guy, he actually postponed the take-home exam by 1 week because we all didn't finish it even though we had 2-3 weeks to do it. He wants you to have a good grade and will help you if you ask, but he really doesn't have an idea how to teach a class whatsoever, not at all. He makes everything really confusing.

Literally the worst professor I have ever had in my life. This guy has absolutely no idea what he's talking about and I feel dumber from having taken this class. He does just hand out A's to compensate for the fact that he is an awful professor but if you are genuinely looking to learn even the most simplest principles of real estate, you will not.

Professor Karabag makes class engaging through discussions and are good at explaining complex concepts. The tests were very reflective of the lectures and readings so you are well prepared for exams. The professor is also very understanding of students and is approachable, often staying behind class to help answer questions and clear up concepts.

Anyone calling this guy rude has no social awareness. He was sassy, yes, but it made the class so much easier and humanized the heavy topics we discussed. He was always open to disagreeing views and allowed for constructive conversations to be had about any topic. Participation was important, but if you were consistent he gave you some grace.

I had a great time in this class, the professor is very helpful with going over material that is in the readings during class. Lots of interesting perspectives as well during class discussions that were held weekly. Would definitely take again!

Prof went heavy on lectures and made sure that we understood material by stopping for questions and elaborating. Once per week we had a discussion where we answered one easy question. If you show up to class, pay attention, and participate in discussion you WILL get a good grade. Only reason I got an A- was b/c I'm bad at multiple-choice exams.

In PHIL 1104, Ozcan Karabag gives you the material and the practice that is needed to succeed in the course and will answer your questions and help you when needed. However, he will not hold your hand and expects effort to be put into the readings and contributing to discussion. Great class if your goal is to actually learn the content to mastery.

Overall,the content went fast but easy to pick up. If you didn't understand something he would go over it until you did. Attendance isn't mandatory but he does grade on participation so take that however you choose. If you do the work you will do well in this class. He was a very understanding professor and want you to succeed. Just show effort.

It was one of the most fun and interesting classes I've taken. Highly recommended if you're interested in challenging and in-depth discussions of philosophical topics. The professor was very articulate and organized. He was always friendly and accessible in and out of the classroom. I have learned a ton from his class!

The class is pretty fun, and if you participate in the discussion you'll always get a high grade. The professor makes the material interesting, and the subject is actually really fun to learn. I would 100% recommend taking this with him, no doubt at all!

Dr. Astitha is one of the best professors I have had at UConn. Her lectures are short and simple, where most of lecture is solving real engineering problems in Excel. This class was incredibly useful and interesting, and the professor was very considerate, gave good feedback, and was easy to talk to. Highly recommend this course.

I first took Dr. Astitha for ENVE2310 and after taking a second class by her I've only grown to appreciate her teaching. Its an engineering course, so of course there are difficult assignments but she's always available with extra support to make sure that you fully understand the concepts. She is also very understanding when it comes to late hw's

After taking my second class with Marina my love for her as a professor has only grown. She truly cares about her students and you will receive a good grade in this class if you show her that you want to learn and that you are understanding of the material. If you take her I highly encourage that you see her during office hours she is very helpful.

Marina is an excellent professor. Attendance isn't mandatory but it helps. There were few homeworks so definitely do well on those (20% of grade), and three exams plus a final. If you had a 90, you could skip the final. She is very nice, and really cares about her students. She has an open door policy which was extremely helpful.

Professor Astitha is an amazing teacher for environmental engineering. She is caring, energetic, and you can tell she cares about all of her students. Homework isn't too difficult and midterm exams are very fair. Would totally recommend taking a class with her.

This class has some hard concepts and problems, however she is a great professor and is willing to help you learn and succeed, you just have to reach out to her. Class isn't mandatory but I recommend going because the discussion is great and she works through the math problems thoroughly which is helpful. Can't wait to take another class with her.

He is an okay teacher, but I vehemently disagree that he cares about his students. Hardly makes himself available or shows that he takes interest in how you do. It is all up to the TAs to decide your grade. If you take this class, make sure to participate. That is what killed my grade. Papers are relatively easy and tests are fair. So participate.
Was a wonderful professor who cared about his students and passionate about what he taught. If you get him as a professor you're incredibly lucky and in for a great class!
Easy a, but rather boring. Everything is online, just read the chapter when there is a quiz. Study guides for midterms and finals are exactly what is on the exam.

Awesome professor. Really easy class. Everything is online so you really only need to show up for the midterm and final and quizzes. He's very helpful if you need it. He puts a perfect study guide online for the exams too. Def an easy A!

Awesome professor, very easy to get along with and funny, I took two courses with him and would take more if i could. As long as you try, he will give you a good grade on all assignments. Attendance is mandatory but his class is fun so you wont want to skip.

LOVED him! one of the nicest teachers i've ever had. as long as you participate you will do great in his class. Even though the material wasn't that interesting (to me at least), I realized that you don't really have to read a lot of it. i would absolutely recommend taking a class with him, he's the best!

Anna has her days... She is pretty nice in class but try to speak with her outside of class and she does not want anything to do with you. Teaches off of powerpoints and gives five quizzes throughout the semester based on different chapters. Her tests are kinda hard too. I would take her again only if I had to.

Brown is a friendly lady. She's a fast lecturer, needs to slow down a little. Exams are NOT easy. You have to work for the grade. Doing the homework will help on exams but it's a lot of material to grasp. Better to self-teach yourself at times. She tries to give partial credit on open ended questions on exams.

Anna gives you the grade you earn. Showing up to class is helpful, but unnecessary if you're willing to put in tons of outside work. Even with going to class, be ready to spend lots of time preparing for exams or you won't do well. If you put in the time and effort exams are fairly straight-forward there is just a lot of material on each exam.
This is class is hard! Her exams are really hard! There are so much materials covered on one exam, and she speeds through the materials in class.

Anna is a great professor - she's friendly but to the point, and her grading basis is clear from day one. She does many helpful examples in class, but the class has lots of material that she speeds through. Pay particular attention to problems done in class and don't underestimate the exams - exam dates will sneak up on you otherwise (3 total).

Exams are very tough and require a lot of outside studying. Questions are tricky but they are nothing you would have not see before in class. Anna is very friendly and her lectures run at a good pace.

Reallly good, took him this year as my english 101. You get to skip 2 times, he takes attendence. He gives out a paper telling you what we gone do each day we in there, he doesn't grade that hard. He is nice & he always smiling & make weird jokes. He puts in the effort & makes class interesting.

Erick is amazing, I absolutely loved his class. He teaches in such an honest, helpful wayyou'll really grow as a writer. The work he gives is very reasonable; basically you won't feel like you're drowning in stress. The discussions were very meaningful, and Erick really helped everyone to approach things from challenging and interesting angles.
Easiest A ever. Teaches the class differently, engaging, and funny

This class was very different than any other English class. Discussions in class were interesting and not what you would expect. Topics of essays are a little hard to underdstand but Erick is always alvailable for help. He listens to suggestions and takes students opinions into consideration. A great English class.

One of my favorite teachers. Super intelligent and good at helping you to understand. I enjoyed his class a lot. Also he's a total hottie. Straight ladies and gay men, you'll get an extra treat when he wears his fitted khakis.

Really nice guy. He cares about students and wants them to do well. Class discussions are interesting and thought provoking. You have to write 3 papers for the class and he gives you good feedback and guidance to improve your writing. Take his class, you'll learn a lot. He's also really cute!

I am a senior and Professor Irrizary is by far one of the BEST professors at UConn. SO kind and understanding. The material was really interesting and easy to engage with. He was VERY flexible with deadlines. He does randomly call on students to participate, so you need to pay attention, but I do believe that this made me a better Spanish speaker.

Thorough participation in every class is necessary and will heavily affect your grade. He really wants students to learn and enjoy material and dig beyond the surface level. However, this makes him a tough grader because he expects your understanding to reflect a deep analysis. Midterm and final were take home, but readings for class got lengthy.

I am learning so much in this class and enjoy the material, but sadly my grade does not reflect it. Really harsh grading =( I'm working so hard for a low C which has never happened to me in a Spanish class. You can do the readings and participate tons, but your grade will still be extremely low.

He expects students to memorize a lot of material and will call people's name out in class to participate so you need to do the readings and attend class. Not a bad teacher, the material is just kind of difficult to remember, but he's willing to meet and answer questions after class. A nice guy

Do your work and you'll do well in the class. He's more than willing to help you with any questions or problems you may have, and he will teach you alot. I absolutely recommend taking any class he offers - awesome professor!

Very understandable. He is not out to get anyone. He wants to make sure that everyone learns the content and he will help you along the way if you have any trouble or if you have any questions for him. A wonderful professor.

Random lecture material that seldom related to labwork. Weekly in-class "quizzes". Labs were generally easy, but take a few hours to do and are sometimes outdated for what's on ArcGIS. He's a strict grader and will take so many points off for small things. No exams. Schedule was M/W/F, with quizzes on Monday and optional class on Friday.

Professor Chen is incredible. If you have an opportunity to take a class with him, do it!! He is a kind, cheerful, humble man who is simultaneously a complete and utter genius. His research is incredibly fascinating, too.

Professor Chen is incredible. If you have an opportunity to take a class with him, do it!! He is a kind, cheerful, humble man who is simultaneously a complete and utter genius. His research is incredibly fascinating, too.

Peter is far and away one of the best professors I've had here. His teaching style is very no-nonsense and he made everything crystal clear and straightforward. He also puts a lot of stock into helping you out with projects or assignments if you so much as ask. Definitely take a class from him if you can.
He was incredibly organized which helped me stay on top of my work.

Peter Chen has to be the nicest and most caring professor out there. He really cares for his students and ensures you really succeed in your time at university- a real gem I've found. Class is as easy as it should be. Make sure to ask for help when you need it because he will help you if you have any problems.

We watch a movie per week that is paired with a reading that you later discuss. Very straightforward in terms of assignments too. You get unlimited revisions which is very nice. You do a lot of easy small group work where you discuss the readings/movies and then there is one final group project that is also quite easy. Attendance is taken randomly.

Such a nice and very understanding professor. It is impossible to get a grade below a B. Extremely organized, class work and your grade is up to you with their grading system. Attendance is extremely optional, by the end barely no one went anywhere. But they are extremely caring and teach interesting content, should still go.

If you have the chance, take ENGL 1007 with Tolonda! They make English super fun and exciting, and go out of their way to make sure you get the support you need. The class is also super manageable (very low stress). Papers are essentially graded off of completion and she is understanding with late assignments.

Tolonda was an amazing professor. They care about their students and forming relationships with them. They are someone you feel very comfortable with and go out of their way to make sure students are excelling. Tolonda also works with their classes to make students more comfortable about sharing their work with other people. They were great.

Tolonda was the best instructor ever. They were so sweet and gave me a great feedback on assignments and would be super clear about assignments. I recommend going to the seminar's because it will help you with your assignments and they make sure you stay on track. There are plenty of extra credit opportunities so it should be an easy A.

Tolonda was just an instructor and not yet a professor when I had her, but her class was very straight forward and easy, which was appreciated since it is a gen ed for most people. Attendance was never mandatory, and all late assignments received full credit. Tolonda was a great instructor, and I hope she becomes a professor at UConn.
Nick is just fantastic! He is super easy and makes everything crystal clear. I highly recommend you take a class with him if you need a basic math pre req
Nick is a great instructor. Clear and tries to help students succeed in course. I definitely recommend him.

Nick was a great teacher! He really went above & beyond to help everyone understand the material. He held office hours, stayed after class, and explained everything with many examples. Very kind and patient, too. A little boring and nervous at times, but not bad! I did have to use the textbook a lot though in order to fully understand everything.

Nick saved me from not graduating. Really friendly, smart, and helpful...has multiple office hours every week to accommodate students and teaches in a way that non-math people can understand. Better than that actual professors who get paid, Nick should be running the course. HIGHLY recommended if you're going to take 1070.

Nick, is the man. Easy to get in touch with him and he's always ready to help work you through the problems you need help with in a clear and thorough manner. Definitely try and get this guy if your taking 1070

I loved Stepanik! He would seem a little nervous at times, but he is a great teacher! You can tell he is really passionate about what he teaches. If you have the chance I would really recommend taking it with him, he's great!
Shannon puts in the extra effort to really make sure everyone understands the material she covers in class. The slides are online and I would not bother buying the book. She's great.

Shannon is very sweet and definitely covers useful material. Mandatory to attend all classes and take careful, detailed notes. If you are a comm disorders major and interested in audiology, she's a good professor to have.
Took sound science with her. I barely went to class, just studied reviews and powerpoints and got a B, she's actually pretty nice, not the most exciting class but easy with not much effort
awful plain awful, our comm class was divided into two halfs, i had an A the first half, but when she took over, i averaged a C on the quizzes and got a D on the final.
Read the book/powerpoints.
This is an easy gen ed that I would definitely take. Shannon is nice and makes things pretty easy and clear. Questions on quizzes and tests come straight from notes.

I had miho for a W class. She is really nice and really funny. Participation and attendance is a part of your grade. If you go to class and take notes you will be fine! She really cares about her students inside and outside of the classroom and she LOVES sociology and what she does. It was a W class...the midterm and final were take home and easy.
I learned a lot from her class!

Easy class! She is very nice despite what others say, as long as you show up and don't talk during class she will give you a good grade. Lectures are really boring, but for an easy grade I would say it was worth it.

This teacher is very hard to understand (Esl). It is somewhat easy but be prepared to be extremely bored. If you are into soc, do NOT take this class- she does not have any idea how to conduct a successful and interesting lecture. I felt like I was in a high school intro course, but I was supposedly sitting in a 300 level class.

Best class I took all semester. Professor Iwata had very clear powerpoints, all with information taken directly from the text. Her exams consisted of very relevant questions, always covered in lecture. Maybe if the person below me had gone to class their grade wouldn't have suffered, that's basically all you need for participation. Buy the text.
Wicked easy, all the tests are stright out of the notes. Very nice and available for help if you need it. Kinda boring, but if you take the notes you should do well.

Will do more writing in this class than other English 1010/1011 classes but the material is interesting. Writing the papers is not that bad at times, he is an extremely fair grader if you make an honest effort to revise your papers. He will make you a better writer.
Good professor, makes you participate in class discussions, lots of writing

I do not recommend this class for ANSC students in the 2 year program planning on transferring into the 4 year. The credits do not transfer and it is required to take a higher level english in the four year. There is SO much writing, and while it was helpful the amount of stress is not worth it. Grades papers hard. i strongly would not recommend it
There is much more writing than many of the other English classes. He is extremely helpful with his comments. The material was interesting and I have become a much better writer.

Interesting class topics, but SO MUCH WRITING. I wrote 4 major papers (about 30 pages for all the papers) but probably 40 pages in other assignments and little papers. Good English class, I ended up getting an A, but its a lot of work.

Great Freshman English course! If you're a good writer and you don't have trouble with the length of your essays, you will do well. I earned a perfect score on 4/5 major papers. That being said, Trebra does have you write a paper every week, though sometimes they are short (3 pages).

Will is such a good professor. Extremely passionate about what he teaches. Additionally, he is super lenient and flexible when it comes to missing class or turning in assignments late (just email him in advance). Overall really nice guy who just wants you to learn and excel. Highly recommend.

Will is by far my favorite professor at UConn. He wants everyone to learn more about whatever he is teaching, so if you ever have any questions he'll spend at least five minutes going in-depth about them. He's always super helpful and his assignments aren't hard. He just wants people to put effort into their work.

I stopped going to his class because his lectures are so long that he tries to get through them by talking so fast and skipping like 3 slides at a time. But I learned by reading the book and taking notes at home. He lets you drop your lowest test grade so I didn't have to stress out for the final. Hes really sweet and understanding

Great professor, really passionate about his subject. Took him for natural hazards, there are 3 tests and he drops the lowest one. The 5 assignments are easy and straight forward. You don't have to show up if you don't want to. Would definitely take him again, great guy.

Ouimet is so passionate its adorable. Lectures are long but are some what interesting. He shows videos of natural disasters a lot which are cool. The final project is so easy and yes you cant do any natural disaster he talked about in class but he gives you examples of ones you can do and finding one is very easy. Tests were pretty direct.

At first the class was really interesting despite it being a 75 minute class but soon it just got too much. You have a natural disaster project due by the end of the semester but you can't do one he's already talked about and he talks about ALOT of them. Never really read the book but you at least need to get an access code to get to the homework.
He was not easy to reach and was never clear on his guidelines for assignments. He wasn't clear in general and is a super tough grader for a 3000 level course.
He's awesome. Take his class!!

He's great! Knowledgeable, laid back, approachable, unbiased, passionate. This is an extremely discussion based class, hardly any notes. He loves to hear everybody's opinions on the readings and encourages you to let your voice be heard. He respects what every student has to say and never tries to argue or force opinions on you. Highly recommend.

Professor Silvermint was awesome! He's so engaging, really nice and funny and is clearly very educated about the topics! He is a very good teacher and always makes sure that the students understand before he continues. I highly recommend him! I'm going to be taking my third class with him!

Prof. Silvermint really made an awesome first impression on me for it being his first course teaching at UConn. He's an all-around cool guy with an awesome personality. This course was really big on participation (30%). There's a large amount of readings (most of which are interesting) and few essays required. Take the class, you won't regret it!

This was the first course he taught at UConn and he did a great job. Being a guy I never thought I would even participate in this class. Even though participation is worth a huge part of the grade, I found myself participating willingly. Does great job of getting interest of students. Recommend him for any course. Good moderator and cool guy
The nicest teacher youll ever have. Really fair about everything, easy A. Take this guy if you need an easy Gen Ed.

Omg I love this man! He is so nice and conferences with you before he grades and he loves what he is doing... I hate his quizes I didn't get about a 3 out of five but all together they're only 5% of your grade.... TAKE THIS FOR AN EASY W you will not go wrong

An amazing guy. it's nice to have a great teacher who is passionate about what he does. Fun (relatively easy or at least it should be) curriculum. Always available and personable to his students. Just a good guy.

I barely had to read one story. He goes over everything important in class, and tells you ahead of time when you need to partisipate so you can get whatever you need to read. This class was surprisingly easy.
No Comments
McGunnigle is the man! A great teacher, actually made studying Greek Classics relatively painless, and dude, the guy likes Monty Python... how can he be bad?

He is a tough professor, but a good one. His exams are hard, true, but if you read and truly understand the homework you will do fine. He also replaces your lower score for the grade you get at your final (which helps a lot since the final is pretty straight forward)

A lot of work. A lot of difficult and time consuming homework. First test was easy but past that, it was difficult to know whether you will pass. TA said that exams were too long and hard, so they graded lenient. However this will not always happen and was luck of the draw for us. Be prepared for too much work and not enough time. STUDY.

Forte is pretty good at teaching considering how new he is. I thought he did a great job of explaining circuits. However, his exams are ridiculous. I took this class twice and Gokirmak's exams were definitely easier. I'm not saying Gokirmak is easy though!

Good teacher, but gets lost in his own notes. Helpful by offering many office hour sessions throughout the week. Home works are sort of hard but prepare you very well for the tests(which are also pretty hard). Lenient grading; Drops lowest homework & replaces lowest test grade with final exam (which was easier) grade if its higher. Overall good
I enjoyed Dr. Forte's teaching and the class, the exams were a challenge but you just need to study, and the homework is good preparation.

First test was reasonable. He said the grades were too high and would make the next tests much much harder. The TA told him the tests were too long but he refused the rewrite the test. Problems take him a class and a half to do and he still gets the answer wrong. Absolutely useless lecture. He was only interested in his research

Nina is so sweet and understands intermediate accounting is a difficult subject. She curves tests and gives extra credit. The material may be hard but Nina gives plenty of study material to go over and even gives you a practice exam that is similar to the actual exam. TAKE HER! Best accounting professor at UConn!

This definitely isn't an easy class but Nina was super accessible outside of class and was very receptive to student feedback about the course and her teaching. Exams were open book but timed so you still had to study for hours. Group projects were manageable and the notes she posted made it a lot easier to follow along during lecture.

Professor Xu is really nice and tries to help students during the tough virtual semester. However, this class is way harder than Financial/Managerial regardless of what she does to help you so if you don't spend 10+ hours studying for each exam and reworking problems don't expect a good grade on the exams or in the class.

Professor Xu is new to UConn but she is definitely one of the best accounting professors you can take here. She lectures well and cares about students. ACCT 3201 is a very tough course. Lots of work but youll learn!

I don't think she does a good job explaining intermediate Accounting. I tried really hard for this class however still didn't receive a good grade. Don't hope there are any curves in the end cause there aren't.

Nina is one of the best professors I've ever had. Intermediate I isn't necessarily super easy but her class notes are really clear and include really great examples that will help you study for the exams. She has a good sense of humor which makes class better and you can tell that she is rooting for us all to do well and is open to feedback.
The worst faculty member at any university.

English 1010 is a themed course so every teacher teaches it differently. Nicole does not put a single grade in the grade book. At the end of the course she pulls a grade out of her flat butt and gives it to you. You can conference with her a hundred times and when the grade comes back she will have made up new things. No Rubric!

Expect no rubric and minimal to no examples at best for assignments. She tends to have a set idea in mind about what your papers will be like when she sees an outline and then grades much more harshly if it is not taken in the direction she originally imagined. Also tends to needlessly shove her political opinions into the class eve when irrelevant
I loved this professor. She was so enthusiastic and caring and went way out of her way to be accessible outside of the classroom.

She is SUPER helpful when it comes to papers. We only ended up writing two 7-9 page papers and they weren't difficult, we did a podcast and a vlog and that was it. You have a lot of time to get things done and she's very easy going and will help you if she can. She's also very flexible. She's super nice and funny. The book was not used often.

Nicole is one of the greatest English teachers I ever had, but her class is a lot of work. I took the honors section with her, so thats why there was so much reading. She is a tough grader, but you can rewrite almost anything and shell take the better grade. A lot of busy work for homework, but she usually doesn't get mad if you forgot something.

FANTASTIC! Lectures were incredibly clear/understandable. He made a point to get to know us by name, and truly wanted to help each of us learn and succeed. Also, he made very kind accommodations for us during COVID-19, and sent daily update emails with motivation and advice for navigating the pandemic. I would definitely recommend/take it again.

Professor Matthew is such a caring professor!!! Make sure you talk to him after class so he gets to know you. He is smart and is a lawyer himself who works at the courthouse. Make sure you read the material and take good notes so you're ready for the class, and if he calls you out. The exams aren't bad if you show up to class and take good notes.

Take good notes on the chapter BEFORE class and you will be prepared if he calls on you to answer a question (for participation, 15% of the grade) and you also won't have to rush taking notes (he does not post his PPT). The class becomes WAY more manageable. You will also have to visit a court 1-3 times so plan your schedule carefully!
one of my favorite classes. he makes the class really interesting with his stories as a respected attorney. nice guy who really wants you to do well

Not an easy A but definetly well worth the class. Gedansky is a successful attorney and knows everything you'd ever want to know. He only teaches one section but you'd be privileged to take it. You have to read the book, go to lecture and really study to do well but it's information that you should really learn anyway

really nice guy and does his best to make lectures entertaining by adding in relevant things and videos here and there. Definitely have to spend a lot of time studying if you want to do well in the class. chapters in the book are so long, but you won't be able to pass without it; go to lecture, he says stuff that's not in the book that's on tests

Cindys amazing! One of the best professors Ive had at UConn for sure. You can tell she genuinely cares about her students, and put a a higher emphasis on learning than grades. Gives clear outlines of what she wants, and makes even the more boring lectures enjoyable.

Cynthia is fantastic. Perhaps the best professor I have ever had. Extremely helpful and knowledgeable. She is far more concerned with your learning than your ability to take a test. Great material, excellent lectures, learnt a lot!

Dr. Jones is a GREAT professor. She is extremely helpful and really wants the students to succeed in class as well as outside of the classroom setting. Her material is very clear and she is very clear on what is expected of you. You have to attend class and lab in order to do well. GREAT class and would take it again or any other class she teaches!
Great teacher, very helpful, TA is really nice, great group of people.

Good teacher who is interested in her subject. Exams are similar to 1107, only easier, and she offers a ton of extra credit. Someone interested in this subject should have no problem getting a B+ or A-
Good teacher. Class could get sort of boring but she was alright.

UConn needs to find a new professor to teach this class! Harrison forgets what he already said and repeats himself multiple times, doesn't know how to use the computer, lacks passion for the subject, and is a total snooze fest. When asked how he thinks we can make an actual difference with climate change he said "Honestly a dictatorship".

Do not take Professor Harrison. I was excited about this class, however he was unwilling to discuss climate change, or how we could affect environmental law. The only topics he was willing to discuss were env laws from 50 yrs ago. Env justice discussions were non-existent. We got no syllabus until weeks into class, and never got a grading rubric.

Do not take Professor Harrison. I was excited about this class, however he was unwilling to discuss climate change, or how we could affect environmental law. The only topics he was willing to discuss were env laws from 50 yrs ago. Env justice discussions were non-existent. We got no syllabus until weeks into class and never got a grading rubric.

Professor Harrison was not a good professor with COVID-19 pushing everything to hybrid. He failed to use Husky Blackboard, grading the class with one exam and an "extra credit". His lectures often repeated, and the only highlight was the guest speakers. He seems to generally care about his students, just not a beneficial professor.

Professor Harrison cares for his students. His lectures were at 8am, and his teaching style is mostly lectures so it can certainly be hard to stay engaged (and awake). However, he's more than happy to answer any questions people have if they get lost. He brings in many guest speakers, and will test you with 2-3 exams on everything taught in class.

Grade in class is based on 3 noncumulative exams, and he gives you the option to skip the last exam. He straight lectures the entire time (with no slides) so you have to show up to every class or get the notes. Overall a pretty easy class, but since he lectures from memory he sometimes forgets if he covered a topic or not. Has a lot of speakers.

Nice guy, really funny and caring. Class is relatively easy, however, he can't stay on topic for the life of him. Every other sentence is "you don't need to know this but.." or "this won't be on the exam but.." He is super passionate about the class which is admirable, but prepared to be somewhat bored with the tangents. Prepare on your own time.

I have never taken a course with Dr. Berkowitz before so I wasn't sure what to expect coming into this class. He is truly the nicest guy and cares about what his students are learning. He genuinely wants his class to be fun and interesting! He strongly encourages students to form their own opinions of what he talks about, which is awesome.

Loves to talk about anything that has to do with agricultural, tends to talk for too long sometimes, which makes lectures topics take longer then they should. Grades fair. P.S. if you take his Vegetable production class, be aware of him driving on the field trips. It could get a little sketchy sometimes.

Wonderful person and professor. Has a tendency to get off topic as he is very passionate about certain topics or may engage someone for a while, but is always willing to meet to go over topics if you need further explanations. Plan on spending most of your study time on definitions as the concepts were easy to grasp, but there is a lot of material.

Nice guy but can't keep on track. Don't take if you get frustrated with getting off topic and taking 3 weeks to cover 10-minute topics. That said he does a good job of showing both sides of every argument, which I respect a lot.

He is so passionate about the topics we go over in class and he loves sharing his knowledge with students. The stuff he teaches is actually interesting!! He cares a lot about all of his advisees too (helped me a bunch when i transferred here) I've taken a couple classes with him and the midterm/exam are rly easy too. Take his classes!!
Loved this class. It is super interesting and Prof Urban is super knowledgeable. Have to study for exams but they are not too difficult.

If you come across this professor and ever thought of enrolling in one of his classes, PLEASE DO! He is very caring and his lectures and slides don't contain a lot of words, yet he explains is straight forward! His exams are all multiple choice, and some of them are from the study guide. Probably one of the best professors I've had.
I took this class online this semester due to COVID and Professor Urban was amazing! As long as you keep up with the lectures and study you'll be okay.

Professor Urban is an absolute gem. His lectures are very enjoyable to watch and he is clearly very passionate and knowledgable about what he is teaching. The tests and assignments are very reasonable and it's clear he wants his students to do well. One of my fav professors I've had at uconn.

very nice, smart and extremely passionate about the topics discussed in class. he will make sure you know the material. his exams are mostly short sentence or essay style but if you study, you will be fine. he likes to synthesize concepts a lot. be prepared to do some work, but this class was very rewarding and you definitely learn a lot

Super nice guy, very smart and knows his field. However, his tests are really difficult, not because the material is challenging, but the format of the tests is just weird. Lots of "fill in the blanks" that require word for word memorization of long sentences. He also is confusing about some of the math material in the course (pop. dynamics).

Srivastava truly cares about his students and could sympathize with the fact that COVID-19 took away our senior year. He often gave advice for jobs/grad school and even organized an entire networking night for us after students expressed interest. Although disorganized, he wants everyone to succeed and dropped many assignments due to lack of time.

Taking this class was more worth it for the life advice than the actual course material. Professor Srivastava was super caring about the students and often pushed back deadlines and even organized a networking night for us. He's a genuinely great guy. The course was rather disorganized though and many assignments never happened. It's not too bad.
Nice guy but the class was very difficult.
I took chef analysis with him and he just wants his students to do well. He curves a lot and only gave 2 out of the 6 quizes he said he would. He offers extra credit too.
Great guy & good professor. Very busy schedule but is there to help when needed. Exams are hard, but manageable.
No Comments

Quite literally the last bastion of UConn's Game Design program. He may be strict in terms of participation and mutual respect, and the weekly projects can be very time-consuming, but he is overall very understanding and actively wants to help students learn. That last bit in particular is something Prof. [REDACTED] could learn a thing or two from.

Coltrain teaches well and gives clear assignments. The work is difficult but enjoyable and he is willing to work with students to arrange things as needed. He is a bit strict with his classes but he explains everything clearly from the start and isn't rude about it. He's very much worth having as a professor, I highly recommend his courses.
Had him for 2D Game Art. Easy grading, but lots and lots of homework, normally 15+ hours a week if not more. Nice and fun to talk to. Knowledgable, but gives no in-class work time.

Hands down one of the best professors I've had at uconn. Class requires a lot of work but he lets you know that from the beginning. Super easy grader and if you participate during the discussions (play the game, watch the movie and you're all set), you get an A in the class. Super funny and looked forward to going to all the meetings.

James is super chill. I had him for the DMD3010W writing course and it was his first time teaching it. The course is 3 papers, 2 of them are super short and the last on is like 10 pages. He gives you a bunch of time to work on everything though and theres really not much homework. He mostly just likes to talk about games or social media in class.

This was my second semester taking a course with Professor Coltrain, and I can safely say he's easily one of the best professors I've ever had. He is extremely passionate and knowledgeable, easygoing but authoritative, and goes out of his way to make sure he is in tune with how his students are doing. Top notch guy. Tall.

Writing with Algorithms was my abosolute favorite course ever! Prof. Booten introduced us to Python where we crafted computer-generated text (but no coding experience necessary). A perfect mix of creativity and coding. My final project was a collection of poems curated from various genres to see if genres promote different emotions for readers.

Intro to Digital Humanities was one of the most interesting courses I took during my time at UConn. Throughout the semester, we worked on a digital humanities "game" of our choice. We worked in a software called Twine, adding a fun technical element (but no prior coding experience necessary). And in viewing other students work, I learned so much!

Professor Booten is an inspirational writing professor. I enjoyed this class because Prof. Booten encouraged us to write about topics that we were interested in; for example, I wrote an essay detailing how diaristic writing is good for our minds. In addition, Prof. Booten provided strong feedback that made me think more deeply about my writing.

Prof Booten is such a sweetheart and is incredibly knowledgeable on computers and literature. His lectures always taught me something I never knew about, or made me think deeper about a particular cause. As long as you showed 100% honest effort, you'll definitely pass. TAKE HIM!!!
He's a pretty good first year writing professor who teaches you some actually good writing techniques. One thing I can say is, get ready for that 8AM seminar but that's not him teaching, its a lab.
