Distance Learning. Sessions are either lectures w/ breakout groups, or workshops. Units are Machine Reading, Making a Digital Archive, Reading like a Computer, and Text Generation. Coding knowledge NOT required. The units represent different ways of reading text. Sessions are twice a week, most assignments are due before class starts.
Really chill and friendly guy. Class was super easy and filled a history requirement. Lectures can be long but he tries to make it interesting.

Lectures can be boring, but easiest HIST class to fulfill the req. Only have to take 2 of 3 exams (SUPER EASY) and there's one "essay" at the end that's only 2.5 pages double spaced. Literally the easiest class I've taken. Like I said, lectures can be long, but he can be funny at times and he really knows what he's talking about. take this class!!

Professor was drop dead hilarious, made the 3 hours go by so quickly. Just have to show up and listen. Even if you don't take notes and just listen you'll get an A. (It's probably impossible to show up, listen and not get a B or above) 3 exams, 1 paper. Can only take 2 exams. Paper is only 2 pages. Great guy and lectures well.

He literally gives you the free textbook, so he is one of the best profs at UConn. His class is really easy IF you show up and take notes. You only have to take 2 out of three exams and write an essay to which you have basically two months to complete a 2-5 page essay and he gives feedback one time. Overall he is a good prof and I recommend him.

Exams are super easy IF YOU TAKE NOTES! Posts supplementary reading materials, but I never read one. 3 exams (only take 2), an essay, and participation make up your grade. Kavanaugh keeps things interesting and wants students to learn, not fail. You don't need to do anything but go to class, and take notes. Handwritten notes are allowed on exams.

Entire class was 3 600-750 word essays and a 2-3 min final presentation about one of those essays. Easier than many of my high school classes but prof. is very boring and just talks at you while he shows some videos. Take for easy history credit, especially if its just satisfying a content area.

I was disappointed when taking this class with Prof. Cheng. While he will try to work with you to succeed it seems at the same time his attendance policy is unfair and does not accommodate for students with disabilities. His expectations are unclear and leaves you in the dark about what will happen that day in class. Don't take him.

I'm a 4.0 student and got a B- in this class. Unclear expectations for grading, deadlines left off syllabus, leaves you constantly guessing and unprepared. 2 midterms, 1 final, 8 quizzes, and the rest is all group work. No excused absences unless you have COVID, even w a drs note. Leaves things out of lecture to confuse you about quiz material.

I'm a 4.0 student and got a B- in this class. Some profs seem like they want you to fail, he is one of them. Unclear syllabus leaves you constantly unprepared & confused. Unclear assignments & unclear grading criteria makes it difficult to understand expectations and impossible to succeed. No excused absences unless it was COVID, even with drs note

Interesting Professor but assignments can be rough. Quizzes are at the beginning of class which can get stressful. Took online, which was easier than in person I'm sure. Possible to do well, a lot of time and effort is needed. Nice professor and sometimes understanding, but is on the more challenging side.

Going to class was boring. You sit there waiting until he says that one important thing you need for assignments. The timing of his assignments is terrible and he does't give much guidance that you need. It's hard understanding him and he goes over things that don't really need elaboration

Very hard to understand (strong Chinese accent), but will repeat himself or write what he says on the board. MUST do the readings and read the textbook to do well on exams and 7 quizzes which are graded by the TAs not him! Group project at the end of the semester that was incredibly hard. Nobody knew what they were doing.

Rachel is by far one of the best math professors I have ever had. I really struggle with math and she explained everything so well that I am taking another calc class next semester for fun. Her lectures are clear and concise and her office hours for homework are really helpful. She has reviews before exams and will show you HOW to solve something

Very approachable and happy to answer questions outside of class. Lectures are concise and teach you exactly what you need to know. I really appreciated the grading system (final is broken into three parts and each part can replace your midterm grade if you did better on the final). She's a really kind teacher, and I couldn't recommend her more

Back from my Calc 3 post to say Rachel is like, the best math professor I have ever had. Her lectures are really good, so I would go if I were you. She makes her own lectures and uploads them so you don't need to read the book. She gives you opportunity to show growth in your learning. If you can, take this class with her!

This is definitely one of the best professors I've had, if not the best at UConn. She is very thoughtful towards her students and wants them to learn and succeed. She conveys info extremely well with lots of examples. During office hours she takes time to help individually and make sure you understand the content. Overall amazing professor.

Possibly the best math teacher I have had while at UConn and definitely a top 3 of my academic career. She is very understanding with grading. She explains problems very well, and she is extremely helpful whether it be over emails or for in person office hours. I am taking a different math class this semester and I made sure to get her. Fantastic!
She really helped me understand stuff, so make sure to go to her office hours. She is so sweet and very smart, I loved having her as my TA, and I will be seeing her in Differential Equations!

Favorite professor. So nice and smart, always responded to my emails. Very approachable and class was so interesting. Not a ton of work but when assignments are due you need to put in effort. Overall, one of the best professors I have ever had.

Food and Race was honestly my favorite class ever. She is extremely knowledgeable and conceptual. She cares about her students and is reasonable (i.e. understands some absences). This was class was so interesting! Definitely a lot of writing, but as long as you go to class and participate a lot, she grades fairly and considers your overall effort.

Her slides are very general so attending class is a good idea. It's a pretty fair intro class with a lot of extra credit and a few map quizzes. 3 exams that are challenging but if you attend class and study for the map quizzes, it's not a hard class. Book isn't really needed

More work than some of the other general education classes, and the material is not traditional geography which made me sad at first. Only a few easy papers, and the exams which are slightly challenging. Need to read the textbook, it saved me in this class (her slides don't cover everything).
Only okay class, professor does not teach that well. Did a lot of the work on my own, would not have gone to class except for the participation grade. Has an interesting Southern accent though.

Class is okay, but she goes through the material extremely fast, so most of the studying and learning must be done outside of class. You must use the textbook and she reads from it pretty much word for word in lecture. But attendence is required for participation grade.
Worst professor I have had by far. I am a Psych major and he is so unhelpful. I've gone into office hours and he doesn't help. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS
I think he's a decent prof. He is not a native English speaker, so he is occasionally difficult to understand, but reading the textbook clears up any confusion.

His class can be very interesting at times but its extremely difficult. most difficult psych class ive taken so far. OFFICE HOURS ARE SO HELPFUL!! clears up so much confusion and he practically gives you the answers! he's a very nice person but his class is definitely a challenge

He is so confusing and it is so difficult to focus and pay attention. His class average on the first test was a D and wouldn't curve. He takes attendance only on Friday classes. He also has socratic hours where he randomly calls on people to answer questions in front of the class, which is 10% of your grade. He is a nice guy, but not a teacher.

DONT TAKE THIS CLASS. the teacher is so confusing and makes the material so much harder then it has to be. He does not write correct sentences in his powerpoints and makes it very confusing to understand what he is trying to say. He takes attendance on Friday classes. The class is so boring I fall asleep every single time I go.
Does anybody find him makes the material harder to understand? Or its just me?
Really honest grader but seriously so helpful. Learned a lot and had fun doing so. Take him, and take his comments on your work seriously.

I thought he was so tough at the beginning but he helped me throughout the semester so now I am well prepared for higher level writing classes. Got A- and started to like academic writing. Highly recommended!!! Take him if you can.
As the other comments have said, Shawn is a very tough grader. Even though in the long run it will be beneficial, it was almost too much compared to the standards of other professors.
tough grader, but really helpful
One of the toughest graders you would have ever seen.

He is a pretty tough essay grader for the standards of freshmen english. However, he is a great teacher and is willing to help you along the way. An A is possible, but you need to be ready to put in the work starting from the first essay.

Avoid Mike Joseph at all costs. A relatively easy topic was made incredibly difficult by his inadequate and extremely awkward teaching style. Teaches in the form of "guided notes," which frankly give the perfect excuse to not pay attention in class, only following along when there are examples. Notes done in class aren't even helpful towards exams.

Michael's a great teacher and truly tries his hardest to help his students learn. I took his Multivariable Class and got an easy A, and it was pretty easy to understand after going to his class. Make sure you don't skip class, he goes over every type of problem that he could possibly give, and I think that's really helpful. Overall he's a 8.5/10 :)

Super easy class, 2 exams and a final all 3 had bonus questions in addition to extra credit assignments. One homework assignment a week and you have a week to do it. He's a super awkward professor and his explanations aren't always very helpful, but the material is straightforward enough that it doesn't really matter. Easy A.
This guy is a sav and a half

By far the worst math teacher I have ever had. He simply does not know how to teach. He can't answer half the examples he puts on the board and is beyond unclear in his explanations. To be honest, I find it ridiculous that UConn has this guy teach classes.

I had him for my discussion section. This guy is a stooge half the time he didn't know how to solve problems and even talk down to students that questioned him. I almost feel bad because he was clearly nervous teaching in front of a class. he shouldn't be teaching

If you have never taken physics before than this may not be the best class to start it with because it will be very confusing. This class is very easy for those who have taken physics before though. Once you get used to him, it's pretty easy. I averaged a 76 on the exams but I got an A- in the class. Make sure that you ever miss lab, it helps a lot

Pease is not nearly as bad as people are saying! His biggest fault is that he is a tad unorganised but all physicists are! study lecture notes, read text, do practice tests=A. do the hmwk problems ff u need Xtra practic. He's easy to aproach, tries his BEST to help students, + gives good critiques! Go to class otherwise you'll mis anounced quizes.

try to share the textbook w/ a classmate and have study partners, it really helps. I always got C's on quizzes, but A-/B+ on exams. But an A in the course. He curves alot for the class b/c I know people who did not do well on quizzes/exams and still got A's in the class. Overall, easy A class that u have to put work into if you want to feel secure.
Averaged a c- on his tests and ended up getting an A in the class. Have to study a bit for tests but he gives take home tests that allow you to get 100s on quizzes not a bad class at all.

Professor Pease seems to be approachable, but he has a very disorganized and confusing style of teaching. If you want to get anything out of the class, you're going to have to read through the book and watch out for anything in his lectures that aren't in it. But the class itself is easy when you get that down.

I'm sure this has been said many times by many people, but he was the WORST professor I have ever had. Completely incomprehensible and has stuttering problem. He knows what hes talking about he just can't put it into words and teach it properly. Avoid at all costs.

This class was very disorganized and lecture was kind of useless to go to. The two exams were open-note and open-book, which made the class pretty easy. She grades easily but I have no idea what she was talking about every lecture. Very sweet lady and understanding.

On top of teaching the most incomprehensible and unorganized class I've taken in my entire academic career, Dr. Li proceeded to double (from 35 to 70%) the weight of the final exam without any warning, later stating that she felt the class averages were too high prior to the exam. I feel that should speak for itself.

Don't take her unless 100% unavoidable. Ignore other comments- worst professor I've ever had. Hard to understand, slides and answer keys make no sense and have many mistakes, tests ask obscure questions unrelated to homeworks. Grades based off whether she "recognizes" your name or not- if not, you will get a B- regardless of class performance.

Dr. Li 's classes are incredibly easy. As long as you turn something in she will give you full credit for the most part. She gives everyone either 90% or 100% on all exams unless you don't put anything down. She is kind and is happy to answer any questions. Her accent is certainly thick, but you get used to it. Super easy class, no reason to fail.

This was perhaps the easiest class I've ever taken (including high school). You'll have 4-5 homeworks and one eight question midterm. I am not kidding when I say that everyone in the class got 100% on the midterm and final. This class is interesting and basically a grade booster.

Her accent is something you will have to get used to. She mentions what will be on the exam and all the work in the class is easy. She sparked my interest for micro Bio and is very considerate of the students. The book wasn't need and you will do fine if you look at her slides and explanations from class. Just make sure to go.

You will end up wishing to stay much longer in her class and waiting for the next session when is over. English classes are not my favorite ones, however she successfully made it so beneficial. She is Funny and Funny and Funny and easy professor to deal with. The assignments are reasonable. I highly recommend to take her exciting courses.
She is awesome, I definitely recommend her! Really nice, interesting topics, easy to talk to, funny, and explains everything very well.
She is a really nice professor.

Most comfortable class situation ever. Respects class opinions and struggles as the semester progresses. Very flexible and personable. Fun prof. to have and be around. Highly recommended. Workload for W course is a bit much, but she is very understanding about packed schedules and such.

Rebecca is a nice lady, she's helpful and she let's the class make decisions before assigning exams and papers and such. She's a fairly tough grader but she let's you revise a couple of papers which was good and the peer editing groups are pretty beneficial. Go to class and do the reading. I didn't read one book and she knew, she trashed my paper
a graduate student for the freshman writing program. beware of the feminist theme that goes on all semester!! you will write a lot but peer editing groups are really helpful.

Objectively, sometimes the material is dry but Prof. Munroe does a great job engaging it in a way that's entertaining. Also, if you miss a lecture, all her material is covered on her lecture sheets which is all that is on the exams. Other than those, there are 3 short papers. if you attend lecture, you should pass with flying colors.

Wonderful woman and professor! She hands out notes for each lecture at the beginning of class, the exams are based entirely off of the notes and what she says in lecture. She also says EXACTLY what she expects on each assignment. Put in the effort of going to class and getting an A is easy!
A wonderful person and very nice to talk to

Natalie is the most adorable human being in the world! She is so sweet and passionate about anthropology, which makes learning it a lot easier. She is out there to help her students, and very understanding. She passes out notes before class, which is really nice! Test information comes straight from the notes she passes out!

I really like her. She is extremely nice. She prints out the notes and gives them at the beginning of class so you can just listen. No textbook was a plus. There were readings on huskyCT which werent really necessary. She really cares about her students, and I have NEVER said that about another professor.

I felt like I was actually learning things in her classes instead of just memorizing. She always has office hours and even open lab hours for zooarchaeology so that you can get extra help and have extra time to study.

Took the class because I thought it was interesting. She chose some really good reading material. Enjoyed the class since she made lectures very interesting and structure of syllabus was straightforward. Reasonable grader but it's a W so intensive reading and writing. Overall, pretty memorable experience. Wish I could take more classes like it.

My freshman English experience with Eleanor was amazing! She is smart and witty and I always looked forward to going to her class! If you have the chance to take a class with Eleanor... DO IT! You miss learn so much and better your writing in ways you can't imagine.

She is really sweet and wants you to do your best! The only problem is if you don't revise enough you get a lower grade but other than that she is really nice and super informatie! She keeps class interesting and fun and lets us work in groups for peer review and everything! I loved 1011 with Professor Reeds!!

Eleanor was one of my favorite professors that i've had at UConn. She made the freshman english class interesting and intriguing and she was very available outside of class. She wants everyone to succeed and she is a reasonable, but tough freshman english teacher.

She really wanted everyone to do well in the class. However, her discussions were unorganized and the class dragged on. There was a lot of readingessays so that was pretty annoying, but she'll proofread your essay before the due date. I felt like I found myself working on an essay a majority of my weekends. I hate English so this class was brutal.
She is very serious about her content and cares about students. Not the easiest grader but this is a class that you can actually learn a lot. Do work and you will get an A.

She is a very good writing teacher that gives very useful feedbacks on essays and if you listen to her and take her advice seriously, you will get a good grade. If you put effort into the class you will get a good grade and improve your writing. She is a very nice person but she does give a lot of assignments and longer essays, for the most part.

Melissa is best professor I've ever had. She's so accessible and helpful after class, and the grade is not that bad. I felt it was pretty reasonable, and the feedback is very detailed. She cares about her students. Most importantly, her topics are so much fun.
Don't take any class with this professor. Very biased liberal. Grades extremely hard and is very picky with writing. She gives good feedback of drafts you turn in, but the workload is ridiculous.

As a math major taking an English class, all I can say is... I can still quote Shakespeare off the top of my head. I found it interesting that they sat in the middle of the class guiding us through the readings but it was very effective and made the class fun.

While she can be funny, her lectures are mostly calling on random students when you are not raising your hand to discuss the material. The assignments are harshly graded, and it did not seem like she cared whether students passed or failed her class. She also has a tendency to run class until the last minute and try to keep people after class too.

I loved having her as a professor, she's super nice and the discussions were very interesting. It was super easy to keep a good grade in the class, just show up and participate in the discussion. The course I took wasn't a W course (there wasn't another option for me to click) but we still had a 10 page paper as our final and she's an easy grader.
She is overall a very nice women. An extremely harsh grader, you can do all the work, go to all the classes, participate and unfortunately still be left with an insulting grade.

Easy class if you do the work. Directions can be unclear but overall not too hard to maintain a good grade. Lectures were asynchronous and relatively short and easy to follow. Weekly readings but they are needed for the final paper and 5 short assignments. Overall good professor who is understanding and grades fairly.

Doesn't give helpful feedback on papers, and doesn't work with you to meet in the middle. From my experience with her grading, she doesn't give 100s on papers and always finds something to complain about. Her grading is harsh and she knocks off huge points for nonsense. Also expected me to add 5 more authors after each rough draft...

This professor was alright. She taught the first half of the class. I didn't start doing well in the class until Professor Spurling came along half way. You have to meet with your TA and really study for the quizzes. The information is unexpected that they expect you to know unless you ask. You can't just look at the slides.
Her lectures were somewhat interesting. Her exams and quizzes were hard but not impossible. Must go to class and pay attention. You really have to know your stuff for the exams. Overall, she was OK.

She is a good professor! Lectures can be kind of boring, but she teaches well. Exams are lectured based so go to class instead of wasting time reading the textbook. Tests are not multiple choice. Need to know how to problem solve. She doesn't try to trick you on exams, but they are difficult. You really need to pay attention in class/discussion

She is a very intelligent and nice lady. I enjoyed hearing her lectures. I thought her exam materials were a little unfair. They were MUCH harder than she made it seem like it would be. Some of it was also poorly written. I liked her as a professor but I wouldn't be eager to take another one of her courses. Mike L. was a great TA - HIGHLY suggest

She's very nice and seems dedicated to the class but I feel like she didn't explain things that well. Quizzes and tests are not multiple choice and study guides don't really help. They are pretty hard. Professors switch halfway through the class and I did much better in the second half with a different professor.
He is good professor he like to help student and always is available for question
Really really good guy. I haven't had much luck with the LING dept at central but he is genuinely a great professor and truly cares about his students
Alex is a nice guy but he has no idea how to teach to an English speaking crowd. I could barely understand him, never mind learn from him. You cant say he doesn't try though.

Vaxman was my TA for LING 1020 and now 1030. I think he has good intentions. He tries to be helpful, but i don't think people in the discussions actually understand what he is saying. But even with the confusion his discussion is definitely an easy A or at least B. Just go to class and take his quiz or hand in the homework and you should do fine.
extremely unclear

professors.name: Fei Miao
professors.department: computer science and electrical engineering department

reviews.review: Fei teaches from recycled slides and runs through concepts of machine learning with very little reinforcement learning or depth. Slides with one or two rather unconventional notations of equations and rarely ever shows any derivation or examples of that statistical representations of the models. I learned more through open source online courses.
Terrible professor. Would not recommend it. Complicates easy material. Copies assignments from UPenn grad courses. You can get this online for free and better.

Course was challenging, but not hard to do well in. The exams were taken at home and we were given a day to complete them so it was not bad at all. They mirrored the homework assignments. The professor also responded to questions quickly.
The review sessions before exams are very helpful, plan to attend. Very clear answers and feedbacks you can get for all the questions asked during class and office hour.

The machine learning course is not easy, includes some math concepts, but worth the effort. You will learn a lot after the lectures. The homework and exam problems are very relevant, so if you attend the lectures that give hints to homework and review lectures before the exams, you should be good.

Best professor I've had thus far. I've had her for 2600 and 3509. She is a very easy grader, and she teaches very well. Readings are always manageable and appropriate. She is very intelligent and leads great discussions about the plays and novels discussed. I recommend her to anyone who's taking an English class.

Pretty good teacher. Genuinely knows what she is talking about. Interesting plays to read and extensive conversations in class as well as skits, an essay, a midterm and a final. Cares for students and may even allow you to turn in work late.
Murphy is SO GOOD AT WHAT SHE DOES. She loves English and doesn't just pick random books, she is really into the books that she chooses.
understanding, fair grader, book choice can be boring, straight forward assignments, exams can be hard.
Understanding, explains things well, book choice can be boring at times, fair grader, projects can be tricky but mostly straight forward.

Chris a great teacher. Class structure is not very serious, which is awesome, and still somehow we learn and understood some of the most important real world events. Gov Comm was a great W- I highly recommend it with him!
Kowal is definetely a fun professor, and you will learn if you are willing to. Personally, I think hes a pushover and allows students to slack off and not meet their deadlines.

Mr. Kowal a.k.a. BOWTIE is the best comm teacher at UConn. Take his 105 class and any others he teaches. Very approachable and wants you to do well. Be nice to him and he will be more than nice back. Fair grader as well.

Best comm teacher ever... If u have to take public speaking take it with Chris, he wants students to do well and is always willing to help. He is a fair grader and really tries to interact with everyone!

No one wants to take a public speaking course but if you do try and get this guy! He is the best. He's a great teacher and easy grader. He is really funny and will always give you more time to do something if you need it. He's hilarious and will usually spend at least a half hour out of each class just wasting time telling funny stories.

Class was mostly memorizing a bunch of different systems and how it worked, not much you can do in terms of teaching. But Dr. Yao does make things very clear in this slides. He also records lectures which is helpful. Practice exams are also good. He adjusts exams based on how the class is doing and there is also a curve!

Slides are good but lectures are incredibly boring. Attendance not mandatory but its very hard to get an A without extra credit quizzes in class. Exams are very specific, he basically expects you to memorize slides, but reading through them carefully 10 times with textbook as reference usually is good enough. Doing well in lab + ec is important.

The lectures were confusing, disorganized, and hard to follow. The exams were mostly MC and sometimes unclear. Grades for the open-ended portion of the exams took a long time. You can earn 5% extra credit just for doing stuff like homework and quizzes, which really helps.

Pretty awful professor. Lectures were boring, via blackboard collaborate since the semester was online. His slides consisted mainly of figures taken from the textbook and don't help at all. He doesn't speak well, contradicts himself, is confusing, etc. Many exam questions are grammatically/mathematically incorrect and he takes forever to grade.
final exam is acs impossible to study for

Dave is an awesome professor. He shows empathy towards students and goes out of his way to make complex topics interesting with his energetic lectures. He's straight up about what's expected on homework and exams, and is transparent with grading. In general he just has a really positive attitude, and it helps foster a good classroom environment.

He is a good professor with the ability to make hard concepts seem less intimidating. His lectures and code files are really precious materials for self-study. You may need to read a lot and do a couple of practice to get an A, but I think it is worth the effort.

Very friendly and helpful. If you pay attention to lecture videos, HWs is very doable. Exam was very fair + 1 group project. He really is not trying to trick you, anything he asks you should know from lecture or just a bit of research. I was scared to take an R class, I had no coding experience, but he has made it a very positive experience.

Dr. Dave is an excellent professor. He does a great job going thru lessons on R & making things easy to understand. I'm someone who had no experience with coding, & I was able to do well & get an A. As long as you put in the time, watch his lectures, & practice R then you will do well! You are graded on weekly assignments, midterm & 1 group project

He might be good at coding, but definitely not good at teaching. When we ask question in-class, he said "Google it when you have question." Also, the material he teaches is so easily, but the homework is extremely difficult and not what you have learned from his class.

This class was really interesting, but it was a lot of work for a gen ed. It wasn't hard, but I put a lot of time into it. This class was mostly memorizing, so if you put your time in, you'll be fine. Lucas is super nice, but if you aren't interested in the subject, you'll probably find his lectures to be pretty dry. Tests can get very specific.

This class was great and the TA's were extremely helpful. There are 3 exams and weekly quizzes. The quizzes were not too hard but you have to prepare for them. The exams were the same as the quizzes but longer. Lots of memorization! Lectures are interesting but he posts everything online. He only asks a few questions from the book on the exam.

Proctor is a pretty cool guy and the TAs for this class are funny and informative. The class gives one quiz per week based off lecture slides. Most of the time they're easy but everyone once in a while one can be a little challenging; his exams are the same just bigger. You don't need to go to lecture, but they're actually pretty interesting.

Lectures a lot and there are quizzes every discussion, but they aren't too hard. He posts all of the lecture slides but I'd recommend still going. Exams aren't too bad either but they were 100% memorization. Overall good class and prof.

Lecture can be a bit slow, if you have some background knowledge in the field. The class is a do-your-work attitude. Instructor is helpful for assisting with assignments if you are unsure of what is expected. Would recommend. Attendance is expected, so this is not a class that you should skip.

On a personal level she's fine and somewhat nice but professionally it is a disaster. As others have stated the entire course was student taught. She's a pretty easy grader most of the time but she's also super inconsistent with the grades she gives for the same level of work. She also provides absolutely no feedback on work. Don't take her class.

Professor Lujan had students teach every class - which were twice a week for a half hour rather than the scheduled three times a week for an hour and 15 minutes. Her heart is in the right place, she cares about students, and she is very passionate but not the greatest professor. Super super easy A, but you will learn next to nothing.

avoid at all costs unless you want to have an absolutely miserable semester that is 100% self-taught/peer-taught with the laziest professor youve ever had. I got an A and I still *hated* the experience of being in her class. worst professor I've had at uconn by far.

Professor Lujan wants her students to succeed, however class can be a little difficult because she sometimes skips portions of the power point and doesn't always explain things very well. With that said, if you're willing to put the work in you should do fine.

Rating her before the semester ends to save other people from her. She makes the students teach the entire course. She has not taught us anything at all. Every single class it is a student teaching the lesson for her that they have to come up with all on their own. To say she's a professor is not even accurate because she doesn't teach at all.

Dr. Loza grades completely arbitrarily and was extremely disorganized during my time in her course. Her due dates on the syllabus often conflicted with the due dates listed in HuskyCT (Blackboard). When contacted for clarifying questions about assignments, multiple times she responded after the due dates had passed. Would never recommend.
Keep up with the work and reach out for help if you need it.

This is an asynchronous class so you need to be very self sufficient. The materials and resources are all there and Professor Loza is accessible if you want extra help. She is kind, caring, and willing to support you, if you ask. Also, if you are not that interested in educational research, this class would not be for you.

Dr. Loza is an amazing, understanding professor and really helped me through this difficult class. Even though the course was difficult she spent a lot of time helping me, despite her family. Overall, I would not say she is a hard grader and she is truly a great professor.

Dr. Loza does not truly care about her students' success. She does not grade based on content of assignments and is a harsh grader. Dr. Loza does not communicate with her students effectively and ignores requests and emails being sent to her. It is as if students should already be familiar with the content before even learning it. Do not recommend.

Avoid taking this course with Prof. Hurley. The first 10 lectures were devoid of any substantial instruction. The only tangible material was in a few presentations which he sped through. Rest of the time was him rambling about irrelevant info. Struggled through the midterm by teaching myself. Got an A by putting in substantial time outside class.

He is a great guy but it's pretty obvious he struggles. The class material is determined by some course co-ordinater in Storrs and he has little control over how the class is taught. 3 Exams, 25% EACH. For 75% of your grade. Class used mcgraw connect which sucks but overall if you put in a good amount of work, you should be alright.

I learned 0 things from Professor Hurley, he spent entire lectures talking about how smart he is and how dumb is grad students are. Exams were take home but that didn't really help. Had to get help from my dad who (an auditor) to actually understand any of the material.

Really funny and interesting professor. I had him for my summer class and although it was four hours long must times he let us out early. He gets off track very easily he has weird stories and is a nice break from accounting. Both exams were take home, he wants you to take advantage of class time and take your time with exams.

He is a very interesting professor and certainly not boring at all. His classes are very engaging but you don't learn much of the material. I have had 2 classes with him and the main thing you get from him is great real world stories. Note that you should be very diligent with the papers he assigns. Bad writers are a pet peve - can subjectively

Her previous job was a CS professor at Georgia State University. And her ratings were no better before she left. She ended with a 2.9 on the rating scale before moving to this school in the past year. I wouldn't take this professor!

*CSE2500* I'm not sure what all the negative comments are for, but she was a really good professor. She explained the content clearly, gave plenty of practice and time to understand in class, and allowed cheat sheets on all of the exams. It's not a hard class.

There are a lot of homework assignments, as well as activities in the lab. You are trying to complete your homework rather than understanding the subject. There is no such thing as extension. The course is online. It has a very heavy curriculum for a 3-credit course. Also, the tests are very difficult, but luckily TA helps a lot!

Absolute worst professor ever. All assignments were on a ebook. Typically there is one chapter due per week and it is incredibly work dense. The labs are impossibly difficult since they is zero guidance and you are given an objective with the lack of many resources. Prepare to do some harm to your mental health.

This class is taught asynchronously using an online textbook program with a lab/discussion meeting once a week run by a TA. I had to take this class for my major but I would not recommend it. The material can be difficult to understand and it's very easy to fall behind so make sure you're in a group chat with students in the class and good luck.

Most of the other ratings are pretty fair, Erik doesn't really seem to put all that much sweat into his class, but he is very straightforward with what he wants out of the students. He is flexible with moving dates if needed, as well as making exceptions for students that cannot make the exams. Overall, the class is easy if you can self teach.

Did not teach. Lectured directly from the book. Exams are more conceptual than doing actual math. Lazy doesn't give any supplemental help outside of lectures that are not posted anywhere. Says he is too tired or busy to make study guides.

Erik has an unrivaled amount of passion for mathematics, he will try to make you understand the theory behind differential equations and you won't understand it. By utilizing resources like office hours this class is more than doable, but I feel I have learned much less than other classes. Instead memorize a few ODE solving methods for each exam.

You can tell Wendt didn't care about the class. He never gave us a practice exam for ANY exams, even the final, didn't write his own notes and never answered emailed. Genuinely the laziest teacher I've ever had, I had to teach myself everything. Says hes 'too busy/doesn't feel like it to do the bare minimum, like giving us practice problems.

Avoid this teacher. He understands the class material well but does not know how to teach it effectively. Class time was spent writing textbook jargon on the board instead of showing us examples. He did not provide us with practice problems to prepare for exams because he "doesn't have time." He did not dedicate much time to this class at all.

It is apparent that Erik doesn't dedicate much time to his class. Study guides for exams are practically non-existent, as he is "too busy" to create one or an answer key. He doesn't post his lecture notes online. Lectures are jargon heavy, and I found myself teaching myself a lot from the book. 2 midterms, 4 quizzes, and a final.

Great class, Professor doesn't even show up much, its mainly the TAs who are amazing, the nature of class is a lab every other week which is significantly less lab reports than a typical lab class and the material is easy. If you are confused just ask questions the TAs help a TON.
Graded on just two take home exams and homework, so you didn't really need to goto or understand anything from lecture

This summer I took ECE 3111 with Prof Dutta. His speech can be a bit blunt which might prevent others from wanting to ask questions, but he wants us all to do well and gives ample time for his online exams. All in all, I think he is a good professor. To get a solid A, you will probably need to buy the textbook.

Took the class during summer session 1. Homeworks are difficult. However, the exams are easier compare to the homework. The professor also gives practice exams which are very similar to the real exams. Go through the practice and you'll be fine.

Not the worst professor, not the best. Class itself was enjoyable, material is not terribly difficult. Professor can be a bit arrogant, but wants you to learn and engage with the material. Will call you out however, if he knows your name and will ask you what you learned in prereq classes. Not afraid to call you out if you don't know something

Grade:20%HW, 20%Project,30% midterm,30% final. HW is trivial, and TA gave full points on the project just for doing it. He gives practice exams and will be covered on each exam. Teaches the material well, and teaches it from the beginning so you can understand it even if you come in with no knowledge/are dumb.

Darby is the kindest, most caring instructor I could ever imagine. The class is super easy, and she makes it even easier on students. She grades based on your level and is very clear about how to get an A. Her priority is your mental health and your understanding of English, that's it!

Great class and professor! There are 3 projects for the semester and you are walked through them a lot, and given a lot of group feedback. If you do everything you automatically get a B with optional assignments to get an A. This was an easy class but also a lot of fun and you do learn too. A lot of group work too.
Sweetest human alive. So caring and very concerned with her students well-being. The class only has work about once a week and she is always willing to offer extensions.
She is really sweet and understanding, often extends due dates for major projects. I absolutely recommend Darby if you arent the best writer but are willing to try your best!

Darby is so lovely. Her classes are small and personal, and she has a very nice dog who she shows pictures of. She's very open and cares about her students and their interests. There are a number of writing assignments but they are all easy. She meets with you after rough drafts to make sure you get the best grade possible. Just great.
Super nice and understanding

I loved this class and Nikole so much. Her lectures are so interesting and engaging and she posts the slides. There are weekly quizzes which are easy and so were the 3 exams and everything is open note. She is great to work with and I really recommend her and this course.
Nicest professor I have ever had. Tests and quizzes are easy and open note. She gives multiple extra credit opportunities which don't take long.

She is an absolute sweetheart. She cares about student's opinions, answers all of our questions and emails back. The exams aren't bad, but you do have to study the material. There are weekly quizzes that only consist of a few questions, and she drops the lowest score and offers multiple extra credit options throughout the semester.

nikole has been my favorite prof so far. her class is genuinely interesting and she's very passionate about slhs. there are no hw assignments. there are online quizzes each week, but they are 3 questions and open-note. her tests are also online and open-note. she offers a LOT of extra credit. this class is an easy A if you keep up with the quizzes

Nikole is a very nice professor, and class is not mandatory, but you are graded on very few things. There is a weekly quiz each week that is open note and a few exams. You would think the exams and quizzes would be easy because they are open note, but she makes the questions incredibly confusing and there are a lot of trick questions.

She is super kind, and teaches at a very good pace. Her exams and quizzes are open note and online, and all of the questions are on her slides. If you attend lecture and listen to her, the quizzes each week are so easy.

Hailey is the best! She made ENGL 1007 really fun and interesting, which is not an easy thing to do. She is very passionate and clearly cares about all of her students. She is also so easy to talk to and I was never worried about grades in her class. Would highly recommend :)
Hailey is the GOAT!!! She cares about her students, always willing to help you. She has no problems giving extra time for assignments. If you take ENGL 1007, you should definitely take it with her.
The class was super easy. She doesn't care about late work so as long as you do it and turn it in, you'll get full credit. The work was manageable, could be done last minute and still get a 100%.
Hailey is the best professor I have ever had. She is so understanding with everything, and is so easy to talk to. I would highly recommend taking her because she makes the class so fun.
Hailey is one of my favorite teachers at UConn. She is amazingly heartfelt and keeps it real. I thoroughly enjoyed her class and how she taught it. Would absolutely take it again.

Hailey is a boss!!!!! I loved taking this class with them, she was so chill, such an easy grader, and had the cutest Google Slides every single class. Very honored to be her first reviewer! If any rising freshman are reading this, try and get Hailey for ENGL 1007 - you won't regret it :))

Hikel is a very nice and easy going professor. I barely did any work in my class, as it was more "let's watch videos/listen to guest speakers and discuss life" as opposed to textbook learning and lectures . Do all the homework (which is not much) and write a thoughtful essay and it is an easy A. Definitely recommend Hikel for an elective.

Professor Hikel is the nicest professor you'll meet. He genuinely cares for his students and wants to see their success in the classroom and in life. He will go out of his way to help you and to prepare you for your future in the real world. His criminology class was interesting as he shed light on the broken american criminal justice system.

Professor Hikel is the most genuine professor I have ever had in my four years at UConn. He is incredibly kind, understanding, and sees and respects students as adults. He is very clear about his expectations for the course, and he wants every single person to do well. The course work is not overly challenging because he makes everything clear cut

nicest professor I've ever had, wants every student to get an A. lectures are boring but easy A for a W course. Extremely helpful and really tries to get involvement from the class. Definitely recommend, great guy.

Easy W course, but prepared for the most boring class of your life. I would say I did not learn anything new in this class. We go on a "field trip" to cultural center once a week. No need to buy the textbook, because he reads everything out of it. Great guy, good intentions, terrible teacher. One 10 page paper.
Excellent professor. Probably one of the best math professors at UConn--if you struggle with math, she'll help you succeed.
Best teacher I have ever had!!! She Is so kind and easy to understand. I am not a math person and she made the class so easy. You MUST have her as a teacher.

This woman is possibly the nicest person I've ever met. Absolute doll, very easy to understand. Also very understanding and helpful. I hate math but I really do like this professor. I wish every teacher was like her.

She is the best professor I've had at Uconn! I loved her! I really do not enjoy math and she explained things so so well!!! I got an A in the class She was extremely kind and always helpful and considerate. Professors like her deserve a big raise. Take Math 1030Q with her! I'm so lucky I ended up with her!

I had her a few semesters ago but the class was fairly simple and I'm horrible at math. I also really liked how she taught, it reminded me of my middle or high school math classes so it made learning easier than the confusing TA's who barely speak english and just confuse you more. If you go to class and pay attention you'll do well

She is one of the best professors here. Her assignments and projects are very straightforward and if you are confused or need any help, she is there to support and provide ideas to help you. The course itself isn't the most satisfying but with her teaching it, she makes it tolerable, and I loved that.

Carly is hands-down the best professor I've had. She is easy to reach, flexible with deadlines, and she is lenient on grading. She gives out clear instructions for the super easy assignments and always lets us leave early. Extremely understanding and a great person overall.

This was Carly's first semester of teaching and I think she did wonderfully. She was very honest with us about unnecessary materials in the syllabus and was understanding about late work, as long as you communicated with her. She's also just a lovely person to talk to; she's very friendly while maintaining the professionalism of a prof.
Love Carly! She's the absolute best. She is super understanding and gives clear and helpful feedback. Her class is pretty understanding and she tries to make it relatable. Definitely take her class!

Carly is one of my favorites! She gives engaging lectures and is always willing to tailor the discussion to our interests. She provides prompt and thorough feedback on all assignments, and lets us redo or edit things for a higher grade. She's always happy to meet during office hours or respond to email questions. Definitely take her course!!!!

PK does a lot to make sure you do good in the class. If you come to class he gives a lot of extra credit and if you attend things outside of class you get extra credit too. Even if you don't know what you're doing he'll help and make sure you know what you'red doing.

Kumavor is a great professor as long as you attend all of the lectures and labs. His lectures are very slow and can be boring, and he is a tough grader when it comes to the homeworks and final project. Many students didn't show up to lecture, and Kumavor took it out on the students by grading extra harsh on the final project and test.

Professor Kumavor is an excellent instructor. He's extremely caring, understanding and wants all of his students to succeed. One of the most down to earth professors I've met. Grading is based off powerpoint presentations given in class, homework (all due at the end of the semester), and a final project where you conceptually develop a sensor.

Prof Kumavor was very understanding during these hard times. He treated the class as a free-be, and wanted everyone to get an A. I probs put 20 hrs total into this class and ended with above an A. Cared about the students and was super nice. I doubt most of his classes are this easy, but hes super friendly and wants his students to succeed

He's super helpful with the class on anything you may have problems with. He really wants everyone to get an A and if you show up and do the work, you should be able to. He's one of the most approachable and nicest professors at Uconn.

He is a good lecturer that is very passionate in what he teaches and you can tell he wants students to learn too. The class is 25% HW, 25% midterm, and 50% final. The exams were very fair and were closely aligned with the homeworks, so as long as you do those and look over his slides, you should be fine.

Pre-recorded lectures that can be long with simple quizzes. Assignments/discussions are easy but may be time consuming, have to search around book/online to do the HW but not bad. Weekly modules are very organized and clear of what you need to do. Exam is fair if you study. There's a lot of content but he is very fair and responsive. Fast grader.

He's extremely well versed in the topics of the course as well as the application of those topics. He expects his students to work hard but is very fair in the grading. His class is not easy but it is certainly worth attending and is very interesting. Overall great teacher!

Dr. Aindow is one of the best professors in the materials department. His exams are thorough, but incredibly fair, and based on the lecture slides he posts online. He will always take time to help a student, gives extra credit, and will move deadlines for the greater interest of students. Those who complain about his class obviously never go to it.

Problem with course is that taught with overly-written slides (too much info). Grading was not objective since writing purely subjective according to style and approach. Too much reading for 1000-2000 word essays which tended to be focused on details.
Every week or so there is a test for each module. Weekly labs, lab report due before following lab. Professor Cohen is very smart, helpful and you can tell he wants the best for all his students

Definitely need to pay attention in lectures as you will be tested in the module exams. Lectures are lively and constantly include student feedback. Very helpful in labs, will help each group and explain anything that is needed in a respectful manner. One of the best professors that you will find in UConn civil engineering department.
Exceptionally knowledgeable and supportive, especially in lab sessions where he would assist with any uncertainties. Paying close attention in lectures is crucial as he tests on lecture material

Michael definitely knows his stuff, and wants his fellow students to learn it. He may seem like a level 1000 professor at first, but he is actually quite laid back and just wants his students to succeed. Labs are quite heavily weighted, but he makes sure to assist when necessary. Make sure to prepare for the module tests, each is timed via lockdown

He is simply the best professor I have ever had at UConn. He genuinely cares about his students and treats everyone with respect. I LOVE his teaching style, he is very engaging and enthusiastic about what he teaches. It is clear that he is very knowledgeable about the course, and he is very friendly and helpful in lab sessions.

Take only if you're an auditory learner. His slides are just diagrams of pathways and tables. Very hard to follow especially since there's no bullet points or cursor to guide you through key points. Exams are open note but don't expect this class to be easy. Essays are difficult if you have never written scientific reviews.

He is very disorganized. Lectures over powerpoint slides with just pictures and diagrams. Very hard to follow even if you listen attentively. There are 3 papers, each first draft is 5 pages and the final draft is 2-3 pages. Tests are open note but its hard to go back to his lecture recordings and find what you need from pictures.

Professor Knoll is friendly and intelligent. But the material is hard. Class is on the biochem of various microbes so I recommend having orgo/biochem first. Exams are open book, open note, short answer but they aren't easy. You need to analyze the material beyond what's in your notes. He does give some extra credit and curves generously.

Dr. Noll is a wonderful human being, an EXCELLENT teacher, passionate about his subject, humorous & truly cares about his students. The class is not easy but his lectures helped. Lecture attendance is important to understand/ bioinformatics/writing portion of the class was my favorite--it was exciting & the best part of the class for me.

Very interesting professor. Passionate and creative, a very good actor, cares about his work and his students. The class was interesting and a lot of fun, but most of the work was done outside of class.

I would highly recommend taking FNCE3101 with Cianna, especially after hearing horror stories about other professors. The only thing I would say is that she goes through lectures pretty fast, which some people don't like. Personally, I just would just study the slides she provided and HW's, and I have been well prepared for exams.

I have nothing but kind things to say about Professor Duringer. She is an awesome professor but an even greater human! She is accessible and has answered any emails I've sent in less than 20 minutes. She goes above and beyond for her students and tests fairly. If you struggle in her class, just communicate with her and she will work with you.

Cianna Duringer was a Grad student when I took her class. She is a very caring person and definitely wants to see her students succeed. Her lectures aren't mandatory but she often times flies through the power points making it very hard to keep up. I'd rather her take the full class time and actually cover/explain the content vs ending 40 min early

She is very caring toward all her students and wants them to succeed. Her lectures, example problems, and homework questions are similar to the exam so there are no trick questions. She adjusts her teaching style so all students can understand the material and will answer any question with clarity. Definitely take FNCE3101 with her if you can!

Professor Duringer is so cool, and you can tell that she just wants us to do well in the class. Very easy to understand and you will probably do well on exams even if you don't know much about finance. Take her if you just need the class for a business gen ed for sure

By far the best professor I've had at UCONN. He was so excited about teaching it was hard not to become excited about what we were learning. As long as you read the stories (which were all really short) you'll get a good grade. A must take professor!

Literally the best professor I've had thus far. No exams, just three simple essays on essentially anything you'd like related to the stories, with prompt options to help, and the stories and lectures are all interesting! I recommend this course to everyone, it is the most fun you will have while sitting in a classroom. He is so enthusiastic!

Professor Herman was absolutely wonderful! He genuinely enjoyed teaching; his enthusiasm was incredibly contagious. His lectures were well organized and integrated discussion really well. I've taken a great deal of English classes, and he is the best professor I've had in UConn's English department. Funny and relatable, too.

He was a super awesome professor. I wanted to go to class, because he was thoroughly enjoyable. Hes really funny, and isnt really strict with grading. A few easy pop quizes, and a few 1000 word essays (again, not hard.) Would take another class with him again!

Professor Herman was an extremely organized, fair, and fun professor. One of the best, if not the best I've had at UConn so far. Grading was three papers and a number of pop quizzes. If you come to class prepared you should do fine. His grading is extremely fair and he will always work with any of his students. Cares more then most professors.

She really is very easy, even though you can't understand her thick accent. EVERY class is a new powerpoint, every once in a while she'll through a multiple-choice quiz in there. She puts the pwpts online so you really don't even have to pay attention. She takes attendance so your grade will drop quickly if you miss too many classes.
Easy going
Yeah if you sleep you're not gonna learn****. Maybe you should ask questions if you don't understand stuff. And at least she has ppts unlike some teachers who ****ing talk nonstop with no visuals.

Worst teacher ever. You will not learn anything from her. She has heavy Russian accent, her pp slides suck, and she can not clarify anything. However, it's not like it matters, because chem 127 is an extremely difficult course, and it is just unfortunate that the chemistry department is garbage.
you go to her lecture, sit there, and sleep. just pick up the copies of the powerpoints that she struggles through, and you're set. study from the book, lecture's useless. not a great conjugator.

She is a very nice woman, what is on her study guides is exactly whats on the tests and the final was not cumulative. Attendence is not mandatory and you cannot understand her accent so most people do not show up, but if you do show up and show her that you're trying you will get an A. She also gives a great extra credit of 5 points to your average

She is a very responsible teacher;the class is interesting and almost 100% attendance every time. I am not sure why there are two opposite commands here. There isn't a class that you send zero effort and get an a+ result at Uconn.

She is a very responsible teacher; class is almost 100% attendance every time and I have no idea why there are two opposite commands here. There isn't any course that you can put zero effort and get an a+ result at Uconn.
Absolutely horrrible. No words can describe how bad she is. Does not care for her students at all. Responds rudely to all e-mails/requests for help.

I had such an awful experience with this woman. I have been an above average student in econ since high school & when I took micro with her I ended up failing because I missed the midterm (I didn't even know it was coming). It is impossible to understand her & everyone would be better off taking micro with Derek Johnson. I have an A in his section.
Takes an introductory class way too serious and load of work is just not acceptable. She got something ready for you to do at home and bring in after every class. Way too much work

A really good teacher. Would totally recommend. Very nice and cares about her students a lot. Will always slow down if you need it and doesn't mind repeating things a few times so that you understand. Will take time out of class to explain anything. Very patient. Take her if you're taking German

Nicest professor in the world. Will consider all input from students for structure of class. Group activities make the time go by much faster than traditional lecture. Work load is not bad at all. Would recommend this professor.
Really caes about her students. Makes class interesting and as long as you show interest and do the work she assigns. Very easy. Great professor
No Comments

professors.name: Minhua Huang
professors.department: computer science and electrical engineering department

reviews.review: She is a nice lady. The class is straightforward as are the exams. Don't sweat it. Yeah she has an accent just like 70% of my other professors at UConn, get over it If you get stuck just google it

I had no problem understanding her. She assigns a lot of homework, but is always willing to give extensions to the class if needed. Her exam reviews tells exactly what she will put on the exam. Don't miss them. Her lectures are not very helpful as she simply reads from the slides w/out any class participation. She's nice and tries to be helpful.

She has an accent that hampers her communication skills a bit but you can still understand her. The homework comes in handy for the exams and the labs aren't too difficult. She generally tries her best for everyone to do good in the class. Not to say it is an easy class, you still need to put in some work.

Dr. Huang is not good at English and reads off PowerPoints for lecture, but she's a really nice woman. She extended deadlines for assignments whenever we needed it. Gave us clear indications for what was on exams. Genuinely concerned for students' success and how to improve her teaching. Though not the best communicator, I still learned a lot.

She tries to be helpful, it can be a bit hard to understand her at times due to a heavy Chinese accent. Her home work is hard and her tests are harder. She does do her best to offer extra help in the 1 hour per week offered in her office.

Really nice instructor, always in a good mood and seemed excited to teach us. Her tests are easy, and include questions you've already seen before, but they cover a lot of material. Would recommend. for a lab gen-ed
Would not recommend.
I LOVE MERE!! EVERYONE SHOULD TAKE A PLACE WITH HER!!!!
One of my favorite classes of the semester

Meredith is a really cool person and a really happy teacher. She just finished her masters degree at UConn (where she also got her bachelors degree), so she knows more about the school than most other professors. Her lectures are interesting and she's always willing to help. However, there is a lot of material on the tests so make sure to study.

If you want a class with no work, don't take this class. There are readings due and quizzes every class and two essays (despite not being a W course), but if you put the work in, you'll do fine. I was a little irked that participation was graded, but it kind of makes sense for a discussion- based class.

Quizzes on the readings every day, so make sure you read. Sometimes the questions are hard even if you read so it helps to skim the readings again before class. Allows you to skip 6 classes before she takes points off, must participate at least twice in class every day to get a good grade.

she seems nice at first but then she becomes a she-devil. has made my classmates and i cry on multiple occasions. she doesn't know the meaning of "having the flu" or "someone died" and assumes that any life problem is an excuse and then holds a grudge against you the rest of the semester. absolutely the worst person i have met in my life.
The only thing I can say is: STAY AWAY FROM HER!
Fully a discussion based class. she does no actual teaching, she only wants to hear your opinions on the readings to make sure you know what was assigned. quizzes every class, 2 exams
He doesn't really teach and when he does it confuses the class more than he helps it. I literally taught myself Pre-Cal because he does problems wrong on the board.

Worst teacher i have had all year. doesnt help us at all in class which is not even mandatory. he just goes over random problems and doesn't understand what it means to live in america. he accuses everyone of cheating too, like actually accuses people if they look around the room during a test

You can't understand a word he says. He gives us homework online and the test are a twisted version of the hw. He tries to trick us, and is not very helpful in office hours or class. Not my best professor

Definitely agreed, very invested in his students. Wants you to go to office hours and attempt the homework problems before hand. The exams were definitely a reward for religiously doing the hw. Upbeat and clearly likes to teach. Recommended!

Best teacher I have had at UConn. Goes through every topic thoroughly and provides great conceptual background that makes intially foggy topics clear. Also has a lot of investment in his students' success. He gives fair tests based off of homework problems and makes himself readily available if you need help. Great teacher.
Amazing teacher always ready to help. I definitely advise him.
Amazing guy who is so interesting and actually cares about the content! Dont let the amount of weekly reading scare you, I hate reading and BSed my way through. Again, content is really cool!

Class is interesting and he grades extremely easy! Only issue is he doesn't post slides online but study guides are so straight forward for the exams that if you miss some classes it wont hurt you! I suggest taking it for a GPA booster!

Goes through slides very fast and doesn't post slides. Doesn't get back to you through email either at all or gets to you through email very late. Very broad topics and questions on midterm. Some questions make no sense. Social explorer project/paper is tedious and quite difficult. Two quizzes, participation, midterm and final make your grade.
Great professor! Easy to comprehend. Take Urban Sociology - very interesting, and a very nice guy.

He is hard to understand but if you pay attention he is really helpful and very helpful in office hours. The class isn't the easiest stuff but really pay attention because all civil engineering courses are based on it
His voice sounds like Borat's. Cable AB... very nice!
Sometimes hard to understand but very straight forward and approachable review questions very similar to actual exams, cant complain
Hard to understand. Bad English. For tests, study over homework problems as tests come right from those problems.
Hard teacher.. Hard to understand... Hard topic material... HArd in general.
Can't say this was my favorite class. It's rewarding if you like to do research (it is very research heavy), but if not, this is not the class for you. You'll thank me later.

Don't take this course during a heavy semester. This course is a lot of work and very time consuming. Weekends were often spent in lab doing work for the class, but the experience overall was rewarding. Although the professor is extremely tough he is honestly the best professor I've had at Uconn.
Hard class. You'll either like the professor or you won't. Expect long nights in the lab during the semester.
This class is very hard and if you do not like benchwork, this is not the class for you. It's much more work than expected and the professor himself was okay.
Interesting class, a lot of work but good professor

3 exams are 75% of your grade. Material is dense. All exams are open-ended questions and no multiple choice. The W is hard from what other people told me. Use the practice exams to study. Overall, very interesting class and Govoni really wants to help you succeed.

The information for Growth is not easy, but Dr. Govoni does a good job of breaking it down and emphasizing what she thinks is important (and what will be on exams). She gives pretty thorough and comprehensive practice exams that matches the real exams that are all short answer/essay type. She grades fairly and is always willing to help if you need

Very clear about what you need to know for exams. Class is mandatory (5% of grade-clickers). Lab is a grade boost and isn't difficult. Exams are pretty straight forward, but still challenging because the material is dense. Good presentation skills and obviously interested in subject matter. Not teaching the course anymore.Teaches Seminar-super easy

Very friendly and approachable, Dr G is happy to answer any questions you have. The material can be somewhat dense and she can go through the slides quickly so pay attention. She gives you all the info you need for exams in class and on the power points. Her slides are not complete online so attendance is vital for a good grade. Labs are an easy A.

Even though she is a professor, Dr. G still has some learning to do herself. Shes a very nice woman & more than willing to help during office hours; but lecture is a mess...speeds through the slides & you think you have a grasp on the info (which seems digestible) until you take her exams; full understanding required for open-ended Q's
Took Fitzgerald in the summer really enjoyed the class, and assignments. I never really had any trouble doing the assignments, pretty easy class. Would take again if still went to my campus.

She is a very nervous speaker and says "um" all the time. She makes it clear she doesn't give out A's. If you want an A get ready to rewrite every paper. I was told my writing was good enough for the school paper in English 1101, when I wrote papers for Annarose she gave me B's and wanted revisions. Other review said she was "Hot" yeah NOT!

she's not an easy grader and she gives us assignments to do in class. and she's not hot. you have to ask her to help if you want to pass with an a grade unless you're nerd. there are better teachers you can take.

She was SO HOT! I just couldnt miss class becuase I needed to see her everyday. She's always an amazing professor who truly cares for her students. A Bit easy grader though but she still challenged most of the students. A MUST TAKE for anyone who cares about learning and/or hot teachers.

tried to make class interesting but became a bit repetitive midsemester. easy grader, makes you do a lot of "class participation" which doesnt count for much. overall, not the worst class i've been in
I LOVED HER CLASS!!!!
EXTREMELY NICE LADY!! VERY INTERESTING! EASY CLASS! VERY HELPFUL! LEARNED ALOT!
I took her Portuguese 101 & 102 classes and by the end of the year I was almost fluent. She was great and so NICE!

She's fantastic!!! knows a lot about what she teaches. the tests are very easy! really interesting and adds clips and drawings which are fun. I love the way she says youtube. she has a little bit of an accent but you get used to it.
Currently taking her class and I love it! She can make political science interesting at 8 am... 'nough said!

Thought her class was very easy. All you had to do was attend, write a paragraph a class on your thoughts, very easy, and you passed. 3 essays were given, but she was very helpful with them and plenty of time was given. Easy A. She was also very good looking, which made attending class easier.

I took her freshman english class which was an easy A. She graded papers very easy. BUT I took her medieval literature class and thought it was very hard. There is a ton of reading which is all necessary and is often difficult to read. There are 2 paper (really helpful) and 2 extremely difficult exams study groups help if you divide the readings
She'll make you work buts its not bad for freshman english
She'll make you work but it will be doable. Not be for en English class. Plus she's pretty good lookin'
She's an extremely friendly person and tries to keep things interesting in class. Papers can be tough, but she is very helpful and holds extended office hours. Fair grader.

She a very bright individual but not a good teacher. The lectures and powerpoints and very long and confusing. Expected us to do most of the work and didn't give any opportunities to make up any grades. No extra credits or homework. The are very hard and it's very difficult to find the information you need to prepare. Makes it very hard to do well.
Brilliant and genuinely nice
very good
Helpful and refuses to give anyone below a C
No Comments

Dr. Renshaw is an inspiring conductor, and we are fortunate to have him at UConn. He is an amazing musician, and programs very well for the wind ensemble. I learned at lot in his conducting class as well. Not afraid of using technology, and is very much in touch with the student population.

Dr. Renshaw is one of the best pedagogues and the VERY best conductor I've ever worked with. His attitude and approach to teaching are positive, and I never fail to learn something useful every time he holds a class. He has a great sense of humor, and chooses stimulating programming. Wish I could take him to grad school with me!
Extremely talented

Dr.Renshaw is an absolute inspiration, who speaks through his baton, and is brilliant in what he does. The man is strict, but demands excellence in his ensembles, being absolutely thorough in his preparation and knowledge. Wonderful resource for anything musical, very fortunate to have him here

Stuck up. To the max. HIS band is the greatest ever and HE is the greatest conductor since Frederick Fennell. HE was Frederick Fennell's assistant for 75 years, and Frederick Fennell Frederick Fennell Frederick Fennell Frederick Fennell Frederick Fennell Eastman Eastman Frederick Fennell Eastman. Frederick Fennell.

If you have to (or want to like me) take Abnormal Psychology, TAKE IT WITH HIM! All of the exam material is in the Powerpoints, but he makes it worthwhile to come to lectures. He is extremely funny and engaging, and you will learn so much from his stories (some of them really stick with you). One of my favorite classes I have ever taken.
This is an amazing class I actually think about what Ive learned very day since Ive taken it. Josh is woke af and the class is really fun to attend. You seriously wont regret taking it!
Best Professor at UConn! cares about the subject and the students. You actually learn a lot, it's not just about getting a good grade.

Very straight forward class, everything you need to know for the test is on his powerpoints which he puts online. If you spend the time to go through the powerpoints youll get an easy A without even having to go to class. In class, the guy is a great teacher and super knowledgeable about the work. He's also hilarious and makes lectures fun.

Favorite professor I've had at UConn! He cares about the material he teaches, and tries to make the class as interesting and doable as possible! His exams are straight forward and focus on the important material (not tiny dates or statistics). If you want to take Abnormal, take it with him!!
I knew the material was going to be boring to get through but Prof. Shewmaker made it bearable. Clear lecturer, fair grading standards.

Peter tries as hard as possible to give everyone a good grade. He dropped a quiz grade, webassign grades, and later, people did not do too well on exams, so he said that if people did better on the final, it'll replace an exam grade. He is so accessible outside of class and answers emails in a flash. Math is so hard for me, but he made it easy.

Peter "Pete" Shewmaker, for all the chaos he inspires, does have several good qualities. He is extremely passionate about Differential Equations, and he has an extensive resume with "creme-of-the-creme" research. Sometimes he gets a little bit off topic, but other than that he is fantastic!

Monotone, mumbling, and unclear professor. Does the typical "I write down notes on the board and you copy them". Talks extremely fast and makes it difficult to learn anything. Personally I am good at math so I still don't think it is too difficult, but I have still had way better professors.

This is such an easy A math course if you need to take a Q course. He gives note packets that are easy to follow, so as long as you go to class and review before exams, you should get a 100 on everything. Highly recommend. He is a little boring during class, but the class itself is very easy.
Tough but fair

Martha is very interested in her topic and therefore gives a lot of information and expects it all to be known for the exams. People in this class are most likely going into the field of cytogenetics and therefore need to know the smallest detail, so her class helps prepare you for that. You are allowed one retake exam but she takes the newer grade

Martha is generally a nice person and cares about her students and the material. Her exams have the smallest details on them but those in the DGS program need to know those small details in the field, so if you're taking it in the program I would definitely pay attention. She gives unit objectives that help immensely when studying for the exams.

Martha's courses are ridiculously difficult. She expects you to memorize every single nitty-gritty detail. I didn't like asking questions in class because can be sarcastic and makes you feel stupid in front of everyone. Overall, that class was way too much work.
