The class was easy as long as you did the readings and participated in the discussions. The exams, however, had only 3 essays which she graded very hard and the avg was lower than it should have been.

I am a pretty solid writer, so this class was easy and boring for me, but Laura actually taught me a thing or two. Take all the assignments seriously and listen to Laura's feedback and you will be fine. She knows her stuff and wants to help you. You will definitely learn something after taking a class with her.

She's pretty nice. The theme for the class was memes so I basically wrote anything I thought was a kind of analysis of memes and got through. I got a bad grade on one essay but still managed to get a B-, so I don't think that she's that tough of a grader.

I recommend her. If youre fairly proficient in the English language you shouldnt have too much difficulty if you just do the homework and the assignments. She is a tough grader, but if you ask her how can I improve my work she highlights exactly where you went wrong or started ranting. Take the rough drafts seriously, and its a rewarding class.

Laura was really an amazing teacher. Our topic for the class was so interesting: memes. She gives a lot of feedback on the rough drafts. Pay attention to the suggestions she makes and you will definitely get an A.
She is passionate, but still too strict on grading.

I took his stat 3025Q and stat 3115. You must go to class since there might be pop quizes. The pop quizes are not graded based on correctness, only based on attendance. Exams are straight forward, similar to quizes and homework problems. Recommend and would take him again.
Yang is very friendly, patient and helpful. He would like to answer every question you have whether it is stupid or not. Definitely recommend this teacher.

He is a really helpful guy. He tries his best to explain the materials very clearly, but the materials are extremely hard. first test was fair, average was around 85, the second exam's average was 45 and he curved the entire class generously and made it 82. As he saw the students were doing really bad, he made the final super simple and easy.

Tough class, but Yang is a good guy. The lectures can sometimes be boring, but he does a good job explaining the content. First exam was very easy, but the class ramped up super hard after that. Class average for the 1st exam was 85. 2nd exam was rough with a failing class average that got generously bumped up to an 82. Would recommend.

He seems like a nice guy, but he is not. He says exam questions will follow the homework problems and problems that we did in class. None of the questions were remotely similar! He just reads off of the slides that was created by another professor 4 years ago. Doesn't write on the board. Very bad at explaining. Don't take him.

If Im going to be honest, he was not the best teacher. In order to understand all of the homework and be prepared for exams, you are going to need to read the textbook. I think Professor Gosselin is a great person; however, he does not give substantial information during class. With that being said, he does give test corrections for you to gain ec

Professor Gosselin covers all the necessary content with his lectures. He's engaging, wants to get everyone's name, and makes lots of baseball analogies. He even will offer test corrections to improve exam averages. Exams can be tricky but you get a formula sheet. 2 exams (20% each), homework 30%, and final 30%.

Professor Gosselin was the best professor I've had at UConn so far. He is very engaging in class and actually asks questions to students instead of reading off a boring powerpoint. There are weekly online homeworks, but they aren't bad. The exams were somewhat challenging, but fair. I felt that I learned a lot more in this class than I usually do!

Professor Gosselin was quite possibly the best professor I have had at UConn, thus far. He gives all of his students an amazing foundation in finance. He is very engaging in class and makes you think about the topics he asks. There is weekly homework, but it is all manageable. Exams are similar to practice exams, there are some tricky questions.

I went into this class knowing nothing about finance. But Prof. Gosselin's lectures made it feel like common sense! Very down-to-earth professor who has reasonable expectations and a manageable workload. While the exams do have tricky questions, he posts a practice exam that is very helpful because all the questions are similar. I recommend him!

Dr. Mellone is definitely one of the best professors that Ive had! If you dont take Gene Expression with her, you are truly missing out the experience! Shes super nice and takes teachings pretty seriously! Definitely an expert in the field of genomics! Class is very organized with 3 exams and 8 quizzes (2 dropped)! Content not too hard!

Dr. Mellone is a wonderful teacher. She cares about all of her students and wants everyone to succeed. The class is challenging, as there are a lot of papers to read, however the class discussions on the papers are extremely helpful. I became better at analyzing scientific papers thanks to this class and I would recommend it to all grad students.
Sometime hard to understand the accent and very monotonic lecture. Not a very helpful instructor.

Really nice and super helpful! always has her door wide open and answers emails asap. A bit unclear about her expectations at times and tough grader (for papers) but I think her course definitely helped my writing because of her helpful input! Definitely take this W course with her if you can!

Very good professor. Has a slight Italian accent, but not difficult to understand. Very willing to help out students during office hours. Only tests on material that she lectures on, so going to lecture is recommended.
SUCH AN EASY CLASS! barely attended class (but you should). easy work and it's all take home quizzes and exams.

Perhaps she has changed her habits, but it is an extremely easy class. She provides plenty of examples for every topic, and spends a lot of time discussing it. She gives study guides for the tests so you can pretty much predict every question on the tests beforehand, with plenty of bonus points. She does have a strong accent but you get used to it.

To be totally honest, she's an ok professor. She has a strong accent which makes it hard to understand but she does give real life examples in her consumer marketing class. Make sure you read the book if you plan on not coming to class cause her power points are straight from the book. Her exams are hard but study the concepts and you'll pass.

Extremely difficult to understand, she doesn't clarify student responsiblities, unfair grader, tests are impossible. Avoid taking a class with her if at all possible, I am a straight A student and this class was torterous, not because the material was difficult but because the grading was insane

You don't really need the textbook if you go to class. Her lectures are pretty clear and she also posts old quizzes/exams online, which is great. Overall, the class is relatively easy and straightforward. Recommended.

You really must teach yourself the content in order to pass the course. Her lectures are very boring and she mostly rambles on while only drawing graphs on the board. You must rely on the textbook in order to complete the homeworks, as well as studying for the quizzes. Wouldn't take again.

She is an amazing professor. She knows everything and explains material in a way that makes you wonder how you didn't understand it before. she normally teaches graduate courses but if you have the chance to take her as an undergrad, take it. You wont be disappointed. The class wasn't too hard but does require studying.
Take this class with Segerson. She knows her stuff, is friendly, and gives weekly online quizzes that aren't timed, so you can get 100 everytime.

I took this as my required Lab thinking it would be easy.... I was wrong. Homework assignments online due before each class (pretty easy but a nuisance) -- The layout of the class page made it hard to navigate and there was almost no material online. The lab section was also very difficult as there was so much random and overly specific info.
Stay clear of this class. So much busy work its ridiculous.

The class is very boring and the grading system is ridiculous. I wouldn't say its hard but there's a lot of work that has to be done and if you forget it, it will bring your grade down. Clicker questions every class so show up. Lab is stupid and tedious. Mostly everything you need to know in the class can be found online.

Easy class but tedious and time consuming. Boring if you don't care about this sort of thing, but professor is really sweet and has clear expectations. Graded assignments and exams aren't a problem if you study. There is a lot of hw before each class, but it's easy - just time consuming. Lab isn't hard but is pointless and boring. Take for gen ed.

Professor Byrne is a genuine guy. His lectures are long and boring and he requires an online book which is mandatory. You have to go to class because he has top hat which includes participation counting as a good chunk of your grade. Exams are difficult so study, but he drops the lowest exam grade.

Didn't use the textbook much, only for Hazard City assignments. Aside from that, the majority of information he tests you on is presented during class. A little dry, but he uses a lot of media to compensate. Easy A.

Prof. Byrne definitely knows the material that he teaches, he's just not too good at teaching it. Most of the lectures were unbearably dry and he seemed unorganized most of the time. There's 3 exams and he drops the lowest one, and offers up to 4 points of extra credit on your final grade though, so definitely take the class if you want an easy A.
great teacher, topic is pretty interesting but it is clear that he loves teaching the topic which makes it even more interesting. As long as your in class you pretty much should get an A in the class

Funny, intelligent man. Keeps class interesting. One easy project, 12 "pop" quizzes that are easy & the midterm and final. Offered a 3 pts on avg bonus assignment. Picks great short stories. I enjoyed this class.

google him. he's amazing. i found out the second to last week that he used to have a show on WHUS, the uconn radio, hes got books, MUSIC albums [itunes-search him too]. great class, one day a week for 2.5 hours, not as bad as youd think, one book a week and a quiz each class, but easy, not critical thinking. one paper/presentation. great guy.
One of my favorite teachers. He's very knowledgable and witty, which keeps your attention up. Attendance is important and not painful. Take his class!

Prof. Cormier is an intelligent man. He clarifies important points of the stories read and makes class requirements very clear. Term paper had three possible assignments from which students could choose to cater to individual needs. He is more than willing to meet with students to discuss grades. Take his class -- you'll be glad you did.
Amazing professor, interesting material, and easy grader. Overall, couldn't ask for a better medical anthropology course.
She was really nice, and was clearly passionate about the subject. I enjoyed going to the class.
She's a nice person! It's better to take this class during the summer. We don't have any quiz. Just two short paper and two presentation.
Engaged in the material, talks about current examples. Encourages discussion.
The very best, plain and simple. Heather was helpful and informative, one of my all time favorite teachers.
She was definitely my favorite teacher this semester!
Heather is the best professor I've ever had. I LOVED her class. Amazing, stimulating readings and interesting class discussion. SO MUCH FUN!
Heather is awesome, she's really understanding and a pretty fair grader. Never been good at English essays but got an A. Readings are pretty difficult though, but overall great class.

He clearly knows a lot about the subject. He is fair when it comes to how the semester's grades are made up. The class material was difficult, but he can't be blamed for that. If you seek help and attend office hours and the math camps you will be way ahead of classmates who don't.

He's a very nice guy and knowledgeable about speech science. The course material was difficult, however he wants you to succeed. He provides chances for extra credit and drops 2 lowest online quiz grades. Biggest complaint is that he did not let us use calculators, even though this is a math based course, which was very frustrating on exams.

This class was a struggle, but part of that is because it was the first time the class was offered. We never seemed to meet his expectations, but he was always willing to help us out by giving us extra credit or curving exams. He doesn't meet outside of office hours, which was extremely frustrating to me because I had class during those times.
He know what he is talking and he is passionate about this class for sure. Gotta study hard and you can't be lazy for this class!

The Dante writing class was one of the best classes and Bucci is definitely in my top favorite teachers. The lectures were beyond interesting and he definitely grabbed my attention. He makes you work hard on the papers but it actually helped in getting me to express ideas a lot better. I wish he was still at UConn, I'd take him again like that.

he was the TA for the renaissance class. he lectured a few times and when he did i understood everything more than when the professor talked. his lectures made so much sense, clear, structured, and were very thought-provoking. i went to his office hours a couple of times and he was so helpful. you can tell he is really passionate about the subject.

had him for italian 3. awesome guy, very down to earth and funny. there are alot of verb tenses in this class and he will drill them into you from day one until the end, but it actually made me learn them well and made the class easier and more manageable. he understands it is alot to do and really makes sure everyone is on the same page. take him!

bucci is literally hysterical and probably the funniest teacher i've had at uconn. you learn a lot even though he speaks italian pretty much all the time. he's big on participation and calls on you randomly so you sort of need to keep up with everything. quizzes and tests were easy if you go to class and study the notes he gives, so not bad at all

Super sweet and funny. Participation is like 20%, but she is pretty lenient about it. Lots of reading, but it is all interesting and not terrible. Midterm and Final are papers, never any tests or quizzes.
Really cares about students, there are a few lengthy assignments, but she's not a really harsh grader and gives plenty of time to complete assignments.

Professor Showers is an absolute sweetheart. She is really caring, but also passionate about her work. There is a lot of reading, but I managed to get through the class without fully reading a single book. U just have to be really proficient at skimming & finding the most important point of texts. There's a bit of writing, but if u do it u'll pass.

Lots of reading, however you can barely read and still get by. Pretty easy assignment. Written exams are long and kind of annoying, but there's only 2, so it's not too bad. Sometimes lectures can be dry, but Professor Fumi is sooo nice and a great professor. I would definitely take her again.

Professor Bolster is still one of my favorite professors here at UConn. He was super easy to talk to and made it very clear what coursework needed to be done. There was a large variety of work that he made easy to get good grades on if you do the readings. I would definitely take a course of his again.

Chris is a truly amazing professor. Teaching an interesting English course is no easy task, but he makes it so fun and interesting. He is so understanding of circumstances and is genuinely interested in the topics he teaches. I could not recommend his course enough. A great professor and human!

I'll be honest, without Prof. Bolster this class probably would have been boring as hell, but he really wants everyone to do well in the class and understand the material. He's really flexible with due dates as long as you have a good reason and don't overuse it. Make sure to participate in class too, just makes the learning experience better.

Professor Christopher is a nice person, and he teaches interesting topics and teaches in a good way. He is really helpful and patient, and he is the one that you want to talk to even you don't take this course.

Course seems impossible at first but becomes doable once you get used to the concepts. Dr. Mani's handwriting is VERY hard to read but when you understand it the notes are very helpful, he knows his stuff. He will grade hw/exams quickly and provide answer keys you can study from. Lots to learn from this class but requires effort. textbook helps.
Literally the worse professor ever. You cant read his handwriting. None of what he says makes sense.

Worst professor I have ever had. Handwriting is completely illegible and yet he insists on writing everything. The course material is also extremely difficult and he refuses to help us practice it beyond the absolute bare minimum (he didn't even use 1/3rd of our class meeting times). Avoid Dr. Mani at all costs.
handwriting for the note is unreadable, dont take this class if you can take the p chem in the summer.

Sacha is literally the best music professor that I've ever had. I have always had trouble in music theory, not so much aural skills, but Sacha, although she will kick your butt in order for you to learn, is hands down, the only teacher that I've ever maintained information from. You will not regret taking her class.
Dr. Peiser is the best. I literally would not have been able to pass music theory if I had not had her as my professor. Take her classes!

The department would collapse without her doing the work of like four people at once. She is very clear and will help you understand the concepts. Made the ear training curriculum more interesting and applicable. A positive force in the department, and very energetic.
She's a great teacher!
Such a great class! He goes above and beyond with students, and is happy to elaborate on anything. 10/10 time in the class!

Rui is a caring teacher and budding educator for many students. He is very accessible in and out of class, and makes learning challenging material fun and interesting. He is a fair grader and gets grades back very quickly sometimes the same day as the test. If you can take Ruis class during your undergrad, do it! You will not regret it!

Rui is a fantastic instructor. In class, his lectures and exams are very clear and you will definitely learn a lot! In addition, he is very available outside of class to ensure you understand the material and seems to genuinely care about your performance in his class. He goes above and beyond to help all of his students succeed

Rui was a great professor. He really cares about his students even though he is a PhD student. He really tries to help you do well in the course. If you go to him, he will sit down with you and work with you until you understand it. Very understanding and wants to see everyone succeed.

Nunnery is great! Had her for writing 1010 at Tulane and though class can be a little boring sometimes, her expectations are clear, and if you meet them you will get an A. She cares about her students and builds in class time to get to know her students and help her students get to know each other. She's always in a good mood which brightens my day

I took this course Spring 2020, so it was in-person at first and then switched to online. I took it as a gen ed and it was just not for me. It is VERY reading heavy we had multiple chapters of books to read before class which was hard to keep up with at times. Class discussions were often awkward and she isn't great at facilitating discussions.
Honestly, she's fine, the essays can be daunting because they're so long but she's very open minded and easy to work with if you just put in some effort.

I loved Emglish before taking this class. If you do poorly on the first paper prepare to do poorly on the rest. Very vague with comments and prompts. Class discussion are filled will silence. Would not recommend at all.

2 exams, 1 group project, bi-weekly quizzes, and lab reports throughout the course. Exams were a little rough, but, there's little reason why you would fail if you actually try. Math isn't bad, course was fun, and professor treats you with respect. I would take again.

I took a graduate level switchgear with him to hopefully get good feedback on my methods but I did not get that. Instead I got grades with no constructive feedback. It felt random. HW had little to no application. Solutions were shown which were ok, but I wanted to see how accurate my methods were for the project which is the crux of the class.

Bazzi is the man. His lectures are easy to listen to and he engages with the class a lot. Make sure to go to his office hours. He likes to make meaningful connections with his students and often give homework and quiz answers during those meetings. You learn a lot in this class, but you have to put the effort in!

Good professor, one of the best at UConn. Clear lectures with original material. Occasionally makes math mistakes, but concepts are always clear. Wants students to show up in office hours. Tests are easy if you know what you're doing. Lab experiments are OK. Homework isn't graded, but there are weekly quizzes from the homework. Nice guy too.

At first she might seem very strict and not fun. But give her two or three classes and she really will open up. She truly cares about improving your writing, and helps you through every step of the paper. Even for a Graduate Student, she doesn't act like she is one, and could rival a true professor. You have to read the books she assigns.
I was told grad students tend to be bad at teaching, and Ms. Dolce proved them wrong. She's very interesting but is also pretty chill, while knowing what she's doing at the same time.
great inspiring smart funny
Amazing English teacher. She is super nice and really makes you think.

She tells you exactly what's going to be on the exams and recycles quiz questions/old exam questions and puts them on exams. I went to lecture for the first week then never showed up again and got an A. Ended up making the last exam and final open note which was a plus. the class was way easier than I thought
Dr. Lee is very nice and understanding. She is very busy so may cancel class some days but will ket you know. Exams are not too bad but those are the only grades.

Do not ask questions in class if you cannot fluently speak in "scientific language" (she will not answer the question, but instead reword it back to you). Our grades were not uploaded for almost three months. Expect that this distance learning class will be canceled randomly and often. Heavy on self-teaching.
She cancelled a bunch of classes and watching recorded lectured out of class time, very exam heavy (4 exams total) hard grader (wants you to write in a perfect scientific manner). I do not recommend

Nice but any of the classes he teaches are painfully boring. He doesn't engage students or make the material interesting. His exams are a lot of memorization. He drones on and on and on. So terrible. Refuses to use rubrics or update his teaching style for the new generations.

Nice guy but boring class. Definitely passionate about what he is teaching even if it is a dull subject. Your grades are papers and exams and he seemed to grade pretty fairly. Just smile alot and he will like you!

This was an interesting class. I took it at night so it was a little difficult to stay concentrated for a couple hours. Almost entire grade is writing papers. This is good if you're a good writer but he doesn't use a rubric-all based on judgement. It was all readings and response with discussion. He treated everyone like an adults with respect
this class is boring. it is very hard to stay awake in and sometimes he forgets about assignments but he really enjoys teaching and tries his hardest to interact.

Often throws temper tantrums/hissy fits, which is awkward and kind of childish. Frustrated easily by technology. He knows his stuff, but he'll post a picture and say nothing about it, leaving you with a lot of painting titles/dates and no information to go with them.
Very nice but very scattered... Mumbles a lot and is unclear about the material. 2 exams (midterm and final) does not give any clues as to what will be on them
Yes, he knew his material (quite well), but also had a poor attitude on many occasions- sometimes even unprofessional with his hissy-fits during class.
i took 17th and 18th cent art with him, he's the museum director at the Benton, and knows his stuff.
If you like writing 10 page papers and getting graded randomly and unfairly without any type of guidelines, this is the teacher for you.
The worst teacher of all time, DO NOT TAKE (unless you're into not learning, writing Like crazy, and reading boring material)
She has you write a crazy amount of essays, i don't think she realizes we have other classes. She also does not teach anything, just has you discuss passages which she doesn't help you understand.

She doesn't teach anything at all. SHe has discussions during class and then you go back home and read. You have to write so many essays its ridiculous. She doesnt grade good at all mainly because she only wants you to write how she writes. She wants to to elaborate the elaborated. No matter how much you revise she only gives Cs
Great guy. Easy class. Interesting material.

If you show up to class, do the assignments and reports, and hand in the final business plan..you will get an A. Def one of the best/nicest professors I've had at UConn. Absolutely no need to get the textbook.
One of the best at UConn, hands down. Fun, keeps things light and as long as you go to class the work is easy and your guaranteed an A.
One of the best Uconn has to offer. Didn't really need the book or to take notes, just show up and you'll have a good grade. Keeps things interesting and is an all around great prof

Easy A. Graded by 4 open notes online exams, a lot of discussion boards but you don't reply to classmates which is amazing! Everything on Husky ct. :). Tuesdays are in-person and Thursdays are asynchronous. I went to neither. You get one week to do each exams. Assignments are due at the end of semes! perfect class for someone who works 2 jobs!

Super easy class - lots of assignments but they are not graded heavily and they are really simple. The exams are online and open note, and you have 3 chances to redo them for the Sexuality and Personality classes.

She is a very nice lady and is very knowledgeable. The class is really easy. There's more to do outside of lectures than in lectures. My only issue is she doesn't put up slides on the board and when she talks she bounces between topics making it hard to follow along and understand what the point is.
Absolutely wonderful professor!! It is impossible not to love this woman!
This has definitely been one of my favorite classes. If you plan on taking this class at some point, definitely try and get Aaron Cooke as your teacher.

Always willing to help you or further explain material you learned in class. If you don't go to class you WILL NOT do well because he doesn't use a textbook. Overall, he's an awesome teacher who makes the material easier to learn.

He made an easy class harder than it had to be. There were three tests, the first test was impossible and 4+ students dropped the course after that. However, the second two tests were reasonable and he gave a decent curve to compensate for the first test. His notes are all over the place, and he does make mistakes, but overall, decent teacher.
Great professor, learned more than in any other econ course. Really difficult though he expects a lot.

After CHEG 2103, there isn't a lot you learn in this course. Lectures were hard to follow, but the material was easy to pick up from the book, particularly because you will already know 70% of it. Also, his tests were easy and his grading was generous. He was very bad at answering questions though...

After CHEG 2103, this course wasn't bad at all. He tells you what is on the tests, and grades easy. He gets defensive if you ask him questions. I can't tell if it's a language thing, or he just doesn't know...
The class is not hard. It might be a little bit boring becuase he only derives equations, but you'll learn the stuff.
It is easy if you have taken Intro to CHEG class.
Definitely one of the best professors at UConn. Gives a few quizzes, exams aren't tricky. He wants to give you a good grade if he sees you deserve it. I would love to take another class with him
Not terrible at all, 5 speeches, 2 exams plus final I believe. Seems to grade speeches easy if you know what you're talking about and give a good delivery. Good guy
Great teacher, funny. Big on discussion. Class slides are posted online so attendance isn't necessary, but he does take them down after some time. Fair grader. Exams are verbatim from the slides.
Nice guy, funny, made what could have been a stressful class less stressful by maintaining a friendly environment.

Her lectures can be pretty long and boring however the class is not too difficult and Madiha is very nice and understanding. Come to class, do the homework right, and do the final exam diligently and you will do fine.

Interesting lectures, but can get long and overwhelming. Midterm was take home and final was optional. Participation counts, but you can make it up if you don't participate. So you need to attend a few of the classes, but attendance is not graded. If you can follow her slides, which are posted online, the lectures aren't really super necessary.
Great teacher who cares about your grade if you are willing to put in effort. Lectures were long and very boring. But midterm was open book and final was optional. Easy A with her!

Good professor. She is a grad student so it was fun to be around someone that is younger than 60 for once. She gave a few homework assingments. The midterm was a take home and she made the final optional which was awesome! I reccomend taking philosphy with her!

This class is what you make of it. Personally she gave me great feedback on my writing. My test grades directly resulted from the amount of studying I did. When I browsed through the material I got Cs, when I studied and out in the work I got As. Just that simple take some responsibility...

Lots of work. Tests are hard and study guides are useless because it is just filled with the headlines of the powerpoint slides. She nitpicks in her grading and sometimes comes off less academic and more self-righteous. Nice woman, not the best professor.

Awesome professor! The exams were super easy. Don't buy the book, I never opened it. As long as you go to class every day and listen, it's pretty easy stuff. She makes it very straight forward and is really clear about what you need to know. She's really helpful and wants her students to do well! As long as you go to class you should do well!!
Exams were tough. Subject is easy in itself, but it becomes complicated when the study guide has 200+ things on it and the exam only has 50 questions.
Great teacher, kept a not so interesting topic interesting.

Gabe is a great teacher, he will always make sure you understand the material before continuing on, responds to emails promptly, and is a fair grader. His lectures follow along in the text, which is extremely useful. Make sure to always read the outside artcles; this will be super beneficial in receiving a good grade.
Easiest class ever. No need to study. He goes by Gabe and he's a real sweetheart that really just wants everyone to succeed. Two papers but you get an A for effort. Reading quizzes are a breeze too
Challenging but fair. Good teacher. Funny in class. Helpful and answers questions. You will have to do the readings but they are short and interesting. I definitely recommend this class!

His lectures and homework assignemtns helped me a ton throughout the semester to understand the concepts. He related concepts of each lecture to real-world applications in physics. When due, he was accessible to review exam questions with me. I learnt a tremendous deal form his patience and understanding when explaining the questions to me.

He explained complex material in a clear-cut manner and even provided supplemental information for enhanced learning. He showed an interest in the success of all his student's and ensured that we fully understood the tasks. A really cool guy! Would take this course again.
It was difficult to understand but the class was self-explanatory. He followed the book in order so if you didn't understand it during lecture the book was there to explain it.

I had Alireza as a TA for Physics so in regards to an easyhard course that wasn't exactly under his control. He is, though, an extremely kind and understanding person that genuinely wants his students to succeed.
Very engaging and friendly professor. Projects are graded fairly. Quizzes and exams are reasonably difficult.

Qi is an awesome professor. He is really passionate about Marketing, and he does a really good job relating class material to outside companies. He likes to joke around in class, and he is a really sweet guy. He learns everyones names, gave us a curve on the midterm/quizzes for no reason, and brings in snacks for the class.
Very engaging class. The professor is patient and very helpful.
Great class! I love it so far. The prof is interesting and fun to listen to.

Maggie is one of the best professors I have had at uconn. Her lectures were hilarious and she is such a kind person. She wants everyone to be comfortable in her class and she really makes an effort to get to know all of her students. The exams were exactly what were on the study guides and the pop quizzes are easy 10/10 if you go to class.

I love Maggie's class! This class is so fun and worth taking! I learned a lot from this course and it definitely worth my time. She is fun in terms of her teaching style, the slides are clear and well-made and she posts them on the website. There are pop quizzes each week but you can drop some. Exams are not bad if you study well.

She's very fun to have as a professor. Very easy to talk to and engages well with students. However, don't take her easy-going demeanor to mean that her grading will be easy. NOPE. Make sure you ALWAYS have a title page because she will take points off. Also, by participation she means TALKING. Attendance does not count toward participation at all.

This was my favorite class, Maggie is also a really great professor. She is really laid back, funny, and tries her best to make the class fun. The course material is really interesting and easy to understand. There are about 10 pop quizzes and class participation activities throughout the semester, so I would not encourage skipping.

Professor Naigles is the best professor I have ever had! He is so sweet and funny and his lectures are engaging. Material is super easy if you are not reading for next level calculus. I hate math and he made it extremely understandable and interesting. Would love to have him again!

He's goated, made online class genuinely engaging, and kept the class light while explaining concepts thoroughly. 1131Q isn't easy and there's a fair amount of work but Prof Naigles is a great lecturer.
This man was just purely amazing. I literally cried thinking I will never have him again as a professor. Naigles was sent from heaven above.

Professor Naigles genuinely cares about his students success and enjoys the subject he teaches. Also a really funny guy. He wants you to come to office hours and always wants to help you. Reasonable with extensions. Lecture and discussion sections did seem pointless unless you had questions since the actual lecture material is online.

This class was a nightmare for me. I ended up doing well in the end but only because of YouTube and an extreme amount of effort. Ben's lectures were not helpful in the slightest and was unable to answer questions well. I do give him a bit of a pass in that the class was ran by a course coordinator so he din't always know what was going on.

Although it was Ben's first yeah teaching, he was alright. Lectures weren't great, so I'd usually go to his office hours to try and understand the material. Don't completely trust the practice exams when studying for exams. Overall, the class was a chore to complete.

If you are taking MATH 1071Q, avoid Ben. This is his first year teaching and to be frank he is terrible at teaching. He is unsure about the material he teaches and makes lots of mistakes when explaining. When someone asks a question he has a hard time answering the question. I find myself watching online videos on huskyct instead of going to class.

Hes literally a 3rd year graduate student and this is my issue because Im paying thousands for not full professors but student instructors. No teaching skills so he reads right from the textbook and does not explain things beyond that AT ALL. His material and exams dont match up. Avoid him.
30% of your grade is homework, 40% is the final, and the other 30% is a midterm. You take 2 midterms but she only counts the higher of the two. Lecture is very confusing but she is very nice
I hate the course but Zhe made it easier for all of us. She is more than an instructor! She is a mentor and friend! Her lectures were so clear and so helpful. I like her personality.

She is one of the best professors I have ever had. If she were half as good of a teacher I still would have given her a 5.0 rating. Always willing to go over examples until everyone understands, and takes feedback about her teaching and testing. Good lecturer, fair grader, amazing person. Take a class with her if you ever can!

Nice instructor! Zhe always gives examples on the material. Very clear lecture, but lots of notes. She has tutoring hours. I went to her tutoring session once, she was patient and helped me prepare the midterm for hours.

I wasn't looking forward to taking micro with him because of the reviews, but he's great! Class was hella boring because it's just lectures, but his notes are super organized and he posts them online, so you don't really have to go to class. He makes concepts super simple, like your friend is teaching it to you.

Lectures were very dry, but overall an easy A. I had him as his first semester of teaching, and everything was online. Mindtap homework wasn't bad, and the quizzes were online and could be taken outside of class. Quizzes were completely different from Mindtap homework and was a lot more definition based. Boring lectures, but organized very well.

Prof Wood is very knowledgeable about the subject matter and loves what he does. He was organized with his notes and had a similar style of teaching each class. Lectures were extremely organized with the information presented in a sequential, easy to follow way. I also liked how the tests were online and could be done on your own.

He is sooooo boring. Worst lecturer ever. He often gets confused and has that classic grad student ego. Mindtap homework and exams that aren't too bad, textbook is expensive though. His lectures often leave you more confused than when you walked in, the textbook is much more helpful.

It's been a few years, but I've returned to say this. Prof. Adams is a good professor. I regret that he did not teach for the whole semester (Prof. Turchin is not terrible but certainly doesn't measure up to Adams). His classes were informative and he was clear with what we should study. The lab portion was very decent, too. He's a solid choice.

Let's face it. Eldridge is the man. He is a very knowledgeable person with tons of research experience. Very passionate about what he does. The course is very interesting and pretty manageable: 3 exams, 2 papers, and participation points/attendance is based on the clicker questions. Sad it's over.

My favorite class at the university so far. Adams is very interested in what he does as well as his students success. He has a good sense of humor and really works with the class to see what they need help with. I wish I could take more classes with him! Great guy!
No Comments
Lectures were not great. He does not explain things clearly and most of the time I had to rely on the textbook to understand the topics.
best professor!

Speaks really soft, sit towards the front of the class. He's foreign and speaks super fast so sometimes he could be hard to understand. But he prepares you for the exams if you understand the material attend class.
Hard exams, but excellent teacher. Take his class at any chance.

Great TA and person. She was always looking to help students and provide chances for feedback before submitting an assignment. I believed she was very fair and sweet. Would definitely recommend this TA.
shes so sweet and funny! one of the best professors this sad school has hired. her quizzes are easy and the final is a group project!
Sara clearly has a passion for teaching and a passion for WGSS. She is a wonderful lecturer and her content is engaging and informational. I LOVED the class.
lost group works, irresponsible, harsher than professor as a TA
I have learned a lot about practical computational biology skills through hands-on activities!!!!

Dr. Lee really went above and beyond teaching this semester. He clearly knows his stuff and conveys it really well to the class and he's probably been my favorite professor so far. Assignments are straightforward and he's incredibly accessible outside of class, even late night when you email him. Take this class if you have a chance!

Amazing professor. Class is super interesting and he knows the material better than just about any professor I've had. No textbook. He breaks everything down in step by step tutorials with pictures and text descriptions. It can still take a few classes to get used to, but once you are it's super easy to follow. I wish he taught more classes.
Dr. Lee is the best. If you have the option to take a class with him you should. He has been my favorite professor I've had at UConn so far. All around great guy who really cares about his students.
Professor Diplock was awesome! He had lots of long lectures, but his lectures kept me engaged the whole time and gave lots of great advice for managers.

The class runs from 6-9 but it usually doesn't feel like three hours or he lets you out early anyways. He did several group activities that made learning the material fun and he is a very understanding guy. There is a midterm, a final, and a writing assignment but he is a relatively lenient grader. I recommend taking any class with him

I had a 6:30-9pm class with Prof Diplock and usually he would use up the entire class time but I didn't even mind much. The class involves a lot of interactive group assignments opposed to being lecture heavy. That being said, the lectures he gave sometimes dragged on but it wasn't often. Graded on midterm, final, final project, and participation.

Probably the best course I have taken at UConn. The professor really wants to see all students do well and cares about each one. I asked for an extension on the final because I was struggling to get it done in time and he gave it to me no questions asked. Coursework is interesting and you will learn a lot about your own learning styles, great class

She was accessible outside of class but mainly through Piazza. Lectures and notes are available after class which was helpful. Many assignments throughout the week that have different due dates but it's not too confusing.

Extremely flexible and understanding. Also gives extra credit for neat work. Hw, exams, and final are all worth the same percentage so it is easy to get a good grade in the class if you do your hw. Lectures are somewhat difficult to understand but they are all recorded so you can go back and listen again if needed.

Very fair teacher. She teaches the material to the best of her ability and will take any opportunity to help clarify or help students out. On a personal note, she is extremely understanding and chill. Just show up and pay attention in class and meet the deadlines for homework and worksheets and you'll be fine. I also recommend taking notes!

alright, lectures were just all over the place so hard to follow. but, she recorded them so you can go back and make sure you get everything. the textbook came in handy bc it explained things better when i was confused. not a huge workload but just make sure to keep up w the content. she gives a little extra credit for early hw and neat worksheets.

Professor Kaufmann was delightful. You can tell he's really excited about the material and it makes everybody else engaged in the material. If you speak another language he'll love talking to you about it. He gave us a couple quizzes just to motivate people to show up, but they were easy and fun. One of my favorite courses I've taken at UConn.

Sigh. He is a really nice guy, but a horrible professor. It is so hard to follow him, if you miss one class you're basically done for, and he has trouble elaborating. If you don't understand the ins and outs of computer science, he won't explain them to you. I've never used this website but I want to warn you- don't take his class.

I've taken two courses with Professor Kaufmann and had a difficult time with the material/class both times. He seems like a nice guy, but his method of teaching and explaining things can be very confusing even when you ask for clarification. He tends to be slow in responding to emails, so you may have to find help elsewhere.

Kaufmann gives new meaning to the phrase "clear as mud". He is one of those professors who says "there is no one right answer" but then marks whatever you put as incorrect. His lectures are boring and monotonous. The slides are confusing. The exams are hard. Don't take this class with him unless you have to.

Not too many assignments so it is not a difficult class. But, he grades a little harshly and does not have rubrics. Recommend taking other math writing classes. Only one class was spent on the paper and it was just for the thesis. Nice professor, always willing to help, but his grading style seems a little arbitrary.

Class is easy in the sense that it is not a ton of work but he does not give rubrics for any assignments and it feels like he makes up grades. Also you spend most of the class not working on anything related to the final paper. No matter how much work you put in, your grade will likely be based off what he is feeling like giving.
Great Professor, fair grading and pretty easy class! Really cares about students and feedback and super helpful in office hours!!Group projects, assignments and exams made up your grade.

Professor Camilli is incredibly understanding and committed to student success. I wont lie - the class is hard, but all tests and exams are completely reasonable. If you do the homework and practice problems, all questions make sense. If you have any problems, office hours are incredibly helpful for class and life advice. Highly recommend.
God flips a coin whenever Kovacs teaches a class. You either get a very helpful very easy to talk to Kovacs, or someone who doesn't really help at all.

A hard class taught by a guy who knows its a hard class. Did his best to encourage us throughout the whole semester and did the best he could with the time that was allotted. Be prepared to go to office hours if you plan to do well. Overall the class is pretty hard if you don't have a good grasp of the concepts but you won't be the only one.

Some pros is that he understands that the homework is too hard but explains that he would like them to be easier but is not in control. He really wants you to succeed, and tries to remove questions from the tests that was too hard. Seems like a decent person overall. The only cons I can say is that he goes through his lecture slides fast.

Gabe was my physics TA for the lab and he was great. I am not a fan of physics but he made it interesting and manageable! He is a fair grader and goes above and beyond with helping students to succeed in the class. Definitely would recommend!

Professor Gallaher was respectful and kind. He has a passion for what he teaches, but he reads right off the dozens of slides he goes through for each lecture, the material is boring, & his tone is dull.

Fall 2022 was his first time as a professor so it wasn't perfect, but he was open to suggestions. Lectures aren't mandatory but he doesn't post the slides which have all the information you need, unless you read the textbook. Not many homework assignments and a weekly open note quiz, but the midterm/final were closed note and on paper.
Pretty easy class he just talks the whole lecture. We had weekly quiz, 4 assignments and 2 tests.

Pretty average teacher overall. He has a passion for what he teaches, but he reads right off the dozens of slides he goes through for each lecture, the material is boring, & his tone is dull. Nice person, responds quickly to emails. No hw besides 4 assignments over the semester. Easy open book/note quizzes, difficult multiple choice midterm/final.

Prof Baloria is one of the only professors to ever make me feel like he actually cared about me. He made an effort to know his students, and support them as often, and best as he could. That being said, the course content is very difficult, and 75% of your grade is test based. I highly recommend going to class, as he often does practice problems

This course is hard. Since the tests are the same for all sections, your prof. matters. Prof. Baloria is kind and makes an effort to get to know everyone. He is also very passionate about the subject. But, I did find him confusing at times and found that sometimes he moved very quickly through content. Great guy, but wouldn't take again personally.

The course content is a little difficult, but he makes it really easy and engaging to learn and tries his hardest to make sure you understand the content. He's very passionate and his classes are never boring. The course is test-heavy, but that's by the design of the department. Overall, fantastic professor.

He's a likeable guy. Makes the lectures engaging and funny, and also teaches you the information well. Often in class we run through practice problems, and it is easy to follow along and learn the concepts for the exam. Definitely my favorite professor I've had at the Business school so far.

John Dunn is the best professor for this class. There are 4 exams on paper that are open notes and easy to pass. His lectures are very good and he has a lot of knowledge. You shouldn't have a problem understanding the material and passing the class. I recommend this professor!

Prof Dunn class is one of the easiest classes to pass. There are only 4 test that you are graded on which make up your whole grade. The test are open notes and laptops, he says that you can google the questions during the test as well. The classes can be boring at times but worth it for the easy grade. He is a teacher that actually cares about you.
The class was extremely easy. Tests are open laptop and notes. He cares about the students and is happy to help.
Professor was pretty funny. Only 4 exams all open laptop, open book, open teacher lol. I stopped showing up after about 10 classes and only showed up for exams. Ended with an A.

Professor Zheng is a great professor. However, his 2 tests were very challenging - too many questions, and his practice exams covered 50% of what you will see on the test. His lectures are good and he was available during office hours - it was worth it to go, especially going over the homework. I like him, but he should prepare students for tests.
Very good professor, does go a bit fast in lectures but he cares a lot about his students. 100% go to office hours!

I think he is a really great professor. He is very easygoing and cares about the content that he is teaching. He is a new professor and takes feedback from the class on HW/ grading adjustments etc. Just make sure that you do really well on the stock market game and have above avg returns or else u might do bad on it ex. get 5% return or better.

His lectures were too fast and hard to learn from in the beginning, but he took our feedback after the midterm and made them concise and clearer. Open note midterm and final, 12 Connect quizzes, and a stock market simulator group project with a report paper. He grades hard for the project, but final grades were curved based on overall class grades.

He is an AMAZING professor. He was very funny and engaging. We only had a midterm exam and a final paper. He mainly grades on participation and group projects, which was always super easy. He's my favorite professor in the PoliSci department so far! I definitely recommend taking a class taught by him at some point. He's the BEST!

Wayne is the best! He will call you out if you call him Prof Lavender so just call him Wayne. In a class that was approaching controversial topics, he did a great job at acknowledging both political sides and all religions. One midterm and final research paper but you get to pick your topic. Take his class if you can, even for fun.. so helpful!

Professor Lavender is super engaging. He is funny and makes sure to ask students their opinions during class discussions. The topics of discussion are very relevant to what is going on in politics today. There is one midterm, which is pretty easy, and a final essay, but it is interesting because you can choose your own topic.

If you haven't taken Wayne I'm sorry for you. He is EASILY the best professor I had this semester, and in PoliSci in general. He is super cool and extremely flexible. Does a lot of group presentations. Did one recently, it was the same time as my enrollment opened and he waited until I was enrolled in class to start presentations. THE BEST!
Len is, hands down, the best. Take his classes while you can. Be prepared to think when you come to class.

Len teaches mainly social philosophy, with a concentration on political and economic thought and theory. I took every class this man has to offer AND did an independent study under him. By far my favorite professor; he conducted his classes as a dialogue, where he facilitated discussion but his views were no more important than his students. Looked

May still be teaching classes, but I'm not sure. Very interesting and fun professer.. I ended up taking every class he offered over my years at uconn. Great discussions, and relevant topics. If he's still around, definatly take his class!

he is a really horrible teacher, he doesn't explain well, Its hard understand in the class. If you ask him questions, its will only waste your time, It seems like he does not how to do it. He is grading really carefully. he is not help at all for final and exams.

Horrible profesor. Bad lecturer-talks into the board, and rarely make eye contact with the class. Assigns homework as only 10% of the grade, and only checks two problems. Tests are un fair.Only five questions each,one of which is usually impossible. Doesn't care about students' success- This is already a hard class, don't take it with Hamilton
he didnt go over things very well. The proofs were not explained well, and his homework, although it covered material, was not easy. This course is not easy.

Mike is such a good professor who clearly cares about his students. His lectures are really good and he tries to make the course material interesting for all of his students. He clearly cares, and the course itself is very cool. If you have the chance to, TAKE A CLASS WITH MIKE!

Dr. Dietz is really nice. I was't thinking water quality management would inspire me but he made it a meaningful experience. After homeowner water qual issues lecture, heard him offer to help someone get their water tested. Really uses the natural resources of the uconn and wants everyone to succeed - go to class & do assignments & you'll do well.

Prof Dietz is a fantastic professor. His lectures are interesting and he's a genuinely nice person that cares about all of his students. If you need any courses and you see he teaches them, I highly recommend taking his class. Open communication lines at all times if you ever have any issues. One of the great professors at UConn

He is a very nice guy. Sometimes the lectures are hard to follow because he just writes code on the projector. He wrote the textbook and gives a pdf. The homeworks are pretty much from the book but pretty hard. Tests are almost identical to the practice exams. He is a lenient grader. The final project is a lot of work if you save it for last minute

A little hard to understand, but the textbook (written by him, by the way) is really all you need to do well. Follow along in the book as well as what he does on the board and everything should be clear. The final project is most of the grade and as long as you do exactly what he asks you'll do well. Also exams are exactly like the practice exams!

You can barely understand this professor, but when you go to class you can follow the work he does on the board. This is helpful as notes for homework and tests, but is also something you can learn on your own.

Only got through 1/2 of the lecture slides every class(be prepared to learn on your own). 3 exams and 3 projects w/ a grading scale where each exam was 15% and each project 5% or vice versa depending on what you did better on. Exams/projects were hard but lots of partial credit, and could earn 12% extra to the total grade from extra credit work.

Dr. Filipovska is probably one of the best professors I have had. She is clearly so passionate about the material, and it really rubs off on the students. However, you HAVE to do your work. Most of the class grade is easily earned (graded based on completion, etc.), so it's quite easy to get B+ or above. If you want the A+, you will need to work.

Whereas Monika was a distasteful person to interact with this year, she was brand new and did everything "by the book". With time, she can be a good professor. For this class though, it was hard. Lots of group projects, but if you enjoyed CE 2710, this is a perfect class for you. HW is very hard, exams are ok, and lectures are long to sit through.

I took 1102 with Christine and she was super accommodating throughout the entire course. We were graded off of three major projects that we each spent ~1 month on each, and she helped critique us along the way. She is always very energetic, friendly, and ready to help you with your projects.

Professor is decent and has interesting projects for the class. Sometimes feedback can be something unexpected things though. Lectures are well presented. Glad that she is very accessible outside of class.

Christine really knows what she's talking about when it comes to HTML and CSS and can really help you learn better design techniques. She tries to keep class fun and interesting and lets you work at your own pace. If you follow instructions and ask for feedback , you'll likely get a good grade. She also lets you revise to get points back.

The grading is unnecessarily strict for the level of the class she is teaching in my perspective. If you want to be a fully skilled (on the requirements she wants but meaningless) student, you can take her class.

Great professor with straight forward lectures. If you show up to class and study the lectures the exams are easy. The information comes right from the power point slides, so there is no need to read the textbook. Overall easy class.

Kate is a really awesome, relatable person. However, she was an extremely tough grader on papers and exams. Her exams are mostly multiple choice with two short answer questions. The exam questions were super wordy and made little sense, which was an issue because most of your grade is based on the exams. Lectures were interesting and she's funny.

Graham is a nice guy but his class is very tough. He grades extremely tough and the grading criteria is often hard to understand. He gives very detailed notes/comments on essays, but often times it seems that changing the things he recommends does not produce a better grade, which is frustrating. Be ready for a difficult English course.

The topic of his class centers around comedy, which is a good topic that everyone can enjoy. A bit dry to start analyzing the mechanics of humor, but gets going quickly. Grades fairly, though effort is required, isn't terribly tough, but gives great feedback on papers and will make you a better writer.

Nice guy but I feel as though he teaches this course to be more difficult than other professors do, which is pretty annoying. I consider myself to be a fairly decent writer and all of my friends that are self-proclaimed "poor" writers are getting better grades in this course with other professors.

You can tell he is passionate about the stuff he is teaching. Even though it's a W, the writing requirements aren't too bad, mostly just reflections. Lots of group work, mostly just discussions to share ideas, but he does expect you to participate. Lots of reading, but you can often get away with just reading the Sparknotes.

One of my favorite professors at Uconn. Clearly passionate about the subject matter and that makes the class so much more enjoyable. You are expected to be present and participate. If you come to class prepared to be engaged it is incredibly enjoyable.

Attendance is expected, but participation is graded many ways (assignments, hw, group talk, raising hand) etc. He takes time to explain what he wants you to know & adapts the class to how the class discussions evolve. There's no set textbook, and he uploads mandatory readings online (free). No midterm/final, you're graded on participation & papers.

He teaches at Oakland University now, and HE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD! He teaches you material and reviews it everyday that you never have to go home and study because you already have it memorized by exam time! Take him if you want an easy 300 level class full of interesting information, and an awesome and very bright professor!

He was the best professor I had at the University of Connecticut but unfortunately is gone. Really knows his stuff, gives fascinating lectures, very human--relates well to students, hates textbooks and always has students read interesting books. Challenging but fair. Great guy, great professor.

He can be intimidating at first, but once you get through the first paper, the class is fine. He tries to scare you a little and tell you that your paper will probably be terrible, but he's a fair grader and if you go to his office hours, he'll pretty much tell you everything you need to put in your paper. Very interesting. Good prof!
He is super funny and reallyyyy cute. His class was a lot of fun and he understands we have other priorities. Excellent teacher though!

great teacher...never had class the whole time, let us out 30 mins early every time, SOOO funny and cute, exams are a little tough but he gives out 20 points extra credit on an exam, he is very flexible and if the majority of the class isn't ready for the test he will move it, overall AWESOME GUY TAKE HIM!!!

He is so funny & not bad to look at either. Really interested in what he teaches and tries to make class fun and interesting. His exams are a little tough, you definately have to read and understand the powerpoints but overal its a great class. Top 5 favorite Ive taken at Uconn!

Very helpful instructor. Gives clear instructions (if you're paying attention). She notices if you're not trying, but she treats everyone fairly regardless. Can't say I'd do the same. Best language professor I've had.
I enjoyed her class. It was very difficult but she is very aware and understanding of the pace.

Maureen is very helpful to students who show effort. Some students were frustrated with the pace of the class and with the strict no-English-in-class policy. But hers is a very manageable class if one goes to lecture and participates. If you want a good grade, you'll have to do the online homework assignments. But these are helpful anyway.
Awesome

Makes the class interesting, even though you have to commit to do all the work, and it's not that easy, but taking class with her motivates me to do work, and improve, one of the best professor here at uconn

She didn't have us buy textbooks, but instead, gave us course packets. The readings were interesting and relevant to everyday life. Even though this was just a gen. ed, it was one of the best classes I ever took, and she was the best professor I have ever had.

She's nice, not helpful. Have emergency? she doesn't care. Don't erase a pencil line drop grade. She mess with your grade/GPA and say 'oh it doesn't mean you did bad'. But, when a transfer college sees it I'm screwed. She likes to control what you do. I rather do me than let anyone dictate who I should be. It's Art not Math
She's great. Very nice and easygoing, and is very skilled at drawing.

Although she is not truly a professor, and is working to get her masters in Fine Arts she is great at teaching printmaking, as well as producing masterful prints. Yelizaveta is very clear and fair in her grading schemes and takes the time to get to know her students in order to help them succeed.

Good professor, he gives a lot of notes but its very helpful when studying. Online homework are kinda hard, make sure to do them, its a big part of your grade. Tests are very hard, you need to study a lot. Also, you can't skip class, he gives a lot of notes and doesnt post them. Gives extra credit randomly if you show up to class.

Steve is the man. The material can get tough but if you have questions he is very available to help you out. He really wants all his students to do well. If you show up the class is pretty easy. Gives extra credit too. Definitely the best finance 3101 teacher.

Steve is a great teacher, he clearly spends a lot of time on his lectures and they are super helpful. If you pay attention and go to class the tests are very easy, he gives out great review sheets for each test. If you go to class he randomly takes attendance and then you get extra credit. One of the best teachers I've had in the business school.

I wouldn't take this class if I were you, it's set up terribly. There are quizzes online where you have 5 minutes for 5 questions. I would study the chapter and still do bad, they're not easy. There is a midterm and a final and both have only 15 questions on them, they cover an entire book each. I've also emailed him twice and he's never responded.

Andrew Rose is a great professor. Hes genuinely a nice guy and treats all his students fairly. He is always open to input and loves when you engage in class discussions. He has 2 exams (midterm and final), both were easy as long you review the power points that he even posts online; and a final project. I definitely recommend you take this class!

Professor Rose is great. he requires reading quizzes (probably about 5), a project, (which he lets you choose), and 2 exams( a midterm and a final). He bases his grade off of points which is way better than percentages and weightings because it allows you to do better. Overall the class is pretty easy. He posts all his powerpoints online too.
He doesn't require the book and you just need to study the lectures. He's a funny guy, easy going.
Class attendance is optional. Powerpoints are super descriptive and all you need to get an A in the class. Hes young and hot and a genius.
Alex is one of my favorite professors at UConn. If you can take him, definitely do it!
Great teacher, only had her for a one credit course but it helped me a lot and she was always very helpful and a great person.

GREAT professor. 3 exams, 25% of grade and a group project (25%). need to go to class for the slides. enthusiastic, interesting. EXTREMELY HELPFUL. can tell she actually enjoys teaching. exams are straightforward - if you study you will get an A. multiple EASY ex. credit opportunities throughout semester that can give you 5 pts on your avg!
shes really nice and her assignments are easy. The biggest project in the class though is a group project, and it is sort of fun because it involves a scavenger hunt.

Outlines online, Paper due every week on reading but its 2 pages double spaces and only need to do 7 out of 12. 5 books to read (dont need to read whole things though, just the part where the answer to the reading response is) Take home midterm. Easy A for anthro majors.
Good teacher pretty easy class she puts the lecture outlines online but you still need to go to class to fill em out. Tests are pretty straightforward but class can get a little boring
class is very straightforward, only one form: lecture with powerpoint. usually gets out early. material is very clear and easy to understand; professor seems frequently irritated with students

great professor, extremely interesting, easily my favorite class and i had absolutely no prior interest. very easy to get a good grade, lots of opportunities for extra credit and help. highly reccomended
It was fairly easy. You need to read your textbook and attend class. She goes through a lot during class so be prepared to take lots of notes. She also gives out extra credit.

i probably should have done better, but really uninteresting class. not a hard class, but not as easy as you think it's gonna be. prof. is ok, doesn't hold interest well, but you get the feeling she wishes she was an actual dinosaur. you'll get what i mean if you take this course...

DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS! It's pointless. He doesn't use HuskyCT so you have to go get printouts of the slides and then listen to him read off them exceedingly slowly for 50mins. The class says it's about different languages; we didn't even start world languages until the last three weeks and NEVER used the book. TA was the only way I got info.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! It makes no sense and you wont learn anything. One exam is 40% of your grade and there's no real way to study for it. It wasn't hard but it was a waste of my life.
odd class, not cohesive at all, did not learn any linguistics

So easy! Midterm and final were the same format. 3 2-page essays on 3 different topics from lecture. and a 10pg final paper. that's it! She takes attendance, but it's not necessary at all. The class focused on topics and movements (we focused on Modern art more than Contemp), so you didn't need to memorize ANYTHING. great class.

She's very kind, has a dry sense of humor, and makes her course requirements very clear. No tricks whatsoever. Exams are typically take-home, and you need to write a ten-page term paper. She's a pioneering researcher in the field of Asian-American art, so if you're an aspiring art historian, you can learn a lot from her. Highly recommended.

She is such a great lady, very kind, and really does love the subject. Her exams are pretty easy and straight forward, 3 essays you can plan ahead, and then for the class, one ten page research paper and thats it. so really not bad and she is really helpful if you need it.

He's a really nice guy willing to work with students. There are two writing assignments , 4 quizzes and a presentation. Not an overload on work for a writing class. He's a good dude and I would recommend.

Bryan is a really nice guy. The class consists of pop quizzes, a few problem sets, a research assignment, and exams. The workload is completely doable, but sometimes lecture can drag on because of the extensive notes. You need to go to class because the notes aren''t online and there are pop quizzes! The exams are great, just use the study guide!

Vanco's a really nice guy, I like him a lot. He's sincere and even though this class is required for the major and has a huge amount of material that you have to know for it, it's manageable. If you have to take this, definitely take it with Vanco, he's always happy to help.

Easy obtainable A. She posts the lecture notes online (easy to read slides), so all you have to do is make sure you have all the information of the lecture notes in your own notes, and you'll get an A on the quizzes cause they're open note. Then the exams are very similar to the practice ones.

I got an A by putting minimal effort in and skipping many classes, but that's only because I was familiar with a lot of the material beforehand. For the average person, I would not recommend this teacher. She just goes through the notes like a robot very quickly. You'll have to study a lot outside of class if you don't pick things up quickly.

Ruochen has very sloppy handwriting and doesnt put much of an effort into explaining any of the notes on the board. She also doesnt think to ask questions very often. She moves very quickly and sometimes will rush through topics just to finish them by the end of class. Quizzes and tests are graded fairly but the homework is graded pretty tough.

TAKE THIS CLASS. BEST PROFESSOR This is the easiest class ever. You don't have to do the readings except for the one week you have to present (which you get to pick, so just pick a week without a textbook). You hand in 2 discussion questions @ the end of every class, I wrote them during class.. You keep a journal all year & I got a 100 on it #EASY

Best professor Ive ever taken. She cares about her students and has little emphasis on tests because she hates the way it stresses students out. She just wants you to be open and comfortable in her class. It was very easy and a class that you'll want to go to

Best professor I have ever had, she really cares about students and wants you to succeed. Very little homework involved, exams are very easy. Final was just drawing a picture and writing about it. Not the most interesting class, but she tries. Wish I could take another class with her!

She teaches at Central Connecticut for the introductory management course, good professor. Has a bit of an accent but is easy to understand. Her class criteria is clear and gives you all the information you need to do well on her exams.

Hyoun-Sook is an awesome professor. She's very nice and friendly. The class is an easy A. You get a cheat sheet for the midterm. The final was a a take-home, 2pg single spaced write-up. Posts all her slides online but it's still good to go to class to get participation points; lots of group activities. Speaks with an accent but it's comprehensible.

She's easy and nice. Her accent is pretty thick, but you can just ask her to repeat herself and she doesn't mind. A LOT of in class exercises. For the tests she gives you a note card which you can just fill up with anything. Group project that she grades really easy too. Uses the book a lot.

She is probably one of the best professors I ever had. She is very passionate about the subject that she teaches. Also, she does do clickers for participation which is a big part of your grade. Also, she is known to give extra credit.

So she finally uploads power points. So following along is easy! Her exams are easy as long as you study the power points and come to class because sometimes she shows videos and gives examples that will be on the exam that cannot be found on power points. As for textbook, you don't really have to read it since power points are detailed.

Doesn't upload full powerpoints online which forces you to take copy down all the slides she shows, which is impossible because she goes through it too fast! She said everything is fair game on exams powerpoints, book and anything she mentions in class which is unfair because you can't take notes of the slide and listen to her side stories.
Very interested in herself
No Comments
No Comments
best instructor i've ever had!
Wow, what a professor...
Awesome guy. Our Journey begins with Matt Farley

She is a great instructor! She motivates participation, the lectures are interesting, and she is so nice! You have to do the readings for every class and attend lectures to really know all the answers to the exam, since the most important points about the readings is what she talks about.

I had her for sociology of sexuality. The class was great, the material was very interesting and you learn a lot. All you have to do is read and get a good deal of the material, her tests are essays so you have to actually learn. She is a fun teacher and makes you come to class. She does come late a lot though but she's funny so it don't matter.

Natalie is hot and smart. She is passionate regarding sexuality and she is the best candidate to teach sociology of sexuality. She is well organized and fun. If you go to every class, take notes and read, you will ace the class.

She really cares for students and wants you to learn precalculus in order to prep you for Calc I - I'm doing much better than my friends who didn't take precalculus in college! However, the class requires that you do the work, do hw and prep for tests. Overall smart, attractive prof that will help you get up to speed in maths

Best teacher I ever had. Math is not my favorite subject, but she made it actually fun. She is very willing to help if you are having any trouble, and is easy to understand. It also doesn't hurt she's hott ;)
Whitney's awesome. If you get the chance, take her classes. She's extremely clear, helpful, and interested in the students. She also easy on the eyes :P

Easy class and he knows it. Quizzes are multiple choice and are actually harder than the exams, which he gives you a study sheet AND allows a notecard! If you don;t get an A on his exams then just drop out haha. You don't really need the book and he knows no one reads. Funny, corny guy that makes a dry class at least somewhat interesting.
Amazing professor, biggest nerd ever and loves history, but you will learn nothing about history. Easiest A of the semester!

He wanted me to give him a hot tomali, he really isnt hot. Funny professor, usually about 1000 years behind schedule. You will learn nothing about ancient history. I thought I would hate this class at first, but his tangents make this class worth it.

Although it's difficult to teach excel, access, and VBA, Jim really tries his best to teach the material. Class is easy, you have assignments every other class, and he basically walks you through them. The midterm and final were easy as long as you pay attention in class. I actually learned a good amount in his class, contrary to what others say.

Jim's a great professor. However, be mindful that the class is no cake walk. The assignments are fair work. The midterms and final exam actually require you to study and do actual work. If you follow everything in class and pay attention, then there should be no reason for you not to get a good grade in the class.

Some students complain, but as long as you go to class and pay attention, you'll do well. He does give a couple online quizzes each semester, but he literally gives you most of the answers in class before it's due. So just go and pay attention. In-class assignments are automatic 100% as long as you are in-class. there is no reason to do poorly.

Highly recommend. Have never liked taking Spanish classes but this was by far my favorite class this semester. He makes class enjoyable and Spanish easy to understand. Wants his students to learn and succeed.
