Ivan is a fantastic instructor. He's very helpful and wants you to succeed. I would love to take this class again with him.

Ivan is an excellent Spanish teacher; friendly, entertaining, does a great job conducting group work and discussions, a good explainer. He's helpful and approachable so that you won't ever feel stupid asking questions or making honest mistakes. His class is easy insofar as if you try you'll definitely learn. I would definitely recommend his class.
Enjoying her class a lot. There is a fair amount of preparation and reading, but the class is interesting and I'm learning a lot.
Really good TA. Makes the class enjoyable when it might otherwise be boring. Would definitely recommend.
I wasn't expecting to enjoy this lab but it turned out to be pretty interesting. Sarah is a great TA and willing to help as long as you put in the time.

This course provides an effective learning experience. I enjoy small group discussions on readings/film materials in class. I also like the online part which makes the course more interesting and engaging. I struggled with writing a 15-page research paper but I have made a lot of improvements. The one-on-one tutorial meeting is definitely helpful.

This class is good, professor is not so much. She is awkward and very dry during lectures, but this class was a hybrid with an online session once a week. As long as you do the assignments, it's an easy A. Only real work that needs to be done is your research paper which is split up into three parts throughout the semester to amount to 15 pages.

Quizzes based on textbook reading (which are open book and very easy). 15-page paper due but is split and spaced comfortably throughout the class. Grades easy. Up to 5% of your grade can be added through extra credit. Class is canceled 3 weeks to meet with her for 20 mins each week. Occasionally awkward lectures but overall I would recommend!

Professor Roth is great! Brings in a lot of his real-world experience into his lectures. The class is super interesting - I'm not premed or in the philosophy field but I found it to be super valuable. There are few grades - supposed to be 6 quizzes (drops the lowest grade) but we only had 3, one exam, one paper, and a graded discussion.

Professor Roth is great and I really enjoyed his class! Beneficial for anyone interested in going into healthcare. Professor Roth makes the class interesting by discussing actual healthcare issues and how to make a good argument for what is good and bad. You can tell he really wants students to succeed and understand -I am going to miss this class!

He recently came to UConn from Cal. State Fullerton, but he fits in well. Lectures are just going over the chapters assigned in the book, so going to lecture provides strong supplementary material. Readings are short and manageable (one chapter a week). Quizzes are straight-forward if you read the book and somewhat understand the material.

This class is terrible. To start, you can not understand the professor and his work on the board. He seems to be proving random stuff and his work seems random, even though it should make sense. I've asked for clarifications in class as well but to no avail. And don't think it's an easy class. Boat loads of homework every week with a quiz too.
Professor Akman cares about student, although he does not show it directly. His class is hard for me, but if you actively reach out to him, he is happy to help you.

Professor Akman cares about what he is teaching and is willing to help those who are ready to learn. Class lectures are very important and it is crucial that you follow along. Murat is most helpful during office hours, I suggest you put as much effort as you can into homework assignments and practice problems then go in to ask questions one-on-one.

I LOVE SARAH! Definitely my fav prof. Cares about not only how you're doing in class but also you as a person. Makes class interesting and engaging, and she is very passionate. She is accessible and always willing to talk. I learned so much from this class and would def recommend for anyone going into NEAG!

Sarah is such a great professor! She's extremely kind and cares so much about her students. Her workload is very manageable and will give you an extension if you need it. She also gives a lot of work days where there's no class so you have time to work on an assignment. She's always open to feedback and wants to help you succeed.

Love Sarah! Super caring. She always asks for feedback on her workload and will give extensions if you ask. Sometimes there was a lot of reading or videos to watch outside of class, but she fixed that when she saw our feedback survey. She gives extra credit too, but you shouldn't really need it because she makes sure that you won't fail.

I would highly recommend taking MKTG3101 with Justin! I had a really great experience in this class and learned a lot. He knows how to teach very while being engaging, and you definitely won't be bored in this class.

This man is a 10/10. Literally so funny, down to earth, actually teaches, cares about his students and if theres ever any questions or issues is happy to answer in class or over email. Class is pretty simple, and you dont have to go to everyone to do well. Just put in your best effort and youll for sure do great. Def take with him!!

Justin has to be one of the best professors. I have a tiny bias towards marketing of course, but as a professor, he is amazing. The content for MKTG 3101 is based off Kelly Herd but he follows her grading requirements and tries to make it much easier on us while making sure we keep up on the group projects and such. If given the opportunity, do it.

Is unclear about what will be on the quizzes. You have to go to class all the questions for the quizzes are small details from the powerpoints. He goes through them very quickly. I recommend bringing a laptop to class. The assignments are easy and he gives extra credit opportunities.

Good teacher. Quizzes are worth a lot more than anything else, so study hard for them, theyre fairly easy if you study the notes and go over the chapters in the book. Two easily graded projects. and the finals worth way less than the quizzes. Good teacher, fairly easy class. Only downside is he considers a 95 an A

Lectures done by Powerpoint, posted a day before class, however lectures were VERY speedy. It was hard to write down everything he discussed sometimes. Yet, the weekly short answer quizzes were good for your grade. Put in all the effort on the quizzes as they're weighted MUCH more than the final. Interesting class, but I studied a lot for quizzes.

She barely gives feedback of each essay, and every time I email her she will tell me that she is on the train to travel or what. Besides, she gives grades of all essay at the end of the semester, you choose this class means you need to be your own professor, yes, she even do not show in office hour.
She's a supportive and kind professor. She gives feedback and helps you through all parts of your work. The only issue I have is the amount of homework.
Incredibly sweet and understanding, willing to work with you to salvage your grade, and an overall great teacher

Professor Dojcinovic is a great professor, extremely accessible outside of the class. You write a discussion board weekly, you have a midterm exam which is completely multiple choice, and the final exam is multiple choice with two essay questions. Class was extremely easy highly recommend taking him.
This class was online since he lives in the Netherlands. There are discussion boards every week and video filled modules. I didn't mind the class at all.

I took this class online asynchronous. The prof is literally a former prosecutor for the ICC and the coolest person ever. Class is comically easy, with weekly short discussion posts and two exams with questions straight from the lecture recordings. Take this for a very engaging and low stress HRTS.

A new Professor, had to withdraw from his class because I did not have time to teach myself the material on top of my other coursework. Be warned that his slides do not go into enough depth, and frequently required me to just seek the information elsewhere. Note, I have no experience with his exams.

Very inexperienced professor. Doesn't explain concepts during lecture and slides aren't descriptive so you have to teach yourself material. Wastes lecture time writing long unnecessary proofs. Exam / HW / quiz questions often ask things barely covered in slides. 2 stars b/c exams were heavily curved so most students passed despite failing raw avg.

This is the worst professor, couldn't teach at all, didn't know how to explain the knowledge, totally unprepared for lecture There are always knowledge that has not been explained at all in quiz exam. Average exam scores was only 7 and 11. don't want him to explain anything Probably know it himself,but can't explain to youMake suredon'ttakehisclass

Professor Brick is a great choice for MKTG 3260. Her class is out of 1,000 points which gives you a lot of wiggle room throughout the semester. Class participation is mandatory and the group project can be stressful. Tests are relatively fair (all MC) and the classes are pretty lecture-heavy. The weekly discussion posts can be tedious.

I LOVE BRICK. I'm not the smartest student but her material was really easy for me to understand. The main thing I would recommend for this class is to actually be on top of the group project because it carries a lot of weight. I was nervous about this class being too hard, but she is easy to learn from and her exams aren't hard.

Professor Brick is a genuinely nice person who clearly cares about the material. Seems a bit disconnected from students but is accessible. Prepare to do an activity every class and tedious discussion posts each week, but overall not extremely difficult. Make sure you get a good group for the final project or else you're screwed

What a role model. Professor Tomazos' knowledge of history and linguistics is enviable. He is a genuinely kind and caring person which is rare amongst academics. He is the best of what UConn and our education system has to offer.

Ilias has the sweetest soul and is so kind and caring. He is so passionate about his culture and has amazing stories and lectures. This class was about the culture and history of Greece and it was very interesting! Super easy class. Take this with Ilias!!!

Mr. Tomazos is the best professor I've ever had at the University of Connecticut. The class consisted of mostly Greek students who either were fluent or had prior exposure to the language, but that shouldn't discourage anyone from taking his class. He is so genuine and makes you feel like family. You'll learn so much in a really great environment.

Mr. Ramponi is a very clever, understanding, and effective teacher, and is generally just a great human being. He's very willing to help you out inside or outside of class and he's very friendly and easy to understand.
Mr. Ramponi made this course interesting and easy to come to class. Super relaxed, easy to talk to and is always there to help the students. I could not recommend more.

Mr. Ramponi was one of the best teachers I have had so far in my college career. He's super chill and really understands us students. Either ending class early when we have other assignments due. He explains a lot of his materials clearly and makes the tasks easier given us options. So if you are taking ENGL 1007 take his class!!!

Professor De Paolo-Gagne is an amazing Professor. She truly cares about you as an individual and wants you to suceed. As long as you show up and put an effort she will work with you and assist you as best as she can in your learning.

Very nice lady, however gives alot of work. I think I spent 90% of my Friday nights doing English homework for her class. Instructions can be pretty unclear and difficult to follow. She for the most part is very understanding about late work submissions once you let her know in advance and don't submit late work often.

Avoid this professor for ENGL 1007. Very difficult class with TONS of homework. No other section of 1007 has the amount of work we do. She is a very tough grader and her directions are very confusing. She is a very nice lady and cares for her students, but she is do disorganized and forgets to grade things.

Nice professor, figured out early on lectures were useless as she just read off slides and played videos that she posts anyway. Discussion and journals are mandatory but not time consuming. No quizzes or tests and one final project that took a decent amount of time but easy A.

Very easy A, professor is kind, plays a lot of videos in class and the lectures require a lot of turning and discussing with peers. I didn't go to lecture and just answered the questions on the discussion board and presented my final project online and got an A.

Plays a lot of videos in lectures. No assignments, just discussion boards and a big project at the end. No midterm or final, but you have to participate every day with classmates near you in lecture. If you have a friend, def sit near them. If not, make one so it's less awkward. She's kind, and she's a new professor

Great guy! Very smart and keeps the class entertained. You'll do great if you just keep up with the work and go to class. There's 2 exams, a paper, 5 quizzes, and a posting. Very easy if you like Latin American history
He was a great TA. He would always help students get a good grade in their discussion sections. He was also a fair grader. He also went into great detail about how to do well on the exams.

George is a very nice guy and he really cares about his students. I can tell he is trying very hard to be help us understand the fundamental concepts of FM. He is approachable most of the time outside classroom. Even though his tests could be tough, he will help you set a solid foundation in FM.

George is a funny guy, and he's really prepared for the class. I think that class should be more problem based, but I can say that after taking 2620 I did learn a lot. Make sure not to take class lightly, and put in a lot of work outside of class, otherwise you'll fail the tests. They are extremely hard, and most people end with a C.

So easy. I didn't read anything that was assigned, showed up to most of the lectures took good notes and got an A. She assigned some group projects and papers that are easy to complete if you listen to what she says in class. She's very nice and you could easily tell which guys thought she was hot by how much they participated.

Dr. Kaeb is a fairly new professor to UConn, but her class is nonetheless interesting and focuses a lot on international business (law). There's only one exam, a final, so I can't speak to her assessments, but she really doesn't assign much work aside from a few short essays and some in-class group stuff to prepare for.

Professor D is a strange man, he likes to say fabulous a lot. With that being said he is a very fair grader and even though he can be a little strange and he doesn't make much sense, he makes the class enjoyable. Most of the time you can just sparknote things instead of reading but you need the book for exact quotes.
Fair grader and easy to get extra help if you need it. Be sure to know your poets though.

His office hours are helpful. If you don't understand anything, just go to his office hour to ask. He has good patience and willing to help students. His exam is a bit hard but reasonable. The material for this class is helpful for the future classes.

Only used textbook for HW and he drops the lowest HW grade. Gives test on Saturdays. Yes ... Saturdays. I could have skipped the entire semester & just gone to the schools tutoring session & passed the class since all he did was read the slides word for word & doesn't know how to explain or answer questions. I don't recommend this professor at all

The class consists of discussion board posts with responses to atleast 1 peer every week. Along with a quiz every week and an assignment every other which usually takes about 1-2 hours to complete. No online lectures just content. He is very are to communicate with, hardly answers your questions, very hard grader with no reasoning,do not take him.

David is the rudest, most unprofessional, and difficult professor to take. Not because of the content but the way he grades and interacts with students. He pulls random grades out of literal thin air and never answers any students comments or concerns. He refuses to give out As and doesn't provide reasons for taking off points. DO NOT TAKE HIM.
Tough but fair
Test scores take up almost everything

By no means an easy class. The books he selects are difficult and he has certain expectations as to what you get from reading, but if you go to class and listen to what he has to say, you will learn to really enjoy him as a professor. My grammar will forever be improved because of him and he does a great job of helping students think and learn.

A good guy but a VERY tough grader and he knows it (he calls himself the hardest grader in the UConn English department)! Do NOT take this class if you are looking for an easy A. You WILL need to read the 3 books and take detailed notes from his lectures bc he wants your paper to be exactly how he would write it. Final grade is the avg of 3 papers.

Lauren was an awesome professor. The class was a gen-ed for me but the topics we covered were interesting and it seemed like she encouraged everyone to participate to get different perspectives on what we were talking about. The class was pretty easy and assignments were evenly spaced out. As long as you have a general understanding you'll be good.
Extremely understanding, caring, and genuinely wants you to succeed. One of the best professors I've ever had. Would take her again in a heartbeat.

Professor Fagbemi is the coolest professor I've ever taken. While the lecture is a bit boring, he encourages the whole class to participate. He also gives you two attempts for every exam, including being able to use open notes and OpenStax. I therefore recommend that you take him.

Professor Fagbemi was so kind and sweet. Exams were 80% of the grade but open notes and the two attempts (higher one taken) was so helpful. Attendance was mandatory since it's 5% of your grade and it's helpful to go since he gives some hints for the exams. Take him if you can!

Patrick used old material from someone else who has taught the class. I feel like this class could have been much easier, but he just wrote his lecture notes on the board every single class. Midterm reviews weren't helpful, he made the final extremely difficult. Prepare to teach yourself. Would've given him lower score if he was a harsher grader.

Patrick is a nice guy but a poor teacher. Spent half d lecture time copying his notes unto the board. The material is tough so go to class, and be prepared to put in extra hours studying. He is accessible at office hours or via email though

Dr. Skoe is one of the sweetest human beings here. Super flexible and caring towards students. All her quizzes and tests are online and open notes and her anatomy models really aren't hard or time consuming to make at all. Considering this is a required class for SLHS majors, it was very easy and straightforward. Definently an easy grade booster.

Erika Skoe is one of the best professors I've had at UConn. Not only is she caring and empathetic towards her students, but she makes sure everyone understands the material and is very fair towards grading. She offers lots of opportunities for extra credit! Definitely try to take a class with her at some point!
great except wouldn't let us have class outside. or a field trip

really good and understanding professor, I really enjoyed the lectures. try and show up to most of the classes but you wont be marked off if you miss a class and email him first. not much homework or classwork. if you participate it will be a good time

Professor McDermott expects a lot out of participation from her students so don't take her class if you're uncomfortable speaking in front of a classroom. Definitely do ALL of the readings--summaries will not be enough to get you through your exams because she asks detailed questions. Takes student feedback well, too.
she never comes to class then expects you to understand and recall extremely detailed summaries of plays as if they'd been discussed for weeks. but shes nice
She tries to make it interesting but its boring because nobody wants to watch old french films. Overall she is great.
So easy and she's really nice and knows her stuff.
He's not that bad himself and is clearly a expert in his field but the class itself deals with boring material (farmers, rocks, Thoreau). But if you can take a different Honors Core.
Great professor. AMST 1700 was the best class I've ever taken. Interesting, helpful.

Just a really boring and confusing class. She just starts writing random equations on the board and mumbles stuff. Had no idea what I was doing throughout the whole course but ended up with a B. Take this class with someone else if you want to learn econometrics.

She is very confusing. If her lectures aren't the most boring you have ever heard, then she is definitely in the top ten. She is straight from China and not exactly fluent in English. Exams are tough. On the bright side, she seems like a nice lady, she drops lowest test score, and exams are mostly multiple choice (but they are tough questions).
Very devoted teacher, was very well prepared. Cared about the students.

really nice lady.. she tries... or at least makes it seem like she does. bad teacher though. it's almost like everyone of her classes is a review for something we're already supposed to know. and then you'll ask her a question, and it's like she's purposefully withholding her knowledge from you.. like she's greedy and doesnt want you to know it.

This class could have been an easy A if Mrs. Edwards knew how to explain things clearly, follow one set of curriculum, and knew how to solve some of the more complicated homework questions. I was extremely disappointed with how little I actually learned in this class.

Professor Edwards is an awesome Math teacher. She explains things very clearly and won't hesitate to go over something in more detail if needed. There was a lot of online homework as well as a worksheet and quiz due every week. If you go to lecture and pay attention, you should be fine! She also gives a lot of partial credit in her exams.

Didn't understand his lectures, and gave limited attempts on homework. Wasn't consistent with online postings besides homework. Also doesn't allow a personal note sheet. He has one already for tests. Beware, you will need the textbook and some extra help outside of class.
Not very clear in lectures, goes on a review rant on things not on the final, for some reason gives limited attempts on HW problems, doesn't follow syllabus, and overall not a very good teacher.

He's ok. He has a thick Indian accent which make it a little hard to understand, otherwise - he's not too hard. This class is Excel intensive though, so make sure to use the macro that comes with the book to get a jump on the work. Also, get a good study partner - it helps. Take home quizes

I would not recommend this class. even though it is very easy and you learn the material in 8th grade or high school, he finds a way to make it difficult. he is a nice guy but he just reads off the power points and does not really make an effort to helping. i wish i had his wife instead

Really nice guy and knows what he's talking about but is of the most disorganized professors I've ever seen. Extremely hard to follow material in class (also rip if you sit in the back of the class). Claims he wants to hear student feedback to become a better teacher but then says "this isn't a democracy" when we give suggestions. Also curves a lot

quite literally the worst professor ive ever had, maybe the worst in the world. the material is impossible and does not exist anywhere outside the classroom, nothing online. he brags about past students complaining to the dean/school about him like its a trophy. he is delusional and unwilling to provide REAL help. entire grade is based on 2 exams.

Stephany and Kevin don't really teach ENGR1000. Guest speakers come in everyday. Stephany is alright, but she never really taught anything, and the class does not prepare you for engineering. Half of the grade is project-based. You will do fine in the class if you just show up and do the iclicker questions but I thought it was a waste of time.

Mandatory lectures with iClicker Q's. Genuinely cares about her students and willing to make extensions as needed. Lots of presentations from guests, some may not be as interesting. Two heavy projects: reverse engineering and catapult/trebuchet plus a take home final: 2 letters of appreciation. Find a good group to work with at the beginning!!
Amazing
If you do poorly, the only person to blame is yourself. More than willing to help for those who put forth the effort.

Probably the best professor I've ever had. I took several of her classes and I feel that those were the ones I got the most out of in college. Really puts in the effort to help students improve their work!
Greatest class I have ever taken. Alison has designed a syllabus that packs in a lot of projects. You will learn so much in a short amount of time.

Jingwei is awesome. You need to understand everything in the notes but not to a further extent than he teaches. Homework and tests are reasonable. He is a great guy who cares a lot about his students. He let us out early when he felt we needed it and brought us donuts. He also fun stories that he tells occasionally. I would 100% recommend him

Jingwei is the best! So funny, and uses tons of relevant examples for concepts. I truly learned so much from this class and any time I had trouble, he made himself available for review sessions. Two midterms and a final, weekly homework, and participation is the breakdown of grading.
Absolutely terrible human being, she is a liar, gas lights and treats people poorly over race. She should be removed from teaching

Worst professor in history, does not follow rubric when grading papers and takes off points for things that she did not include in her emails. She does not answers emails on time and would not recommend that she should be a professor. Neither do I recommend someone taking her class. I REPEAT AVOID AT ALL COST.
Love her teaching style, she's awesome

A pretty tough grader. Seems to grade based more on how much effort she thinks you put in rather than how much effort you actually put in and content. Basically she likes to nitpicks essays. Otherwise pretty clear about what was expected and the syllabus was easy to follow.

Ashley was always accessible to the students, and used student feedback to change the structure of classes to make it more productive for the students. She graded essays in fairly. You had to put effort into the essays to receive a good grade. Readings were short.

Dr. Powell is easily the best professor I have had. She understands students. She presents the material in a way that makes it applicable to real life. Her lectures are clear and her examples explain the tough material. She is caring and always happy to meet to answer your questions. If you put in the effort, you will do very well. 100% recommend.

Dr. Powell is a great professor! The class was all online, but she is very organized and the class isn't that difficult. She posts lecture videos that are at most 30 min long and there are short quizzes after each lecture. Everything is open note and as long as you are understanding the material you should do good. Two group projects
Not so helpful
Never had an acutal lecture just reading from the book and homework.

He is not clear or coherent at all. Very nice man and much more helpful in office hours. Self taught class, he cannot hear your question and goes off on unrelated stories. Strongly recommend avoiding if possible.

It seems like he is always rambling about something, but he never really connects it to anything. Subject is interesting if you just do the readings on your own. 3 exams, essay format, not that hard, but need to study to do well.

Extremely time consuming and useless class that goes into way too much detail on the least interesting subject material. Weber is pretty pretentious; he means well, but the class was nearly insufferable.

Not a a very clear professor and the class is directed toward grad students just because the class is an honors core. Not a single student in the class is a music major. The class started way above my level of understanding but he does tell you throughout the class that the big ideas are what is tested. This class is very time consuming.

She's one of those professors who is very passionate about what she does. You will learn alot from her, although at times she talks alot. Overall, I was glad to have a teacher who knew her stuff and cared about it as much as she did!

Very concerned with fine art specifically. She really only focuses on how you can paint and challenge space in an original and meaningful way, which sometimes makes it hard to do your own thing in her class. Super smart and pretty; you will learn a ton in her class.

professor lolos is quite expierenced of the subject. One question will get you explinations. Professor Lolos has an interesting persanality that breaks the ice and helps to get thru dull exerpts of topics. Professor Lolos is quite fair and eager to assist. I would take this class again.

Good lab instructor. Loves the subject and knows a lot about it. The labs themselves are mostly boring and somewhat difficult, but probably easier than a bio/chem/etc lab. The first month deals with rocks and minerals and really sucks. Was a fair grader. Grade consists of a dozen labs and 2 exams.

Lectures are pointless to go to and boring. Gives test review packet that is very similar to the test. There are weekly online required homeworks, not too difficult. You do not need the text book for this class, you won't use it!
Hard to understand in class, but exams are basically the same as the study guide so its an easy A

The best class I've taken at UConn. I took ANTH1000W over the summer. He makes everything really interesting and uses really funny slides and examples in his powerpoints. I thought it was going to be boring and hard but it was a really good class!
one of the best professor I had! Professor listens to your problems and tries to help you out as much as possible.

I don't find this class difficult at all. Dr. Jones is a very understanding guy and easy to talk to. His discussions can get long winded &difficult to follow at times but if you pay attention you can get a lot out of it. Reading isn't mandatory because he reviews the next class. Grade based on 4 papers that aren't terribly difficult to do well on

Dr. Jones' class is difficult, with an intense workload of constant reading/response and essay writing. However, he's a great guy, extremely entertaining, and exposes his students to new ways of thinking. His writing style and what he expects from his students is kind of quirky, but once the student figures it out... its smooth sailing.
Textbook is everything. Super inconsistent
She's a decent professor (bordering on bad). Her tests are not bad, just read the slides and read the book. Don't have to go to class ever.

Steve is a great guy. Enjoys all kinds of breakfast foods, for some reason he made it a point to share that with us haha. Definitely on the left side of the political spectrum, he does a great job at taking really hard concepts and making them understandable. Just an overall upstanding dude.

This was his 1st class. Each student leads 2 class discussions for credit. 2 take home midterms, take home final. 5 pop quizzes but you know when to expect them. Steven is a great teacher & a great guy. He's passionate about Crit Race theory & he taught me a lot. He wants his kids to do well, & he will do anything to help. Made me a better human.

One of the best professors I've had. He is very down to earth and interested in the subject matter, and he makes you interested as well. Class syllabus/assignments are structured to make assignments easy to complete and very open. Study the book for quizzes.

I liked him because he tried really hard. to make a difference and he did. He was nice when I asked questions after class. The first of the three test/quizzes was done on our own, while the rest were done in groups, which I thought was very helpful. You have to read the book for the tests. I wouldn't mind taking another class iwth him.

Professor Ferguson's class requires a lot of reading, but the reading is very rewarding. She had a "monsters and madness" theme, which was extremely interesting. All of the books were fantastic, and Professor Ferguson was able to engage the students in lively discussions. The assignments were reasonable and manageable. I would highly recommend her

She is such a great teacher and very intersting. We do lots of interesting discussions based on readings and do observations (three required) along with a major project. I look foward to attending her class. Key: Read what's assigned and do well on observations and PARTICIPATE and it you will be fine!

Wessam is a great teacher. Unfortunately, he was only at Uconn for the year. But he did great. He works really hard to give good presentations/lessons, he cares about his students and he is really easy to be friends with (he's young enough for that to not be creepy) He should have been paid as a professor.
Wessam THE MAN! Very enthusiastic teacher, has a really great way of being easy to talk to, so understanding and very willing to help you outside of class...just the best guy ever!

Very easy to understand for being foreign (from Romania). He really tries to include the class in the lecture and is a generally understanding person. Exams were on the tough side, but there were generous curves. The lectures were worth going to not only because he's an engaging lecturer but also I learned a lot by going.

Literally five written pages of mathematical proofs only to have him grade the two problems you absolutely could not get ? be prepared to prove absolutely everything (no matter how obvious it is) and write a lot. Not a bad teacher, though. He's from Romania ? it's very far away. And he went to Iowa ? also very far away. Now prove using PMI.
Such an amazing teacher! Explained everything with detail. He's grades are very fair. I didn't need do purchase a book because we used lecture notes that you can print online. How great is that!?

Jay is AWESOME. I don't know whether he's staying here longer because he's a grad student, but he knows his stuff and cares about his students. Clarified things during discussion, left time for questions, prepared us for quizzes well and was a fair grader for papers. Held SUPER HELPFUL review sessions. Chill guy so get to know him. Take his class.
Take her if you have a chance to! She is an awesome professor and she is funny and makes the lectures interesting.

I had her for the sexuality course which was the most fun class I have ever taken Shes so easy and clear tells u the answers to all the quizzes and tests and makes u go to VIP as a field trip! One of my gave teachers of all time. Taking a different course with her again this semester...can't wait!

Professor Hyde is a good professor, gives interesting classes and makes class easy to listen to. He gives extra credit opportunities which is good! Over all I think that his class is a good class to take if youre interested in Sociology or not and you need to get a Gen-ed out of the way.

Professor Hyde is a good professor with a general knowledge of whatever he is teaching. He is an easy grader and has a charming personality. I liked him and I recommend his class to anybody out there interested in sociology or just if they want to take a W or elective course!
Taking this class changed my entire outlook on life
Professor Blanco is awesome! His class is informative and fun. If you love basketball this is the class for you

Paul is a bit weird, super funny, and overall a great guy. He goes over all the material you need to know in class, but I feel like if you haven't taken probability beforehand, the material might be a little difficult. 3375 is a proof based class, so the exams are a bit annoying, but as long as you do the HW and go to class, you should be fine!
Great guy, great class. A little weird but awesome.
Professor Duncan is my favorite professor! He is very approachable and gives feedback to his students so that they can be the best musician that they can become
Duncan is very funny and understanding towards students who struggle with the inherently challenging content in Ear Training classes.

Claire was a delight to have as an instructor and really knows how to help you advance with your drawing skills. She is very personable and understanding, just dont abuse that respect or take it for granted. Its an art lab so you must show up and put the work in on your drawings and in class exercises. Claire is a wonderful instructor and person.
Awesome person, awesome teacher, awesome music. Loved this class and loved Claire. The only thing is she gives out some generally easy assignments and doesn't push you too hard.

I saw the comment saying that Sarah's homework was weeks due before other professors. However, this is not completely accurate. Every FYE class has to do the same amount of assignment but due in different order. Sarah even cooked and baked for her students during Thanksgiving break. You'll never find such a caring instructor again.

It's a class where freshmen need to be introduced to college life but she treats it as another lecture course. She is completely incompetent and piles on projects due weeks before other FYE teachers. Speaking to her is like speaking to a wall that only answers with "deal with it yourself."

Professor Powell genuinely cares for his students, and tries his best to get knowledge and learning embedded into course. That being there were plenty of group structured projects that were engaged in the course that were life changing. Gary is a professor I will never forget. (your final grade is a split between midterm/final)

Professor Gary Powell provides only one of 4 grades for all exam questions and for major assignments. You either get an A+ (100%), C (75%), F(50%) or F (0). You will have no idea what grade you are going to get until the class is already over because he provides little to no feedback on assignments. The assigned course material is also dated
One of the best professors I have ever met and very easy to work with. Highly recommend taking his courses, he is very kind and helpful!

Easily one of the best instructors Ive had at UConn. I highly recommend working in Dr. Provatas' lab as he makes the work fun and meaningful while you are working on important research. Stress free environment and a great steppingstone to grad school or industry.
An excellent professor who places limited emphasis on homework, instead prioritizing projects. Approximately 60% of the coursework involves creating high-quality projects.

This professor is very knowledgable in data science. You don't need to go to lecture as notes are provided online, but it is pretty interesting. There are a few homework assignments that are practical and fun, as well as a final project on a topic of your choice. The professor is lenient in the case you miss a deadline, so I would recommend.

Find a different course/take it with a different professor- not worth the time or frustration. Passive aggressive/petty toward students; he WILL call you out in front of the class just if he feels like it that day. Harsh grading makes the stories better in the end, but his criticism is often presented in a rude way rather than constructive.
Gives terrible feedback and is a tough grader. Spends most of the class going over trivial subjects then complains how our writing hasn't improved. Avoid at all costs. Long and slow lectures.
I took ASL 3 and 4 with Chantal and she is the best! Lots of homework but nothing too hard as long as you go to class. I learned a lot and enjoyed going to class everyday.

This was Chantal's first year teaching here. I found her to be an awesome teacher. She's absolutely hilarious. Lots of homework, assigned weekly and due every Sunday, but don't worry - it seems like a lot but it's very easy and you can get it all done in 30 mins or less. No papers, no writing, no reading - just video projects.

The assignment is every confusing. He did not asked the margin in the guidelines. and if you miss that, you will get a 1 point off. This assignment has a total of 5 points. The funniest part was that his exams were graded on a percentage basis, and if you overwrote, you would lose more points if you were wrong.
Hard class, but learned so much. Is being very strict on attendance. Participation REALLY matters. Lots of group projs. Not good for shy ppl.

JUST EXAMS no other work! 3 exams and you need to read 2 150-200 page books cover to cover and gives you 3 seconds to answer ?'s then moves on. Short essays he gives you two prompts (pick one) and you have only 30 min to make the entire thing with intro and conclusion. Final exam is optional, can get up to 5 points extra added to grade if you do it
Awful. Doesn't help. Don't care. Exams are hard

One-page paper single spaced so it's actually pretty long. Get the same grade on every single one, a 90 every time even if ive tried to improve. You do have to go to class because participation in 15% of the grade. Not that hard to do well but not easy to get an A. Just an Okay class overall. If you need a W course it not that bad.

Now this is someone who actually knows how to give a lecture. Class is NEVER boring, always learned someone thing new. There are weekly quizzes, but they're super short and easy if you're going to class. No exams. Gotta participate tho. Two essays: one 5pg, and one 10pg paper. She's a pretty fair grader. I would take this class a million times over

You can pass this class by going to your lab and doing the assignment. She teaches you things in the lab that makes the class super easy. Her lectures are very nice, but you don't have to go to learn the material. Due to her slides being amazing and having everything very clear. Exams are in person and on paper if that matters to you.
short and sweet: justine is amazing and I love her. definitely take floral art! shes so so helpful and im going to miss her and her class so so much
She does some pretty sick research and is organized in the lectures, but th

The class is very math heavy as well as deriving models. 70% of your grade comes from the 2 mid terms (20% each) and the final. Exams are (usually) open book and note, which is a lifesaver. Lectures are recorded and posted very quickly after class. There is a group project worth 20% that uses MATLAB, and the last 10% is HW.

Very slow grader, took him months to grade second midterm. He uploads his lecture slides but information is missing, so its best if you take your own notes. Lectures are always fun, he's very charismatic and engaging. Also wears cool bowties. If you can take a class with him, definitely do

Professor Johnson is a great Professor and a great guy. His teaching style is very clear and is super easy to understand (best in UCONN imo). He really wants you to succeed in his class. If you pay attention, interact with him and review his slides you will do good in his class. I definitely recommend taking him if you get the chance.

Throughout the semester, professor Wang maintained consistently engaging lectures and was really able to connect environmental issues with everyday things (e.g. Consumption, employment, etc). Was nice to all student and quite lenient.

If you have the chance to take this course with Professor Wang, he is such a nice and caring professor. He loves to interact with the class and if you make a small effort he will remember who you are. This course is only graded by a handful of assignments so if you want an easy E credit, take ENVE 1000 with this man. He's seriously the best.
Good professor in my experience, our class was online and he was easy to reach and we did a lot of google meets for office hours.

Absolutely awful teacher. Tons of homework, and super difficult directions to follow. Do NOT take this class with this professor. Long classes and always teaches until the last minute of the class. None of the material feels like it's doing anything for me, instead feels like busy work.
Is an excellent resource for students of all levels and truly loves what she does!!

UNIV was a very easy class, but Dr. Singe made it something I looked forward to every week. Going to class helped me get involved in the exercise science community and learn about resources available to me. Dr. Singe was always willing to help with any questions from scheduling for the next semester to career questions. Would highly recommend.

His lectures are fast but he is very passionate about what he teaches. Follow through his lecture material, do the homework, and ask as many questions that pop up in your head. His exams are fair and he changes the modality of the exams if the class wishes. Meaning they can be take home exams to ease the stress of taking it in person.

All of Ross's reviews on this website are under "Ross Bagtzoglou", be sure to check out that page. Overall, Ross was not a good professor. After hearing all about how "he's such a great, nice guy" for years now, when I had him, he was actually really rude in answering questions, was fake, and didn't explain things well. Grades super fast, though.

She's the best. Shurupova gives amazing feedback on projects along with making lectures engaging and easy to follow along with. She is understanding and the directions she gives are straight-forward. As long as you participate in her class, you're sure to get an A.
The course itself is a standard "intro to major" course and isn't the most worthwhile, but Prof. Shurupova is a nice and cooperative prof. who I really have zero complaints for

Jose's class was incredibly boring. It was difficult to pay attention and they did not help a lot when it came to the homework. Unless you look up the question they were very difficult to answer. You would have to teach yourself a lot but the midterm and final were pretty easy.

Jose is a fine professor, his lectures are very boring, but he gives you the material that you will need on the exam for the most part, but the homework is killer. The homework has some relation to class, but half the time it is impossible to figure out because you have to find the formulas on your own.

Weekly homeworks, 2 exams and a cumulative final. Final is worth 40%, with everything else worth 20%. He is extremely boring and reads right off the lecture slides; adding absolutely nothing else to them. Need to review slides and memorize formulae and vocab for exams. Exam questions themselves aren't overly difficult.

Nice person, just super boring to listen to during lectures. Class was mainly exam based with hw being only 20%. Exams were ok but were graded pretty strictly and TA's weren't that much of a help. A lot of memorizing words and processes for exams. One good thing were the fun mini group projects (not graded) you did during some classes.

*ANTH 3320* was eye-opening and fantastic. I learned so much about the world & the historical and legal discourse around reproduction in the US. This course should be required because of how interesting & important the topic is. Lots of reading & few papers. Prof Williams is an inspiring lecturer who is well-versed in this area. TAKE THIS COURSE!!

It's a 3000 level course, don't take this if you think it's an easy W course. She's a nice person, definitely wants you to participate in discussion as that's the majority of the class. There's only a couple of papers with a lot of time to do them. But for each week you have a lot of reading so be prepared for that. She's also generous with grading
Not that prepared for classes, seems preoccupied. Doesn't know how to answer tough questions

Assigns short readings/podcast episodes to be listened to for class, and then there's a class discussion. One group project to cover a chapter that she assigns and you have to turn in a short review after. Grades very fast and has good feedback. Lots of extra credit opportunities. A single research project due at the end of the semester.

Great professor for PDEs. Homework was sometimes difficult, but tests were pretty straightforward. Only reason this is a 4/5 rather than a 5/5 is because he doesn't upload any notes to HuskyCT. Either you are in class or you'll have to figure it out from the textbook yourself. I wish he scanned a picture of the board every time he needed to erase.

I loved this course. Prof Wu's teaching style is very logical, and he's always checking his work to make sure each step flows and is clear. The exams are similar to the homework which is similar to class examples, so going to class and doing the homework is enough to excel in the class. He's also very respectful and helpful when questions come up.

One of the worst classes ever. An easy A , but you will not learn anything in this class. I never went to class and ended with a 100. Apparently too many people were doing well, so he made the final all open ended questions which we were supposed to write 16-20 pages to answer. After people complained, he made it a bit less but still ridiculous.

He is a great guy. Super funny and chill and lectures aren't bad at all because he just kind of talks. Very reasonable amount of work and grading criteria - take home exams and quizzes. He just wants you to learn so he gives you chances to fix your mistakes. If you have the chance take a class with this guy!!
I LOVE HER AND HER CLASS! Enough said.

She has a passion for teaching that really shows. Get ready to know a lot about her because she always uses real-life examples during lectures. I took her Conservation Law Enforcement class. She is very understanding of life outside the classroom and will give you extensions and the like if you ask. She's really funny and always will make your day.

She truly is an amazing professor and a wonderful person. The work was very difficult (it is a W course and you learn R) and I do not think I would have survived it with a different professor. It was her first time teaching methods of ecology and she did an excellent job considering she was just handed the materials from the previous professor.

The class was difficult, but not due to the professor. She is a wonderful help, and I learned several really useful skills from this class including GIS and R. This course is writing-heavy, and there are a lot of assignments. Definitely practice the skills yourself, and don't be afraid to look stuff up when you need to. Very valuable course/skills.

Anna and this class were great! There is iClicker at the end of the guest lectures, but the guest lectures are actually very interesting. Anna is really lenient about iClicker and she's understanding when there's an issue with it. The assignments aren't bad, but they're kind of pointless. The final is just a slideshow with pre-written directions.

Anna is one of the sweetest people you will meet. She is super down to earth and always available to help! Her class is super fun and super interesting. You have to go to class because she does in class participation that is part of your grade. She makes lecture super engaging and will always answer your questions. Her RD experience she utilize.

He is very kind and tries to answer every question thoroughly in lecture. Although the methods in the textbook can be confusing, he tries to make sure everyone is on the same page. Also makes sure office hours are accessible to everyone.
It is a good lecture. The professor is very patient and caring. If you have any questions, the professor will answer them. The exam is very similar to the practice exam.

Wish she was the actual professor of this course and not just a TA! The one lecture she gave was still the most interesting all semester. Really cares about students even when she's busy all the time, she will get back to you. Always gave me the time to chat after class.

Audra is simply one of the best. The workload for W is a lot, 3 essays, reading quizzess, and thought questions in every lecture. Lectures are engaging, and she's good at getting everyone to talk, which made class fun.She has a lot of funny stories from life and work, which is pretty incredible, and she's clearly passionate about it.

Melendez took what was supposed to be a Gen-Ed and made it extremely difficult. She talks way too fast and when someone asks her to repeat it she gets angry. She also screams while she talks, so she is mostly difficult to understand. Somewhat hard workload, although the content is interesting and she is definitely intelligent.

This has been my favorite English class ever. The readings were pretty good and the entire class would get into these deep discussions about them that would always end in a joke and laughter. The papers were not too easy but a good grade is completely possible. She is such a nice person and a really god teacher!! Recommend her class!

Very enthusiastic about her class, but her assignments were confusing, and she was not helpful in explaining them; you were just expected to know what to do. Exams were graded extremely easy, but she required both a group and individual presentation. Overall, the class was interesting and easy, just be aware of the presentations

Tumolo knows the language in and out, and, as expected, speaks only in Italian throughout the classes (with exceptions). There's plenty of homework to do, and they won't really help for studying. It's a relatively tough course, but Tumolo is always willing to help. Tests can be rough. A book is required to access online homework.
He can be difficult to undertand at times, but gives stickers and toys. Does not dress like a professor more like a homeless man. but tht makes him approachable. Take for an easy pass.

Lists everything about every drugbut is usually unclear what she wants us to know for the exam. exam questions are among the most confusing in the school. Had a meltdown post on Facebook decrying lack of attendance to her class prior to another class's exam. Most of my peers found it unnecessarily confrontational and unprofessional. Doubt she cares

Lectures were taken straight from the book (literally word for word) and she just read straight from the slides. Final grade: 40% group paper, 40% final exam, 20% discussion posts. The class is boring and does not prepare you for the paper or the final so cross your fingers and hope you get a good grade.

He was one of the best TAs I have had. He was very understanding of students' problems. He was also very helpful is you are struggling. He also held review sessions before exams and would present problems similar to the ones of the exams.

Have taken McCringleberry several times now due to necessity, please avoid this professor. Assignments are often due at very late hours, typically on weekends. I've had exams on Saturday nights and Sunday mornings. Often times I'm not even sure what the material is. Tendency to switch up topics or language the class is spoken in. Great guy though.
One of the best history professors I had. Awesome lectures, only a couple of small essays. All the course readings were incredibly interesting too!
Took this class online, the nicest interim Professor ever. Just the best. So understanding and cares for her students well-being. Wish I could take her again, such an easy class

She never communicates - never responds to emails; sometimes just doesn't show up. She does not really tell students what they need to do for an assignment. Ridiculously bad. Skip this course if you can; it doesn't even feel like an English course it's like digital media.

Professor Dhillon was honestly amazing. I was worried about it being a difficult course because it was W, but I ended up really enjoying it. She treated us like humans first and was always accommodating. Not as much writing as I expected, and the writing we did do was actually useful. The only thing I didn't like was that attendance is required.
Very dynamic, made a night class interesting and exciting.

Dr. Menuz is not understanding or accommodating of students who need an extension or a makeup for any reason. Exams are difficult, but she is a decent lecturer and her slides are informative. She's a decent teacher but clearly does not care that much about her students doing well in her class.

Professor filled in for the original instructor. Primary source of study material was from the book or from in-class slides (of the book). Lectures help to complement the readings. Labs were straightforward. She provided helpful study guides for the exams, and offers extra credit assignments. Keep up with the readings, and you'll do well!
He's amazing!!!!!

Worse Professor! Was more like a writing class. Tons of writing; 20 page research paper w/proper footnotes plus each week you'd write "feeling" essays & then for final she asked all technical questions...bait & switch. She was snipptm rude and she takes an interesting subject & makes it boring...I would NEVER take another one of her classes...EVER!

She's hard, no doubt, but you'll be better for it. Keep all of her lecture notes, which she does on PDF. They'll be good for your entire nutrition career. Test questions are TOUGH. sometimes it feels like she's trying to trick you on the True/False or Multiple choice. But she records all of her lectures and posts online so you can listen later.
Class is a lot of work, but you learn a lot. Material can be challenging if not mathematically inclined.

Required readings were not needed. Bit dry in lecture good with questions. Class could be more molecular and has a heavy neuro slant but its PNB. Found interesting people for the guest lectures and generally likable. Teaches with Conover and they make a good team. Mild exam difficulty just pay attention to technical details. Solid prof

really easy class - but A LOT of reading - class participation and reading checks are a part of the grade so it forces you to read; no midterms, just a final, 2 short essays, and 2 projects [1 was 10 pages]; explained things well, but the class gets boring if you're not interested in the subject and all the reading is annoying
Very unclear when teaching. Writes random things on board. Goes on tangents when explaining what would otherwise be pretty easy concepts. Definitely avoid.

One of the coolest professors in the psych department, honestly a useful course for anyone interested in combining their interests of health/healthcare and psychology. Exams require you to know information well but the material is interesting and his powerpoint are clear. Need the book, but the material isn't dry and its pretty interesting.
No Comments
Lindsey is such a great instructor. She makes educational psychology so interesting and engaging. Its a great class and I would take it again!
She's really nice, have to go to class because she's required to give quiz every time. She's helpful as a TA but the professor for this class is awful (Paul Ellis).

Bartch has a pretty good sense of humor, but lectures can be drawn out. I tried to slack off for the rewriting of the first paper and got dumbstered. The change in rewriting of the papers is probably the most important aspect in getting a good grade. Overall, rewrite the papers and you should come out with a B or higher.
Great professor. Very helpful and enthusiastic. Makes class interesting.
I love Oliver. He's so kind to his students and tries to make class as engaging as possible. He's also genuinely passionate about what he teaches and makes participating super easy. Would take again
Easy to followpatient with all students, free to ask all kinds of problems even not about English. She is a good teacher.
I was really worried about taking a philosophy course because its not my strongest subject, however she is a very fair teacher, and as long as you take good notes and attend class you will be fine.

Ppts are based off book word for word. Attendance not mandatory, as long as you read the book. Not a difficult class, as long as you look at the material. She's pretty clear as to what she expects, and very nice.
This professor is engaging and fun to have as a teacher. She puts a lot into the class, and as a result, all the students get a lot out of it.

Randall is extremely interested in your success in his class. He wants you to do well but at the same time he will push you to your limits. He stresses neatness and craftsmanship so if you hand in a project that isn't up to his standards he will make you redo it. This will only make you stronger. If you can take critique well you will survive.
Great guy! Easy class!
Shes cool

All around excellent professor. I took Children's Literature with her and learned far more than I anticipated. She assigns a decent amount of reading, but the pieces she selects are always relevant and interesting (and it is a ENG course). Exams are in class essays and your given many choices for prompts. Participate and take and engagedA
Isn't a bad professor but the class does get boring sometimes. Overall and incredibly class to take though.
Best TA I've ever had in Uconn. He will give you an extra review section before every exam if it's need. And explain things really clear. Very helpful and very responsible!
I'd take him again.

The material is very easy, and she makes attendance mandatory although it's pointless because everything is straight of the book. Tests are fairly easy if you just skim over your notes a day or two before. Take this class only if it's not a 3 hour class. Gets kind of boring after an hour. She likes to ramble on about herself a lot.

She was an excellent teacher. Goes very fast, but is more than willing to email anything that you missed in class. Just attending lecture, taking notes, and doing the hw is more than enough to get an A in the class.
She is very nice, helpful teacher. She has a spanish accent which I found adorable but most people might find difficult to understand if they have never been around a spanish peaking person before.

Niamh is a great instructor. She really cares how the class is doing and tries to keep the class fun. She is very accommodating to people if they need to miss class or need extra time. If you put effort towards Irish, she will help you succeed. Classes are small (6 or less). Everyone will participate/talk in front of the class.
Had him for my UNIV class, he is amazing. easy going and gives great advice in how to make it at UConn. Definitely get close to him .... he is an amazing mentor.
Great professor. Lectures are posted online. 2 open-note take home tests and one final project. Easy A.
Joyce was very engaging and patient in teaching the course. Her examples are always helpful. And she does not make you to buy textbook. Great class!

Never really explains things and when you ask for help he says it in his own little language. You have to look up how to do the assignment since he barely explains things and there's no textbook in his syllabus. Unless you're familiar with programming, you're gonna be pulling your hair out the entire course.
Its hard material to learn, but she really cares about students learning it. She'll go out of her way to help you if you ask. Wicked smart, but approachable professor.

Racca is a horrible professor. He gives unclear assignments, he is not accessible outside of the classroom, and is a tough grader. He expects you to know the material before it is even taught and to do advanced level assignments with no assistance. I would NEVER take another course taught by him ever again. AWFUL EXPERIENCE AND PERSON

Worse professor I've ever encountered. Exam class averages were in the 20-30% before the curve. After curve, students were still in the 50-60% range and this is with a class size of 100+ students. I got an A in physics 1 but still failed every test in physics 2. Exam material has nothing to do with lecture slides or online hw. Avoid at all cost.

I took her in the summers for 5 weeks, pretty standard class. Buy the Textbook because there is A LOT of reading, since I took it in the summer we covered 2 chapters a class 2x a week. A project/presentation every week, participation mater-you get points, show up, for me there was a final cumalative exam, straightforward if you study, critical teac

Easiest class this semester. Reads off the powerpoints then is posted onto HuskyCT. No quizzes. The few homework assignments are super easy. Posts study guides as well. Make sure you go to review sessions before the midterms and final because he will literally tell you what questions he will be putting on the exam.

Not a finance major so was nervous to take this class especially having this professor for his first year. To my surprise he was awesome. The exams were super similar and fair to what he taught you in class and he made sure to do all practice exams in class to make sure the students fully understood. Only one homework due a week.

She is a very nice professor, but the work load is heavy. Be prepared to spend many hours outside of class working on your assignments. Expects 20 hours of outside work time. Can be strict, but gives very great advice
Horrible grading scale and gives little to no feedback, this class did not promote learning of the industry and was horribly out dated.

She gave tough tests. All of those tests are worth 80% of your grades, so if you did bad on one of the exams, you will probably get a B or even worse. She only gave out 2 extra points which compares to her tests worth nothing. If you skip her classes, chance that you will miss a quiz, which will make your grades even worse!!
No Comments

Definitely take this class- no textbook, minimum work throughout the semester...not a whole lot of work to do. Project is fun, which is mandatory for all MGMT4900 courses. Take this class with this professor.

Adriana is an excellent professor. She is very helpful and answers any questions you ask her, and will also talk to you about things other than German. She is funny too, which helps ease the seriousness of learning another language. Take her!

He is young and not too worn out, so it was really great to have a class with him. He is still excited about linguistics (unlike some of the other faculty who don't really like spending time going over "the basics" for undergraduates). He is whip smart, has a cute accent and uses good, entertaining examples to demonstrate some complex ideas.
She's nice and teaches pretty well. Lectures can be a bit boring but she is easy to understand and is always open to questions.
MFB is fantastic. If you have the chance to take a course with her, she's caring about students and is very approachable.

Took her for first year English. The subject matters of the class were really interesting and she made it a lot of fun. There are a lot of group activities in class but none of them are really difficult. Even when I was struggling in all my other classes, this was the one I maintained an "A" in the whole semester. Don't skip more than 1 Lab!!

She is absolutely amazing. Ive never once liked doing math, but she goes at the perfect pace and really explains things clearly step by step. She is always willing to help and is super understanding of lifes circumstances. She answers all questions and has a dependable schedule of weekly homework and she prepares you properly for every exam!

All round great professor. Best professor teaching this course. No exams - just quizzes and homeworks. The quizzes summed up make up your final exam grade (pretty cool and easy). Can turn stuff in late just talk to him. Sometimes can be homework heavy but chatgpt is your friend for sumarizing texts if youre in a time crunch. He cares about you too!

Dr. Puhl is an amazing professor. She clearly explains what she expects and provides guidelines for everything. Building a portfolio in this class is great career preparation for the future. The class does seem to go at a quick pace, so try to work on assignments as soon as possible. There is a lot of writing but it is split up into smaller chunks.

I loved having Professor Sims. This class was so informative and provided such great, important information. There are some group projects, including a final service advocacy project. Although the class was online, I truly learned so much and was honored to take this class!

Shihan was a great instructor! Very kind, accommodating, and understanding. There's lots of readings that you discuss in class for participation points, but he listened to us when we said the readings were a bit too long and he assigned shorter readings after. The class can be very interesting too!
